hundred threescore fiftene homelyes sermon vppon actes apostle written saint luke made radulpe gualthere tigurine translated latine tongue commoditie englishe reader iohn beholde lambe god taketh awaye sinnes worlde seene allowed according queenes maiesties iniunctions anno domini ecclesiasticvs x glory riche honorable poore feare god blasoning haue skill yet say thys good poesie garter set closeth armes keepe friend confounde foe shielde harmes perfourmde lorde otherwise garter wryt alone hart shamefull fruites yeeldes see echeone worthy erst wofull wightes marked well might haue sit honor seate nowe haue lost name right honorable verye good lorde fraunces earle bedforde knight noble order garter one lordes queenes maiesties honorable priuie counsell grace peace god father encrease temporall dignitie honor good lord sundry menne haue sundry meaning dedycating studyes traueyles men honor seeke friendshippe good augmentation lyuing authoritie commende sette foorth woorkes labour one thing haue herein beene ledde none consideration honor beneuolence friendship long sithence well founde prooued gaue best part exhibition wherby lyued italie three foure yeares togither whereby also lyue daye better meane experience knowledge learned space mannes allowaunce authoritie maiestie matter offer vnto honour needeth worde god almightie farre taking authoritie man rather man haue authority especially men authority whome god sayth per reges regnant c otherwise respect mine owne simple handling thereof must plainelye confesse hath neede meanest simplest man allowance lyuing haue hytherto greatly gaped knowing haue eyther euer made great suite well deserue small sufficiencie great charge ministerie committed vnto well weighed mine onely intent simple labour mine shewe selfe maner wayes vnmindefull lordshippes liberalitie longe agone bestowed vpon great humanitye vsed nine yeres past twise one lent court white hall towarde poore man preuenting bashfull nature slackenesse speach towarde superior curteous affabilitie among manifolde experiment eftsoones seene noble gentle nature iudged one least true nobilitie consisteth somuch goodes fortune gorgeous apparell prowde hauty lookes behauior courteous countenance vertuous quality minde verye true implementes furniture right courtier soeuer quality found may truely called nobilis peraduenture honor say gift lesse thankeworthy longer good desertes towarde mee haue bene forgotten verilye good lorde alwayes lesse truely commonly sayde exercise enterprise mine sat cito si sat bene forget benefite good turne vnkindenesses woorst vnkinde denyeth good turne receyued vnkinde also acknowledge vnkinde doth requite able vnkinde forgetteth proofe neuer forgat honor good friendship could shewe three bookes machiauelles discourse translated ut italian englishe fourtene yeares past thought haue presented vnto honour stayed therefrom partly bicause hearde worke inueighed paules crosse treatise vnworthy come abroade mennes handes partly hoped still haue matter plausible acceptable gyue vnto albeit confesse truth heard stronge reason alleaged booke myght thought ease ynough haue beene answered although inueigher himselfe discourser deede suspected mine owne rude vnripe translation therfore easlier induced suppresse therfore men honor seneca sayeth vse keepe kalender benefites bestowe christ sayth let left hande knowe right doth looke reward world come fewe word hope rather sure may suffise answere albeit see seneca sayth also beneficium reddidit qui libenter debet parte shall alwayes gladlye confesse bounden vnto honor lyke anye time make satisfaction booke haue translated shall many skilles trust welcome vnto honor first bicause actes apostle conteyne infallible vndoubted wordes lyfe saluation true hystorie thinges apostle taught christes ascention secondly wryters sake luke whose praise gospell thirdlye sake whome luke dedicate theophylus noble manne authoritie commendation farre passeth sincere louer faithfull setter forth god true religion honour would make comparison betwene spake honor others perhaps shoulde incurre much suspition flatterie prayse face last sake beseech sayth take good part nowe surelye quoth else verie great present gift vnlesse perhaps thou make little account thy selfe thus trusting poore present shall none otherwise receyued honor hande aeschines socrates humbly commende mee vnto beseeching almightie god christ sake giue lyfe wherein maye long defende maintaine honour glory herne xxj aprill honor bounden iohn bridge vicare herne pthe legende authour whereof vndoubtedly leaden mouth yron face lodouicus viues learned spaniarde well perceyue testifie ioyned festiuall like bookes vse owne terme truely doe bible babble stuffed erhorteth counsayleth men hearing reading scripture word pray sayth come hither oftener harken diligently reading holy scripture onely come hither home also take holy bible handes receyue great studie commoditie therein conteyned little againe pray therfore sayth let v lose great commoditie negligence let v apply reading holy scripture euen home also nowe newe diuines haue gone long disguised vnder visar antiquitie yet farther replye saye scripture difficult men vnderstand sufficient discusse controuersies may arise church must wayte oire determiner counselles diuersitie translation breede obscuritie errours among people hereto also make aunswere doctor may herein also appeare doe pretende doctor seing yeelde doctor heare speake make expressely first touching hardnesse difficultie wherewith charge scripture saint augustine second booke christian doctrine sixe chapter sayth thus holye ghost hath honorably wholesomely tempered qualified holye scripture hath put hunger awaye playner place lothsomnesse darker againe thirde epistle volusianus sayth maner speech wherof holy scripture consisteth men may easely come vnto although verie fewe pearce vttering playner thing therein conteyned like familiar friend without coulour heart aswell vnlearned learned thing hydeth mystery doth set haultie elocution fraying slowe vnlearned minde come neere lyke poore man commeth vnto riche allureth men lowlinesse speeche feeding onely manifest truth exercising secret hauing verie thing playner place hath harder cyrill seauenth booke iulian sayth intent scripture might knowne men small great commodiously set foorth familiar speache passe none capacitie saint hierome vpon xix chapter esay sayth maner scripture harder thing set playner saint austen booke question affirmeth circumstaunce scripture openeth sence meaning tertullian booke praxeas prooueth rather selder place must expounded mo tener chrysostome among many place hath one verie notable first homely vpon mathew sayth scripture easie vnder standed bondman ploughman wydowe childe seemeth verie slender witted howbeit though sort let passe scripture vncomptrolled yet paules wrytings epistle seeme harde vnto woulde seeme prooue peter wordes thirde chapter seconde epistle whereas god knoweth scripture euen easiest alike harde peter speaketh vnlearned vnconstant fickle person peruert turne owne destruction heare chrysostome aunswereth obiection speaking paules epistle romaine preface vpon maye see none pieuishe obiection newe diuines aunswered olde doctor well searched ignorance sayth chrysostome cause hereof meaneth vnderstoode epistle romaine continually haue handes writing holy man selues knowe peraduenture know ought know pregnancie goodnesse owne wit entirely affectioned man neuer cease reading loue men knowe doings men carefull lou r therevpon concluding sayth wherfore also finde hart earnestly diligentlye bestowe labour reading shall bee nothing else required christes saying true seeke shall finde knocke shall opened vnto surely chrysostome spake priestes religious men onely church constantinople vniuersally many shoulde reade workes sayeth vij homely hebrewes reproofe vsed looke vpon ye scripture man take heede sayth vnto scripture woulde marke shoulde keepe selues errour deliuer also deceyued pull daunger moreouer vpon seconde genesis xiij chapter sayth let v come scope marke holy scripture expoundeth selfe againe holy scripture expoundeth selfe suffereth hearer erre tertullian also one first wryters next apostlesin apologie toward ende apologie christian sayth harken scripture shall finde god studie vnderstand shall enforced beleue place doctor well latine church greeke sufficient ynough teach perswade reasonable bodye iudgement whole church vniuersall touching scripture read men also prooue facilitie easinesse vnderstanded consequently mine assertion howe catholikely church doth like vnto primitiue church permitting person indifferently haue scripture looke reade instruction vnderstanding newe diuines herewith satisfyed yet vrge custome authoritie predecessor lyke weake instance new mumpsimus rather yeelde olde sumpsimus let v aunswere roundly thus word hierome vpon ix chap ieremie saying neyther must error parent forefather followed authoritie scripture commaundement god teaching v though crie neuer much haue scripture whereby prooue opinion god wote many time apply purpose handsomely deuill reasoned christ wildernesse olde new heretikes doe say likewise affirme doe accloy church deede much let v aunswere tertullian saying thus booke fleshe true manhoode christ tooke let heretikes sayth vse scripture whose worlde also vse shall serue testimonye condemnation decke furnishe blasphemy example haue councels decyde controll controuersies whereof consist pray men menne creature cannot erre shoulde men best doctor church haue erred part writing least haue thought might erre report else owne sayinges bookes founde euery place neuer arrogate themselues anye prowde priuiledge immunitie erring late loftie prelate rome hath done lowlynesse submit writinges scripture shall see perceyue haue done yea requiring men freely finde fault correct haue attayned truth woulde neuer haue done knowne thought coulde haue erred one pope name church sixe hundred yere comparable eyther life learning one olde doctor thus modestlye haue written themselues shall thinke better men doctor haue met councels since dayes say woulde mette good yet saye heresy haue bene alwayes confuted councelles saye heresy haue bene alwayes confirmed councels councell ariminum italie holde conclude arrianes seconde councell ephesus holde entiches councell chalcedon fowly erre woulde haue giuen leo bishop rome title supremacie vniuersall bishop refused wherein surely erred since haue done slaughter murther vniust meanes haue vsurped heauen earth knoweth councell also gathered cyprian carthage grieuouslye erre enacting baptised heretikes shoulde baptised againe woulde receiue church councell constance moste abhominably consent error robbe god people one halfe christes sacrament late councell trent foureteene yeares least trauell bring forth length forsooth horatius mountaines italie great childe harde trauell brought forth mouse one error abuse church many worlde nowe seeth although impudent ynough cannot denie haue refourmed surely neuer might worthy bishoppe nazianzum saying truly spoken councels must needes write truth sayth neuer sawe good ende conclusion bishop councels epistle procopius xlij epist yet shame still say confuted example seauentie translator interpreter fiue sixe christes time corrected origen hierome euangelistes apostle writing greeke tongue yet alleage one two place olde doctor confirmation permit let v therefore addresse prepare selues diligently onely reade scripture also vnderstande vnderstande onely stay afrayde manye dayes make onely ende reading also frame selues expresse flowed vp walles nilus riuer aegypt watered fieldes bene raine bene anye earthquake apolog dearth plague people would crye haue christian throwne lion ridde countrie deface beliefe doctrine followed hereof uerily nothing lesse weened tertullian tolde plainely torment racke condemne make v awaye vniust dealing v tryall innocencie therefore god suffreth v suffer handes exquisite crueltie towarde v allureth take partes whereas call v sectary christian lette v reioyce see quarrell slaunders like tell tertullian telleth scapula romanes president sect shall fayle decay seemeth cut downe let assured builded vp considering condemners let v also saye consecrators condemnation reioyce tertullian sayde whosoeuer knoweth meaning nero must needes vnderstande force must singuler good thing woulde condemne may truely say boner storye like haue condemned faythfull brother sisterne whosoeuer knewe liued howe dyed must needes know also coulde none good woulde condemne therefore lette v saye many yeres diuers excellent state common weales haue bene ashamed ymitate howbeit tell playne truth chiefe cause dooyng perceyued matter booke consideration therof appertayned vnto principally boke taught word vse administration common weale howe shall kisse reuerence christ neglect church esteemeth dearer apple eye yea life neglect body whereof member vnder christ head saued must hearken rather vnto esaias prophecying christes church amonge thinges sayth kinges queenes shall thy nurrices wordes seemeth much comfort church sette foorth office dignitie kinges ruler chiefly appeareth god doth vouchsafe commit vnto care church hath redemed bloud sonne dede must confesse god hath herein neede man helpe would vse absolute perelesse power neyther deny many time church increased defended rather power vnspeakeable councell god industrie man commeth passe bicause god disalloweth care dutie magistrate might appeare howe prayse glorie ascribed onely bicause man thinke religion depended vppon man vppon god prouidence meane season goodnesse god doth vouchsafe take men hys coadiutors helper ministery regenerate elect people word defendeth vnder godly magistrate ye rage world midle present daungers euery side may liue peace rest farre forth conuenient faith saluation god scripture testifie whole consent nation doth likewise proue ye certes golden world patriarkes read one man king priest god afterward vnder law would haue office seuered yet ordeyned great coniunction amitie betweene kinges priestes least eyther king shoulde reigne without religion priestes cared regarded might pleasure wicked men bee misused wherevnto also maye referred howe god first gaue lawe vnto iewes chose moses aaron brother germaine committed one charge tabernacle god whole seruice ordering common weale therby teaching v church common weales safetye brotherly concord agreement betweene administration thing iudges kinges well perceyued commended scripture well gouerning common wealth reade chiefly gedeon samuel dauid iosaphat ezechias iosias whome man would compare residue holy ghost hath noted naught shall find bee cause well priuate publike calamitie haue thought worde god care religion hath eyther nothing belonged vnto else might dallye playe pleasure reade hystoryes gentyles shall appeare woonderfullye deceyued knowledge true god therefore polluted seruice god horrible errours yet firmelye helde generall rule principle common weales coulde happely gouerned without true worshippe god knowledge cause greatly reuerenced philosopher professours rare singuler wisedome diuers thinges necessarie vnto saluation wee knowe true christian church apostle tyme furthermore arrogancie contende apostle whome sonne god appoynted bee teacher worlde witness doings though wee able selues inuent deuise absolute perfite thing shall also profitable marke trade order primitiue church loupe creuise chiefe poyntes thereof luke sayth sprang first word god christ ascended heauen thence sent holy spirite whose inspiration apostle beganne preach gospell vnto worlde bring disciple beleeuers vnto christ wherevppon wee gather either member christes church selues bring communion felowshippe thereof must beginne wholesome doctrine worde god byrth child wrath wee must needes regenerated aboue become child god seede regeneration eternall worde god beeing preached ministerie man quickened myndes hearer power spirite renueth whole nature man fleshe mortified lyueth onely vnto god christ long estraunged god lyued vnto sinne apostle taught one vniforme doctrine worde place worde christ himselfe distributed hys partes first commaunded repentaunce preached name next forgiuenesse sinnes although apostle alwayes one kinde hearer seemed greatly differ vocation conuersation nature yet thinke good cause chaunge omit thing doctrine gospel wholy busted bring many men vnto christ duly orderly dealing word vnto doctrine ye word ioyned ye vse sacrament whome perceyued beleue tooke whole bodye church surely knitte togither bande loue charitie meanes within space eyght twentie yeares euident whole worlde brought vnto obeysaunce christ ministerie neyther noble stocke dignitie calling estimation learning therefore verie working god aboue wherein wee haue reuerence power embrace goodnesse graciously prouided worlde liuing oppressed vnder tyrannie deuill booke setteth forth diligently exercise primitiue church great sinner notorious wicked men long wickedly enterprysed shed bloud begotten sonne god embraced doctrine gospell brought consideration sinnes openly confessed feruently occupied consideration owne infirmitie reason dayly perilles incombraunces many example declare woulde haue neyther doctrine wholesome frequenting sacramentes cease speciall regarde might content themselues reiecte christ none king sauiour also would haue reigne among gentyles wherefore mooued procured vprores agaynst apostle place appeareth adoe happened antioche iconium lystrae corinth thessalonica many place finally brought passe apostle professor christian fayth reported bee guyltie onely matter religion also haue oldelye transgressed broken romayne lawes haue troubled distourbed whole worlde wherevppon matter went farre romaine emperours also whose power tyme stretched ouer worlde drewe sworde agaynst christian among great many daungers craftie cruell attempt enimies appeared marueylous constancie apostle beleeuers whereby truely plainely protested fayth christ boldly defended mainteyned doctrine truth neyther flattrie threat coulde brought forsake standing wherein god placed therfore faythfull god fayle godly constancie declared many euident token care church bandes prison deliuered ministerie seruice aungelles comforteth ioyfull ightes vision armeth spirite constancie giueth mouth tongue none enimies able resist confirmeth doctrine faith people myracles effectually draweth mindes men beleeue short causeth doctrine gospell dispite worlde prince thereof fire sworde luckily spreade ouer whole face earth thing conteyned perfite absolute paterne church wherevnto thing written else scripture touching church maye bee referred fourme frame church euident also honourable lordes haue followed god vouchsafe xxxix yeares past illuminate countrey heluetia light word call darknesse superstition brightnesse gospell thinking longer lingring thought greatest prayse glorie consist herein god giuen grace bee happely ouercome follow christes chariot triumph daye forwarde neuer ceased deuise doe thinges perceyued appertaine glorie christes desire priuate lucre delited nouelties speciall regard others might haue whole fruite auayle reformation selues payne labour reforming lyke sweepestakes rape reue church goodes handes put man eyther nobilitie church theyr right deceyued caryed common sway ignoraunce laboured winne friendly brotherly instruction vncurteously cast wherby came passe best witted amonge afterwarde great good seruice christ church whome eyther age dulnesse wit hindered suffered paciently enioy goodes reuenues bicause shoulde haue occasion eyther make complaint tumult whatsoeuer goodes fell administration appoynted partlye building mainteyning schooles partly sustentation relieuing poore vsed liberall wyse mainteyne onely professor science tongue also certaine studentes number fourescore continuall stipende exhibition insomuch part day preach christ citie countrey haue hundred fortie parish bounde beholden liberalitie rowme place dexteritie handling matter wisedome taking counsell modestie executing thing seemed impossible done easily brought passe insomuch within short space time free nation without feare publike tumult sedition great approbation people thing haue spoken taken hand brought ende although thought poperie gainefull therfore coulde well brooke ouerthrowe thereof attempted oftentimes many thing yet singuler benefite god enterpryses alwayes vaine tempestes raysed chased away wholesome breath heauenly father according precept christ simplicitie doues wisedome serpentes appeared deuyses often aduersaryes went eyther flatterie fayre promise fearefull menace withdrawe purpose least woulde haue perswaded haue left controuersie religion iudgement bishop clergie still aunswered wisely plainly sort coulde woulde denie reiect thinges learned god worde true readie render reason beliefe man shoulde demaunde yea woulde willingly yeelde man coulde conuince error holy scripture coulde teach better waye saluation helde diuers aunsweres lyke kinde tenour wherewith stopped mouthes great many wherein still maye read saying apostle whether right od hearken vnto rather god iudge cannot choose speake thing haue seene heard againe ought rather obey god men therefore heauenly grace eternall god fauoured prospered godly enterprise whereby came passe common weale hath happily escaped kinde tribulation day middle horrible daungerous styrres trouble christendome doth liue peace hir selfe also safe sanctuarie forreyners straungers resorting hir place therefore great weightie cause thinketh haue mooued honourable especiall good lordes dedicate labour traueyle vnto wherein according grace god bestowed vppon mee haue gone open make plaine booke describeth fi st countenaunce looke church called primitiue church wyth proceeding encrease whole estate president wherof see haue followed lesse industrie diligence good happie successe president shall follow shall suceede gouernement common weale shall see howe haue done nothing rashly head shall also perceyue themselues woonderfully pricked forwarde obserue keepe power fourme order refourmed church religion shall receyue surely shall verie profitable meditate oftentymes meanes beginning auncestours deuised order fourme church common weale shall neyther regarde slaunderers maliciously depraue thinges done well godlily neyther shall turned truth anye stormes persecution threates worlde may aryse also profitable manye tymes talke thinges people ledde commonly thing present doe easily forget thinges passed gone verie seldome thinke thing come therefore allow deuises magistrate see ioyned eyther present profite cleere perilles daunger soone daunger appeareth finde fault lacke wisedome equitie whose councels ought faythfullye set forward obey vnderstande ruler god authour guyder drift deuises whatsoeuer according duetie surelye woulde learne religiously iudge ruler easilye obey woulde sodenly bee mooued turned euerye rumour daunger arysing surely thing chiefly ment intended began openly reade booke flocke christ among publishe set abroade openly spoken declared sawe state age waxing euery day woorse woorse nedefull continually pervse bookes holy scripture sette people example primitiue church conteyned shoulde deceyued gloses vnder false colour pretence antiquitie burthen v newe errours accuse thinges noueltie graue godly menne haue restored vnto v worde god accept therefore labour mine honourable good lordes fauour haue manye yeares borne vnto truth vnto mee manye fellowes coparteners euen childehoode continue good vnto student diuinitie holde accustomed humanitie gentlenesse toward pilgrimes banished christes sake abide mainteyning lawes correcting people maners enhaunceing vertuous exercise bridling wickednesse iustice many place horrible contempt god reigneth diuers doe wickedly reiect wholesome benefite god worde knowledge christ charitie men waxeth chill fayth fayleth euerie day little little iniquitie aboundeth newe croppes naughtinesse dayly encrease god therefore angrie threatneth v punishment feareth world woonders monster horrible vprores kingdomes yet neuer fayle abyde continue promoting glorie defende church christe according measure vocation perseuere duetie shall blesse labour gouerne councels spirite shall blesse people shall owne accorde obey wholesome lawes moste happilye enioye gladsome benefite euangelicall peace shall blesse whole church shall go forwarde euerie day doctrine godlinesse onely lorde lordes immortall euerlasting god blessing honour power glorie euer amen giuen zurich famous chiefe citie heluetia first daye august round feare eye lorde ouer righteous haue seene vngodly great prosperitye flourishing lyke greene baye tree citie great king call vpon time thy trouble heare thee thou shalt glorifie thinkest thou eate bulles flesh drinke bloud goates washe throughly e iniquitie clense sinne renewe mee right spirite thou ha numbred flittinges thou hast put teares thy bottell venemous poyson serpent bee like deafe dder stoppeth hyr eares blessed man whome thou choosest thou wentest vp high thou hast ledde captiuity captiue zeale thine house hath euen eaten mee prayse name lorde songue domynion shall one sea shall delyuer poore cryeth afflicted c iewrie god knowne name great israell shewe light thy countenaunce shall saued haue sworne holynesse fayle dauid couenant breake alter thing gone lyppes made eye shall see multitude sorrowes heart thy comfortes refreshe soule lorde seeth neyther doth god iacob vnderstande thou makest clowdes thy charyot watereth hylles aboue earth replenished fruite thy workes pag touch mine annoynted turned theyr glorye similitude calfe eateth haye let giue thankes whome lorde hath redeemed deliuered hande enimie lord sayde vnto lord sitte thou right hand thou art priest euer ye order melchisedech rule thou myddle among thine enimies hee lifteth simple dust right deere sight lorde death saintes pag rewarde shall gyue vnto lorde benefit hath done vnto lord strength lyfe stone builder refused better trust lord pag good mee haue beene miserye lyft vp mine eye vnto hylles whence helpe shall come beholde euen eye seruaunts looke vnto handes theyr maysters c enter tabernacle house set watche god mouth put trust prince pag hee declares hys worde vnto iacob statute ordinance vnto israell hee couereth heauen wyth clowdes prepareth rayne earth prouerb beginning knowledge feare lorde thou seeke wisdome golde thou shalt finde hyr pag lord hateth false witnesse bringeth vp lye lotte cast lappe ordering thereof standeth lorde searcheth maiestie god shall depriued glorie matthei thou shalt call hys name iesus shall c pag repent say haue abraham father beloued sonne whome well pleased blessed poore heart shall see god citie great king one iote one title lawe shall scape thou bringest thy gyft aulter remembrest shall perfect euer father heauen perfect maketh sonne aryse c pag treasure heart also seeke shall finde measure meate shall c euerye one sayth vnto lorde depart fro yee worke iniquitie follow let deade burye deade thy fayth hath made thee safe pag man foe shall owne housholde whosoeuer shall confesse men also confesse father heauen receyueth receyueth speake spirite father speaketh wise serpent feare ye kill c pag persecute one citye c goe waye gentile hee loueth father mother shal gyuen hower speake come vnto mee yee labour sore laden man knoweth father sonne thanke thee father bicause thou hast hidde thing wise one enter strong man house spoyle c abundance hart mouth speaketh secret kingdome heauen euery planting heauenly father c meete throwe childrens breade vnto dogges nothing goeth mouth c vaine doe worship mee teaching doctrine preceptes men gate hell shall preuayle beloued sonne whome well pleased heare hym two three gathered togither name cheefe among let seruaunt kindome god shall taken c god abraham god isaac giue vnto cesar thinges cesars vnto god thing god whatsoeuer bidde obserue obserue doe hierusalem hierusalem thou killest prophetes heare christ ye shall heare warres rumoures warres parable talentes enter ioye thy lord pag harbourlesse yet toke hee king israell let nowe come downe crosse vntill ende world power gyuen mee heauen earth teaching obserue thing soeuer haue commaunded marc euer shall bee ashamed mee wordes c man forsaketh house c pag goe yee worlde preache c hee beleeueth baptised shalbe saued hee beleeueth shall bee dampned lord spoken vnto hee receyued heauen luc hee hath put downe mightie seates exalted lowe degree pag woe vnto nowe laughe shall wayle weepe pag thy sinnes forgyuen thee pag euer receyue go citie man putteth hande plough looketh back apt kingdome god pag hee heareth heareth mee hee despyseth despyseth mee whatsoeuer citie enter happie heare wordes god keepe pag let loynes bee gyrte lightes brennyng feare little flocke father pleasure gyue kyngdome bee prophete perishe hierusalem child worlde wyser child light pag chaunced dayes noe shall bee dayes sonne man iudge certain citie gyue mouthe wysedom agaynst c pag yee haue abydden mee temptacions pag appoint vnto kingedome father hath appointed vnto mee bee come foorth vnto theefe swordes stanes pag daye thou shalt bee mee paradise father forgyue wote doe ought christ haue suffered thing c must fulfilled written mee lawe moyses prophet psalmes handle mee see spirite hath fleshe bone see mee haue repentace remission sinnes muste bee preached name among nation ioan hee came amongest hys owne lyfe man hath seene god tyme sonne c beholde lambe god pag tho zeale thyne house hath euen eaten mee hee beleeueth sonne shall see lyfe god loued world c pag wynde bloweth listeth thou hearest sounde thereof knowest whence commeth whether goeth pag whosoeuer drinketh water shall gyue shall neuer thirst true worshipper shal worship father spirite truth ye worship wote pag woorkes father hath gyuen mee finishe beare witnes mee hee heareth worde beleeueth sent mee escaped death vnto lyfe pag houre shall come ye graues shall heare voyce man commeth vnto mee except father drawe sent mee euery one whiche seeth sonne beleueth hee beleeueth mee belly shall flowe ryuers water lyfe doth ruler beleeue abraham sawe day glad hee god heareth worde god doo woorkes father beleue sheep heare voice man shal pluck hande haue sheepe also whiche folde infirmitie vnto death glory god sonne god might glorified thereby expedient v one man dye people shall also minister bee lifte vppe earth drawe men vnto mee receyueth soeuer sende receyueth mee shall men know disciple loue one another ought also washe one anothers feete waye light truth man commeth vnto father mee father house many dwelling place leaue comfortles pag come agayne receyue euen vnto self praye father hee shall gyue comforter without mee yee nothing pag haue kept sayinge keepe also nowe cleane thoroughe wordes haue spoken vnto yee shall leaue mee alone yet alone nowe yee haue sorrowe see agayne harte shall reioyce worlde yee shall haue tribulation haue glorified thee vpon earth pag father whiche thou hast gyuen mee life euerlasting might knowe thee kingedome thys worlde wee haue kynge cesar pag finished thing written might beleeue roman declared bee sonne god power whosoeuer hath sinned without lawe shall also perishe withoute law though dyd beleeue therefore wee holde man iustified fayth men haue sinned destitute glory god iustified freely thorough hys grace circumcision vncircumcision sinne abounded myght grace also raigne pag lawe spirituall carnall wretched shall deliuer mee body death god bee v v haue receyued spirite bondage feare anye pag hee knowe also dyd hee predestinate pag spirit adoption wee crye abba father neyther death lyfe seperate v loue god pag industrie man mercie god pag harte man beleeueth vnto righteousnes mouth confesseth vnto saluation pag whosoeuer shall call name lorde shalbe safe shall call whome haue beleeued pag shall beleeue without preacher howe shall preache without sent hearing commeth worde god giftes god without repentance god spared naturall braunches deepenesse ryches c doth mercifully let hym doe cheerefully gyuing honour go one reioyce doe reioyce weepe weepe prince fearefull doe well euill knowe perswaded lorde iesus nothing common whatsoeuer thinges haue beene written afore time written learning mysterye kept secret since worlde begonne corinth wee preach christ crucified vnto iewes stumbling blocke gentyles foolishnesse vnto called iewes gentile preach christ power god wisdome god pag naturall manne perceyueth thinges spirite god paule fed corinthian mylke minister god whome haue beleeued disposers secret god pag hast thou thou hast receyued christ iesu gospell haue begotten pag whoremonger adulterer shall inherite kingdome god woe vnto mee preach gospell ye cannot bee pertakers lordes table god faythfull suffer v bee tempted aboue strength must bee sectes tryed among might knowne nowe see glasse euen darcke speaking shal see face face spirites prophetes subiect prophet corruptible must put incorruption death thy sting corinth promyses god hym yea affliction christ plenteous v c selues wee sufficient thinke c wee messenger roome christ euery man shall receyue according hee hath done bodye pag god hath made bee sinne v whiche knewe synne pag god loueth cherefull gyuer pag galath maruell soone turned fro christ pag angell heauen preach gospell onely woulde learne whether receyued spirite deedes law pag though bee man testament yet bee proued man c hee sayeth seedes many thy seede one ibidem lawe schoolemayster vnto christ neyther bonde free neyther male female bycause sonnes god hath sent spirite son c pag full tyme come god sente hys sonne c pag byte deuoure one another would god cut haue called hir witnesse tymes light truth life remembrance maystresse lyfe messenger antiquitie yet certaine title may applyed hystorie deseruedly truely hystorie contayned bookes olde newe testament holy ghost hath deliuered vnto church hystorie bringeth v exact infallible account tymes first beginning worlde vnto birth iesus christ account wryters founde vncertayne deceytfull hystorie onely light also touchstone whereby writinges credite hystoriographers ought tryed hystorie conserueth v memorie thing done deede deede appertayne aluation thing lye hidden ecrete closet reuerend antiquitie truely reporteth vnto v maystresse life shee onely none ought called layeth v example onely vice vertues chaungeable occurrence worlde may learne rame present life taking hir flight yet higher giueth preceptes eternall saluation soule shee reuealeth holy god shee layeth v president god promise threates shee describeth iudgement god disobedient declareth protection tuition wherewith hee defendeth worship conclude shee setteth v beholde glasse nature propertie god euery man may see one vouchsafeth v maner one requireth v againe towardes thing vnlesse imprint mindes traueyle hystories vaine may delight v vaine ioye able enflame mindes loue true vertue holy religion amongst volume holy scripturethe comme datio argument actes apostle make mention report thing done thinke none extant reading knowledge whereof eyther profitable necessarye entituled actes apostle say nothing luke author hereof whose prayse gospell present almost thing done holy scripture inspired god needeth authoritie prayse man dignitie maiestie thing comprised booke able allure mooue man esteeme loue woorke vayne shalt thou go humane reason perswade amongst thinges intreate presently containe argument summe whole narration discourse kingdom christ worldand first luke descrybeth beginning proceeding successe kingdome christ hath thys worlde whereof appeareth prophet many thing foreshewed tolde dauid testifieth christ declared king god father psalme whose inheritaunce sayth hee nation earth also shall rule islandes zacharie prophecieth zachar boundes hys kingdome stretch sea sea daniel daniel called mountayne shoulde fill worlde wherevnto thinges referred written prophetes wordes esaye mich latter dayes hill house lord buylded shall chiefe among hilles exalted aboue little hilles passe ouer diuers thing prolixitie might alleaged purpose thou wouldest search thinges hystorie iesu christ written euaungelistes thou shouldest finde little nothing answerable honorable oracle describe christ lowly poore subiect iniuries reproches euery man infinite sort calamity abode shamefull death crosse shewe border kingdome haue bene narrow straite misteries vnderstanded thou wilt pervse booke whatsoeuer prophet haue prophecied shall appeare true seemed despised man estimation glorious ascention heauen hath triumphed ouer deuill enimies sitteth right hande hys father thence sendeth holy ghost promysed apostle wherewith inflamed beginne preache christ content within border iurie dispersed amonge gentile amongst playne simple preaching gospell spredde kingdome christ farre neare christ stretcheth kingdome sea sea islandes sea beginne acknowledge theyr king ministerye apostle commeth passe nation people flocke vnto mountayne exalted aboue mountaynes yea reigning heauen thing christ dayes death prophecied come passe wordes shall lyft vp earth iohn drawe people vnto mee euident argument kingdome christ power none euident prince neuer mightie coulde quickly chaunge fashion whole world apostle yeres abiects contemned person spirit christ woorking graffed harte men newe time vnknowne desire fayth christian religion except therfore booke extant truth kingdome christ maiestie therof appeare eyther none leastwise might seeme obscure vncertaine beside thisthe forme church primitiue rule reformation thereafter one thing profitable necessary knowne say maner countinaunce primatiue church founded apostle according church age ought refourmed error abuse shall happen touching thing men dispute therof day shall man finde fewe wil take straight way opened apostle amende wherby commeth passe put newe error place olde driue away olde superstition new pieuish noysome olde whereas would obserue thinges written luke wee haue certaine infallible rule aswell doctrine ceremony apostle left vnto church taught one iesus christ onely auctor saluation men nature sinner daunger damnation meanes iustified saued faith iesus christ yea booke aboundeth notable example wherewith principall chiefe article christian fayth sayd eare whyle warranted confirmed cauillations sophisters phariseis euer apostle require vncleane gentile straungers common weale people god leaue olde superstition beleeue christ preache saluation forgiuenesse sinnes turning open ydolatrie stoutely stande blinde bayardes would burthen gentile woorks lawe though christ beene power saue prepared themselues deedes lawe wherfore faith iesus christ sufficient gentile charged workes ceremony lawe published god pray shall let faith beliefe shal suffise v day shall say tradition men profitable necessary attaynement iustification saluation god ordayned remayne till time correction touching ceremony outwarde rytes apostle thought vnlawfull charge church thing vpon priuate authoritie baptisme order wherof receyued christ lorde haue sincerely deliuered vse maner lordes supper christ institute thought good retayne matter church chiefe care haue discipline wherewith christ woulde naughtye disposed kept vnder poore shoulde honestly prouided whose case condicion lorde vouchsafe earnestlye commende vnto v thinges besides dayes vnder name apostle canon apostle obtruded wee acknowledge apostolyke neyther good man blame v therefore forasmuch luke maketh mention whose diligence labour holy ghost thought good vse writing sermon actes apostle surely neuer thinke holye ghost eyther vnwyse take negligent wryter high matter else forgetfull let passe thing knowledge obseruation whereof necessarie hys church would speake euery thing large recourse treatise hystorie commodiously handled let suffise time haue shewed great vtilitie booke ministreth v true infallible rule reforming church except obserue called counted reformer may well reioyce reformation ye iudgement fleshe shall neuer giue v church man meanely trayned holy scripture shall acknowledge pointes sincere true apostolike church howbeit booke sheweth v forme paterne church christthe condition state church world also plainely teacheth v state condicion church earth know profitable necessarie aswell doctrine information also comfort thereby commeth vnto v shal see apostle euery part world finde true christ foreshewed touching crosse affliction god would worke thing supersticiously wickedly maintayned worlde till daye shoulde yeelde owne accorde preaching would invre labour contention euery place founde woulde withstande theyr doctrine rascall common sorte learning godlynesse worlde woondered scribe priestes amongst iewes philosopher gentyles neyther matter decyded wyth wordes great authoritie enimies truth magistrate tooke partes fayne pleade cause contrarie commaundements hazarde lyfe thus banished natiue countrie felt smart exyle perill sea lande laye bounde prison euerye man hated rayled vpon finallye ended charge preaching gospell death bloudsheading thinges wee consider wee shall perceyue haue hope nowe dayes neyther shall wee offended eyther wyth authoritie power men striuing gospell wyth rage furie side loyaltie truth christ shall marueylously comforte v apostle founde true promyses promised ayde holy spirite present counsell aduersitie safegard defence men perfourmed hauing vpper hande despite world prince therof obtained purpose able good successe perfourme vocation let man therefore feare threates tyraunts day let man afrayde sathans enterpryses let man abasshed stormes tempestes worlde christ liueth still truth promyses infallible made apostle euen continued men beleeue christ according doctrine surely iohn vtilitie booke one man seeth necessary knowledge therof dayes wee see euery horrible attemptes church christ vnhappy disturbance trouble yet besides example whereof hystorie full bringeth v small fruit learning godlynesseexamples men degree condition stage church may wee see apostle apostolike person whose example minister christes church may learne trust prudencie ought handle christ cause constancie truth may defende puritie maners shoulde leade others courage pacience vanquish aduersitie set forth magistrate good bad whose counsel doings office may take president gouernment want example neyther riche poore haue men whome may learne remembred notable deedes certaine woman womanhood may take example lyue briefe degree state eyther laytie spiritualtie booke instructeth many peculyer president although little haue spoken commendation thereof yet suppose appeareth therby god ment enriche church singular iewell treasure whan liked mynisterie luke haue storie apostle primitiue church written behooueth v acknowledge goodnesse follow diligence holy ghost searching thinges comprysed holy writing luke beginneth woordes former treatise deare theophilvs haue spoken iesvs began doe teach c hee entreth discourse actes apostle rehearseth thinges christ apostle little ascention vseth little short plaine preface rehearsall thinges done hee continueth ioyneth booke first entituled gospell iesu christ written luke therwithal sheweth purposeth thys booke sense hys woordes seemeth first booke spake thinges iesus christ sonne god earth sake purposed discourse thinges would haue done mynistery apostle hys departure body worlde doth dedicate booke one theophilus theophilus men thinke haue bene speciall friend luke singular fayth deede addition putteth hys name preface gospell calling nonlatin alphabet noble excellent vsed chiefely great men authoritie afterwarde wee shall heare attributeth festus foelix president iurie therefore godly man authoritie god vseth alwayes appoint hys church succour ayde beyng strife contention yet man may hereof gather booke appertaineth aswell v rather let men endeuour shew themselues theophili saye louers god thinke luke speaketh lesse vnto auncient theophilus truly many beleeue christ reconciled vnto god loue theyr harte power touchyng opinion mattereth much since playne ynough doctrine olde newe testament appertayneth chiefely loue god thereout may haue learnyng comforte rom shall profitable examine fewe woordes euaungelist somewhat diligently first considered professeth write thinges luke vnderstanded saying hath written thing luke may seeme repugne iohn ende gospell written saith also many thing iesvs shoulde wrytten euery one suppose worlde coulde contayne bookes written place may easily reconciled luke saith hath written euery thing perticularly testifieth hath spoken thing necessary knowe attaynement saluation may instruct v sufficient knowledge iesus christ albeit euaungelistes rehearse doings sayinges christ yet christ neuerthelesse beleeued neither needefull declare thing euident christ selfe truth gainesayth selfe anye place obserueth one ende sayinges manifest doings tende one marke purpose wherefore though apostle let passe none yet haue knowne none christ learned fayth wee haue learned writinges extant doth iohn witnesse saith many signes truely dyd iesvs presence disciple written booke wrytten yee might beleeue iohn iesvs christ sonne god beleeuing yee might haue lyfe thorough name iohn witnesseth wee attayne vnto life beliefe christ forasmuch beliefe may fully learned perceyued thinges written christ thinke man past shame denie thinges concerning perfect doctrine saluation christian fayth comprehended writing euaungelistes therefore luke woordes reprooueth impudent arrogancye sophisters dayes tried conuict haue thrust many thinges church without authoritie holy scripture would fayne slippe away slye shift saying thinges necessarie v beleeue obserue contayned scripture wee graunt must wee confesse eyther apostle prophetes haue taught v faith christ perfectly faith sufficient saluation neither tollerable christian eares christ ministerie consisteth work doctrinefurthermore luke comprehendeth christes office ministery earth two woordes say woorkes doctrine wee speake dutie teacher whome well sayde hee teach people good example euaungelist meaneth place describe property teacher propose set forth thinges considered christ giueth woorkes first place whereby meaneth myracles onely whatsoeuer thinges else hee saluation kinge priest scripture teacheth v euery place psalme hee gyuen v king priest chieflye dauid king gaue v lawes lyfe euerlasting made expedition worlde fight sathan common enimie mankinde ouercame set v libertie tyed fast chaines sinne furthermore liberalitie royall abundantly enriched beleeue treasure kingdome heauen moreouer priesthood taught v prayed v al hanged crosse offred body bloud tooke v sufficient sacrifice acceptable god sinnes hereunto serued myracles thought bring men obedience faith teache simple thereby know place assigneth doctrine wherin reason thing done christ declared meane season must thinke luke vaine haue ioyned workes doctrine togyther comprehending twoo woordes concerneth christ teacheth consideration christ twoo must needes ioyned togither except wee consider hys doctrine hys woorkes shall auayle v knowledge saluation thinges done liuyng thousand fiue hundred yeares past consider doctrine shall vnderstand thinges wrought sake saluation might happen v benefite christ redeemer also consideration hys woorkes shall bring credite authoritie doctrine forasmuch beare manifest witnesse hys diuine power godhead christ selfe teacheth saying iohn woorkes father hath giuen mee finishe woorkes doe beare witnesse mee father hath sent mee againe doe woorkes father beleeue iohn doe beleeue mee beleeue woorkes yee may know beleeue father mee woordes counterfait christian worlde impeached beleeue workes christ furnished hystoricall faith vse praise thing euer suffered commeth poynt beleeue one christ saluation obtayned onely merite though forgotten theyr former fayth turne way seeke infinite meanes besides christ attayne saluation men doe allured testimonye common reporte friendship familiarity greatly extoll science phisicke fall sicke refuse vse thereby plainely declaring distrust arte knowledge phisicke euen men confesse christ theyr mouth denie deede cause hurtfull wauering none consider christes bare woorkes whereby mooued somewhat marueyle marueyle endureth forasmuch wanteth proppe doctrine ignorant ende whereas would heare christes teaching perceyue myracles wrought described intent onely wee repose hope saluation saying waye light truth iohn man commeth father mee whosoeuer drinketh elementall water drawne owne strength shall thirst againe iohn whosoeuer shall drinke water shall giue shall neuer thirst math come vnto mee yee labour laden shall refreshe furthermore considered luke maketh christes ascentionthe ascentio christ ende gospell ende bounde story gospell saith hath spoken first booke thing christ sayde vntill daye taken vp heauen giuen commaundements apostle chosen hereby gather christ glorious ascention heauen hath perfourmed poyntes redemption saluation wee haue shewed gospell perfectly contayned thinges concerne saluation bicause therefore ascention christ placed last certaine last ende thinges necessarye saluation wee holde shall appeare cleare may wee henceforth neede bodily presence christ earth doe earth longe since hath faithfully fully perfourmed thing doe wee haue neede spirite grace meryte doctrine counsell protection christ neuer withholdeth sorte promised vntill ende worlde math math selfe also forbiddeth v beleeue shall say hee corporallye present bicause wee haue commodious place speake thinges little hystorie ascention handled let fewe woordes suffice present care studie christe churchthis obserued christ would leaue earth giuen commaundementes apostle vnderstande place one commaundement badde departe hierusalem till receiued promised holy ghost luke seemeth speake vniuersally thinges christ meant admonish apostle chiefly concerned office apostleship little followeth saide comfortable christ although absent body ceaseth yet care prouide church fulfilleth dutie good faithfull householder goyng countrie committeth charge familie trusty friendes meane season telleth eche housholde shall doe absent euen christ ascending heauen commended care church apostle testifieth gospell take friendes instructeth commaundements least rashnesse vnfaithfulnesse offende parable xxiiij xxv mathew make exposition place let man therefore thinke daunger tyraunts deceyuers left destitute ayde christ lieth open theyr pleasure crueltie hath redeemed sheepe pryce owne bloud gaue charge apostle goyng worlde vndoubtedly beholdeth still suffer taken hande meane also serueth purpose iohn gaue commaundements went forth declareth thereby plainely one day come agayne let v therefore prepare selues commyng beyng alwayes mindefull woordes christ sayth luke let loynes gyrded aboute lightes brennyng yee selues like vnto men wayte theyr lorde returne weddyng commeth knocketh may open vnto immediatly happy ruaunts lorde commeth shall finde wakyng c author ie apostle doctrinebut wee ende sermon thinges remayne discussed commend vnto v dignitie authoritie apostle doctrine first sayth chosen christ speaketh speciall choyse election whereby taken onely number shoulde saued also appoynted ende vse preacher grace conferred christ paule sayth stewardes mystery god furthermore saith receyued commaundementes christ1 cor prince make ambassadours letter commission wee call instruction onely contayned remembrance thinges haue doe also credite authoritie put euen iesus christ would instruct ambassadours commaundementes might appeare doe bicause many consider christ man onely perceyue nothing apostle passing condition common persones therefore luke addeth commaundementes giuen holy ghost wee would lay thinges togither appeare humane diuine affayres committed apostle shall appeare also theyr doctrine referred christ auctor thereof christes messenger paule sayth2 cor commended testimonie christ saying receyueth euer sende receyueth againe iohn receyueth receyueth mee receyueth mee math receyueth sent mee partes therefore brother iudge well office doctrine apostle thankefully acknowledge vnspeakeable benefite god giuen v theyr preachyng imbrace true faith shall come passe wee borne againe immortall seede diuine woorde shall leade life woorthy child god beyng deliuered horrible tempestes worlde shall liue euer heauen sonne god iesus christ onely lord sauiour prayse honour glory power dewe euer amen seconde homelie story gospell tolde yesterday doth aladuentures admonished instructed holy ghost meaneth thereby teache v excellent pointe learnyng hereby appeareth story apostle meanes seuered story gospell serueth well purpose discourse story place speaketh two thinges wherof christ intreated disciple one diligent proofe resurrection instruction touchyng kingdome god speake asmuch lord shall put mindes describeth christ resurrection amongst thing first apparition appeared mary magdalene garden sepulchre iohn like gardener shee knewe little whyle meetyng woman also commyng graue math hee saluteth place saith resurrection lyfe beleeueth mee though dead yet shall hee lyue euery one lyueth iohn beleeueth mee shall dye euer needeth many woordes none cause beliefe christ god promiseth v euery life body soule would beleeue finde life able restore selfe lyfe againe therefore least wee beyng offended christes death doubte promise reuiued againe thyrde day death raysed againe true body declared power authoritie rayse againe body likewise beyng truely dead buried touchyng manhoode coulde rayse againe shall much aliue kingdome able restore body death lyfe againe hereunto belonge promise christ prouyng resurrection sayth shall mynister iohn place come againe take selfe iohn may also againe father thou hast gyuen mee iohn shall mee may see glory else could fayre promise declare vnto v death hath giuen euery man haue planted apollo hath watred god giueth increase neyther planteth thing neyther watereth god giueth increase thinges obserued shall worthily esteeme ministerie giue glory taught hereby sacramentes doe seale promise benefites god wee neede whit doubt god mocketh v vaine shewes promise whatsoeuer promiseth worde sealeth sacrament hee vseth perfourme deede promiseth v whosoeuer beleeueth promise gospell hee certayne forgiuenesse sinnes adoption possession heauenly inheritance certayne hee washed baptisme lyke reason taught gospell flesh bloude christ gyuen offred aultar crosse lyfe worlde sinnes worlde purged sacrifice immaculate lambe christ hath ioyned promise supper remembraunce hys death steade seale therof therefore whosoeuer beleeueth gospell certaine christes body bloude offred sinnes surely fedde merite christes bodye bloude vnto lyfe euerlasting hee sure receyueth part breade wine lordes table according christes institution sort sacrament sayd seale righteousnesse fayth confirme feede fayth outwarde element conceyue anye secrete vertue power wordes consecration efficacy power must attributed holy businesse reason christes institution institution thou take away alter breake thou prophanest ouerthrowest sacrament vtterly therfore myndes must lift vp thing testifye outwarde action wee may perfourme fayth apprehendeth christ benefites hath bestowed v gathereth v number shall raigne heauen blessing honour glory power euer amen fourth homelie therefore come togither asked saying lorde wilt thou time restore againe kingdome israell hee sayde vnto know time season father hath put owne power yee shall receyue power holy ghost come vpon shall witness vnto onely hierusalem also iurie samarie euen vnto worldes ende argument vse place luke great diligence hath declared sauiour iesus christ instructed apostle would haue teacher al world thing knowledge vse wherof necessary ministration office length commeth hystory glorious ascention christ first declareth last talke christ disciple wherein comforteth reasoneth fullye large touching office hytherto seemed well vnderstand disciple gaue occasion christ discourse hereof doctrine straightnesse lyfe bene able haue mooued anye kinde men howe smally profited proofe well declared vpon followed christ doctrine framed prepaced maner wayes winne added myracles force efficacie able make verye enimies confesse truth iohn uerily nicodemus confessed man sent god coulde doe thing sawe doe euery daye manye openlye sayde iohn shall christ hee commeth worke myracles man witnesse appeareth great power iesus christ smal remnant prophet afore time tolde able multiplie encrease church fewe yeares spred ouer worlde wee maye learne also vntowardnesse man nature acknowledge declared isaye christ speaking flocke sayth feare little flocke luke hath pleased father giue kingdome himselfe speaking last time declareth shall fashion condicion worlde luke commeth shall finde rude selfe surely paule bishop requireth thing chieflye able teach playne doctrine truth tractable sort men also able refell conuince shall gainesay contrary same1 timo titus whereof alwayes great multitude therefore minister worde knowledge christ misteries necessary al thing concerne article christian fayth dutie faythfull required diligent reading scripture wherein hee ought well exercised hath neede knowledge tongue reading scripture depende vpon sense others constrayned looke men eye go men feete furthermore meete furnished artes speaking hee maye perceyue propounde place sort order weyght paule without cause exhorted timothy continue still reading yet confesseth childe learned scripture moreouer whereas infinite daungers hange ouer function minister boldenesse minde requisite shoulde yong scholer nouice1 timo least puffed vp sodaine dignitie commit thing dishonest vncomely giue occasion aduersary reprooue yea christ himselfe last supper commendeth apostle plaine luke subiect many faultes infirmity chiefely cause abode temptation office apostle minister wordebut let v see peter last wordes defineth office dutie apostle let one appoynted sayth may witnesse resurrection first haue partner fellow ioyned eleuen seruant whome reast pleasure might commaunde knewe equalitie needefull amongst christes minister calleth witnesse name christ called little went hence often repeticion diligent consideration name little profitable hereby worthynesse christian fayth certaintye doctrine euangelicall may perceyued bicause christ onely preacher thing ut also sworne witness wrate deliuered v fayth last sheweth whereof hee shoulde beare witnesse namely resurrection vnderstanded though apostle preach nothing else christ resurrection thought hereby expresse chiefe article wherin al contayned yea plainely teacheth whereto referred verilye preaching death necessitie included ioyned resurrection shall teach christ risen death first teacheth died man teach christ dyed must first speake nature christ able dye must teache therefore sonne god one euerlastingnesse substance father ye tyme appoynted tooke man nature virgin wombe many diuers trouble life length suffred bitter death vpon aultar crosse therefore preacher witnesse resurrection iesus christ must omitte none thing went another cause also peter would make mention resurrection ende accomplishment redemption paule sheweth large first epistle corinthian xv chapter sinne sting power death whervnto men subiect death ouercome vanquished resurrection christ doth manifestly declare wherefore sinne also meanes whereof death power ouer v meryte christ must needes taken awaye guylt sinne taken awaye death spoyled vnarmed seeth serpent heade crushed tyranny deuill vtterly subdued deede rageth yet maketh horrible adooe christian mindes afraide terror shoulde able hurt v hauing dartes sinne death taken naked force christ hath taken away whyle purged sinnes worlde vppon aultare crosse glorious resurrection hath killed force death therefore syth peter haue must taken number apostle witnesse christes resurrection appoynteth office residue whome sayde go yee worlde marke preache kingdome god vnto creature whosoeuer beleeueth baptized shall bee saued meane season dayes called taken successor apostle admonished dutie although man require witness sawe christes resurrection yet office truly boldly beare witnesse christ thing aswell suffred v men may vnderstande howe redemption saluation mankinde contayned christ onely whosoeuer taken apostolykes puft vp may vnderstande dooing tymethe state condition apostle certaine thing repeated first chapter first heard howe obeyed commaundement christ nowe readie ascende heauen bade returne hierusalem wayte spirite promised therefore returne thither abide vnto day spirit sent little shall see luke sayth plainly happened hierusalem moreouer attributeth vnanimitie concorde went dispersed vp downe citie neyther brawle contention betweene woont taryed one accorde togither one place adde vnto thirde poynt whereof mention also made howe continually persisted praier thought become euer slacker praying seeing compassed wyth daunger euery side appeareth choosing mathias prepared themselfe diligently administration office thing serue publike instruction v teache v howe ought prepare themselueshowe men must prepare themselues receiue holy ghost desire haue holye ghost giuen vnto haue giftes increased hereof haue neede reason inwarde naturall corruption wherewyth onlesse borne againe shall see kingdome god haue neede spirite bicause worlde desire fleshe wherewith many tymes reuoked way saluation iohn haue neede also reason temptation wherewith sathan oftentymes goeth bring v doubt certentie saluation redemption would easily ouercome v except confirmed wyth spirite christ paule sayth sure earnest pledge saluation spirit entereth froward soule2 corin ephes therefore haue neede prepare selues may meete receyue first therefore obedience requisite whereby behooueth v subiection god precept yea euen thing reason seeme daungerous hurtfull superfluous meanes shall thinke come passe shall haue spirite god giuen ashamed rebell agaynst god psalm god abide shall glorie lawe worde runne disobedience howe much lesse vouchsafe giue holy spirite furthermore meete one accorde charitie togither shall receyue holy ghost iohn god himselfe charitie requireth earnestly studie thereof yea christ appoynted cognizance knowne cannot christ iudge worthie spirite christian brotherhoode deuided hatred enuie contention open enimitie declare themselues straungers bodie christ church congregation moreouer vnto studie concorde obedience must ioyned feruent continuall prayer although god promise spirit freely giueth meere grace yet haue v pray aswell doth maiestie god require praye dutie whereby bound neyther declare manifest token fayth go aboute prayer obtaine thing belong saluation therefore heare dauid saye make cleane heart god renue right spirite within psalm cast mee away thy presence take thy holy spirite say euery day christ commaundeth v let thy kingdome come yea christ himselfe promiseth v shall aske god spirite vaine sayth euill giue good gyftes vnto child luke howe much shal father heauen giue holy spirit desire therefore let v dayes ioyne togither three obedience vnanimitie prayer example apostle shall perceyue selues marueylous comming forwarde true godlinesse wholsome increase holy ghost spirite christ author concord holinessefurthermore consideration apostle teacheth v spirite christ worketh preaching gospell spirite concorde holinesse author dissention carnall libertie dayes crie meanes would bring doctrine gospell suspicion hatred bicause say seede dissention planting licencious liuing may easily aunswere theyr slaunders apostle vnitie concorde receyued holy spirite plaine receyued concorde disturbed euery day confirmed effect spirite beleeue cannot author discorde amongst knit togither one head iesus christ maketh member one bodie coheyres kingdome impossible member one bodie quickened one spirite variance togither striue amongst themselues brought doctrine gospell vnto christ indued spirite touching enimies obiect v libertie flesh denie whosoeuer hath taste doctrine gospell shall confesse preaching therof beateth downe neyther doth spirite christ outwarde worde onely oppugne also consecrateth mind vnto god little ago bondslaues sinne become temple liuing god meane season denie many abuse colour gospell sow dissention plant libertie ought gospell charged therewith pray wise man condemneth magistrate bicause diuers vnder colour thereof haue become tyrauntes oppressor libertie countrie doe rather marke vse magistrate appointed ende lust priuate person restrayned violence tyrannie brideled euen let v confesse right vse gospell effect holye ghost onely set vp true concorde holly honestie life nay shall confesse truth none concorde acceptable god amonge faythfull iesus christ borne againe worde spirite god neyther true holinesse innocencie whereof christes spirite author holinesse men counterfaite without spirite hippocriticall able abide iudgement god straunge righteousnesse christ vseth supplie defectes wantes faythfull maner holy ghost sentnow aforesayde poyntes luke ioyneth maner sending visible bicause apostle might conceyue presence spirite greater confidence boldnesse go office also cause might appeare iesus christ neuer forsaketh church defendeth inuisible grace declared sending holy spirit hereto serueth notable promise leaue comfortlesse againe iohn math beholde vntill ende worlde touching maner howe thing done three thing remaine discussed first sodainly noyse heauen without mysterie thing come passe sodainly vnlooked forsuddenly noyse came heauen alwayes god vsage truely performeth promise least looke yea helpe remayning man performeth promise deliuering people bondage egypt foure hundred yeares israelite bereft libertie constrayned beholde horrible example tyrannie newe borne babe haue nothing safely trust vnto place sendeth holy ghost sodainely least thought whose comming deferred xj day long taught example paciently wayte promise god god truth selfe cannot deceiue forasmuch lord seruaunts becommeth v attende leysure prescribe time tarie thou lordes leysure sayth dauid stronge shall comfort thine heart put thou thy trust lorde psalm habac prophete sayth tarie yet wayte thou verie deede come slacke noyse sounde came heauen bicause wee might knowe holye apostle endued heauenly diuine spirite become preacher heauenly diuine doctrine man aucthoritie credite whereof might called doubt serueth confute foolishnesse ritche glutton require teacher come worlde heauen hell whatsouer thinges sayde man saluation dutie reiect scoffe saying yet neuer none came eyther heauen hell tell v disclose theyr wicked mindes voyde religion onlesse wicked men vtterly put away shamefastnesse would know sonne god came downe heauen fleshe rose againe death faythfully declared vnto v mystery kingdome heauen would know holy ghost came downe heauen spake thing apostle haue taught v touching meane saluation dutie would require newe kinde learning yea though aungell brought heauen ought beleeued galat accursed secondly certaine blast violent winde russhing ina vehement winde filleth house filled house apostle dwelt spirite signifyed blast winde doubt bicause name spirite borrowed speache diuine power called pierceth power conserueth thing hebrues vse worde ruach well vsed winde spirite christ woulde place therefore vse token winde set eye strength efficacie holy spirite incomprehensible man capacitie attayned power man better himselfe interpretate thing reasoning nicodemus operation spirite beleeue borne againe sayth winde bloweth thou hearest noyse thereof knowest whence commeth iohn whither goeth wit man coulde hitherto shewe v certayntie cause begynnynges wynde although haue long much searched operation holy spirite farre passeth capacitie man although effectuallye feele harte euen blowyng windes let deuice force men spirite christ worketh gospell feareth strength men hindred therby shew power wyll yea foolishe ridiculous endeuour whosoeuer wyll striue god bryng spirite worde god bent wyl holde within boundes appoynted example hereof haue euery apostle example right ought haue first place commaunded lorde fyll world preachyng seemed thing impossible done simple vnlearned men despised person yea many counted eyther power wisdome worlde withstoode yet spirite christe ministerie apostle burst worlde vehement blast foresignifie despite worlde prince worlde doctrine gospell published throughout nation let thinges comfort v vayne enterprise worlde tyrannes studie stop course gospell christe lyueth styll hygh derideth counselles whose spirite bloweth wil psalm ruled men pleasure clouen tongue ben firethirdly appeare clouen tongue fire settled vpon heades eche fylled holy ghoste wee sayde wynde token signe holye ghoste commeth visible signe also presence spirite myght doubt thereof maner trade god declare outwarde token inwarde spirituall giftes conceyued fayth haue beyng mynde reason proportion infallible truth god wherof signes seales vse called name thing signifie meanes commeth passe luke reasonyng tongue sate vpon apostle heades speaketh though spirite selfe syt heades euident tongue neither essentially holy ghost yet holy ghost included wyll say substaunce holy ghost fire except man list dote persian worshipped fire god also wyll thinke holy ghost whiche pierceth thinges scripture teacheth euery present inclosed small thyng tongue besydes luke saith holy ghost sate heades mindes fylled holy ghost holy ghost shoulde vayne syt vpon crownes onlesse entred mindes shewed foorth power efficacie therfore tongue token presence holy spirite neither coulde name holy ghoste cause applyed reason proportion similitude betweene euen nowe sayde furthermore signes whiche god accustometh vse perceaued great lykenesse thinges signified also presence spirite coulde signe haue bene euidently properly expressed lykenesse tongue agreable apostle office god appoynted preacher diuision tongue represented gift chiefly neede bicause must beare witnesse christe country vnderstanded men element fire signified voyce apostle shoulde effectuous workyng spirite spirite bright brenning fire consumeth thinges v carnall earthly spirite kindleth myndes men loue heauenly thinges leauing earthly thinges behinde may aspire onely eternall goodes heauenly kingdome holy ghost warmeth men benummed sinne maketh meete nimble good workes doe thinges christe feruencie fierie zeale proper marke led spirite christ spirit euer feeleth quenched let ceasse glorie spirit coulde rehearse diuers effect christes spirite commodious place speake therof sermon folowyng shall declared spirite wrought apostle let v acknowledge truth goodnesse christ wherby would thus prouide church let v prepare selues ensample apostle also may endued spirite christe enflamed holye loue god founde stoute duty men euery nation vnder heauen noysed multitude came togither astonied bicause euery man hearde speake owne language wondred marueyled saying among themselues beholde speake galiley howe heare euery arabyans haue hearde speake owne tongue great workes god amazed wondred saying one another meaneth mocked saying men full newe wine although promise lorde sauiour iesus christe first made apostle may seeme belong onely yet manyfest generall extended doe beleue apostle bicause imperfection faultes neede holy ghost without helpe could discharge office committed euen haue neede spirite bicause destitute neither order life christianly holde certainty faith temptation satan therfore ye consideration present hystorie man ought thinke either vnprofitable superfluous strongly mainteyneth aucthoritie apostolike doctrine also instructeth v many wayes teacheth v howe shoulde prepare selues receiue spirite iudge spirites touching ye first spoke yesterday may learned preset place luke goeth ye discription hystory declareth effectes holy ghost wrought aswel apostle hearer gift tonguesand beginnyng apostle hee attributeth two thinges vnto receyued operation holy ghost first receyued holy ghost began speake straunge diuers tongue great wonderful myracle know whether euer happened greater amongst men ignoraunt much laboure industrie required euen childhood learne diuers tongue see men growen yeres scarse able learne one tongue perfect vse thereof apostle men ripe yeres well striken age beyng idiotes vnlearned spent childhood youth studie learning handy occupasions euen moment became notable excellent knowledge vse one tongue two tongue acknowledgeth euident worke god reuerenceth operation holy ghost coulde industrie dexteritie man wyt haue done short tyme neither myracle superfluous seruing bare vayne ostentation thinges done iuglers profitable necessarie apostle discharging dutie office iesus christe appoynted teacher worlde ministerie doctrine gospell might published among nation necessarie shoulde vnderstanded nation howe coulde men vnderstande coulde haue vsed owne tongue onely euery place yea thinke founde greater lacke hitherto office perceyued themselues destitute necessarie knowledge tongue great incommoditie diuersitie tongue bolde enterprise man pryde moses sheweth brought meanes hereof seemed wholsome doctrine gospell hyndred passage thereof diuers nation stopped god one sounde taketh away impediment stoppell apostle euen first comming spirite feele selues eased difficultie thought woulde much haue hurt hereof may learned common generall comfort none walking vocation god dispayre helpe fauour god vseth cast many thinges wayes seeme impedimentes wherby go charge calling god meaneth much hinder trye faith patience therefore behooueth v constant faith good courage set thinges passe man strength shall finde god true faithfull thing seeme impossible v brought passe neither banishment stuttyng tongue coulde let moyses bringyng israell egypt yea red sea way stopped passage whyle followed god callyng taken way dryed vp passe ouer infinite example lyke sort seene euery aswell holy prophane hystories whosoeuer therfore appoynted teacher magistrate gouerne people let remember thinges take vnto good courage minde let priuate men also mindefull go forwarde like constancie vocation god wyll finishe worke hath begunne v repent v labour must taken sake let v also marke placethe apostle licensed preache tyll well instructed howe christ iesus chose ydiotes vnlearned men apostle woulde giue license preach abrode worlde tyll made perfect learned thinges parteyning office preachyng litle vnderstoode none syrian tongue neither perfectly pronuntiation appeared peter taken galilean nowe come foorth furnished knowledge tongue besides thexact vnderstanding olde testament spirite taught appeareth sermon condemneth insolent barbarousnesse anabaptistes step plough cart vnprepared pulpet thinke themselues apostolike felowes beyng destitute good learnyng manner contemne kinde knowledge peruerte whole order church farre beyng defended apostle example rather aucthoritie thereof sendeth learne thing needefull minister worde paule certes would haue rectour churche instructed habilitie sufficiencie teache requireth bare knowledge article faith saluation knowledge wherby may able confute aduersarie therefore easily finde also furnishe meete giftes require chiefly knowledge tongue without bookes holy scripture commodiously sufficiently declared meane hebrue greke tongue one hauyng olde testament written newe testament published apostle paule certayne place saith chiefe vse tongue interpretation holy scripture1 cor thinges whosoeuer lacketh shall neuer attayne certayne knowledge holy scripture whyle depende vpon men interpretation become lyke vnto see men eye heare men eares go men feete needefull vnderstanding tongue knowledge hystories specially science vtteraunce whosoeuer lacketh certes say shall doe little good ministerie church schoolesbut bicause thinges bestowed vpon men myraculously reade chaunced apostle happeneth fewe others therfore industrie labor continuance studie requisite referred thing written child prophetes colledges wherof holy prophet samuel elizeus rule gouernaunce great care diligence prophete reade howe greeuously reprehended went dissolute manner conuersation belly pieuishe supersticiouse sprong therof horrible ruine decaye church iulian apostata subtyll craftie man well forespyed cause commaunded christian kept learning ignoraunce lacke knowledge subtyltie mockerie philosophie might take place therefore christian prince wyll taken folowers fellowes iulian let knowe prouidyng caryng schooles belongeth principally let v returne apostle sayde erewhyle instructed gift tongue holy ghostthe holye ghost chaungeth oure tongue teacheth although seemeth haue come passe apostle onely yet extended alway effect holy ghost chaunge instruct tongue beleeuyng bicause naturall man perceyueth thinges belongyng spirite god therefore reason meete often goeth dispute diuine matter often bewrayeth follie infancie thing chaunced gentile philosopher paule saith besides man delighted vanitie rom reioyceth filthy talke oftentymes giueth bridle tongue blasphemie euery daye may seene dayly communication child worlde ouer besides mischiefes cannot speake would taken religious goeth prayer craue helpe god mynde pulled away either vayne thoughtes else troubled conscience sinnes pray sure affiaunce mynde prayer without faith auayle spirite christ remedieth fault regenerateth mindes men powreth true knowledge mystery saluation maketh v able reason nature god wyll iudgementes tongue vsed blasphemie backbyting raylyng periurie filthie talke kinde vncleannesse loseth prayse god giue thankes maketh speake thinges set foorth glorie god serue edifying abstayne thinges corrupt good maners againe bicause spirite adoption beareth witnesse certaynly sonnes god aucthour wee dare call vppon god father distruste good wyll fauour longer paul expresseth effect spirite saying haue receyued spirite bondage feare haue receyued spirite adoption whereby crye abba father againe bicause sonnes rom galat god hath sent spirite sonne heartes cry abba father whereunto large promise christ referred promise pray father name hearde iohn spirite lykewise therefore harte suche vndoubtedly possessed vncleane spirite sathan christ therefore doth without cause confesse shall either iustified condemned sayinges math dauid among preceptes lyfe numbreth
