forth great workes god hearde beare witnesse call preaching christ gospell nonlatin alphabet great wonderous workes god bicause christe whole maiestie god euidentlye thinges seene although many workes god whereby sheweth v nature power yet amongst worke christe chiefest rigour god iustice seene woulde haue owne sonne spared thende sinnes shoulde purged due punishment also declareth vnspeakeable fauour mercie god wherewith tenderly loued v rather see owne sonne dye crosse shoulde condemned herein also appeareth infallible truth god woulde deceyue v sonnes lyfe hazarde howe shoulde deceyue v thinges commendeth v besides inuinsible omnipotencie god couered vile mortall fleshe able vanquishe sathan power togither sinne death gate hell argument vnsearcheable wisedome whereby coulde inuent remedie redeemyng mankynde serued set foorth mercie god also satisfied rigour god iustice conclude whosoeuer well marketh thinges fell christe hath euidently perceyued maiestie god farre foorth may perceyued v lyuyng prison fleshe therfore apostle truely sayde haue set foorth great woonders god preached christ nowe effect holy ghost extended true beleuers apostle forsooke christ many dayes reason feare kept themselues close feare doores shut assoone endued holy ghost laying feare asyde begyn preache christ openly citie shed blood christes greatest enimies bare rule feared multitude thyther gathered whosoeuer spirite inspireth boldneth freeth feare confession christ thinke duetie onely occupied settyng foorth glorie christ neither yeelde man shal go either worldly entisementes threates bring purpose becommeth v labour gift spirite possible power since euident confession meanes seperated true faith saying christ whosoeuer shall confesse men also confesse heauenly father agayne math whosoeuer shalbe ashamed word adulterous sinfull generation shall sonne man ashamed shall come glorie father holy angel mark wordes paule tooke saying beleue heart iustifieth rom acknowledge mouth maketh man safe sayinges trifler dayes ought well obserue accompt confession faith amongst thinges indifferent though sufficient haue faith heart vtteraunce required men boast fayth vtterly ignoraunt force propertie thereof holy ghost necessitie ioyned fayth neither idle himselfe suffereth enspireth idle bicause kindleth mynde loue christe men beyng led foorth loue seeke christ onlye haue onlye mouth folowe onely fire water say therefore absurde thing shoulde deny name christ fayth haue tasted spirite yf men iudgement shoulde preuayle myght iustly accuse martyr follie madnesse offered themselues cruell torment wheras dissembling myght men woulde haue escaped sozomenus hystorie tripe tite booke sixt thirde chapter howe much better dyd iulianus souldiers perceyuyng craft emperour vnawares burned incense goddes published openly howe ignoraunce erred blemished fayth thought best defende glorie christe seeme haue preiudiced errour sufferyng death hygh wytted men thinke matter worthy pardon commendation yea greatest poynt wisdome craftie dissimulation treade downe fayth christ surely better altogither key colde since wyll whot bicause warme apoca god wyll matter saying meaneth taught example men meete hearer doctrine gospell doctrine bryngeth foorth worthy fruites beyng wholly destitute religion doe humbly marueyle myracles god sticke onely outwarde contemplation earnestly thinke ende vse god suffereth men studyes frustrate whose pleasure men shoulde come knowledge truth reade salomon sayde prouerb math thou seekest wisdome money thou shalt finde hir christ saith seeke shall finde men follow another sort men christ calleth name dogges swinescoffers dogges hogges scripture place calleth scorner mocker luke saith aswel mocked apostle woondred saying men full newe wine example men set foorth shewe v howe farre wickednesse runneth haue purposed persecute truth become incurable reclaymed maner wordes deedes myracle wyll mooued myracle mooue greatest euer wrought amongst men farre mooued therwith take occasion rather reproche blaspheme attribute detestable vice drunkennesse force perceyue workyng holy ghost diuers example sort apparaunt serue ende teache v offended vniust iudgements worlde concernyng truth alway seene doctrine gospell sauour lyfe vnto life cor cor sauour death vnto death paule teacheth v christ crucyfied stumblyng block vnto iewes foolishnesse vnto greekes therfore let v leaue iudgement god let v frame selues doctrine gospell beyng quickened heartes woorkyng holy ghost may bryng foorth worthy fruites may knowne true beleeuers may enioy euerlastyng promise gospell iesus christe whome blessyng honour power glorie euer amen xij homelie bvt peter stepped foorth eleuen lyft vp voyce sayde ye men iewry ye dwell holy reuerende olde father simeon inspiration holy ghost amonge thynges sayde beholde luke chylde set fall vprisyng agayne many israel signe spoken agaynst howbeit spoken iesus christ may vnderstanded gospell christ preached apostle although doctrine therof playne simple sheweth also true way howe attayne saluation yet shall men alwayes haue diuers iudgementes touchyng shall small number shall openly speake agaynst dyd esay prophete see long agoe vtteryng prophecie christe doctrine begynneth sort hath giuen credence preaching arme lord knowne esay iohn lorde declareth cause matter saith world abyde lyght bicause workes therof euyll scripture also set foorth many lyke example ende warnyng shoulde offended lyke happen dayes among example apostle prooued first day receiued holy ghost went administer office notable indued singuler myracle lyke neuer beene hard tyll day vnderstandyng language preached iesus christe diuers tongue reason hearer diuers nation vnconstant people deuided sundry diuers opinion godly sort woondered worke god diligently searched meanyng thereof wicked scorner accused drunkennesse true paule saith christe seemeth foolishnesse wise worlde bicause spake hereof last sermon let v haste explication present place fayth courage apostle cleerely euidently seene litle mooued feared wicked slaunders men yt peter rather taketh occasion hereof speak vnto fruitfull sermon winneth many vnto christ effectual op ration holy ghostbefore go expounde peter sermon let v consyder sayde hym apostle peter sayth hee standyng eleuen lyft vp voyce stoode therefore without feare thought neither flye leaue charge although vniustly iudged yet seemed small cause feare desperation shoulde thinke coulde preuayle wordes whose wicked frowarde mindes great myracle euer wrought could mollifie mooue stoode vnfeared onely remayne tary also begyn set foorth god quarrell cause great boldenesse therefore example may see howe effectuall operation holy ghost long vsed handy craftes occupation rude vnlearned men nowe able abyde sight multitude diuers clamour vnruly sort constant courage euery lyght occasion made afrayde durst professe name christ fewe rascall segons nowe defend quarrell stoutly great assembly gathered togither euery nation degree neither lacke handes tormentours make confesse truth offer themselues freely defende learne hereof howe must trye prooue whether spirite christ raigne v yea vnlesse zeale stoute courage defende christ truth seene v shall vayne boast spirite yet nowe dayes amongst bragge spirite thought commendable thyng man stop eares horrible blasphemy wicked men vttered agaynst christ truth gospell sirenes songes apostle shewe themselues place farre maner men amongst whome peter mooued lyght taunt quip myght seeme begynneth bolde speache defende christes cause gospel lyghtly passed ouer howe peter saide stande eleuenthe apostl take themselues equalles felowes euident argument equalitie apostle diligently conserued among themselues christ put one office hauyng receyued holy ghost better vnderstoode vayne contention superioritie wherewith enflamed vtterly quenched therfore peter sytteth throne alone hym selfe standyng seruauntes garde separated ioyned togither sheweth euidently one number although alone make oration yet defendeth owne cause common case herein peter myght seeme rather minister residue prince chiefe away therfore peter example challenge supremacie themselues churche puffed vp pride persian christ gaue apostle example humilitie followe becommeth christian men much whome hath appoynted sheepeheardes churche hereunto referred place paule vsing great obtestations vrgeth one thyng accompted minister christ must seeke vnanimitie humilitie mother thereof let nothyng done saith contention vayne glorie meekenesse mynde et euery man esteeme another better himselfe looke euery man owne thing euery man thinges men let mynde also christ iesu see place philippian seconde chapter let v consyder peter sermon whichthe argument pet r rmon effect power holy ghost shall clearely appeare begynnyng hereof neither affectate ambicious doctrine truth simple hath neede commended vaynnesse wordes forasmuch commendeth selfe sufficiently teacheth v playnely way saluation wherefore peter callyng vpon men whome purposeth speake vnto saith yee men iurie yee dwell hierusalem knowne vnto eares heare wordes vseth name iewes admonishe auncient glorie duetie god tymes passed chosen made iehudim confessours woulde celebrated worshipped wherevpon place sayde god knowne iurie psalm cause maketh mention hierusalem often time called holy citie shewe ought mooued euen holynesse place listen diligently thinges appertayne glorie god owne saluation content hearde onely way men otherwyse occupied diligently wyll haue layde vp myndes oration consisteth two partes first aunswereth slaunder wicked scoffer accuse drunkennesse thyng first behooued put away bicause saying haue bene aucthoritie credite yf bene taken drunkardes blowboldes part preacheth iesus christe comprehendeth order man saluation taught example firstchristians ought put awaye slaunder defende good name lawfull make aunswere vnto slaunders defende honestie name fame agaynst slaunderers detractours salomon saith good name honest report preferred much rich behooueth specially ministerie haue regard thereof bicause slaunders whereby name estimation impayred prou doeth much touch owne person god himselfe whose contempt specially tend1 tim cause apostle would haue bishop haue commendation abrode also much ought take heede contemned hath charge bicause naughtinesse many goeth farre ashamed charge holy minister god false crymes may easily make doctrine truth hated suspected therefore excusations purgation themselues necessarie lawfull reade christ manye tymes vsed thereby bring doctrine contempt paule fewe tymes one plentifully copiously disputeth aduersaries touching apostleshippe calling truth vsed bicause sawe coulde contemned preaching gospell also must grow regarde mindes many therefore peter beginneth os well purging crime thereby bring apostle suspicion neyther regarded case require sufferance christian pacience letteth may defende christ truth vttermost opinion thinke slaunders ioyned contempt gospell ought passed ouer though heare deserue neyther name pacient modest men counted rather warmelings cowardly forsakers standing place set howbeit putting away crime neyther vseth bare deniall onlye waywardly retorteth slaunder slaunder prooueth argument false layde theyr charge inuocationfirst sheweth saluation deliuerye inuocation scripture great consent teach due vnto god onely ergo selues hope saluation deliuerye strength selues saue v absurde thing seeke saluation otherwheres saluation also shewed v god without selues cannot attayne vnto owne power abilitie haue neede vse inuocation prayer due none whose meere kindenesse liberalitie put trust perswaded hath deserued thing vseth intreatie prayer law right requiring thing due vnto manifest therefore saluation bee founde god onely meere free gift liberalitie must labour obtaine prayer continuall inuocation done setteth forth maner howe shoulde inuocate wherein manye perplexed much doubtthe maner inuocatio vnderstande well ynough saluation god onely suppose reason sinnes debarred maiestie god therefore eyther abstayne altogither inuocation vnprofitable superfluous else exercise coldely without faith prophete proponeth lorde name lord inuocated name lord shall say peculiar name consisting letter sillables wherby see name thing nature god disposition property comprised think man simple supposeth euerlasting incomprehensible infinite vnspeakable essence nature god comprehended fewe letter think iesus christ shall hearde god bicause faith true inuocation christ himselfe teacheth consist spirite truth fayth springing v holye ghost iohn leadeth mindes spirites contemplation god bicause breedeth v sure trust grace god prayer cannot bee feyned true testimony faith hope wherefore prophete promiseth v excellent fruite themthe fruite inuocation sayth shall saued calleth vpon name lord simplest playnest deliuereth v many care trouble infallible certaine bicause stayeth resteth vpon promise god force worlde ouerturne wherfore let v acknowledge sinnes let v seeke cause euils suffer let v vse acknowledging sinne beate downe affiaunce owne righteousnesse turning vnto god let v call vppon holye name surely heare v deliuer v name sake iesus christ whome blessing honor power glory euer amen xiiij homelie ye men israell heare wordes iesus nazareth man approued god among myracles woonders signes god middest yee selues knowe haue taken handes vnrighteous person hee deliuered determinate counsell foreknowledge god haue crucified slaine god hath raysed vp loosed sorowes death bycause impossible shoulde holden haue hearde first part peter sermon alreadye wherein cleareth apostle crime drunkennesse teacheth endued holy ghost vseth place demonstration testimony prophet ioel rehearseth therewith declareth horrible punishmentes remayning contemners gospell teacheth onely way remedye escape fayth iesus christe thing bicause sufficient feare altogither incurable apostle passeth parte preacheth christ whome late sayde chiefe marke apostle shotte doctrine least preaching might vayne proposeth matter stirreth vp mindes conscience sinnes ende feared therwith might feruent fayth greedinesse embrace iesus christ heard saluation preached chiefe studye short playne least man might thinke knowledge christ way saluation contayned therein lyke dreames philosopher neyther explicated infinite volume discussed disputation fully comprehended anye man compriseth chiefe article fayth fewe woordes whosoeuer vnderstandeth hath attayned knowledge christ waye saluation first descrybeth person christ teacheth v howe knowe secondly intreateth passion death christ thirdly declareth resurrection three meane saye much spirite shall giue v grace speaking christes person handleth thing prudentlythe person christ circumspectly least yet weake might take occasion offence gotten attent short kinde exhortation bringeth little little knowledge christ saying iesus nazareth man approoued god amongest myracles signes woonders god wrought middest ye selues know c word pronounceth christ two thing first man calleth one nazareth name nazareth citie galiley brought vp appeareth storie gospel bicause seemed sure strong ynough calleth virum say man name agreeth none man deede christ truly called man bicause paule saith taketh angel nature heb heuenly essence sede abraham furthermore least man might take common person maketh difference betweene adding approoued god amongest myracles c although purposed teache diuinitie christ yet prudently yet dissembleth name god would haue seemed straunge eares iewes woulde haue deedes learne god whome hitherto thought onely rascall common person much saye preach vnto iesus nazareth many iudge man ought consider god hath openly shewed many declaration diuine nature ende commend vnto teache long wayted sauiour mankinde tyme past promised workes christ whereof god commended adorneth three title first calleth power vertues least might seeme haue affinitie iuglers thing euangelistes write verilye deede owne power luke plainely testifieth sayeth luc vertue power went whereby sicke healed himselfe sayth another place power vertue went luc healed woman sicke bloudy fluxe calleth christes workes woonders bicause exceeded common course nature drewe mindes beholder admiration amazednesse bicause thing whose cause know oftentimes taken woonders deede portende nothing length calleth thinges christ signes workes christ certaine ende beare witnesse godheade office knowne sonne god also promised redeemer worlde cause sent disciple iohn consideration work math oftentimes inculcateth workes iewes vpbraydeth fault incredulitie greater work sayth father hath giuen finishe workes doe beare witnesse father hath sent iohn againe doe workes father beleue doe ye beleeue mee beleeue workes iohn ye may knowe beleeue father againe done among woorkes none man iohn haue sinne therfore peter doth wel call workes christ signes sayth signes done amongest calleth none witnesse themselues whome preached see quippeth neyther dolor body followe death expounded syth yet feele bytter power death loosed terror taken away wherewith time past tormented men mindes vsed sinne sting punishment wherof god appoynted death therfore must needes terrible seeing punishment sinne albeit christ hath taken sinne away yet death remayneth whereby passe thys life worlde merite christ made doore lyfe therefore feare beleeue christes body onlye surely plaine body subiect corruption saying god must necessitie fulfilled thou art dust dust thou shalt returne againe neyther doth arte industrie man thing preuayle gene going conserue body great men sweete odour spicery perfume christes bodye bicause raysed againe thirde daye coulde see corruption much lesse corrupted rose againe glorious body voyde corruption resurrection body proued although body corrupt moulder dust yet power christ last day commeth shall restored againe haue heretofore declared mortall body paule sayth must become lyke vnto christes glorified bodye neyther shall impossible raise body dust phil made man beginning claye yea great frame worlde nothing maye also confuted saye christes body resurrection vanished awaye true property body felt handled conteyned place moue place place c sawe corruption howe coulde lose thing without verye body cannot consist thirdly sayth thou hast shewed mee wayes life islife euerlasting thou hast brought life speaketh heauenlye eternall life worthye called ergo life euerlasting followeth resurrection life euen christ shall haue well obserued sayde waye life shewed christ adam sinne deserued death doore paradise driuen god fensed garded sworde fire least shoulde returne thither eate tree life gen god signified hereby men owne strength power could enter life christ waye life set open againe euen one man sinne entred worlde sinne death rom christ righteousnesse life shoulde restored againe therefore apostle speaking christ sayth life appeared v iohn christ euerye called breade life light waye lyfe resurrection lyfe iohn commoditie therefore resurrection christ hath gotten v verye singular bicause shall raysed heauenly eternall life earthly mortall nowe liue may trulyer called death life meane hereto christ alone whome whosoeuer despiseth cannot attayne vnto life christ sayth man commeth vnto father iohn last al addeth thou shalt make full ioy thy countenance state heauenly life ste blissefull wordes expressed condicion heauenlye eternall life farre sort life haue earth life aforesayde full traueyle sorrowe care trouble eternall life full mirth ioye god wipe teares eye hys finde certaintie soundnesse next speaketh outward baptismeto baptised forgiuenesse sinnes commaundeth receiue forgiuenesse sinnes wordes vnderstanded though outwarde baptisme washed v sinne euident speach assureth saluation comforteth argument deduced taken ende baptisme meane season bicause taken church god baptisme become professor christ people vnder conduct must fight agaynst worlde prince thereof peter requireth themthe confessio faith christ necessary free open confession fayth christ christ haue worshipper shall ashamed howbeit iewes openlye denye christ pylate whyle cried king messias beside caesar c wherfore necessary shoulde freely confesse christ least might iudged stil number false runnagates could done way commodiously baptisme christ woulde haue administred ende get bring disciple may read math nowe man compare thing togitherthe order doctrine iustificatio haue hitherto bene sayde appeare order peter taught way iustification saluation began rebuking sinne haue hard saw pricked contrite hart requireth repent meanes bringing hope grace fauour againe least trust workes penance leane vppon owne righteousnesse sendeth name christ merytes length commaundeth professe christ openly ioyne themselues church order teaching see apostle euerye obserued learned christ maister man deny thus sayd little afore departure hence luc marc math necessary repentance forgiuenesse sinnes shoulde preached nation name go ye therefore worlde preach gospell creature bring disciple nation baptizing name father sonne holy ghost thing man compare auriculer confession satisfaction merites pardon yeremindes purgatory infinite like exacted doe penance shall finde farre wyde sunder furthermorepeter comforteth promise bicause peter doe felt themselues guiltie heynous wickednesse bene seene lyke comforteth double promise maner gospell feare swallowed vp desperation first shall receyue sayth gift holy ghost gift ye holy ghost seemeth speake peculiar gift spirite time primitiue church ye beleuers endued either speak diuers tonges else notable myracles hereafter eight chapter shall appeare plainely behooued haue ministerye apostle adorned singular giftes thende men might easily woonne vnto christ although gift dayes part ceased yet remayne necessary effect spirite whose operation beleeuing regenerated mortified renued assured saluation emboldened confirmed peril dare stoutly without feare stand confession name christ spirit adoption vseth worke al thing child god haue neede world promise able singularlye comfort whose conscience afrayde reason sinne howe coulde doubt haue forgiuenesse sinnes heard haue spirit apostle meane season promise serueth also instruction teacheth v true beleeuers christian cannot vtterly destitute giftes holye ghost diuers operation diuers gift spirite paule sayth see excell therein meanest vtterly voyde spirit bicause member christ haue spirite christ rom therefore aine profession christ except shewe declare olde testament child farre euen many lord god shall call thing vnderstanded couenant promise made olde testament summe wherof may seene gene yet doth peter extend promise farre gentile yet straungers alienes societie people god bicause woulde easilier induce perswade borne abraham coulde doubt longer god goodnesse seeing hearde extended also vnto gentile thing teache v vse god promise serue verily throughout worlde many yeares since howbeit bicause doe nothing mindes men needefull shoulde drawne god operation spirite according saying christ man commeth vnto mee iohn except father drawe god according free holy worketh winde bloweth manifest iohn saluation dependeth vpon meere fauour god calleth whome draweth whome maketh like ymage sonne meane season dutie called aunswere drawne pull certayne liberalitie towardes poore place commended god would haue alwayes flourish church know god sayth deuter let begger amongst deut yet god ignorant woulde alwayes shoulde pinched penurie shoulde runne vagarant publike spectacle pouertie beggerie contrary nature charitie whervnto god people bounde diuers lawes god extant deut c whereby order declared howe poore may commodiouslye prouided neede go begging doore doore hereof commeth passe prophetes euery place commend poore vnto v christ doth vouchsafe commende care helpe ought taken testifyeth later daye reward haue done good poore sake mat euen though done himselfe order institution force authoritie apostle ashamed make prouision poore yea paule barnabas declared trade ministerie iohn peter iames thought good admonish one thing galat shoulde neglect poore whome knewe christ diligently commended vnto besides paule exhorteth corinthian shoulde onely see prouision owne poore1 cor cor also rich shoulde helpe needye brother ierusalem verye poore surely euident predecessor great care herof consider donation foundation prince priuate men greater liberalitie giuen goodes church ende puritie doctrine myght preserued poore needy relieued helped dayes religion growne contempt fewe scant giue ought owne euery ynough wil rape reue prodigally waste others haue giuen shall one daye prooue christ reuenger contemne crye poore seuerely reuenge spoyle waste church feared least shall leaue wicked enimies churche fayth rifled bicause disdaine bestowe euen christian brother christ let v returne luke congregation meeting faithfull describeth publyke holy assembly church sayth continued euery day temple one accorde came oftentimes togither temple would iewes sacrifice knew abolished bloude christ bicause concourse people might teach winne vnto christ example taught seeke occasion euery side set forth kingdome christ cause people ought oftentimes meete togither may greater number heare worde god faithfull gouerned light truth cannot ashamed thereof iohn seeke darckenesse corner doe whose workes euill uerily reade christ taught alwayes openly luc iohn thereby excused himselfe taken afterwarde also caiphas paule apostle first epistle corinthian xj xiiij chap diligently describeth publike assembly holy meetinges woulde neuer haue done vnderstoode bene much force setting forth god true religion two thinges ascribed primitiue church continuance togither vnanimitie mindes needefull time specially assembly churche meetinges god hath otherwheare bene sayde hath commended singuler promise earnest studie perseuerance keeping meete christian againe assembly made doctrine sake publike prayer vse sacramentes vnanimitie purpose chiefly requisite becommeth minister word ioyned togither least author partaking sectes suche knowe church corinth let one accord vrge set forth doctrine truth labor bring disciple vnto christ commaunded xxviij chap mathew vnanimitie praiers great weight god appeereth hereby bicause mutuall loue euery commaunded christ earnestly desireth father iohn beleeuing may one father one reason may made also sacramentes seale vnto v benefites christ token pledge fellowship vnitie haue christ vsing wherof taken one body christ cannot vse duly enmitie amongest themselues thing ought well haue bene considered dayes great faulte committed side glorye doctrine gospell haue enioyed long whyle waxe slacke part quite voyde perseuerance though attayned already perfection doe deuided diuers sundry sectes one excomunicateth another must needes come passe paule sayth galat byte deuoure one another take heede least likewise consumed one another marueyle gospell doth better succeede go forwarde considering men neither feruent perseuerance ioyned togither vnanimitie whome chiefely required let reade eusebius preface vpon eyght booke ecclesiasticall hystorie shall finde liuely description time may looke unto luke ioyneth trade lyfe first christian liued inhowe christian liued priuately priuately among themselues brake breade sayth house house eate meate togither singlenesse heart praysing god although speaketh breaking breade may sort vnderstanded mysticall supper declared homely going yet maketh mention also common meate seemeth place commodiously may wholy expounded priuate trade lyfe bidding one another house meales repastes luke teacheth v richer sort depart portion goodes reliefe generall also exercise liberalitie towardes poore others reserued peculiarly themselues therefore expresselye mencioneth house might appeare diuers number faithfull kept house goodes still wherby confused sedicious communion thing anabaptistes doe imagine strongly confuted order trade lyfe conuersation expressed full benefites loue mutuall helping one another bicause men offende much immoderate excessiue ryote pride feasting luke thought good chiefely entreate hereof saying obserued three thinges therein first feasted togither gladnesse according saying paule sheweth mercy rom cor let doe cherefulnesse god loueth cherefull giuer therfore feasting disdainefulnesse causeth v yrke benefites receyued euery man glad chearefull minde chiefely whome knewe wanted liuing christ commaundeth v bid pore luc able recompence requite v benefites againe unto cherefulnesse addeth singlenesse heart vnderstandeth sinceritie minde voyde deceyte guyle contrary vice seeme benefite others yet seeketh commoditie gayne little minding vtilitie profite others thirdly rehearseth thankesgiuing wherby set forth bountie god made thinges psal math preseruer nourisher man ioyne three togither shall easilye appeare singuler care temperaunce true cherefulnesse christian simplicitie much lesse giuing thankes therefore christian men must drawe rule thing howe behaue themselues banquet let knowe chiefe thing therein must charitie benefiting others let studie harborous knowe appointed lordes stewardes goodes haue let mery cheerefull giuing bicause christ sayth better giue receyue actes herevnto let ioyned singlenesse minde sinceritie becommeth christian chiefely let mindfull god let acknowledge author thing belonging life let aske necessary thanke gift receyued fayth giuing thankes paule sayth meates sanctified tim haue christ example hereof whome neuer read haue broken breade without blessing giuing thankes maye seene math luc iohn c thing teach v maye thinke banquetting eyther vtterly despise poore else giue euill forgetting giue god thankes reioyce scurrilitie kindle intemperancye lowde singing vnseasonable musick sermon prophetes isa amos furtherthe fruite true godlynesse least man might thinke feruent studie godlynesse lacked successe luke teacheth v commoditie ensued thereof sayeth fauour people lorde added dayly c sheweth double fruite hereof comming first fauour authoritie men wiser sort playne sayde wicked afrayd wee hereby taught thing getteth men true authoritie verilye studie desire god religion glory must needes true lorde sayde prophete honour honour shall put shame despise sam let ruler church magistrate marke well thing superintendent know haue neede authoritie fauour go alwayes get wayes ought doe while hunt worldlye prayse studye heape vp rich seeke aloft worldly pompe little carefull meane honor glory god feruent zeale desire god glorye compendious way come vnto glory god turne harte men way pleaseth preserueth remembrance psalmist sayeth surely rewarde euer fruite commoditie therof lord added dayly vnto church saued church congregation therfore encreased first entred felt fayth also encreased man therfore labor vaine vineyard lord earnestly applye vocation marke meane time howe encrease church attributed lorde lorde sayth added euery day vnto congregation saued deede apostle preached drewe men preaching worde successe labour must ascrybed god onelye onely hath power vpon hart men christ hath taught v man commeth iohn except father vouchsafe drawe thing paule expresseth elegant parable husbandrye first corinthian thirde chapter lorde testifyeth prophete write lawes heartes faythfull iere shall neede none instruction wherevpon another place beleeuing called properly nonlatin alphabet saye taught god disciple schollers god isa christ himselfe sayth spirite shall counseller maister leade v truth iohn impudencie reprooued gather themselues disciple call owne name also faultie acknowledge maisters beside christ reioyce name name christ math cor whome christ paule earnestly impugne rebuke let man take occasion hereby slouthfull euerye man must haue respect calling walke ascribe successe owne industrie grace god worketh v according good pleasure thing make glory mennes saluation let suffice declaration order primitiue church let v knowe partes occupied exercise sometime giuen vnto let ende glorye god saluation manye whome must labour bring vnto christ shall come passe shall haue fauour authoritie amongest men shall receyue plenteous fruite traueyle iesus christ whome blessing honour power glory euer amen thirde chapiter vpon actes apostle xx homelie peter iohn went vp togither temple ninth houre certaine man halt mother wombe brought whome layde dayly gate temple called bewtifull aske almes entred temple hee sawe peter iohn woulde go temple desired receyue almes peter fastened eye iohn sayd looke v gaue heede vnto trusting receyue something sayde peter siluer golde haue none haue giue thee name iesus christ nazareth aryse vp walke tooke right hande lift vp immediatly feete ancle bone receyued strength hee sprang stoode walked entred temple walking leaping praysing god haue perceyued sermon going trade successe encrease primityue church thing notable faythfull grewe fauoure authoritie manye men caused wicked afrayd among thing mention made manye diuers myracles luke sayth apostle wherefore number taketh one gaue occasion newe sermon peter bringeth certaine thousand knowledge christ shall see come place nowe bicause singuler myracle meete diligently discusse circumstance therof much regard luke hath penned beginneth first occasion myracle describeth lame mannes person whome myracle wrought last sheweth successe folowed myracle lame man healed occasion miraclethe occasion myracle peter iohn ninth houre went vp temple time lame man brought thither aske almes people ninth houre day three clocke noone v maye gathered sayde seconde chapter touching counting houres calleth houre prayer bicause people god certayne appointed houres made publike prayer maye seene well otherwheres also daniel sixt chapter god appoynted law morning euening sacrifice man wit exod nume saye done without prayer touching time midday noone also appointed prayer shall speake hereafter tenth chapter peter houre simon tanner house went vpper storie thereof praye without cause scripture make diligent mention houres prayer first taught hereby ought beginne finishe ende doings calling name god bicause without helpe grace impossible v accomplishe thing well salomon sayth man deuyseth waye heart lord ordreth going prou wherevpon apostle iames sharpely reprooueth without respect vnto god deliberate appoint matter iacob though successe depended owne power also admonished disciplyne needefull church according paule sayth thing appertayning religion honour god ought done decently order confesse deede dutie christian euery place lift vp pure cleane handes vnto god haue neede helpe may heare v yet bicause christ hath commended vnto v publike prayer peculiar promise becommeth v haue speciall care consideration therof without cause refraine holye congregation euident instituted long agoe doctrine prayer sake though many thing afterwarde grewe superstition yet ought impediment vnto v superstition ought taken awaye primitiue lawfull vse restored nothing left iangling belle whereby called morning noone euening prayer superstitious vsage whereof many accuse fewe traueyle haue solemne houres prayer first vsed restored apostle specially marked sayth luke went church houre prayer sacrifice sake offred heretofore declared bicause desirous praye also hoped finde occasion whereby teache people would bicause pieuishe superstition iewes easily might corrected leaue dutie vndone let slippe occasion opportunitie doe good whose example teacheth v must seeke maner occasion set forth doctrine gospell knowledge christ dutie owe vnto christ bindeth v herevnto intermitted nothing belonging saluation must fayle duty enlarging boundes border kingdome2 cor caused paule thinke weight care congregation laye shoulder another place reioyceth attemptes aduersaries yllwillers phil bicause perceyued serued sort setting forth gospell let v ashamed therefore negligence slouth like sluggardes say woorse doe daily let passe occasion lord offreth v chiefely hath saying prophete place iere cursed doth worke lorde negligently secondly luke diligently describeth lame man personthe description lame man whome myracle afterwarde wrought description excellencie myracle power christ author thereof doe euidently appeare first sayth man lame mother wombehalt lame mother wombe lame hauing lost vse limmes fayne borne unto ioyne age taken word follow fourtie yeare olde thou shalt perceyue disease coulde cured arte man disease part cleaue vnto v natiuitie else long time continuance yeares growne nature custome yet ende moste blessed thinges aggrauate increase poore mannes calamitie serued setting forth god glorie might haue seemed small glorie christ peter heale disease curable mannes arte cunning wheras whose helth man euer hoped healed name christ euident christ almightie endued diuine power therefore verye god ende commonly serue greatest calamity god vseth take v thing counsel help man remedie setteth forth glory name example whereof haue place iohn also blinde natiuitie disciple demaunding whether fault parentes borne blinde christ aunswereth neyther hath man sinned yet father mother woorkes god shoulde shewed serueth instruction consolation teacheth v must rashly iudge mennes mishappes misery though fallen therein deserued vngraciousnesse many time commeth passe god suffreth v afflicted none cause v set forth name glorye wherefore must hastie iudgement least runne rocke reade iobes friend calamitie gathered wickednesse sinfull life deserued wrath god also let take comfort hereof whose calamity great hope helpe man let therfore thinke forsaken god let yeelde themselues paciently god doe pleasure shall shortly prooue thing thought token wrath pertayned glorye name saluation wherevnto paule respect said knowe loue god thing worke best rom beggerbesides remedilesse disease luke testifieth poore token extreeme neede laid euery day temple gate reason gorgeous building called beautifull aske almes went finde law god appeareth sayde last sermon god lawe manifest deut forbidding begger israel many thinges commaunded god relieuing poore woulde haue ordred brother shoulde go abrode lyke publike stage woondermentes miserie beggerie whereof little mindefull appeareth example miserable creature maye seeme bringing euery day temple gate one ierusalem dwelling welthye citie yet compelled amongst brother among infinite number priest begge liuing haue described iohn marc declareth great corruption degeneration iewish nation hereby appeareth goodes god appointed feede poore alienated abuse transposed wayes true nothing right order among god religion dare rashly dispence thing contrary word long extreme destruction folowed extreme corruption wherby may iudge ought looke dayes lyke fault iewes contrarye example primitiue church suffer begge whome ought take loue brother true vse church goodes marred depraued papistes thinges serue maintenaunce ydle men wherewith poore church ought found nourished although bragge gospell haue put awaye superstition ydolatrie yet reformation church stop shoulde dispose church goodes truly relieue poore christian whereby manifest great many vnder cloke gospell seeke owne gaine onely christ shall come later daye reuenge quarell poore math fayle dutie last considered lame man luke sayth asked almes apostle daily layde gate temple vnlike ignorant miracle euery daye rather aske health body shall iudge according propertie beggers dayes cast themselues disease refuse healed whereby get begging god forbid great benefite coulde haue light vpon prophane contemner god grace thinketh rather cause nowe vtterlye dispayre cured disease deede diuers example many christ restored former health knewe none borne lame mother wombe healed wherefore since hope hauing health againe thought vaine desire body hauing none care liuing asked apostle thereto belonged receyued eyther hee durst hope aske deliuered sickenesse made singuler instrument vessell god goodnesse glory vse saluation manye singuler goodnesse god towardes v oftentimes vseth preuent doe beyonde hope prayer much giueth v greater thing coulde haue hoped gene promiseth vnto abraham onely carefull ismael life sonne also sara called isaac brought people israel egypt exod owne substance part egyptian also scarce euer hoped deliuered dauid prooueth like goodnesse notably setteth forth promised messias shoulde borne stocke2 sam thing neuer durst haue looked let passe manye example bicause trye finde like euery day whereas carefull thing belonging body promiseth v owne accord blisse heauenlye kingdome sonne esay passeth man vnderstanding capacitie let v therfore learne put trust grace goodnesse let v despaire good liberall bountifull eyther wishe desire nowe let v come thirde part hystoriethe report myracle contayneth diligent description myracle peter shewed circumstance whereof must diligently consider peter beginneth causing lame man take heede attent saying looke v woulde saying procure take diligent heede shoulde well acknowledge author benefite within whyle receyue least might suppose done either chaunce mannes arte magicke euident onely fruitefully receyue benefites god consider god author ascribe glory thankes therefore neglect christ looke onely vpon minister myracles many time men cause superstition may see men dayes defend worshipping saintes chiefely reason myracles wrought token great modestie peter speaketh himselfe alone sayeth looke v acknowledgeth therefore iohn partener fellowe farre pride pope taken peter successor doe imperiously lord ouer bishop chalenge themselues power vppon church christ ignorant man looked receyue money putteth conceytethe pouertie peter causeth hope better thing saying siluer golde haue none haue giue thee apostle stewardes spirituall goodes mystery god paule sayeth money wherewith vngodlye moste time abounde godly1 cor peter professeth two thinges verye profitable bee marked first pouertie hee hath neyther siluer golde one companye left followed christ marc therefore coulde haue rich worlde shall therefore thinke vnhappie miserie god defende let man therefore measure felicitie goodes rich world cannot miserable possesseth christ although bereaued goodes peter neither siluer golde peter lacked goodes howe come peter successor great abundance maner patrimonie praye peter whence commeth nowe dayes hath onlye greatest reuenues golde siluer also whole country kingdomes surely haue nothing scripture written hereof neyther doe credible hystories make mention hereof onely iudas mention sought golde siluer vnlawfull meanes cause desperation destruction antichrist prophecie shoulde possesse treasure earth daniel let pope therefore stint bragge peter patrimonie whereas peter plainly reprooueth lying shoulde stinte beco impudent feare make laughing game peter wordes new pope lift vp high stoole easement whurleth amongst people kinde counterfeyt money neither golde siluerlooke pontifical father touching pope coronation saying siluer golde haue none c within remooued another place casteth owne creature golde siluer cry hath scattred abrode hath giuen poore righteousnesse remayneth euer euer pray playing iesting worde god uerily thomas aquinas feately quippe godlesse menne andforsakers truth counsell lyon certaine reuenues annuity brought naples gregorie tenth hee ashamed saye thomas cannot nowe saye peter sayd siluer golde haue none thomas answered neyther say arise walke learned man sawe couetousnesse pope church brought square giftes holy spirite wherin church sometimes flourish vtterly extinguished many men perceyue nowe dayes also vntowardnesse time men wittingly deceyued let v whose eye light gospell hath opened flie snare impudent tyrannie suffer selues anye longer deluded robbed secondly peter professeth promptnesse readinesse good benefite doe good sayth haue giue thee much shoulde saye money woulde giue thee also howbeit giue thee haue wordes shewe example well willing minde also ought haue exercise beneuolence professe earnest good saye wote howe much shoulde giue poore lawe looue good aunswereth question commaunding v looue neighbour selfe whosoeuer thus doe enquire howe much shoulde giue seeke neighbour hath neede finde haue depart neyghbour liberally wherefore haue money helpe needy money haue plentie victualles deale amongest hungrye haue raymet cloath see go naked haue none leastwise giue heart poore brother good wherof declare friendly wordes counsell comfort wherewith reare cheare vp poore bodye afflicted following example peter giue whatsoeuer haue wherevpon gather voyde charitie ledde affection good aske howe much giue vnto poore nowe peter gaue liberallye vnto poore addeth name iesus christ nazareth aryse walke tooke right hande lift vp giueth perfite health body power receyued togither apostle christ giueth may appeare men doth owne power christ author thereof whose commaundement power operation myracle wrought thing afterwarde discourseth people also many thing concurre fall make veritie setting forth myracle peter taketh lame man hande lifteth vp anclebones feete receyue strength hath much adoe rise whose limmes weakened long sickenesse starteth vp leapeth sodeyne moouing pang onely season phrenetike haunted spirite standeth steadily feete walketh vp downe besides goeth church apostle springing leaping declaring benefite god therefore lame man healed remayned signe former infirmitie disease god workes perfite poynt craft fraude deceit conclude sermon must speake two thing seruing institution fayth first figure spirituall restitution holy ghost thought good set forth myracle touching soulea figure restitution mankinde like case lame man tooke sicknesse euen natiuity bereft vse al limmes borne sinner mother wombe force sinne naturally adam father hath ouerflowne posteritie hath left v power whereby fulfill lawe god doe thing belong saluation lawe god spirituall rom carnall solde vnder sinne mercifull lorde goodnesse preuented lame man without hope helth god first sought called first father feared sinne fledde sight god gene comforted free promise saluation lame man healed name iesus christ peter preached vnto taking hande lifteth vp merite christ haue gotten saluation preaching gospell offreth v haue receyued fayth straightwayes feele christes spirite effectually working v giueth v hande lifteth v vp maketh v strong ouercome tiranny sinne able walk wayes lord work regenerate enflame loue heauenly thing stirre vp affiance saluation iohn rom certifie make men sure ado tion teach crye abba father besides lightneth mindes knowledge god iohn leadeth truth comforteth aduersitie therefore operation commeth passe weake lame able thing christ comforteth v phil although propertie fleshe remayneth maketh v sometime slippe inuegleth v diuers temptation yet alwayes christes spirite benefite christ cheerefull minde lyue longer sinne rom whome merite christ hath deliuered bondage sinne paule teacheth large afterwarde goeth apostle temple nowe plaine temple figure christ let v therefore ioyne selfe vnto follow apostle shewe v waye howe may ioyned christ church church christ receyued vnlesse first forsake tentes satan vnder becommeth refuse fight desire christ souldiers besides sayd reioyced praysed god let v also reioyce lord let v prayse goodnesse becommeth v plainly confesse set forth vaine redeemed deliuered ashamed christ redeemer benefite obtayned therfore requireth v euery confession fayth hath dedicated remembraunce death mysticall supper would haue alwayes continue church behooueth v therfore labour thing truely graft christ quickened spirite may reigne heauen whome prayse honour glory power euer amen xxj homelie people sawe walke prayse god knewe sate begged beautifull gate temple woondred sore astonied happened vnto halte healed helde peter iohn people ranne amazed porche called salomon peter sawe aunswered people ye men israell marueyle ye looke v though owne power strength made man goe lvke hath expounded notable myracle whereby peter healed man halt mother wombe ende myracle others shoulde serue confirme apostle doctrine wherefore euangelist contented haue tolde hystorie hereof onely declared also successe effect followed first sheweth lame man tooke benefite christ sayth ioyned himselfe vnto apostle went church openlye set forth prayses god example shadowed vnto v ought doe whome christ hath restored againe vertue merite must embrace apostle doctrine thereby openly ioyned church declare benefite god grace seeme bestowed vpon vnworthy person luke passeth matter declaring effect great myracle tooke among people howe occasion preaching thereby offered peter proper right vse whole hystorie sheweth selfe people sayeth luke sawe lame man walking praysing god sawe walkinghow people receyued myracle knew certainly woont sitte gate temple aske almes thing maketh proofe truth myracle least anye man might deeme anye craft sleyght vsed matter rauished admiration ranne thicke threefolde apostle whome lame man ioye yet let go forsaken haue two thing obserue one worthy great commendation reprehension plainly shall appeare peter wordes first striken marueylous admirationto marueyle workes god necessary luke sayth prouoked runne apostle bethinke straunge vnwoonted matter manne denye well done without cause ought diligently consider workes god marueyle excellencye ende philosopher altogither vnwittily haue sayde god made manne bicause obseruation marueyling stayeth certaine blinde amazed dulnesse minde certayne preparation mynde whereby drawne true knowledge god god verily reuealeth himselfe worde long since written hath commaunded alwayes preached church corruption minde vnlesse drawne forcible motion neuer brought earthly thing consideration heauenly wherefore god ioyneth worde many time certaine signes singuler work may awake mindes dull sleepe bring consideration worde cause christ oftentimes eyther teaching teaching vsed myracles make men ready receyue doctrine myracles howe much good appeareth example nicodemus others iohn came first knowledge christ nowe myracles iudgementes workes god chiefe ende purpose shoulde take occasion ryse higher better knowledge god pleasure sluggishnesse age bewayled whereby commeth passe many waxed deafe neyther heare see anye thinges whereby god puncheth v waketh v vp acknowledge saluation word gospell preached andthe lord commaundeth v watch see euery horrible example god iudgements wherewith bridleth punisheth vncurable wickednesse world signes woonders token sortes kindes shewed conclude whatsoeuer thinges christ prophecied shoulde come passe later age glorious comming math luc dayly done sight fulfilled lying bolt vpright snorting regarde none thing none signe token surely ouer great securitie carelesnesse worlde maye perceyued daungerous hereof came passe gentile worshipped sunne moone planet god ascribing benefites god bestowed mankinde thing errour mooued make men god e author publike weale pleasure errour stayed men bicause benefites receyued beastes creature thought certaine kinde godheade brute beastes riuers fountaines tree herbes turned glorye immortall god likenesse men flying fowles fourefooted beastes neyther ydolatrie vsed among christian rom spring anye occasion myracles wrought time past saint began doltishly written vnlearned also foolishly preached blazed pulpets straight way ignorant people thought done vertue power saint another errour sprang false opinion caused sicke great daungers make vowes saintes whose helpe hearde eyther themselues bene deliuered bicause god sometymes mainteyned remembrance saintes myracles wrought sepulchre thought godly power also place whereof came passe tyed worshipping inuocation place peculiar least anye thing shoulde wanting superstition ydolatrie sa beganne beautifie image saintes signes myracles whereby matter came farre frame nowe thinges due christ alone attributed saintes also saintes image superstition men set vp commaundement god maiestie ynough make vowes saintes must also famous place ymage saint wrought carued thing truth done taught history example superstitious men shew v dayes infinit number wherfore negligent consideration myracles foolish admiration hath giuen occasion fowle error manifest vngodlynesse warned whatsoeuer myracles done without doctrine god worde teacheth v trulye iudge ought neuer regardeddiuersitie signes miracle duiers signes woonders aswell true false wrought amongest men taught holye scripture called true myracles thing truly done sayd done beareth witnesse doctrine truth marc math sometimes myraculous workes apostle done christes institution called false deceyue v lying shew charmer iuglers vse call men god faith doctrine truth sometimes iannes iambres shewed pharao thess math ascribed antichrist deceyuers later dayes god suffreth otherwhiles done sight people elect may trye constancie faith moses testifyeth deut reprobate maye exercise seueritie iudgement bicause efficacie errour paule sayeth seduced woulde admit loue truth therefore myracles neu er taken must clea e onelye doctrine worke must examine rule god worde beare witnesse truth teach v trust god may acknowledge god author reiect false whose baytes satan vseth lye wayte faith saluation thing obserued shall owne default deceyued onely false myracles also true whereof god author whyle heeding person regarde ende wherfore done whereof place giueth v euident example another hereafter written people lystra actes tooke occasion commit ydolatrie myracle done paule place shall appeare let v consider peter people amazednesse taketh occasion preachthe argument peter sermon thinke abuseth ignoraunce errour people goeth meane get himselfe fellowes authoritie might easily haue done verily naye beginneth preach christ defendeth honour glorye fower member principall pointes sermon first correcteth ignorance people sheweth nothing done power vertue holynesse men secondly declareth god author myracle hath wrought sonne also admonisheth heynous offence committed sonne god thirdly requireth repentaunce last bicause christian religion seeme repugne moses prophet teacheth set forth christ must necessitie beleeue christ vnlesse seeme grieuouslye offende moses prophetes therewithall also teacheth christ promised father belonged also least drowned dispaire conscience sinnes present speake first part onely purposing intreate reast thei place time peter putteth away errour ignorauncefirst goeth remooue ignorance error mind right commodious waye teaching truth man propertie condicion like earth whereof made earth yeeldeth thornes bryers owne accorde neyther bringeth forth good seede increase vnlesse diligently clensed ridde minde man corrupt originall sinne bringeth forth error selfe except strongly repulsed neyther suffer doctrine truth receyue fruite commoditie thereby wherefore lorde commaundeth prophete breake downe roote vp ierem builde set peter colde behalfe though hunned honour ciuilitie modestie sake ambicious folke vse hunt glorye euen feyne contemners thereof framing talke interrogatiue point maketh vehement saying ye men israell marueyle yee looke v though owne power strength wee made man go wordes sauour reprehension pray sayth cause hath mooued conceyue abashment myracle wheras long sithens many wrought christ howe commeth passe remember easily appeare author surely vaine looke vpon v yea errour great may winked power holinesse hath herein done nothing anothers woorke must haue prayse done saint holy men ascribe glory godlet v obserue place modestye truth apostle whereby challenge vnto christ honor glorie reserue nothing themselfe due propertie saintes acknowledge christes voyce saying prophete esay lorde name glorye giue none example endeuour place also otherwheares baptist hee asked whether hee messias iohn sauiour giueth prayse christ onely whose forerunner onely confesseth himselfe disciple carnall zeale enuied christ testifyed christ bridegroome church whome men must brought sheweth power glorye giuen vnto god father iohn math sendeth disciple vnto paule rather stoned woulde receyue godly honor lystra offred owne free motion actes minde plaine also angel iohn rauished excellencie reuelations would haue worshipped aungell sayde vnto see thou doe thy fellow seruant apoc thy brother prophetes keepe wordes prophecie booke worship thou god wherevpon augustine xlix epistle disputing honour due god writeth aungels calleth spirituall creature wise howe much godly subiection god muche lesse doth vouchsafe selfe honour knoweth belongeth god little afterwarde comparing euill aungels sayth ioy delighted error men good addeth wherefore euen wicked pryde whether bee men spirites commaundeth desireth diuine honour giuen vnto godly humilitie whether men holy aungels hath refused thinges offred sheweth whome due may taken sure rule wherby iudge well apparition doctrine whosoeuer teacheth v trust god serue worship one god iesus christ whether aungels men ought taken holy minister god may safely beleeue whosoeuer teacheth v take glorye saluation christ conuey himselfe creature seeketh health mennes owne workes accursed yea aungell heauen galat apparition spirites counterfeyting soules men departed life teaching must redeemed sacrifice masse like workes put flight dart likewise false teacher abuse simplicitie men chalenge themselfe glory redeeming forgiuing sinnes peter example condemneth romishe antichristes glory seate succession peter number reported one sayd nothing profitable plenteous christian religion came passe like lordes world saying one rashly vttered bewrayde minde opinion also admonished peter wordesgod alone author myracles whome take author myracles wherein men part respect two thing power holynesse whose ministerie wrought peter teacheth v neyther cause efficient myracles reprehendeth iewes bicause thought great thing wrought power godlinesse apostle want reason whereby prooue peter saying called myracles wrought eyther course nature beside god lord nature math iohn hath giuen power christ heauen earth wherfore behooueth v also acknowledge author myracles men doe order nature doe nothing thinges wrought course nature naturall thing age mannes stature encrease vntill come iust measure proportion age commeth shoulde waxe gray heared man carefulnesse industry adde one cubite stature math make one heare heade white blacke nothing attributed holinesse person though chiefe cause myracle whereas knowe haue bene many holy men coulde worke myracles myracles woont wrought sake doe commonly saluation cause god would many time vse meane wicked person nothing shoulde attributed merites men see iudas numbred amongst whome christ committed preaching gospell gaue power worke myracles christ sayth place many later day shall glory myracles sayth cast boast thing vntrue math bicause worker wickednesse therefore myracles alwayes sure testimony holynesse men neyther must ascribed holynesse doe man doe contrary nature reason inwarde corruption vnworthye naturall daily benefites god therefore god onely taken author myracles meane serue confirmation faith saluation worketh myracles bicause deserue carefull saluation testimony truth doctrine stirre vp men mindes consideration also meaning woont done saint tombes lord ment confirme doctrine testifie immortalitie blisse cruelly tormented wicked persecutor faith wise shoulde offended death might comforted let v therefore hedge compasse myracles limites glory maye ascribed god alone whosoeuer shall passe boundes shall eyther deceyue others aware myracles else others deceyued themselues ought godly sort beleeue sainteslet man yet take saying though enuied holye saintes god honor glory ascribe vnto whatsoeuer glorye called parthian gothickes almanickes africanes numidian thing doe men learne style haue destroyed people spoiled country fire sworde god dealeth farre otherwise named men whome fauour deseruing present matter hande first nameth father admonisheth promise god time past made father concerning christ abraham sayde gene thy god god thy seede thee thy seede shall nation earth blessed gen promise reade repeated afterwarde isaac iacob speake nothing dauid prophetes busilye occupied setting forth promise profitable yea necessary promise shoulde repeated bicause iewes little denyed presence pylate saying looke none king caesar hereafter shall heare therefore bicause shoulde thinke themselues vtterly fallen couenant promise premised past hope saluation peter sheweth god liued reigned yet still time past made couenaunt father forsaken abraham isaac iacob euen beginning nowe also woulde called god woulde turne vnto furthermore auoide suspicion wherwith apostle charged title style god serued much many suspected preached newe god newe faith new religion hitherto vnknowne father cause many would heare many thought worthy death according law moyses deut peter vsing title god openly protesteth acknowledgeth none god shewed himselfe time past father preacheth none faith religion whereby father pleased god saued conclude teacheth father iewes ought marke followe faith religion christ alone maister men father hath appointed teacher worlde must onely follow steppe whose fayth religion knowe pleased god whose faith integritie god doth vouchsafe beare witnesse number whome aduentures common counsell consent elder math luc lyking allowance people followed vnto pylates house euangelistes testifie besides seconde place sayth yee denied pylate speaketh certaine light tryfling deniall one whereby renounced promise god touching messias king shoulde redeeme denied hope father wherewith many yeares wayted comming sauiour reade iohn pylate still repeated name king respecting doubt messias promised hytherto looked great impietie crie haue king caesar promise made vnto dauid vnderstanded caesar ocke one shoulde borne king euer vnderstanded tiberius naughtie wicked person sayd behold thy king commeth vnto thee euen righteous sauiour lowlye forth therefore peter chargeth impietie whereby spoyled themselues saluation promise health hope saluation least shoulde lay fault pylate though feare sayeth themselues pylate iudged loosed gaue openly testimonie righteousnesse innocencie therefore affirmeth iewes fault fulfill wickednesse mischiefe made lorde life chargeth bitter hatred christ blindnesse ashamed preferre bloudye murtherer christ make wickednesse seeme heynous vseth comparison denyed iesus holy person iust whome neyther bishop although coulde pylate herode coulde finde faulte furthermore stewe author lyfe yea lorde lyfe death whome ought haue knowne reason myracles late raising againe lazarus meane season required theefe citie yea temple bare swinge chiefe author wyckednesse knewe yet breathed hatred christ therefore againe taught libertie open wickednesse reprooued whome lorde hath appointed watchman church shewe daunger sworde hanging ouer v least men shoulde perishe owne slothe negligence cause shoulde harcken saye neede vehemencie dayes forasmuch none whome crueltie obiected nay iewes onely haue thus sinned excuseth iewes haue seene many quite conscience haue denyed christ heart trembleth oft remember heynous offence committed onely denied truth themselues compelled belonged denie embraced forme religion author inuentor thereof allowed like impietie committed hath bene hearde god graunt may repent wickednesse faultie therein meane season see howe bloudye barabasses euerye reigne flourishe great price money hyred vsed shed bloude prouoke wrath god horrible destruction countrie vngodlynesse therfore must accused thing openly committed accounted wicked ought modestie vsed oh impietie vngraciousnesse goodnesse god hath directed meaning blot wipe remembraunce christ amonge men bicause thought enimie god true religion ignoraunce blinded whereby came passe madde sonne god ende tragedie ioyfull god offende let v acknowledge fault selfe excuse selues make god author wickednesse anye goodnesse fall wickednesse yet let v thinke altogither faultlesse let v embrace goodnesse god turneth wickednesse deserued damnation saluation alleaged example hereof hystorie ioseph solde away brother ioyne example also shall glasse behold reason controuersie matter furthermore let v harcken saye may sinne acknowledge sinne sorie see iudas addeth worde namely must conuert conuersion turning must vnto thing sinne departed depart god sinne manifest needeth great proofe wordes therefore sayde scripture righteousnesse christ maketh v able stande sight doctrine gospell teacheth v god father reconcyled vnto v christ faith springeth inuocation god whatsoeuer fruites vse growe repentance therefore peter promiseth forgiuenesse sinnes wherof credible chiefely carefull marke maner speach great cause consideration vseth conuert sayth sinnes maye bee done away doth attribute vnto glorie merite desert though workes penaunce might put awaye sinnes make satisfactio teacheth must done away another saye god whome sinne sinne become debters vnto metaphore translation taken creditor lender haue power authoritie wype debtes bookes reckening eyther satisfyed debters else themselues fauour goodnesse remitte forgiue debt sinne become debters vnto god according saying dauid haue sinned thee lorde verily whatsoeuer comitted lord sinne therfore vnlesse god wype btes sinnes none deliuer v wysest iewes gentile haue herein consented agreed albeit gentile attributed muche superstition yet confessed vaine vnlesse peculiar fauor god ioyned among iewes phariseyes attributed much work yet read themselues confessed openly god onely power forgiue sinnes math forgiueth putteth awaye bicause power purge thende might vnderstande sinnes nowe done awaye would heart embrace iesus christ whose merite put away nowe sayde must thinke spoken also v aboue thinges must haue care repentance haue eye fast fixed vppon onelye forgiuenesse sinnes wicked ouer bolde confidence chalenge selues merites workes benefite commeth grace god obtayned meryte christ vrgeth feare last iudgementfurthermore nothing wholesome necessary man repentaunce turning vnto god wherevnto peter place counselleth v fleshe credit beleeue anye thing easily corruption nature delight sinne proude ashamed confesse fault amende therefore apostle vrgeth standing wauering doubt strong argumentes agreeable purpose setteth eye remembraunce later daye glorious comming christ iudge talke phrase herein somewhat defectiue full may wise easily supplied vaine require repent turne vnto god shall profitable necessary maye hereafter able stande sure time refreshinge shall haue lordes sight commeth shall sende iesus christ preached whome heauens must receyue vntill time thing restored againe wordes may gather two argumentes one taken time sense whereof thus forme worlde shall alway endure neyther trade men creature see shall come daye refreshing restoring thing godly shall deliuered restitution required wicked c therfore saluation deare vnto applie busily day may bring vnto refreshing saluation feare tormentes argument taketh iudges person god sende iesus christ whome speake iudge whose iudgement seate men must stande may receyue body according doings whether good badde therefore necessarye shoulde get fauour iudge come punishe offence seemeth thirde argument also maye gathered wordes sayth whome preached shall come iudge taketh pretence ignorance shoulde thinke theyr former ignorance shoulde excuse daye iudgement weyght thinges spoken consideration mooue man certes vaine mooued argumentes day refreshinghere haue consider state later daye peter expresseth two wordes first calleth daye refreshing figure called synecdoche perteineth godly shall feele refreshing deliuered griefe sorrowe shall god wype away teares eye apoc shall death neyther sorrow neyther cry c also shall enriched goodes neyther eye hath seene eare hearde esay comprehended reason man many liued worlde suffered kinde griefes flesh paciently iohn shall iobe sayth see god flesh cause christ biddeth v lift vp heades see signes going later daye luc redemption draweth neare sight christ iudge terrible godlye forasmuch vnderstand sauiour aduocate great benefit haue faith none otherwaies faith maketh v bolde sure saluation comming christ shall finde helpe rich honors1 iohn friendship world liued earth despised fayth christ therfore behooueth v armed hope temptation worlde aduersitie shall neuer remooued waye saluation calleth day restitutionthe day restitution shall restitution al thing perfite immutable state creature many looke vaine long liue world world full confusion breedeth new trouble euery day wherwith kingdome christ sometime hath bene assaulted yt might seeme vtterly haue quayled later day kingdome shall set vp prophetes haue prophecied power aduersaries shall brought vnder christes feete shall nothing trouble faithfull shall ioyfull peaceable state thinges esay ierem amos prophetes many time make mention daye shall body restored againe howsoeuer haue perished sea shall giue vp hir deade shall death hell apoc shall restored ioyfull blessed condicion worlde engine frame world groneth vnder burthen corruption shal deliuered rom made accursed sinne man shall bee newe heauens newe earth wherein righteousnesse shall dwell apoc pet euery man shall receyue bodye according hath done whether well euill yea christ himselfe hath put downe rule cor thing subdued vnto shall subiect vnto put thing vnder shal deliuer vp kingdome god father cor god may conclude shalbe restitution thing neyther vtter woordes comprehende reason nowe knowledge vnperfite propheciyng vnperfite perfite come vnperfite shall done awaye cor nowe see glasse euen darcke speaking shall wee see face face meane consideration hereof serueth instruction borne vp hope ofthis restitution may paciently suffer whatsoeuer aduersitie miserie order conuersation oflife fayth christ great daye lord may bring vnto v also comfort refreshing among godly many seemeth marueyle lord deferreth comming longwhy christ deferreth comming perhaps iewes might mooue question hereof measure god propertie flesh cannot choose marueyle god tariaunce deferring iudgement peter aunswereth question sayth christ must remaine heauens reigne heauen vntill thing restored fulfilled prophetes haue prophecied hath earth fulfilled affaire redemption remained yet certaine thing done long decreed god foreshewed behooued gospell shoulde preached world gentile brought fellowship church prophetes one consent testifie remayned mysterie antichrist whose tyrannie needefull church shoulde tried2 thess apoc number christes martyr fulfilled christ therefore hath giuen place thing going heauen hauing receyued power heauen earth let man therefore thinke vnmindefull eyther v dutie bicause deferreth comming daye iudgement knoweth hath doe thinges let comfort v knowe reigneth heauen let v seeke mindes lift vp faith without care ofhis corporall presence earth vntill great daye come math like lightning shall appeare vnto v sodenly woulde god would diligently examine peter wordes dayes bicause woulde ratifie bodily presence christ earth saye humaine nature reason coniunction hath godly extended pierceth place cannot circumscribed conteyned neyther within time place let therfore looke aunswere make peter appointeth time place yea affirmeth appoynted god taken heauen shoulde sit vntill last day came shall returne iudge bestowe fully vpon godlye restitution long agone promised knowe iumble heauen earth togither worde heauen vnderstande heauenlye glorye conuersation earth glose cannot prooued scripture vtterly vnknowne learned antiquitie therefore needeth great confutation therefore leauing quiddity let v learne thirde part sermon sinnes despaire god grace repentance true faith let v returne vnto god let v prepare selues daye v also may shine happie ioyfull iesus christ shall come deliuer condemne wicked whome praise honour power glory euer amen xxiiij homelie moyses truly sayde vnto father prophet shall lord god rayse vp vnto euen brother like vnto shall heare thing whatsoeuer shall saye vnto time come euerye soule heare prophete shall bee destroyed among people prophet also samuell thenceforth many haue spoken haue likewise tolde dayes apostle peter grieuouslye accused heynous wickednesse iewes committed sonne god thirde part sermon gaue counsell howe obteyne saluation declared last sermon bade repent conuert vnto god partly doe repentance partly faith iesus christ whose merite reconciled vnto god small blocke kept iewes embracing christ yet come knowledge great many feared shoulde receyue shoulde offende moyses lawe giuen god seemed weightie matter forsake religion god giuen vnto helde many yeares order according receyued forefather therefore apostle fourth part oration correcteth errour teaching moyses prophetes direct true worshipper god vnto christ therefore little offended lawe beleeuing christ rather disobey moyses beleeue prophetes truly except receyue christ whome beare witnesse againe least shoulde distrust goodnesse christ whome nowe oftentimes hearde offended great crueltie declareth promised father belongeth also sauiour well father woulde embrace true fayth present speake thinges onely peter alledgeth concerning mysterie christ grounded vppon bookes olde testament beginneth moyses bicause greatest authoritie among iewesmoyses bear th witnesse christ whome might haue brought diuers testimony taketh one among manye whereby teacheth v christ long agone appointed teacher schoolemaister god people thing serued much present purpose bicause saide euen nowe many thought grieuous matter forsake moyses knewe appointed god lawmaker maister sheweth therefore moyses minde alwaye hang vppon pointed another prophete shoulde perfitely teache thing place deuteronomie xviij chapter place prohibited superstitious soothsaying artes heathen whereby go search knowledge thinges come secretes god diuination wicked mathematicalles noise birdes flying necromancie like kinde diuinations moyses doth aduertise shoulde forsake thing turne worde god wholy depend vpon bicause thinke harde matter finde meaning god word sayth neuer want prophetes whome god would rayse vp among themselues whose ministerie shoulde learne god thing shoulde take hande deceyued thinke vniuersall promise conteyned place whereby gift prophecie established confirmed people church god peter wittily applieth generall promise vnto christ euident chiefe prophetes whose spirite sayth another place1 pet prophetes ledde inspired thing spoken moyses belong vnto christ euident needeth anye long demonstration borne iewes sent god appeareth doctrine myracles whiche see pointes conformable doctrine apostle therefore peter argument seemeth strong whereby laboureth perswade beleeue christ according moyses saying euen shoulde say moyses little challengeth selfe alone authoritie teaching commaundeth v giue eare credite euerye prophete teaching worde god hath appointed despise prophetes saying punished death therfore much ought beleeue christ hath taught v god father plainly perfitely anye man whome truly verified whatsoeuer moyses sayth prophete peter trimlye toucheth ende scope purpose take mindes preposterous religion let hindred ouermuch reuerence moyses law pieuish opinion woulde let embrace iesus christ yet bicause peter steuen appeareth hereafter expounde place moyses ment christ also search thinges maye enstruct v knowledge christ first moyses doth elegantlye describe vnto v christ sauiour next teacheth v dutie owe vnto pronounceth sentence death agaynst doe contemne first description christ sheweth whome shall spring bornechrist manhode borne iewes lorde god shall rayse vp brother must borne iewes infallible argument hys incarnation true manhoode whereby conuinced saye christ brought flesh heauen tooke substance virgin came virgin worlde water runneth conduite verily paule testifieth tooke aungels nature heb heauenly creature seede abraham speaking prerogatiues iewes wherewith god aboue nation vouchsafe endue among thing maketh mention howe christ touching fleshe shoulde borne god thing praysed euer rom wherevnto promise haue incarnated made man least eyther might afrayde maiestie thinke disdained infirmitie paule also considered heb christ prophetesecondlye declareth office christ calling prophete howbeit moyses ignorant christ king redeemer mankinde denyeth place maketh mention office purpose matter hand chiefly required prophetes whether shewe thing come else worde god admonish men thing present interpreter opener god bicause christ shoulde priest church god euer must abstayne teaching chiefe poynt required priest maye seene malachie wherfore also another place described person prophete preacher esay diligence openly confesseth sent cause mar luc therefore without cause moyses peter calleth prophet taught place sufficient confesse christ sauiour redeemer vnlesse acknowledge teacher sent god doe dutie schollers owe faythfull trustie schoolemaister thou shalt moreouer consider howe ought reuerence ministerie whereby gospell preached whereby singularly commended example sonne god himselfe minister earth appoynted ministerie alwaye church wherevnto paule hauing respect sayth wee messenger roume christ preache vnto worlde worde attonement woulde god hearer minister woulde alwaye remember least one sort thinke contemptuously ministerie naughtynesse make laughed thirdly declared maner prophete christ bechrist like vnto moyses saye like vnto moyses taken though shoulde acknowledge christ nothing excellencie moyses whereas moyses meere man sinner christ god man author saluation similitude comparison must referred office prophete figure christ moyses bare wherein many thing pleasant profitable come considered first paule testifieth moyses rather suffer sorrowe affliction people god heb taken pharao nephewe enioye treasure delightes egypt affection see christ shape god humbled abased himselfe taking shape seruaunt chose rather afflicted v die v see v longer misery furthermore moyses brother moste vnworthilye refused christ came amongst owne owne receyued pylate denyed saying wee haue king caesar yea iohn nowe dayes also vnworthily reiected manye whome offreth himselfe himselfe eternall life saluation gospell thirdly moyses deliuered people god cruell tyrannie pharao brought egypt drowned surge read sea sonne god hath deliuered mankinde power deuill brusting bondes sinne death hath slayne satan spirituall pharao preparation engine armor merite bloude fourthly moyses lyke faithfull shepehearde ledde people israell safely vnknowne wayes wildernesse iesus christ faythfull shepeherde goeth sheepe psal iohn leadeth v safelye deserte worlde full kinde daungers light worde guiding spirite fifthly moyses gaue manna people hungred gat springes water rocke thirst iesus christ feedeth soules vnto life euerlasting merite flesh hath opened side plentifull fountaine saluation al thirsty drouthes soule quenched see iohn sixthly moyses interpretor god worde people exod deut able abide maiestie god speaking none v hath seene god see long clothed mortall fleshe sonne god bosome father hath declared vnto v whatsoeuer behooueth v knowe god prooueth argument taketh v friendes iohn bicause hath hid none thing v heard father seuenthly weyghtie cause coulde discussed ordinarie iudges vsed referred brought vnto moyses receyuing sentence mouth lorde declared taken vndoubted ought countermaunded may seene exod leuit numer c whatsoeeuer thing eyther mystery spirituall blessing paule teacheth ephe peter addeth maner also blessing saying whyle turneth euery man wickednesse sinnnes curse springeth place blessing afore sinne taken awaye nowe christ taketh awaye yea hath long sithence clensed merite death cause baptist calleth lambe god taketh awaye sinnes worlde iohn taketh sinne away fo one time conuerteth fro sinnes beleeue giueth spirite regenerated
