carelesse lyfe mindes men certainlye1 iohn christ came worlde destroye workes deuill among workes sinne hath chiefe place none denie nay rather confesse truth v true turning sinne christ author spirite according saying ieremie ierem conuert thou shall conuerted agayne thren turne thou v vnto thee lord shall turned furthermore make ende haue obseruedall prerogatiues christ value iewes raigne heauen whome prayse honour glory power euer amen fourth chapiter vpon actes apostle xxvj homelie spake vnto people priestes ruler temple saduceys came vpon taking grieuously taught people preached iesus resurrection death laide handes vpon put holde vntill next day euentyde howbeit many hearde wordes beleeued number men fiue thousande hitherto luke hath described beginning successe primitiue church haue seene doctrine apostle deliuered vnto church also study exercise primitiue church nowe herevnto commodiously adioyned worlde receyued doctrine shall see howe thing fell christ shewed apostle iohn sayth seruant greater maister haue persecuted persecute also haue kept saying iohn keepe againe shall deliuer vp councels math shall scourge sinagoges thing god hitherto kept safe furie enimies vntill beginning church myght stablished settled little surer beginne nowe finde true nowe fierce enimies sodenlye rushe vppon take cast prison bring examination counsayle length vexed long disceptation reasoning dismisse grieuous threates must narration marke one thing chiefely aboue shall serue much consolation instruction offended attempt wicked wherewith dayes oppugne doctrine christ church worlde whose propertie hate persecute light truth iohn bicause bewrayeth naughtie doings vseth olde thus doe behooueth v armed constancie primitiue church leaue place assaulted wayte happie ende successe temptation stronge inuincible fayth god graunteth vnto whome seeth tried1 cor made better vnder crosse bicause shall haue occasion oftentimes speake thing let suffice v haue touched little hereof least lose marke whereto thing must directed nowe shall discusse euery part circumstance thing luke hath sayde describeth apostle enimies author persecution craftes deceite vsed cloke wicked vniust enterprise howe violently layde handes apostle howe vaine attempt bicause furie number faythfull rather increased diminished among enimies apostlesthe author apostle persecution three kindes men rehearced first priestes whome circumstaunces may easilye gather ringleader beginner businesse howbeit bene partes rather haue taken vppon defence truth haue preached christ vnto people whome moyses prophetes bare witnesse followeth ruler temple likelyhoode capitaine romaine souldiors temple stoode impregnable place citie well fenced munition suppose romaynes gaue presidentes iurie speciall charge thereof least iewes vnder colour religion holy assembly shoulde mooue insurrection sedition vndoubtedly capitaine temple brought garde souldiors alwayes attended seruice commaundement thirde kinde men beside called saduceyes plainely scoffed religion denyed resurrection bodye whatsoeuer else written mystery eternall life may seene math actes syncere religion coulde durst denye thing without religion coulde stande expende matter well shall appeare men came apostle sent take christ mount oliuete luke luke gospell sheweth let v markethe enimies christ gospell alwayes like greatest enimies church doctrine christ author persecution uerily priestes say take vpon gouernance doctrine whole church soone ouercome ambition couetousnesse beginne seeke priuate honour chaunge religion lucre storie gospell abundantly declareth iewish doctor math iohn c chosen first withstand truth bicause first reproued light truth hereof see commeth passe age kinde men haue procured trouble agaynst doctrine truth time prophet liued declare true whome bishop priestes made iohn baptist prooued true iohn whose doctrine baptisme leuites sent ierusalem beganne first reprehend christ sorer enimies priestes whose deuises taken condemned nayled crosse apostle nowe finde grieuousest enimies pylate romaine garrison hytherto suffred preache christ disturbed whose fauour defence ought haue setting forth kingdome christ let v remember geare troubled though perceyue v dayes hitherto haue chalenged themselues church name learning holynesse meane pope rable bishop monkes euident ledde couetousnesse ambition haue long since obscured doctrine truth mannes tradition haue made lucre religion cannot must hate light truth wish extinguishment thereof craft enimies truthbut let v consider craft vse setting vppon apostle first enter church alone laye hande vpon apostle men woulde haue perceyued howe beene led desire priuate honor lucre daungerous matter prouoke furie rage people wherefore ioyne vnto ruler temple authorised publike order see shoulde businesse made church woulde seeme haue regard publike tranquillitie deede none purpose vse ayde officer defence tyrannie ioyne also vnto saduceyes men voyde religion bicause thought meetest purpose men thinke poynt eyther foolishe seditious minde contrary custome alter thing religion last rushe vpon sermon sodenly bicause would feare people withall wherevpon may thinke consulted hereof nothing aladuenture without deliberation like craft haue vsed truth nowe many yeares haue conspired daniel attributeth antichrist eye man say witte wylinesse foresee thing christ sayth child worlde wyser kinde dan luc child lyght surelye well consider hystories bishop rome shall see haue vsed lyke wylinesse many yeares haue chiefely set forwarde owne matter haue seemed nothing lesse bolstred vp secular power haue clymed vp rule tyrannie nowe exercise boniface thirde made phoca embrued heynous murther maurice maister emperour platina sabellicus carion thintent againe might make supreme head church strength lumbardes draue emperor greece italie lumbardes seemed intollerable greekes vsed frenchman ayde subdue lumbardes neyther made charles emperor west church romaine bene without emperour three hundred yeares cause haue captaine ruler church whose ayde helpe might vse defende vsurped power ouer church brydle woulde speake plainely bewrayed meaning conueyed empire germaines caused emperours sweare homage obedience reserued authoritie confirming crowning emperour themselues least woulde doe pleasure ascende dignitie shall confesse say truth whosoeuer reade fourme oth wherwith emperours bounde haue put among canon lawe also canon boniface eyght concerning maioritie obedience speaking two swordes ecclesiasticall secular power doth expressely chalenge vnto bishop rome word power church namely spirituall swoorde materiall one bee exercised church church one hande priest hande prince souldiours becke sufferaunce priest c let v therefore acknowledge truth olde president see bishop fight truth force kinges let v marke subtiltie beast compasseth hir matter strength others let v consider hir continuall trauey e oppressing truth iudge according leysinesse wake soundly snort let v therfore awake likewise according christes admonition beware men math howbeitby pretece truth assaulted might seeme straunge tyrannicall deede violently carie men awaye without order lawe therefore luke sheweth pretence tooke grieuously sayth taught people preached iesus resurrection deade word sheweth grieued also thing layde apostle charge uerily two thinges first seemeth thing intollerable peter iohn rude vnlearned men time gotten liuing fishing taken none order shoulde teache people seemed thing tending schisme bring people vnitie churche matter come passe among iewes administration church priestes handes woulde admitte none teache church sworne thing see bishop rome haue done many yeares whose church christ hath prophecied reuelation man may buye sell apoc except haue marke beast yet woulde haue meaning taken though men church permitted preach without exception1 tim c know apostle haue taught touching ordering minister condemne tyrannie challenge themselfe onely power whereas chiefely author mischief church deserue haue lowest rouine place church secondly thinke worthy punishment preach iesus risen deade saduceyes wholy condemned doctrine resurrection another thing grieued euerye man might gather rising againe christ sonne god author life vniustly condemned priestes pylate peter openly sayd sermon intollerable slaunder also sedicious matter charge apostle went rayse people bloudy vniust iudges apostle therefore charged two heynous crime say schisme church sedition common weale without cause seeme good men hatefull detestable weygh consider intent priestes condicions shall easily perceyue vaine pretence cannot abide schisme church regarded saduceyes writing wherein make answere reproches slaunders gentyles dayes also gospell cause chiefely spoken bicause rippeth christes coate without seame say church deuideth men mindes kindleth warres aunswere thing easie well knowne farre thing wringeth disquieteth men haue church deuided beseech doe highly commend rule order monkes whereby ought professe name christ deuided sundrye rytes factious name hearcken paule cor grieuously condemneth thinges abhorre diuision greatly commeth passe bishop rome author warres haue bene many yeares may thanke horrible schisme neuer ynough bewayled christendome publike peace tranquillitie men maye marueyle apostle aunswered crime layde chargethey fight agaynst truth open force luke teacheth plainelye let therof layde handes prison haste bicause shoulde haue leysure make purgation people propertie enimies truth open force proceede professor thereof hauing alwayes eye vnto faithfull shall haue place leysure excuse themselues knowe force veritie light thereof easily disclose attemptes wote well howe safetie people ignorance therefore vse spreade false accusation amonge people godly labour man shoulde vnderstande innocencie therefore reason scripture go worke vse plaine force halter prison sworde fire like euident needeth long proofe yet let remember christ testifyeth power darkenesse prince darkenesse shall one daye punished luke teacheth v little wicked tyrannie preuayled christ church many sayth heard wordsthrough persecution church encreaseth beleeued number men fiue thousande shoulde first saye marueyle brother vnspeakable considered consideration whereof lesse profitable necessary first howe holy ghost foresheweth christ refused thosechrist reiect builder goddes appoyntment chiefe among people reprooueth wicked pride bishop rome say cannot erre although manifest appointed god yet cannot erre shoulde neuer graunted seeing ordeyned god haue often erred saye cannot erre bewray follie whereas error open onely barbours bleare eyed prouerbe also boyes childrenthe pope erreth owne confession looke also wil platina reporteth benedict ix appered deade sayde damn bicause liued lawles liue lawlesse damned must needes erre clement seauenth pope confessed grosse ignorance rather impudent lust lye table two monk maner disputing whether ye pope could erre many word fro agreed might erre man pope christes vicar earth could mean erre clement offended impudent slauelike flatterie sayd monke angrie moode nay confesse euen pope may often doe erre whyle bestowe benefice ecclesiasticall dignity suppose vpon good godly person bewitch mindes caused saye none scribe phariseys accursed rascall people iohn ignorant lawe scripture helde christ therefore presupposing shoulde easily haue ouercome apostle could choose amazed see paule disputeth large first corinthian first chapter cause amazednesse euident truth myracle wrought apostle neyther able call doubt yet charge suspicion magicke enchauntment see man stande whome apostle bestowed benefite health whether called owne accorde ioyned see ende successe matter wote therefore perplexitie minde haue one worde answere thought haue ouercome caught apostle trip demaunding one question shamefully vanquished confounded fulfilled christ promised saying giue vtteraunce wisedome luc aduersaries shall able make resistaunce appeareth also howe vaine deuises men christ knoweth cogitation vaine bringeth counsayle heathen naught counsayle lorde endureth euer dauid sayd psal verily elephas themanite sayth destroyeth deuises subtill handes able perfourme stedfast thing iohn compasseth wyse owne craftynesse ouerthroweth counsayles wicked gospell sheweth v like example blinde man restored christ sight againe vnlearned begger doth marueylously hold whole colledge scribe phariseyes baye question aske iohn vtter foolishnes let man therefore afrayde eyther power craft enimies god easily turneth vpside downe cause haue hande god giue v mouth vtterance speake spirite father v leaue place math must speake somewhat two thing worthy obserued first without cause luke writeth wicked enimies christ amazedboldenesse speache doth moste confo wicked bolde free speach apostle example taught nothing effectuall bridle wicked freedome speach reprooued face truth withstand boldly defended force wordes easily pierce minde zeale god truth glorie ioyned therevnto cannot conscience hearer must wounded howsoeuer many time dissemble whereby commeth passe although alwayes truly repent yet many time counterfeyte repentaunce abstayne euill maye see manifest example achab elia libertie beseemed prophete1 reg vpbrayded vnworthy slaughter naboth againe minister word suffer tongue brydled else themselues keepe silence please worlde see wicked encouraged runne kinde licentious sinne fill vp measure iniquitie length miserably perishe blinde watchman dumbe dogges see ezechiel iij xxxiij chapter cause franke bold kinde reprehension euerywhere required minister lorde sayth vnto esaye crye lowde thou canst leaue esay lift vp thy voyce like trumpet shewe people offence house iacob sinnes lorde commaundeth hieremie stande priestes people prince kinges ierem like brasen wall without feare therefore paule woulde haue sinner openly rebuked afore men thereby might brought feare yea1 tim prison commendeth himselfe cause prayer congregation watch sayth instancie prayer sainctes vtteraunce may giuen vnto ephe may open mouth freely vtter secretes gospell whereof messenger bondes therein may speake freely ought speake therefore let minister neuer suffer boldnesse taken see apostle carefull nextthe lame man standeth apostle must diligently consider writeth lame man healed stoode apostle pleaded cause therefore daunger teacheth v slate condicion godly worlde assoone haue receyued benefite saluation christ vnder perill threates wicked lazarus raised againe christ great hazarde bicause clergie iewes sought make christ waye wicked seeke haue glory christ extinguished iohn abide whome set forth declared diligently obserued least christ offreth v eternall saluation promise selues felicitie friendship world brought fooles paradyse tribulation afterwarde cometh fall away see many doe dayes daunger saluation also lame man example christian thankfulnesse courage bicause forsaketh benefactor peril power standeth helpeth yet diuers reason wherewith might haue excused himselfe haue obtayned pardon ruler benefite receiued apostle yet reade vsed none thing example reprooueth glad receyue benefite christes saluation abide neyther perill tribulation whose number also contented haue saluation christ preached haue thinges ioyned therewith christ pronounceth antichristes deceyuers bicause see many world offended therewith whome also lyke greedily embrace doctrine saluation preached minister reioyce deliuered entanglinges caltroppes errour see worlde rageth stormeth minister denie helpe succour yea shunne sight least might seeme holde worlde dayes full men may goe best openly rayle minister daunger giue vineger drinke hang vpon crosse let remeber christ cannot deuided must altogither without else receyue sort giuen v father scripture set forth crucifyed teach v crosse entred glory father must embrace sort come way glory heauen calleth bearing crosse promiseth better condicion worlde math iohn tasted founde worlde cannot abyde disciple seruantes marc ashamed naughtie adulterous wicked worlde let v therefore example lame man armed christian stowtenesse saye euery one paule ashamed gospell christ rom power god vnto saluation beleeue decre counsayle agaynst apostlesnowe let v come seconde part place wherein conteyned counsell decreed apostle commaunded go aside begin consult among themselues maye seene marueylous perturbation confusion mindes first shall doe say men foolish preposterous question ignorant innocent ought set libertie rewarded done good way bewray pretensed malice seeking meanes howe vse crueltie well doer guyltlesse going yet vtter selues confesse truth myracle saying manifest signe wrought knowne inhabiters hierusalem cannot deny therefore wicked bicause yet conspire togither christ author myracle confesse also chiefely vrgeth offendeth make mention neyther god christ grieued matter knowne spredde abrode among people therefore regarde people god altogither depended vpon estimation ignorant superstitious multitude care glorie god iohn thing christ one place sayth chiefe cause incurable vnbeliefe length conclude doe thing done coulde vndone perceyuing daunger like ensue people falling awaye thinke good matter noysed abrode obliuion forgetfulnesse thinke burie memorie remembraunce christ labour bring passe threates tyrannie see haue reason therefore let v threaten saye henceforth speake man name send apostle great grauity word publish godly decree sacred oecumenicall counseloecumenicall signi eth vniuersall generall shal first either marueyle detest brother impudencie wicked tyrannie dulheadnesse follye openly confesse cannot denie myracle yet woulde haue kept close euery body mouth forbidde apostle speake furthermore take vpon wrastle christ whome coulde keepe graue deade buried garrison armed men authoritie romaine president sealed grauestone signet nowe liue reigne blockheaded disardes thinke vaine bragges threates suppresse extinguishe glorie let v consider wherevnto obstinate impietie mindethe wickednesse persecutor incurable hatred conceyued truth bringeth men able cease striuing god counsayle ordinaunce perceiue themselues guiltie owne conscience surely peace wicked prophet sayth esa mindes rage like sea troubled tossed waues sourges affection haue example hereof euerywhere dayes see many ignoraunt howe light gospell pierced farre dayes pope haue many time confessed grieuous abuse church knowe also learned also artificer mariner carter plowman child woman reason iudge religion see euerywhere reprooued sermon minister worde howe common people mocke howe publike songes nicked accused liuelye set forth portraytured kinde picture payntinges yet still chalenge kinde iudgement church still say canot erre forgetting vndoubtedly haue oftentimes confessed diuers abuse crept church yet dare commaunde minister silence ignorant though holde peace stone preach many yeares haue prooued tryed pasquill yet still thinke crake bulles vaine counterfayte lightning sufficient power oppresse truth christ reigning blinde foolish people see great light wicked deuilishe men sight worlde afrayde striue god shall one day feele howe vnhappy ende shall haue like vnto saule haue dauid reigne ouer like vnto bishop iewes go put iesus christ sonne dauid kingdome psalme furthermore learne example menpower feare god shoulde haue speciall care religion exod iethro counsayled moyses whose aduise god well liked approoued let put office thinke haue power giuen doe list authoritie restrained within boundes god lawe religion deut psal shall one daye giue account vnto god scripture sette forth paterne president true iudgement magistrate consider thing power hande madde man shall destruction well common weale epicure hearde onely professe name religion bicause would taken prophane godlesse people men cannot abide worde god bicause reprooueth sinne iohn wickednesse christ sometime sayde perceyue must eyther right trade obediencethis aunswere apostle verye notable first declareth right trade obedience wherein men vse diuersly daungerouslye erre men vnderstande obedience necessary publikely common weales agree cannot mindes deuided therefore let v followe trade praying vsed primitiue church shall perceyue aduersities god helpe neare hande shall good consider diligently prayer made may deuided three partes describe god omnipotenciethe first conteyneth description god wherein acknowledge creator whole worlde make mention first creation men might consider omnipotencie god singuler power ouer creature whereby might conceyue greater consolation thus aduertised wicked enimies christ neyther coulde hinder worke god enterprise yet hurt thing without deuise sufferance god behooueth v likewise haue consideration god omnipotencie acknowledge creator also gouernour preseruer creature though hath set throne high psal yet hee humbleth himselfe beholde whatsoeuer done eyther heauen earth consideration profitable amendement life maners tribulation bringeth comfort prayer chiefely confirmeth faith iacob math wherevpon effect prayer principally dependeth chiefe vse first article apostle creede professe beleeue god father maker heauen earth maketh confirmation faith taketh awaye cause distrust commonlye springeth reason thinke god eyther cannot helpe v impossible vnto hath made heauen earth worde hath hyther preserued worlde like neglect men hath made lord ouer thing hath created hath respect vnto thing voyde lyfe seeth gouerned seconde part contayneth narrationthe narration described kingdome christ also wicked enterprise worlde fight kingdome sense sayinge thus wee finde nowe true god thou didst prophecie mouth thy seruant dauid truly citie ierusalem time past called holy seate righteousnesse herode pylate haue conspired togither thy sonne souldiers also gentyles haue gathered themselues togither people israel ought haue serued thee c naught recyte olde prophecie hereby declare straunge vnwoonted thing come passe therefore man ought offended wicked attemptes christes enimies taught example howe also shoulde call remembrance prophecy scripture tossed tempest shall followe liue godly christ iesus timo wherevnto chiefely belongeth god prophecied first beginning worlde shoulde perpetuall enmitie betweene serpent seede woman betweene deuill prince worlde christes enimies dauid also congregation faithfull enterprise christes enimiesfirst describeth enterprise saying rage ymagine stande vp take counsayle togyther thing expresse ardent earnest hatred christ kingdome seeke meanes ouerthrow trimly describeth maners condicions numbreth nation people kinges among enimies christ attributeth peculyar property vnbeleeuing gentile rage ledde rather furiousnesse affection counsayle people whereby vnderstanded communaltie ymagine speake thyngs vayne whyle amonges cuppes commonly talke ouerthrowing kingdome christ king prince tossed care kingdomes psalme psalme conceyued vexation traueyle vanitie bring forth lying god whose counsayle endureth euer doth easily bring counsayle heathen naught hereto belongeth saying godly prophet breake downe people shall broken downe muster shall broken downe prepare battaile shall torne peeces take counsayle togither yet must counsaile come naught esay goe hande wyth yet shall prosper lorde v reade scripture story church may see euerywhere example hereof needeth greatlye make rehearsall yet one example iulian apostata runnagate notable burning hatred christ ready giue vp ghostin tripartite historie vi booke xliiii chap constrayned say thou hast victorie galylean thou hast victorie certaine christian wittilye aunswered wicked sophister asking carpentare galyley making coffin beere beare iulian graue vpon christes enimies warre godafterwarde sheweth whome enterprise made came togither lorde annoynted myght haue seemed light matter contende striue wyth christ reason humble lowly porte mannes nature tooke christes enimies onely also enimies god hee disdayneth acknowledge kinges onely sonne heyre king realme procurer sedition worthily iudged make warre king acknowledge sonne god king sauiour may well sayde enimie god hath giuen power kingdome glory man redemption men might honor sonne iohn euen honor father neyther god acknowledged honoured otherwyse sonne wherefore consequence neyther acknowledge honour god doe acknowledge honour sonne rebell mooue warre sonne god like wicked gyaunts may iudged make warre god also iohn baptist well perceyue sayde father loueth sonne hath gyuen thing hande beleeueth sonne hath lyfe euerlasting beleeueth sonne iohn shall see lyfe wrath god abydeth vppon doubt enimie god prouoketh himselfe irreuocable wrath god thing serue instruction defyle selues wyth lyke impietie also comforte afrayd power enimies see selues weake fight battell taken hande vnder god conduct easilye subdue force attemptes thing iohn teacheth v sayth v iohn power worlde last allthe enimies christ fulfill wyll god faithfull expresse euidently effect ende mischieuous attempt say gathered themselues togyther doe whatsoeuer thy hande thy counsaile determined done howbeit wicked consult meete togither put god purpose execution declare vnto v able doe nothing god hath decreed haue done god purpose studie hinder shall appeare manifest consider priestes iewes dyd woulde keepe christ oute kingdome therefore mooued romane president communaltie ynted vntill sawe vpon crosse dead buried thing helpe christ sauiour worlde according eternall purpose father enter kingdome consideration hereof apostle remooue way blocke whereat stumble thinke wicked able ouercome christ power force serueth vse god singuler prouidence make men vnderstande enterprise wycked go doe god hath appoynted haue obserue acknowledge god prouidence onely prescience foreknowledge also stable decree hande whereby doth execute pleasure hath decreed himselfe may yet wicked therfore excused bicause respect decree god followe owne corrupt affection haue alreadie many time declared although primitiue church doth truely beleeue professe yet prayeth feruent sute beseecheth god succour ayde therefore doctrine submitteth thing successe vnto god taketh praying away god prayed inuocated cause godly vse ardently knowe thinges gouerned appoyntment doe commaundeth search ouer curiously secret counselles permit successe thing vnto whome knowe faithfull suffer v tempted aboue strength bringeth thing happy ende loue prayer beleuednowe let v see thirde part prayer contayneth peticions thinges perceyued neede first lorde beholde threatnings worde beholde meane iudgement punishment much saye desyre god reuenge theyr cause right reuenge much agaynst warre made prooued wordes psalme thys peculiar vsage godly perceyue hyndered vocation able make parte good appeale vnto iudgement god psal others see dauid oftentymes dyd saule persecuted hym yet shall neuer doe wyth affyaunce glory god wycked openly impeached thus ezechias layde blasphemous letter king assyria esay open lorde beseecheth hym wyll defende hys quarrell doubt heareth carefull glorie name seeing mercyfully heareth pryuate quarrel hys ende woulde seeme commyt thys matter vnto god withdrawe themselues daunger beseeche god also gyue grace maye speake declare worde boldely thing chiefely vnderstanded apostle minister worde vnlesse boldened guyded wyth spirite god may easily made afrayde threat assaultes worlde intermyt office thing paule hys manifolde traueyles ministerie acknowledged therefore thought good holpen wyth publike prayer congregation might speake worde god freely open mouth ephes yet thys also referred euery singuler christian behooueth pray euery particuler person may confesse christ boldely stowtely thys naughtie adulterous worlde necessarie vnderstand boldenesse gyuen v god shall prouoked pray oftentymes increase fayth cry apostle lorde increase fayth luke iohn thirdly require power working myracles may increased bycause god hath appoynted certayne publike seales testimonial apostle doctrine desyre may done name christ declare theyr care onely christes glorie thys place shyneth marueylous stoutenesse ardent zeale towardes christ primitiue church perceyued little mindes iewes incensed doctrine myracles apostle yet desyre apostle may haue boldenesse graunted giftes myracles increased little place doe gyue enimies furie though season yet men dayes wyll doer thinke best trade teaching pleaseth professed enymies truth seeke nothing ydlenesse peace worlde little nothing carefull increase christes kingdome men thinke minister feruent manye tymes also scarce luke warme seemeth chiefe cause christes kingdome little inlarged amongst v conclude luke sheweth effect ensued prayingthe prayer godly heard god heard prayer declared sensible signe saye moouing house signified presence god also wholesome effectes filled holye ghost say perceyued effectuall comfort holye ghost courage giuen feare daunger somewhat dismay whome ministerie gospell committed preached great constancie man might iudge rather kindled enflamed threat enimies made afrayde whereof shall sayde next sermon taught example psalm god neglecteth praiers godlye eye fixed vpon iust eares open vnto prayer let v follow example primitiue church dayes cruell enimies euerywhere conspire togither truth turning selues vnto god prayer let v commit whole cause vnto let v beseech increase fayth holye ghost ouercome daungers terror haue happily ended course life may receyued heauenly kingdome liue iesus christ whome prayse honour power glory euer amen xxxj homelie spake worde god boldly multitude beleeued one heart one soule neyther sayd ought thing possessed owne thing common great power gaue apostle witnesse resurrection lord iesu great grace neyther among lacked many possessours land house solde brought price thing solde layde downe apostle feete distribution made vnto euery man according neede io called apostle barnabas saye sonne consolation leuite countrie cyprus hauing lande solde layde price downe apostle feete luke euangelist hath diligently described first persecution raysed apostle reporteth diligentlye faithfull time whurly burleys ende learne doe like case first foremost gaue themselues vnto prayer powred god one feruent accorde minde god likewise must resort aduersities vaine helpe fleshe must aske thing serue carelesnesse ydlenesse fleshe concerne setting forth christ kingdome let v see exercise primitiue church wherby shall appeare intermitted nothing belonged dutie apostle constantly preach gospellfirst luke speaketh apostle office teaching committed sayth preached worde god confidence boldly freely whervnto little added great power gaue apostle witnesse resurrection lorde iesu accomplished therefore protested woulde doe contrarie decree counsayle luke maketh mention resurrection preached bicause thereby christ perfited fulfilled businesse redemption saluation shoulde thinke apostle yeelded anye thing saduceyes greatest authoritie without cause luke maketh mention doctrine first thing therevnto principall care must always regenerate doctrine church gathered togither without church cannot stande hir full strength vigour neyther without prompting holy ghost salomon tune past sayde prophecying fayleth people go hauock truly sayde example age abundantly testifye wherefore sayde church continued preaching doctrine apostle also testifieth apostle mindefull earnest office example minister admonished must suffer libertie preaching taken feare persecution threatning enimies daunger approcheth cease feede christes sheepe word doctrine comfort propertie hyrelings christ sayth iohn readie lay downe liues vnfearefull affiance minde attributed apostle necessary minister plaine bicause alwayes woulde haue brydled musseled iohn christ witnesseth worlde cannot abide light truth worlde cannot abide liberty bolde affiance preaching whereby bishoppes church may applie office season season ezech maye encourage others yet hope remayning deliuer owne soules bloude perishe required handes furthermore ministerie worde must directed edification profite next care must thing edified builded must fall downe againe shall performe none prosperously constantly resisteth truth doctrine assaulted craft tiranny enimies moste hazarde set defende city castelles vse bende bring al force place enimies stronglyest assault let whome lorde hath appoynted gouernors pastor congregation doe like neyther heard thinke thing ought suppressed spoken offende aduersaries preaching lord hath appointed v minister word maisters iudges vpon whose determination appointment doctrine must depende therfore boldnesse wicked dare take vppon prescribe holye spirite gouernour church doctrine secondlythe cogregation gyuen concord sheweth howe whole church giuen vnitie concorde multitude sayth one heart one soule meaning one minde ende whereof vndoubtedly none enlargement christes kingdome likenesse parilitie minde bringeth forth true friendship stable concorde haue marke set forth kingdome christ nothing desirous priuate lucre thing alone disturbeth friendship shall appeare singular worke holy ghost consider multitude beleeuers concorde consent euidently appeared fyue thousand person truly right marke token faithfull neuer without acknowledge one father heauen receyued one baptisme one bodie vnder christ head quickned one spirit christ cannot deuided among themselues therefore christ appointed thought giuen alone woulde haue serue vse necessitie others also whereby gather thinges common among willgoodes common wyll lawe lawe sort prouerbe sayth thing common among friendes place true fountaine christian beneuolence contribution declared say minde addict tyed desire rich iudgeth truly vse according paules saying vse rich worlde consisteth onely meate drinke clothing wherein howseroume also vnderstanded forasmuch borne naked worlde1 timo neyther shall carie thing hence v faithfull person vnderstandeth mannes nature suffised thing cannot drowned ouer great desire heaping rich togither iudgeth treasure consist although seeth multiplie increase psal math yet setteth whole hart vpon vnderstanding rather stewarde laboureth make friendes vniust mammon may receyue shall haue neede luke euerlasting habitation consideration hereof maketh goodes faythfull common vnto although keepe themselues right propertie maner order distributionthe maner order obserued thys distribution maketh declaration thys sense thereof luke sayth many possessours house landes solde brought price thing solde layde downe apostle feete distribution made euery man according neede first sayth house landes solde euery man dyd ne yet sell solde reserued nothing themselues dyuers example many house owne kept family paule onely permytted also may reade1 tim streightly commaunded therefore solde much seemed requisite present necessitie church euery man disposition eyther keepe sell owne shall hereafter appeare peter wordes ananias layde price money downe men take brought apostle whome thought good haue distribution thereof vntill deacon ordeyned publike consent congregation take office vpon actes neyther apostle publishe money brought vnto euery man might take therof lysted distribution made euery man according neede therefore disordinate communion goodes confusion thing vyolent vsurping men goodes phrenetyke seditious ymagine consider circumstaunces well shall easily appeare contribution ordeined ende church might haue publike treasure help serue poore neede compelled pouertie shrinke fayth christ bodye congregation part goodes eyther goodes owne able honest labour get lyuing haue consider ecclesiasticall goodes vsed beginning declared primitiue church rycher sort godly liberalitie gaue goodes church came passe dayes afterwarde number christian increased king prince others great wealth following example men inriched church college yearely reuenues tythes manye olde foundation testifye wylling goodes vsed true doctryne might conserued poore maintayned knewe chiefely commended christ church vse meete dayes also eyther obserued church beyng decayed restored wyll haue forme presydent primitiue church remayning may easilyer sighing seeke thys vse call agayne vngodlynesse come boldenesse many afrayde chalenge themselues thing tymes past auncestours liberalitie gaue whole congregation thys poynt haue seene reformation almost church dayes stoppe though bene sufficient haue taken monkes fryer administration church goodes rather haue restored agayne auncient right vse wherefore first ordeyned serued yea better leaue still filthie hypocrytes stumble stone ought according example primitiue church bestow owne good vpon congregation neede requyre must grieuously sinne gyuing nothing owne openly bereaue men haue gyuen hereof see commeth passe poore neglected minister rare selde religion decayeth fruite commoditie contributionbut let v see singuler fruite christian distribution whiche luke intermedleth discription maye hereby perceyue haue dayes trust easily neglect exercise thereof euangelist sheweth double commoditie ensuyng hereof first came passe none among lacked wherefore fulfilled lawe commaundeth shoulde bee begger israell deut seemeth nowe dayes impossible thing many consider multitude poore confuted example primatiue church reason seeme impossible liue rest peace seeing godlye brought passe midst enimies bloudthirstie citie able theyr owne goodes finde poore shall furnished helpe rich donation great treasure wherewith church tymes passed haue beene indowed thinke impossible v doe let meane obserued euery one may haue according neede shall perceyue shall holpen blessing lord liberalitie godly wyse shall find lacke herafter requyre difficult impossible bicause thing handled preposterously order haue least haue neede bestowed whose partes bene giue owne goodes church would consider daunger trouble discommoditie publikely priuately vseth ensue multitude beggers poore see commoditie christian contribution primitiue church receyued inestimable value one commoditie springeth great grace fauor accepted people also yet illuminated knowledge christ force liberalitie draweth enimyes woonder loue bicause lorde taketh bestowed giuen poore name vseth recompence rewarde shall fauour authoritie many men would consider one thing w marueyle hated enuyed professe gospell besides worlde hateth light truth god haue v exercised invred naughtinesse thereof stonie heartes neglect christian pouertie deserueth say nothing meane naughtinesse whereby hale v goodes church vnder colour refourming gospell christ greatly hindered empayred gayne honor god spirite bloweth pleaseth neyther must dispayre man health bycause profession trade lyfe cypriote looued faythfull ierusalem onely woulde bestowe shew phrenetike troublesome men herof would take occasion rashly condemne church wherein thing answereable perfection primitiue church wherfore would haue historie ananias sapphira folow teacheth v satan disciple name therefore must consider minde ananias math maye gather part historie wordes sapphira shall see wherein offended saye hypocrisie counterfeyting fayth loue wherwith went deceyue well god congregation ambicious man sawe prayse glorye io leuite gotten liberalitie wherefore desirous also extolled thought good doe lyke yet bicause couetous meaning prouide ne de afterwarde might ensue priuily withholdeth part price wiues necessity seeking yet accounted number giuen vnto church many thing annexed fault aggrauate heynousnesse thereof saye nothing ambicion couetousnesse tossed vnhappy minde hypocrite contrarie waues manifest distrustfull altogither voyde fayth beginning mischiefe distrusted promise christ math sayth alwayes helpe church abundantly prouide meate drink cloth promise beleeued woulde neyther haue feared penurie following craft haue made prouision time come distrust ioyned great contempt god dauid ascribeth hart say either psal god else perswade themselues regardeth becommeth men supposed doe men propertie hypocrite like durst thus haue done beleeued god bene beholder thought deedes beside committed sacriledge owne goodes woulde haue men beleeue giuen money receyued lande church thereby plainly confessed due church wherefore cannot auoide blotte sacriledge afterward giuen goodes reliefe church founde church treasurie money sacrylegall collusion whereby hee ment deceiue church ioyning himselfe church gaue liuing vnto full euill distrust vnbeliefe newe vice spring therof continually ananias president false christian meane professe christ shall neuer losse hinderance see christ hath set vp kingdome nation doubt continuance thereof consent agree present reformation well beware giuing counsayle may occasion losse church fayleth decayeth go serue two maisters saye christ worlde math christ himselfe sayth impossible yet men moste commonly haue greatest prayse wisedome modestie deede ananias whose heart right lorde although appeare benefites towards church kinde men beare swaye nowe dayes woulde god alone bare almost greater number beside doe good church waxe riche church goodes appropriate selues thing haue giuen followe example iudas iohn himselfe gaue nothing vnto christ vsed imbecill pilfer awaye giue content wickednesse betrayed christ also example may learne looke peter iudgement touching ananias factfurthermore dayes men place ghost pronounced peter apostle thereby may appeare maye iudge dayes worse ananias peter releuation spirite perceyued thys guyle howe great prayse euer ananias thinketh get subtiltie yet coulde beguyle peter spirite rue saying christ math nothing secret hal disclosed apostle cloketh fault espyed seuerely accuseth example taught minister must onely openly accuse manifest faultes also whatsoeuer wicked go secretly truth church christ propertie good capitayne resist open attemptes enimies also preuent disclose ambusshes lying wayte must minister worde fight wyth encouragement agaynst enterprise wicked peter wordes marueylous vehemencie saying ryseth certayne step ende ananias heynous fault might appeare first detecteth roote beginning euill saying ananias satan hath filled thine heart wordes declareth destitute beliefe plaine reprobate godly elect also tempted satan runneth vp downe alwaye seeking whome may deuoure much resist hym strong fayth fyll heartes state wicked sort fallen fayth wholy possessed satan place left holy ghost also admonished hypocrite many vse dissimulation religion bondemen satan christ teacheth v father lying thys argument prooueth phariseys iohn borne deuill vnto example iudas also may referred sayde satan entred gone hys rooted hypocrisie guyle christ apostle last supper iohn furthermore peter sheweth effect satan sayth ananias brought poynt lye vnto holye ghost may vnderstanded two maner wayes partly falsely fayned ledde holye ghost partly went beguyle church knewe hytherto many argument endued wyth holy ghost meaning argue impudent boldenesse hym declare howe farre men runne suffer satan haue power ouer mindes thirdly drawing nearer ananias fact accuseth withdrawne parte price lande therefore accuseth theft sacriledge shewed little may commyt owne goodes partaker ananias couetously conuert owne vse goodes knowe due poore else ryotously waste consume offende herein particulerly generall generall whyle manye conuert church goodes called prophane v poore meane season onely pyning away hunger also church lying desolate want faythfull fitte teacher offende also priuately glorie god hath appoynted v stewardes goodes meane whyle eyther make hauock neglecting poore else hoorde vp home neyther profite v others yet menne commonly complaine mulitude beggers though impossible helpe reprooued lying prodigalitie maintayne haue good ynough rust money insatiable greedinesse lay vp looke vpon cofers abundance apparell rather suffer mothes eate wyll gyue money might make selling vnto poore iames sayth shall one day feele damnation increased verie thinges wherevnto haue bene much giuen addicted ananias haue nothing excuse hymselfe peter sheweth forced necessitie doe wickedly saying pertayned thy lande thy selfe onely solde thyne owne power thou mightest eyther haue solde thy lande else haue kept money therof thy selfe man would haue thought thee euer lesse worthy company christian whereby may euydently gathered man compelled lawe sell hys goodes free voluntary contrubution declared former sermon yet peter leaueth sheweth heynousnesse thys offence great christian man shoulde haue thought thing much lesse haue done sayth hast thou conceyued thing thy heart christ requyreth great sinceritie vprightnesse onely haue maners outwarde conuersation pure also mindes cogitation voyde dissimulation last rehearseth chiefe matter thou hast lyed men vnto god thou hast doe men onely also god searcheth harte reynes thou shalt perceyue reuenger thy wickednesse let v marke thinges howe take vnder pretence fayth religion go deceyue menne amongst whome ananias chiefe haulting side professe christes religion although kingdome christ fayle fall vpon earth prouyde themselues well ynough next vnto lyke vnto iudas robbe christ church eyther craft open force length betraye kisse whervnto may ioyned ieroboamyshe prince vse religion establishe tyranny whyle prescribe article fayth thrust rytes religion knowe commaunded god worde depende vpon meere tradition men seeke none thing keepe men awe obedience ouer whome raigne reade ieroboam dyd1 reg first author tyranny among israelite many vnder cloke gospell christian fayth seeke lyue licentiouslye lyke vnto whereof dayes great number easie matter eyther beguyle men else put silence shall bewray hypocrisie bycause lye vnto men onely also god hymselfe psalme prou apoca shall neuer escape vnpunished nothing hidden hym vseth hate abhor e lyers others christ testifyeth shall shutte kingdome would thinke honest man would suffer beguyled vnder pretence name therefore folly madnesse imagine god one truth selfe punishment ananias returne history doth ananias fact seeme horrible thing peter onely nay horrible god iudgement successe thereof declareth soone heard wordes ended lyfe sodaine death casting great feare miserable ende heard whereof speake hereafter shall entreate like destruction sapphira wife first haue consider efficacie god worde god haue perfourmed though vttered man strength thereof dependeth man authoritie standeth selfe thys vnderstanded well promise threates conteyned scripture whatsoeuer preacher promise faythfull seruaunts god shall well fulfilled god heauen would thunder whatsoeuer threaten vnto wicked prophane contempners god shall vndoubtedly fall vpon worde christ witnesseth sayth math iohn whatsoeuer minister binde loose earth shall bounde loosed heauen let man obiect vnto god alwayes vseth present execution iudgements see although wicked take occasion hereby mock make light maner threates yet shall buye carelesnesse full deare shall voyce chryst iudge whome shall able abyde let v rather acknowledge long suffering god therfore sometimes differreth punishment giue v time repent sometimes againe sheweth example iudgement declare truth authoritie worde furthermore considered peter slayeth ananias worde pronouncing god iudgement whervnto vnlike paule strake elymas sorcerer blinde shall see xiij chapiter thing might seeme haue beene vns emely ministerie lyfe saluation committed vnto apostle deserue maner reprehension whome amongst giftes holy ghost paule teacheth efficacie power giuen effectuall power perfourming thing spake1 cor also right authoritie sworde prooued magistrate hath punishe malefactours peter paule may excused vsed gift gyuen god agaynst ananias elymas sorcerer reason shall accuse magistrate lykewise hath authoritie sworde committed god rom thinketh needeth long disputation agaynst matter religion haue authoritie sworde altogyther cease though graunt man ought violently compelled fayth gift god yet magistrate duetie sworde keepe vnder blasphemer deceyuers false teacher least lacke punishment doe speake agayns glorie god publike tranquilitie see aw leuit deut neyther seemeth peter thys present place paule afterwarde haue sought thing defence religion primis let v beare minde chiefe poynt hystorie frayde horrible example ananias let v flye dissimulation let v worship god spirite truth cleaue iesus christ mindes burning godly fayth whome prayse honour power glory euer amen xxxiij homelie came passe space three houres wyfe came ignorant done peter sayd vnto hir tell solde ye lande much shee sayde yea much peter saide vnto hir haue yee agreed togither tempt spirite lorde beholde feete haue buryed thy husbande dore shall carie thee fell downe streyte waye feete yeelded vp ghost yong men came founde hir deade caryed hir buryed hir hir husbande bycause sauiour iesus christ ignoraunt would alwayes false brother hypocrite church would author great offence would therefore beginning springth church haue terrible example shewed agaynst whereby myght learne shoulde looke trust haue seene first part hereof ananias condition hypocrytes trimly expressed men destitute true fayth thing fountaine beginning euill hereof commeth passe wickedly mocke despise well god church herevnto maye adde incurable obstinacie accomplishment vice wherby commeth passe man may easilier conuert open synners haue purposed theyr minde deceyue congregation hypocrisie dissimulation thing shall appeare plainely consyder part thys storie contayneth dolorous lamentable ende sapphira within three houres knowing hir husbandes death came vnto peter faythfull luke reporteth commonly commeth passe knowe thing last behooued v first knowe bicause menne vse rather absence disclose faultes reprooue v face also affection loue worketh godly vnwyllingly bring tydings anye thing may giue occasion griefe neighbour seemeth cause sapphira yet knewe death hir husband ende may receyue vtilitie consideration thys hystorie first speake question wherewith peter beginneth hir ouer bolde confidence sapphira last punishment wherewith god reuenged hir peter demaunde neyther light superfluous thereby sapphiras impietie appeare playner peter reprooueth sapphiras naughtinesse otherwise might eyther haue seemed ignoraunt hir husbandes craft else haue bene induced hys authoritie haue dissembled therefore peter requireth hir reason saying tell solde lande much furthermore successe matter declareth peter nothing priuate affection instinct holy ghost behooueth v marke order god vseth punishing wicked incurable naughtinesse sapphira could hidden neyther coulde man haue letted haue punished woulde haue time repentaunce graunted hir hir minde tryed stirred vp straunge demaunde least might seeme ouer hastie anye man seueritie example god long sufferaunce euerywhere extant well ware vsing crueltie guiltie tyrannes doe haue vnderstande offence haue prouoked wrath punishment agaynst themselues thus read first parent gene gaue liued beginning worlde hundred twentie yeares space wherein repent also vouchsafe sende noah gene peter gene preacher righteousnesse likewise would destroy chanaanites amorrhites vntill saw filled measure iniquitie become alltogither incurable neede example seeing haue plentie holy prophane hystories let passe thing whereof wee see experience daylie others selues let v rather apply matter instruction first let v abuse long suffering god prouoketh v repentaunce let v therefore like reprobate procure vnto v wrath god rom contynuing synne without repentaunce waxe euery day woorse woorse god slacke punishing slacknesse heathen haue vsed saye recompenceth weight heauinesse punishment also let v followe goodnesse god valerius maximus booke chap hastie iudgement although appeare haue deserued punishment god euery desyreth saluation rather destruction men boldnesse pray ryue ouercome god iustice rigour seueritie thing haue chiefely consider haue receiued power authoritie god punishe least seueritie hastinesse iudgement bring bodyes soules ieopardie whose saluation shoulde principallye seeke let v harcken sapphira boldly lyeth without shame feare god doth simply affirme thing vsing signe contestation confirmeth h knew false euery man libertie giue seemed good lyke hytherto man required giue account congregation receyued layde forth therefore sapphira haue thought without mysterie question mooued especially knowing hir selfe guiltie without care boldly dareth lye prooueth strong argument altogither incurable goodnesse may man hope shame banished wherewith honest nature bridle kept dutie meane season sapphira expresseth confident audacitie peculiar propertie hypocrite whome feare haue minded beguyle god afrayde sight wherefore scripture many example prooueth nothing bolde confident hypocrisie open sinner part fall downe first worde god speaketh afrayde come sight hypocrite dare euen vaunte integritie perfection feele conscience wounded layd open iudgement god caine sheweth v example thing asked abel brother durst malapertly answere god say hath made brother keeper gene prophete hypocrytes expostulate god wayward saye wherefore fast hou seest v wee put liues straightnesse esay thou regardest v againe lost labour serue god profite haue keeping commaundementes walking humbly lorde hostes malach shall saye iudas traytour knewe christ ignoraunt wickednesse perceiued grieuously rebuked reprehended yet apostle dare aske christ whether suspect great offence math sapphiras confidence great considering many example declared apostle inspired holy ghost profitable marke well thinges boldenesse temeritie hypocrite beguile v wicked saying put v ananias sapphira tempted spirite lordebut let v returne vnto peter inspiration holy spirite vnderstandeth fraude guyle suffreth himselfe mooued womanish hypocriticall boldenesse pronounceth sentence god spirite put minde agaynst hir consisteth two partes first accuseth reprooueth hir sinne god punisheth person first conuict sinne may vnderstande wherefore punished howe commeth passe haue agreed togither tempt spirite lorde amplifyeth boldenesse heynousnesse fact admiration interrogation sayth haue conspired togither tempt spirite lorde man woulde haue asked ananias sapphira beleeue woulde haue earnestly denyed meaning maketh matter iudgement haue sinnes examined rule god lawe bicause two maried folke went beguyle congregation whome spirite god resident reigneth cannot denied wicked temeritie tempted spirite god therefore hypocriticall wilynesse sinned lawe deuter forbiddeth tempt god lymed fault go dayes beguyle church christ counterfayting fayth holynesse also shall well find god let go vnpunished tempting least sapphira might excused authoritie commaundement hir husbandeconsent synne deseru th punishment peter first accuseth consent betweene argument taketh hir excuse learne man must consent euill men escape iudgement god haue authoritie ouer v giuen god man power giuen ouer wife sayde eue thy lust shall pertay e thy husbande gene ephe colod hee shall haue rule ouer thee apostle commaunde wiues obedient vnto husbandes sapphira blamed onely consented hir husbande craftily withhelde part money woulde seeme haue giuen church therfore sinne committed lawes god excused authoritie commaundement man bicause must obeye god rather man peter sayde shall repeated agayne chapter nowe lawfull consent sin e haue power ouer v ordinaunce god become allowe defende onely consent minde vnlawfull company publike prayse wickednesse whose companie maye altogither forbeare yea lawes god ought forbeare say nothing companion traueyle daungers helpe forwarde mischieuousnesse part god sentence pronounced peter punishment sapphira ananias conteyneth punishment sapphira hir husbande beholde sayeth feete buried thy husbande bee ready doore carye thee fell downe deade peter feete caried forth buried hir husbande tenour god iustice commit like fault punished like punishment testifieth prophete saying punishe thing auenged people ierem hereof ought generall rule taken must extende sinnes wickednesse time past reuenged seuerely oppression poore vniust violence tyrannie vsurie slaughter adulterie whoredome like punishe v day except repent commeth christian yet chiefe ende meaning place learne remayneth vnder pretence christ seeke owne lucre dare deceyue church seemeth sometimes worlde laugheth vpon felicitie stable long enioye goodes wrongfully gotten iob gladnesse vngodly quickly ended ioy hypocrite continueth twinkling eye haue also example hereof iudas traytor thought best prouided owne behoofe seemed haue bene high fauour bishop feeleth himselfe seueritie god iustice driueth halter coulde long enioye neyther lyfe money dearer lyfe god graunt number dayes taste lyke punishment vnder colour gospell haue sought nothing else spoyle possession church good haue seene men turned againe monkes bishop haue founde helpe succour goodes layde vp vse defende church force agaynst open enimies religion better successe let looke commit lyke offence ananias sapphira deserued sodeyne death luke writeth tooke nothing church deceytfully put aside withhelde part owne good deathes mischiefes doe deserue dare ryfle church open force publike authoritie let v thing acknowledge power iesus christ alwayes doth vouchsafe mercifull church suffer hir beguiled worthily punish hir professed enimies persecutor also hypocrite deceyuers synceritie true religion may preserued prayse honor power glorye euer amen xxxiiij homelie great feare came congregation many hearde handes apostle many signes wonder shewed among people togither one accorde salomon porch durst man ioyne himselfe neuerthelesse people magnified number beleeued lord men woman grewe much brought sicke streetes layde beddes couch hat least waye shadowe peter came might shadowe came also multitude city rounde vnto ierusalem bringing sicke folkes vexed vncleane spirites healed euery one wee haue hearde horrible example goddes iudgement whereby ananias wife sapphira punished sodeyne death falsly counterfeyted fayth christ al went beguyle churche goodes giuen reliefe poore example teacheth v great seueritie god punishing hypocrytes cannot deceyued grieuouslye offended go beguyle haue seene also feruent desire primitiue church conserue mainteyne discipline least eyther dissembler open malefactor shoulde creepe cause fayth christ eyther defamed suspected thintent posteritie myght enflamed followe present place followeth rehearseth manye singuler fruites example whereto adioyned traueyles exercise primitiue church thintent maye learne haue dayes doe desire haue kingdome god enlarged christ fauourable vnto v first luke sayeth great feare came congregation manye hearde thinges discipline keepeth good bad duty christian feared well straungers whome report thing came vnprofitable feare godlye aware traueyled earnestly god affayres enimies durst doe lesse church sawe spirite god manifestlye chiefe fruite ecclesiasticall discipline keepeth godly dutie feareth vngodly dayes bicause men may doe church disordered licentiousnesse lyfethe vse iudgementes god become praye enimies must also learne vse god iudgementes consisteth learne god iustice afrayde amende liues godly consideration thereof god taught v vse shewed abraham horrible destruction sodome saying knowe commaund housholde child keepe way lord doe right conscience gene cause woulde e presidentes iudgementes shoulde recorded writing reade church priuately apertly asaph testifieth thus writeth made couenant iacob gaue israel law commaunded forefather teache child psalm posteritie might knowe child yet vnborne intent grew vp might shew child might put trust god forget woorkes god keepe commaundementes forefather c therefore vse god iudgement whereby ananias sapphiras dissimulation punished must also dayes retained may conceyue true feare god take heede hypocrisie worship god spirite truth christ hath commaunded v yea let men excited example applye vnto themselues whatsoeuer hystories written kinde mennes example maye learne haue doe meane auoyde wrath god secondlye sayde apostlesthe racles apostle ministerie many signes woonders shewed among people wherby appeareth prayer faythfull hearde also behalfe besought god apostle might endued myracles authoritie whereof might holpen setting forth kingdome christ worke common myracles power extended farre diseased layde streete desire shadowe peter pa sing thinke helpe nowe beginneth saying christ fulfilled beleeueth mee woorkes doe shall doe greater shall doe second fruit ecclesiasticall discipline god heareth prayer church prouer encreaseth gift spirite contrarily abhorreth prayer stop eares lawe appeareth history euidently declare rarer giftes holy ghost working myracles began cease discipline beganne waxe dissolute corruption maners encreased yet let man thinke superstition defended written peter shadowe shall afterwarde heare paules handkerchefe vse thus reason place peter shadow helped many much shall rayment bone herof springeth confused chaos superstition see pilgrimage saint reliques wherof part counterfeyted say myracles wrought testifie eyther peter paules power confirme preaching gospell whereof minister therefore serue commende set forth gospell sende men vnto christ vaine superstition hath hitherto entangled trifle profite furthermore may firmely reason peter wordes heard thirde chapter regarde god vertue godlynesse garmentes mannes bodye yea vertue godlynesse saint auayled nothing working myracles therfore much lesse ought ascribed garmentes bone adde argument place sayd luke power went christ himselfe cote superstition quickly fall consider ende marke wherto myracles referred directed two sortes first math mark behooued doctrine apostle shoulde confirmed christ himselfe teacheth wherevpon gather beleeued nowe dayes neede newe myracles minister preache doctrine apostle doctrine hath long sithence bene prooued confirmed miracle teach doctrine agreable ought receyued though worke neuer many myracles forasmuch myracles permitted false antichristian teacher thende fayth elect maye appeare manifest euident see deuter math thess ende vse myracles teach knowledge iesus christ whose name wrought apostle apostolike men diuers diseased sickness infirmity christes name healed demoniackes whome naughtie spirite satan haunt therefore let v acknowledge iesus christ hee sayeth prophete hath borne disease infirmity healeth onely body also soules borne againe spirite word phil receiue fresh strength able thing comfort deliuereth v tyranny satan therfore came world iohn saith1 iohn destroy workes deuill first promise saluation teacheth v gene power merite serpentes heade must troden downe done alredy himselfe partly teacheth gospell partly myracles wrought name abundantly testifie luke sayth healed name christ brought vnto apostle healed wherevpon gather vniuersall sauiour calleth men vnto labour laden math iohn euen excludeth none come vnto adioyneth apostle myracles publike exercise whole churchthe exercise primitiue church sayth continued one accorde salomon porch vnderstanded holy assembly appeareth ende seconde chapter mention made house brake breade euangelist place meaneth none thing faythfull speciall care come vnto church vnited togither much body myndes fayth charitie wherein shewe v example christian stoutnesse constancie ignorant threates decree counsell woulde yet refrayne commyng among congregation howbeit woulde haue sufficed mannes wisedome haue kept fayth myndes haue commoned christ faythfull brother wythin priuate house dayes many excuse dastardlynesse reason wherby account confession christ amongest indifferent thinges suffer prince decree lawes wring wrest yea thought poynt prudencie tyme daunger dissemble fayth intermit comming church sacrament eyther vtterly meddle article controuersie else make shypmans hose else wholye denye fayth yll ende success wisedome hath church findeth without great griefe destruction manye doe muche better haue learned christ wordes confession seperated faith heart beleeue vnto righteousnesse mouth confession made vnto saluation rom christes saying whosoeuer shall ashamed wordes adulterous sinfull generation also shall sonne man ashamed marc commeth glory father holy aungels let v consider without cause mention often made comming church hereof gather church meanes stande wythout assembly bicause publike prayer christ hath commended v without peculiar promyse also preuent false teacher whose propertie paule wryteth go house bring bondage woman laden sinne lye open craftynesse2 tim man shoulde take occasion trouble breake necessary order christ himselfe neuer shunned comming church taught therein openly argument prooueth iob ought taken neyther schismatike false teacher cause seemeth first beleeuers abhorred iewes temple bicause commodious place citie anabaptistes confuted example fanaticall broode kinde seditious people thinke vnlawfull come within church congregation haue great warynesse polluted notwithstanding seemeth trifle make schisme church christ horrible detestable crime let v returne disciplinethe maiestie vnfayned christian exercise primitiue church amongst thirde place conteined certaine maiestie made enimies afrayde people reuerence luke sayth durst man ioyne himselfe vnto people magnified vnderstanded vtter godlesse voyde religion yet ledde carke care worlde fleshe seene horrible vnhappie ende ananias sapphira afrayde ioine themselues company punished hypocrisie seuerely conscience well knowing owne imperfection therfore societie company church thence forth purer perhaps first many ananias craftily crept yet men meane season good opinion published theyr prayses abroad bicause sawe certayne kinde heauenly aungelike lyfe shine diuers lyke example maye reade hystories vnder traian emperour plinius yong r epystles tertullian hys apologie ye christian whome eusebius cyteth iii booke history cha christian lyfe vnblameable intended persecute intreatie plinius secundus one iudges let alone medled thys place teacheth v two thing worthy obserued first church consisteth onely faythfull person true christian lying hypocrite haue place therein christ king truth testifyed pylate abyde suffer lyers hypocrite gospell sayth shall put maryage come without wedding garment place math adiudgeth eternall damnation fearefull vnbeleeuing abhominable adoc murtherers whoremonger sorcerer idolators secondly learne getteth christian authoritie fauour men verilye aunswere vocation math lyue lyfe aunswerable name christ whereby god heauenly father may glorifyed god sayde vnto heli priest prophete shall alwayes stand firme ratified1 sam worship worship despise shall come shame thing would diligently consyder easily appeare howe commeth passe name gospell dayes euerywhere enuyed professours thereof part hated slaundered vnbrideled dissolute lyfe deserueth whereby vnder pretence gospell burst vngodlynesse would seeme holyer others doe passe almost lycentious lyuing let v amende thing shall quickly prooue church shall reuerenced agayne woontthe church encreased persecution fourthly sayth daylie added church newe christian well men woman indued true fayth moued thervnto holy ghost thys teacheth v vaine attemptes christes enimyes seeing supremacy citie ierusalem able hynder growth church nowe springing christ sayth winde bloweth iohn subiect man pleasure appointment dyuers example teach v church tyme persecution alwaye increased rather diminished propertie christ beare rule middest enimies psal let man therefore feared manaces wicked enimies though power ouerthrowe church buylt vpon christ whome gate hell cannot preuayle math kingdome christ spreadeth neare vnto ierusalembesides kingdome christ beginneth spreade abroad city nigh adioyning fame myracles caried fro caused great manye bring sicke demoniake people ierusalem occasion came knowledge christ chiefe vse place make v dayes vnderstande meanes christes kingdome may enlarged wherein vnder cloke gospell follow carnall wisedome haue yet subdued obedyence faith take dyuers consultation thinke best faythfull serue time graunt many thing winke vntill worlde maye looke countenaunce mindes waxe calmer hate truth agayne turning carnall defence thinke good confederacie fight bring matter passe successe thing prooueth sortes farre wyde deceyued god businesse brought passe none power strength zach neyther thorow hoste men neyther thorow strength thorowe spirite lorde sayth prophet agayne saue lord god saue bow sword battayle horse horseman c know deede sometime vseth ministerie prince men warre example machabees constantine theodosius doe testifie euen moderateth matter power spirite sheweth selfe middle thinges hath onely preheminencie therefore let many consult haue church mainteyned kingdome christ aduaunced regarde onely go bring matter passe man counsell defence god worke longer therefore let v continue exercise primitiue church luke hitherto hath rehearsed let teacher constantly preach doctrine truth suffer themselues plucked considering hath bene confirmed many myracles let taken christian earnestly harken let ioyne contynuall prayer studye worde much without god secrete working nothing brought passe let authoritie ecclesiasticall discipline force neyther hypocrite open naughtie packes may haue place church let studie loue liberalitie towarde poore raigne amongst v household fayth couetousnesse gased like publike stage beggerie bycause thinges nowe dayes onely neglected also peruerted marueyle see little fruite doctrine gospell let v therefore settle selues herevnto harte lorde sauiour iesus christ wyll helpe study endeuoures whome praise honor glory power euer amen xxxv homelie chiefe priest rose vp sect sadduceyes full indignation layde handes apostle put common prison aungell lorde night opened prison doores brought forth saide goe stande speake temple people wordes life heard entred temple early morning taught oracle dauid king prophet psal saying christ reigne middest hys enimies verye wonderfull hereof gather christ shall rule thys worlde yet shall neuer want shall go aboute subuert ouerthrowe kingdome example hereof may euerye see scripture ecclesiasticall hystoryes manifestlye others seene thys present booke report apostle actes description primitiue church luke alwayes ioyneth two thinges togyther say successe christes kingdome furious rage vngodly thinges serue ende neyther offended crosse aduersitie whereof christ often tymes hath gyuen v warning neyther hope anye contynuall peace tranquillitie church thys worlde euen prepare selues crosse church seemeth safetie wherevnto thys present hystorie chiefely referred luke little setteth forth vnto v flowrishing state church shewing v thoritie grewe increased day day much citie ierusalem nowe little conteyne kingdome christ bicause began caryed abroad among straunge nation among many prosperous proceeding foloweth grieuous persecution great daunger bicause christ gaue enimies power layde handes apostle put prison thinking also put vnto death yet thing serue comfort v feare v bicause lorde presently helped apostle daunger glorie name maye receaue vtilitie profite hereby first must consider enimies christ apostle howe lorde elude frustrate enterprise last declare apostle delyuered perill enymies persecutours church luke wryteth diligently enimies persecutours church enterprise sayth high priest rose vp agaynst apostle alone complyces fellowes nearest friendes familiar sayth sadduceyes secte may perceaue corruption raigned nowe among iewes supreame heades church whome resurrection dead chiefe article fayth religion seemed game pastime1 cor haue often tymes declared surely bene vtterly voyde religion eyther sinceritie apostle doctrine reuerente maiestie congregation wonderfull worthynesse myracles great concursse sortes people kingdome christ might haue mooued lesse haue raged luke declareth also incensed sayth full zeale enuie indignation could abyde prise estimation whose doctrine theyr honor aduauntage defaced yet doubt made zeale god publike commoditie people pretence priuate affection reade caiaphas complyces wherevnto came zeale farre layde hand apostle commaunded common gayle breaker publike peace open malefactours thing must applyed time also bicause manifest al thing written sake may haue enstruction rom comfort thereby first example teacheth v alwayes like greatest persecutor christes truthfrom companie priestes come greatest enimies truth truely glorie tytle priesthoode taken chiefe heades church ought chiefely maintaine preach truth soone vnder pretence religion beginne seeke owne gayne lucre neyther beleue themselues yet suffer light truth whose brightnesse discloseth naughtinesse deceit parte sadduceis yea hogges epicure hearde vnlesse thought thinges written scripture touching heauen hell immortalitie soules resurrection deade vaine fable woulde neuer neyther wickedly corrupte scripture tradition yet impudently turne relygion priuate lucre aduantage1 thes therefore christ apostle shewe v antichrist place sea1 iohn euen church might perceyue whence daunger looked feared well marke tymes shall appeare onely haue bene enimies doctrine gospell kingdome christ heretofore haue bene thought chiefe heades church euident matter attempted prince king done sake procurement instigation thing offendeth many day make thinke doctrine church truth bycause pope byshoppes enimies thereto great folly offended hath bene vsuall common thing since worlde beganne whers hath bene declared must diligently consider wyth craftthe craft enimies truth weapon men fight first noted howe egregiouslye counterfaite zeale god whose glorie lament troden vnder foote church daungerously deuided corrupt zeale see caiaphas whome confession truth christ vttered seemed blasphemous intollerable nothing seemeth impious intollerable heades tasteth truth gospell repugnant proude tyrannye aduauntage appeareth euen place ought haue better iudgement zeale enimies bicause bishop iewes coulde beare madde errours saduceyes woulde helpe bring downe christ men beare wicked sale marte holye thing condemned pope owne canon scorcing god doctrine horrible periurye whoredome kinde vnbridled lyuing thing pertaine vaineglory aduauntage might left alone vntouched graunt deede haue zeale glory god yet excused lyke vnto iewes rom paule sayth zeale god yet voyde knowledge truth god haue v followe owne zeale woorde cause hath witsafed reueale age intent man followe suggestion fleshe wisedome man maner zeale men may iudged successe thing stewardes worde god ought argumentes scripture haue brought erred waye haue conuinced gaynesayers men hauing forgotten dutie turne vnto force shut common prison yet conuicted fault crime christ layde charge came armed swordes clubbes luke take dayly hearde teaching temple ought haue bene conuinced iohn taught thing repugnaunt god truth naye vsed open force euen counsell suffer high priestes seruaunt strike christ cheeke without check history declare howe haue fought many yeares weapon agaynst doctrine truth neyther neede heape many example togither bicause one fact counsell constance sufficient heades romaine church commytted agaynst holy martyr christ iohn husse whome neyther safe conduyct neyther emperours maiestie neyther lawe armes neyther intreatie godlye threates bohemian coulde deliuer bloudy handes maisters bishop dayes vse argumentes often teacher truth arme prince teache thinke notable defender church persecute true church christ fire sworde speake nothing meane season saye examination hearing matter appertaine nothing prince hale martyr christ execution without hearing cause first cutting tongue bicause shall declare fayth cause death people looking howe farre men passe tyrannie iewishe bishop much grieuous shall punishment christ hath ordeyned whose kingdome oppressed force man god disappoynteth enimies purpose delyuereth hysthis doth part storie declare wherein shewed lord meane whyle myght seeme haue cast care church suffered enimies long neyther sleepeth forsaketh daunger sake aungell lorde came neyther feared authoritie priestes yet lawe breaking prison openeth doores bringeth apostle commaundeth returne temple preach wordes lyfe saye gospell iesus christ whome lyfe thinges teache v howe god hath care worde cannot bounde although minister lye bounde prison breath god breatheth subiect iudgement worlde paule sayth lyeth bounde worde god cannot bounde let man therefore offended imprisonment minister goddes worde2 timo death seeing setting forth worde dependeth v pleasure power god shall good diligently consider maner ende deliuery angel minister keeper electin deliuery chiefely obserued god would haue prison doores opened ministerie aungell myght many wayes haue brought passe god woulde waye testifie declare great dignitie elect whereas onely inferiour earthly creature also heauenly spirites aungels appoynted doe seruice taught manye place scripture gather generall rule hereof paule verily teacheth v aungels ministering spirites sent seruice shall heyres saluation hebr saying dauid well knowen aungell lorde tarieth rounde feare deliuereth psal malignaunt tempter expoundeth christ referred euery one member whome god hath commended charge custodie aungels shoulde dashe foote agaynst stone psal wanteth example haue bene holpen visible ministerie aungelles loth deliuered burning sodome aungelles iacob eeth hoste aungelles gene gene reg daniel perceyueth himselfe safetie ayde succour whole army aungels deliuer elizeus handes assirians daniel confesseth aungell lorde shutte mouthes lyon coulde doe hurt dan aungell many day faithfully serued thobias sonne visible shape likenesse aungell smiteth first borne egyptian guideth people israel wildernesse appeareth ezechias deliuered siege assirians helpe aungell esay example lyke rehearsed thende also shoulde require ministerie aungels visible wyse shoulde doubt ayde helpe although appeare v manye time finde true deliuered secrete daungers escape vnknown ieoperdies without counsell helpe man let v therefore acknowledge dignitie nature condicion wherein set benefite god grace let serue comfort despayre aduersitie instruction offend impure naughty life aungels driue v holy necessary succor defence furthermore aungell sheweth ende deliueredthe ende deliuerye saith apostle brought prison go stand speake temple wordes lyfe people appoynteth therefore returne execution office charge christ put co mmaundeth vttermost power set forth kingdome christ whose ayde helpe nowe presently prooued psal agreeth goddes commaundement place deliuered distresse shoulde glorifie spoken onely apostle appertayneth indifferently men god haue men diligently applye vocation deliuered daunger returne therevnto feruencie longer haue intermitted therefore offence grieuous deliuered sickenesse pouertie kinde calamitie giue themselues vnto vice naughtynesse pollute name god impuritie lyfe seeme vnto bee lyke souldiours sent take christ cast grounde secrete power yet permitted ryse agayne layde handes bounde offence much lesse haue twyse bene daunger name christ though nowe done dutie shunne daungers may ensue auoyde trouble maye betyde v christes sake yet offende grieuously keepe themselues daunger feare denye truth shoulde paules example finish race course power appoynt selues ende labour traueyle must abide pleasure lorde although deferre helpe season abac yet fayle firmely constantly trust meete kingdome christ hauing set hande plough looketh backe agayne luc math shall safe continueth ende chiefely notedthe gospell worde lyfe aungell calleth gospell iesus christ worde life adourned diuers name scripture called worde grace bicause declareth grace god giuen v christ paule
