giueth v thinges necessarye lyfe haue forgiuenesse sinnes satisfaction righteousnesse sanctification pryce redemption whatsoeuer lyke worde doth onely regenerate v sonnes god fayth also giueth v nowe regenerated spirite adoption whome crye abba father rom ephe infallible pledge saluation cause doctrine gospell excelleth wisedome world bicause guide eternall lyfe professours science cannot safely promise v safety present life therfore truly compared precious pearle incomparable treasure whose cause men desire true saluation ought willingly lose bestowe goodes agayne bicause christes sake lyfe saluation gospell adourned singuler title doctrine ought reputed deadly pestiferous obscure merite christ pull mennes mindes fayth doctrine whosoeuer professe theeues murtherers robbe christ glorye also steede worde lyfe giue vnto simple follower thereof deadly poyson mannes tradition let v returne apostle luke writeth obeyed aungelles commaundementthe apostle obey aungell morning went church seemeth good owne sight num fulfill commaundement greater hurtfull plague take fleshe counsell god hath expressed playne commaundement thing example saule others abundantly declare paule many time witnesseth obedience fayth marke ende preaching gospel2 cor rom therfore whosoeuer cast obedience away harken counsailes flesh surely glorie vaine gospell fayth christ wherefore let v applye example opened found man within chiefe priest ruler temple high priestes hearde thing doubted wherevnto woulde growe came one shewed beholde men put prison stande temple teache people went ruler temple minister brought without violence feared people least shoulde haue bene stoned king holy prophete dauid purposed describe kingdome redeemer sauiour iesus christ taking beginning furious attemptes sunder cast awaye cordes v dwelleth heauen shall laugh scorne lorde shall haue derision shall hee speake vnto wrath vexe sore displeasure whereby taught attemptes christes enimies vayne also saluation men must needes imbrace desyrous saluation way meane consisteth two pointes say repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes written christ onely author repentaunce conuersion turning whole man vnto god hath manye time already beene declared conuersion vnto god necessarie men bicause sinne haue gone astray daylie swarue waye saluation worke man power strength taught onely scripture also daylie experience man conuerted except conuerted god see ieremie lamentation conuersion christ onely worketh truely v make v newe men seede worde spirite regeneration illuminating v knowledge god enduing v new holy gyuing v strength doe owne power neuer able doe confuted hearing repentaunce required thinke merite owne righteousnesse confirmed extoll power free glorie owne wyll christ author conuersion v praye shall merite repentaunce able repent except christ spirite stirre v vp leade v thereto although man conuerted vnto god yet herein saluation perfite full sinner haue neede also forgiuenesse satisfaction nothing want satisfie god iustice sayde euen coulde conuert vnto god vnlesse regenerated christ math luke much lesse satisfy sinnes christ teacheth v sinnes debt able pay wherefore first part christ succoureth infirmitie also helpeth v merite death purgeth debt sinne maketh v iust sight god whyle bestoweth v beleeue iustice therfore became sinne v meanes righteousnesse cor god allowed bicause thing without man saued come benefite christ onely strongly gather hereof without christ haue saluation cause comprehending summe gospell fewe wordes teacheth repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes luc must preached name meane whyle learne also much erre vnder pretence christ seeke lyue lycentiously thinke cause occasion dissolute conuersation verie onely author true healthfull repentaunce furthermore confirme preaching christ testimony saythe apostle holy ghost witness gospell witness wordes also holy ghost god hath giuen obey let man thinke rashlye insolently done apostle alleage owne testimonie whome accused christ appointed witness dooings iohn actes might refuse doe dutie behalfe hereby doctrine greatly authorised man meanes ought denie except accuse christ falsehoode bicause apostle ignoraunt testimonie little weight priestes adde testimonie also witte testimonie holy ghost holy ghost god giueth vnto obedient vnto christ although beleeuing feele testimonie within mindes assertayned saluation yet chiefely wordes vnderstanded giftes operation holy spirite whereby bare wytnesse primitiue church doctrine gospell power holy ghost came passe faythfull spake newe tongue sodainely became newe men wrought myracles thing neede dayes much apostle doctrine sufficiently prooued testimonie holy ghost ought suffise v whereby feele mind confirmed whose encouragement crye abba father negligently passed ouer sayth holy ghost gyuen vnto obey christ yet must needes endued holye ghost bycause without hym neyther could beleeue obey gift e spirite augmented increased chryst sayth euery one hath shall gyuen whereof gather agayne math cannot haue holye ghost striue agaynst christ confesseth holy ghost thing worlde receaue iohn hereby appeareth operation giftes holy ghost rare seldome dayes thys cause verily bicause fewe endeuour obey christ becommeth v example stirred vp holy obedyence fayth indued holy spirite may go forwarde goodnesse atteyne saluation iesus christ whome honour prayse power glory euer amen xxxviij homelie heard claue sunder sought meanes slay stoode vp one counsell pharisey named gamaliel doctour lawe reputation among people commaunded apostle go side little space sayde vnto ye men israel take heede selues ye intende doe dayes rose vp one theudas bosting himselfe resorted number men foure hundred slayne beleeued scattered abroad man one iudas galyley dayes tribute drew away much people also perished euen manye harkened scattered abroad nowe say vnto refrayne selues men let alone counsell woorke men come naught god ye destroy least happily ye found striue god euangelist luke yesterdaye declared vnto v crymes highe priest obiected apostle howe apostle aunswered hystory serueth chiefly purpose myght vnderstande crymes wycked wonte defame truth minister thereof also constancie boldenesse behooueth v vse defence first chiefe care must dutie owe vnto god man fauour pleasure offende must take heede fearefulnesse enimies waxe insolent appeareth propertie furthermore must constantly holde fast keepe confession christ ashamed men ashamed become man suffer death sake nowe foloweth effect aunswere apologie wicked enimies christ verie notable place bicause reprooueth incurable obstinacie wicked also teacheth v howe easilie god beateth downe theyr bloudy enterprise firstdeath deuised apostle speaking conceaued implacable hatred truth sayth heard claue sunder men ready burst anger spited prowde ambitious men see authoritie little regarded seemed thing intollerable truth christ boldly stoutely defended therfore verie presence apostle consult howe put death verie lyke rather vsed furious exclamation graue deliberation example teacheth v wicked reprobate hardned hatred christ maner waye mytygated mollified receiue holy ghost onelye hath power alter chaunge harte sayde last sermon although outwarde worde god pierce mindes touch conscience yet hardeneth maketh fierce great heate vpper region ayre dissolueth colder matter drawne vp thyther maketh congeale yse euen mindes wicked vrged worde god fierce wax hard hearted else heate sunne melteth wax hardneth myre claye worde god wherewith mindes vngodly wonte taught enfourmed maketh vngodly stubborne frowarde fault worde god bicause corruption nature wicked letteth stoppeth true effect word example haue caine pharao saul achab iudas traitor infinite others wherevnto men may also adioyned matter well declareth let v learne iudge men dayes manifestly vtter ankred hatred worde taught heynous offence persecute truth especially proceede ignoraunce foolishe zeale towarde god instigation corrupt affection thing deserueth made vnfitte medicine god worde onely able restore v health lyfe ende christes enimies attemptesfurthermore thys example teacheth v wicked enimies truth meaning purpose counsel surely none minister truth maye made waye alone suppose hinder desyres wyshes peculiarly thinke nothing worde god reprooueth wickednesse whereby commeth passe ashamed shewe power fewe simple men striue might mayne whome valiaunt men haultie courage would scarce vouchsafe take labour paine men opinion haue perswaded themselues safe troubled painefull sermon god worde achab thought elia onely enimie disturber people israell promised himselfe certaine victorie assyrian till tooke micheas counsell perswaded delighted nothing telling vnlucky tydings euen men beleeued free gylte christes bloude safegarde sure apostle might dispatched waye could ring eares euen nowe dayes man happen demaunde men grieueth onely complayne minister god worde hereof commeth passe worlde rageth preacher truth beleeueth onely disturber publike peace tranquilitie thing since hath age beene done let v marueyle vsage dayes offended attempt wicked whome christ hath often gyuen v warning let v rather arme selues spirite constancie fortitude pacience mat c let v also walke warely circumspectly vocation wherevnto lorde hath appointed v christ long agoe hath taught v man may marueyle whose helpe intercession apostle deliuered handes cruell enimies gamaliel deliuereth apostle death perill present death luke sheweth stoode vp patrone defender one owne bench number saye gamaliel whose profession diligently describeth sayeth pharisey sect ascribed selfe countenance outwarde iustice aduersary christian faith doctrine doctor lawe wherevnto appeareth gaue studye residue profession studie wanted profitable successe beside great authoritie made people loue reuerence thing matter verye commodious auaileable residue feared people authoritie coulde reiect vpon whome knewe common depended therefore mooued importunate deuises fellowe phariseyes meaning withstande furiousnesse commaundeth apostle little whyle stande aside myght freely intreate cause declaring howe much prudent wyse residue presence apostle bewrayed impotencie rage mindes declareth iudgement whereby mittigateth moodes iudged apostle put death wee declare gamaliel wordes haue consider howe easie thing god deliuer people daunger seeing raise vp defender euen among enimies counsell authoritie one man confounde enterprise attempt great many euen sayd iohn kinde men bent christ doctrine phariseyes good whyle pronounced sentence excomunication professed christ yet colledge also nicodemus iohn defended christes quarell commeth gamaliel colledge whose meanes pleaseth lorde vse deliuerie hart gene yet afterwarde saued present death maye adde also howe philistine deliuered dauid sam exodus inclosed euerye side wyth saules souldiors shall speake moyses capitaine people israel whome daughter cruell pharao saued drowning riuer nilus woulde long shoulde tarie example might brought behooueth v rather obserue vse feared attempt men lord forthwith bring naught whose seruice bound one thing men well generall particulerly woulde thin ke woulde meanes suffer themselues pulled fulfilling vocation gamaliel counselllet v marke gamaliel counsayle full wisedome deede yet wherein man may perceyue diuers thing wanting declare hee yet fully instructed truth yet pleased lorde vse helpe thought afterward grewe godlynesse saying consisteth three poyntes first vseth pretie preface wherby apeaseth furious exhorteth nothing rashly vnaduisedly take heede selues sayth concerning men intende doe though shoulde saye heare determine shall suffer death feare deuyse headie therefore daungerous woulde therefore haue diligent sober deliberation taken wrath commit afterwarde wee may repent profitable age necessary admonition anger doe appoynt nothing auncient wryters sayde anger euill set hande fall grounde alone god gouerned ordered cannot quayle anye force counsayle man man dust ash able preuayle agaynst god ende counsell must diligently obserued whyle manye neglect take occasion hereby pernicious opinion whereby say attemptes neuer wicked error neuer blasphemous force kept vnder whereof followe none thing ouerthrowe discipline aswell ciuill ecclesiasticall magistrate shall carie sworde vayne vayne doth paule appoynt minister church shall onely teache truth also able confute conuince gaynesayers thinke wyse man ment loose sinewes ciuill ecclesiasticall gouernement beat innocent men whippes roddes therefore must needes verie great rage matter seemed done past yet quenched verie propertie persecutours christ seeme pleased appeased yet secretly foster hatred furie mindes seldome let christ minister passe without marke ignominie open punishment least might seeme vniustly haue risen would put followe feare pylate although iudged christ innocent yet would let go worde god amongst horrible persecution cruell attemptes enimies moste prosperous successe administred howbeit bicause thing intreated somewhat generall nowe length godly writer descendeth matter church christ grewe marueylously encreased enterprise wicked bishop laboured oppresse church vtterly vaine howbeit bicause church gathered togither diuers kindes people could long agree arose quarrell fellowship church forasmuch long peter rebuked hauing preached gospell cornelius familie men circumcised appeareth hereafter xj chapter cause grutch greekes widowes neglected dayly administration saye distribution liuing delt euery day among beleeuing hath bene heretofore declared howe many layde moneyes togither disposing apostle giue thereof euerye manne shoulde haue neede case chaunced apostle eyther ouercharged multitude businesse ouerhipped fewe amongest else deemed despised thing straungers suspicious kinde people aboue bitterlye complayned thing cause accustomed order maner administration money hitherto seemed nowe somewhat altered speake hereof haue certaine thing obserue first considered howe euen primitiue church voyde hir defectes faultesthe primitiue church voyde faultes hitherto yet seemed prosperous perfite poyntes light faultes recited horrible obserue difference nation christ none neyther iewe gentyle scithian barbarous gallat colloss factiouslye deuyded nowe beare malice grutch secretly hart vtter bitternesse mindes vniust complayning see therefore primitiue church infected fault reade manye thousandes vnder moyses somtimes ouerthrown wildernesse1 cor god horrible iudgement may added detestable ingratitude towards apostle knewe occupied many affayres yea twise cast prison alone sawe bare brunt daunger almost whole church great offence haue wrong opinion deserue well v benefite v murmuring call apostle credit doubt giue occasion sedition doe time persecution behooued haue bene carefull mutual loue vnity example taught neuer appointed perfite president church yt alway thing may happen worthy amended eyther obscuritie worde god incertaintie nothing perfitely ordered therby bicause corruption witte alwaye seeketh occasion infringe breake moste holy ordinaunces god therfore foolish moste arrogant boldnesse men thinke haue attayned highest perfection abyde kinde admonishment furthermore rashnesse reprooued forsake congregation find perceiue blemish imperfection author cause schisme wherin anabaptist commonly guiltie mennes reason shoulde take place shall primitiue church iudged free thought worthy whome man may ioyne himselfe also christ hath chiefely commended v keeping vnitie easily appeareth spirite sedde iohn iohn thinke trifle breake vnitie church obseruedgrutch multitude thys grutch arose number christian increased ought haue acknowledged god grace haue imbraced vnitie way seene multitude also murmuring confusion bicause impossible diuersitie desyres mindes satisfie mennes wyshes nature hath ordeyned pleased content seeke alwayes occasion puling complaint faythfull seruaunt god moses whome israelite many tymes went stone remembred theyr fleshe pottes egypt founde thys true like feele apostle notwithstanding administration thing vsed vndoubtedly kinde truth diligencie let man therefore thinke straunge wonderfull nowe dayes though multitude poore needie euerywhere see murmuring complaynings heard al place vsed chiefely seene hospital place poore found mainteyned though cause else yet pouertie selfe alwaye whyning complayning faulte cause chiefely deserueth pardon bicause chaunceth daylie dyuers occasion able mooue mindes neuer constant let rather haue charge ouersight poore beware giue iust occasion murmure complaint whyles eyther vnwyllingly distribute suche thinges haue neede else wickedly conuey away giuen finding poore small tryfling fault commit herein contamynat themselues great sacriledge lye vnto holy ghost also occasion poore small offence giue cause angrie mooued otherwise neede comforted let waigh howe primitiue church troubled none encumbraunces sprang eyther vniust negligent administration ecclesiastical good scripture teacheth iudas stumbled block iohn see also ananias sapphira made wracke saluation rock thys place grecian take occasion seditious murmuring thought wydowes neglected publike distribution church goodes example holy ghost would therefore diligently written declare daungers chiefely ought shunne auoyd purpose vnprofitable bragge christian calling doings meane expresse becommeth eyther haue already forsaken owne goodes name christ else ought forsake necessitie requyre bestowe goodes poore fraudulently guylefully absurde neuer ynough punishable offence purloyne imbecill away thing men haue giuen reliefe poore maynteyning whome commaunded spend haue woulde god easie matter herein correct vsage dayes may without great cause bewayle doe apostle grutch risen doe rayle whome heare thus murmure themthe apostle speedily consult redresse vniust distribution doe forsake vnkinde murmurer leaue displeasure care administration church doe priuate authoritie prescribe anye newe order church thing might haue shewe charitie doe dissemble make delayes though delaying winking matter mischiefe might haue beene qualified luke maketh mention anye suche thinges see mindes already much incensed prouoked neyther fewe murmurer sake leaue care whole church christ committed neyther doe priuate authoritie aspyrers tyranny prescribe god houshold inheritance thing neither thinke good dissemble negligently passe ouer apparaunt inconuenience time prouyde remedie calling multitude togither openly friendly consult better order way appointed poore example president onely age obserued also great diligence followed desyre church preseruation safetie1 peter neyther must pleasure fewe borne shall doe whatsoeuer lyketh lyke lordes prowdely beare rule ouer church neyther must open vice winked especially giue occasion murmuring complaint gather strength creepe long tarryaunce inflame mindes euill beginning might easily haue beene cured remedied becommeth incurable also commeth passe hereby occasion gyuen rashe seditious inuade vsurpe rule dominion ouer churche pleasure make appoint newe order reformation thing ought haue consydered nowe dayes bragge false succeeding apostle taken chiefe ruler church thinke intollerable godly magistrate appoynt reformation church complaintes whole worlde many yeares could awake take away manifest horrible abuse whereof haue bene long author defendors yea also ought haue consydered thing glory name gospell wil seeme haue refourmed church foolish heareth poore euery day like cause murmuring complayning would god complaynts poore iust theyrs whome intreated many place magistrate rape reaue church goodes spent consumed neyther serue church neyther ledde desire euangelike truth poore meane whyle minister church also extreme beggerie ready ster e hunger math whome christ diligently hath commended hys church say nothing neglecting study wasting schooles contempt discipline good maners infinite like mischiefes may thanke wicked robbing church colledges many wise men see thing lament diuers faythfull pastours church reprooue desyre amendment many openly bewayle wante seditious murmuring testifie indignation mindes profite wayes men thinke murmurer brydeled threates proclamation punishment seeme best neglect care nothing therfore man thinketh earnestly reformation bicause man put possession church goodes lorde finde way one day horrible iudgement awake sluggardes whome admonishment diuine worde complaintes poore awake matter great wayte intreatedthe apostle oration concerning ordeyning deacon luke also reciteth apostle oration wherein proposed impossibilitie declare discharge office haue hytherto susteyned wherefore necessarie one committed also declare man ought take grieuously haue made default consydering manifold affayres wherein hitherto beene occupied much say bicause money taken vnto v certaine godlye disposed giuen church vse gladly tooke vppon v distribution least seeme anye waye neglect church commoditie learne experience able satisfie place teaching also office distribution confesse among manifolde business something might ouerseene v wherefore must lay aside one office may intermyt office teaching seing christ hath commended vnto v hath appoynted v witness thinges hath done therefore office must appointed may serue table say may see thinges belonging helping succouring poore taught first part thys relation great dignitie gospell worde god isthe dignitie gospel consydering apostle preferre preaching hereof ecclesiasticall distribution helping poore yet godly thing verie necessary neyther ignoraunt minister gospell ought meanes despise poore seing afterwarde earnestly commended care paule barnabas galat matter came thys point either ministerie table worde must intermytted thinke vnmeete neglect preaching worde vnder pretence looking poore bicause greater respect soule fedde worde god body bodily foode christ hymselfe teacheth math seeke first kingdome god c yea christ banquetting hawking hunting sometime dishonest exercise spent greatest part tyme otherwise shoulde employed reading teaching shall one daye feele horrible iudgement god bloud haue perished negligence although might seeme profitable commit charge publike good fewer bicause many time commeth passe eyther waxe insolent else seeke priuate gayne vnlesse restrayned rule authoritie others though thing followed thinges herein also committed great ouersight papistes hath nothing remayned bare name deacon onely yea euen called gospeller whether bring church goodes publike treasury conuert v commonly correction errour beene superfluous vnprofitable luke sheweth great vtilitie ensued therof word god increased spread farther vnto others also bring forth fruite mindes hearde receyued agayne number faythfull whome chiefe byshops priestes desyred onely haue diminished vtterly extinguished meruaylously increased ierusalem power authoritie enimies greatest furthermore onely common lay fee nowe also priestes beginne submit themselues obedience fayth professe christ thinges haue marueylous consolation diligently considered teach v armor weapon christes church profitablie enlarged conserued uerily must glorie god saluation many thing diligently obserued wiser sort feared noueltie beginne giue eare doctrine credite doubt would day better successe church affayres behalfe vtterly deafe though bare profession christian name sufficient saluation stay ydlely mooued neyther publike corruption maners manifest errours iust complaint godly earnestly amende thing ought amended therfore negligence securitie commeth passe gospell day goeth better forward againe taught euydent example howe vaine forcelesse enterprise wicked kingdome christ rage spreadeth nowe christian fayth findeth place among priestes fayth thought vnmeete suffered common people like thing happened christ yet vpon earth nicodemus ioseph arimathaea beleeued whome residue order wyshed life yea whyle nero cruell proclamation thundred church yet founde owne court professed christ paule philippian wytnesseth also singuler token goodnesse mercy god doth vouchsafe illuminate knowledge hys truth many number shed christes bloud example serueth onely consolation also instruction also like facilitie readinesse must pardon doe v iniurye shall come passe hauing true spirite child god giuen vnto v deliuered debt trespass shall come inheritaunce heauenly kingdome iesu christ onely begotten sonne god whome blessing honor power glory euer amen xlij homelie steuen full fayth power great wonder myracles among people arose abyde desyre lyue godly partaker heauenly kingdome forbicause offended nothing crosse god would haue v instructed confirmed onely precept also example primitiue church offended persecution aduersitie straunge vnwonted thing much see time passed prosperous success amog horrible persecution mixed church al stil increasing example wherof ye story presently haue hand shall shewe v compared thing went next luke hath declared vnto v prosperous proceeding gospell common people also many priestes beganne beleeue church affayres seemed nowe haue bene quyet safetie seing defended many singuler patrones beholde newe conflict beginneth horrible perillous yet steuen whose side whole church christ foyned constrayned defende christes quarrell onely wordes also stowte protestation fayth bloude vse hystorie chiefely thys poynt must offended though grieuous tumult sodainely arise thing seeme hushte whome hoped haue faythfullest defendours eyther able wylling helpe v god suffereth come passe take v trust carnall helpes shoulde learne deede christes kingdome enlarged neyther hoste men force spirite lorde bicause diuers thing concurrent make instruction consolation whole hystorie circumstaunces corinthian xij chap declared fayth feruencie zeale testified gifte holy spirite notable myracles woonders although nothing saide publike sermon appeareth yet order text vsed preach often earnestly effectuously wherefore may note way deacon primitiue church wholye debarred ministerie worde although chiefely busied distribution church goodes yet bestowed labour farre able seruices church meane lordes sight made free aduaunced great dignity wherein straungers taught instructed knowe liberti great power authoritie many went winne fauour people benefit learne example centurion whome priestes thys cause commended vnto christ bicause builded sinagoge without cause steuen resisted men diuers nation learned experience mystery kingdome christ part hidden wyse worlde greater glory saintes get conflict serueth also comfort v yeelde feare time see selues assaulted many furnished enimies profitable consider sorte conueyances conspirator appoint onset steuen luke sayth beginne disputation steuen set disputation ende drift wherof appeareth none catch entangle owne word thing scribe also many time assayed christ trusting wit learning hoped easily haue victorie rude vnlearned bodye least one yet great name learning matter fell farre otherwise looked whome supposed rude vnprouyded instructed heauenly wisedome prompted holy spirite doth onely answere question propone vseth plentie force argumentes meanes able resist whereby see agayne christ truth selfe neuer fayleth promise promised spirite comforter counseller lead truth promised vtteraunce wisedome iohn men shoulde able stande luke hath hitherto perfourmed promise haue seene example apostle treasure heauenly wisedome yet spent drawne steuen also draweth thereof thing necessary conflict let man therefore feare eyther wisedome authoritie worlde1 cor coloss forasmuch businesse christes haue hande made vnto v father wisedome whome treasure knowledge wisedome hidden let v also consider greater vs1 iohn maketh suche stirre worlde doe sophisticall libertine ouercome disputationfalse witness brought steuen yeelde turning vnto vnlawfull craftie conueyances labour oppresse lye false witness whome perceyued strengthned truth therefore inuincible suborned men tongue sell slaunders went bring faythfull preacher christ enuye people speake little hereafter nowe let v consider farre vse go nourishe hatred heartes agaynst truth yeelde yet ouercommen men giuen vp reprobate sense become blinde vnder pretence godlye zeale wherein wickedly glorie thinke may doe feare moste manifest heynous wickednesse libertine coulde ignorant lawe talio appoynted god talio doer suffreth lyke damage hurt himselfe doth looke place deuter false witness though lawes anye extant yet common reason teacheth v commit grieuous fault eyther beare false witnesse themselues else bring forth alledge false witnesse burne hatred truth make count thinges commeth passe iust iudgement god bereft common reason therefore pollute themselues great wickednesse chasing driuing away truth hath shyned heartes diuers example hereof extant well olde newe amongst one notable bishop counsell constance vsed towardes iohn husse agaynst right lawe whome afrayde breach owne promise emperours safe conduct cruelly burne hauing none cloke excuse heynous fact promise kept vnto heretikes let man therefore marueyle though perceyue vniustlye vnworthily entreated meane season let v learne beginning quench fire hatred glimering truth least also fall lyke blindnesse incurable frowardenesse steuen oppressed sedition takennow bicause importunacie fewe coulde little nothing preuayle agaynst doctrine truth subtill sophisters labor earnestly set al people elder scribe steuens top may gathered bythe circumstaunces rayse open tumult citie meaning apprehend bring counsell olde pollicie satan meaning make away vprore sedition see armed defence truth lawe moste time commeth passe seditious sleyghtes assault thetruth miserably perish sedition may see hath hapned nation iewes set forth notable example leuitie inconstancie common people declared apostle church great estimation people notablenesse theyr myracles also shew heauenly diuine maiestie shone number circumuented sleyghtes sophisters stande vp doctrine truth lyke lightnesse people christ also finde whome one whyle woulde haue made king another whyle like mad men cried haue crucified men lystra first cried actes saying paule god within whyle woulde haue stoned many like doinges reade history gentile vse hunt prayse people studie please worlde rather god whose certaine remayneth stable vnmooueable steuen accused impietie obstinacienowe let v see thinges laide steuens charge false witness luke saith brought counsell summe accusation man ceaseth speake blasphemous wordes holy place lawe therefore accused impietie thereof also incurable obstinacie hitherto reason coulde perswaded make mention holy citie temple name bicause seemed iewes intollerable impietie speake intende thing place commended many promise god therfore chiefly laid hieremies charge prophecied holy citie temple hierem bicause behooued crime shoulde prooued witness blasphemy shoulde declared plainely adde haue hearde saye howe iesus nazareth shall destroye place shall chaunge ordinance moses gaue v therefore thought religion citie shoulde endure euer iudged shoulde saye thing touching destruction thereof wicked body furthermore whence tooke hold accusation may easily gathered apostle doctrine taught men iustified saued mere grace god merite iesus christ nothing businesse saluation attributed eyther mannes workes outward ceremony one polluted imperfite shadowes figure redemption christ come christ put awaye sacrifyce hys owne body might gathered renting temple happened death christ also exhorted al men cast away al vaine hope righteousnesse lawe embrace sure faith righteousnesse god offred christ thing bicause woulde easilye perswade called remembraunce peril present destruction wherof christ oftentimes warned therefore craftie impudent sclaunderers take occasion accusation hereof saying steuen spake abolishing religion destruction citie craftilye conceale cause moouing saye yea set forth matter though steuen shoulde seeme haue threatened set temple fire speaking contemptuously christ compare glorye magnificencie temple make doctrine despised place diligence obserued teacheth v truth part assaulted lye plainly warneth v christes doctrine neuer wysely modestlye preached wicked world wil take occasion sclaunder finde true corrupted dayes wherein whatsoeuer faythfull teacher truth say vniustly carped teach men iustified meere grace god strength workes haue prayse case saluation called enimies good workes mainteyners carnall libertie agayne say whatsoeuer belongeth saluation conteyned christ onely bicause onely mediatour aduocate intercessor appoynted betweene god v streyght way condemned wicked blasphemer blessed uirgin saintes item go deliuer church christ intollerable yoke humane tradition correct abuse restore auncient simplicitie primitiue church start vp crie aduersaries religion true worshippe god deprauers sacramentes robber god honour declare vnto worlde drowned filthy lowes wickednesse imminent wrath god punishment long agone deserued therefore condemned railed disturber publike tranquillitie sower sedition briefe nothing done soundly godlily modestly escape censure checke sclaunderous enuious aduersary man must mooued thing must leaue forsake charge committed lorde let v consider olde guyse world agaynst must constantly prudently striue resist let v likewise encouraged testimony scripture promiseth godly forgotten god haue layd vp heauen psalm math plenteous rewarde meane season worlde shall scape scot free shamelesse sclaundering iewes enforced extreme miserie abide horrible destruction citie nation would haue apostle speake alwaies founde true shall feele smart deedes amended wordes disdaine threatened steuen daunger death afraydebut sayth steuen adoe snatched euerye one lyke sheepe middle sort woolues dismayed feare bewrayeth feare heart palenesse face trembling nay rather rendreth reason fayth doctrine great boldnesse libertie sharpely reprehendeth impietie incurable contending god shall see chapiter following least man ascribe saying vnto rayling declared shyned countenaunce token couragious minde conscience reioysing christ iudges oft time seene earnestlye countenaunced sawe face beene face aungell thinketh expounded vnaccustomed humane brightnesse wherewith god would dazell eye enimies intent perceyue feared without doubt steuen meane whyle incredible comfort god spirite rysen minde furthermore god gaue herein token taste glorye come thorowe hope wherof may ouercome aduersitie shall happen daunger testimonie name example wherof haue many history martyr amongst one seene farre v aboue thirtie yeres past worthy euer remembred certaine husbandeman countrie profession gospell brought fyre burned whyle prison shewed manye token christian stowtenesse yet neerer death approched euydent appeared bounde gybet ready let downe fyre sayde alowdea notable historie manye wayes comfort persecuted religion would fayne speake iustice eare dyed whome came though iustice vsed many delayes put said thys wise sir quoth haue daye condemned burned heresie howbeit though confesse selfe sinner yet acknowledge cryme heresie professe imbrace heart fayth conteyned apostle creede recyted article thereof nowe good sir sayth craue last bowne peticion would lay hande first heart owne testifie vnfaynedly vnto people standing whether hart mine quake tremble feare trulye cheerefull heart haste vnto christ whome haue beleeued nowe minde opinion see iudge neuer worde say bade hast execution yet perceyued pensiuenesse countenaunce martyr great glorye fayth euen comforteth cheereth harte thing seeme horrible fearefull let v therefore labour keepe thys fayth diligence hauing passed race thys lyfe goulfe persecution merie mindes cheerefull conscience may attayne ioy glory heauen promised v christ iesu whome blessing honour power glory euer amen seuenth chapiter vpon actes apostle xliij homelie sayde highe priest euen sayde ye men brother hearken god glory appeared father abraham yet mesopotamia hee dwelt charran sayde vnto go thy countrie thy kyndred come lande shall shewe thee went lande chaldeys dwelt charran thence father deade hee brought hym thys lande yee nowe dwell haue heard blessed martyr steuen accused enimies false wytnesses blasphemer god law giuen moses threatned citie temple destruction thing set forth thys ende vnderstande first martyr apostolike church beginning well afterwarde oppressed false accusation learne hereby case minister truth stande worlde others go promote glorie god common saluation people iudged wicked enemy god glorie publike tranquillitie christ oftentimes admonished hath bene declared long sithence example many therfore wronge iudgements men dayes concerning mynisterie minister truth ought offende man wherby lysten lesse vnto god calling bicause spake thing last sermon dyuers time wyll nowe let passe intreate present place luke sheweth howe thys matter handeled counsell first beginneth highe priest saythhow ye wicked suffer christes cause bee entreated councels demaunded whether thing euen declared steuens accuser yea wherein set forth vnto v notable example crafte wylinesse wherewith counterfeyte byshops vse set minister follower truth therfore doth aske steuen question prouoke aunswere would vnder visure iustice deceyue vnwarie though gaue steuen libertie pleate defende matter euydent ment nothing lesse yet wicked decree whereby forbidden men preache name iesus stoode men force nowe enquyreth touching right equitie deede simplie fact onely though might seeme sufficient accusation men steuen shoulde haue bene founde haue sayde thing obiected vngodlye accuser lyke trade vse persecutor dayes neyther beginne wayes true worshipper christ know owne confession whether haue spoken thing receyued superstition abuse error popish tyranny yea thing appeere sentence death pronounced neyther heare reason argumentes whereby able defend dooings man confesse haue denied intercession saintes hath spoken agaynst superstitious worshipping streight way condemned heresie permytted giue accompt doctrine behalfe likewise iudged heretike speaketh sacrifice masse fyre purgatorie supremacie sea rome selling pardon diuers lyke merchaundizes farther reason teaching heare let v well note thinges beguile simple see giue v free libertie counsell pleate matter lyeth snake grasse couet nothing else v confession truth thing hate detest argument steuens orationbut let v heare steuens aunswere consisteth whole narration historie taken first origene beginning iewishe nation comprehendeth chiefe benefites god bestowed time past vpon father deedes done againe eyther good euill ende scope whole discourse may easilye gathered poyntes accusation chiefe pointes wherof hee blasphemed god lawe therefore beginneth purge himselfe impietie least might seeme beguile vaine trifling argument doth vtterly protest altogither voyde impietie god ordinance first argument consisteth herein acknowledgeth preacheth god whylome wrought diuers thing among father onely worshypped prooueth ought iudged vngodly abrogating lawe ceremony much father time passed pleased god without lawe ceremony onely obedience fayth god liked many lawe ceremony instituted thereof hee euidently prooueth law ceremony farre vse ende men could iustified saued rather way saluation shadowed length accomplished christ therefore ceremony let passe christ embraced true fayth length woulde driue vaine affiaunce father setteth eye stubborne incurable impietie accusing earnestly lieffer followe progenitor auncient holy father fayth pleased god thys summe steuens oration wherein taught sort howe boldly ought defende god quarrell agaynst enimies thereof appeareth also marueylous power holy ghost could instruct perfite knowledge diuinitie great boldenesse minde set middle woolues could wisely giue account doctrine faith constauntly contempne enimies example ought encourage v thinke power holy ghost ouercome stowtenesse frowardnesse wicked let v see nowe beginning oration conteyned thys place beginning briefe short sayththe getting attention good wil yee men brother hearken calleth brother bicause countrie sake name iewes vsed often salute one father dignitie office sake god appointment whose authoritie wyllingly acknowledgeth although knewe corrupt wicked yet amazed dignitie thinketh vnfit dissent rather plainely freely speaketh iudgement accuseth errour example taught christian fayth doth abolishe duty humanitie ciuilitie owe vnto authoritie dignitie aboue v although touching state saluation gallat col c difference person christ iesu paule teacheth yet degree dignitie remaine christ hath abolished lawe god father commaundeth v honour parent rise vp vnto gray head apostle witnesseth propertie christian modestie one goe honor yet chiefe care woulde god rom duetie owe vnto least dissemble truth man sake confession whereof christ euery requyreth v neyther must time forget apostolike verie christian maximum sentence teacheth v countrie whereof lande chanaan sometime figure meere grace god without respect workes desert matter deserued seeing chosen christ world made ephes bragge haue nothing haue receyued1 cor surely consider disposition nature shall appeare mindefull heauenly countrie called drawen abraham land chanaan whose name heard yea lord calleth v prooue vntowarde nature fleshe stryueth agaynst god calling neuer able ouercome except holpen effectuous drawing holye spirite furthermore taught vocation offereth v saluation dependeth vpon onely worde god therefore taken holde fleshlye sense mannes reason fayth onely also gift god naturall man perceyueth thing belonging spirit god ephe god hath prepared thing loue him1 cor neyther eye hath seene esay eare hearde yet hath entred heart man power fayth marueylously declareth selfe taketh holde promise god surely embraceth thing farre exceede sense capacitie mannes reason therfore paule calleth sure confidence thing hoped heb certeyntie thing seene thing ought well considered thinke doctrine iustification fayth light matter though appoynted easie waye vnto saluation mainteyned securitie licentiousnesse fleshe iudged light easie matter surmounteth passeth power man shal account matter greater weyght god men doe owne power cannot done without power holy ghost let v compare fayth workes monkes euer yet shall finde yea perfiter workes sayth great desire lyking still maketh mindefull thereof small authoritie kinsefolke allyaunce whome vehemently loue ready forgo age also infirmitie father myght haue stayed whereof dyed came border prooue acknowledgeth true god whome father sometime worshipped partly shewe iustification saluation tyed ceremony lawe bicause father serued god pleased without whereby gathereth also aduersarie true religion considering beateth downe thing father might well forbeare instituted ende signifie true trade waye saluation onely conteyned iesus christ fetcheth beginning abraham whome bragged first sayth men nowe dayes also shoulde saued without ceremony leuiticall lawe fayth christ therfore accused impietie holde affirme abrogated beginning abraham diligently setteth fayth following mercifull calling confesseth circumcision instituted god whyle ioyneth thing going thereby putteth away sheweth giuen vnto abraham thing hitherto bene recyted called chaldea declared beliefe openly many notable signes faith beliefe iustified god gaue testament circumcision say made couenaunt sealed confirmed circumcision whervpon followeth iustified circumcision circumcision seale righteousnesse alreadie gotten fayth argument paule also vsed fourth chapter romaine abraham receyued institution circumcision simply plainly lord appoynt plainely obserued commended posteritie circumcised isaac eyght day according god institution without adding superstitious ryte thing none godly doubteth isaac also iacob sonne agayne hys twelue child patriarch people israell holy ghost would haue fewe thing nowe almost remembred touching thys matter might thereby appeare howe holy father stacke outwarde thing rather regarde vnto god testament couenaunt wherein contayned promise saluation outwarde ceremonie thing reade xvij genesis make better vnderstanding hereof genesis meane season steuen plainely reprehendeth preposterours religion iewes gloried much circumcision touched consideration healthfull couenaunt sealed ratifyed merite christ sacramentes sacramentall kindes speechand place teacheth v also iudge sacrament sacramentall loqu tions whereof certaine superstitious contentious person take occasion nowe dayes contynuall quarrelling forasmuch still vrge letter seeke deeper vnderstanding mysterie steuen sayth abraham receyued couenaunt circumcision sayth owne heade respect god worde sayde vnto abraham couenaunt shal obserue betweene seede let euerye manchilde among circumcised c wordes vnderstande according letter shall circumcision selfe called couenaunt vndoubtedly thing deceyued manye time past thought serued god throughly circumcised thing selfe declareth ought otherwise vnderstanded deut iere iere first god requyred lawe prophetes circumcision heart ieremie sayth circumcised abode couenaunt beside abraham circumcised obteyned thinges god promysed couenaunt thys obeyed god called receyued promise fayth beliefe god imputed beliefe vnto righteousnesse therefore grafted christ without whome neyther righteousnesse saluation come vnto man therefore circumcision called couenaunt reason proporcion agreement betweene signes thing signified sacrament bicause god testifyeth seale acknowledge confederate heyres truely fulfill keepe article couenaunt circumcision receyued societie god people confirmed fayth temptation fayth god would haue vnderset shored vp outwarde proppes bicause flesh frayltie lyke reason sacrifice woont lawe called sinnes expiation clensing sinnes man would vrge strayne letter heare apostle speak saying bloud ox gotes take away sinne knowe god prophet reiecteth wicked vncleane person daylie gaue offering spared cost labour shall thinke therefore god mocked people commending sacrifice goodly name certayne true meaning signified christ true lambe god taketh awaye sinnes worlde whome whosoeuer trusted vnfaynedly sake delyuered sinnes vsed doe sacrifice wanting fayth god regarde sacrifice offered dogge hogge esay testifieth come sacrament new testament shall finde lyke reason also apostle calleth baptisme lauer newnesse regeneration ala many shall finde baptized shewe token bodye renewed regenerated yet holye ghost commendeth baptisme false praise hath respect vse thereof namely bicause according god institution effectually truely sealeth elect inuocation regeneration whereof christ himselfe author mysticall supper breade called body christ wine bloude wherevpon many gather true body bloude christ eaten drunken reallye substantially well good badde make christ iudge controuersie reason thys sort vpon selfe wordes whosoeuer eateth fleshe christ drinketh bloude dwelleth christ christ many eate breade supper drinke cup neyther dwell christ haue christ dwelling ergo body bloud christ receyued really substantially mysticall bread wine bounde vnto outwarde signes man denie maior christes making daylie experience prooueth minor would god prooued example herein sufficiently shewe howe farre christ bring horrible schisme diuision church contention cruelly persecute true worshipper iesus christ seeth therefore word supper vnderstanded sacramentally yea sacrifice olde tyme profited none endued wyth true fayth brought christ vnto euen supper shall receyue fruyte except bring true fayth v hauing mindes lift vp aboue heauens feede fayth fayth whosoeuer wanteth farre christ prophane vnhallow supper hypocrisie therefore eate drinke vnto themselues damnation thinges ende must consyder may learne pernitious errour tyed addicted vnto outwarde ceremony seeke belongeth onely vnto christ fayth onely founde therefore must vse sacrament first must acknowledge god goodnesse doth vouchsafe confirme fayth outward signes ceremony mooued vse receyue must reare vp mind thinges signified chiefly must perfourme thing god prescribeth v herevnto serueth augustine rule bookes christian doctrine vttered wordes lorde himselfe apostolike doctrine hath delyuered vnto v third booke ix chap certaine fewe sacrament steade many verye easie done verie singuler excellent meaning pure cleane obseruation sacrament baptisme celebration bodye bloude lorde thing euery man receyueth instructed inspired knoweth wherevnto referred may reuerence carnall seruitude rather spirituall libertie follow letter take signes thing signified token seruyle weakenesse infirmitie interpretate expounde signes vnprofitably token wandring errour c surely miserable seruitude minde cleaue vnto outwarde thinges able lyfte vp sens heauen maye enioye christ sitting right hande father aboue nowe ceremony instituted god neyther iustifie saue v yea vse hurtfull done without fayth much detestable errour attribute man constitution wearishe colde ceremony bolde curiositie brayne hath deuised glorye iustification saluation lorde vniuersally condemned tradition men cleere sunne isay math rom ceremony ministred faith bicause fayth rest vpon none foundation worde god paule teacheth therefore onely canone ouerthroweth poperie rytes ceremony therof mainteyned foolishe decree superstitious men needeth demonstration steuen prosecuteth narration begonne beateth downe vaine affyaunce fathershe beateth downe theyr affiaunce father whome marueylously gloryed tofore haue declared prooue father iustifyed neyther circumcision euer whyt better therfore yet merited saluation anye workes saued meere vnspeakeable goodnesse fauour god rehearseth straunge vnnatural deede ioseph brother toucheth fewe word may easily appeare heynous deede thus sayth patriarch hauing indignation solde ioseph aegypt storie moses gene gene chap first sheweth spring fact enuie wherein boyled innocent brother none cause vnderstoode god appointed great honor dignity lyke fault caine slewe brother abel gene blynded affection enuie hatred although patriarch shed bloude yet guilty murther bycause pretenced malice mynde fulfilling wherof god stopped meanes ruben also solde brother exodus alyauntes thing god afterwarde appoynted punished death adde vnto number thing concurring deede shall appeare one fact deserued cast euer therefore ascribed righteousnesse god goodnesse vouchsafe make nation came owne people inheritaunce vpon bolde rashe impietie vngodlynesse tooke vpon contende wyth god whose deuise thys meane thought stop hinder also vnkinde towardes father knewe well great delight ioseph whose olde age rather haue comforted haue made sadde theyr vngodlynesse towarde brother needeth speake much laye went onely kyll bodye also soule whyles sell ismaelites egypt miserably serue among knewe knowledge god wyll punishmentes therefore helles sufficient reuenge suche deede god would haue shewed rigour rather goodnesse mercie place also serueth informationthe glory vayne sought vertue au cestrye teacheth v vaine thing vaunt glory vertue auncestors deny singuler gift god man happen haue famous excellent progenitor say haue thend brag god sight though forefather neuer good yet goodnesse fauour god v commeth profite vertue steuen noted iewes euident seene nation well particulerly generally although forefather reason vertues good deedes deserued prayse amongst men yet want diuers others whose vngraciousnesse deserued onely destruction whole nation also eternall damnation forsaking whole posteritie vnlesse god peculiar fauourable sparing woulde haue saued let v therefore humble selues sight god let reioyceth reioyce lorde mercifull louing pacient great goodnesse dealeth v sinnes rewardeth v according wickednesse see psalme bicause steuen entred historie ioseph ioseph also fauour saued whose chastitie wisedome righteousnesse godlynesse myght seeme deserue bring promotion dignitie sake nation iewes honoured benefited aunswereth error also sheweth euen ioseph also receyued whatsoeuer god fauour owne captiuitie benefite god woulde leaue destitute grace grace came also passe instructed spirite prophecie coulde giue king wholesome counsell get hys fauour wherfore attributed neyther iosephes witte first sayth god ioseph neyther falshoode brother shamefull slaunder mistresse rashe vnrighteousnesse putiphare could depriue ioseph faythfull worshipper god helpe came passe falleth godly psal eye lord ouer righteous eares open vnto prayer maye also saye dauid father mother forsake psal lorde taketh mee vppe christ sayde alone though disciple forsooke alone iohn graffed christ fayth forasmuch daunger lyfe meane hir accusation long kept prison let man therfore thinke god onely safetie libertie let man also vpon presumption god helpe promise himselfe kinde rest securitie flesh let v vnderstande god doth defende deliuer v sometimes must beare crosse yet neuer vnder god protection tried affliction psal telleth fleetings teares gathered togither bottell whatsoeuer haue good god endue v spirite nothing sounde whole agayne except cause v doyngs please others shall nothing preuayle shall able doe others able teach gouerne himselfe therefore god gift iosephes counsell well accepted pharao except god inclyne heart men lyke v doyngs shall vnprofitable vayne thing paule well marked ministerye worde sayde hee nothing watereth neyther hee planteth god giues encrease consideration hereof maketh v prowde god giftes vse ought doe hast thou thou hast receyued cor thou hast receyued gloryest thou though thou hadst receyued thou hast receyued surely thou shalt hereafter giue account thou hast receyued layde christ hath taught v parable talentes math ioseph figure christlast ofall shall vnprofitable ifwe consider figure christ ioseph purporteth forasmuch afterwarde deliuered vnto gentyles iewes fleshe brother ioseph suffred many thinges baker cupbearer whereof one put death saued reade christ suffered middle two theeues whereof one grace god saued countrie counsell prouision hys familie fed goodnesse trust god set forth hundreth fifth psalme thus sayde god called dearth vpon lande destroyed prouision breade sent man euen ioseph solde bonde thys counsell god comforteth brother feared remembraunce wickednesse saying sent egypt god prouydence benefite publike vtilitie many oftentimes commeth passe gene thing enimies vniustly vngently procure agaynst v serue benefite commoditie yet wickednesse excused therefore bycause goe fulfill god counsell purpose satisfie owne vnruly lustes hath oftentimes already bene declared also haue consyder pharao ioseph wisedome thankfulnesse pharao pharao deserueth small commendation wisedome kindenesse maketh ioseph whome seeth wisedome counsell men gouernour hys kingdome although knewe straunger bonde man saw thing prospered according deuise counsel liberally considereth rewardeth kinsfolke example men authoritie may learne onely thankefulnesse also howe profitable thing put office worship god truely bicause blessing god followeth suche done vnto god taketh done vnto himselfe thys thing putiphar perceyued well ynough whome god prospered doings whyle ioseph ruler hys house although little considered doth pharao nowe finde iosephs industrie wisedome perceyueth himselfe greatly inriched egypt nation adioyning preserued mainteyned afterwarde booke paules sake manye sayled companye saued drowning godly great commoditie vseth come vnto many oftentimes fewe wicked authoritie power may doe list ensueth great inconuenience mischiefe iosua achan onely sacriledge close taught first father fayth waye saluation founded merite iesus christ onely therefore doctrine onely auncient true yet euery accused noueltie falshoode cause men regarde outwarde signes shewes spring owne deuyse brayne worde god therefore commeth passe whyle looke onely externall thing take author newe opinion enimies god religion teache contrarie labour bring agayne way salu tion true religion god hath ordeyned instituted thing came passe steuen teaching gospell iesus christ ierusalem sending people ceremony lawe vnto christ accused one deadly hated temple true worshipping god excuseth himselfe wordes onely also deede gathering togither hystorie father declareth followed none waye fayth saluation christ bringeth historie verie origine beginning nation vntill comming israell egypt death patriarch nowe beginneth declare increasing deliuerie people wherin vseth great diligence bicause deliuerie egypt figure redemption made christ whereby also taught state churche hath bene age gathereth meane true religion saluation consisteth outwarde ceremony rather fayth taketh holde grace promise god bicause shall intreate thing theyr place thys present speake increasing people moses
