byrdes ayre compriseth also tymes season christ himselfe testifyeth reprehendeth hys disciple bicause inquisitiue thinges acte father reserued hys owne power onely consideration thing must serue consolation great distresse trouble see god deferre helpe might seeme forgotten v promise let v remember god hath appoynted certayne time perfourme promise god neuer let ouerpasse helpe trust hym dutyes meane whyle wayte abyde helpe god appoint time order howe doe hys pleasure psal tarie thou lordes leysure sayth dauid put thy trust shall comfort thine heart yea sayde place haue tempted lorde haue prescribed anye time shewe power suche desert durst aske fleshe noble bethulia sayde num psal iudith woulde wayte fiue dayes helpe god let v vse tryacle conserue impaciencie waywardenesse fleshe thinke god bringeth affayres certayne time place yet meane whyle abacuc forsaketh put hope hym argument taken state tymes wherein people increased would haue seemed great marueyle people multiplied among remembring ioseph hys benefites would haue cherished done appeereth former king egypt people iewes grewe multiplied euen agaynst willes chiefe ruler stryuing coulde agaynst arose newe king knewe ioseph regarde benefites done vnto thys king onely neglected people israell let others misvse craftily set vpon made egypt hate suspect vsed crueltie tyrannie contented bereaue libertie alone oppresse bondage caused child birthe time eyther kylled else borne throwne awaye else sought minister hys crueltie wayes made way see exodus first chapter yet notwithstanding people grewe increased exceedingly lyke palme tree rose vp despite tyranny oppressed kept downe therfore doth acknowledge certayne singuler worke god goodnesse ought ascribed anye ceremony seing none thys tyme yet appointed god mixeth aduersitie among prosperitiefirst let v consyder howe tyme promise drew nigh god raysed vp king oppressed people tyranny intreated scarce hope deliuered thys god vsage olde mixe aduersitie prosperitie togyther suffer tyrannes rage destruction draweth nighest thys meane vseth trye fayth people verie carefull carelesnesse abuse liberty euerywhere example hereof dauid ezechiel infinite others hereto belongeth came passe people returned babilon restoring againe church neyther authoritie cyrus could represse attemptes enimies cambyses sonne following encouraged enimies church supportacion insomuch wrought vpon walles citie fayne worke one hande nehem fight profite diligently consyder thing bolde prosperitie least entangled securitie rather consyder howe must tryumphe vnder crosse therefore must prepare selues vnto howsoeuer thing seeme laugh vpon v small remembrance benefites receyued princesnext haue consyder sayth king arose knew ioseph searche chronicle shall finde scarce fiftie yeares betwene death ioseph raigne tyranne ioseph thirtie yeares age made ruler egypt followed seauen yeres plentie seconde yeare dearth sent father iacob come vnto wherefore allowe anye time prepare iourney iourney shall finde israell came egypt long ioseph fortie yeres age ioseph lyued yet three score tenne yeares moses sayth dyed hundred ten yeares olde israelite egypt two hundred ten yeares take three score ten yeres ioseph foure score yeares moses liued brought people shall three score yeares onely remaine betweene death ioseph byrth moses yet must taken ten yeares least amram liued matrimonie tyme persecution moses sonne borne playne aaron borne three yeares moses moses founde ryuer side sister marie age able talke pharaos daughter giue hir counsell howe saue bring vp childe consideration thing teache v howe little remembraunce prince worlde haue good turnes men doe vnto seing king following within little space ignoraunt ioseph whose counsell egypt preserued king power greatly increased drunken prosperitie good successe easily waxe prowde thinke heynous matter acknowledge themselues debters man therefore dauid truely wisely sayth put trust prince psal psalm anye childe man helpe agayne better trust lorde put confydence prince also taught howe hurtfull thing forget ignorant auncient actes lawes priuiledges place plainely testifieth thing cause cruell tyrannie length horrible destruction therfore notable custome persian median whose king hystoriographers saye contynually occupied reading chronicle howe much profite ensueth thereof hester onely hystorie mardocheus aboundantly declareth thirdlyethe wylynes tyraunts let v consider craftes tyrauntes vse oppressing subiectes pharao seemeth vse absolute power craftily circumuenteth people israel vseth matter seemeth haue great regarde publike tranquillitie equitie yet deede cruelly persecuteth people spoyled auncient libertie vndoubtedly complayned reason right straunge nation shoulde free haue libertie egyptian furthermore sheweth daungerous matter feared least ioyne forreyne nation aspyre kingdome egypt consider falling matter ende altogither couetousnesse taught egyptian howe waxe rich oppressing abusing labor others hereof followed crueltie passing infantes new borne coulde escape lawfull thinke doe thing haue violated broken lawe right haue tasted priuate aduantage profite thereby let v marke craft may learne easilier beware yet let v discouraged forasmuch commeth passe many time tyraunts enterprise set forth power glory god easily ouerturne deuises people godly prophet teacheth appeereth came passe place nowe steuen goyng forth narration bringeth forth moyses whome iewes captaine deliuerer lawe makermoses saued brought dignitie goodnesse god chiefely gloried prooueth preserued aduaunced high dignitie singuler goodnesse god nothyng wherein reioyce wherevpon easie euery man conclude deliuered ministerie receyued lawe much bounde goodnesse god three reason whereby prooueth haue sayde first arguing time sayth borne tyranne ragedof tyme coulde none meanes saued secret working goodnesse god addeth another poynt euen newe borne appeared manifest token goddes fauour surelye ascribed deserte moyses meane season must note howe borne deliuerer almost hope deliuerie himselfe lyke bee daunger coulde declare anye token valiauntnesse deliuering god vseth succour people hope past esaye sayeth maye doe worke straunge worke esay forget may execute afterwarde glorie god proper worke saue men doth hope helpe seemeth quite past lyke thing fell christes natiuitie iewes lost libertie compelled pay taxe tribute straunge prince ethnike euery man ceassed cyrenius promised long looked sauiour world borne yea borne stocke dauid esay lost dignitie seemed esaye sayde rotten vnprofitable stocke therfore let man despayre imminent affliction seconde argument whereby prooueth moses bee saued mercy godof cause efficient moouing parentes taketh parent brought vppe three moneths home house contrary king commaundement paule testifyeth interpreteth hebr worke fayth whereby respecting god mercie promise comforted durst breake king commaundement fayth boldenesse minde gyftes god euident needeth long proofe therefore must fayth moyses parent considered encouraged example must learne contemne wicked commaundementes oftyrauntes man obey godlynesse thinges must peter rule followed plainely sayth must rather obey god men maner order deliuerythirdly rehearseth order maner howe moyses saued grace power god may appeere pharaos daughter tooke cast riuer nylus brought vp bene hir owne sonne furthermore trayned vppe court maner wisedome egyptian became expert quality belonging ruler gouernour thinges attribute anye thing mannes desertes merites exod acknowledge god singuler grace fauour power god marueylous woonderfull disappoynteth laugheth tyrant enterprise pharao bringeth vp owne court hys owne bosome captaine deliuerer people sought oppresse whyle achab persecuteth prophetes church abdias faythfull defender prophetes true doctrine greatest honor authoritie court vnder romaine emperours sometime mainteyners true fayth greatest charge fielde although emperours would haue faith destroyed many example declare howe greatest enimies christ haue furthered set forwarde church therfore afrayde attempt ruled bridle god power prouidence let v also consider howe sayeth moyses brought vp maner wisedome egyptian christian therefore maye reade workes gentyles philosopher appeareth paule writing sermon wherein feately placeth sentence ethnickes yet meane must obserued least mystery worde god beginne contemned delyght gentyle philosophie make much thing writing openly impugne prophecy heauenlye wisdome thing commeth passe astrologer ouer curious searcher naturall cause yet ashamed defend vngodlynesse moyses example ought rather followe modestie description frame workmanship worlde hauing great occasion haue shewed set egypticall wisedome comprehendeth thing marueylous playnenesse breuitie curious wittes mathematicalles philosopher haue wearied braynes vnprofitably nowe manye hundred yeares referreth cause thing god alone scripture euerywhere doth easily saw wicked ostentation wit spoyle god part glorye bring gouernaunce world subiection bondage course creature therefore foolishnesse madnesse detestable make abraham moyses author iudiciall astrologie let v rather depende vppon god appoyntment prouidence onely goodnesse chose abraham moyses hath promised v hys sonne sauiour king whome prayse honor power glory amen xlviij homelie full fourtie yeares olde came heart visite brother child israel hee sawe one suffer wrong defended aduenged quarrell harme done smote aegyptian supposed brother would haue vnderstande god hande shoulde deliuer vnderstoode next daye shewed himselfe stroue would haue set one agayne saying sir yee brother hurt yee one another neyghbour wrong thrust awaye saying made thee ruler iudge ouer v wilt thou kill mee thou diddest aegyptian yesterdaye fledde moyses saying straunger lande madian hee begate twoo sonnes whereas blessed martyr steuen following order tracke storie father commen moyses iewes greatly glorie deliuerer lawe giuer diligentlye handleth hystorie partly bicause moyses touching deliuerie egypt figure christ bare witnesse christ partly bicause would seeme contemner moyses accused preached agaynst temple ceremony lawe bicause woulde quyte take vayne affiaunce outwarde ceremony sheweth father little trusted mannes righteousnesse moyses himselfe nothing whereof reioyce god bycause helpe man onely grace god saued called honour wherevpon followeth whatsoeuer afterwarde worthy singuler prayse commendation attributed vnto god goodnesse grace plainely set forth present place declareth moyses beganne vse office wherevnto god appoynted howe father vnworthily despised benifyte deliuery giuen vncourteously reiected moyses reuenger defender moses stirred vp god taketh vpon office deliuererhe beginneth moyses age cause mooued take vppon charge people grieuously afflicted sayth fourtie yeares olde gaue anye token people deliuerie meane time liuing court among noble realme seemed haue little regarde people thing steuen manifestly teacheth sayth full fourtie yeares age came heart visite brother put thought hart else coulde spring selfe one bene brought vp courtly pastymes taught science egypt secrete motion holye spirite twitched moyses eare one sleepe awoke mynde consideration auncient promise making hym ioyne himselfe people whose stocke vnderstoode sauiour mankinde shoulde borne paule agreeth herewith attributeth moyses vnto fayth fayth whole scripture teacheth gyfte god sayeth fayth moyses great honor refused called sonne pharaoes daughter chose rather suffer aduersitie people god hebru enioye pleasure sinne season estemed rebuke christ greater rich treasure egypt also appeareth euidently place prayse deliuerye ascribed god alone onely giue moyses strength put thereto heart also except drawne god doe goodthis must meane season serue learning moyses tooke hym care brother tyll stirred vp god hereof gather vniuersall doctrine yet ledde worldly fleshely desyres ruled worldly wysedome doe nothing good commendable god affayres vnlesse drawne motion holy ghost forasmuch selues paule sayth thinke well cor iohn cant christ teacheth v man commeth except father drawe wherefore bryde salomon cryeth without cause drawe mee thee wherevpon foloweth agayne prayse merite due workes whatsoeuer good thing doe grace onely also moyses example teacheth v dutie god stirreth draweth vswee must obey god calling drawing v iohn must yeelde thereto shewe selues obedyent force god calling faythfull want effect much christ sayth propertie sheepe heare voyce follow thing vse doe feruencie zeale despise thinges might hynder calling noysome verie dunge againe thinke nothing intollerable harde ioyned god calling thinges see example moyses soone heareth worde god speaking heart without anye delaye hee refuseth delycacies court pompe realme dignity publike authoritie friendship greatmen rich ease whatsoeuer else like court steade chooseth traueyles pouertie shame infinite daungers wherewith sawe people god euery daye vexed vnder cruell enimies see moses see apostle although forsooke great ryches yet little forsooke earnest affection zeale unto whome may ioyne zachaeus diuers example whome compare owne sluggishe slouthfulnesse thinke meete reasonable lose suffer thing christes sake shall plainely appeare howe farre yet christian perfection forsaking denying themselfe christ requireth disciple obedience fayth paule euery vrgeth without profession christian name vnprofitable obiect confesse sayde moses deliuery father aegypt grace yet thought father merites deserued god appoint hym reuenger defendour steuen therefore prudently preuenteth obiection sheweth father iewes delyuerie egypt deserued little prayse glorye rather worthy haue bene perpetually bondage bicause reiected benefite redemption offred god moses verie churlishly vnworthily proofe hereofhe alleageth storie written seconde erasmus may see thinketh luke place briefe short ende father despised benefite god moses deliuerer wherefore whole departure egypt attrybuted onely fauour god steuen also manifestly retorteth contempt moses wherwith charged vpon forefather vpbraydeth wyth olde vngodlynesse ingratitude rayling ent shewe howe well followed father steppe seeing like contempt reiected christ moses long commaunded heare follow omytte thing serue eruditionthe dutie magistrate first moses consydered dutie gouernour magistrate ashamed people whose shepheard ouerseer god appoynted hym therefore man must ashamed people committed god neuer great dignitie worlde though people neuer much despised iudgement worlde yet god sight verie deare hath vouchedsafe redeeme death owne sonne also defendeth agaynst open violence tyranny armed power protecteth though wyth daunger owne lyfe thus doth salomon describe dutie good prince shall delyuer poore cryeth needie also hath helper shall fauourable vnto simple needie shall preserue soules poore shall delyuer soules falshood wrong psalm deere shall bloud sight paule teacheth v god hath gyuen magistrate sworde thys ende keepe vnder frowardnesse vngodly rom defende innocent good therefore greatly deceyued bragge bare emptie tytle haue care people let tyrannes misseintreate thing chiefely consydered religion prince must see mainteyned among people drawne god superstitious tradition men therefore esaye calleth prince nurrices church glorie name would god would acknowledge suffer people committed charge bondage cruell tyrannye pope wicked counsel decree besides meane concorde betweene brother maintenaunce whereof becommeth aboue thing well see haue common weales safetie saying romane hystory confirmed example many kingdomes nation concorde small thing increase discorde great thing come decay doubt theyr ende alwayes vnhappie contynuall discension among themselues compare moses minde doings dayes haue rule christendome shall lesse marueyle vnhappie state age bicause raigne euerywhere ashamed people careleslye contemne else ouer great exaction vtterly impouerishe moreouer mainteyne diuision among conclude thinke theyr greatest prayse consist warres rashely vnaduisedly taken hande needelesse vnnecessarie shedding bloude let man grieued ingratitude peoplelet v also examine thankes moses gotte iewes louing benefite steuen sayth verie little naughty packe feared doe brother iniurie hys stowte naughtynesse burst agaynst opprobrious maner saying made thee ruler iudge ouer v wylt thou kyll also thou diddest aegyptian yesterday wordes vpbraydeth though tooke vpon ruler hauing refused forsaken rule authoritie sake also accuseth manslaughter yea murther daunger owne lyfe procured safegarde people although one noted naughty ingratitude yet appeareth many like minded bicause none rebuked sawsinesse malapertnesse long moses came pharaos knowledge whereof egyptian wytting must needes therfore israelite accuser whyt better delyuered egypt learned many signes woonders sent god captaine defendor oft thing fell mindes oft accused moses treason falshood property world sort recompence best benefactor fell moses came passe also vnto dauid ezechias iosias prophet among gentyles myltiades phocion camillus scypions infinite others consideration whome serueth teache v grieued ingratitude worlde leaue duetie vocation like cause let v therefore looke recompence hys hande liberall rewarder let v remember euen layde vp v heauen great rewarde faythfull little shall appointed hereafter ouer much see mathew fifth xxv chapter moreouera figure christ redemption moses example comprehendeth mystery redemption vpbraydeth v vnkindnesse toward christ moses forsooke pharaos court rich egypt visited brother tooke vpon defence iesus christ ye glory father vouchsafe humble himselfe incarnation became brother phil take vpon quarrell defence agayne moses reuenged defended israelite killing egyptian iesus vanquished slue deuil set v liberty feede woman promised whose merite serpent head troden downe moses author perswader brother concorde iesus christ prescrybeth hath set libertie merite death made child member body none thing precept charitie iohn hath appointed charitie cognizance disciple whereby knowne israelite afrayde murmure moses manye person feare murmure vnworthily lawes christ fewe acknowledge king delyuerer bicause part men eyther giue glory creature alone hath deserued else boldly robbing ascribe themselues merites owne workes therefore impudent charge iewes crime vngratefulnesse selues offende much sonne god shall profitablethe punishment ingratefull iewes nowe consyder punishment god vseth vnkinde person moses dryuen awaye entertayned iethro madian taketh daughter wyfe whome hath two child comfort exylement meane season israelite lack reuenger deliuerer fayne feele smart tyranny fortie yeares longer might haue bene deliuered draue moses away many time commeth passe naughtinesse cause god helpe v according goodnesse hys nature like came border lande chanaan grutching murmuring num deserued brought backe agayne wyldernesse fortie yeares longe afflicted kinde miserie dyed therefore author owne aduersitie accuse god vndeseruedly let marke complayne disease procure themselues owne distemperancie likewise away pouertie owne ryotousnesse fallen lyke also euen businesse saluation many disdayne imbrace righteousnesse god offereth v sonne dare set vp owne righteousnesse commeth passe owne desertes able neyther auouch owne righteousnesse god sight rom ne yet iustified saued christ last haue consider moyses flighthow godly may sometime flie whose example taught lawfull v sometyme prouyde selues flying keepe selues commodious season reade christ oftentimes math commaunded apostle doe lyke haue neede take good heede circumspect least vnder pretence christes commaundement seeke cloke wherewith hyde feare dastardlynesse vnhonest flying leaue standing wherein appoynted god moyses fled yet accused therefore bicause vnderstoode vngentle repulse time deliuerie yet come coulde yet bring egypt disdainfully cast soone beganne acknowledge appoynted god reuenger yeelded themselues calling god could threates tyrant discouraged flie neyther could haue auoyded name deceyuer nowe woulde rather haue prouyded owne safegard obeyed god read christ fledde knewe howre yet come come went death pacientlye without feare therefore whosoeuer publike office charge let set rule let thinke may leaue whose mindes see bent persist god vocation malice people first forsake dutie dishonestly reiect magistrate secular preacher worde faythfully dutie cause maye christ hath commaunded seeke owne suretie flying spare themselues better time oportunitie obedience fayth tempered loue god neyghbour shall much profitable shall cause blinded deceyued priuate affection god graunt mindfull grace good maye diligently defende vocation right course come marke blisse maye liue heauen iesus christ lorde whome prayse honour power glory euer amen xlix homelie fourtie yeres expyred appeared wildernesse mount sina aungell lorde flame fire bushe moyses sawe woondred sight drewe neare beholde voyce lorde came god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob moyses trembled durst beholde sayde lord put thy shooes thy feete place thou standest holye grounde haue perfitely seene affliction people aegypt haue hearde groning come downe deliuer come sende thee aegypt bicause steuen accused aduersaries spoken wicked blasphemous wordes agaynst moyses ceremony god giuen moyses therefore comprehendeth fewe wordes yet sufficient exposition hystorie moyses partly shewe thought reuerently partlye prooue saluation manne ought attributed ceremony bicause whatsoeuer good excellent thing moyses desert meere grace fauour god principall scope ende thinges call iewes vayne affiaunce ceremonialles lawe trust onely grace god christ ende declared moyses maner birth bringing vp first conuersation among israelite shewing howe vnworthie father declared selfe deliuerer seeing reiected greatest ingratitude could much fayne liue like banished man among madianites nowe foloweth solemne calling moyses wherby restored office agayne may easily perceyue token god fauour consider euery poynt thereof order first time noted moyses called fourtyeth yeare banishment madian time moyses calling came passe fowrescore yeare age ioyneth place kinde lyfe sayth wildernesse kept sheepe iethro father lawe may seene exod nowe consider time fourtie yeares shall appeare moyses serued god without anye temple ceremony lawe bicause playne thing instituted afterwarde meane excluded company common weale iewes remayneth must onely meere grace god thus called meane season haue diligently consider howe soone would haue ioyned himselfe church god felt ye griefe long banishment noble man came keeper sheepe hereof may gathered generall rule teaching v may trust forsake worlde ioyned vnto church god fall diuers affliction bicause worlde neyther suffer falling cannot abyde light truth moyses found iethro hoste father lawe yet made account keepe sheepe godly giue houseroume seeme greatlye fauour part liue yet miserablye contempt greatest temptation sometime woundeth heart open enimies cruellye commit agaynst v therefore christ warneth v rashly take vpon v profession name first trie selues whether able neede requyre suffer banishment pouertie infamie persecution lyke name sake luc thinges come passe let v followe moyses modestie constaunt fayth doubt sundry wayes tempted yet ouercommeth fayth caused preferre rebuke christ rich egypt let v also ouercome assaultes temptation ashamed crosse christ sake hath first vouchedsafe beare shall come passe ashamed v shall come glory father iudge quicke deade marc aungell lord calleth moyses secondarily steuen sheweth called moyses verily aungell lorde sayth appeared desert yet aungell within whyle sayth god abraham god isaac god iacob againe afterwarde sayth wash e whose working power moyses wrought signes woonders egypt guyde vnto people way desert paule apostle testifieth haue bene iesus christ promised sauior world1 cor steuen therfore calleth iesus angell lord acknowledged greater thing excellencie aungell seeming imitate esay time called aungell messenger great counsell tooke nature angelicall thing paule hebrewes cap expressely denieth sent god father world accomplished great eternall deuyse counsell god concerning redemption mankind paule teacheth chosen foundation worlde layde ephes peter sayth predestinate foreordeyned euerlasting1 pet shoulde redeemed merit must thinke without cause sayd haue appeared moyses hereby euident christ tooke beginning borne virgin marie fro euerlasting yea talked father tymes past thinges belonged saluation although yet incarnate made man yet diuine power goodnesse coulde choose helpe deliuer time appointed ment take manhoode iohn therefore sayth abraham abraham sawe daniel sawe clowdes heauen iudge lyke vnto sonne man dan came vnto olde aged furthermore peter plainly confesseth prophetes tymes past inspired spirite christ1 pet prophecied thing come therefore great temeritie vtterly refuse olde prophetes say bookes belong vnto v whereas illuminated christes spirite diuers sundrye wayes bare witnesse see iohn luc lette v rather acknowledge goodnesse god time past vouchsafe declare old father meane woulde set forth vnto v knowe antiquitie certaintie beliefe fierye bushefurthermore steuen diligently teacheth v fourme fashion christ appeared vnto moyses sayth aungell lorde christ appeared moyses flame fire bushe auncient guise vsage god talke men time past visible liknesse men able abide godly nature maiestie haue example euerywhere hystories patriarch prophetes causeth men attent heedefull admiration god otherwise woulde carelesly contemne godlynesse yet god part tooke formes shape agreeable present affayres time person thing also see done place woulde fiery bushe set moyses eye condicion state people afflicted egypt burned incensed cruell tyrannie pharao consumed bicause sonne god middle time appoynted shoulde take manhoode posteritie state church age consideration wherof shal profitable v often occupied like bramble bushe weake feeble flock cannot easily scattred abrode bicause thorowe faith straightly knit ioyned christ heade thereof therefore husbandman put fire vnto bramble thornes cleauing one another burne altogither worlde putteth fire persecution church one fire goeth destroye christ suffereth fire kindled bicause needefull way haue fayth people tryed fleshe kept vnder bridled yet suffreth church vtterly consumed himselfe middle thereof sayeth iohn math leaue comfortlesse vnto ende worlde hitherto belong whatsoeuer thing god hath done defence church since beginning world caine first set fire though killed brother abel yet could destroy fayth much lesse hinder god raysing vp freshe spring church seth neyther could mightie men went floud thing let perished deserued god could marueylously preserue certaine remnaunts church benefite arke bushe burned often also time iudges alwaye preserued god aide assistance burned babylon whence yet lorde brought agayne deliuered burned returne babylon length antiochus reygned seemed almost past recouerie god raysed vp machabees restored god religion brought people libertie agayne burned christ borne whole three hundred yeares almost vntill time constantine great yet god neuer fayled able defende people middle fire sometime daniel felowes burneth euen day euerywhere put firebrandes vnder inflame mightyest monarch worlde hatred agaynst hir yet shall neuer preuayle much woulde shall feele wrath god vengeaunce whose sight death precious psal suffer bloude hys belooued vnreuenged yea whyle persecuting tyraunts put fire vnder church lyke drie woode consumed fire god iudgement church meane whyle abyding middle fire persecution lyke leade cauldron mettall tryers melt get golde siluer see sayde similitude zacharie let v come calling whereby restored office beganne execute fortie yeares moses calling calling hath certaine pointes consideration wherof verie profitable first god declareth hee least moses might doubt thing certainetie vocation sayth amazed sight bushe burning god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob pleased god among many stylesthe god ye father c vse tytle chiefely call moses remembraunce couenaunt made abraham promise made long vnto father declaring thereby forgetfull couenaunt promyses although hytherto suffered people afflicted example taught aduersitie chiefely haue respect god promise god neyther forget fayle perfou yea see truth god promise infallible god forsaketh deade whome hath taken tuition hee lorde lyfe death rom wherefore neyther lyfe death seperate v loue god whether liue die lord ende sayth god abraham isaac iacob yet deade long thus spake christ reason calleth lazarus friend iohn dead buryed whervnto chiefely appertayneth christ place tooke generall doctrine confirme resurrection deade math certaintie eternall lyfe sadduceyes cauillations let v therefore occupyed meditation tytle oft feare death ariseth v shall perceyue shall delyuered care pensiuenesse whereas moses feared aswell sight burning bushe voyce godthe shooes must put durst come neere tolde must doe god sayth moreouer put thy shooes thy feete place whereon thou standest holy grounde sayth bicause hys owne appointed place set forth hys lawe without cause steuen maketh mention precept hereby meaneth admonishe iewes god tyme past requyred moses also requyreth v nowe dayes saye neyther temple neyther leuiticall worshipping colde ceremony whether bloud ox goates purge mind beastly affection signifyed shooes wholy ioyned sinceritie fayth puritie mindes true worshipping god christ otherwheres sayth consisteth spirite truth herevnto belongeth precept washing feete iohn whereof ought haue greater respect outwarde thing must also marke euery howe scripture testifie vnto v iohn god present euery place daylie example aboundantly prooue god seeth affliction peoplelast god openeth intent pleasure vnto moses haue sayth perfitely seene affliction people aegypt haue heard groning come downe delyuer word serue aptly ste en purpose declare desert israelite ought delyuered god regarded nothing affliction wherewith miserably troubled wherevpon followeth benefite deliuerie appertayneth meere grace god wee also taught god doth neglect people although sometime seemeth doe seeth teares psalm dauid sayth put bottle sight heareth onely crie also groning bicause searcheth heart reynes reade hystories finde example euerywhere whereby may easily prooued let serue therefore comfort v forsaken false vnkinde person let also serue instruct v vnaduisedly afflict whome god hath speciall care hereto appertayneth written exodus concerning wydowes fatherlesse straungers cry vnto written zacharie second chap toucheth toucheth apple mine eye chiefely let v haue regarde giue se e wholy god considering miserie mankinde hath giuen v sonne iesus christ deliuerer reuenger whome e prayse honor glorye power euer amen l homelie moses whome forsooke saying made thee ruler iudge god sende bee ruler delyuerer handes aungell appeared bushe brought shewing woonders signes aegypt redde sea wildernesse fortie yeares moses sayde vnto child israel prophet shall lorde god rayse vp vnto brother like vnto mee shall heare althoughe steuen taught none waye fayth saluation founded vpon merite iesus christ promised sauiour whome moses prophet beare witnesse yet accused teacheth newe fayth erronious yea blasphemer moses father goeth abolishe fayth obserued deliuered v state worlde day follow fayth deliuered apostle sealed bloud martyr accused subuerters auncient religion condemners olde father haue doe thys case steuens example teacheth v reasoneth diligently large touching beliefe father chiefely cyteth hystorie moses rehearsall therof might shew partly reuerently iudged moses partly prooue enimie auncient religion father although taught ceremony nowe put awaye without well ynough serued god yea without moses also pleased god aduaunced high dignitie honor vnlearneder sort nowe dayes must taught beliefe doctrine martyr time past howe saued without thing whereabout day bytter contention steuen brought oration solempne vocation moses prosecuteth length entreth prayses moses first testifyeth acknowledgeth thing moses god bestowed vpon hym prooueth hys doctrine iesus christ testimonie moses whose meaning sayth israelite stick lawe ceremony gyuen haue eye especiall prophet god afterwarde sende whome signe figure onely notable place whereby taught must thinke speake reuerently ministerie vertues saint yet leaue iesus christes honor whole hymselfe onely hath preheminence thinges concerne true worshypping god meane saluation moses ruler delyuerer israelfirst begynneth office moses excellent thing could deuise sayth god sent ruler delyuerer people israell thys thing proponeth hytteth agayne teeth ingratitude father vnworthily refused moses laying charge contemned whome greatly bragged sayth thys moses whome denyed saying made thee ruler iudge god sende ruler delyuerer hand aungel c nowe bycause acknowledged moses ruler delyuerer people god thys one thing might haue bene sufficient proofe ynough agaynst aduersaryes complayned hauing spoken blasphemie agaynst moses god aduau ceth abiect despysedwe haue chiefely consider howe god maketh ruler deliuerer hys people already hated egyptian refused hys bretherne israelite long time bene banishment example learne iudge neyther owne case mennes according iudgement worlde oftentimes falleth greatest fauour god whome worlde contemptuously abhorreth disdayneth thys god propertie choose humble base confounde pryde worlde reade hundred xiij psalme god taketh vp simple dust lyfteth poore mire may set prince euen prince people wherevnto holy uirgin singeth lyke luke hath put downe mightie seate hath exalted humble meeke example hereof haue onely moses also dyuers others god assekeeper made saule king dauid tooke sheepefolde set hym vp princely throne wherevnto may also referred done apostle part fyshermen authoritie worlde aduaunced high might called conqueror whole world preaching worde brought obeysance christ within fewe yeres may despysed wythout glory receyue comfort also aloft hyghe degree may learne humble least presumption salomon sayth go destruction prouer sort moses sayde delyuerer peoplefurthermore let v see respect moses called delyuerer people thys vnderstanded though dyd anye thing owne priuate power authority steuen plainly testifieth sent delyuerer hande aungell appeared bushe belonged delyuerie people appoyntment commaundement iesus christ whome last sermon declared aungell manifest therefore moses minister glorye delyuerie due onely christ sense place scripture must taken expounded wherein anye thing peculyer vnto god attributed n none sort waye ministerie take hande commaundement god sayde minister plant buylde wynne men vnto god remyt sinnes keepe vnremitted bicause doe thinges owne power pleasure bicause god doth vouchsafe vse ministerie bringing passe also euen wythout pleasure able rule gouerne thing bicause sayde moses made ruler deliuerer people god sheweth howe vsed office brought forth moses fulfilleth office delyuerer shewing wonder signes aegypt redde sea wyldernesse fortie yeares steuen acknowledgeth moses bare name delyuerer onely wyllingly confesseth faythfully discharged fulfilled office bicause would seeme conceale nothing made hys glory maketh mention signes woonders god wrought woonders signes deuided three sortes diligently set moses wrytings first sort done egyptmoses myracles egypt amongst first placed wrought purchase credite vocation turning rodde serpent serpent eate sorcerer roddes enchauntment transformed serpent followed ten horrible prodigious plague wherewith god marueylously afflicted pharao egyptian egyptian water turned bloud made onely vnfyt vse also vpbrayded egyptian bloudy tyranny babeslaughter frogges sent onely fieldes also crawling house troublesome oyse vexed guiltie conscience followed lyce troublesome frogges bicause stacke fast vnto bodyes eating fleshe came dyuers swarmes flyes heapes vexing men beastes bicause thys might perhaps seeme ea ytings tryfles yet grieuous thys sent among horrible contagyous rotte murhen kylled vp cattle small great mennes bodyes rose filthy botch sore vgly running monstrous hayle destroyed whole yeares crop increase hayle touched sproong afterwarde grounde againe caterpyllers deuoured lying fieldes thicke bayle bycause wyttingly wyllingly persisted blinde wilful ignorance god sent among fearefull feeleable darkenesse length aungell strake egypt fylled slaughter first borne house voyde horrible calamitie mourning consideration teacheth v howe easie vnto god keepe downe vanquishe mightie tyraunts deede lorde hostes vseth send forth well good aungels badde yea creature world enimies creature vyle weake able ynough vexe yea kill man please god arme therevnto iustice iudgement came passe pharao troubled frogges vexed swarmes louse fly long prowdely ected god hebrues mouse reuenged wicked contempt name amonge philistine gotten arke god handes sacrament signe presence reade antiochus sylla herode diuers eaten vp louse vermine bredde owne fleshe let v therefore humble selues sight god like mad men suffer selues bewitched vaine hope confidence thing temporall myracle red seathe seconde sorte myracles wrought moyses came passe red sea israelite inclosed chariot horseman egyptian thought must needes perishe eyther vpon swordes else swallowed vp sourges sea sodeinly sea stricken moyses rodde god commaunded deuyded selfe two part lyke walle standing side winde blowing roughly dryed vppe myerie fourde israelite went middle sea drie foote whome egyptian deadly hatred pursued sodeynly heapes water ioyned togither agayne oppressed swallowed vp myracle god euidently taught v able helpe people thing seeme hurtfull agaynst giue passage escape middle thinges lye waye wa ke hys vocation agayne vseth punishe enimies thing haue hope affiaunce yea blinde eye sende spirite gyddinesse shall runne owne mischiefe able anoyde daungers lying face certayne egyptian tooke redde sea sure bulwarke thought israelite wiues child shoulde pershe therein yet god prouidence ordreth thing israelite passe safely body goodes egyptian bee drowned owne heade enter middle sea betweene two mayne walles water notwithstanding often felt god heauye hande whereby learne shoulde despayre aduersitie put trust confidence outwarde thinges bycause god able quickly turne thinges vpside downe myracles desertin thirde sort steuen comprehendeth done wildernesse people manna giuen vnto fedde fourtie yeares togither quayles fell rounde tentes moyses opened veines quicke spring hard rockes godly prayer gate glorious victorie amalechi e god marueylously defeated sleyghtes balaam wicked murmurer perished straunge plague garmentes fourtie yeares space neyther consumed wearing neyther dyd rotte oldenesse omit diuers thing moyses diligently rehearsed seeing steuen willinglye acknowledgeth thing highly commendeth abundantly declareth doe small iniurie accuse contemner moyses bicause sendeth israelite moyses christ euidently sheweth al signes serued confirme moyses doctrine ought racked ende cause people depende hang vpon moyses confuted place abuse myracles wrought sometime saintes pro ue superstitious inuocating worshipping whereas witnesse doctrine whereby brought vnto christ bicause ignorant aduersaries chiefelye vrged argument ledde hearer doctrine ceremony lawe vnto christ beliefe prooueth doth contempt moyses according example commaundement moyses sayeth sayde vnto child israel prophete shall lorde god rayse vp vnto brother lyke vnto shall hear wherevpon gathereth moyses meaning iewes shoulde sticke ceremony giuen promised another prophete whose saying must hearken vnto else perish body soule prophete christ1 pet scripture calleth prince prophetes whose spirite prophet inspired also beateth backe accusation contemning moyses vpon owne heades whyle sheweth refuse iesus christ whome moyses earnestly authoritie commended place xviij deuteronomie vpon explication whereof haue spoken largely xxiiij sermon expounded place peter sermon brought text let v learne god father shoulde heare christ obedient vnto true obedience fayth obteyne saluation whome prayse honour power glory euer amen lj homelie congregation wildernesse angell spake mount sina father man receiued worde life giue vnto v whome father would obey cast heart turned backe agayne aegypt saying vnto aaron make v god go v moyses brought v lande aegypt wee wote become made calfe dayes offered sacrifice vnto ymage reioyced ouer workes owne handes bycause iewes trust saluation outwarde ceremony gloryed keeping fayth auncesters forefather accused taught men seeke saluation christ onely great blasphemie agaynst god agaynst moses father steuen founde true haue declared would easilye cleere himselfe hereof breaketh forth prayse moyses greatly extolling declaring vnworthily father intreated ende laye crime wherewith charged vpon father whome greatly gloryed also vpon themselues stubbornely refused christ whome sheweth moses bare witnesse moreouer gathereth hereof father saued none desertes meere mercy god therefore ought put hope trust none ende also present place first rehearseth setting forth lawe whereof moses minister afterwarde declareth heynous trespasse father offending agaynst moses lawe god lawe gyuen moysesand speaking setting forth lawe maketh mention two thing able purchase small credit vnto moses first sayth congregation father wildernesse wordes comprehendeth fourtie yeares space wherein suffered great fayth pacience nation iewes founde hystories compared argument singuler fayth coulde ouercome terror continuall labour vnkindenesse people would stoutly go forth charge giuen god seconde sayth spake aungell appeared afterwarde familiarly conuersant appoynted god interpreter people exo declared paule thys aungell christ wherefore moses dignitie declared wherein excelled prophetes age thus reade god sayde prophet lordes among knowne vision num speake vnto sleepe seruaunt moses faythfull house vnto speake mouth mouth thing steuen calleth remembraunce make vnderstande howe great authoritie moses oracle god gaue ought haue bene father time passed ought nowe also ende afterwarde addeth man receiued worde lyfe giue vnto v without cause calleth lawe word lyfe purgeth himselfe cryme contemning lawe setteth forth one word effect lawe truly lawe liuely worde worde lyfe although otherwheres paule calleth strength sinne ministerie working death cor cor leuit teacheth v rule howe liue holily promiseth lyfe fulfill next leadeth men vnto christ whome meane saluation yea life selfe conteyned cause paule resembleth schoolemayster moses sayth set lyfe iewes galat bicause shewed lawe true way howe attayne vnto lyfe thing becometh v acknowledge lawe rightly iudge therof compare corruption nature may worthily called strength sinne ministery death bewraieth sinne otherwise lurketh v vnknowne witnesseth haue deserued death furthermore teacheth v weake able fulfill righteousnesse therof owne power merites escape wrath god rom moses deliuereth precept receyued god thing paule entreateth large ought well marke howe sayth moses deliuered israelytes deuyses owne brayne worde lyfe receyued god thing appeareth perfourmed diligence without certaine expresse word god neuer durst institute decree thing doubtfull matter may see case blasphemer man brake sabboth daye polluted touching dead coarses myght come passeouer feast congregation moses obserued leuit nume prophetes apostle time past commaunded also obserue teach nothing owne head vnder colour god name shoulde diligently set forth worde god speaking scripture god putteth wordes hieremies mouth commaundeth ezechiel take worde mouth shew vnto people hierem ezech math apostle commaunded teache nation thing learned christ bragge succeeding apostle like diligence obserued shoulde haue church true godlynesse fayth lesse errour superstition consider moses prophetes apostle shall finde boldenesse pope rome detestable arrogate themselues power make new lawes newe article faith whose licentious lust come passe yoke christian grieuous burthenous yoke iewes secondlythe law giuen also came obserued steuen testifieth law giuen father liuing onely moses time also vnto posteritie yea includeth himselfe others nowe professed christ number whome giuen place errour manifestly confuted thinke thing done moses prophetes according god appoyntment belong vnto father howbeit euident god euerlasting vnchaungeable therefore must needes alwayes one vnchaungeable maketh matter though manye thinges abrogated sometime appoynted olde father ought haue remayned vntill time correction resemblaunces shadowes thing verity whereof fulfilled christ thing consisted worshipping god ought spirituall iohn bicause god spirit meane time true point faith religion first declared beginning world fully afterward set forth moses prophetes remayne safe sounde wherevnto prophete respect saying esay math worde lorde endureth euer christ sayth worlde shall peryshe one tytle lawe shall perishe let man therfore beguyle himselfe false hope though thinges deliuered father time past also spoken v seeing fayth lyfe deedes must tryed examined according rule olde lawe let v returne vnto steuen ynousnesse idolatry exodus whiche setteth agaynst publication lawe ingratitude naughtynesse father vniustly reiecting moses lawe although myght haue recyted diuers naughty deedes yet bringeth sinne idolatrie onely whereby appeareth plainely howe small authoritie god law contrary commaundement durst make ymage god appoynt newe kyndes worshipping whereas many dayes heard terrible diuine maiestie storie exodus xxxi ha steuen arke ende herein prooue father alwayes moses present trimly trode steppe frowardnesse therefore father olde time saued grace onely none hope saluation founded vppon grace god shall profite v diligently consider fewe wordes wherein heynous disobedience comprehended bicause cunningly paynt vnto v begynninges proceedinges idolatrye beginning going forwarde ydolatriefirst declaring fountayne euill sayth father would obey liuely worde god lawe heart returned egypt name egypt comprehendeth abhominable superstition raigned nation whervpon sayth set myndes againe noteth execrable leuitie inconstancie soone forgotten grieuous seruitude bondage woonderfull deliuerie would imitate folow whose name ought hart haue abhorred contempt wordethis fountayne vngodlynesse heart turne worde god president example men studie please god forthence springeth detestable vnstablenesse maketh v onely forget lawe god quyte putteth remembraunce thrall bondage tyme haue bene haue example hereof dayes euerywhere please worlde followe superstitiousnesse thereof intollerable yoke antichristianitie wherewith oppressed extenuate make verye light bicause seeme doe wickedly altogyther contempt god law followeth contempt moses contempt minister manifestly expresse wordes saye moses brought v lande aegipt wote become confesse benefite receyued moses meane wote befallen yet sawe goe vp vnto mountaine god calling also bade abyde hys comming appoynted hur aaron vycares delegate yet though bene left doubtfull vncertayne thing dare complayne whereby appeareth moses authoritie small seeing coulde wickedly cast lawe god alwayes men harte contempne worde god vseth breede contempt lothing god mynisters sathan knoweth god hath set labourer watchman whose admonition kept eyther well else brought waye doe erre laboureth onely discredite bring authoritie wyth men place teacheth v iudge vse scoffe rayle mynisters worde surely argument prooue despysers god worde although neuer much denye vseth contempne legate ambasadour honoureth prince sent learned et light coulde contempne mynisters legate fountaynes beganne idolatrie springnewe goddes whyle saye ote become moses adde make go v shal thinke become madde iudge goddes coulde made handes men wou e haue visible signe token god presence whereby might assured god present helpe wherevnto might dyrect ceremony outwarde seruice worshipping bycause swarued worde deuyse man reason cause golden calfe molten following egyptian worshipped apis god fourme calfe wherein commit manifolde errour first doubte presence god whose many notable signes hitherto seene neyther remember woonders shewed egypt redde sea neyther regarde piller clowde fire went campe neyther mindefull dreadfull maiestie appeared mounte sinai next contrarie commaund ment god make molten image wherein go expresse fourme shape god prophet sayth tourne maiestie god similitude calfe eateth haye psal therefore doe god extreme dishonour make new goddes imagine god farre maner one deede next step idolatrie men contented suche meanes pleased god reueale himselfe dare owne heades deuise newe meanes god reuealeth himselfe worde sacrament frame workemanship worlde creature appeare euident token godlye wisedome goodnesse iustice omnipotencie intent seeing thinges might stirred vp co sideration god true godlynesse nothing almost conteyned worlde holy ghost hath taken parable whereby shadoweth mystery god saluation therfore eye euery side beholde image consecrated worde god admonishe v dutie whosoeuer despyse image follow reason fleshe choose polluted vice idolatrie herein came passe vnto iewes reade also fell among gentyles rom idolatry among christian sprang cause euident needeth long proofe furthermore taught howe requisite childehoode well instructed religion seing israelite many myracles seene hearing worde god fall agayne kinde idolatrie vsed egypt thys newe god foloweth worshipping wherefore saythworshipping idolles offred sacrifice vnto calfe howbeit woulde seeme haue offered true god brought lande egypt make mention true god aaron reade proclaymed holye day lorde bicause calfe neyther sometime rule ofhis worde holy ghost speaking steuen ther opinion worshippe resteth image st etcheth vnto god similitude represen idol represent god truth self idol image habacuc prophet calleth lying deuil god beside reioyced workes owne wordes expressed partly trust mindev reioycing idolater ioye ringeth thereof ought sought god onely partly kinde outward reioycing whereinto ydolaters vse fall without modestie measure holye historie sheweth thing came passe thys place assoone calfe molten grauen great showte cry thy god israel brought thee lande aegypt filled fleshe offred idoll rise vp play ho propertie idolater idol men heart prophet sayth commeth passe reioyce god onely reioyce idol ought ledde gouerned spirite god rage immoderate vnseasonable pastime nowe thou wilt compare thing hytherto spoken done papa ie popedome thou shalt see one beginning canst thou alleage ydolatrie men leaue worde god turne agayne harte abhominations iewes idolater whence benefite god delyuered appeareth well dyuers doings agree rytes ceremony iewes gentile contempt worde followed contempt ministerie ignoraunce blockheadnesse priestes greatly set forwarde sent simple people dumbe ymages learne belonged saluation springes issued newe goddes like men like woman like oldemen like yong yea beside fourmes men added fourefooted beast fowles ayre wormes earth fyshes sea let passe gastly fourmes sightes souldyours whoorishe prancking decking image haue represented lykenesse saint god hymselfe new goddes must haue new wayes maners worshipping therefore honor temple buylded aulters theyr sinnes greatly reioyced workes owne handes wanted libertie carnall ioyes neuer raigned feastes dedication goddes grieuous great blyndenes god hath deliuered v light gospell let v therfore hereafter flee inuencions owne witte workes owne handes let v serue god father lorde iesus christ spirite truth whome prayse honor power glory amen lij homelie god turned himselfe gaue vp shoulde worship therefore translate beyonde babylon amongst many thing iesus christ foretold come passe ye faythfull preacher hys gospell least sayde worlde shoulde persecute publike enimies true religion thing see apostle founde true euen first springth church among steuen chiefely goeth bring men vnto christ accused spoken blasphemy agaynst god moses lawe ceremony thereof boldly wisely aunswereth shamelesse sclaunders rehearsing auncient religion whereby father saued diligently expounding thing done moses declaring howe receyued worde lyfe god deliuered vnto father sheweth moreouer father neuer obedient god commaundements addicted outward ceremony onely feyned diuers thing owne braine contrary true religion meane goeth put mind vayne trust father religion moste daungerous impediment let would come right waye saluation ende therefore recyted hystorie golden calfe whereby conuinceth father great vngodlynesse shewing saued meere fauour seeing deserued destruction wicked idolatry adioyneth herevnto present place verye handsomely declaring alone sinned herein prooueth posteritie followed steppe rehearsing idolatry posteritythe idolatrye israelytes cotinuance seemeth preoccupation thence preuenteth man shoulde make lyght ye erecting calfe say long ago expiated godlynesse successor excuse left bicause lyttle better first fall rather increased whole heapes impietie following throwne awaye worde god rushed owne destruction myndes bent vngodlynesse god tenderly fauoured turneth back giueth ouer reprobate sense worship hoste skye greedinesse followe maner superstition gentyles fewe wordes steuen briefely comprehendeth euer afterwardes agaynst lawes god salomon first beginner euill wyues sake aliauntes straungers builded temple vnto diuers god sydonians reg moabites ammonite nation ieroboam brought againe superstitious worshipping calues1 reg reg para para achab brought honouring baal amasias madde counsell deuyse setteth vp goddes idumeans whome vanquished worshipped achaz delyted god religion assirians length manasses following farre passed wickednesse forefather brought iurie whatsoeuer superstition ydolatrie founde among gentyles force defended religion agaynst true worshipper god insomuch reade hierusalem filled bloude saintes2 reg whose impietie tooke deepe roote coulde wholy pluckte vp agayne iosias dayes sermon ieremie sophonie abundantly declare least man might marueyle howe thing came passe god giuen lawe sayth iustlye forsaken god giuen vp reprobate minde vtterly blinded iust iudgement god may easily gathered thing going vngodlynesse vnthankfulnesse deserued neyther worde god infinite thinges whereby pleased god reueale himselfe vnto coulde keepe dutie worthy therefore euen seeing shoulde blinde hearing deafe hardened hart god threatneth prophete esay yet may see nation lyke example god iudgementes rom paule affirmeth gentyles superstition would god sawe lyke euen among glorye name christian banished authoritie god worde lyked learne rather dumbe ymages liuely worde god ranne farre superstition iewes turkes laughed commeth remembrance notable saying turkishe ambassador court great christian prince asked turkes abhorred christian religion coulde induced beleeue aunswered man right witte coulde alowe lyke religion worshipped goddes inferior lesse power worshipped ment therby declared breaden god idol worshipped church made worshipped prooue sufficiently sayde religion preposterous contrary common sense reason thinges christian prince knowe bishop people generall yet man grieued great iniurie thereby done vnto christ wise men without cause afrayde many euen dayes also giuen vppe reprobate mindes place teacheth v also man holde right waye religion except first guyded hande spirite god naturall man perceyueth thinges belonging spirite god1 cor iohn man commeth christ except father drawe bicause draweth worde must studie whosoeuer make light thereof cast fro make themselues vnworthye grace god wherefore god turneth backe vpon wrappeth darkenesse deuoyde light truth therefore behooueth v haue diligent care worde depende vppon entred ryght waye swarue neyther right hande left deut least man impudent denye father thus steuen alleageth testimonie prophete amos place amoz v ch written v chap lord accuseth people israell well many vice abode syncerely worde heynousnesse sinne might appeare men might see howe god doth expostulate without cause sheweth olde impietie begun somtime wildernesse afterwarde increasing become incurable taken awaye destruction whole nation shall make much instruction diligently consider euerye thing sayde first speaketh disobedience wickednesse father wildernesse wordes gaue yee sacrifice meate offering space fourtie yeares wildernesse ye house israel asking question fortifieth saying denyeth father gaue sacrifice fourtie yeres long yet appeareth built tabernacle according god appointed alters vpon offred kind sacrifice vnto god brought lande egypt god denyeth thing done honour done ende appointeth god appoynted ende outwarde ceremony shoulde resemblance sauiour promysed shoulde admonish dutie well fayth religion whole conuersation lyfe forgetting occupied ye bare ceremony thought satisfied god purged sinnes whereby came passe abused leuiticals cloke colour licentiousnesse wickednesse therefore god worthily refuseth worshipping sayeth belonged also place scripture wherein constantlye affirmeth sheweth obseruation thing diligently prescribeth lawe profitable looke psalm esay mich hosea yea sawe gloryed circumcision hauing respect spirituall circumcision cryeth circumcision auayleable ierem taught therefore place worshipping vayne done ende god hath appoynted without obedience fayth kinde worship please god heb worde god neglected remayneth place faith obedience therfore vncleane prophane thing whatsoeuer doe although outwardly appeare agreeable worde god shall say ceremony stande onely vpon mannes authoritie tradition lord long ago one word hath vtterly ouerthrowne saying worship vaine teaching doctrine men euery plant heauenly father hath planted esay math shall pulled vppe rootes lorde holding repeating sinnes israelite rehearseth posteritie possession lande chanaan tooke vnto tabernacle moloch starre god rempham figure made worshippe comprehendeth sortes idolatrie vnder three kindes worshipping molochthe first worshipping moloch appeareth actes salomon first builded temple god ammonite seemeth god called mennes natiuities byrthes honour whome infantes sacrificed fire manasse sacrificed sonne fire god appoynted death punishment wickednesse declared leuiticus wordes whosoeuer hee child israel straungers dwell israel giueth seede vnto moloch let slayne people lande shall stone set face agaynst manne destroye among people bicause hee hath giuen seede vnto moloch defyle sanctuarie pollute holye name though people land hyde eye man giueth seede vnto moloch kill put face agaynst man agaynst kindred destroye go whoring commit whoredome moloch among people yet coulde authoritie seuere inhibition weyght wicked kinde sacrificing common easily maye appeare prophecie ieremie xxxij chap god remphamthe seconde kynde idolatrie worshipping starre consecrated god called rempham read nothing certainty thinke ye planet saturne venus mar deede worshipping starres vsed amongst nation bicause marueylous course brightnesse fourme easily perswaded simpler sort men godheade hereto referred place scripture sayde iewes worshipped hoste heauen haue consider worshipping starres cosisteth adoration sacrifice sometime vsed among gentyles also worship thinke successe warres peace famine plentie sickenesse tempestes lyke thinges depende manifest thing gouerned rule god prouidence whose iudgements tied vnto starres ordred rule worde immutable therefore whosoeuer attribute thing vnto starres denye god honour make man excellentest creature god subiect course planet starres cause blindenesse dayes much bewayled gone farre consulteth starres enterprising greatest affaire hang hope eyther good successe stande feare badde doe rather lysten prophete sayth shall lear e wayes hea en sha ot ayde fo token heat heathen iere third sor compr hendeth figure similitudesworshipping image made ende would v deuised worshipping men ill seeme honour workes image instruction ignoraunt learned men theyr owne head deuice tute th nges religion god hathe commaunded god hath commended vnto v reine benefites fewe sacramentes yea th se easy obserued instruction hath appointed worde himselfe preached would haue voyce onely hearde similitude image sene therefore let v contented thinges deut brydle wisedome vnruly fleshe least wyser meete become fooles paule sayth gentile philosopher rom last threateneth incurable impietie euery day waxyng worse worse punishment saying translate cary beyonde babylon amos sayth damascus bicause would put ten e tribe myndes vayne affiaunce league assirians steuen hauing respect sense sayth shoulde caried beyonde babylon came passe deede salmanazar kyng assirians taken samaria ouerthrewe kingdome tenne tribe caried captiue syria long senacherib miserably afflicted kingdome iury whereas ezechias counsell turned vnto lord threw idolles againe deliuered hande tyrant helpe aungell vnder manasse turned vomite agayne set vp abhominable superstition idolatry againe woulde admit reformation iosias begun would commit idolatry secretly house appeareth sermon sophony god sent nabuchodonozer destroy citie set fire temple cary remnaunt people beyonde babylon ouer kyngdome thus god reuege incurable idolatry prophane cotempt holy name reade like came passe agayne returned home babylon made temple religion market lucre gayne denne theeues would admit christ reforme heare apostle god brought vespasian titus reforme set fire citie churche scattered iewes liuing ouer partes world ought dayes diligently consider thing horrible mischiefe idolatry greatly increased among christian lack moloch lyeth lurking amongest monkes chalenging burning baptisme grafted christ many beguiled superstitious obseruasion starres image made v worship learne stande euery solde god hath many yeares preaching worde required reformation vayne wherefore feared lea n b reformed bicause seeme haue erred shall length destroyed surely feare vayne suspect turkes shall make away uident mpire th east de ided wes image sake th sarazen turkes g eatly increa ed tha go may shewe v plain ly maner abolishers idolatry hath long since appointed experien e teacheth v horrible example god sheweth vpon obstinate image worshipper euery day ye turk surely may thinke without prouidence god soliman emperor turkes many yeares ago h wonne buda see paulus iouius historie yme booke chiefe citie hungary would haue mary church chiefe church citie cleane ridde altares image church would yeelde thankes god almighty victory giuen vnto hym hereby god woulde plainely testifye idolatrie exercised vnder pretence christ hys saintes chiefest cau e turkishe ouerthrowes calamity wherefore tyme warneth v length awake casting v vayne inuentions men worship god father according prescript truth spirite iesus christ lorde whome prayse honor power glorye euer amen liij homelie ovr father tabernacle witnesse wildernesse appoynted speaking vnto moses make accordyng fashion sene tabernacle also father came brought iosue possession gentyles whome god draue face father vnto tyme dauid found fauour god would fayne haue founded tabernacle god iacob salomon built house howbeit highest dwelleth temple made handes sayth prophete heauen seate earth footestoole house builde mee sayth lorde place rest hath hand made thinges accusation steuen consisted two speciall pointes one went abolish put away law spoken blasphemye temple rite ceremony first hath thus farre answered vnto disputing earnestly reuerently touching lawe moses minister thereof hath shewed giuen god moses confesseth worde lyfe bicause comprehendeth rule life leadeth v guide teacher vnto christ furthermore bicause iewes gloried much name father declared alwayes disobedient appeareth saued merite righteousnesse lawe benefite god mercy fauou done passeth parte accusation reasoneth holy place temple wherin chiefe hope helpe consisted short ende steuens saying prooue god right worshipping hym tyed vnto temple wherevpon followeth oughte straight wayes taken blasphemer god speake agaynst abolishing therof first therfore intreateth tabernacle temple builded foure hu dred fourescore yeares comming egipt tabernacle place ordeyned god seruice inthe worshipping god tyed vnto tabernacle made boordes sechim woode hanged rounde curtines caried vpon two staues running ringes gold curtines fastened togither loupe button silke tabernacle arke couenaunt golden table candlesticke altare incense altare burne sacrifice brasen lauer residue implementes belonging seruice concerning see exod c thinges easily graunteth father wildernesse moses appointment god mouth interpreter calleth tabernacle witnesse bicause god testified presence gaue answere place resoluing people doubtes addeth three thing wherby prooueth worshipping god god himselfe bound place first saith madethe tabernacle type heauenly thing according paterne saumpler shewed moses mountaine whereby appeareth figure serued shadow mystery heauenly thing paule also viij ix cap hebrewes hath declared tent figure church god haue one althoughe consist diuers kyndes order men hath teacher steade pillers paule calleth iames peter iohn gal hath boordes ceder tree couered ouer golde wherby faythfull signified whome fayth beliefe maketh vncorrupt shining heauenly brightnesse ioyned togither band aswel doctrine belief loue builded vpon christ buttrace foundation ye whole church arke conteyning true treasure heauenly mystery prepareth v table may receiue breade eternall lyfe place candlesticke light word shineth vpon church prayer also offered pleasaunt incense odoure sweete smell god father true altare vppon whome must offer selues whole conuersation lyfe thinges might largely intreated touche chiefe pointes may appeare euery man steuen sayth tabernacle made heauenly paterne ende verilye might therby vnderstande man tyme past cleaued tabernacle onely fayth holden contemplation christ church mystery wherof tabernacle signified father pleased god best myndes lyfte vp heauen worshipped god iohn spirite truth many place scripture wherin grieuously rebuked cleaue outwarde ceremony neglect spirituall worshipping see psalme esay micheas ieremy c meane taught nothing ought instituted god seruice religion according man deuise pleasure tyme past outwarde ceremony vse moses bounde obserue paterne prescribed god appeare horrible example durst attempt contrary must dayes much diligent obserue thing sonne god hath appointed churche euer tyme laste comming taken hym tabernacle made confirmation stabilitie kingdome thing ieroboam euidentlye obserued perceyued kingdome could firme stable1 reg without certayne place house religion meane season learne singuler gift god vpon earth externe religion firmly established men may safely follow strong bande conserue ecclesiasticall vnitie vnspeakeable argument god goodnesse fauour lyue vnder tyrannous persecutor church acknowledge thing earnestly desire let v likewise acknowledge liue rest peace least prouoke wrath god notorious vnkindenesse aduersitie let v vnderstande howe great commoditie nowe dayes many men make little account nowe hauing discoursed thinges belonging tabernaclethe worshipping god tyed temple reg entreth reason temple also succeeded tabernacle place vse tabernacle scripture declareth builded salomon whereas tyll religion place appoynted none bicause dauid diuine reuelation knew place iewes seemed vayne thinke true worshipping god place onelye steuen sharpely rebuketh blockheadnesse although graunt temple builded god appoyntment yet agayne sayth hee highest dwelleth temple made handes bicause would reprooued rashnesse bringeth word god speaking wise esay cap heauen seate earth footestoole maner house builde vnto sayth lord place rest hath hande made thing argument taken owne nature prooueth included certain place hath neede thing done men power might heauen heauens able receyue salomon himselfe confesseth reg impossible conteyned within house agayne creator maker thing hath neede benefites declared large psal thing serue consolation instruction whereas god euerywhere may therefore euerywhere worshipped neede neyther troubled ouermuch costes ne yet great labour bicause hath neede goodes true trade worshipping fauour consist thing therfore fowle filthie error hypocrytes done thing thought fully discharged duty vnto god wherefore behooueth v rather consider true vse meaning outwarde thing consist time place ceremony tyme place conuenient order sake behooueth v appoynt certayne dayes religion obserued cannot done place also saluation tyed obseruation dayes place yet thing haue vse religion serue vse holy congregation whome behooueth oftentimes meete togither reason preaching worde publike prayer administring sacramentes bycause temple appoynted exercise therefore shoulde exempt prophane secular vsances cause aggeus prophet much called building vp temple let v supersticiously tyed opinion ouermuch reuerencing place nowe vse ceremony appointed god man constitution one worde common custome calleth sacrament seale confirme vnto v benefites god therefore lift vp mindes contemplation fayth heauen admonishe v duty god man thing commeth v well obserue contented least occupied outwarde thing wrapped olde errour iewes lose heauenly goodes let v therefore worship god father spirite truth hath fully giuen v sonne onely priest sauiour iesus christ thing sometimes figured father signes ceremony temple prayse honor power glory euer amen liiij homelie ye stiffe necked vncircumcised hart eares haue alwayes resisted holy ghost father doe prophetes haue father persecuted haue slayne shewed comming iust whome haue betrayed murthred ye also haue receyued lawe ministration aungelles haue kept hearde thing heart claue sunder gnashed teeth thus farre blessed martyr steuen hath aunswered obiections layde agaynst long discourse hath shewed neuer blasphemed god law yet temple beginning abraham declareth worshypper onely god vouchsafe time past reueale himselfe vnto father offer vnto grace done maketh singuler discourse lawe prooueth christ euidently promised father lawe length intreating temple outwarde obseruances prooueth strong argument neyther grace god tyed neyther true worshipping yet meane mannes saluation bycause steuen ignoraunt maner iudges shoulde haue cause coulde longer dissemble rage mindes euery man may easily gather circumstance weyghtie vehement kynde reprehending concludeth oration maye perceyue steuens purpose intent plucke visure face bragged name church fowly abused power longer feare simple vnlearned slye conueyance thing needeful perceiue haue whome worde doctrine preuayle surelye day nothing much hindreth verity enimies therof many yeres haue challenged name gouernance therof wherfore necessary haue charge church committed vnto doe followe euen day also example steuen come beginning circumcisionhe beateth downe confidence circumcision sheweth gloryed therin vayne calling stiffenecked vncircumcised heart eares seemeth haue respect vnto wordes moses god written deuteronomie ieremie though shoulde saye knowe haue great confidence circumcision vanitie seeing neglect circumcision heart minde god woulde shoulde outwarde signe professe hys couenaunt commaunded circumcise heartes sworde spirite put neckes hytherto ouermuch disobedient yoke obedience playne neuer woulde thus doe euer resisted holy ghost speaking scripture prophetes steuen accuseth common disobedience heynous incredulitie went mocke god circumcision signe god couenant place teacheth v men little holpen outwarde signes vnlesse sticke vnto thinges signifyed god spirite worshipped vaine ceremony spirite truth ceremony hath instituted sake intent shoulde bring mindes contemplation fayth consideraunce dutie thing neglect signes improoue v infidelitie excuse v cause prophetes earnestly accuse obseruers outwarde ceremony carefully commende vnto care spirituall worshipping serueth also teache v cleaue much baptisme supper neglect fayth christ studie innocencie charitie without christian religion cannot consist colde obseruation rytes commaunded god able saue v shall say obseruers men tradition god hath wyped cleane awaye sworde worde otherwheres haue declared esay math taught also maner men wickedly resist worde god preached men thing euident iewes dyd sayeth steuen resisted prophetes holy ghost must thinke thus sayd aduentures minister speake inspiration holy spirite spirite worketh obedience mennes mindes putteth v often remembrance amendement lyfe certes resist spirite refuse obey worde infallible argument vncircumcised heart stiffe neck therefore haue rule howe iudge people dayes marueylously please delyght themselues dare boldly contemne sermon god minister scoffe rayle ouerthroweth confidence forefather math iohn let v returne vnto steuen likewise ouerthroweth glorye sought dignitie auncestry iewes put great confidence forefather appeareth iohn baptist christ admonished amende lyfe chopte teeth abraham father alleaged prerogatiue stocke steuen maketh difference betweene forefather amonge certaine good sincere worshipper god abraham isaac iacob like coulde glory altogither vnlike bastardes going kynde againe othe notorious wicked person bloudy tyrannes prophetes unto sayth fellowes lyke bicause liuely represented nature condicions yea passed father euen prophetes haue father persecuted esay haue killed shewed comming iuste calleth iesus christ absolutely iuste himself1 cor ierem whose mouth could found guile made god father righteousnes wherfore ieremy called ye lord righteousnes furthermore father killed ye prophet foretold monument sepulchre declare builded ye honor euen betray christ himselfe romane president made way cruell death crosse thus haue fulfilled ye measure father farre exceeded thing spoken steuen without secret working god holy spirite must thinke without god thinges written left vnto posteritie teache v howe deale glory vertues ancestor title lawful succession beguile simple people authoritie chalenge themselues number adayes see bishop rome notwithstanding persecute doctrine apostle fire sworde infecting whole worlde example abhominable corrupt lyfe turne true religion lucre gayne yet vaunt themselues christes uicares successours peter paule constantly affirme churche rome cannot erre fleightes manifest worlde hath bene deceiued great many yeares therfore visure must pulled face faythfull minister churche must suffer great asse disguised lion skinne iet vp downe fraye conscience simple people longer behalfe heard would haue thinges talked prescribe v rule modestie meekenesse glory christ assaulted saluation soule imperilled remayneth place feare meekenesse thing christ well perceyued whome thinke man finde fault modesty meekenesse thought good beate downe false byshops kynde seueritie rather cowardly preposterous lenitie whose example steuen apostle rightlye followed let peece passe shall note prophetes foreshewers christ thing christ himselfe confesseth luke peter attributeth ame thing maketh certaintie dignitie faith1 pet thinke thing either newly inuented vncertaine perswasion small number person steuen goeth purposehe beateth affiance lawe psal taketh vayne affiaunce lawe seemed chiefe thing amongst god benefites dauid testifying god shewed nation like declaration goodnesse confesseth giuen ministery aungels whose presence god thought good shewe vnto glorye maiestie sheweth glory sought therin vayne bicause neuer obedient therevnto ouercome desire sinne neglected lawe wickedlye persecuted christ whome law brought whereupon gather glory also vayne haue word god doctrine gospell vnlesse expresse lyues thinges prescribed blessed saith christ heare worde god luke keepe place putteth refuseth worker iniquitie whiche neglect father math consideration wherof dayes ought diligently meditate transgressor moses lawe grieuously punished shall come vnto whiche wickedly contempne woorde gospell deliuered v christ surely christ sayeth shall grieuously punished math hebr sodome gomorrhe graue iust defence steuen first martyrhow steuens enemy like oration sermon ought haue bene great force weight godly ye professed enemy christ lacked successe also ex sperate myndes sharpe goade greater vngodlinesse luke writeth hearde heartes claue sunder gnashed teeth cleauing heartes signifieth sorrow heart boyling rage fury wherwith cruelly set fire yre great could hide ye place appointed euer iustice god religion gnashing teeth testified become like vnto madde dogges hereby expressed propertie wicked vrged word god intollerably scorne rage inflamed whome god hath appointed preacher worde reade caine incensed god speaking admonition infinite example men needefull rehearse bicause see like euery day let v learne infallible token extreme vngodlinesse good man hope better ye woorse word god let v therfore subdue affection assoone feele selues touched mooued therwith meane season let v learne minister worde must therefore holde peace bicause vngodly incensed reprehension2 tim paule commaundeth instant season season let man offended though preuayle nothing saying among albeit ensue effect ye worde yet faithfull minister therof shall least deliuer owne soule ezech meane shall want electe seruauntes christe shall instructed preached wicked testimony iust condemnation god father mercy graunt may duely heare oracle worde wee
