right hand god sayde behold see heauens open sonne man standing right hand god gaue showt lowde voyce stopped eares ranne vpon one cast citie stoned witnesse layde downe clothes younge mannes seete whose name saule stoned steuen calling saying lord iesu receyue spirite kneeled downe cryed lowde voyce lorde laye sinne charge thus spoken fell sleepe although worde god fruitefull wholsome yet bringeth forth fruite heare mindes rightly framed disposed little profiteth wicked thereby rather fretted made woorse myndes froath boyle like vnto sea pressed vrged therwith vse raue example haue hereof euerywhere among one set forth counsell gathered togither steuen verye notable steuen declared innocencye moste weightie reason proofes woorthy wordes reprehended canckred olde maliciousnesse little mooued wyth remorse conscience amende lyfe rather conceyue heartes vtter vntreatable rage furye filthy faulte iudge onely alteration countenaunce also doggish maner gnashing vpon teeth yet might sorte haue bene suffered helde handes though hitherto bewrayed madnesse ynough ioyne herevnto vnworthy death punishment innocent man thinge luke diligently describeth bicause teacheth v many thing touching deathe martyr diuers thinges therein comprehended make comfort instruction god comforteth steuen ready put deathhe beginneth thinges god shewed martyr wrapped many woe daungers perceyued himselfe set middle sorte wolues hope man helpe appearyng began eye lift vp heauen seeke helpe god thing god long denied sheweth vision wherwith comforted enimies made afeard thing taught god forsaketh daunger hee seeth heareth scripture euerywhere teacheth bicause father touched misery hath pitie distresse sheweth himselfe faythfull reuenger although alwayes deliuereth v present daungers yet comforteth myndes suche wyse able beare suffer let v therefore learne haue respect mannes helpe vayne lift eye vp heauen shall deceyued hope saying godlye whiche dauid vttereth haue lifte vp myne eye vnto hilles whence commeth helpe helpe commeth lorde psal hath made heauen earth prophete pronounceth happye whose hope trust lorde accurseth trusteth man iere maketh flesh strength shall profitable v considerthe maner order god comforteth iohn maner order howe god comforteth steuen point holy ghost hath first place wherewith luke sayth steuen replenished lord perfourmed promised sayth would leaue v comfortlesse sende v holy ghost comfort v haue much neede reason infirmitie fleshe desire god christ commaundeth saying let thy kingdome come spirit faythfull emboldened easily contempne assault world saying iohn vnderstanded greater worlde iohn bicause appeared euery side suche thynges might feare valiaunt martyr pleased god also sende hym outwarde comfort sheweth hym therefore vision conteyning meane saluation seeth heauens opened thing reade also done baptisme christ christ also appeared glorye standing right hande father thinges forasmuch reported name vision also said lifted vp eye heauen thinke appeared deede visibly offered contemplation mynde neede dispute much naturall sight forasmuch thinges appeared steuen onely whose eye easie thyng god giue straunge farre pearcing sighte needefull first martyr see thinges might vnderstand others hope signifie vnto v merite christ heauens open v haue christ promised place prepared v furthermore declare christ raigneth heauen doth like ydle sluggish body neglect people quarell standeth readinesse preserue deliuer trustie faythfull shepeheard suffereth sheepe taken handes ioh herevnto thinketh prayer saintes referred wherein desire god woulde arise vp saue although steuen onely grace see thing psa yet god mooued spirite shewe wicked iudges thing boldly therby might vnderstande enterprise christ vayne forasmuch nowe triumphantly raigned heauen whome little put shamefull death crosse must learne generall lesson hereof knowe christes power force inuincible althoughe wycked world storme striue neuer much dauid long sithens foretolde psal woulde propertie beare rule euen middest enimies fury steuens enemes incurablebut nowe steuens enimies among thing declaring matter thing mitigate raging moody mindes truly first furious showting make noyse outcrie agaynst holy man stoppe eares woulde agaynst willes heare worde god propertie wicked refuse nothing much word god neyther heare suffer bicause nothing contrarye desire purpose wherefore dauid likeneth adder stoppe eares psal bicause woulde heare wordes charmer wickednesse deserueth shall crye another time hearde prophete sayth mich length shall heare last horrible sentence christ iudge shall sende satan king paynes eternall fyre yet contented noyse cry trouble steuen preaching glorye christ turne open violence one consent runne vpon thrust citie stone appeareth argumentes wicked vse dispute agaynst truth verily seditious showting clamor vniust force wyth stone swordes firebrandes whatsoeuer instrumentes power darckenesse reade prophetes tymes past assaulted disputed agaynst christ hystorie following shewe howe vsed agaynst apostle bicause christ hath many time giuen v warning thinges must offended let v therefore prepared light vpon v vnawares vnlooked wicked obserue shew equitie leuit deut worthy great obseruation heede whyle rage violence wrong yet seeme obserue kinde lawe equitie bicause accused blasphemie agaynst god false doctrine therefore gyue punishment appoynted god blasphemer seducer witness prescribed law threwe first stone doe ease put apparel deliuer vnto saule keepe conuerted vnto christ called paule therefore wanteth nothing belonging forme lawe steuen myght seeme iustly haue suffered according lawe alwayes lawfully done hath shewe lawe must deepely wey cause punishment else shall grieuouslye erre iudgement meane season marke howe god sometime suffreth wicked whose rage haue people exercised fyll vp measure wickednesse example witness taught howe farre impietie proceedeth stopped beginning sinned bearing false wytnesse neyther ignoraunt lawe god neyther punishment appoynted false wytnesses afrayde salomon sayth prouerb lorde hateth vtterly abhorreth false witnesse yet contented haue committed horrible fault go embrue handes innocent bloude also ignorant written lawe touching murtherers num true salomon sayth wicked ouer shooes prou hoe let v therefore feare entycing beginning sinne least whyle instill v hatred worde god sticking fast toughe myer thereof length wholye swallowed vp great gulfe vngodlynesse thing sayde saule written consented death holye man receyued great pleasure therein make waye preparation hystorie following setting forth glory god thing shall sayde place remayneth declare howe steuen behaued himselfewhat steuen doth ye point death put cruell death three thinges tolde first called vpon lorde thing beleeue continually vsed doe expressed prayed three wordes lorde iesu receyue spirite wordes haue confession true fayth argument token great strong beliefe euery side beset terror death yet acknowledgeth confesseth christ sauiour folowing example theefe crucified christ beleeueth soules dye death passe state better life yea knoweth euen death fayth christ men fynde lyfe great prayse fayth euen inuincible comforteth v helpes fayle also steuens example teacheth v whome commende soules poynt death saintes superstitious vse vnto christ lorde hath redeemed pryce bloude resurrection hath ouercome death ascention heauen hath prepared v place iohn shall gathered vnto secondarily steuen sheweth token charitie seperated fayth folowing example commaundement christ prayeth enimies god woulde punishe sinne deserued reprooueth wickednesse enimies put death enimie common weale witnesseth last wysh made man desirous mennes welfare state vngodly worlde chiefe cause whose infelicitie neyther knowe benefactor beware daungerous enimies publike weale let v learne extende charitie euen ingratefull math godly prayer commende god moste grieuously offende agaynst v let v suffer selues feared wickednesse men forasmuch god iudgements vnknown v god lightly vseth reueale vnto euery man incurable amongest men reade sometime vnto ieremie cap let v also stirred vppe effect prayer conuersion saule alone prooueth fruitelesse last sayd steuen hauing thus spoken fell sleepe steuen falleth slep yet enimies hoped doctrine haue bene cleane dispatched way scripture oftentimes vseth word slepe speaking death godly condicion propertie death set forth death resolution dissolution man consisting soule body death soule neyther dyeth sleepeth passeth lyfe euerlasting christ sayth iohn wherevpon death hath aptly bene called passing heauen body sayde sleepe bicause layde earth sleepe latter daye shall raysed vp christ may also enioye blysse heauenly lyfe euerywhere testimony scripture concerning thing occasion shall serue oftentimes intreate wherefore nowe meane briefe let v set steuen v imitate shall depart lyfe soules gone dwelling blessed happy last gloriously raysed vp also body may attayne inheritance kingdome heauen iesus christ lorde whome prayse honour power glory euer amen eyght chapiter vpon actes apostle lvj homelie tyme great persecution agaynst congregation hierusalem scattered abrode throughout region iurie samarie except apostle deuout men dressed steuen made great lamentation ouer saule made hauocke congregation entred euery house drew menne woman thrust prison therefore scattered abrode went euery preaching worde god holy ghost would haue vnworthye death blessed martyr steuen great diligence described luke muche steuens sake name according oracle dauid might perpetuall remembrance sake whose instruction comfort hystorie doth greatly serue taught example holy man first martyr also ought suffer maner extremitie christes sake truth shunne death neuer cruell forasmuch haue christ reuenger hath layde vp v moste excellent rewarde heauen agayne moste comfortable see kingdome christ ouerwhelmed slaughter tyrannie wicked rather dylated enlarged thing hath oftentymes otherwheres bene declared tyme hystorie following abundantly sheweth came passe tyme steuen receyued garlande martyrdome declaration whereof luke present place prepareth premising three thing whereby haue sayd prooued euery one three thing intreate order first sayde vniuersall cruell persecutionan vniuersall persecution church raysed ierusalem agaynst church haue seene diuers thing attempted priestes apostle chiefely thrust enimies repressed feare people calme nowe perceyuing thinges succeede agaynst steuen woulde haue aryseth tumult businesse people lyke beastes hauing tasted bloude waxe thirstie therefore yea cruell bolde set vpon whole body congregation ouerthrowe wherein rage take within short whyle whole congregation scattered throughout iurie samaria hither vnto dwelt togither ierusalem shalbe profite diligently behold viewe primitiue church church see thinges verye well ordred rule christ apostle oftentimes notable victorie apprehended caused pleade cause counselles wherevpon body would haue hoped great rest peace shoulde haue ensued beholde horrible tumultes aryse vppon sodeyne enimies emboldened wyth death steuen alone cruelly make warre set whole congregation shall therfore dayes hope whose sloth manifolde defectes deserue seuere correction god haue suffered thinges come passe greene tree shall doe drie place also reprooueth preposterous iudgements vse pronounce fayth doctrine fayth according successe thinges falling worlde shall beleeue men must confesse priestes quarrell good right primitiue church vtterly deceyued must search deeper cause god iudgements shall perceyue saluation exercised invred furiousnesse wicked meane season fill vp measure iniquitie length receyue worthy punishment tyrannie christes handes defender church chiefely consideredthe apostle remaine ierusalem apostle remayne citie residue fled yet reade chiefly molested troubled wherfore must needes woonderfully preserued ye help god boysterous tempest persecution god would haue gospell long preached bloudy citie ierusalem intent mercy iustice might easily appeere mercy goodnesse hee suffred doctrine grace saluation long bee preached embrued bloude sonne iustice subuerted horrible destruction incurable woulde repent meane whyle haue two thinges consider first certaine limit bound appointed wicked persecutor congregation cannot go beyond hath set border sea within great heape water conteyned bindeth satan lawes bridleth wicked cannot would vse crueltie agaynst would herein receyue great consolation mynde consider lawes god prouidence broken rage wicked agayne apostle gyue v example faythfull superindents word congregation although knewe christ sayde persecute one citie flie vnto another yet bicause bounde certayne vocation perceyued remnant church lyke fall awaye also shoulde leaue citie rather hazarde lyfe vnhonest flying forsake congregation surely minister haue neede case diligently beware rashly condemned flying prouyde themselues must thinke lawfull euery man time place case minister alone sought enimye else forsaken hytherto woulde haue name congregation ruine detryment ensue vnto congregation departing cause may reserue himselfe commodious season forsake publyke cause congregation go holde fast confession fayth deede apostatas hyrelinges iohn christ sayeth vse flie see woolfe come woulde god well considered thing dayes hastily forsooke church behooued rather haue folowed ensample ambrose se tripartite hystory ix booke xx chap see lyke storye godlye courage ambrose agayn theodosius emperor ambrose excommunicated great slaughter committed thessalonica would haue comen church milane withstanded ambrose booke xxx chap denied deliuer church vnto arrianes although emperour commaunded see epistle marcella sister number thirtie three faythfull dyd towarde steuen luke going history begunne sheweth faythfull remayned citie vnto steuen thus stoned first sayeth dressed buried auncient vsage agreable firste sentence pronounced god sayeth came earth shall returne earth agayne conteyneth mistery resurrection body committed ground seedes vnto earth afterward shall raysed vp glory howbeit like holy men consideration decently bury condemned sentence counsell manifestly reproue vnrighteousnesse aduersaries giue euident testimony ye fayth steuen preached furthermore declare reuerenced saw singular instrumet christ like vnto adays vse let slip raynes impotent vnbridled tonge minister word whose free speach doctrine see enimies incensed seeke bloud faithfull minister christ deride costancy boldnesse ought reuerence honor meane time learne example owe body deade say honest comely buriall forasmuch paule sayeth body temple holy ghost must buryinges vse pryde superstition wherin diuers faultes adayes committed puffed vp vanitie doe forgette mortall estate death also prowde fasten armes cognizance vayne glory tumbs labour diriges sacrifice away sinnes dead else peculiar sorte ceremonie vse canonize make saintes wherof one peeuish without example derogatory repugnaunt vnto christes merite doctrine teacheth v beleeue passe death vnto lyfe iohn haue neede new expiacions moreouer make great lamentation ouer steuen rule paule thes whiche forbiddeth v shoulde mourne heathen lament vncertaine doubtfull steuens estate see wicked haue power church depriued excellent minister might yet haue done much good setting forth kingdome christ neither blamed cannot forget friendes like men voyde humanitie common sense enforced weepe forasmuch god hath made v blockes scripture euery condemneth destitute naturall affection sort reade abraham bewayled sara wife ioseph brother iacob father people israell aaron moses samuel wyth godly dutie yea christe sawe two sister mourne wepte belooued lazarus ioh deede meane must kept lest may thought either enuy dead heauenly felicitie else stande doubte firmely beleeue inheritaunce last saule singular example tyranny luke setteth v singuler example tiranny saule vsed church wherin first great crueltie tyranne next vayne successe purpose intent considered saule sayd consented death steuen kept clothes stoned wherby signified guiltie innocent bloude satisfied tirannye vniuersall persecution deuiseth peculier way goeth vtterly pull vp church rootes setteth alone openly professed faith bursteth priuate house draweth onelye men woman also whome infirmitie weakenesse sexe defended putteth prison muche certaine writer thinke vnwittily oracle woolfe shoulde come tribe beniamin ought applied vnto saule gen deede rauenyng woolfe yet length conuerted distributed wholesome spoyles euangelicall preachyng almost ouer whole world thinges luke reporteth himselfe oftentimes confesseth yea lamenteth hym verye often see actes cor galath vse shoulde acknowledge goodnesse god whiche vouchsafe take fauour great enimy himselfe interpreteth matter hym would iesus christ shewe long pacience tim declare example vnto beleeue vnto eternall lyfe preuayled saules great enterprise coulde make hauocke church nothing lesse yea cause beyng scattered hither thither spred word saluation kingdome christ thus god knewe set forth glorye sonne euen wayes seemed hinder whervnto also referred euill spirites gospell euen brought christe threw ground thought power ouer therefore feare foolishe suffer themselues discouraged attemptes tyrannes meane aduertised dutie ouercome persecution forsake dutie thyng diuers doe dayes hauing bene twise daunger make holyday euer though fully discharged dutie toward christ already luke speaketh better driuen ierusalem banishment made bolder preach christ euerywhere myndfull sentence sayth shall saued begin well continue vnto ende math let v therfore follow zeale haue faithfully finished race life may attaine garland heauenly reward iesus christ praise honor power glory euer amen lvij homelie came phillip citie samarie preached christ vnto people gaue heede vnto thinges phillippe spake one accord hearing seyng myracles vncleane spirites cry lowde voyce came oute many possessed manye taken palseyes many halted healed great ioye citie certaine man called simon tyme citie vsed witchcraft bewitched people samarie saying man coulde doe great thing whome regarded least greatest saying man power god called great hym set much bicause long tyme bewitched sorcery although kingdome christ church alway assaulted set wicked yet ouercome bicause truth god oracle promise infallible hath appointed christ sonne euerlasting kyngdome haue seene hitherto prooued declared many example oftentymes striue stoutely senate counsell apostle truth alwaye victory length steuen stoned enimies made fierce therby shew vttermost power amongst whome rage saule chiefly appeareth little christes kingdome amongst rage brought vnder rather seemed heretofore hedged within narrow walles ierusalem stretcheth self iury samarie hereof luke taketh occasion shew successe gospell beganne preached iurye first treateth couersion samaria reade foretold prophetes historye whereof haue longer stande thinges diligently proponed serue greatly comfort simon simoniakes although deacon office take charge church goodes poore yet also permitted preache gospell necessitie required hitherto haue seene example steuen maye great neede deacon ierusalem reason congregation scattred tyme persecution therefore gaue themselues wholy ministerye worde distributer goodes ecclesiastical paule afterward bade deacon well ministring1 tim get themselues degree greater office function nowe reported philip two thing samaria first preached christ luke toucheth briefly place afterwarde declareth large saith preached mystery kingdome god name iesus christ place manifestly taught alone giueth spirite regeneration succoureth corrupt nature alone also forgiueth sinnes hath purged price bloud therefore preacheth christ necessitie must preache repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes sure note whereby true preacher may knowne false whosoeuer teache iesus christ come fleshe hath performed thing needefull amendement saluation mankynde1 iohn bee taken true minister christ whosoeuer sheweth thinges christ inuenteth newe meanes attayning saluation called false teacher though aungell heauen galat therfore paule plainly testifyeth knoweth iesus christ only1 cor galat reioyceth crosse onely unto preachyng ioyned myracles philip wrought according christ promised draue vncleane spirites men healed folke sicke palseymyracles wer wrought philip whose disease incurable working christes spirit superfluous although worde thinges offered v serue saluation yet needefull myndes drowned certaine naturall slumber awaked outwarde signes prepared receyue worde force deuil ouerthrew kingdome valiauntly deliuered v tirannye hath restored v againe strength corrupted nature able good thing selfe2 cor phil able doe thinges himselfe gospell sayeth without nothing iohn worthy consideration sayd euill spirites went cry playne lyke otherwheres also christes presence complaine driuen tyme leaue miserablye torne whome depart willes thing set eye propertie disposition satan altogither giuen destroy men beginning murtherer iohn peter alwayes runneth vp downe like roaryng lion seeketh whome may deuoure cause vnwillingly departeth whose myndes hath possessed math yea one cast forthe studieth laboureth gette olde possession agayne christ teacheth thinges stirre vp v ardent desire take heede circumuented craft hurtfull enimy lose saluation declare vnto v power christ spirit worde able easily expell deuill though struggle striue neuer much samaritanes embrace gospellnowe let v see howe samaritanes receyued iesus christ whome philip preached came knowledge sheweth fruite earnestnesse beliefe first belongeth sayth hearde philip sermon saw myracles gaue mindes study thinges sayde studie earnestnesse sprange fayth shall afterwarde heare sealed baptismethe order astayning saluation haue herein consider order saluation although acknowledge god author hereof worketh men according pleasure yet moste part vseth bring men orderly certaine rule saluation order first hearing worde god offereth v saluation worde psal dauid sayth sendeth worde healeth v must neglect saued bicause hearing alone ynough wicked men spirites doe many time heare behooueth mindes also mooued stirred thing brought passe partly outwarde thinges see signes partly inwarde working holy spirite working feele shall nothing profite v heare outward preaching reading worde1 cor paule diligently plainely teacheth howbeit god reuealeth worde v pricketh mindes inwarde suggestion holy spirite requireth earnest attention taking heede least let infernall birdes eate vp seedes minde suffer choked thornes luke math troden vnder naughtie affection thing christ hath faithfully warned v whosoeuer therefore sort proceede businesse saluation reade samaritanes shall quickely receyue great profite thereby compare thing doings shall perceyue answere make marueyle commeth passe profit preaching word almost stumbleth say thressholde beginning see fewe hearer worde church thinke haue sufficiently done dutie heare sermon vppon sundaye onely fewe heare attentiuely desire learne fewest muse meditate diligently haue hearde meane season naughtie affection fleshe beare rule euery carying v headlong vnto blinde desire worlde therefore herein otherwyse come passe fielde ouergrowne thornes full stone except diligently ylled let v cast noysome sloth mynde followe trouble mindes feared conscience sinfulnesse doctrine gospell teacheth god reconcyled v iesus christ sonne doth marueylously cheere recreate spirites therefore aungels tolde shepeheardes christ borne sayde brought great ioye luc olde father simeon filled feeling ioye desired haue leaue depart deliuered prison body paule also byddeth christian alwayes reioyce bicause ioye cannot taken away grafteth v christ maketh v partaker giftes god shadowed represented v sacramentes going forwarde fayth increase holy ghostnow forasmuch haue seene marueylous effect holy spirite flourishing church ierusalem luke teacheth v among samaritanes also holy ghost shewed like power efficacy least man myght thynke church gentyles inferiour iewes church sayth giftes administred apostle ende vnitie church might strongly fasten among people heretofore diuers myndes variaunce discention howe great diuision mindes betweene iewes samaritanes appeareth fourth iohn otherwheres iewes certayne prowde preiudice vsed much despise people samary therefore god thought good vse ministery apostle herein rom galat coloss might manifestly appeare one fayth christ church faythfull quickened one spirite difference nation christ apostle giue holy ghost ye samaritanes luke sayth peter iohn sent ierusalem comming samaria prayde professed christ holye ghost might giuen vnto also cause doyng holy ghost yet come vpon none baptised name christ place vnderstanded though faythfull samaritanes hitherto vtterly voyde holy ghost fayth gift effect holy ghost baptisme planted christ coulde vtterly voyde benefites christ abroade although adayes giftes part ceased yet commoditie commeth v therby knowe holy ghost president gouernour christes church hee promised iohn industry mode ye apostle place haue consider industrie apostle soone heare tell philip laboureth samaria businesse lorde sende certayne company vndesired helpe traueyle herein appeereth maner way doltishe ambition sende peter iohn whose labor hytherto apparant euident others contented go appoynted others taking vpon themselues alone sende legate latere called philip come latere side meaning tyer friend counsaylors doth disdainefully reiect thrusting sickle mannes haruest depriuing part honor glorie courteously giueth place church whose foundation first layde whereby taught ioyning mindes mutuall helpe chiefly required setting foorth christes kingdome bicause place thinges among ambitious therefore christ warneth disciple often humilitie wherevnto giuen dayes haue rule church surely gouerne prouinces committed commodiously doe touching rytes order vse none ceremonieprayers ioyned vnto laying handes laying handes vsed christ least man shoulde rashlye arrogate himselfe power authoritie alter chaunge anye thing make prayer thy money perishe thee bicause thou hast thought gift god may obteyned money thou hast neyther part fellowship businesse thy hart right sight god repent therefore thy wickednesse praye god thought thine heart may bee forgiuen thee perceyue thou art full bitter gall wrapped iniquitie aunswered simon sayd praye ye lorde none thing haue spoken fall euangelist luke common maner scripture doth onely describe prosperous successe primitiue church notable example faythfull also sheweth maners false christian hypocrytes vice brought church declared hystory ananias grutch quarrell begunne church lykewise declareth horrible example simon contaminate profession fayth sacrilegall ambition couetousnesse vse thing vnderstande shall alwayes bee hypocrite church shall author grieuous offence wherwith faythfull yet must offended thinke therfore ought condemned else forsake church haue seene anabaptistes dayes doe place worthy well considered first declareth simon sinne next earnest reprehension peter last simon thought therof howe tooke luke comprehendeth simon fault fewe wordes saying hee saw laying apostle handes simon nne holy ghost giuen offred money saying giue also power euer laye handes may receyue holy ghost declared howe simon beleeued woondring myracles straunge hee among others baptized number although forsake desire fleshe yet touched feare god openly striue men sort whyle cloke corruption minde cannot alwayes lye hidden sort doth simon bewraye himselfe sinneth two maner wayes first puft vp ambition desireth lyke vnto apostle dignitie ministerie arrogateth selfe godlye honor whyle coueteth haue power giuen vnto might owne giue holy ghost vnto men nowe vnto ambition couetousnesse companion wherewith blinded hee maketh religion matter gayne lucre thinketh maye make merchandize giftes holy ghost therfore would buye power money thintent afterwarde might make gayne vnholy cogitation god giftes farthest meaning christ endewed apostle giftes math sayde freely haue receyued giue freely example simon teacheth v pryde cause euill wiseman sayeth beginning sinne eccle cause made aungels fall adam pricked forwarde pryde became transgressour god commaundement whyle would forsooth lyke vnto god moreouer dayly example teach v prowde ambitious men doe nothing right part pernicious disturber publike weales whereas euill ambition euery pestilent thing churh pestilent inuadeth church soweth seede dissention among whose concorde labour peace tranquilitie church ought mainteyned num mat luke example wherof haue set forth core moses enimie often contention apostle christ many time earnestly repressed euill discention might seeme tryfle although part pernitious congregation greater plague ensued saye wicked robbery mart ouerturneth religion vseth plucke mennes myndes wholy religion thing euident simon needeth long demonstration assoone taken ambition couetousnesse counsayle matter religion discendeth spirituall merchandise robberie would god one simon herewith slaundered eueriwhere sawe others offende wickedly certayne earnest zeale desire religion endowed church wyth great abundaunce rich byshops beganne reuerence honor beganne simon syncere ledde spirite ambition couetousnesse vnlawfull meanes aspire byshopricks cathedre dignity afterwarde gotten supremacie deuised wayes might recouer againe spent purchasing voyces hereof hatched slaunderous buying selling religious matter beginninges may thanke selling sacramentes buying pardon hyring prayer merites supererrogation gaynefull dispensation buying buriall place whatsoeuer like kinde inuentions man may marueyle howe chiefe byshops church become impudent glory succession simon peter manifestly bewraye themselues rather successor simon magus men haue reygned many yeares church vntill lorde whippe hys worde began driue yet repent taken owne mischieuousnesse rather crye still true lawfull gouernours church yet accuse onely also lament among professor gospell many time plague founde see many come gospell none minde woulde fensed vnder plausible colour greedily inuade church goodes dishonestly abuse many time meete minister lyke vnto themselues hauing gotten vnlawfull meanes haue rule ouer church neyther reprooue keepe vnder raueners therefore spirit simon nowe dayes stretcheth boundes kingdome farre neere seemeth greatest plague church wherby commeth passe faultie antichristians doe little preuayle preaching gospell let v see peter sayth expostulateth simon peter expostulateth simon graue sharpe expostulation consisteth two poynts first accuseth fault denounceth punishment deserueth figureth fashioneth saying imprecation kynd curse beginning wise thy money sayth perishe wyth thee saye thou thy cursed money perishe togither apostle beginneth sort moodynesse minde vnbrydeled affection anger mooued holye ghost woulde phrase maner speache vtter heynousnesse wickednesse punishement therefore imprecation must referred vnto certaine kynde prophecying see diuers psalmes wrytings prophetes grieuousnesse punishment amplified sentence next adioyned sayth thou hast part fellowship businesse wordes declareth vtterly excluded participation spirituall giftes excommunicated church lorde least peter might seeme causelesse vse kynde rage addeth cause cruell threates bycause thou hast thought gift god maye obtayned money one thing abundantly declareth thy hart right god forasmuch thou thinkest lyke vnto couetous merchaunts vsurers hereof gathered generall sentence whereby taught allowed god make vauntage gaine religion vnder colour religion seeke owne lucre taught also peter example zeale feruencie spirite minister ought reprooue filthie lucre sake distayne glory god must handled maye vnderstande howe haue horriblye sinned deserued grieuous punishment eternall damnation place modestie meekenesse vsed glory god openly assaulted gift god grace made subiect gainefull pleasure couetous person reade therfore elizaeus vsed lyke zeale towarde giezi naughtie seruant sodeinly strake plague leprosie bicause required naaman assirian reg rewarde health freelye giuen god iesus christ perfite paterne meekenesse mooued impious sale holynesse layde hand author wickednesse iohn math mar draue church whippe lyke impudent dogges may therefore iustly complayne iniustice dayes say offende agaynst rule christian modestie charitie accuse antichrist rome creature cardinal bishop monkes priestes reason wicked prophane fayer mart many yeres haue caused christes religion mocked scorned iewes turkes yet daye haue serious earnest thought reformation amendement notwithstanding euery spoken perpetuall euerlasting decree god appoynted prophete house shoulde dwelling chanaanites saye zach kinde merchaunts rich wicked accursedmoreouer woorthy noted peter graue sentence condemneth onely simon also simon money therfore thing euer serueth wicked glory god accursed well money wherwith kyng balaac would haue hyred balaam haue hindred god appointment towarde people called rewarde iniquitie pet money iudas solde christ appeareth haue beene accursed bicause iudas could neyther long enioy neyther serued priestes vse purchase perpetuall blot memorie bloudie impietie neede speake goodes reuenues monasteryes whereof great part appeareth gathered togither simonicall sleightes person vsed sell thinges religion cleere day light goodes vnhappie commonly stumbling stone whome gospell hath shined vpon earnestly busied getting handes setting foorth christ glorie vnhappie vnprosperous mischieuous simonie sayde goodes may iustly vnderstanded verified goodes vniustly gotten propertie procure vnto owner horrible malediction cursse god saying lorde well knowne habac wo hourdeth vp thing none seconde part oration peter exhorteth repentancethe ende reprehension church whereby plainly putteth comfort pardon ende one repent conuert thinke therein vnprofitable appeareth ende marke reprehension congregation ought truely men might turne sinnes reconciled vnto god marke vnlesse obserued libertie rebuke reprehension shall nothing differ euill speaking rayling wherefore least simon shoulde suspect peter wordes hereof addeth repent thy wickednesse pray god thought thine heart may forgiuen thee mencioneth thought heynousnesse fault might appeare cogitation wherof ought farre christen mannes minde way learne men sinne onely deedes also thought desire men ought giuen vnto god bodie soule deserueth called sinne swarue neuer little obedience god herevnto belong thing christ speaketh mathew fift chapter touching exposition lawe furthermore would pearce simon minde deeper whome perceyued grieuously tempted deuill toucheth fountaynes rootes sinne thereby shewing hath neede earnestly repent wherevnto referred hee sayde maner doubtingly happily thought thine heart may forgiuen thee nowe addeth perceyue thou art full bitter gall wrapped iniquitie first member part alludeth saying moses israelite commaunded beware themselues least among deut roote beareth gall wormewood noteth inwarde malice corruption ye minde causeth whatsoeuer men doe bitter vnpleasaunt god true worshipper god good treasure heart bringeth good vngodly bring nothing wicked euill treasure hart math deede christ sayth polluteth men wrapping binding expressed ye state intangled snare sinne cannot vntwine themselues without much doe feruent zeale repentance teacheth v simon condition case shoulde thinke colde superfluous shewe repentaunce sufficient place teacheth v whether sinner ought sentsinners must sent vnto god verily vnto god whome vnlesse made one hope saluation therefore see prophetes one thing still repeated people conuert returne vnto god sinne strayed commodious hereof behooueth obserue two thing peter prescribeth vnto simon first woorke repentance haue elsewhere taught comprehendeth acknowledging sinne contricion heart amendment whole lyfe consisteth godly prayer wherby aske forgiuenesse sinnes bicause free gift commeth merites workes christ alone worketh spirite regenerateth beleeuing merite death washeth away sinnes reconcyleth father vnto v againe therefore order saluation consisteth fayth whereby take holde therefore aboue thing behooueth vrge require fayth deade fayth hypocrite bragge liuely effectuall power spirite whereby commeth passe liue christ spirite worketh v onely grace god certifyeth wauering conscience man vseth bring forth v plentifull fruites true godlinesse howe simon tooke peter expostulationnowe simon take graue wholesome expostulation wordes declare striken conscience mynde sayth praye yee vnto lorde none thing haue spoken fall seemeth commendeth himselfe prayer congregation manifest argument distrust sayeth nothing himselfe thinketh may holpen onely prayer vaine prayer others vnlesse returne selues vnto lorde place prophet teache v forbidden pray wicked repent see iere ezech therefore errour peeuishe noysome think may blinded affection ambition couetousnesse lose saluation may serue god sinceritie heart attaine vnto saluation iesus christ lorde whome prayse honour power glorie euer amen lx homelie testified arose went beholde man aethiopia chamberlane great authoritie wyth candace queene aethiopians rule hir treasure came ierusalem worship returned home againe sitting chariot read esay prophete spirite eustachium first preface commentary vpon esay epistle paulinus priest vppon bookes byble prophet meane god prouidence bee considered gouerneth mennes affayres suffereth nothing hazarde come passe whereof wee haue euident argument bicause euen tyme philip beginneth talke aethiope luke sayth reading verie place ethnick infidell would impute thing vnto fortune chaunce acknowledge prouidence god doth onely giue thing successe also ruleth thinges appertayning neglect men matter neuer small numbreth heares heades feedeth byrdes ayre singulerly decketh flower fielde furthermore touching place esaye comprehendeth whole summe redemption declareth mysterie christes death victorie whereby entered glorie father hath gotten immortall euerlasting kingdome shall good consider euery thing order declared christ died owne willfirst setteth forth death christ wordes ledde sheepe slaine like lambe dumbe shearer opened mouth wordes doth onely set forth pacience christ many tymes passion death appeared perfite also teacheth tooke death owne accord willingly counsaile force enimies wrought deede scribe phariseys tooke counsaile agaynst iudas sought meanes busily betraye high priestes theyr counsaile pronounced guiltie death pilate caused whipped nayled crosse could haue done would haue vttered shewed strength diuine power maiestie yea pulled downe father bosome earth whose counsayle tooke fleshe manhoode uirgines wombe gaue strength rise againe sent agaynst fell grounde one worde spoken hym thinges therefore teache v dyed bicause pleasure die math forasmuch came worlde none cause would giue life life worlde therefore able valiantly haue resisted enterprise enimies would yet led death like sheepe lambe would seeme worde vtter token vnpacient minde vnwilling die herevnto appertayneth sayde gospell therefore doth father loue iohn bicause put life might take againe man taketh fro put away selfe haue power put haue power take againe paule expounding saying sayth became obedient father euen death crosse phil tooke vpon shape man shape god thinges serue partly redemption saluation partlye instruction thus behooued sinne disobedience done away made v subiect eternall damnation moreouer christ taught v hys example pacience obedience bearing crosse admonisheth v oft tymes gospell1 pet peter wryteth thus purpose christ suffered v leauing v example follow steppe sinne christ death got victorie neyther guyle founde mouth reuyled reuyled agayne suffred threatened howbeit prophete ioyneth vnto death christ victorie gate hys death saying bicause hys humblenesse esteemed name humblenesse vnderstanded state crosse death whereby appeareth outwardly humbled brought downe therefore meaning wordes seemed altogyther oppressed destitute helpe god iust iudgement reuenged hys cause declared conquerour death satan although seemed conquered thys agreeth first promise sayde serpent shoulde sting christ heele gene christ treade vpon heade dauid prophecie come passe sayth psal shall drinke brooke way therefore shall lift vp head merite death purged sinne tooke away1 cor colos also spoyled disarmed death reason sinne power vpon v shortly rysen death openly declared iohn death deuil power vpon wherefore gloriously tryumphed ouer enimies thys glory desyreth hys father often gyue hym consideration hereof verie necessarie serueth confirmation fayth offended neyther christ crosse owne christ crosse entred glorie father rom dyed raysed agayne death sake declare lord sauiour well quick dead death ouercome whether lyue dye lord god reuenged christes cause although seemed altogyther oppressed psal vseth defende preserue memorie hys godlynesse punished shamefull deathes wicked men malefactours may knowne come wherevnto referred example well prophet apostle moreouer victory followeth kingdome attrybuteth euerlastingnesse vnspeakeable power sayingchristes kingdome eternall inuincible shall declare generation thys worde generation according vsage hebrues taken well age man posteritie declare contynuall enduring kingdome angell testifyeth kingdome euerlasting sayth vnto mary luke kingdome shall none ende likewise christes posteritie euerlasting made child god shall neuer fayle shall alwayes vpon earth shall acknowledge sonnes god coheyres taken worlde shall liue reigne euer effect summe last death would haue father ratifie father thou hast giuen mee bee may see glorie thou hast giuen mee iohn touching holy ghost teacheth v prophete saying seede dauid shall endure euer seate like sunne psal shall stand fast euermore moone faythfull witnesse heauen thing wherein christes kingdome differeth kingdomes worlde shall perishe neyther remayneth auncient riche monarchy remayne flourishe day doe euidently portend ruine decay hereof may worlde hath promised argument may comfort selues al assaultes tyrannes next certaintie eternall life dependeth hereon without vaine written fayth religion1 cor paule disputing resurrection death hath taught christes posteritie ineffable therefore eternall must bee life say heauenly eternall remayneth firme stable paule sayth neyther life death seperate v loue god rom death entry chrystes neuerthelesse made himselfe reputation taking shape seruaunt becamelyke vnto men found apparell man hee humbled himselfe became obedient vnto death euen death crosse wherfore god hath also exalted glorified thus much touching exposition place prophet eunuch handes let v nowe see howe vpon occasion aethiope attayned vnto knowledge christthe zeale eunuch yet ignorante many thing little confessed ende would learne true meaning scripture meane season negligently passed ouer eunuch inflamed desire religion yet ignoraunt thing comprehende maner saluation god oftentymes permitteth eyther vnmindfull promise enuyeth v knowledge worde delaying kindle v feruent desire exercise faith teach v misteryes wisdome high bee atteyned man diligence capacitie therefore let delaying offende man let v rather go feruent desire truth search healthfull mysteryes diuine wisedome christ fayle promise offereth himselfe founde seeke math also philip easie entreatance marked philip facilitie easie intrea ought vnderstanded iesus christ sonne god marie two thinges obserued first ought preached iesus christ onely name shoulde oftentimes foolishly repeated iterated whatsoeuer thing belong saluation must declared alone father hath giuen actes true repentance remission sinnes commeth vnto v peter hath taught v onely lyfe saluation founde actes wherefore foolishe false teacher whosoeuer teache thinges without christ shewe anye beside thing taught howe doctrine preaching christ maye taken learned bookes prophetes yea among thing extant beside whereby prooued chryst himselfe confesseth luke sayth thinges conteyned moses prophetes suffered saluation himselfe schoole nazareth teach knowledge true saluation himselfe taketh place esaye luke reade lxj chapter expounde therefore wicked execrable ingratitude disdainfully contemne bookes olde testament let v rather acknowledge grace god woulde vnderset beare vp knowledge sonne many euident testimony lette v seeke feruent desire thexample eunuch therwith indued may reygne christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxij homelie went way came vnto certaine water chaberlain said see water doth let baptised philip said vnto thou beleeue thine heart thou mayest hee aunswered sayde beleeue iesus christ sonne god hee commaunded chariot stande still went downe water philip also chamberlaine baptised soone come water spirite lorde caught awaye philip chamberlaine sawe went waye reioycing philip founde azotus walked countrie preaching city till came caesarea yesterday charitie heard sermon philip wherewith conuerted eunuch tooke writinges esay argument thereof iesus christ whose mystery doubt diligently expounded declaring sauiour worlde promysed whome god father peter thys taught v giueth v repentaunce remission sinnes followeth effect sermon herein appeareth eunuch endued knowledge christ desyreth baptysed name receyued outwarde societie church visible signe sacrament would neuer haue done vnlesse spirite god marueylously wrought mynde promised vnto elect nowe let v see eunuch baptisme description whereof luke diligentlye setteth forth bicause euery circumstaunce thereof serueth aswell consolation instruction eunuch desireth baptizedfirst commeth eunuch hearde philip good intreating christes mystery perceiued mind drawne illuminated power spirite assoone sawe water desired baptised saying ardent desire beholde water doth lette may baptysed whereof may gathered philip among thing intreated baptisme also according institution christ whereby haue beleeue consecrated vnto taken body church whereby also sealeth vnto v benefites rom sometime vsed doe circumcision paule hath taught v therefore eunuch receyued chryst wyth heart coulde refrayne longer would testifie beliefe also numbred church christe solemne ceremonie woulde numbred taken one chrystes church haue consider propertie fayth wherein two thing noted first fayth cannot long lye hid hath conceyued christ minde hath instructed whole manne knowledge christ shewe also forth selfe outwarde profession name seperated others desiring graffed christ consecrated knoweth god iealous god suffer anye religion among people knoweth iesus christ chose peculiar people world whome haue giue themselfe onely therfore frameth selfe lore desireth nothing much seene men whereas knoweth hath reioyce none christ alone thinges reprooue sluggysh mindes men dayes ashamed christ saye fayth maye dissembled lyke ensue daunger confession thereof howbeit manye thinges myght haue feared aethiop baptized much knewe queene candace people hir countrie farre knowledge christ thing threatened manifest perill estate goodes mynde incensed liuely fayth christ ouercommeth bursteth impediment whose hart vndoubtedly written suggestion holy ghost saying christ marc whosoeuer shall ashamed wordes aduouterous sinfull generation also shall sonne man ashamed shall come glory father holy aungels moreouer also one propertie fayth although eunuch thinketh hath obteyned christ treasure god grace infallibe certaintie saluation yet iudgeth vse baptisme vnprofitable superfluous fayth knoweth christ hath ordeyned nothing vnprofitably vayne bycause knoweth eternall wisedome god father whome hidden treasure knowledge knoweth also corruption fleshe hath neede many thinges col scarsely compelled many prouocations take way saluation wherby appeareth voyde aswell knowledge christ themselfe vse despyse reiect sacramentes although fayth christ attayne whatsoeuer thinges necessary saluation yet bicause inclination flesh profitable god benefites shoulde confirmed outwarde seales shoulde admonished dutie whereof oftentymes forgetfull luke bringeth forth person act say philip requireth confession fayth philip obeyed eunuch least shoulde seeme haue yeelded vnto bicause dignitie humanitie requireth first confession true fayth saying thou beleeuest thine heart thou mayest hath therefore respect hys fayth haue voyde guyle dissimulation example taught sacrament ought prophaned saye giuen faythlesse badge cognizaunces church christ becommeth weare straungers fro church bicause part dogges hogges whome christ forbiddeth v whoorle pearles math consider commaundement christ shall appeare apostle first ought teach beleeued doctrine shoulde baptised sayth teach ye nation baptising name father sonne holy ghost c math yet accounted among child houshold church reason lawe couenant holy christ commaundeth brought vnto also manifest please god bicause aungels alwaies see face father although capacitie cannot conceyue state condicion yet christ testifyeth haue fayth haue holy ghost example iohn baptist others teach v wherfore denye baptisme vnto small impietie point boldenesse monstrous howbeit bicause haue intreated hereof place let thys little suffice present let v see confession eunuch made marueylous breuitieiij confession eunuch comprehendeth thinges importaunce beleeue sayth iesus christ sonne god confession much like peter made name apostle math iohn attributeth vnto christ whatsoeuer spoken holy scripture yea matter narrowly marked comprehendeth article fayth creede apostolicall acknowledgeth god doubt god scripture say creator heauen earth confesseth god iewes turkes doe one hath sonne borne himselfe coeternall consubstantiall beleeueth sonne incarnated may gathered thinges red esay beleeueth sonne god christ say annoynted wherein vnderstandeth kingdome priesthoode unto priesthood belongeth passion christ offered sacrifice bodie bloud sinnes whole worlde name kingdome conteyned glorious resurrection whereby ouercame death also ascention whereby gorgeous tryumph entered heauen sitting right hand father declareth mightie king whome power giuen heauen earth shall come againe giue iudgement sentence vpon fleshe confesseth christ king must needes also confesse hath church wherein reigneth gouerneth church communion felowship saintes whome christ hath committed inestimable treasure say forgiuenesse sinnes resurrection fleshe felowship eternall lyfe mystery say short confession eunuch comprehendeth whereby taught one also acknowledge confesse christ well considered howe confession mouth ioyned fayth minde haue declared howe two must necessitie coupled togither paule expressely teacheth sayth worde fayth wee preach thou acknowledge thy mouth iesus lord beleeue thine hart rom god raysed vp death thou shalt e beleeue heart stifieth acknowledge mouth maketh nowe philip gotten eunuch chiefly desiredthe eunuch baptized without ariaunce went downe water baptiseth haue consider howe baptisme ministred common water whether ryuer fountayne ierome thinketh knowe neyther mention made newe hallowing salt sprinckled oyle exorcisme many like superstition pope age following brought philip knewe example iohn baptised ryuer iordane knewe also ordinaunce christ water consecrated vse baptisme neede newe purging coniuring away therfore wicked peeuish inuentions bolde merchaunts would haue religion serue priuate honour gaine yet would none example shoulde take occasion euery baptise fountaynes ryuers confesse may godlily done necessitie require church appoynted thing ought done decentlye according lawfull order1 cor least libertie bursting vnbrideled licence disturbe discipline vnitie church remayneth tell ende hystoriethe sodeyne departure philip comprehendeth departure philip eunuche luke sheweth myraculous sort came water spirite lorde caught philip eunuch sawe god woulde myracle confirme fayth eunuch sort hee might vnderstande nothing done businesse chaunce thing prouidence god let v see seperated luke sayth eunuch helde way reioycingthe eunuch complayneth philip absence complayned philip sodaine departure neyther carefully enquired much lesse detested though beene craftie apostle iugler hereof must gathered argument inconstant vnkinde minde whereas indued fayth taught holy ghost according christes promise brought thing minde testimonie confirmed doctrine fayth philip taught therefore coulde easily settle quiet hys minde example learne must sticke minister gone must dispayre matter fayth religion let v acknowledge god coadiutours stewardes mystery god whome giueth v fayth againe1 cor let v vnderstande spirite christ truely supplyeth dutie teacher christ fayle v although sometime take away knowe much bounden iohn god spirit bounde neyther person place bloweth lyketh moreouer fruite fayth eunuch receyued declaredthe fruite fayth ioy conscience luke sayth helde waye greatly reioycing hee wrote great ioye made samaria philip preached gospell ioy faythfull minde must hereby vnderstanded vseth spring peace quiet conscience christ receiued fayth man vnderstandeth god father reconciled vnto whose wrath horrible iudgement afrayde peace god paule beareth witnesse passeth vnderstanding chaseth minde l ereth whole minde maketh v without ea e affliction saying faythfull god bee v agaynst v shall lay thing god chosen rom god iustifieth v condemne knowe gate hell able preuayle agaynst liuelye rocke whome buylded therefore bicause eunuch obtayned suretie quiet minde returneth home greater ioye gotten great treasure king returned candace triumph victorie greatest enimies aethiopia ryches deserue compared treasure kingdome heauen victorie great faithfull haue gotten iesus christ deuill hell prince dayes desirous victorie kingdomes vaine glorie worlde would also reioyce worlde also better case painfull industrie philip let v returne philip founde azotus thence passing long sea coast preached gospell city quarter vnto caesarea seemeth tooke house dwell bicause paule hosted maye see xxj chapter shall marke diligently feruent great desire men primitiue church set forth kingdome christ although philip traueyled greatly conuerting samaria might greatly haue gloried conuerting great man aethiopia yet thinketh done duetie enioyneth himselfe freshe labour refuseth vndertake new daungers christes sake see lyke desire paule hauing laboured apostles1 cor cor rom yet holdeth course great feruencie thing reprooue slouth dayes sortes state men soone haue borne little brunt make holyday doe though disposition libertie start calling god dutie committed v furthermore thinges teache v howe vaine enterprise wicked agaynst doctrine christ rage truth shineth ouercommeth yea tyme persecution meanes gospell church let v rather trust god able saue elect worlde make coheyres christ world come whome prayse honor power glory euer amen ninth chapiter vpon actes apostle lxiij homelie saule yet breathing threatnings slaughter agaynst disciple lorde went vnto highe priest desired hym letter carye damascus sinagoges hee founde anye waye whether men woman myght bring bounde ierusalem iourneyed came passe nygh damascus sodeinly shyned round lyght heauen fell earth hearde voyce saying saule saule persecutest thou sayde art thou lorde lorde sayde iesus whome thou persecutest harde thee kicke
