commeth v meere grace god nothinge bee ascrybed workes merites hereof many example among one notable late sawe aethiop vnto whome philip preacher true saluation meere benefite god sent thought much lesse seeking yet bicause reported endued certaine singuler gift least man myght thinke attayned saluation merite hystorie saule conuerted vnto christ purpose sette conuersion whome iesus christ doth prouoke draw agaynst vnto saluation sayd parable certaine guestes luke compelleth come surely luke reporteth historie yt euery man may see nothing attributed merit man saluation commeth vnto saule benefite god onlye grace yea paule himselfe plainly teacheth ensample bee referred chiefely ende sayth therefore called cutte euen middle hys tyrannicall enterprise agaynst church iesus christ might shewe first clemencie mercye ensample vnto shoulde beleeue another place confesseth vnworthy name apostle respect merite desert hee grace god whatsoeuer howbeit whereas hystorie many thing worthy knowne considered shall profitable v examine poyntes circumstance thereof present luke first propoundeth description saule beginneth hystorie hys conuersion description saule persecutor luke diligent describing saule bicause description god power goodnesse euidently knowne first declareth disposition nature sayth breatheth threatnings slaughter mynde therefore inflamed incensed agaynst church signe note whereof giuen stoning steuen make hauocke church ierusalem hath bene declared heretofore yet nowe seeing preuayleth nothing church spreadeth euery day conceyueth furie rage mynde doe nothing nowe breath dreame cruell threates bloudy slaughter destruction sayde nature tyrauntes enimies church haue tasted bloude godly rage lyke beastes haue cast sense humanitie able put awaye rage mynde haue conceyued vnlesse tamed mightie hande god example crueltie euerywhere seene hystories consideration serueth v purpose make v vnderstande hope tyraunts dayes whome see nowe vsed vnto bloude thirst cruelly tygres surely vnlesse lord tame mannes force reason mollifie appease saule hath power giuen high priestsbut bicause rage mynde must fenced armour saule prouydeth also sayde went vnto high priest whome receyued letter sinagoges damascus whereby full power giuen bynde many coulde fynde christian wherby gather matter religion tyme committed romaine presidentes high priestes blinded gentyle superstition credible soone wearied dayly controuersies religion sought meanes whereby ridde themselues incombrances lay enuie hatred people vppon others neckes thys occasion fell byshops woulde wyshe whose aduaun age honor came perill preaching gospell saule therefore garded authoritie taking complices minister mischiefe goeth damascus vnderstoode kingdome christ beganne spring flourishe marueylously place thing teacheth v byshops alwayes bee grieuousest enimies true religion christian doctrine studie diligence ought set forwarde assoone begynne conuert religion lucre abide lyght truth longer reprooueth naughtynesse byshoppes euident hystorie gospell needeth long demonstration may therefore hope prelate dayes shall easily perceyue well marketh couetousnesse ambicion meane season haue consider prophane cowardlynesse slouth prince magistrate bicause passe little religion get enuie hatred religion sake yet least shoulde seeme godlesse voyde religion commit matter pope byshops cardinal getting themselues pretence great estimation godlynesse seeking excuse agaynst might saye persecutor truth say controuersies belong vnto perswade themselues cannot doe godlye commit matter vnto heades church iudgement marueylously confirmed counterfayte bishop meanes chalenge themselues power iudge religion whose ambition couetousnesse woulde fall grounde doctrine truth extinguished god let trayne craft go vnreuenged shall full sore punish byshops iewes togither pretence shall excuse prince forasmuch charge church hearing matter religion pertayneth vnto deut ende purpose booke lawe deliuered king prophete teacheth v kinges ought nurse church esay wee want notable example kinges bicause setting forth truth maintayning church haue purchased themselues singuler commendation let v also consider saules ende purpose saules ende purpose whosoeuer shoulde finde men woman christes profession bring bounde ierusalem therefore difference sexe surely becomme cruell spared age neyther nowe purposed make christian awaye vtterly extinguishe name christ cause cruell attempt declareth otherwheres zeale olde religion thought meanes retayned defended manifest pharisey himselfe confesseth many time actes philp galat persecuted name christ church euen looue bare lawe let v first obserue howe much god suffreth wicked doe luke sheweth thinges attempted agaynst disciple christian woman lorde foreshewed shoulde iudged god seruice iohn kill beleeued apostle wa ne v many time thintent offended stormes persecution crosse shoulde dayes wishe ourselues better state condicion time christ hys apostle primitiue church moreouer saules example teacheth v howe litt e preposterous zeale religion men sometymes conceyue humaine tradition wythout prescript god worde auayleth attaynement saluation feruent saule herein farther recedeth christ way saluation striueth righteousnesse law farther righteousnesse christ alone defendeth v iudgement god commeth passe saule testifieth came passe iewes sayth burne zeale towards god according knowledge fell inconuenience whyle woulde establishe owne righteousnesse om lost righteousnesse god maye affirmed monkes part giuen belly ydlenesse religion yet maye truly sayde tyrant constantly labour keepe religion forefather feruently persecute gospell hurtfull error confuted thinke thinges done agaynst god true religion may excused zeale godlynesse though god giuen v rule worde vayne ought chiefly obserued haue elsewhere declared furthermore considered goodnesse power god coulde make cruell woolfe sodeinly tame also faythfull shepehearde flocke let man therefore rashly dispayre mannes saluation church seeing god sodaynly chaunge myndes men make defender church euen nowe seemed woulde haue destroyed historie saules conuersion time placelet v come hystorie saules conuersion luke setteth forth liuely color beginning time place iourneyed sayth came passe hee nygh damascus therefore saule hope good successe bringing matter passe oth christ withstande attemptes nowe beholdeth damascus face perhaps woolfe hauing espied pray casteth mynde terrible cogitation howe myght soonest rauishe christes sheepe marke h e counsayle vsage god manye time suffreth enimies raunge farre seeme scarce naile bredth marke purpose thing cause christian whose destruction tyrant conspyre sometime conceyue great horrible terror mynde terrours lyke damascus heard saule came almost neck thus vseth god doe gloriously shewe power agaynst wicked teach godly bee afrayde feare see themselues beset rounde enimies suffered pharao go farre israelite beganne deuyse howe escape howe buried open mouth like woolfe would haue swallowed vp israel god sodeinly destroyed many thinges lyke sort myght rehearsed time woulde serue thys ought vse prescribe god time wil let oportunitie meanes escape whereby bring doinges effect let v obserue saying prophete tarie thou lord leysure psal strong shall comfort thi e heart furthermore euangelist declareth maner conuersion sayingthe maner conuersion sodenly shone light rounde heauen fell ground heard voyce saying vnto saule saule persecutest thou terrible sight mannes sens yet sufficiently teacheth v thinges easily done lorde sendeth light heauen beene lightning easie thing doe sende call backe sonne againe hee woulde haue light sodainly appeare ende cruell woolfe might feared greedie famine sort alreadie deuoured church christ unto flashing light added voyce steede thunder sodeinly smiteth grounde least feared thing thinges teach v easie matter god beate downe enterpryses enimyes lorde hostes arme thing agaynst none dispysed creature able punishe god haue punished sent water sodeynly destroyed worlde upon sodome rayned fire brimstone heauen haughtie stowte stomaked aegyptians brought downe one darknesse one swarmes fly sometime hopping filthie frogges sometime twinging byting louse antiochus herod killed wormes vermine bred owne fleshe killed saul tyranne wyth owne sworde let passe infinite number like sort bicause fall saul may serue steade many example shall profite v well beholde doe letter procured high bishop profite nowe sodeinly fallen auayleth power graunted authoritie agaynst christian helde vp ministerie garde brought engine weapon lyeth ouerthrowne euen seemed enceladus clap thunder yet heard ratling clowdes among themselues renting reauing fall thunderbolte onely light heauen flashing hys face voyce christ sounding eares stryketh bodie soule lyeth wide open yeeldeth christ conquerour whome little ment put cleane away men remembraunce thing serue consolation agaynst wicked enimies christ must applyed instruction teach v vnprosperously pride succeedeth seeing euery day example god power maiestie dare yet stowte waxe fierce god worde iudge one chiefe argument corruption puffed vp affiaunce well fauourednesse kindred dignity ryches forget god easily pull downe prowde stomackes let v rather acknowledge god power humble selues willingly vnder valiaunt hande least prooue vtter losse hinderaunce much able doe nowe let v beholde saule thus lying prostrate alongthe effect hearing voyce heauen asketh art thou lorde hearde cast downe whome persecuted yet asketh yet saying token humbled asswaged minde would god might see dayes whome god vseth cast downe either sicknesse pouertie affliction calamitie yet acknowledge lorde god hath cast downe bicause saule sheweth himselfe nowe somewhat meekerthey christes enimies persecute church lorde doth vouchsafe make aunswere saying iesus whome thou persecutest harde thee kicke agaynst pricke aunswere standeth two poyntes first teacheth also reprooueth heynous offence though shoulde saye thou thinkest thou goest persecute men hated men haue reuenger defender amongst men without reuenger neyther doest thou persecute alone iesus whome professe reigne heauen diligently obserue condition case long since promised patrone defender yea familiaritie betweene thinke done selfe whatsoeuer thou doest least c hereof may gathered generall doctrine whatsoeuer done worship christ done christ saying reade prophetes zach toucheth toucheth apple mine eye esay lxiij chapter speaking beneuolence god towarde hys people amongst thing sayth affliction afflicted let serue instruction tyrannes forget howe haue christ enimie persecute church shall one day bruyse rodde yron psal breake peeces lyke potter vessell againe let godly take comfort hereof tribulation haue christ companion2 tim whome suffer shall one daye reigne part aunswere layeth punishement eyesthe punishment persecutor church saying hard thee spurne agaynst pricke vseth metaphore translation taken ox horse winse agaynst goade preuayle doyng also pricke themselues deeper fleshe occasion hurt lorde threatneth shall come passe saule example persecute church saye attemptes shall onely vaine daungerous hurtfull also beginner church christ heauie stone lifting vp whereof zach man shall trie maystryes without hurt god promiseth prophete want example whereby prooue hereto belongeth storie pharao spurning pricke hath renowmed waues redde sea hys people destruction iudgement tryed sanheribe warring god people israell hande one aungell lost hys whole armie bagges baggage antiochus herode spake ere whome may ioyned emperours rome manye christes tyme persecuted churche within short space bought crueltie full deare wee ioyne example god iudgementes dayes agaynst enimies church shall say truth sentence christ pronounceth infallible v must vse thing feare power worlde persecution tyrannes therewith discouraged verie christ lyueth still forsake hys church hath promised vnto ende worlde blessing honour power glorie euer amen lxiiij homelie trembling astonyed sayd lorde wilt thou haue doe lorde sayde vnto aryse go citie shall tolde thee thou must doe men iourneyed wyth stoode amazed hearing voyce seeing man saule arose earth opened eye sawe man led hande brought damascus three dayes without sight neyther eate drinke saule hee conuerted vnto iesus christ great crueltie persecuted name church christ god chose set forth peculiar ensample grace goodnesse teaching v hereby haue nothing may glorie god saluation whatsoeuer thing else helpe v attayning thereof ought referred god mere goodnesse grace although men beare like hatred agaynst christes church paule god compelleth men open force take way saluation yet men one state condition must bee drawne conuerted mightie power god consider man ruled led naturall lore reede1 cor shall well perceyue vnderstandeth thinges belonging spirite god wherefore vnderstanding corrupt must needes bee euill corrupted bringeth forth impure wicked desire fleshe god truly sayd beginning gene inuentions man heart euill euen childehoode reason sinne power weakened selues able thinke well well appeareth man either would could earnestly think saluation except illuminated drawne molified god although men corruption manifest notorious others bicause saules conuersion many thing serue information luke standeth diligently vpon discription therof time bicause hath declared first act dooing rehearseth effect harde encounter diuers thing incident comprehendeth word marueylous effect god punishmet paule sayth trembling astonyed sayde lorde effect god chastyning wilt thou haue doe lorde sayde vnto aryse go citie c haue place diligently consider god person paules first paule may see token minde greatly humbled readie kinde obsequie seruiceablenesse doth vouchsafe call lorde whome hated woorse dogge tode owne accorde enquireth pleasure folowing seruaunts dutifull diligent readinesse please vse preuent maysters commaundement heare hereout may gather two thinges belonging instruction first whosoeuer feele god hande chastyning themthe dutie whome god chasteneth admonished dutie let acknowledge god like father punisheth beateth entent amende correcteth least condemned world1 cor psal repent cause prophete pronounceth happie blessed whome lorde chasteneth againe let acknowledge bee lorde earnestly enserch may knowe get fauour good propertie god elect thinke nothing grieuous intollerable perceyue god offended reprobate farre opinion although sometime compelled obey yeelde vnto god yet frette fume many guments declare doe agaynst willes wherefore eturne againe nature olde woont scarcely intermitted scripture sheweth example hereof pharao saule king whome may numbred bishop seruaunts sent apprehende christ though smitten grounde power worde yet rose againe iohn layde wicked handes whome ought haue acknowledged lorde let v therefore doe paule oft cast downe sicknesse oppressed pouertie become prayes enimies wayes troubled molested let v say heart lorde wilt thou haue v doe shall thinges turne health seemed v hurtfull chastisement hath place matter religionsecondly example teacheth v howe necessary seuere kinde correction sometime matter fayth religion see many propertie condicion vnlesse constrayned force yeelde vnto worde god wherefore christ commaunded shoulde compelled come heauenly mariage number euident paule one luke needeth great declaration therefore small error holde crye man ought compelled matter fayth religion bicause god onely hath power authoritie ouer mynde man graunt belongeth god alone inspire drawe giue fayth yet knowe agayne god commaundeth false teacher conuinced argumentes scripture deut also bridled sworde magistrate waxe obstinate incurable reason superstition false worship blasphemie commaunded made awaye absurde thing punishe lye wayte body goodes let scape free wickedlye deface glory god lay snare damnation mennes soules example euerywhere restrayned seuere chastisement haue ceased blasphemie haue bene brought knowledge truth thinges herein chiefely wishe wisedome moderation vsed let v heare christ sheweth himselfe courteous friendly himchrist turneth hu bleth whome seeth ready doe commaundement father prophet crieth returne vnto returne vnto reade gospell hee calleth vnto heauye loden math iohn openly testifyeth refuse none cometh vnto commaundeth go citie maye learne ananias hath doe two cause maye rendred commaundement god meanes trieth paules modestie whyle hee sendeth whome long ment violently laye hold also procureth hereby authoritie dignitie ministerye worde knoweth men oftentimes contemne teacheth v therefore vse thereof necessarye attayning saluation sawe hystorie aethiop whose heart illuminated secrete working spirite yet woulde vse ministerie philip although vouchsafe talke saule yet sendeth ananias learne mystery fayth saluation ministery baptised taken fellowship church wherevnto also lyke hereafter shall heare tolde cornelius centurion whome god admonisheth aungell sent vnto sende peter taught thing teache v must thinke ministery worde vnprofitable superfluous must looke angelicall heauenly reuelations instruct teache v lorde haue v taught scripture preaching worde whosoeuer contemneth declareth plainely vnworthy kingdome shall neuer come knowledge sayth shoulde god vouchsafe teache despiser order newe sort therefore saying paule standeth sure rom shall beleeue haue hearde howe shall heare without preacher agayne saying christ haue moses prophet luke whome heare neyther heare ryse deade declare saluation admonished also none neuer simple minister christ worde ought despised lawfully ordeyned seeing singuler vessell god paule sent ananias whome till time mention hath bene made authoritie god word dependeth vppon dignitie man standeth full strength force whatsoeuer whome god sendeth v teach preach furthermore paules co panions luke enterlaceth among premiss short treatise paules companion whome sayth stande amazed haue hearde voyce haue seene man hearken paule declaring thing agrippa shall appeare also beginning fell downe albeit first ro e againe yet stoode menne amazed minde reason great feare put luke seemeth somwhat vary paules narration wheras saith neyther hearde voyce sawe man contradiction thing sayde heare voyce bicause hearde sounde noyse sayde hearde bicause vnderstoode sayde god would haue vnderstande thing belonged else spoken voyce must referred paules voyce companion heard heard voyce christ talking paule pertayned thus seemeth paules wordes meane thus written xij chapter following saw verily light afrayde hearde voice spake mee place chiefly bee considered remayneth ioyne open enimies christthe companion wicked punished wicked partaker deuyses punyshed whether seruants subiects child priuiledges men must giue place obedience wherewyth god hath bounde v authoritie thys saying shall remayne firme sure euer must obey god rather men therefore many fauour men forget dutie owe vnto god deserue perishe whome haue looued god thing teach v auoyde company wicked cannot doe leastwyse take heede allowe wicked enterprise consent defende wyth authoritie fable storke taken among crane well knowne writing heathen husbandman kylled pleading hir innocencie vayne bicause taken among crane cropped eate downe corne paule another place pronounceth worthy punishment onely doe euill also consent euill rom thinges dayes woulde consider shoulde lesse marueyle manifolde misery tyme men faultie contemning oppressing gospell whereas one sorte cruellye persecute another sort busily seeke friendship league persecutor others stande ydlely looking suffer punished oppressed whome ought maintaine defende let v returne paule whose state luke nowe descrybeth first sayth rose vp paules state condicion whereas christ lorde giuen power doe addeth opened eye sawe nothing blynded brightnesse light came heauen wherfore commeth damascus ledde companion remayned whole three dayes neyther eate dranke whyle small token great feare stricken bodye mynde tell paules taken paradyse wee leaue vncertayne bicause seeme ouer boldly affirme anye thing god turneth enterprise wicked vpon deuysers galat meane season shall suffyse marke howe god vseth defeate deuises enimies turneth vpon owne head thing procure agaynst faythfull seruants paule vnto diuers seemed till thys tyme see profited many fellowes himselfe testifieth otherwheres nowe blynde body minde vntill illuminated god commeth accompanied trayne companion seruaunts whome picked ende bring christian bounde ierusalem himselfe ledde captiue bounde al like woulde haue brought many famine pouertie nowe suffreth famine three dayes togither knoweth doe lyke ensamples euerywhere scryptures see balaam balaac deluded whyle heape blessing vpon israelite whome mynded curse ouerwhelme egyptian thrust countrie laden owne treasure whome ment oppresse perpetuall bondage saule ministred vnto dauid euery day matter greater glorie whyle seeketh destruction herevnto storie haman mardocheus referred infinite others confirme saying dauid declareth god heauen laugheth enimies deuises psalm let v therefore learne acknowledge power sauiour iesus christ let v feare threatnings enterprise enimies let v submit selues faithfull obedience may hereafter heyres heauen glorie hath promised v whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxv homelie certaine disciple damasco named ananias lorde sayde vision ananias hee sayde behold lord lord sayd vnto arise go streete called straight seeke house iudas one called saule tharsus behold prayeth hath seene vision man named ananias comming vnto putting handes might receyue sight ananias aunswered lorde haue hearde many man howe much euill hath done thy saint ierusalem hath authoritie high priestes bynde call thy name lorde sayde vnto go thy way chosen vessell vnto carie name gentyles kinges child israel shewe howe great thing must suffer name sake although ought diligently consider conuersions callinges apostle yet paules conuersion others deserueth singulerly marked partly bicause contayneth rare example god mercye towarde sinner partly paule laboured al apostle neyther anye whose writing often alledged eyther olde writer newe matter fayth religion therfore necessary knowe howe god called conuerted may haue doctrine authoritie thing cause luke writeth hystorie diligently hitherto hath declared howe lorde interrupted fiercenesse horrible attempt middle hys race businesse forceably fayne offer himselfe lord obedient taught whyle grieuous enimie herevnto conueniently addeth howe appoynted office apostle contayneth notable discourse betweene lorde iesus christ ananias whose ministerie paule ordered euery part whereof declare farre forth god shall permit first lorde calleth ananias ananias called giue paule hys order actes paule may take order ministerie ananias luke speaketh little place paule large commendeth godlinesse sayth deserued among iewes testimonie good innocent man lorde certifyeth vision likewise prepareth paule prayer vision worthily receyue ananias sauiour christ well marked instructeth euident vision hereby perceyued ardent desire christ hath saluation mankinde shewed declared ingenerall towardes men especially seeking lost sheepe luke himselfe elsewhere testifyeth thing comfort also serueth instruction traueyle rather saue sinner destroy follow glorying feruent zeale god glorie rashly reiect condemne whome see haue swarued way truth moreouer taught expedient thing done rightly duely outwarde ministerie worde except minister duely called well assured calling hearer well prepared receyue saying followe worthie fruite auayle howe shall preach except sent rom argumentes shall bee emboldened agaynst threates enterprise wicked craftily haue vsurped intruded vpon office teaching againe hearer come well minded prepared heare worde lorde shall receyue wholesome seede eyther way eyther stonie place among thornes shall many impediment shall cause shall bring forth worthie fruites wherfore christ requireth honest mindes holde fast seede haue receyued armed agaynst suggestion satan luke worlde flesh bring forth worthie fruit pacience haue neede diligent preparation hereto euery man may easily vnderstande well considereth corrupt nature man thing well weigh expend shall easily appeare much preaching dayes little profite part minister without wayting lawfull calling lorde get ministerie vnlawfull meanes belly sake seeme vngodlyest hearer worde come vnto custome sake earnest desire amendment beeing altogither like vnto prophete ezech sayde come praye let v heare woorde gonefoorth lorde paule prayethfurthermore haue also consider paule lord speaking ananias witnesseth prayer vnderstanded continuall prayer made three dayes long easily appeareth circumstaunces bicause many thinges might mooue paule vnto prayer felt horrible hande god threw downe hearde howe accused heauen professed enimie sonne god came minde wicked enterprise crueltie vsed name christ church also banishment chaynes imprisonment torment lamentation cry woman child whereofhe beene authour yea guiltie conscience yet troubled againe wayting promise reuelation instruction able styrre vp earnest prayer yet earnestnesse diligence praying god disappoynteth might say whole three dayes togither thing commend vnto v incessant earnestnesse prayer bicause many vrgent cause styrre v vp also theretoo discende selues wee shall finde tryfling sinnes whereby haue deserued god wrath many tymes feele hande god anger conscience wickednesse oftentymes molesteth v still daunger kindes aduersitie thinking hereof able kindle v heartie ardent prayer shall wee worthily called colder yron yce1 thes paule cause commaundeth v continually pray let v remember continue prayer ouercome distrust impaciencie rashely prescribe god tyme heare helpe v sometime deferreth helpe promiseth v bicause meaneth disappoynt trust bicause exercise trie fayth example wherof haue paule abraham woman chanaan many others therefore let v bende force fayth follow example widdow whose importunatenesse luke christ sayth wicked iudge ouercome miserable vnhappie wretch scarce take v vnto prayer extreeme necessitie faint giue ouer god doe graunt peticions first verie little mindefull state seruauntes ought paciently abyde lordes leysure imperiously appoynt let v consider ananias ananias fearfully draweth backe ouercome feare daunger putteth expresse euident commaundement lorde sayth lorde haue hearde man many howe great euill hath done thy saintes hierusalem hee hath power highe priestes binde call vpon thy name alleageth testimonie others least might seeme feare vaine ridiculous matter stande vpon testimonie man vpon worde god also ridiculous rehearse saules doings others mouthes lorde though hitherto beene ignoraunt herevnto feare naughtie foolish counsaylor vseth bring v take consult discussing god commaundements yet appeareth example taketh hold many time euen holy men faythfull worshipper god gene feare reade abraham ouercome denyed sara wife moses striken lyke feare exod scarcely induced take vpon conduct leading people israel elia prophete tasted feare slaughter baal priestes wi whither flie feare iesabell queenes manaces threat ionas also deceyued feare1 reg promised safetie among flouds sea barbarous shipmen ayde vocation lord might also brought forth example others prophetes apostle man infirmitie man rashely condemned bicause see many token hereof appeared christ also howre death drewe nigh must take heede ouercome herewith leaue charge inioyned v lord rather hauing respect prouidence god math committe selues wholy god christ teacheth apostle wherevnto also referred general promise god helpe promise walke vocation sure certaine ayde succour herewith beleeue ananias also confirmed although first seemed somewhat timerous yet yeeldeth god instant vpon seconde tyme commaunding faythfully obeyeth himthe lorde comforteth ananias singuler consolation wherewith lorde comforteth ananias wauering fearefull minde go sayth chosen vessell vnto mee beare name gentile kinges child israell shewe howe great thinges must suffer name sake seemeth two reason alleaged wherefore ananias ought feare taken paules person first sayth tyranne persecutor heretofore number elect hereafter valiant faithfull defender christes name little feare persecution made paul rather suffer many thing ye name christ prayse paule wordes contayne singuler worthie prayse paule ought diligently consider excellencie god goodnesse may better knowne also may vnderstande howe great authoritie paules doctrine chosen vessellfirst called hebrue phrase vessell election say chosen picked culled instrument hebrues name vessell vnderstande kinde instrument vtensiles implement vse genitiue case substantiue adiectiue men called vesselles instrumentes god bicause god executeth hys iudgementes paule otherwheres calleth elect vessel glorie mercie rom againe reprobate vessel wrath senacherib esay reason called rodde god furie christ calleth paule chosen vessell bicause executed many thinges yea wholesome workes setting forth gospell fayth meane season word vessell instrument teacheth v remember state condition haue thing v excellent wee thinke learne giue prayse glorie vnto god hath vouchsafed vse helpe reprobate want knowledge god vnderstande therefore attribute owne power witte whatsoeuer excellencie esay dan howe much displeaseth lorde senacherib assirian nabuchodonosor babilonian aboundauntly testifie paule much better weighed thinges plainely confesseth grace god1 cor whatsoeuer teacheth minister must arrogate nothing themselues others remember effect successe ministerie commeth lorde giueth increase consideration hereof serueth much make men humble heart minde maketh take heede exceede pride securitie become vessel instrument wrath paule appoynted preach gospellsecondlye christ declareth ende vse instrument sheweth paule appoynted beare name aduaunce extoll name gentyles king people israel vnderstandeth preaching gospell whereby christes name vseth extolled celebrated repentaunce remission sinnes reioyceth onely crosse christ name peter cary sayde none name vnder heauen giuen vnto manne actes coulde saued wherby gather minister christ ledde spirite antichrist declare name wherein repentance forgiuenesse sinnes preached see concerning men iohn let minister remember also must cary name corner nation king iewes although apostle yet appertayneth minister ashamed christ speake testimony lorde dauid sayth king prince pet readye giue account fayth euery one asketh v howe great trust diligence paule discharged office committed christ text shall declare confesseth ierusalem coastes rounde illyricum rom filled country gospell thirdly paule strong bearing crosse least man might thinke great minister christ endued priuiledge immunitie escape alway free maketh mention also affliction sayth shewe vnto howe great thing shall suffer sake wordes haue commination promise first knowe christ maketh partaker glorie whome doth vouchsafe haue parteners hys crosse insomuch paule afterward commendeth philippian cause giuen onely beleeue lord also suffer sake sayth shall inuincible promiseth hys succor ayde bearing crosse paule himselfe shall best expositor saying writing vnto corinthian sayth iewes fiue time receyued euery time fourtie stripe saue one thryse beaten roddes stoned suffred thryse shipwracke night daye haue bene deepe sea iourneying often peril water peril robber ieoperdies myne owne nation ieoperdies among heathen peril citie peril wildernesse peril sea peril among false brother c see place cor furthermore thing teach v gospell preached without crosse tribulation worlde cannot abyde lyght thereof bicause workes thereof bee naught therefore euen paule place iohn christ euery place admonisheth beare crosse therefore foolishe men thinke ministerye gospell matter may brought passe without daunger go please worlde nay shall little meete office function except well haue prepared himselfe beare crosse kinde aduersities touching poynt see luke xiiij let v remember god onely giueth v power strength whose looue wherewyth looued v well perceyue shall prepared ready assayes paule afterwarde teacheth rom let v therefore make continuall prayer vnto graunt vnto v able suffer name christ also come inheritance heauen whome prayse honor power glory due euer amen lxvj homelie ananias went waye entred house put hand sayde brother saule lorde appeared thee way thou camest hath sent thou mayst receyue thy sight filled holy ghost immediately fell eye bene scale receyued sight arose baptised receyued meate comforted saule certayne dayes disciple set forth paule calleth chosen vessell little seemed vessell wrath furthermore attributeth handling affayres fayth dexteritie constancie paciency mynde whereby gather goodnesse god towarde sinner iesus christ acknowledgeth himselfe seruaunt whome knewe hytherto christes mortall enimie agayne bicause hearde testimonie christ gaue paule disdayneth call brother therefore minister strong bolde courage minde must ioyned gentle milde facility speach least either suffer themselues beaten confession christ hys due obedience else hawtie port ouermuch seueritie driue awaye whome ought embrace brother meanes winne vnto christ unto premiss luke ioyneth marueylous successescales fall paules eye hee wryteth fell eye paule thing bene scale sight againe maketh mention scale thende myght vnderstande eye lightly blasted vseth lightning striken great marueylous blindenesse without great marueyle wythin fewe dayes scale coulde gather eye take sight lesse marueylous see soone agayne restored sight lost meane season appeareth christ would sort admonishe paule state lyued iudaisme phariseyisme gamaliel scholer profited incredibly amonge fellowes seemed wyser see wisedome highly ignorance carnall zeale bicause lyght began shyne paule scale fell eye seeth hitherto bene fowly miserably beguyled blinde zeale ignorance therefore whosoeuer continue fayth saluation without falling let followe lyght christ walke see iohn chapter doth paule receyued hys sight aryseth paule baptised baptised eateth made whole first sayth baptised bicause hereof admonished ananias himselfe witnesseth xxij actes howbeit saye baptisme superfluous christ knewe c osen vessell felt marueylous power christ nowe endued wyth holy ghost whose eye aswell mynde body lorde lyghtened saintes iudge nothing superfluous vnprofitable know ordeyned god bicause reade obseruing thinges ordeyned olde testament till tyme correction commaunded seueritie death transgresse woulde neuer take vpon neglect thinges christ deliuered obserued till ende worlde therefore impudencie rashnesse dayes contemne vse baptisme lordes supper execrable herein declare perfection fayth dare wickedlye despyse ordinaunces lorde paule refresheth himselfe meatemoreouer paule taketh meate refresheth cheereth decayed strength body saintes therefore vse thing serue preseruation health god hath giuen v vse meate drinke clothing kyndes lyke paule admonisheth timothy tim vse wine nowe bicause cruditie rawnesse stomack example pieuish superstition confuted whych bicause abstayne thing necessarye attribute themselues tytle singuler holynesse although condemne fasting whereby pryde wanton fleshe subdued tamed rather obey christ allowe set merite god worde commaunded men agreeth saying lorde ye eate drinke doe yee eate drinke owne selues zach reason may sayde also ye fast ye fast selues yea paule teacheth v beware bidde v superstitious sort abstaine certayne thing colos tim sayth bring doctrine deuils commaunde v abstayne meates created god man vse first thing paule apostleshipbut let v go treatise present place consider first thing paule doth ministery gospell whome two thing reported first sayde conuersant disciple saye christian damascus ioyned himselfe iewes gentyles publike enimies christ vnto faythfull professed name christ hereby taught taken christian ought vse company godly abstaine whome knowe professed enimies christ although godly permitted keepe company infidel farre forth necessitie requyreth yet faythfull finde company keepe without necessitie worldly friendshippe pleasure sake hurt hinderance reade iesus christ diuers time phariseyes table publyke feastes euident satisfying owne pleasure winne saluation neuer forgetfull dutie wynke errours woulde powder table talke wholesome precept mystery kingdome god seeke companye vngodly thys ende allowe purpose endeuour winke blasphemy wicked abhominable ydolatrie foolish superstition corrupt maners filthy desire dastardly sluggish minde seeme trimme companion enioy friendship fauor alleage saying dauid accounteth among citizen heauen spyse wicked psalm psalm make much feare lorde sayth delyght saintes earth shoulde see christes souldiour antichristes tentes sitting ydle suffer doings saying knoweth deface honor glory christ secondly speaketh paules doctrine paule preacheth iesus worthily placed first dooing sayth preached thinges haue compendious abridgement paules docdoctrine ought great authoritie vsthe summe apostle doctrine confesseth otherwheres knoweth nothing iesus christ1 cor therefore onely knew thought best onely preach comprehendeth yea two poyntes whatsoeuer large sayde prophetes apostle writing first teacheth iesus borne uirgin marie sonne god hath herein comprised whatsoeuer belongeth knowledge christes person wherein acknowledge humaine diuine nature togither reason saluation cannot stande safe sure scripture sayth dependeth christ onely paule acknowledgeth nature howe acknowledge humaine nature intreateth taken crucifyed iewes knewe dyed elsewhere testifyeth borne iewes rom concerning hys manhoode sayth sonne god cannot denie diuinitie thing borne god god taught iesus god man god euerlasting gala tyme therevnto ordeyned made man otherwhere sheweth furthermore declared office sheweth christ annoynted god kinges priestes tyme past annoynted according auncient olde vsage bicause sauiour promised mankinde must king priest therefore god woulde haue called name messias christ say annoynted poynt paules doctrine iesus true god man also promised sauiour worlde whome ceremony lawe shadowe oracle prophetes sayde come doctrine deserueth onely called apostolike agreeth confession peter demaunded christ made name apostle saying thou art christ math iohn sonne liuing god thou hast wordes eternall life thys fayth buylt vpon christ rocke cannot swarue agaynst gate hell cannot preuayle therefore whosoeuer taken true worshipper christ reioyce apostolike faith let constantly keepe knowledge iesus christ defaced thought good confute confirme true doctrine christ authoritie scripture euident iewes acknowledge auncient promise messias bicause imagined shoulde earthly prince onely shoulde restore auncient kingdome iewishe nation maiestie thereof deliuer yoke romane bondage could neuer fynde heart acknowledge iesus whose comming poore conuersation humble death reprochfull messias errours men paule stoutlye wythstandeth affirmeth iesus sonne god messias authoritie scripture number argument greatly molested shamed best learned hitherto vsed deny thing commeth passe thynke shame yeelde vnto chryst truth gospell ought preachedthis place teacheth v howe doctrine gospell shoulde preached wherein opinion thinke playne simple exposition mystery saluation sufficient right waye haue bene euerywhere daye faythfull must admonished giue eare shall man neuer able doe vnlesse shewe altogither deceyued agayne growne impudent dare openly speake agaynst truth must also openly confuted least boldnesse cause truth come suspicion reade christ apostle vsed wayes whose example ought dutie followe bee called taken minister church cause paule haue teacher able onely instruct rawer sort sounde doctrine titus also refell conuince speake agaynst it2 tim sayth scripture giuen v ende confute aduersaries thereof thing seemed importance holy ghost woulde haue apostle vouchsafed endue hys grace furthermore paules ensample teacheth v man shoulde ashamed forsake improoue knowne error although thys seeme many men signe inconstant impudent mynde yet dutie doe god cause brother knewe brought caesarea sent forth tharsus luke hath bene diligent describing paules conuersion hath hee haue hearde declared doctrine wyth lesse diligence summe whereof iesus borne marie uirgin also sonne god christ saye king priest redeemer promised vnto mankinde thys agreeth confession apostle reade peter made name comprehendeth also whole order saluation sayd last sermon wherefore paule otherwheres teacheth becometh v vse constancie retayning keeping thys doctrine drawne authoritie man aungell bicause chryst sayde paule chosen vessell euangelyst thys place rehearseth briefe declaration thing done beginnning apostleshippe declare thereby faith industrie vsed aunswering great commendation christ thys narration diligentlyer considered bicause plainly teacheth howe variable grieuous misfortune faythfull minister christ thys lyfe howe faythfully aydeth daunger glorye hys name according hys promyse luke beginneth hys discourse wyth thinges came passe vnto paule damascus order hystory opened report word course hystorie must set order whych appeareth luke obserued verye greatly purposed particulerly rehearse thinges done onely declare thynges myght suffyse instruction church plainly declareth hath wittinglye willingly pretermitted many thinges forasmuch confesseth thing rehearseth came passe many dayes paules conuersion wherfore must perclose make vp order history thing paule himselfe rehearseth owne doings writing vnto galathians first sayth went damascus arabia came ierusalem returned arabia credible preached christ gospell damascus fell daunger speaketh author whereof sayde iewes hys later epistle corinthian xij chap sayth ambushe take layde king aretas lieuetenant wherby gather iewes suborned thus doe whervnto thys cause might easily perswade paule aduentured preach gospell arabia vnder king aretas hys obeysance therefore luke hath omitted paules voyage arabia force must ended hazarde forasmuch shortly escape sayde came ierusalem chrystes minister abyde persecutionfurthermore touching present hystorie chiefe point thereof note men may looke worlde soone ioyne themselfe vnto christ christ consecrateth hymselfe onelye whome chooseth worlde worlde afterwarde cannot abyde iohn teacheth euerywhere manye example prooue true marueile see many day offended aduersities scripture giueth v warning often wherewith faythfull christ haue bene invred first beginning world meane season let v obserue luke sayth thing came passe good afterpersecutors bridled hande god certaine day therfore paule time giuen preach meane whyle god stayed rage hys enimies vndoubtedly woulde haue stopped beginning kepte backe brydle layde whereby learne wicked cannot alwaye doe lyst seemed chiefely able doe like reason may made heade satan vnder power god prouidence doe nothing agaynst man god sufferance lord brydleth tyrant manger might nill many tymes vnknowne wyse themselues marueyle deuises come better passe see manne able withstande yet see god psal vseth bring naught therfore let v alway set god prouidence eye often heare enterprise enimies word let v remember heares heade numbred sight math dyd faythfull damascus brother damasco set paule libertie whyle wicked enimies lay wayte paule doe forsake hym leaue su courlesse vse saying lorde resist agaynst euill carelesse looke helpe lorde daring doe nothing themselues paule meane season thing sayde naye aduenture deliuer paule daunger owne liues yea transgressing common lawe commaundeth walles inuiolable appeareth auncestors counted walles gate city amongst thing holy consecrated walles vnto god verily knewe lawyer sayth man affaire coulde man industrie sufficiently gouerned ordered one great falshood men citizen somewhiles negligent borderer malicious enuious therfore leape ouer walles breake open ye gate city death although trespasse bene comitted yet brother vsed godly holy ordering matter without contempt ciuile lawes therfore deserue excused saw regard god law biddeth v succour perill commaundeth v obserue man lawe displace god law preiudice good godly therfore intent might escape present daunger let downe ouer walle basket paule refuseth benefite thus offered example first wee taught sometime christian men yea minister worde may flying prouide themselues rashly put themselues ieoperdie death reade christ oftentimes fledde conueyed himselfe iewes lying wayte rage herode also warned disciple take heede men math persecution ariseth flie one citie another deede must well aduised flie tarying maye set forth glorie god doth pull v office dutie wherein lorde hath appoynted v vnlesse haue diligent eie two thing flie shall shamefully betray glory god forgetting dutie neglect saluation whome ought holde moste deare paule consideration thing forasmuch fled notwithstanding damascus set forth christes quarrell paule gaue himselfe shamefull ydlenesse ierusalem elsewhere set forth doctrine saluation great fruite vtilitie hystorie following sheweth moreouer faythfull admonished dutiethe godlye must defende deliuer minister cor galat lorde hath bounde teacher requireth shall prouide safetie minister perill owne life playne accounted parentes bicause ministerie paule sayth borne againe eternall life therefore ingratitude falshoode assoone persecution ariseth let go vnbridled tongue minister god worde redeeme purchase themselues peace liues shamefull dutie priuate person defende minister perill owne life howe much required ciuill magistrate esay christ promised nurse defender church wherefore opinion playne foolishe saye magistrate ought defende religion walles fight whereas brother damascus brake religion walles great commendation defence paule onely paule commeth ierusalem furthermore luke declareth paule prosperous escape damascus saying came ierusalem came passe iii yere conuersion himselfe writeth would haue ioyned himselfe disciple galat chiefely peter mistrusted bicause hys former tyrannie vsed agaynst beleeued christ barnabas mention made ende fourth chapter hauing better intelligence doings commended ministerie great prayse vnto apostle namely peter iames whome onely paule sayeth sawe apostle beside writing galathians therefore remayning fifteene dayes space hee boldly maintayned christes religion till agayne layde wayte compelled flie disciple afrayde paule math haue consider disciple ierusalem luke writeth afrayde paule dastardly feare feare christ commendeth requireth hys people wysedome serpent scarce credible cruell tyrant could sodeinly chaunged thought good cause beware least might beguyle vnawares knewe saying christ testifieth child worlde wyser generation child light luke afterwarde enformed truth embrace courteously brother fellowe thinges haue example christian prudence charitie whereby taught howe vertues must coupled togither men lyers knewe ought rashlye beleeue euery one coulde egregiously counterfeyte godlynesse great harme false brother doe2 cor paule himselfe confesseth prooued great perill cause biddeth v beware newe brother yong scholers1 tim haue desireth bishop haue commendation abrode without agayne must take heede ouer great rigour wherwith many stiffe hardened thinke straungers vnknowne person ought reiected dutie christian charitie thinke well men easily admitteth honest credible testimonie giuen vnknown brother let v therefore vse moderation dayes seeing banished christes sake wander vp downe euerywhere let v yeelde sentence side extreeme eyther ouermuch facilitie cause men laugh great austeritie reiect men without difference moreouer barnabas considered liberalitie relieued needye whole church barnabas co mendeth saul therefore called childe consolation nowe testimonie maintaineth paules good name daunger ashamed whome knewe euery body suspected deede charitie singuler necessary bicause scarce anything amongst men ryfe sinister wrong suspicion blinded selfeloue flatter selues diligently note mennes maners seeke euery little occasion howe backbite good name therefore great offence aggrauate faultes wrongfully suspected whose good name fame rather ought tender defende thirdly let v consider paule luke writeth paule de reth ioined vnto congregation declared fayth ierusalem many singuler vertues first writeth howe hee sought familiaritie company church christes disciple worthy singuler prayse man consider howe paule long accounted amongst chiefe citie iudging worldly dignity worthy nowe stamped vnder feete desirous get christ ioyned vnto church see thirde philippian let v laye example eye glory friendship world inuegleth v forsake christ although christes flocke little state church seemeth miserable vnhappie yet common saying godly one day thy courtes better thousande psal rather doore keeper house lorde dwell tentes vngodly also paule giueth v great argument christian modestie paule taketh hys repulse good part whyle suspected reiected godly doth stubbornely murmure immodestly setteth owne prayse forsaketh church disdainfully paciently abideth remembring former lyfe marueyleth nothing matter yea acknowledgeth iudgement god woulde haue humbled exercised shoulde humble lowly wyse seeke societie whome disdainefully contemned cruelly persecuted let v followe example often iniurie doth vnto v grieueth v although knowe selues vniustly iniuried yet lette v thinke vnworthye iniurie haue deserued god woulde deale v according desert finally seeth himselfe reconciled brother prooueth himselfe deede true disciple christhe preacheth boldly speaketh freely boldly name iesus christ description gospell preacheth v repentance forgiuenesse sinnes name iesus christ onely haue oftentimes declared disputeth also greekes actes sawe heretofore author murmure grutch greatly disquieted church men vsed mingle lawe gospell ouerthrowe fayth christ iustification workes confutation whome paule appoynted peculiar counsell god epistle declare place teacheth v saluation must preached name christ therewithall must also earnestly withstande thing maye ouerthrowe touching poynt bicause haue intreated last sermon shall suffyse way haue noted thus much ende sayde paule better successe ierusalem damascus paule hath persecutor ierusalem also iewes made newe conspiracie agaynst woulde haue killed argumentes hypocrite egerly contending righteousnesse workes thinke tryfle slea innocentes shed guiltlesse bloude agayne appeareth fayth loue disciple accompanie caesarea sende tharsus cilicia paules natiue countrie paules constancie worthy singuler commendation euery side still daunger yet forsaketh christ fayth knew reading prophetes many tribulation iust knewe professed christ called beare crosse knewe also deserued much grieuouser punishmente bicause procured like vnto christian wherfore thought ought rather reioyce seeing suffred christes sake god might haue layd punishment owne sinnes consideration mindes woulde easily cause v also offended aduersitie meane season paule deserueth great prayse according god commaundement hehad escaped preached gospell tharsus owne countrie appeareth hereafter xxij chapter following example christ regarde hys owne countrie though ingratefull vnkinde lette v imitate paules fayth godlynesse constancie shall come passe god protector defender shall deliuered trouble lyfe present liue hereafter heauen iesus christ sonne god sauiour whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxviij homelie congregation rest throughout iurie galiley samarie edified walked feare lord multiplied comfort holy ghost came passe peter walked throughout quarter came also saintes dwelt lidda founde certaine man named aeneas kept bed eyght yeares sicke palseye peter sayde vnto aeneas lorde iesu christ make thee whole aryse make thy bedde hee arose immediatly dwelt lidda assaron sawe turned vnto lorde haue hitherto seene beginninges apostle paule howe entred hys apostleshippe great labor daungers twyse ieoperdie lyfe twyse escaped faythfull helpe industrie disciple thoughe without daunger thing teach v trouble ordeyned faythfull seruauntes christ whome yet becommeth follow constancie fayth paule suffer themselues drawne christ wyth peril aduersitie blessed abydeth vnto ende putteth hande plough looketh backe luke thereby declareth sufficiently worthy meete kingdome heauen whereas thing hitherto declared may seeme threaten vniuersall ruine destruction church godlye writer breaketh storie paule without instinct holy spirite passeth peter apostle describeth cheerefuller success church shortly followed consideration whereof ought bee diligent comfort able minister vnto v wading waues tempestuous dayes beginneth generall state condicion church gathered togither founded iurie galiley samarie church hath rest declareth ioiful prosperous ende trouble turmoyles enimies truth began church sayth rest may seeme sodeyne chaunge thinges passing expectation consider state church compare fierce mindes enimies deuises power church nowe god vsage hauing regarde infirmitie intermedleth prosperitie aduersitie1 co cor psal suffereth v bee tempted aboue strength affliction abounde giueth comfort difficult thing euery day sheweth lyke example thing naturall winter grieuous v frost colde commeth delectable pleasaunt spring cheerefull mery sommer fruitefull haruest continuall showres horrible stormes hayle commeth comfortable phoebus chaseth away clowdes mariner terror tempest ouerpast haue afterward cleere weather prosperous windes state church ruled lyke interchaungeablenesse example age testifie booke iudges may abundantly suffyce approoue let man therefore abashed countenance present calamitie thinke must vtterly perishe eyther god cheere lyfe better successe thinges else mercy take stormes world inheritance heauenly kingdome meane season place teacheth v crosse alway marke church neuer without bicause heare place primitiue church vniuersall peace came passe also oftentimes yeres following therfore iudgement vayne rashly condemne euery church benefite god enioyeth rest graunt vnto christian time breathing rest crosse agayne admonished attayning peace needeth neyther dastardly dissimulation false abnegation fayth rather constancie boldnesse keepe word doctrine faith luke sayth peace ensued paule stirred enimies truth damascus ierusalem earnest preaching disputation agaynst therefore nowe dayes woulde haue v dissemble truth say vehement inueyghing error superstition exasperate kindle enimies mindes talke altogither vayne though god able bridle keepe vnder rage doe nothing threaten fire sworde naye taught example men sake finde hart denye fayth truth doe seldome finde faythfull friendship next luke declareth fruite peace ensuing forasmuch saith congregation edifyedthe fruite ecclesiastical pe ce may vnderstanded two maner wayes church sayde edifyed eyther new beleeuers added therevnto else beleeued plentifull gyftes holy ghost profite faith holy ghost doth without cause vse metaphore building forasmuch church ye house god builded liuely stone say beleeue christ timoth peter faythfull called otherwheres ye temple holy ghost cause teacher called builder building ye church called building god cor furthermore beside example appeareth howe enterprise christes enimies pulling downe church vayne also taught oughte ende marke beare office church paule diligently inculcateth speaking publike exercise churche first epistle corinthian xiiij chapter herevnto let minister apply themselues power teaching reproouing let alwayes remember saying paul cor haue power giuen edifie destroy let therefore suffer nothing church serueth destruction thereof let kinges magistrate haue ende whome lorde hath appoynted nurse church haue already oftentimes declared elder discipline church belongeth let looke vpon let parent teacher youth direct doinges ende care shoulde euery day stirre vp priuate men also whosoeuer bringeth thing spirituall building vp church shall builde one man liuely stone vppon christ foundation surely deserueth prayse great costes builde church marble last declared faithfull vsed peace tranquility walked sayth feare lorde godlye vsed rest wherein liued filled comfort holy ghost attributeth feare lord whereby vnderstandeth thing belonging true religion knowledge god sincere faith loue god fulfilling word faithfull obedience vnto shal feare god knoweth shall ye knowledge god lacke fayth shall fayth want looue god thing must needes loue word obedience sayth also fylled wyth comfort holy ghost may vnderstande preaching gospell inwarde suggestion spirite iohn christ promiseth surely marueylously comfort mindes afflicted conscience men teache v god made one v reconcyled v merite christ middle broyle affliction besprinkle v promise god helpe wholesome water liuely fountaine thinges luke sayeth primitiue church sought recreation myndes ioyes delightes whereby gather exercise ought rest peace therefore execrable wickednesse ingratitude abuse quietnesse peace license fleshe meane season neither helpe counsayle least comfort ease whome see many wayes afflicted testimonie iesus christ sinne heynous common dayes whereby commeth passe abuse peace easily offended vtterly dismayde euery light affliction thing thus premised passeth peter actes doings peter traueyleth church church picketh two myracles done orderly one one done lidda ioppe occasion myracles said peter traueyling church church according apostolyke office vsurped vpon lorde ruler succour neede heauy laden distresse confirme weake pull vp error growen bestow benefit vpon men duty apostle appeareth many place name apostle teacheth forbiddeth haue anye certaine fixed sea dwelling place reade euerywhere paule afterwarde obserued trade confirmed church euery place2 cor sayth toke care church therfore bishop rome go foolishly ridiculously defende supremacie place first attribute peter onely euident also commaunded apostle next impudently chalenge themselues office peter altogither vnlike peter besides catch vnto themselues cure ouer church discharge dutie belonging faithfull apostle shepehearde ouer one church furthermore taught church haue neede faithfull ouerseers thing seeme peace safetie ydlenesse ease men easily fall licentiousnesse fleshe ease peace quietnesse math daunger snare deuill christ hath taught v meanes came passe peter came saint faythfull sanctified merite christ dwelt lidda myracle aeneas healed pa e restored one aeneas man sicke palsie lyue bedrid space eyght yeares togither health agayne name iesus christ myracle circumstance person diligently considered aeneas certaine thing reported make setting forth myracle sicke palsie hardly cured euen beginning let long run becommeth incurable figure corruption manne sinne hath brought v weake bereaued strength first state beginning wee bee able thinke well sickenesse coulde cured mannes arte counsayle2 cor deriued first father v conceiued borne v groweth v dauid testifieth himselfe psal wherefore except borne agayne aboue helpe v anye thing peter plainly teacheth v place iohn whereas mooued holy ghost commeth wyth great boldenesse sayth aeneas lord iesus christ make thee whole aryse make thy bedde speaketh wordes manifestly confesseth effect prayse myracle due vnto christ onely himselfe belongeth ministerie thereof apostle euerywhere wise declared restitution man lame hault third chapter faythfull lydda acknowledged perceiuing aeneas made whole name iesus christ conuerted vnto lorde iesus vse myracles beare witnesse apostle doctrine bring men vnto iesus christ whose power done therfore pieuish foolish set forth myracles wrought ministerie saintes teach people runne vnto worship plaine false miracle done ende establishe worship creature call men god creator thing might many thing sayd bicause matter intreated otherwheres falleth oftner intreated purpose nowe briefe let sufficient hereof admonished iesus christ onely phisition bodye soule faythfull defender protector hys church onely able preserue hir amiddes floudes persecution sodeinly graunt hir rest hir affliction prayse honor power glory euer amen lxix homelie ioppa certaine woman disciple named tabitha interpretation called dorcas full good workes almes deedes came passe dayes sicke dyed washed layd hir chamber forasmuch lydda nigh ioppa disciple heard peter sent vnto desiring would bee grieued come vnto peter arose came come brought chamber wydowes stoode rounde weeping shewing coates garmentes dorcas made whyle peter put foorth kneeled downe prayde turned body sayde tabitha aryse opened hir eye sawe peter sate vp gaue hir hande lift hir vp hee called saintes widdowes shewed hir alyue knowne thorowe ioppa many beleeued lord came passe taryed many dayes ioppa one simon tanner sonne god sauiour iesus christ sent disciple preach gospell furnished myracles whereby purchase credite doctrine declare force fruite merite iesus christ ende must two myracles principally referred luke reporteth done ministerie peter ende chapter first restitution aeneas laye bedred eyght yeares palsie calling name christ healed wherby taught strength decayed nature restored christ phisition able otherwyse thynke good thought able doe thing ioyned another myracle deede greater woonderfull comforteth v peter rayseth thabita dorcas deade life agayne thereby declaring iesus christ lorde also ouer death therefore ought feare death fayth grafted consideration hereof shall profitable order marke person whome luke intreateth beginneth description myracle hirthe description thabita whome myracle shewed although seeme matter great importance name called yet thought good make mention thereof troth storie sayeth called thabita assirian tongue dorcas greeke tongue worde latine tongue much saye kydde behoofefull consider thing reported hir first profession fayth religiona disciple bicause writeth shee disciple saye christian beleeued primitiue church called disciple vntill antioche called christian shall afterwarde perceyue eleuenth chapter name without mysterie admonishe v christ teacher declared christianitie consisted bare profession name rather doctrine preceptes diligent obseruation wherevnto paule seemeth haue respect2 cor rom appointeth obedience ende preaching gospell apostolicall ministerie therefore consideration name taught profession christian name vayne vnprofitable vnlesse faythfully obey christ whome haue professed also taught first steppe greeste saluation ye disciple christ foundation doctrine ephes cor well prophetes apostle vppon whome many saued must builded cause thinge first placed commendation dorcas reprooueth superstition ascribing selfe tytle godlynesse religion forsake name christ whome professed baptisme choose rather called disciple men1 cor whose vanitie long since hath bene grieuously reprehended confuted apostle furthermore sayth full good workes full good work myght appeare work ment exposition calleth almes deedes worde comprehendeth workes mercie charitie whereby neyghbour relieued whyle eyther hungry fedde thirsty haue drinke naked clothed captiue redeemed sicke visited else whensoeuer afflicted counsell comfort holpen refreshed worde almes greeke taketh hys name mercye least man might thinke hir vayne affectation sayth almes deedes mercy example teacheth v fayth maketh v disciple christ ydle consisteth sluggysh slothfull contemplation heauenly thinges possesseth mynde chiefe part man truly beleeueth heart cannot must drawe man wholy obedience god bring forth much fruite therefore iesus christ saith iohn abideth bringeth forth much fruite iames apostle exacteth chiefely vaine vaunter fayth workes declare fayth much mouth iacob therefore may worthily complaine haue much iniurie done vnto v glory merites owne righteousnesse saye enimies good workes seeing confesse fayth except shewe selfe workes none doe good workes except ioyned vnto christ fayth sayeth braunch cannot beare fruite selfe iohn except abyde vyne ye except abyde agayne example teacheth v whych deede good workes haue hearde disciple christ nowe workes charitie attributed vnto hir therefore bee good workes christian doe fayth according rule charitie selues able thinke well whatsoeuer doe without fayth must needes sinne paule sayth rom furthermore cannot called good serueth commoditie none bicause god himselfe cause called good liberally poureth treasure grace vpo creature therfore christ hath taught v lawe fulfilled loue charitie prophetes euerywhere exacteth loue puffed vp confidence ceremony lawe esay hosea thought men saued obseruing thereof yea teacheth v charitie loue cognizaunce whereby people seruantes may knowne sayth day iudgement haue respect hervnto iohn math place confuted thing men fayne owne head while attribute saluation trifling ceremony voyde faith charitie obseruing whereof scripture one consent sayth altogither vnprofitable see esay math colos c sickneth diethit followeth description dorcas fell deadly sicke dyed time god woulde peter apostle shoulde lydda howbeit god could easily haue prouided neither haue fallen sick yet haue died forasmuch appeereth prolonged day ezechias christ healed many mortall disease suffreth hir ouercome sorrowes sickenesse die wherevppon gather elect free common calamity wherewith mankinde vseth afflicted punished sickenesse suffer penurie hunger feele smarte banishment haue experience whatsoeuer aduersities paule testifyeth thinges worke commoditie rom god glorie declared fayth exercised tried alwayes appeare euident argument god goodnesse thing example blind man teacheth v christ sayeth borne blinde ende work god might shewed iohn hearde lazarus sicke sayde infirmitie vnto death glorye god iohn sonne god may glorified ioyfull prosperous successe matter declareth example dorcas ought referred ende restored vnto lyfe hir meanes many wonne vnto christ thing teach v neither shoulde offended aduersities falling vnto v ouer hastily giue iudgement fall aduersity miserie many time excellent vesselles god mercye grace reason continuall aduersitie seeme iudgement worlde vessel wrath moreouer addeth vnto thinges spoken dorcas dorcas dead washe hir corp hir housholde certaine widdowes ioppa deade first sayth washed hir body layde chamber corse olde time vsed washed bicause hope resurrection also knew life appeere iudgement seat god neede purified hereby prefigured purification giuen v bloud christ also meaning spice ointment wherwith dead body dressed buried ceremony might suffred whyle primitiue church vntill become perfite renounce altogither meane season taught christian people shoulde deale decently corse although ought mourning maner heathen amonge knowe shall resurrection thes neede iewishe ceremony bicause thing belonging saluation abundantly fulfilled christ yet diligent consideration must honestie godlynesse law charitie christian religion commaundeth v obserue reason body temple holy ghost therfore shoulde body vngently reiected spirite christ long vouchsafe dwell surely prophete doth chiefely vpbrayde moabites forgetting humanitie burned bone king edomites amos therefore offence grieuous dayes lyke brute beastes vse crueltie agaynst deade vnmanerly throwe cast carcass rounde yet vse one courtesie send messenger peter sende peter whome hearde lydda famous man reason myracles small deede faith charity hope minister christ able restore hir lyfe agayne greatly desired bicause knewe church christ neede yet member also propertie fayth despaireth death bicause knoweth christ hath ouercome death embrace fayth sincere affection loue casteth death also appeareth singular rewarde christian godlynesse liberalitie dorcas lyued much giuen herevnto wanted faythfully cared hir shee deade thus god vseth preserue memorie oftentimes commeth passe seemed hated men bicause godlynesse deade finde many defender good name whereof haue example heade iesus christ put vnto shamefull death crosse ioseph nichodemus secrete disciple buried honorably let man therfore shunne suffer shamefull death christes sake psal since god faythfully preserueth remembrance shewe garment madeouer beside declare presence peter griefe conceyued hir death weeping shewe vnto apostle garmentes caused made poore whyle liued beside dutie charitie wherof haue spoken may seene true reliques saintes faythfull christ godly ought openly shewe worship kisse sayethe relikes deade workes charitie steppe life sayd follow deade reliques becommeth v dutie prayse diligent imitation worship worship bone superstitious sort commaunded testimonie example scripture moreouer great prayse godly leaue behinde posteritie example presidentes charitie dishonest shamefull thing leaue gone token couetousnesse lecherie vnrighteousnesse intemperancie hourdes heapes treasure whatsoeuer instrument else wickednesse thereby gotten apostle sayth shall hereafter iacob testimonie iust condemnation wretched state shall memorie wherof widdowes fatherlesse child reason goodes taken shall testifye weeping teares wretched shall though committed small offence lyfe time hange ouer sepulchre swordes shieldes stande complete harnesse remembrance lyfe ledde robberie murthering maye remayne longer harde heart remembraunce bitter death able mollifie peter rayseth vp dorcas let v see length peter sent sayd straightwaies went sent vnto great argument readinesse zeale promoting kingdome christ wherby may easily gather spirite ledde shew themselues daungerous going thing serue setting forth christes glory saluation others came ioppa brought chamber corp layde much regarding weeping wyddowes bicause instinct holy ghost working mynded another matter put chamber falleth knee turneth vnto feruent prayer holy apostle truly followeth olde presidentes example forasmuch appeareth elizaeus prophete2 reg math iesus christ vsed lyke trade raysing vp deade prayer require certaine going aside solitarinesse seemeth poynt modestie woulde shewe thing importaunce among many seeke prayse thereby woulde doe himselfe alone whyle maketh
