let v follow modestie apostle therin beleeue serue iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen tenth chapiter vpon actes apostle lxx homelie certaine man caesarea called cornelius captaine souldiers italy deuout man one feared god wyth houshold gaue much almes people alwayes prayer vnto god sawe vision euidently ix houre day angell god comming saying cornelius looked hee afrayde sayde lorde sayde vnto thy prayer thy almesses come vp remembrance god nowe sende men ioppa call one simon whose surname peter hee lodgeth one simon tanner whose house sea side shall tell thee thou oughtest doe hitherto first part storie hath bene declared wherein hath bene shewed howe apostle according commaundement christ preached wholesome worde gospell euerywhere iewes great many beleeued luke declareth marueylous increase christian faith church yet greater part specially authoritie withstoode truth layde handes apostle stoned steuen made hauocke whole church ierusalem horrible persecution sent saule publike commaundements farre damascus oppresse growth christes church euen blade commonly vse saye vnlyke manye others written saule therefore vncurable stubborne contempt wholesome doctrine deserued length kingdome god shoulde taken iewes math brought gentile christ prophecied come passe thing beganne put effect luke rehearseth chapterthe calling gentyles declareth storie cornelius maye aptly name first fruites gentile called seeing chosen god beginning weightie matter aboue thinges principall vse hystorie must obserued consisteth herein howe god vseth cast vnthankfull wicked enimies gospell iust iudgement bounde nation compelled beare vnwoorthy herevnto added thing saye howe saluation contayned christ belongeth iewes onely also gentyles small comfort v come gentyles behooueth wee stande alwaye feare bicause iewes cast forsaken least like vnthankfulnesse disobedience deserue also refused paules saying shall alwayes stande full strength force rom god spared naturall braunches take heede least come passe spare thee also sentence christ long agone pronounced euery braunch bringeth forth fruit iohn shall hewen downe cast fire bicause vocation adoption vncircumcised gentile seemed iewes foolysh absurde thing onely many yeares togither thought worthye name tytle therefore abhorred nation doe turkes day first god would haue vocation gentyles preached prophetes whereof may see singuler testimony psal esay agayne zach c declareth notable beginning hereof cornelius whome called man might see therein counsell deuyse god prouidence doth vouchsafe sende aungell heauen cornelius instructeth peter heauenly vision whereby declareth haue gentyles called church shall see come place tyme haue consider god vouchsafe doe cornelius luke beginneth description cornelius description cornelius captayne knitteth vp marueylous breuitie playnenesse first declaring state kynde lyfe hee sayth captayne italian souldiers romaynes vsed entertayne diuers bandes men diuers nati ons according gaue name bicause among nation esteemed none italian italian garrison preferred aboue others doubt cornelius italian forasmuch one chiefe bande bicause dwelt ca sarea auncient wryters call turris stratonis tower castell straton maner state souldiers dayes must considered maye easilyer vnderstande state cornelius thus wryte romaine hystoriographers victory pompey called ye great gotten first subdued syria iurie vnto romaine empire people rome grieuous enimies parthian greatly encouraged death crassus ouerthrowe romayne legion number ensignes standerdes taken wherein picture splayed eagle paynted wyth whose incursion roades bicause continually molested thought good place city bordering vpon certayne garrison souldiers within short warning mustred myght make complete armie neede required whereby repulse beate backe enimie souldiers also defence safegarde city iurie tame keepe vnder courage iewes prone redy make tumult insurrection hence commeth heare often mention made captaynes souldiers writing euangelists pomponius mela hys first booke situation world chap whereof diuers dwelled kept house iurie wandered place place solde hyred nation caria pleased god kinde men gather togither first fruites gentyles church christ grace goodnesse might appeare greater seeing euident lyfe souldiers great licenciousnesse much corruption maners kynde vnrulynesse meane season thing haue spoken souldiers dayes maye gathered state people sometime free ingratitude disobedience lost priuiledge freedome manifest iewes god brought egypt set libertie people obeyed owne lawfull magistrate subiect vnder forreine prince power abusing benefite lost libertie goodes part onely subiection commaundement couetousnesse romaine president haue euery city garrison forren souldiers among whome though commended equitie godlynesse yet many example teache v part souldierlike saye fierce presumpteous yea god time past threatened infelicitie disobedient therefore let many enioye benefite freedome dayes learne example iewes obey lawfull magistrate wholesome lawes least hereafter taste lyke tyrannie bondage deuout fearing godbut let v returne cornelius whose conuersation maners marueylously commended luke attributeth deuotion feare god whereby appeareth free ydolatrie gentyles wickedly foolishly worshipped many god shall appeare haue bene great singuler enterprise consider state time nation vnder rule romaine whose lawes enacted man shoulde professe straunge religionin apologie cap tertullian writeth none might worshipped god senate woulde allowe god much refused take christ god bicause tiberius mooued senate haue taken prerogatyue suffrage voyce therefore must needes proceede great constancie minde cornelius durst officer therefore knowing coulde go vnespyde refuse goddes gentyles worship true god example men dayes confuted matter religion thinke inferior officer must attempt nothing without consent highest magistrate men must simply obey ye higher power denie whatsoeuer duty belong emperours king must performe fulfill keepe appoynt religion god onely affirme religion must violated broken prince pleasure knowe daniel fellowes long sithence thought doe chose rather cast hote fornace caue lyon violate breake god true religion greatest commendation cornelius openly worshipped true god tarying prince lawe establish yea christ commended fayth centurion plainlye confessed vnder commaundement another luke singuler testimony also myracle euangelist attributeth cornelius praise deuotion feare god declareth also outward exercisesthe exercise true godlynesse wherby vttred declared religious minde amonge first hee sayth feared god himselfe onelythe instructing familie housholde familie also well instructed true deuotion feare god propertie godly selues giuen vnto god wyshe also belong vnto shoulde suffer straye god whome knowe hath committed charge surelye abraham commended bicause godlye himselfe teach familie true worship religion god gene bicause commaundementes god ende purpose seene deuter psal vngodlynesse housholde worthilye imputed housholder negligence waxe vngodly scripture setteth v notable example hereof heli sam reg queene saba prayseth salomon bicause well ordred country afterwardes blamed vngodlynesse wiues manye therefore praysed religion let thinke haue done dutie selues worshipper god let labour bring haue charge vnto god likewyse moreouer cornelius almesse sayealmesses exercised workes mercy whereby appeareth religion taken roote hys hart enflamed therwith shewed kinde dutie vnto men also lyke ignorant rule baptist giuen vnto souldiours came aske hym counsell saying hurt manne neyther trouble man wrongfully luke bee contented paye wage though done little perfourming hereof thinketh dutie relieue men necessity also truly feeleth hys minde yet affected let cease glory religion bicause paule counteth thing greatest importance1 cor vnprofitable voide charitie unto thyrde thingcontinual prayer added continuance prayer iudge stirred vp desire knowe truth thinketh counted number hauing long agone attayned true knowledge god thinke true god promysed sauiour ignoraunt therefore desired haue reuealed vnto least shoulde come passe following owne reason might erre way saluation sense may gathered afterwarde wordes aungell saith peter shoulde shewe doe let v compare souldiers dayes captainea comparison betweene cornelius souldiers dayes vse defende themselues well example others calling shall easily appeare little example serue cornelius commended deuotion men thinke deuotion belongeth vnto souldiers vnto religious men cornelius feareth god houshold men thinke mindes souldierlike haue least feare god man cornelius sayeth luke holpe relieued poore almesse men lyue stealth refrayning neyther prophane church goodes cornelius continuallye prayer desired haue knowledge promised sauiour reuealed mennes tongue vsed swearing cursing blasphemie wicked audacitie pollute crosse sauiour christ passion woundes whatsoeuer else speake nowe howe cornelius warred vnder lawfull magistrate keepe forren force enimie suppresse sedition maintayne publike tranquilitie souldiers lyke people caria hyred mony entermedle busy themselues warres pertayning nothing hate name peace worse deuil speake souldiers seeing compared cornelius thinke themselues nowe dayes perfitest men christendome deade deuotion mindes men great desire priuate lucre sortes men mennes mindes almost colde prayer vnto god though aduersitie euery side vrge cannot shake carelesnesse calling cornelius nowe description cornelius followeth vocation beginning wherof proceedeth aungels apparition appeareth great token god goodnesse god might haue thought v vnwoorthy seruice basest creature contented haue appointed thinges serue vse sendeth aungels also paule teacheth mynisterie hebrues maner apparition voyde al suspition craft subtletie cleere light ix houre daye doth angell come vnto visible fourme yet representing maiestie man calleth cornelius propre name thereby make attent receyue commaundements god god vseth plainely deale v neede suspect guyle commonly vseth apparition deuils alwayes darke doubtfull yet notwithstanding cornelius great feruent study religion abashed sight angell thing may attributed infirmitie man property godly afraid presence godly maiestie wee reade came passe vnto daniel afterward christes three disciple mount thabor wee ought thus reuerently affected towardes woorde god forasmuch god way much sheweth self present vnto v therfore let v cornelius acknowledge god speaking v woorde offer selues prompt ready fulfil commaundements chiefe thing businesse message angell appeereth consist two partes therefore speake eche order saying message aungellthe first part conteyneth consolation whereby cheereth vp cornelius minde hauing bene long perplexitie saith thy prayer thy almesses come vp remembraunce god woordes negligently passed ouer bicause papistes abuse two maner wayes striue glory man righteousnesse merite christagainst mainte ners merites first hereof gather men prepared owne power workes afterwarde iudged woorthy receyue greater grace saluation christ next simply absolutely attribute prayse merite vnto workes though iustifyed saued thing selfe declareth deceyued theim bothe touching first vaine dreame place concerning theyr preparation forasmuch sufficiently appeereth cornelius self none thing rehearced one gentyles borne brought vp superstition childehode know passe god working yet shall appeare thing following fully euidently declaration hereof present place maketh little sheweth faythfull obedience cornelius thus admonished aungell also teacheth v peter helpe ayde man wherby myght hope defende himselfe agaynst power emperor rome moreouer suspected tanner house shoulde coulde teach man waye lyfe saluation would looke teacher schoole woulde also neyther meates forbidden lawe gentyles signified taken henceforth vncleane also contayneth generall doctrine whereby taught ought establish nothing owne heade agaynst god iudgement decree offende defyle man tim math admit cauillation saye thing appoynted keeping flesh vnder thinke meates vncleane owne nature meaning doe snarle mennes conscience precept appoynt certaine dayes abstinence binde meditation study concerned ende effect matter one little vnderstanding standing conceyt ofmans wisedome would say thing happened chaunce aduentures reuerence prouidence god worketh al thing hath number heares headin bookes agaynst academites first boke retractations chap suffreth nothing come passe hazard peraduenture allowe rather iudgement augustine ashamed confesse common errour vsed among though wicked sense deceyued vayne wordes fortune chaunce furthermore returne agayne peter holy ghost teacheth musing meaning ende vision peter aduertysed holy ghost shoulde doe sheweth men come woulde speake therefore commaundeth go downe go rendreth none cause hereof sayth sent speaking nothing successe effect thing nay commaundeth doubt reason debate matter fro himselfe hereof may gathered generall rule whereby taught must simply obey god take reason counsell haue hearde expresse commaundement god god hath authoritie ouer v commaunde v pleaseth propertie fayth captiuate reason vnderstanding subdue vnto word god suffer reason manifest commaundementes god ouer wicked audacitie go make authoritie god preceptes gyue place reason therfore olde testament sheweth abraham sometime neyther doubted god promise although sawe agaynst course nature disobedientlye gaynesayde commaundements though absurde vnreasonable see doth holye ghost place require peter admonished also ought suffise v vnderstande god hath appoynted spoken thing forasmuch euident ordreth thing wisely saluation wrastling fayth wherein ought exercised taken true faithfull worshipper god nowe dayes obediently diligently occupied much lesse troubled finde better successe doings peter obeyeth commaundement godbut let v see obedience peter declared hearde commaundement holy ghost first without delaye went downe nothing mutter wayward doe vse eyther interrupted prayer let dinner sawe messenger whome apparell might easilye iudge gentyles souldiers friendly telleth seeke asketh cause comming streightway messenger courteously aunswere faithfullye declare vnto maister commaunded singulerly commende maister diligently report oracle vttered aungell intent might easilier obteyne purpose came waye maye seene diligence trust christian seruauntes ought go maisters businesse onely serue sight paule sayth much labor absent set forth honestie worke commoditie ephe peter heard message vnderstoode mysterie secret vision perceyued gentyles signified vncleane beastes whome god woulde nowe haue brought preaching gospell fellowship christ saluation wherefore bringeth house next day goeth accompanied peter peter notable example hospitalitie men thing commendable becommeth bishop minister worde whyle herein giue others good ensample cause doctrine better spoken cause among property bishop1 tim paule thinketh also worthy rehearsed therfore peter example waywardnesse reproued taken authoritie beare themselfe verye straunge shewe maner friendly familiaritie eyther straungers owne house whome example peter cannot yet authoritie christ ought mooue euen marke writeth friendlye receyue men marc reason people importunitie preasing vpon scarce leysure eate meate thing luke declareth meeting cornelius peter meeting peter cornelius cornelius telleth two thing first called togither hys kinsfolke alliance acquaynted wayted peter comming thinges expresse propertie true fayth fayth stayeth onely vpon worde god seeketh wayteth carefully agayne burneth desire god glory loue hir neighbour desirous communicate saluation also vnto many others property doth cornelius performe without great perill haue alreadye oftentimes declared daungerous matter among romaynes alter chaunge religion therefore coulde daungerous haue many witness therof fayth standeth feare daunger well scripture many example euerywhere declare let v followe endeuour desire least whyle make prouision selues betraye glory god neglect saluation ought deare vnto v according law nature cornelius doth yet another thing assoone seeth peter apostle runneth meete falleth downe hys feete worshippeth token deuout minde hath good opinion worde god minister yet cornelius exceedeth herein offendeth ouermuch veneration whyles may gathered peter word attributeth vnto belongeth man many time cometh passe vse ye vnaduised zeale reason reuerencing god minister none beginning sprong superstitious worshipping saintes pilgrimage deuotion sake kissing reliques infinite lyke thing bicause men beguyled inconsiderate zeale religion thought sparke godheade whome god vsed sometime enlargement glorye saluation others behooueth v therefore lift vp eye god himselfe least whyle seeme religious defraude god due honor purpose belongeth answere peter doth dissemble cornelius error friendly reprehendeth saying arise peter refuseth godly honor also man though shoulde saye perceyue haue opinion farre aboue bicause thinke godheade therefore doe vouchsafe giue honor farre deceyued although grace god hath made apostle yet touching essence nature nothing man saye mortall frayle sinfull neede selfe also god grace christes merite therefore giue diuine honour bestowe whose minister seruantes aswell meaning peter wordes paule also expressed sawe men lystra lyke sort deceyued saying ye men brother doe thus actes men subiect infirmity thus apostle put ouermuch honor might yet haue excused vnder pretence made authoritie gospell thought vnmeete man shoulde abuse zeale men craft goe purchase authoritie vnto doctrine thing teach v honor ouermuch giuen vnto creature vnder pretence godly worship paule prescribeth duty ciuilitie commaundeth one goe another honour rom wicked blaspheming god honor applye vnto creature due god alone also reprooued outragious pryde bishop rome chalengeth supremacie vnder pretence peter suffreth come onely fall downe feete also compelleth king emperor kisse feete afeard treade neckes fowle feete wherein followeth faythfull minister christ caligula dioclesian monster mankind heinousnesse much grieuous intollerable bicause admitted vnder pretence though peece godhead wicked creature let passe aduersary christ saluation let v acknowledge mercie god whereby witsafe call gentyles let v remember dutie serue hath made v heyres kingdome coheyres iesus christ sonne sauiour whome prayse honour power glorye euer amen lxxiij homelie talked hee came founde many come togither sayde vnto know vnlawfull thing man iewe company come vnto aliant god hath shewed shoulde call man common vncleane therefore came vnto without delaye soone sent aske therefore intent haue sent cornelius sayde daye iiij dayes houre sate fasting ix houre prayed house beholde man stoode bright clothing sayde cornelius thy prayer hearde thine almes deedes remembrance sight god sende men therefore go ioppa call simon whose surname peter lodged house one simon tanner sea syde soone hee come shall speake vnto thee sent thee immediatly thou hast well done thou art come nowe therfore present god heare thing commaunded vnto thee god bicause calling gentyles seemed iewes puft vp confidence ceremony lawe thing onely absurde also vniust holy ghost vseth singuler diligence setting forth conuersion cornelius receyued church without circumcision ceremony maye appeare men howe nothing done mannes aduyse god ordinance appoyntment chiefe vse hystorie well represse prowde boasting iewes confirme myndes fayth come gentyles seeing perceyue preachinge saluation belongeth aswell v iewes euident infallible argument whereof heare howe peter commeth caesarea god leading appoyntment preache saluation vnto cornelius shall appeare playne consider peter first communication cornelius wherein excuseth comming gentyles cornelius declareth purpose sent peter therefore beginneth excuse peter excuseth going gentyles partly bicause iewes brother came ioppa hearde lea mght offended straunge vnaccustomed partly bicause cornelius friendes kinsefolkes gentyles least suspect lightnesse rashly transgressed auncient vsage people without iust cause hee confesseth therefore custome iewes least shoulde seeme rashly haue forgotten layeth oracle god whose authoritie sufficient excuse must intreate pointes particulerly speaking custome ieweslet eschewe company wicked honor god calleth hearer witnesse knowe sayth lawfull man iewe company come vnto aliaunt although lawe god extant expressely doth inhibite yet custome seemeth take beginning bicause god forbade marie make league gentile speciallye chanaanites deut iosue least companying might fall true god right worshipping credible manye vnder pretence affayres necessitie fall amongst menne therefore familiar gentyles become slacker honouring god thing cause deuout godly father made boundes lawe yet straighter willing take awaye occasion falling god hereof may taken generall perpetuall precept called accounted honorers god must auoyde companye knowe swarued fallen god eyther false religion else corrupt maners conuersation life nature prone vnto euill easily infected custome mennes vngodlynesse dayly example declare force companying euill case wicked talke whereby paule sayth good maners corrupted cor beside also partaker punishment delite company vngodly wherof scripture sheweth v example lot dwelling among sodomite first vexed cruell warre lost wife goodes length hys daughter company prooued howe much company wicked nation hurt whereas craftie subtile meanes committed incest lying father therfore without cause paule warneth consecrated vnto christ2 cor beare yoke wyth vnbeleeuers maister christ speaking punishment antichrist wicked babilon warneth people earnestly come among least partaker hir plague apoc companye common people doe entrappe beguyle godlye must false teacher much diligently auoyded vse craftily creepe mennes bosomes instill deadly poyson false doctrine heart vnawares see math iohn chap manne must iudged vnworthye doctrine saluationhowbeit apostle layeth late oracle god agaynst receyued custome iewes saying god hath shewed call man common vncleane calleth vncleane place vnworthye doctrine gospell saluation else euident men ought counted vncleane forasmuch conceyued borne sinne thought hart wicked childehoode psal gene esay righteousnesse lyke filthye arayed clowtes ragges scripture testifye bicause bloude christ hath clensed v sinnes iohn cap heart purged fayth man ought rashly iudged vnworthy purification christ exceeding liberalitie offreth men louingly giueth many beleeue except finde anye men kinde dogges hogges whome christ forbiddeth v throwe pearles holy mystery kingdome heauen therfore greatly deceyued math enuiously hide secretes saluation vse keepe haue professed christ knowledge chiefely considered apostle layeth oracle god agaynst olde receyued customecustomes must yeelde vnto worde god taught example authoritie god worde vnto thing instituted men godly zeale holye intent ought giue place soone seeme wayes make god therfore obstinacie pieuish pernicious go retayne ceremony church appeareth haue bene deuysed foolishe men confirmation superstition derogatory vnto merite christ thinke daungerous matter alter chaunge thing much daungerous sticke obseruation olde error losse saluation ought remember obedience fayth ende true christianitie2 cor math luke requireth v denie selues resigne yeelde vppe thoughtes iudgements vnto power god moreouer peter apologie defence demaundeth question saye intent sent demaunde seemeth superfluous although peter instructed heauenly vision also sent vnto meane thought woulde stirre vp mindes hearer diligent attentiue heede hearken thing wanting worde cannot preached profite doth little prouoke minde zeale teacher seeth men desirous heare whome god hath appoynted teache instruct cornelius answere vnto peter nowe followeth aunswere cornelius simple without colour hath diuers thing serue instruction men declareth cause counsellhe declareth cause sending giueth thanks vnto peter woulde vouchsafe come vnto also promiseth giue good eare vnto wherein plainely admonisheth peter dutie pervse order beginneth cause wherfore sent peter least shoulde seeme man eyther negligent saluation else arrogant went ioppa himselfe therefore repeateth thing mencioned touching appearing aungell grieueth luke oftentimes rehearse one thing thende truth certaintie hystorie might appeare summe matter admonished euident oracle commaundement god sende peter let v marke howe sayth abode fasting prayer vntill ix houre day three clocke noone v thing expresseth ardent desire truth wherabout like greatly troubled reason diuersity religion forasmuch saw iewes differed gentyles begonne new religion among christian therefore carefull least swarue truth made continuall prayer vnto god adding vnto prayer holy fastes man may plainly perceyue trusted merite fasting sought onely vnderstanding truth compare nowe souldier monkes dayes thou mayest perceyue howe farre passed godlynesse discipline fleshe publike officer gaue himselfe exercise whereby errour maye appeare vnto men denye perfite studie godlynesse consist without solitarie life appeareth also place cause men profite little nowe dayes studie godlynesse god incessantly called prayer feruent proceede sober subduing flesh dayes small regard prayer studie sobrietie chaunged surfetting ebrietie thinges vse make men vnapt eyther serue god man drunkennesse reigneth many place euen among minister worde man maye marke maners esaye attributeth false teacher chap lvj prince office commonlye banquet betimes morning giuen surfetting altogither vnmindefull saying salomon wo vnto thee thou land eccle whose king childe whose prince early banquette common man may see dayes noah loth math luke christ time passed taught marueyle therfore little knowledge truth since desire reigne among v vse styfle truth vtterly suppresse hir secondlyehe giueth thanks vnto peter cornelius giueth peter thankes woulde witsafe come vnto meaneth kinde speach vseth thou hast done well thou art come acknowledgeth hath done well herein plainly confesseth beholding therfore example taught must thankefull minister worde bring vnto v peace saluation according saying prophete psal sent worde healed also v steade father bicause ministerye bee borne againe1 cor galat made sonnes heyres god reade paule hath oftentimes inculcated philosopher haue taught euen lawe nature child neuer able make parentes amendes able recompence whose labour traueyle made sonne god heire kingdome heauen cause prophetes vse account faythfull teacher among chiefe benefites god may seene psal esay amos mich c paule among giftes holye ghost wherewith aboue adorneth church ephes maketh mention chiefely pastor teacher prophetes apostle euangelists dayes men growne vnthankfulnesse dare say minister sent deuill publike author euill shal one daye haue teacher meete since vnthankfullye reiect preaching saluation2 thes thirdly cornelius promiseth peter obedience attention saythhe promiseth attention nowe therefore present god heare thinges commaunded thee god wordes worthye singuler consideration teach v maner person hearer worde first sayth present god therefore behoueth men heare worde god church remember aboue thinges stande presence god saying christ luke math heareth heareth promiseth bee middle gathered togither name moreouer sayeth present belong vnto one thing hearer shoulde remember namely haue neede teaching instruction therefore vnmeete shoulde suffer wittes sermon time wooll gathering doe receyue word christ sayth way destroyed birdes bring forth fruite finally cornelius ready heare thing peter hath say god let v thinke required v also let v bolde heare embrace thing let passe like appetite fantasie man woulde compare thinges wyth vsage dayes ala horrible corruption shall finde many come togither sight god much like vnto whome reade ezechiel chap man shall euerywhere heare busie body haue hearde worde brag haue neede teaching instruction number dare controlle worde god haue thing preached whereof hope haue gayne commaunde minister silence speake thing dislyketh affection worlde cannot brooke howbeit better worde preached shall one daye feele wicked contempt shall beare witnesse agaynst dutie ministersthese thing also admonish peter dutie shoulde onely freely preach thing god committed without inuentions owne braine dutie minister specially consisteth hath already oftentimes bene declared let v set cornelius v imitate followe enflamed lyke desire worde may worthilye receyue doctrine saluation therby regenerated may liue godly life iesus christ prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxiiij homelie peter opened mouth sayde truth perceyue respect person god people feareth worketh righteousnesse accepted know preaching god sent vnto child israell preaching peace iesu christ lorde ouer thing although cornelius hath sufficientlye heretofore declared great desire knowe truth godly prayer holy fast yet euidently sheweth heard peter apostle come vnto ready teach confesseth apostle welcome vnto promiseth faithfully obediently heare say vnto god behalfe place teacheth v haue doe meane heare worde god profitably furthermore cornelius sheweth v example godly diligent hearer also appeareth godly feruent desire vnto word cannot without profite good successe according promise christ whosoeuer shall vnfeynedly seeke shall finde god little stirred vp peter oracle heauenly vision go vnto cornelius euen also secret inspiration spirite stirreth vppe minde thinke gouerned thing auentures addeth people feareth worketh righteousnesse accepted comprehendeth two poyntes whole lyfe man god requireth honor percloseth religion vnder feare god forasmuch manifest feare cannot without knowledge god without fayth obedience worde righteousnesse vnderstandeth excellent vertue giueth euery man best gouernor man whole lyfe springeth fountaynes christian charitie thou compare corrupt nature man thinges thou shalt perceyue thinges founde people regenerate cannot attayned without grace god fayth christ howe shoulde aliauntes christ please god outwarde workes seeing onely mediatour whome father well pleased therfore greatly deceyued wordes peter thinke merit man righteousnesse may established forasmuch grace god onely cause efficient thing highly commended error also confuted abusing place affirme euerye man may saued religion hys nation whether iewe turke illuminated reuerence god seeke accomplishe common ryghteousnesse peter meaning place farre rather goeth prooue doctrine gospell wherby saluation christ preached appertayneth men indifferently praye needeth pub ished men saluation may without christ kinde people moste pernicious vnder pretence christian modestie bicause wil seeme boldly condemne man plainly extenuate merit christ yea call doubt righteousnesse god goodnesse wisedome truth whatsoeuer vertues besides god man may saued without christ appeereth saluation must depend vpon free wil zeale came christ world vayn incarnated suffred died vaine rose dead ascended heauen vayne shall conuinced lie yt said man cometh father iohn peter also shall reproued lyer according spirit christ prompt sayde name vnder heauen giuen vnto men could saued furthermore pray shal say god ye father eyther iust wise true mercifull without great cause woulde put sonne bitter sorrowes affliction away therefore men whyle seeme modest adnihilate mystery religion let v obserue ende marke peter word leaue whome light gospell hath yet shined acknowledged assoone borne haue rather marke diligentlye businesse christ iesus gospellthe gospell beganne preached iohn beganne iohn whose dutie prepare mindes shoulde disciple christ doctrine repentance baptisme waye christ thought good declare hee woulde haue man seeke howe lyue licentiouslye fleshly vnder pretence thing euident many tymes past many doe dayes also euen glorye name gospell cause christ himselfe thought good beginne teaching repentance bade apostle afterward beginne math luc hearde seperate doctrine repentance gospell wheras without repentaunce cannot partaker saluation christ yet attribute saluation mannes merite righteousnesse bicause commaunded preach repentance name christ peter act hath taught v god father hath appoynted christ author giuer thereof vnto v meane season reprooued also slaunderously say open gappes fleshe whereby sinne preaching gospell whereas men none cause hate persecute gospell grieuously accuseth inueyeth agaynst open wickednesse cloked saluation vse doctrine wherby declare vse yea vse straunge tounge administration absurde thing ought iudged paule sheweth large first corinthian xiiij chapter hauing nowe declared beginning gospelliesus annoynted god sheweth iesus christ author thereof ende woulde notifie vnto v maner one ought beleeue expressely calleth iesus nazareth acknowledge reason basenesse countrie bicause poore lowly conuersation outwardly men contemned testifyeth god annoynted teaching wordes sauiour mankinde god long ordeyned maketh mention annoynting bicause olde figure olde time priest kinges israel vsed annoynted manifest1 sam daniel psal figure sauiour promised receyued opinion promised sauiour called name messias christ saye annoynted bicause denomination declare priesthoode kingdome whole order redemption wherevpon disciple asked gospell whome sayde iesus math luke confessed christ annoynted god moreouer least man might think excellency priest king reason outward annointing called name peter teacheth annoynted wyth holy ghost power alluding doubt verse dauid prophecying kingdome promysed sauiour sayth psal god hath annoynted thee oyle gladnesse aboue thy fellowes thus calleth holy ghost whose guyding sonne god became man administred kingdome priesthoode perceyued griefe sorowe therein kinde pleasauntnesse delyght interpreteth prophet saying spirite lorde god vpon mee lorde hath annoynted e sent preach good tydings vnto poore esay might bynde vp wounded heart might preach deliueraunce captiue open pryson bounde restore sight vnto blinde declare acceptable yeare lorde sayde annoynted aboue hys fellowes iohn bicause god hath giuen vnto spirite measure abundantly receyue fulnessesee eusebius ecclesiasticall hystorye lib cap came downe vpon visible forme doue baptised iohn iohn thereby knewe sauiour god declare manifest vnto mankinde see iohn first chap also argumentes prooue passed annoynted olde testament whether king priest although called christes annointed yet none power annoynt subiectes coulde call annointing christian annoynted apoc sonne god hath perfourmed hath annoynted v made v king priestes god father also none annoynted olde testament worthye diuine honour worship none hath reformed whole worlde none hath bene estimation amonge scholers maisters death coulde finde heart die maisters namesake moreouer mannes kingdome priesthoode hath endured euer vnto day bicause mortall men neede uicares successor administer office wherevnto called sonne god made administrator euerlasting kingdome hath receyued power heauen earth math bicause present hys church hath neede neyther uicar successor king euer psal ephes order melchisedech hee blesseth v spirituall benediction teacheth v outwarde worde inspiration holy spirite giueth vnto church apostle prophetes euangelistes ephe pastours teacher hath one offering heb say price body bloud purged sinnes world hath made perfite euer sanctified furthermore gone vp heauen maketh intercession v faythfull bishop v heb thing done v god therefore truly sayde peter annoynted god saye appoynted king priest people whervpon gather sinne agaynst eternall decree god make themselues patrones saluation sauiours soules priestes intercessours robbe sonne god honor constantly affirmeth prophete giue none esay agayne bicause manifest annointed god must beleeue power inuincible neede feare force worlde hell acknowledge king bicause haue otherwheres intreated argument lette fewe thing tyme suffise christ accomplyshed office king priestfurthermore least man might thinke iesus sonne god delyted bare name tytle maner men peter declareth hath doth faithfully performe office king priest present premyseth certayne generality declaring benefites arde v meaning hereafter intreate maner redemption sermon following shall declare first sayeth went doyng good vnto men christ goeth good dutie faithfull king priest onely helpe ayde counsell seeke hande also diligently prouide looke haue neede tutor benefactor euangelistes teache v iesus christ sonne god hath faithfully performed saluation sake came worlde caried doctrine saluation myracles wherwith confirmed ouer iury galiley remayned long whyle anywhere plainly confessed must preache men euerywhere marc luke onelye curteously receyue came also friendly inuited called hym laboured heauy laden promising would come vnto hym reast refreshing math appeareth dyd tymes passed doth also daye spreadeth preachyng gospell wyde ouer enricheth lyke shower raine one nation seede heauenly word esay without cause may sayd adayes also goeth vp downe bestowing benefites euery man faithfully teacheth errour bringeth deceyued wandring pilgrimes way friendly correcteth corrupted vice gently comforteth afflicted conscience righteousnesse satisfaction defendeth feared rigor god iudgement therefore great hydeous ingratitude abhorre benefactour cruell vnmercifull vse seeke helpe counsell others yet iniquitie horrible wickedly reiect word witsafe heare cast saluation ought seeke embrace open armes kinde diligence vice common dayes indignitie wherof woulde diligently expende shoulde lesse marueyle cause many euils euery side compasse v benefite iesus christ sayth oppressed deuill healed christ healeth oppressed deuill appertayneth peculiarlye office king whereof also mention made psal shall kepe simple folke right defende child poore punish wrong dooer c bicause christ author spirituall redemption peter maketh mention spirituall tyrant saye deuill made first parentes guiltie transgression brought kinde calamitie death selfe world permission god oppressed mankinde wyth exceeding tyrannie thereof called prince worlde brought passe sinne god created vnto lyfe fell death whome god aboue creature endued reason sinned agaynst lawe nature ought wholy haue depended worde god suffred themselues seduced lying oracle deuill whome became haue worshipped god onely worshipped woode stone abhominable sacrifice vnto deuils bicause fewe acknowledged great tyrannie deuill god suffred also many corporallye possessed raged aswell agaynst themselues agaynst others may learne hystorie gospell malady iesus christ gyuen phisition according promyse made beginning1 iohn shoulde breake serpent heade apostle sayeth destroye workes deuill thing abundantly declareth able willing doe whyle worde healeth whych scourged horrible whippes sickness draue forth men deuils vncleane spirites would suffer seemed lordes ouer thinges hysse heereto referred whatsoeuer myracles lyke sort euangelistes write whereby declared vnto v strong man come hath entred deuils house saye worlde hath bounde taken awaye armor harnesse luke christ teacheth v gospell peter testifyeth thing done power god aunswere scribe sayde cast forth deuils helpe belzebub example hystories declare kingdome deuill destroyed power christ euident oracle ceassed kept silence christ died constantinus wryteth dioclesian reygnedsee eusebius lyfe constantine lib see also lyke aunswere deuill coniurers co spiring athanasius ruffinus x booke eccles history ca deuill complayned apollo caue denne christian whome called iust let could gyue true oracle vsed howbeit shall little hereafter see euident proofes christes victorie agaynst deuill peter disputeth death resurrection meane whyle becommeth v remember dutie taken power darkenesse kingdome sonne god defende libertie fight continually agaynst satan common enimye time founde vnthankefull iesus christ deliuerer whome prayse honour power glory euer amen lxxvj homelie wee witnesse thinges hee lande iewes ierusalem whome slewe hanged tree god raysed vp thirde day shewed openly people vnto v witness chosen god intent eate drinke arose death hee commaunded v preache vnto people testifie hee ordeyned god iudge quicke deade giue prophet witnesse name whosoeuer beleeueth hm shall receyue remission sinnes apostle peter hath taught cornelius centurion appoynted therevnto god wyse hath also set men generall absolute doctrine saluation preacheth vnto iesus christ onely sauiour mankinde whome scripture testifyeth meane saluation conteyned hereof discourse e sayd two thing first god annoynted ordeyned king priest people wherevpon gather appoynt themselues mediatours patrones saluation doe sinne agaynst eternall purpose god next teacheth howe diligently faythfully iesus christ vsed himselfe office sayeth went exceeding liberalitie offred benefite saluation sought ende purpose doyng bring oppressed deuill kingdome liberty sonnes god deliuery declared shewed myracles thorowe faythfully releeued vexed troubled well wyth incurable disease wyth rage deuils wholesome helpe power worde vnto thing peter thys place addeth perfyteth maketh vp doctrine saluation first declareth order maner christ vsed redeeming mankynde sheweth vtilitye profite commeth v thereby therefore place worthye considered v verye diligently declareth order maner mannes redemptionthe apostle witness christ confirmeth doctrine witness saying wee witness thinges lande iewes hierusalem ought seeme absurde straunge thing man peter boldlye produceth himselfe among fellowes witness sayinges haue already oftentimes hearde howe christ appoynted charge little hereafter shall declared chosen god beare witnesse iesus christ thing concerning saluation thing teach v howe grieuously offende disdayne beleeue gospell narration thyngs christ bare emptye hath testimonie god easily appeareth contumely reproch must needes redounde vnto god hath bene otherwhere large declared howbeit concerning maner redemptionthe maner howe mankinde redeemed sayde chiefly intreated place three thinges sayde christ thinges contayned needefull done behalfe among first death christ toucheth briefly bicause well knowneour sinnes purged sacrifyce christ saith ye iewes hanged tree killed maketh mention tree muche bicause would expresse cruell horrible kinde death put hearer remembraunce mistery sacrifice christ offred dyed sinnes appeareth sacrifice woont offered burned vpon bundels woode thus doth peter see interpretate place second chapiter first epistle writeth christ bare sinnes body tree purged sacrifice body vpon altare crosse christ teacheth v sayth iohn giue flesh lyfe world playne crosse esaias prophete copious expositor thing sayth chap liij wounded offence smitten wickednesse chastisement peace layde vpon stripe healed haue gone astraye like sheepe euery one hath turned owne way lorde hath heaped togither vpon hm iniquitie v c pertayned vnto priesthoode christ whome behooued thys sort paule sayth enter heauen heb bloude ox gotes owne bloude offring vp himselfe put sinne flight take awaye sinnes manye behooued redemption take beginning forasmuch god angry v bicause sinnes lawfull v come presence profitable consideration christes death thinke vpon sacrifice body offred sinnes meane season let v thinke vayne peter might haue made mention death sayth also ayne iewes herein accuseth great vnkindnesse nation especially seeing little made diligent mention christes benefites let v therefore consider continuall ingratitude worlde offende woondering affliction persecution godly wherewith doctrine gospell assaulted death ouercome resurrectio christthe seconde thing order redemption glorious resurrection christ peter entreateth diligentlye bicause chiefe foundation religion saying paule well knowne christ bee risen agayne preaching vayne fayth vayne cor bee yet sinnes perished fallen slepe christ might sure saluation needefull death hitherto power ouer v reason sinne shoulde vanquished ouercome shoulde haue held christ fast men man could haue hope saluation bene obteyned wherefore christ declared himselfe lord life death raysing agayne lazarus certayne others euen suffered death himselfe bene buryed thirde daye lyke valiaunt conquerour hee burst peeces bandes death breaking open gate hell returned lyfe agayne euident infallible argument sinne death vanquished bicause iewes denye cauill resurrection christ ende mathew sayth brybed souldiers mony therefore peter constantly nowe defendeth god sayth raysed iesus third daye shewed openly people vnworthy whome christ whome deadly hated shoulde familierly declare himselfe vnto v witness chosen god intent eate drinke arose death whereas might haue alledged diuers argument true resurrection content whereby christ himselfe declared chiefely truth thereof luke iohn howe twyse eate meate disciple offered sight great gentlenesse goodnesse christ confirme v resurrection whose dulnesse well acquaynted woulde abase himselfe lowe eate meate also whereof glorified body neede bicause man hereafter doubt risen agayne true naturall bodye went vppon earth whereby improbitie wickednesse greater yet cease scoffingly deride resurrection deade bicause lyke vnto iewes shall also iudged vnworthy haue saluation christes resurrection furthermorechrist iudgeth quicke dead although iesus christ sonne god death resurrection wherin may also included ascention heauen hath accomplished whole redemption saluation therewithall hath purged sinne taken awaye power hell yet peter ioyneth thirde thing herevnto say giue account saying doings surely thinking hereof doth effectuously keepe vnder affection wanton fleshe entycements worlde agayne strong effectuall comfort godly vnderstand shall day iudgement wherein euery thing distinguished doctrine necessary may seeme euident first shewing vtilitie thinges hath hitherto declared teacheth v haue forgiuenesse sinnes name christ whyle maketh mention thereof plainely testifieth sinner haue neede thereof whyle teacheth giuen christ sheweth free proceeding meere grace god without desert may heare saying paule men haue sinned rom destitute glory god cleane awaye peter sheweth v haue forgiuenesse sinnes name christ onely teacheth v lose labour seeke otherwhere newe argument confirmeth graue sentence vttered senate ierusalem none name vnder heauen giuen vnto man could saued christ himselfe affirmeth sayth way truth iohn lyfe man commeth vnto father remission sinnes taken holde faythsecondarily peter declareth v sentence meane whereby take holde remission sinnes offred v christ sayth euerye one beleeueth obtayneth fayth obtayne forgiuenesse sinnes reason doctrine faith onely grafteth v christ sayth himselfe eateth fleshe drinketh bloude say whosoeuer beleeueth dwelleth forasmuch forgiuenesse sinnes dependeth vpon god free promise none waye taken holde fayth fayth taketh holde christ set forth gospell cleaueth altogither vnto promise god cause christ euerywhere attributeth saluation vnto faith euerywhere repeateth generall sentence marc math math beleeueth hath lyfe euerlasting agayne beleueth baptised shall saued sayth woman great thy fayth vnto thee thou wilt agayne thy fayth hath made thee whole hence tooke apostle opinion teach men iustified fayth onely christ saye deliuered purged sinnes opinion iustification workes plainely excluded iustification euen nowe declared christ onely take holde none waye fayth must needes followe fayth onely iustified yet condemne exercise good workes take insolent tytle merite iustification glory whereof due onely christ christ maye haue glory wholye himselfe otherwise ignorant kinde innocencie righteousnesse required whome iesus christ hath restored libertie child god merite bloude whereas peter little confirmed doctrine testimonie apostlesthe prophetes teach iustification fayth bicause man shoulde thinke anye collusion craft among defendeth cause yet grauer authoritie telling v prophetes testifye christ doubt stoode pretie whyle reciting testimony albeit luke thought ynough touch chiefe poynts sermon breuities sake hath passed ouer easy matter prooue peter sayth writing prophet begin moses yet rehearse first promise writeth abraham beleeued god gene fayth imputed righteousnesse playne abraham none faith wayting seede nation shoulde blessed gene iohn iesus christ sayth desired see day reioyced therein moses also setteth vnto v figure law man denie haue beene shadowes christ especially haue diligentlye reade one epistle hebrues rom paule plainely prooueth iustification fayth xxxij psalme esaye neede speake whereas haue heard testimony vnto addeth also knowledge righteous seruaunt shall iustifie multitude shall beare awaye sinnes esay beastes earth vermin wormes foules ayre hearde voyce saying vnto aryse peter slea eate sayd lord nothing comon vnclean hath time entred mouth voyce aunswered agayne heauen count thou thing common god hath clensed done three tymes taken vp agayne heauen beholde immediatlye three men already come house sent caesarea vnto spirite sayde vnto mee shoulde go without doubting moreouer sixe brother ac ompanyed wee entred mannes house shewed v howe seene aungell house stoode sayde sende men ioppa call simon whose surname peter shall tell thee word wherby thou thine house shall saued began preache withstanded god although blessed euaungelyst luke hath abundantlye diligently described hystorie cornelius conuerted vnto fayth chapter going yet chapter repeateth againe another sort maner narration cause might appeare men gentyles vndoubtedly called according god appointment preaching gospell receyued communion church sacrament baptisme declaration hereof necessarye bicause iewes hath already oftentimes bene shewed serueth much instruction bicause grace god goodnesse thereby marueylouslye set forth certaintie saluation springeth iewes firmely prooued therefore man must accuse holy writer often repeating one thing needelesse loquacitie babling rather ought prouoked diligence earnestly weygh consider matter importance furthermore luke taketh occasion rehearse agayne hystorie reason vniust iudgement certaine sort person deceyued accuse peter whereby enforced thus declare open meaning dooing vnto howe church iudgeth peter deedefirst therefore let v see howe church dispersed iurie iudged concerning vocation gentyles thing coulde long lye hidden bicause notable worthynesse person also straunge thinge seene therefore sayth fame hereof streyght waye published ouer iurie two sortes men vttering bewraying themselues first apostle brother name suppose minister word fellowes ment euaungelist sayeth one thing hearde gentyles receyued word god also wherevpon may gathered although yet vnderstoode well mysterie matter yet mindefull christian modestie woulde blame accuse peter ouer hastily whose credite diligence manye proofes tryed whose modestie holy ghost hath set v imitate least iudging mennes doinges ledde vnaduised zeale breake rule christian charitie also considered phrase maner speaking sayth gentyles receyued worde god receyue word god whereas might haue sayd receyued christendome made partaker christ church way thought saye somewhat make difference betweene true christianitie counterfayte dissembling kinde person receyue worde god acknowledge worde god therefore labor transfourmed become follower god paule writeth thessalonian receyued word sayth receyued v worde whereby learned knowe god thes receyued worde man deede worde god agayne became follower v lord receyuing worde much affliction thes receyue worde god sort bring forth marueylous fruites denying themselues mortifying affection fleshe forsake olde vngodlynesse child light followe innocencie know god light1 iohn haue fellowship must walke light bragge gospell neede oftentimes consider thing least whyle crye open mouth haue receyued word god accuse themselues lying shewing forth fruites agreeable worde let v come kinde men indifferent iudges peter singuler peter reprehe ded well luke sayth circumcision whereas first sort also circumcised iewes suppose meaneth people iewes onely rather would taken christian yet cleaue fast vnto circumcision ceremony lawe necessary vnto saluation men sayth luke ouer boldly reprehended peter openly contended lay charge matter life death went men vncircumcised gentyles heathen men eate thus accuse breaking tradition elder custome origine whereof haue otherwheres declared haue sproong law god ouer straitly strayned example taught howe hurtfull thing bletched error continue long commonly certaine frowarde feruencie defende error ioyned therevnto bicause inclination mannes nature none seeme haue erred vyce men also blinded woulde admit gentyles congregation albeit manifest playne testimonie god admitted thereinto great tough corruption mannes nature inuincible stubbornnesse defence error receiued would god day infinite example kinde men heades church thinke tryfle defende thing knowe contrary expresse oracle god worde furthermore place teacheth vsno man please party man prosperously godlily doe thing shall satisfie men rather state worlde shoulde commended accused blamed scripture teacheth v came passe vnto moses amongst egyptian israelite reade howe prophetes experience watched laboured mennes saluation called disturber realme enimies countrie author euill appeareth worlde none iudgement iesus christ one accused neglecting washing handes another conuersant sinner againe breaker sabboth crie samaritane possessed ye deuill therfore peter suffreth yt maister worthy singuler prayse bringing kingdome god prosperously vnto gentile faine rather abide ye venymous bitings slaunderers onely manifest enimies christ doe thus vniustly controll also would taken christian brother yea schollers take fetula rod maister consideration herof ought make v pacient like time fal vnto v also teacheth v must labour rather approoue doings god worlde many time vnkinde benefactours moste part deceyued iudgement againe let v learne great offence dishonestly defame slaunder well doinges brother doe declare deuills disposition whome greekes therefore haue called diabolum saye deuill bicause vseth slaunder misreport misconstrue saying also breake rule charitie1 cor prouer pet whose propertie alwayes hope well brother rather couer multitude sinnes disclose open vniust accusation waywarde men followeth peter apologie defence deuoyde bitternessethe apology defence peter ende scope whereof shewe nothing herein done priuate diuise thing commaundement god woulde haue gentyles receyued communion christ church bicause sawe aduersaries mindes greatly exasperated frameth diligent narration thing done euen beginning confirmeth sounde argumentes narration touch modestie apostle considered thought good humblye carefully excuse himselfe whome hauing iust cause might eyther haue set light giuen aunswere least might snappishly haue put back rebuked knewe lawe aswell belonged himselfe commaunded christian men ready giue reason aunswere euery man pet place paciently suffereth vniust censure checke men iust quarrell accused paule men dissimulation inconstancie reade aunswered nothing disdainefully galat reade alwaye custome primitiue church bishoppes coulde suffer beare bee iudged corrected byshoppes eusebius storye ye church v booke chap thus appeareth victor bishop rome reprehended admonished dutie iraeneus certaine bishop lesse famous church ouer hastie sentence excommunication giuen bishoppes asia thing reprooue pride bishop rome folowed ashamed make themselues iudges ouer world also refuse iudgement men hart quaketh often remember blasphemous canone haue pope condemneddistinct cap pope c though forget owne mennes saluation leade headlong hell whole heapes mennes soules howbeit coulde maner way euidently haue prooued himselfe antichrist refuseth iudgement church bishop challenging themselues supremacie ouer let passe let v hearken peter intreating cause matter peter apologie vseth diligent narration discourse euen nowe declared ordereth reporteth onelye done sheweth also well done lawfully narration consisteth fiue partes member speake much appertaineth present matter letting passe hath bene sayde chapter going vi sheetein first part contayned vision great vessell sheete let downe heauen god taught man thenceforth iudged vnworthy gospell fellowship people god neglecting ceremony lawe forasmuch stoppe lawe broken downe iesus christ ephes made one people peter thought good beginne narration might appeare men nothing owne head according god appointed second part alleageth sure commaundement god commaundement god least might thought haue bene beguyled dreame ydle phantasie euen time sayeth prouidence god stoode hostesse doore sent cornelius addeth spirite sayde shoulde go nothing doubting strength whole defence setteth aduersaries accusation sayde thou wentest menne vncircumised hast eaten therefore peter aunswereth spirite lord bade simplicitie word content letteth passe rhetoricall color wherwith might haue confirmed garnished argument example teacheth v accused accused may easily defended christian men cast tradition customes men god appoy tment authority saying apostle shall remaine force euer must obey god men let v also dayes argument defende selues papistes lyke frowardnesse accuse v hauing broken tradition men take occasion offence euery side without giuen behalf offendeth deny christ offred sacrament aultar sinnes quicke deade laye word christ yeelding vp life vpon crosse declared maner expiation sinne redemption nowe accomplished furthermore heare paule say christ offered offred offended bicause see haue put ymage christ saintes church laye selues agaynst authoritie god forbidding ymages made commaunding made made way destroyed offended bicause haue taken awaye difference meates apostle defendeth v sayth doctrine deuill bring vp lyke reason thinges controuersie betweene v haue alleaged onelye example sake aduersaries yeelde vnto word god holde set customes tradition men authoritie shall easily appeare seruauntes god men thirde part narration contayneth vision aungellthe appearing aungell heard sent god vnto cornelius hereof peter thought make mention declare cornelius nothing vnaduisedly mooued god sende teach diligently obserued howe aungell speaketh ministerie preaching gospell peter sayth shall speake wordes whereby thou thy house shall saued testifyeth saluation commeth preaching gospell holye psalmist sawe sayde psal god sent hys worde healed paule sayth gospell power god vnto saluation beleeuers thus sayd bicause sounde wordes bringeth saluation supersticious thinke exorcismes bicause preaching gospell christ offered vs2 cor preach gospell messenger roume christ ministerie men might reconcyled god father christ therefore common weales familyes haue sounde health saluation without receiue gospell iesus christ therfore ingratitude saye worde saluation cause euils well priuate publike execrable read somtime obiected ieremie ierem men ledde spirite caiphas also sayde christ woulde author cause destruction vnlesse made awaye wicked conspiracie priest fourthly declareth marueylous sending holy ghost expositor whereof alleageth iesus christ remember sayeth worde lorde howe sayde iohn baptized water shall baptized holy ghost seemeth peter reasoneth wise christ lorde promised elect spirite worlde coulde receyue sayd alone giuer therof therfore whereas hath sent spirit vnto gentile hath vouchsafed baptise holy ghost could choose followe example guyde iudge vnworthy baptisme water god iudged worthye spirite peter maketh trimme difference betweene christ minister bicause woulde haue wrongfully attributed externe ministerie belongeth onely vnto christ bicause haue otherwheres entreated hereof shall suffise time haue noted thus much waye fifth part conteyneth graue conclusion well wordes argumentsthe sending holy ghost sayth god therefore gaue vnto lyke giftes gaue vnto v beleeued lord iesus christ withstande god shoulde haue bene wicked part haue sayde bene vnlike whome god vouchsafed make like much greater impietie bene haue shut communion church whome god euident argument declared haue pertayned church yea whome openly chosen adopted therefore peter confesseth shoulde haue bene aduersary god gone thing aduersaries god keepe men fellowship doth vouchsafe make member church bicause thinke vnworthy great fauor grace shall saye false doctrine deceyue christes sheepe else rage plaine force tyrannie bicause confession christ shall one daye feele mightie heauie hande whose enimies chose rather friendes follower part acknowledge embrace grace god also bring trayne fellowship saluation god father hath set elect beloued sonne iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxix homelie heard helde peace glorified god saying hath god also gentyles graunted repentaunce vnto lyfe also scattered abroade affliction rose steuen walked throughout vnto phoenicia cyprus antioche preaching worde man vnto iewes onely men cyprus cyrene come antioche spake vnto greekes preached lorde iesus hande lorde great number beleeued tourned vnto lorde apostle peter conuerting cornelius dyd duetie godly faythfull apostle whyle thought good obey expresse commaundement god wythout lyngering dooing person vniustly reprooued shewed excellent example christian apostolyke modestie declared reason friendly diligently vnto whome might iustly haue requyred authoritie doe leauing argument apart vrgeth one thing nothing hys owne deuyse according god appointment commaundement example haue learned argumentes shoulde arme selues nowe dayes accuse v lyke frowardnesse breaking tradition customes men let authority god worde suffise v whosoeuer despyseth vnworthye whome church christ make accompt remayneth thys hystorie intreate howe men erewhile knapped comptrollershow brother acc pt peter apologie accepted peter apologie defence sayth helde peace gloryfied god saying hath god also gentile graunted repentance vnto lyfe moreouer whysted dyd man reason argue replye agaynst commaundement wyll god argument aboundantly declared stroue malice enuie rather inconsiderate blinde zeale godlynesse paule also otherwheres layeth charge bicause peter easily espyed affection thys cause thought deale herein gently ledde zeale glory god vse credyt yeelde vnto reason shewed must cast incurable ouer bytterlye delt withallthe godly yeelde vnto reason propertie truely faythfull willing yeelde vnto argument brought worde god although lly perceyue reason thing sayde true right exercise fayth submit reason vnto commaundementes worde god thing paule euerywhere teacheth vnder obedience fayth2 cor rom sheweth ende scope preaching gospel wherby easily appeareth taken faythfull ashamed stiffely contende manifest oracle god worde furthermore sayde glorifyed godwe must reioyce saluation meere euident signe receiued peter excuse admitted good wyll subdued force reason holde peace bycause haue answere yet poet sayth hyde griefe bottome hart glorifyeth god testifieth infallible argument fully satisfyed taught must reioyce gladde whome god doth illuminate lyght truth ought doe reason desyre euery christian man bounde haue glorie god also bicause loue ought beare furtheraunce profite neighbour surely nothing reioyceth faythfull soule see light truth spreade selfe abroade increase god glory saluation many againe ought mourne hart see neglect fall waye saluation read samuel contynually mourned bicause saules wretched fall paule contynueth prayer iewes rom desyreth accursed christ might saued nowe day colde pointes thing chiefe cause gospell proceedeth better god giueth repentancebut let v see wordes wherewith declare affection minde hath god also graunted gentyles say repentaunce vnto lyfe god giueth repentaunce two sortes eyther graunteth time place repent else mollifyeth conuerteth men mindes spirite worde repentance frame themselues better trade lyfe place appeareth god although later sense agreeing present argument worthy obserued say repentaunce vnto lyfe giuen vnto gentile preaching gospell saying testifie speake repentaunce fayth christ bringeth saluation may call scope marke gospell reconcyled vnto god christ shoulde turne vnto harte liue paule writeth god hath reconcyled v vnto himselfe iesus christ hath giuen v office preache attonement nowe messenger rowme christ cor euen though god beseech v pray christes steede reconcyled vnto god name repentaunce expreslye hauing respect vnto saying christ commaundeth repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes preached name neyther must two time seperated least men take occasion vnder pretence gospell liue carnally againe hath singuler comfort sayeth repentaunce giuen vnto lyfe therefore repentaunce faythfull neuer vayne vnfruitefull maketh partaker saluation christ apparaunt promise god wherein euerywhere promiseth lyfe vnto turne vnto hart sayth death sinner rather conuert liue ezech must thinke god flattereth deludeth man vaine promise hereto belongeth whole booke almost iudges prooueth many example israelite neuer returned god true repentaunce vayne manifest niniuites faythfull repentaunce caused god reuoke sentence passed shall speake seing reade repentaunce achab season little time mouth god commended1 reg thing ought encourage stande vpon pytbrinke desperation thinking god offended former wickednesse repentaunce acceptable vnto men woulde comforted saying prophet sinnes red scarlet esay shall whyte snowe though like purple shall whyte woolle againe lorde full compassion mercye psal long suffring great goodnesse alwaye chyding c nowe luke hath made ende storye cornelius spreading christes kingdom vnto ge tyles contayneth beginning first fruites vocation gentile returneth discourse thing belonging whole church intermytted declareth howe kingdome christ began stretched enlarged vnto gentyles first telleth antioch conuerted vnto christ men first called christian principally noteth ye occasion therof saying bicause persecution raysed agaynst steuen occasion spreading church arose reason persecution worthye considered sayth beginning benefite sproong dolefull cause howe pitifull case church stoode time persecution hearde viij chapter rage persecutours went farre safe man secrete christian men woman haled dores slaughterhouse thing cause church scattered hither thither seemed like scratched torne body ne incurable grace goodnesse god commeth passe euery member scattered church springeth newe body whome cruell tempest thus scattered remembring office dutie beganne preach euerywhere name christ many going farre phenicia cyprus illustrate country light gospell example primitiue church fayth full age might confirmed offended ye cruell attempt enimies forasmuch appeareth men kingdome christ ouerthrowne driuen straightes rather thereby builded vp enlarged luke reporteth haue come passe writer ecclesiasticall hystorie report haue come passe persecution horrible tempest cleere weather commonly followeth appeareth persecution church alway looked bright cheerefull god scattereth deuises nation purpose standeth fast euer whereby hath made sonne king ruler worlde see psalmes luke diligently intreateth thosethe minister neuer godly doe sometime disagree whose ministery god brought passe matter weight importance dispersed bicause faith doctrine christ yet agreed point touching order ministerie gospell preached iewes lyke ignorant thing done betweene peter cornelius writeth cyprus cyrene came antioch preached greekes gentyles oftentimes commeth passe thing counted faithfull seruants iesus christ doe disagree god disposing giftes woorde may authoritie successe thereof shoulde seeme depende certayne conspiracie consent men among themselues wherevnto also referred hereafter reported contention fell betweene paule barnabas wexed hote singuler chosen instrumentes christ departed one another therefore let offende man nowe dayes see like matter fall church publishe worde god constancie ought faithfull minister christ haue thende must thinke haue done dutie haue bene daunger name christ must thinke none cause graunted flie shoulde daunger escaped turne name extant onely written ciprus cyrene howbeit might haue pleased god aswell haue vsed helpe notable apostle vyle contemned thinges worlde maner woulde bring passe thing importance might knowe howe onely remission sinnes founde repentance made without fayth christ cannot please god haue therfore answere reprehende v scorne v bicause sermon inculcate often repeate christ thus doe following example apostle doe otherwyse forasmuch fynde saluation without christ last luke declareth notable successe gospell sayingthe successe gospel great number beleeued turned vnto lorde first declareth cause efficient least man might ascribe vnto ministerie men sayth hande lorde whereby gather successe fayth saluation dependeth vppon god nothing attributed man outwarde ministerie thing paule declareth large first epistle corinthian thirde chap good oftentimes haue remembrance bicause minister shoulde waxe prowde also whome god hath illuminated true faith might learne thankfull vnto also draweth whole man vnto obedience god taken christian drowned superstition sinne conuert vnto lorde let v therefore set v marke turning true faith vnto god may attayne saluation iesus christ onely definition good man laye fonde iudgement worlde vseth call hypocrytes giuen pleasure desire fleshe good men furthermore taught place maner men shoulde called beare office common weale specially matter falleth part reade vnto noah sent rauen arke salomon sayth wisely doth thing lame feete yea drunken vanitie committeth message foole prou deceyued hope manye time paye follye lightnesse
