contention congregation gouerned spirite christ illuminated true fayth easilye despyse losse priuate glorye perceyue maye aduaunce glorye god barnabas exhorteth antiochianes barnabas exhorteth perseuerance purpose heart woulde cleaue vnto lorde exercise study chiefly religion perseueraunce continuation needefull wrastleth crowned rewarded except wrastle stryue lawfully luke christ alloweth haue layd hande plough looke behinde therefore barnabas doth well requiring perseuerance antiochians least might seeme require onely outwarde shewe bare bragge wordes exacteth purpose heart true perseuerance ioyning sauiour christ haue dedicated giuen hart seruice haue done terror peril feare lorde esteeme thinges losse dammage may winne christ bicause barnabas ignorant many thing vsed call men christ thought exhortation also needefull notwithstanding appeared notable token god grace thing caused paule commaunde timothie tim continually exhort committed charge meanes alwayes instant vppon therefore error absurde thinke doctrine vnprofytable superfluous haue already attayned knowledge truth barnabas bringeth paule antioch thirdly barnabas goeth tharsus thence bringeth paule antioch thintent congregation ministery might strengthened argument true faithfull minde feruent loue towarde christ barnabas coulde ignorant howe great giftes spirite paules brest much authoritie lose paule came antioch ye singularest instrument christ haue shewed feruent faith seeke glorifyed men desire promote glory god yea certayne lacke fayth led desire owne glory prayse argument christ vseth scribe iewes iohn ye meane season barnabas example teacheth v well ordred congregation chiefe care haue fit minister word shoulde sought brought place christ teacheth math biddeth v praye vnto lorde haruest sende forth labourer herof see came passe chiefe prophetes noble king diligent care consideration schooles bicause without perceyued church coulde stande pure doctrine fayth maintayned wherefore ingratitude grosse onely contemne minister person vnprofitable whome lorde mercy offreth also hate greatest malefactor woorse toades last adioyned howe barnabas paule continued whole yeare togither antioch cause vndoubtedly sawe congregation neede help luke writeth sate ydelie like sluggard declareth yt instructed great company men true faith religion christ let minister church followe example perswade men perseuerance let constantly perseuer duty boaste themselues bare name pastor lette doe belongeth true pastor least become follower successor foolishe shepeherde described zachary xj chapter nowe remayneth profite successe godly feruent diligence luke sayth notable first sayth successe godly studye zeale manye brought vnto lorde great company added vnto lorde whereby euident traueyles godly minister without effect worde god like vnto fruitefull seede hath power vertue selfe bring forth fruite alwayes falleth vpon well disposed receyue bring forth worthy fruites although bring stony heart thorny giuen kinde pleasure yet hath god people euerywhere luc receyue seede good heart keepe till bring forth much fruite prophete beareth witnesse worde god returneth without fruite vaine like vnto showre raine esay watereth grounde maketh fruitfull moreouer god blesseth study minister shall labour vayne ought encourage labour church christ thinke traueyles lost deliuer fewe soules destruction let thinke haue gotten great treasure math bicause christ witnesseth saluation one soule cannot redeemed substance world meane marke howe sayth compa ye added vnto lorde paule barnabas gathered scholers themselues vnto lorde knewe well must glory christ alone math math teacher maister knewe christ commaunded bring schollers vnto therefore great insolencie author sectes among christian make seruauntes men whome christ hath purchased himselfe price bloude see paule sayth first epistle corinthian c ensueth yet another commoditiethe disciple call christi n hath gotten perpetuall immortall glory citie antioche citie first church gentyles gathered togither came passe hytherto called disciple first adourned name christian newe name god long promised hee woulde giue vnto elect esay greater glorye coulde comme vnto antiochianes let bishoppes prowde haultie rome compared men shall whether nill inforced giue place yet neuer reade prowde tytle giuen antioch called heade church let passe matter let v rather expende force name bicause giuen v without prouidence god euident called sonne god according figure olde testament wherewith king priest annointed greekes excellencie sake called christ hebrues meschias v annoynted bicause god hath appointed vniuersall euerlasting king priest people may seene psalm giueth himselfe wholye people therefore woulde haue called christian owne name hath giuen v naked emptie name apostle sayth hath annointed v made v king priestes god father apoc vse name christian therfore vse name manifolde first admonisheth v dignitie haue christ wherevnto none like shall confesse throughly weigh matter plaine neuer king able make subiectes realme king courtyers counsayle vertue power iesus christ able make king euer acknowledge king name serueth confirme beliefe certaintie saluation iesus christ god father well pleased therefore angrye v forsake v whome hath vouchsafed call name belooued sonne hence therefore may fett argument consolation aduersity especially temptation conscience finally title admonisheth v dutie forget made king priestes christ valiauntly maintayne dignitie name propertie king libertie subiection vnder rule another let v therfore abide libertie wherevnto sonne god hath called v suffer selues oppressed hereafter seruitude sinne fylthiest miserablest thing property king vanquish ouercome enimies let v therefore subdue vanquishe moste cruell enimies saluation satan world fleshe concupiscence therof part king comaunde beare rule let v therfore rule selues mightily ouercome al thing leade v crosse way saluation let v lykewise performe dutie priest teach pray consecrate offer wherefore shall dutie teach belong vnto v word example lyfe farre forth dutie calling bindeth v shall part pray secret openly make intercession god onely owne necessity also neyghbors shall also duty consecrate selues liuely sacrifyce vnto god offer euery day bullockes lippes say giuing thankes moste acceptable thankefull sacrifyce giue vnto thinges myght large drawne whole lyfe man shall suffyse giue vnlearned occasion expende consider better whosoeuer perfourmeth thing worthy called christian appeareth patriarch time pastsee eusebius ecclesiasticall hystory first booke first chap whome god hundreth fyft psalme calleth annoynted saye christian credible men antiochia first enioyed name presumptuously bragge name shall surely deceyue themselfe god cannot deceyue let v therefore diligently thinke thinges remembring dignitie dutie may aunswere notable excellent name taken lyfe may raigne heauen iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxxj homelie dayes came prophetes citie ierusalem vnto antioch stoode vp one named agabus signified spirite great dearth throughout world came passe emperour claudius dayes disciple euerye man according abilitie purposed sende succour vnto brother dwelt iurie thing also sent elder handes barnabas saule although lorde sauiour iesus christ alwaye present church yet suffereth foretolde diuerslye manye wayes troubled hauing aduersitie continuall enterchaunge still following prosperitie principall cause wherof partly woulde brydle lustynesse fleshe partlye bicause woulde teache v well able deliuer people aduersitie maintaine prosperitie haue heretofore seene certayne notable example hereof gospell beginning prosperouslye preached ierusalem brought great number disciple vnto christ shortly riseth tempest persecution driueth florishing church flat grounde againe saule conuerted vnto christ sodeinly church quiet doctrine christ caried vnto gentyles gaue likelyhoode great encrease seeing antioch noblest citie syria church gentyles assembled togither first called noble name christian beholde great straunge aduersitie following namely dearth troubled whole worlde miserablye afflicted faythfull whose goodes spent partlye finding poore church partly taken rage persecution consideration herof profitable v herby may learne lesse offended lyke aduersity betide v dayes present place worthy diligently considered well manifolde comfort also instruction holy ghost setteth forth declareth dearth church setteth fatherly prouidence god hauing care also sheweth way counsayle faythfull tooke seeing publike calamitie like ensue meane orderly intreate first speake dearth wherof prophane writersthe dearth dayes claudius chieflye iosephus suetonius make mention dearth man deny sent iudgement god except one deny god gouernor whole worlde prophete witnesseth plague citie without lordes amos lawe among punishmentes wherewith god reuenged contempt hys worde barrennesse grounde scarcitie victual ar chiefely reckoned see leuiticus deuter must thinke anye thing commeth vnto man fortune forasmuch appeareth care god prouidence extendeth selfe euen sparrowes flowres field shall good thing come passe math search cause god iudgements founde sooner mennes conuersation surely luke seemeth poynt fynger cause dearth writeth dayes claudius caesar therefore named prince world authoritie rule hande might iudge whole state worlde condicions dayes appeareth vice prince first infect contagiousnesse nobilitie corrupt example poysoneth comminaltie euen prophane writer report claudius poyntes moste naughtye prince childehoode cumbred diuers continuall disease dulled made lumpish bodye spirit growing age thought vnable discharge office publike priuate insomuch antonia hys mother vsed say monster worke nature begunne fynished woulde note body blockishnesse dulnesse would say foole hir sonne claudius sister liuulla hearing time chosen emperour openly alowde detest vnworthy vnprosperous state people rome declared corrupt nature many wayes first wan good souldiers mony wherby came emperour time vsed himselfe much care belly vnder belly empyre would neuer rise banquetting long paunche woulde holde till well whittled himselfe alwayes burning insatiable desire lust woman lyke prince coulde delight noble counsaylers like himselfe publike corruption maners degree time maye easilye coniectured writer dayes continuall sermon iohn christ apostle concerning repentaunce whereof bene neede bene naught accomplishment vice contempt hatred god worde god sent sonne worlde appoynted reconcyle mankind againe vnto himselfe euerywhere published healthfull worde grace great many bolde onely contemne hate also moste cruellye persecute insomuch euen among iewes gloryed name god aboue nation worde god coulde brooked marueyle god denyed fruit earth drunken corrupt world despising wholesome foode heauenly worde woulde tame bring vnder famine woulde rage agaynst christ verily hystoriographers testifye reason continuall drowthes scarcitie victual reygning aswell euerywhere rome claudius caesar daunger lyfe hardly escaping people wearye dearth lyke haue stoned example teach v cause publike calamity verily publike vyces contempt god worde cause god alleageth lawe prophetes confuted say thing growe doctrine gospell although godly also feele taste affliction yet farre case vntowarde worlde acknowledge chastysement discipline god father ouercome aduersitie fayth pacience bicause rightly vse aduersitie amendement lyfe commeth passe part prosperously deliuered fro aduersity mercifull hande god god faythfull cor suffer people tempted aboue strength thinges following teach v howe faithfullye lorde prouided church dayes reade came passe yeares following much vnlyke herevntoin ix booke ecclesiastical history viij ch eusebius writeth reygne maximinus cruellye persecute christian god sent forth dearth victual rich men welthy died openly streetes long caused christian deuoured wylde beastes satiate cruell eye miserable death openly eaten vp deuoured dogges miserably perished christian onely sufficient liue also charitably relieued great many readye sterue hunger thinges woulde considered v nowe dayes one claudius alone reigneth drunkennesse beareth swinge euery place little preuayleth godly admonition men rather ioyne vnto dissolutenesse lyfe wicked contempt deadly hatred god worde surely want also dayes example god iudgements want eye eares perceyue might serue saluation see esay eccles amos math let v see howe god prouided church daungerous time calamitie raysed vp prophetesgod prouideth church prophetes sent ierusalem antioche lighten late sproong church gentyles gift prophecie among one agabus stirred vp instinct holy ghost gaue christian warning famine ensue cause made prouision aswell themselues haue consider fatherly goodnesse god prouoked sinnes sende punishment yet vseth first admonishe v men might see nothing commeth passe lyfe chaunce also wee admonished might conuert saued thing hath constantly obserued euer since beginning worlde prophete amos durst saye lorde god doth maner thing amos telleth secretes vnto seruants prophetes appeareth men first age god sent noah preacher righteousnesse graunted hundred yeares space repent woulde sende floude destroy sent lot also sodomytes whose doctrine example lyfe might prouoked amendement ioseph warned egyptian dearth come whereby succoured lyfe great manye afterwarde prouoked moyses onely wordes also horrible woonders doe dutie needeth speake captiuitie babilon manifest foreshewed prophetes many yeares euer came christ foretell last destruction iewes also iosephus declarethin vij booke xij chap warres iewes warned therof many woonders though god neuer call sinner backe aduertisements yet generall warning confirmed innumerable example god iudgements sufficient signifyeth dutie ministery dispensation whervnto referred saying christ admonishing v make v friendes vniust mammon depart hence luc maye receyue v euerlasting tabernacle done sayth purposed sende euery one according bilitie god moderate christian liberalitie hee woulde man shoulde charged aboue possibilitie well knowne paule sayth first willing minde accepted according man hath according hee hath cor set libertie brought combraunce egalnesse nowe time abundance may succour lacke wee reade widdowe cast two mytes corban marc praysed christ bicause able giue niggishnesse greatlye reprooued neglect workes liberalitie vnder pretence thinke vniust bestowe goodes haue gotten labour traueyle vpon whereas god requireth nothing able spare last circumspect godly necessarye deuise craft subtiltie hindred disappoynted gathered mony committed aduentures euery one caried paule barnabas whose credit tryed diuers wayes surely let geare passe appeareth paules writing great truth vsed behalfe howe carefully hee procured reliefe needye brother iurie see corint cor rom moreouer sende elder might duely distributed according discretion haue therfore place learne christian haue doe time affected present daungerhow peter affected minde prison verilye man consider common course world would seeme shoulde haue bene ready die feare seeing reason iames late putting death straight watching hope better helpe therefore doe crye lament owne state case glorious souldiour christ set v farre minde luke writeth lay sleepe fast bounde two chaines betweene two souldiours token sloth sluggishnesse rather argument true faith sure confidence may gathered hereby hearde apostle scourged rod went reioycing glad iudged worthy suffer christes sake let v compare herode peter togither shall easily appeare howe great difference betweene wicked true worshipper god herode carefull much troubled howe might handsomely compasse intended persecution christ may hereby appeare causeth peter neyther power doe anye hurt bound chaines bene fierce sauage beast kept souldiers lying eche syde prison doores haue yron gate barred trouble vexation minde felt thinke thinges carefull onely peter keeping much better case peter sleepeth soundlye tyraunt take rest night long example declared may applyed state wicked procure themselues traueyles care thinke bring matter passe owne deuises hath appoynted prepared aungels serue elect thing pertayning explication place may supplied said like hystory ye xxxiiij homily shall suffise adde one thing men ought haue great consideration dignitie remembring aungels present giue themselues innocencie puritie maners least bereaue themselues owne default holy succour safegarde wherevnto seemeth paule respect gaue warning woman coulde none otherwise prouoked shamefastnesse comelynesse apparell yet feare aungels conuersaunt among godly1 cor shoulde vse sayde certaine light shyned prison otherwyse darke horriblea lyght shyneth thinketh teacheth v christ able lighten giue effectual comfort euen middest darkenesse make thing pleasant comfortable otherwise seeme vnto v fearefull horrible light world iohn whosoeuer followeth walketh darknesse angell awaketh himthirdly aungell puncheth peter side sleepeth waketh biddeth aryse quickly whereas thinketh anye maner deliuerye argument goodnesse god alwaye waketh v cruell enimie deuour v commeth passe vnto peter eche one v euery daye fyndeth true blindenesse acknowledge present goodnesse god euident satan lyeth still wayte catch v wandreth vp downe like roaring lyon seeking whome maye deuour commeth passe sleepe destroyeth v able prayer keepe doe thinke thing owne safegard reason alleaged dwell safe vnder defence highest vnder shadowe almighty ye prophet saith psal wherby also leearne diligence ought time commend selues vnto tuition protection god thing may also comfort v agaynst terrours death appeareth god taketh care v sleepe ymage counterfeyte death shall thinke death excluded prouidence example whereof christ setteth lazarus whome deade lying buried graue doth vouchsafe call friende iohn cause saintes ready giue vp lyfe vse commende themselues vnto god father lyke though woulde laye themselfe downe sleepe rest fourthly chaines fell peter hand voice aungell thing touching deliuerythe impediment deliuery castly taken awaye done without difficultie souldiours whether god power fast sleepe whether amazed brightnesse aungell reade came passe resurrection lorde neyther staye peter araying himselfe going without let stoppe peter passeth first seconde watch ledde aungell moreouer yron gate alone able keepe person opened owne accorde aungell leaueth peter sette safe daunger pleased god thus steppe degree set libertie benefite might seeme notable otherwise coulde straunge myracle haue set safe sodeinly mary house inuincible power god considered howe easie thing set people libertie thing otherwise inuincible vse obeye giue place hath onelye come passe peter deliuerie also diuers time nature hath bene fayne yeelde vnto god pleasure waye escape might opened elected hereto maye referred passage redde sea deuiding parting sunder riuer iordane likewise reade fyre touched daniel fellowes much garment heare beyonde course nature lyon chose rather laye aside naturall fiercenesse daniel hurt seruant god contrary god pleasure thing ecclesiasticall hystorie reporteth oftentimes haue come passe martyr herevnto belongeth falling walles iericho blasting trumpettes army assyrian slaine one night diuers example seene reade eyther prophane ecclesiasticall hystories thing therefore let v strength fayth threates tyrant moste certayne god able deliuer daunger good pleasure time refuse doe bicause knoweth needefull saluation meane season remayneth faythfull suffreth v tempted able beare1 cor conclude euangelist sheweth peter meane whylewhat peter doth deliuered first sayth peter wyste whether geare done truth thought vision shewed hystory cornelius argument man infirmitie wherewith encombred cannot perceyue manifest work god specially ouershadowed maiesty godheade peter sawe christ glorifyed mount moses helias luke vttered certaine vnfyt saying ignorant sayd yet daungerously deceiued marke manifest iudgements god whereby prouoked repentance thing common dayes meane whyle peter obedience deserueth small prayse though ignorant thing ment yet obeyed aungels admonition teaching v example howe wee shoulde vse selues obey fayth hath bene oftentimes declared come himselfe perceyued libertie greatly magnifyed god author great benefyte nowe sayth knowe suretie lorde hath sent aungell deliuered mee hande herode c example taught must giue god thanks deliueries although vse ministery angel men must yet haue whole praise vseth creature onely according pleasure thing himselfe teacheth prophet psal saying call vpon time trouble heare thee thou shalt prayse wherevnto appertayneth saying dauid psal let giue thankes whome lorde hath redeemed deliuered hande enimie therfore peter truly acknowledgeth god onely reuenger thing paule also doth confesseth himselfe deliuered mouth lion2 tim god power wherefore error intollerable deliuered prison sickenesse like kinde daungers ascribe prayse deliuerye vnto saintes howe much ought redeeming mankinde tyrannie h ascribed god onely author let v acknowledge thing brother thankfull mindes prayse god hath deliuered v power darkenesse hath brought v vnto fellowship kingdome sonne iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxxiiij homelie hee considered thing came house marye mother one iohn whose surname marke many gathered togither prayer peter knocked entry doore damsell came forth harken named rhoda knewe peter voyce opened entry gladnesse ranne tolde peter stoode entrie sayd vnto hir thou art madde affirmed euen sayde hys angell peter continued knocking opened doore saw astonied beckened hande might holde peace tolde meanes lorde brought prison sayde go shewe thing vnto iames brother departed went another place assoone daye little adoe among souldiours become peter herode sought founde examined keeper commaunded caried awaye descended iurie caesarea abode euangelist luke suggestion holy spirit hath described chapter grieuous persecution church christ example whereof wee taught state church vpon earth lykewise setteth forth notable example goodnesse prouidence god defendeth faythfull distresse faithfully perfourmeth helpe long agone promised sawe erewhyle lorde hande peter apostle seemed destitute aswell god helpe mannes onely shew semblant token good vsed inuincible power deliuer sent aungell vnloose yron chaynes openeth doores woonderfull wise defeateth watche souldiours bringeth peter daunger setteth libertie sentence death already giuen agaynst albeit imprisoned band christes sake deliuered woonderfull wyse yet generall promise giue themselues god seruice vnder protection dauid affirmeth eye lorde ouer righteous psal math eares open vnto prayer sonne god testifyeth heares head numbred let thing passe already sufficientlye entreated let v consider present place taught peter deliuered bandes prison exercise church meane season howe herode tyraunt tooke iudgement god peter perceyued aungell gone himselfe libertie peter desireth io ned ga e weyghing expending diligently himselfe certaine appeareth marie woman rare fayth godlynesse euen thys one argument agrippa cruellye persecute disciple christ yet would let resort hir house publike temple meete togither exercise themselfe worde god prayer coulde doe without apparaunt manifest perill lord thought good teach v example weake vessell howe boldly christian ought stande tackle defende cause euen middle daungers trouble peter came thither doores opened myraculously yron gate bicause neede straunge myracle knocketh haue body come open doore peter example well considered v hauing escaped daunger death desirous aboue thing ioyned congregation agayne agaynst whome yet knewe tyraunt still raged hereby taught care wee ought haue ecclesiasticall vnitie fellowship howe spirite christ scattereth faythfull sunder ioyneth togither well inwardly outwardly cannot fynde hart easilye contemne coniunction knowe saluation contayned christ alone vnderstand deriued christ head vpon member christ saye church therefore absurde pernicious errour persecution ariseth forsake congregation else haue bene daunger thinke haue done ynough part ioyned longer feare newe daungers thus alienate themselues christ whose name sake abode vnseemelye speach harmelesse minister though matter touched whole congregation alone hereof commeth wee perceiue continuall calamity day god spare strike whilste layde esay amos acknowledge hande true man coulde haue compassion v yet two thing diligently considered go first consolationthe prayer godlye vaine taught prayer godly accepted god many time goodnesse farre exceedeth graunting dare number aungels gen reg whether one two three whole army aungels defende one man wee reade iacob helisaeus much lesse thinke wee bee hearde saye soules bee deade walke vp downe appeare opinion therfore aunswere make vnto woulde haue minister worde put woolues handes say truly followe apostle without hope good suffer wicked onely condemne doctrine truth christ also themselues easily appeareth causeth men thus say woulde haue minister gospell gone antichristes superstition might brought agayne wherefore wee must vse wisedome serpent men according christ hath commaunded v temerity rashnesse indammage christ quarrell nowe remayneth last part placehowe herode tooke myracle god whereby wee taught herode affected minde worke myracle god first knowne peter escaped bandes suffer doe psal zach beare well minde christes saying touch myne annoynted toucheth toucheth apple mine eye sayinges threaten present destruction persecutours church therefore taken syncere loouers peter bicause none thinke herode alway prosper god catcheth also horrible reuenge luke nowe place diligently describeth beginneth rehearsall newe hystory herode offended border vpon manifestly yet sheweth nature herode hereby may better knowe cause grieuous punishment summe chiefe poynt hereof conceyued minde displeasure tyre sidon compelled publike necessitie say famine humbly sue peace waxing hereby prowder hasten vengeance god although luke declareth cause enmitie yet harde perceyue seldome commeth passe monarch free city agree togither one bicause take ambition licentiousnesse example make blastus priuie chamber friende thing could compassed without many bribe rewardes thinges holy ghost hath set vnto v beholde glasse condicions tyrauntesthe condicions tyrant herode content wyde boundes kingdome desireth haue borderer also vnder obeysaunce insatiable desire fleshe bee brydled heart prince none large wide kingdome content minde suffyse ambition couetous men heape masse vp mony ioyne house vnto house fyelde vnto fyelde greedye desire kinges labour ioyne realme vnto realme still extend power ouer border vpon little regarding meane season may prudently gouerne people god hath giuen rule cause continuall warres whereby miserable subiectes wasted consumed fynde ought shepeheardes father vnto destroyer againe king puffed vp insatiable ambition desire haue men subiection vnder selues commonly ruled vile slaues craft creepe bosomes knowe well ynough vse foolishnesse blockeheadnesse owne aduauntage kinde men appeareth blastus vppon whome one place easily declareth whole rule ye realme depended emperours reade authoritie bondman villaines made free saye nothing ledde ruled player ester harlot abused yong springalles hereof hath come passe haue thing doe great prince haue bene compelled become suiters wicked menne vnlesse made friendes neuer haue bene able come speach prince forbicause gaped money wherby maintaine coueted dignitie came passe kinges courtes thing went money according poetes saying right money stirring thing sayde thende prince may vnderstande vice neede beware men may acknowledge goodnesse god diligentlye disswaded people king reade first booke samuel cap whome god hath giuen liue libertie maye learne make much benefyte worthily vse least loosing co ming subiect pleasure vnruly men desire vaine carefull sighes gronesthe successe wicked preamble ruine libertie lost obserued good successe herode hath persecuting church embruing himselfe bloude guiltlesse saint yet worthy eyther haue bene destroyed thunderbolt heauen else haue lost kingdome wander vp downe like begger beholde moste riche city owne accorde fall downe feete glad receyue condicions peace hee prescribeth thing offendeth weake faith bicause see wicked prosper feele none plague punishment men doe prophete sayth psal therefore ieremie crieth howe commeth waye vngodlye prosperous ierem goeth well without shame offende liue wickednesse furthermore wicked take occasion hereof gather studye endeuour true religion superfluous vnprofytable maye see malachie chapter must remember wicked euen ruled becke god prouidence thing seeme moste succeede oracle god although haue hitherto feared thee man yet see thou art higher nature c seemeth thing cause chiefely intermedled hystorie maye beholde vanitie people wherewith infected deserued oppressed pinched loden like ambicious godly style tytles sufficient call benefyciall conqueror must called victorious haue diuine name grace maiestie scripture due vnto god onely often repeated till man woulde lothe therefore god shall punishe herode proouedthe destruction herode streightway aungell lorde smote eusebius iosephus writeth appeared visible wise stroke beganne tormented pangues grypes belly eusebius booke ecclesiasticall storie x chap extorted confession truth heart though otherwise ambitious turned wayted sayde beholde god must nowe exchaunge lyfe death whome called immortall nowe ledde away vnto death luke declaring kinde death sayth eaten gnawen wormes gaue vp ghosta disease maye well called lowsie euill reason lyce encrease mightily deuour eate vp body seemeth therefore dyed disease called phthiriasis hauing wormes lyce breeding fleshe fedde vpon whyle liued great griefe fylthinesse length cause hisdeath moreouer luke assigneth onely cause hereof gaue god glory first thought honour ye kingdome came god caesar whome cause worshipped ordeyning shewes game honor went cruelly persecute true religion god last reioyced blasphemous wordes flatterer whome behooued haue detested abhorred let therefore learne example looke god hande lyke impietie set vp themselues behooueth v chiefly note mightily god reuengeth pride seeing doth onely punishe prowde grieuously also shamefully tame pull downe haultie heartes courage pleased pharao shoulde dye valiauntly fyelde drowned waues redde sea shamefull kynde death slewe sanherib miserably church owne god owne sonnes disease described antiochus herode great sylla length maximinian persecutor vglily consumed peter therefore sayd truly1 pet god resisteth prowde let degree state men hereby learne keepe themselues within bound vocation perceiue thing themselues singuler excellent acknowledge commeth altogither goodnesse god shall come passe humbling themselues vnder mightye hande god shall vse giftes ought doe furthermore place teacheth v hurt flatterer procure vnto prince nature selfelouers like best owne doings sayinges admit flatterer become starke blinde see manifest vice grow cannot abide heare truth admonished thing hath bene cause great realmes haue bene ouerthrowne tongue flatterer hystories declare surely herode bene prosperous giuen eare rather apostle reprehending vice voyces flatterer clawback caused swollen wicked prowde contempt god destroyed horrible death ouer hauing shewed ende tyraunt luke returneth story churchthe enlargement christes kingdome begonne howe gospell spreade declare herode nothing hindered worde god sayth encreased multiplied spreading selfe euery daye farther abrode declare thinges following wherevnto maketh digression touching paule barnabas returne chapter yea maye see epistle paule iewes oftentimes withstoode saluation gentyles stoode doubt iewes cause much offended paule made vncircumcised gentile one iewes christ thought without notorious iniurie prophane contempt lawe moses also people iewes thing also cause euerywhere vsed earnestnesse defending vocation could well ynough haue borne contempt owne name sawe glory god saluation whome nowe dayes call pastorspastours minister worde therefore antioch onely church euerywhere also college schoole taken learned minister sent city place teacheth v chiefe ornament beautie church yea preseruation thereof consisteth furnished prouided fyt minister teacher ministery paule plainely teacheth worde god church begotten builded vp preserued shall beleue sayth whome haue hearde rom howe shall heare without preacher agayne christ iesu haue begotten gospell cor hereto chiefely appertaineth writeth christ hath giuen apostle prophetes euangelistes shepeheardes ephes teacher edifying saintes euen edifying body christ bicause euident gift teaching giuen men myraculous wise apostle therefore needefull haue schooles may brought vppe shall afterwarde serue ministerie woont among iewes city leuites appeareth storye samuel helisaeus singuler prophetes god speciall care schooles yea amos prophete sharply reprehendeth vse corrupt nazarites yong menne giuen studie scripture wyne amos remembraunce might euidently appeare god regard th doe faythfullye serue studye church among person manaen seemeth chiefe luke writeth fostered brought vp herode tetrarch childe therefore courtyer noble stocke thinke one ba e stocke shoulde appoynted playfellow king sonne herode woulde afterwarde despyse bene brought vp childehoode notable example goodnesse god vseth state men haue chosen call seemeth good vniuersall spirite author eternall life bloweth pleaseth reade naaman court king syria babilon daniel fellowes helde fast god true religion yea paule maketh mention house nero beleeued phil nichodemus disciple among scribe greatest enimies christ also manaen set vnto v example fayth syncere religion following example moses chose rather afflicted people god enioy pleasure sinne season heb thinking rebuke christ greater rich treasure herode surely man woulde compare state church dayes life court shall fynde marueylous working holy ghost manaen euident token true regeneration mortifycation forsaking himselfe heare behooueth v imitate cannot truelye take holde christ haue yet learned despyse treade vnder foote worlde honor rich pleasure thereof let v come seconde part diuision paule barnabas sent gentyles wherein sending paule barnabas gentyles described two thing chiefely discussed videlicet holy ghost author moderator businesse order luke writeth obserued first expressely teacheth holy ghost author ministred lorde fasted holy ghost sayde seperate barnabas saule worke wherevnto haue called doubt thing spoken holy ghost forasmuch mention made holy ministerye fasting papistes playe fooles following erasmus translation bicause vnaptly translated greeke worde worde sacrifyce expounde place sacrifyce masse howbeit greekes saye doe nonlatin alphabet occupied busied publike office affaire may appeere paule calleth magistrate aungels nonlatin alphabet rom heb vsed sacrifyce god publike officer minister christes death manifest leuiticall sacrifyces abolished seruice christ consisteth outwarde ceremony spirite truth therefore vnderstanded none ministery christ woulde haue vsed church comprehendeth preaching worde publike prayer sacrament sacrifyces holye action instituted keepe memorie sacrifyce christ offered vppon aultar crosse herein busily occupied holy ghost admonished sende forth paule barnabas earnestly occupied herein mention made fasting abundantly prooueth part many thing prooue vocation gentyles worke god ministring lorde spirite aduertised congregation thereof afterwarde seperate mee sayeth paule barnabas ministerye seruice god preached vnto gentyles besides sayeth worke wherevnto haue called thinges make assuring saluation insolent bragging iewes saye onely people god hereout may taken argument whereby christ may prooued appertaine vnto v also mennes conscience incline vnto desperation order ecclesiastical ministeryhere ought consider order ministery whereof place teacheth v iudge author hereof holy ghost hereafter also shall appeare xx chapter spirite dignitie minister appeareth plainely manifest taken lawfull minister vnlesse called spirite howe shall preach except sent rom cause aswell prophet apostle often constantly inculcate defende vocation yet let man alwayes looke voyce come heauen call men vnto ministerie must iudge called god furnished necessary giftes holy ghost chosen lawfull voyce congregation church hath herein hir voyce election appeareth plainly place although holy ghost doth expressely confesse called two paule testifyeth appointed mother wombe ministery yet holy ghost requireth allowance church thinke requisite chiefly cause hereby ministery might haue credit authoritie bicause holy ghost knewe thing subiect reproch great many meane season taught order necessarie church well thing chiefly choosing minister least man apostle sayeth shoulde take vnto himselfe honour howe much thing displease god heb learne example corah hystories manye age whereby may prooued hath risen church scarce thing greater trouble disordinate vnlawfull choosing minister furthermore electing minister part belongeth vnto church behooueth church vse holynesse matter great weight importance wherevppon sayde agayne haue fasted prayed howbeit coulde erre person forasmuch holy ghost named appointed present businesse yet pray may increased holye spirite forasmuch hearde called office labour perill woulde god men woulde weigh thing vse choose minister among cuppes matter weyght vse affection woorst counsaylers whose wickednesse may thanke part euils seene dayes church also antiochians adde vnto prayer solemne ceremonie laying handes declared heretofore outwarde signe consecration spake institution deacon nowe remayneth last part diuision howe paule barnabas began discharge office committed god congregation part luke ioyneth vnto premisseshow paule barnabas beginne preach amog gentyles appeareth forthwith tooke iourney thence notable example godly industrie zeale excuse might haue layde themselues men may easily vnderstande haue lightly run ouer story time romaine time lord almost whole worlde knewe would admit abrogation olde ceremony superstition knewe also shoulde haue doe gentyle philosopher men subtile greatly exercised extemporall ready vtterance speach moreouer knewe condicion comons howe vse stowtelye maintaine olde mumpsimus much rather lose lyfe howbeit thing cannot stoppe preparing themselfe herevnto ready take good worth whatsoeuer trauels daungers shoulde ensue men diligence ought imitate appoynted god publike office forthwith obey calling god constantly go lorde cannot away lingerer trifler right challengeth thinges himselfe cause sayde exod angry moses time past bicause refused office called vnto christ sayth disciple woulde fyrst go burie father followe mee let deade burie deade howbeit math luke maketh mention three thinges eche whereof somewhat sayde first sheweth whither went seleucia apostle preache vnto cypriote farre distaunt antiochia thence salamine citie cyprus olde cosmographer part attribute vnto cyprus among islandes mediterranean sea chiefe prayse fertilitie rich cause cypriote giuen ryote lecherie ere declared whole islande dedicated venus reported borne one thing declareth great corruption lyfe maners reygned nation dedicate selfe whole lande vnto venus wherefore must thinke without great cause first went thither sent holy ghost preach gospell vnto gentyles singuler example god fauour vseth forsake sinner seeke saluation paule sayth sinne abounded rom might grace also abounde whervnto chiefly belongeth saying christ testifyeth came worlde saue sinner notable example sinner math luke whome christ bountifully graciously embraced amongst present example neyther least last thing serue consolation teach v may rashly cast sinner rather comfort traine meanes may amended saued apostle preach worde godfurthermore noted argument doctrine preaching sayde preached word god certaine worde god saluation contained wherefore needefull rehearse article doctrine may easilye gathered well sermon epistle apostle let v rather obserue mannes authoritie ought great church preach listeth seeing heare paule barnabas preached nothing owne brayne worde god church house god must word voice god onely sounde poynt sacrilegall boldenesse teach thing church vnder pretence god name agreeable worde god cause reade aswell prophetes apostle bounde vnto commaundement propone nothing vnto church receiued mouth god see ezech ierem math preach synagoge iewesthirdly declared taught say sinagoges iewes although sent vnto gentyles yet order obserued saluation fyrst preached vnto iewes behooued owne default fallen saluation kingdome god shoulde caried vnto gentyles fall might serue vnto saluation nation rom yea well expende matter shall appeare without deuise god prouidence time iewes shoulde dwell scattered almost among nation hereby offered apostle good occasion preach gospellsee theodorete touching ye prouidence god x sermon law oracle prophet declared iesus christ sauiour worlde promised thing gentyles hearde perceyued hystorie iesus christ agreed poyntes writing prophetes beganne haue good opinion holy scripture first steppe vnto saluation thus came passe true fayth embraced auiour preached among therfore apostle well wisely beginne preaching iewes sinagoges lette v acknowledge goodnesse god whose benefyte true saluation preaching gospell offered v also dayes though vnworthy iesus christ lorde whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxxvij homelie gone isle vnto paphos interpretation withstoode sought turne away ruler fayth saule also called paule full holy ghost sette eye sayde full subtiltie deceytfulnesse thou chylde deuill thou enimie righteousnesse wilt thou cease peruert straight wayes lorde nowe beholde hande lord vpon thee thou shalt blinde see sunne season immediatly fell myst darknesse went seeking leade hande ruler saw came passe beleeued wondred doctrine lord sentence dauid king prophete notable prophecieth iesus christ shall rule middest enimies psal hereby kingdome promised vnto christ therewith also admonished subtiltie tyrannie deuill assaulteth kingdome continuall warre booke declareth vnto v many notable example hereof hitherto hath set v haue openly encountred christ fyrst chiefe head ierusalem herode called agrippa yet christ king ouercame enterprise well founde stroue vaine herode bicause attempted bolder enterprise rest bought wickednesse horrible punishment yet satan pulleth back foote bringeth game place new champion throughout cyprus nowe drewe nigh vnto paphus great renoumed citie setteth sorcerer meane stoppe prosperous course gospell among cypriote yet apostle ouercome hauing christ captaine whose glory satan went obscure darken shined brighter describing contention diligently considered christ setteth apostle wrastle famous sorcerer deceyuer besides teacheth v alwayes looke contended egregiouslye pa n e h condicions false prophetes teacheth v howe shall maye receyue commoditie hereby fyrst consider occasion contention encou ioyning togither last conclusion occasion nesse seemeth haue bene prosperous successe gospell isle ciprus occasion co tention betweene paule elymas sorcerer beginning salamine standeth sea coast eastwarde apostle gone whole islande farre paphos westwarde fame newe doctrine thus published came hearing sergius paulus proconsull sent apostle desirous heare preach worde god whereby appeareth though romaine desirous truth begonne already suspect gentyle religion perhappes cause gaue eare sorcerer iewe hoping able teache truth pricked forwarde like desire sent paule barnabas also heare taught coulde elymas sorcerer abyde hitherto bene familiar proconsull therefore diligently watched meanes withstande apostle shortly shall heare nowe go two thinges marked first god hath degree people sayde sermon going added howe vseth call saue seeme stande vppon pit destruction sergius paulus whome mention made brought vp childhoode ye religion gentile bene alwayes vsed ydolatrie afterwarde although acknowledged errour encombred newe hurtfull errour whyle hitteth vpon iewe sorcerer false prophet saye god care man whome suffreth seduced many diuers errours faythfull shepehearde christ seeketh lost sheepe mountaynes valleyes luke iohn yea sea also suffer taken hande place therefore teacheth v must despaire hastilye man except manifestly proue himselfe number reprobate moreouer luke declareth sergius example good godly magistrate desirous learne truth also ouerhastilye condemneth minister doctrine heard calling giueth libertie freely declare doctrine prince dayes shoulde doe well imitate man whereof manye condemne doctrine truth knowe vse cruelly punishe whose fayth religion vtterly ignoraunt let remember shall excused ignorance considering part nothing ignorance diligently search examine cause thing thus premised let v nowe marke howe contention beginneththe meeting togither paule elymas sorcerer plainly appeareth apostle beginner hereof sergius proconsull sent learne worde god like made tariance speede hasted set forth kingdome god streyghtway commeth forth magitian withstandeth preach worde quickly sawe like longer abiding proconsull lightned knowledge truth although luke declareth sort resisted apostle yet bicause false prophete sorcerer maye easily gathered left wayes vnassayde might seeme oppresse truth contender diligentlye considered may learne knowe false prophetes fyrst marke prowde name whereby challengeth himselfe certaine godheade called right name elymas woulde syrian tongue called bariesu saye sonne sauiourthe condicions false prophetes whereby coniecture presumed promise saluation woulde follow teaching therefore number christ prophecied shoulde come challenge maiestie name math propertie false prophetes themselues vsurpe name god yet haue doctrine called name vnder pretence might easlyer beguile simple thus zedechias speaking achab victorie shoulde get syrian vseth common beginning prophetes thus sayth lorde may see diuers others yea yet neuer false prophete went get authoritie colour god name moreouer doth according vsage false prophetes getteth friendship familiaritie proconsull cleaueth fast vnto neare companion deceyuers vse get friendship great estate haue gotte side example easlyer allured also purchase themselfe safetie authoritie knowe destitute ayde truth must needes seeke arme power man whereby defende themselfe baalam time past notwithstanding admonished contrary oracle went get friendship balac king moa ites manifest romaine antichristes haue clymed power haue ayded amitie armor prince yea deceyuers hooded iuglers neare hande prince scarce let fart must know cause teacher frame doctrine according delicate eares hearer least shoulde offende vpon whome wholy depende elymas onely scope ende turne proconsull fayth shoulde beleeue paule sayde minister true doctrine consent herein winne menne vnto god fayth christ deceyuers agree herein ouerthrowe faith christ ouerthrowne kingdome god take place among menne satan knoweth force weakened true fayth wherof example euerywhere euangelistes let v see howe paule confuted wicked enchaunter paule confuteth elymas first luke sayth full holy ghost wherby meaneth moued spirite somewhat aboue ordinarie wont thing therfore declareth aforehande might thinke nothing fleshly affection shall heare heauy intollerable weyght wordes meane season admonished fyght enimies truth blinde affection fleshe conduct counsayle holy ghost whome vndoubtedly shall fynde bee enimye neuer well garded worldly power goeth businesse fyxing eies fast vpon elymas argument well meaning vnfearefull minde verily becommeth v boldly constantly resist antichristians maye thinke men feare not1 iohn shoulde feare seeing greater side also shoulde encouraged cowardlynesse already turmoyled terrours naughtie conscience thirdly painteth egregiously colour ioyneth speciall weight poyse vnto euery worde first full deceytfulnesse sayth accuseth therefore subtiltie craft one sought praise authoritie sorcery enchauntment secondly vpbraydeth naughtynesse minde readye commit whatsoeuer wickednesse naughtye wicked vnder colour god holy name beguile men chiefe commendation false prophetes sorcerer meanes sette god sixe seauen saye threatneth let prophanation name go vnreuenged thirdly calleth chylde deuill declare impudencie presumed call himselfe sonne sauiour childe deuils insolent pride minde earnest studie naughtinesse abundantly declare fourthly calleth enimy righteousnesse well worthy forasmuch christes aduersarie without whome founde righteousnesse god acceptable fifthly thou ceasest sayth peruert straight wayes lorde wordes comprehendeth two heinous offence incurable maliciousnesse earnest desire peruert worde lorde worde simple pure sheweth vnto v playne waye saluation naughtinesse manne seemeth vncertaine full perplexitie last thundreth heauy sentence punishment nowe beholde hande lorde vppon thee thou shalt blinde see season yet among terrible thunder crackes god threates see hope saluation left repent turne vnto lord god vseth reueale wrath worde yet haue swallowed vppe despaire whome haue saued chiefe vse place learne faythfull minister christes church haue doe dayes many elymae buzeing eares king prince bring fayth may pleasure oppresse ruder sort comminaltie iudge monkes priest none deceytfully sell trifle vnder color god holy name like presumpteous gyauntes arrogate themselues power vpon heauen set purpose striue righteousnesse christ faith maketh righteous impudently set light authoritie god word corrupt tradition men make plaine way saluation intricate vnfyndable infynite maze monkish vowes order rule merites bulles pardon case reserued fynally herewith content procure prince committe slaughter murther shedde innocent bloude must accused like boldenesse libertie men example iudgement dayes want eye behold elymae much miserable blinde yet thinke still see seeke none leade contemptuously disdaine god offereth furthermore contention came passe vnprosperouslye elymas disapointed helpe whome ought fast haue cleaued godly businesse also occasion bitter contention arose afterward betwene paule barnabas bicause sayde returned ierusalem mother like pretended sloth loue ought mother widowe maye iudged number wherof gospell example called christ sayde woulde fyrst go burie father holy ghost setteth example v followed might vnderstande alwayes slidebackes heauy calamity shall hinder course gospell satan desired syft euen apostle ydle although could pull cleane christ yet brought passe feared apprehension bandes fled reade vj iohn diuers thousandes fell paule seeth marke thus slippe away complaineth afterwarde howe demades embraced thys present worlde shoulde brought caesar howe friendes forsooke let man therefore offended leuitie inconstantnesse people dayes hauing profited well christes religion giue ouer christ apostle prophecied come meane let men remember grieuoussy sinne forsake christ cause kinde denying beside offende weaker sort giue occasion thinke well gospell christian faith sclaunder meane name christ yll spoken furthermore make vnknowne forreners suspect whome otherwise woulde succour relieue finallye authours diuision cause thing following shall abundantly declare example admonished must eyther falshoode sloth suffer selues plucked dutie mennes fault cannot excuse v whose falles must rather eschew imitate bicause lordes cause stande shall easie defende though fewe authoritie worldes sight yea many time suffreth fall away hoped helpe thereby might declare howe reioyce god alone besides though forsaken worlde yet alone christ pronounced himselfe must applied vnto member time commeth sayth shall scattered euery one owne shall leaue alone yet alone iohn father yea sayth moreouer leaue succourlesse iohn math beholde vnto ende worlde hereto belongeth saying dauid father mother forsooke mee lorde tooke psal receyued thinges must minister worde onely remember also prince magistrate also haue god author vocation abstaine business exercise ordeyned kept holilye num appointed death breaker thereof prophet reckoned one grieuous offence cause captiuitie babilon vnhallowe sabbothes lorde cause sonne god although many time reprehended superstitious keeping yet diligently obserued thinges wherein worship god consisted day entred sinagoges present publike assembly prayer moreouer hee taught hearde others teach also vsed diligently deedes liberalitie thing apostle remembring thought good also followe example maister dayes matter come passe among christian may go best menne breake sabbothes handy work toward getting liuing whereas great many prophane heynous wickednesse time doe men sinne pryde arrogancie drunkennesse concupiscence ryot day ought bestowed wholy study godly workes eternall rest quiet notwithstanding thinges openly committed yet wee still seeke bee cause misery wretchednesse dayes howbeitthe order holy metings assembly religion sabboth touching outward obseruation consisteth chiefly holy assemblyes moses calleth holye conuocations luke declareth diligently done assembly first apostle sate downe doubt among residue gathered togither dutie modestie honestie wherof regard must alwaies euerywhere chiefly church nothing done order dishonestly maketh mention howe lawe prophetes reade obserued among iewes common custome shall vnderstand little paules sermon wordes iames xv chapter moses ordeyned commaundement god custome returne babylon esdras restored againe appeareth nehemias cap christ vsed none custome place esay taught mystery saluation sinagoge nazareth thinges therfore errour enormious absurde church declare vnto simple people foolish trifle legendes saint else vrge exact man tradition wherwith christ himselfe prophete teacheth math esay god religion none taketh vppon speake lawfully requested although auncient custome interpreter prophetes sate next teacher yet none impudently intruded himselfe vndesired without necessitie woulde speake vnto people wherefore paule barnabas also although sent holy ghost yet thinke good breake profytable auncient custome church therefore anabaptistes disorder suffered abuse place paule cor saying men ought haue leaue speake church paule place speaketh gift interpretation prophecie sate teacher euen nowe sayde interpreter commaundeth keepe silence commaundeth thing done decently order neyther lette man cause haue broken custome furthermore verye well done antiochians giue leaue vnto men vnknowne straungers saye minde woulde quench spirite despise prophecying wherof paule elsewhere giueth warning exhortation may builded true faith vnto glory iesus christ praise honor power glory euer amen lxxxix homelie paule stoode vp beckened hande silence sayde men israel ye feare god giue audience god people chose father exalted people dwelt straungers lande egypt high arme brought time fourtie yeares suffered maners wildernesse destroyed seauen nation lande canaan deuided land lot afterward gaue describeth sermon paule apostle chosen vessell made congregation antioche fyrst paules sermon holy ghost would put writing iudged rest vnworthy knowne might iudge could like vnto bicause spirite god affiance lawe ceremony therof vnto fayth christ better obteyning whereof proceedeth commodious order fyrst knewe gloryed much certaine prerogatiues thought superfluous search take waye saluation teacheth haue nothing themselues wherin glory haue receyued euer good qualitie meere mercie god messias sake promised vouchsafe saue also giue prerogatiues thereof gathereth necessarye embrace messias least fall grace god depriued goodnesse done sheweth iesus sonne god mary virgin sauiour messias promised reasoneth office briefely comprehendeth businesse saluation confyrmeth euident oracle olde testament length sheweth threat prophet many despised sonne god saluation offered might knowe horrible iudgement god hanged ouer heades summe sermon suffyceth fewe wordes haue touched bicause entende speake large euery thing place nowe let v come treatie beginning paules sermonthe beginning short maner apostle suspected curious artifyciousnesse conueyaunce fyrst holdeth lifteth vp hande kinde gesture vsed olde time cause men keepe silence others speake wee shall see place following fewe one make attent calleth name knewe woulde get good also admonishe dutie fyrst calleth israelite name greatlye reioyced onely bicause iacob patriarch fyrst called bicause therein also conteyned manifest promise god helpe protection may see gen addeth yee feare god giue audience plainely thereby admonishing dutie might perceyue true israelite feared god obeyed worde breuitie apostle beginning admonisheth v two thing worthy knowne considered fyrst wherefore tytles serue wee vse beginning reuerently honourably speake vnto hearer wherein much attributed honor euen testimony paule commaundeth v giuing honour go one another rom yet must take diligent heede nourish ambicion arrogant men flattring tongue meaning euen drunke pride glorious name rather wee must obserue meete condigne name admonishe whome haue doe dutie therefore simplicitie auncesters elder worthy commended content name office dutie neuer knew painted flattering tytles ment wilt thou adde vnto name king shall honourable noble seeing name alone conteyneth manne able perfourme thou haue speake vnto christian canst thou deuise amiable name brother honourable name christian wherby priestly dignitie princely maiestie whervnto christ hath aduaunced v expressed nowe dayes worlde come foolishnesse iudged rude rusticall stuffe oration writing counterfeyted p euish ridiculous tytles whereby make men already well wit starke staring madde much better augustus caesar thought name dominus suetonius tranquillus lyfe augustus chap lorde honorable sitting mortall man secondly taught maner men shoulde heare worde god worthily profyte vtilitie first must israelite wrastling temptation must take fast holde worde god suffer anye aduersitie taken them1 iohn therefore fayth required whereby apostle witnesseth ouercome must feare god tremble great reuerence worde lorde admonisheth prophet esay cannot obey worde god hath learned thinke well cause moses came talke god commaunded put shooes say beastly fleshly affection whereby maiestie god vseth driuen awaye nowe seeing fewe hearer dayes cause see worde god much preached vaine returne vnto paule addeth beginningthe narration narration hystorie wherein fyrst part oration ended taketh beginning narration father therby declaring preached neyther newe god newe fayth father time past saued affirmeth deede many singuler giftes yet nothing god grace gaue woulde haue sauiour promised borne posteritie bicause trust owne worthinesse hardly acknowledge grace god paule vseth diligent rehearsall god benefyts maintaineth grace god boaster merit also contayneth manifest example whole redemption wherefore shall paules purpose runne ouer expende poyntes serue haue good ought referred vnto grace god whereby vouchsafe choose v also foundation worlde layde ephe dauid therefore doth well saye blessed man whome thou hast chosen haue goodnesse selues chosen god psal madnesse pray attribute saluation merites work vnlesse free election go cannot please god secondlythe deliuery egypt alleageth glory notable deliuerye people egypt pilgrimes straungers egypt god fygure common redemption much agreeing present argument manifest pilgrimes vpon earth haue continuall dwelling place therefore deserued possession vpon earth hath god lift vppe heauen yea hath witsafe take child also hath deliuered v oppressed deadly tyrannie deuill highe arme saye sonne whome esaye prophete cap calleth arme lorde sufferance god towarde sinnersthirdly sayth god suffered maners fourtie yeares wildernesse herein noted marueylous fatherly bearing tendernesse mortall man woulde vse towarde sonne seruaunt profytable vnto thing well appeareth read storie moses howe often reade murmured moses howe often rose sediciously howe often went murther let passe thinges moses commit god himselfe forgate commaundements made calfe chaunged glory god immortall similitude oxe eateth haye often preferred seruitude egypt benefyte glorious deliuery often tempt power god yet god bare incurable malice although daily deserued newe punishment destroyed might seeme wonderfull meekenesse god daylye founde like daye houre passeth prouoke iudgement god v eyther wordes deedes thought wicked desire yet lorde spareth v though thunderboltes diuers weapon hande wherewith punishe strike v psal knoweth whereof made vse wordes ye prophet remembreth dust yet least man might thinke maye hereby sinne without checke let v note lenitie god serued hereto onely bicause woulde destroy whole nation according desertes meane grieuously punished incurable woulde repent none entred lande promise ouerthrowne wildernesse many plague somuch god neyther spared aaron moses bicause also bene occasion offence vnto people possession lande promisefourthly rehearseth inheritance lande promise god gaue lot people iewes hauing fyrst destroyed seauen mightie nation large set forth booke iosue moses diligently setteth forth benefyte god sayeth lorde thy god hath brought thee lande sware vnto thy father deut abraham isaac iacob giueth thee great goodlye city thou buildedst house full maner good thou fylledst welles digged thou diggedst vineyardes olyue tree thou plantedst c wordes marueylously amplify liberalitie god might cause god thought vnrighteous cruell vnlesse cause well considered nation cast moses reciteth place forbiddeth wandring promiscuous lustes incest ydolatrie sorcerie enchauntmentes curious artes addeth thou shalt doe maner nation cast thee thing haue done wherfore haue abhorred c see leuit deut therefore offence nation destroyed wherewithall israelite also defyled reade god cast also man case accuse god eyther vnrighteousnesse ouermuch seueritie fifthlythe ordinance common weale kingdom setteth forth benefyte common weale gouerned good lawes god onely giue vnto lande also iudges gouerne defend tyrannie enimies marked manifest errour negligence stationer printer hath depraued number written moses distribution lande iudges ruled foure hundred fyfty yeares whereas infallible computation gathered three hundred yeares onely paule ignorant euident people touching christes passion sayth prophecy fulfylled wicked enimies christ learne wicked also instrument god whome oftentimes vseth bring ordinance deuises passe yet therfore excused bicause doe god haue b done like bedlems rage impietie god go hinder set forwarde ordinance fault god praysed glorifyed moderate order audacitie boldenesse well also inuincible power infallible veritie appeareth example hys deuises take effect meane enimies also must needes stande fast euer therefore whose infyrmitie feared cruell deuises prince worlde let seeke comfort hereat whereas might notwithstanding obiected scarce credible god would appoynt sauiourchrist put death crosse innocently made away slaunderous death cursed euen lawe therefore thirde part prooueth innocent guiltlesse sheweth kinde death must much considred cause founde sayth cause death yet desired pylate kill thing might haue bene declared large like paule bicause spake vnto suspected christes let suffyse v holde fast scope ende paule howe man ought offended christes death suffered innocent forasmuch many time holyest men vse put death vnworthily vniustly also true vse christes innocencie must well weyghed consisteth purgation clensing sinnes christ bene free cleere sinnes coulde neuer haue bene able haue satisfyed sinnes howe make others cleane himselfe vncleane shoulde one indebted himselfe paye mennes debtes therefore behooued christ shoulde innocent might knowe howe deserued death part suffred death v esay maketh mention herof expoundeth mysterie redemption cap hereto belongeth saying paule god made sinne v knewe sinne cor meanes shoulde righteousnesse god allowed chiefe cause euangelistes earnest setting forth innocencie christ none ought bee offended christes death bicause suffred innocently rom tim reason vnworthy vniust slaughter saintes ought offende body whereby made partaker christes crosse thende glorifyed fourthlythe priestes enterprise coulde hurt christ least anye man shoulde thinke christ ouercome force power enimies therefore shoulde deny sauiour reuenger teacheth receyued losse harme wicked enterprise priestes perfourmed thinges prophecyed killed crosse pierced side declareth stock iesus christ maner co mming agreeable oracle olde prophetes alleageth testimony iohn authoritie iewes lawfull speake knew crosse christ greatest stumbling stocke sheweth prophetes bicause chiefe hope resurrection dependeth thereon first bicause seeme none knew testifyed hereof apostle produceth galyleyans wytnesses also sawe christ risen agayne death nowe ioyneth testimonie oracle prophetes apostlesthe testimonie apostle co cerning christ resurrection alleageth testimonie apostle speaking name apostle preach vnto sayth promise made vnto father ho god hath perfourmed vnto child say v raysed vp iesus againe c man must take graue saying apostle insolent arrogant bicause paule vseth christ ordeyned apostle wytnesses also barnabas tooke present ambassage hande speciall commaundement holy ghost declared beginning chapter therefore setteth forth commaundements apostleship committed vnto plainely worthie grauitie whereof summe howe god gaue vnto posteritie time promised vnto father sense meaning seconde epistle corinthian first chapter sayth promise god iesus christ yea amen say fulfilled appeareth greatly deceyued glorie promise grace god yet reiect christ onely ratifyed vnto v whatsoeuer thing appertaine saluation mankinde giuen vnto v righteousnesse1 cor iohn iohn rom defendeth v iudgement seate god made vnto v god wisedome satisfaction redemption father thou hast giuen mee iohn although thing part accomplished vppon aultar crosse euen christ ready yeelde vp ghost sayde finished yet resurrection chiefely appeareth effect thereby testifyeth sting death made blunt broken1 cor therefore death spoyled disarmed paule teacheth large therefore apostle nowe maketh mention begunne speake resurrection certaine thinges diligently obserued go place make selues vnworthy grace incurable malice despise saluation offred vnto thing therfore remaineth turne vnto gentyles gather god church among hitherto haue bene straungers couenant testament must saying christ fulylled kingdome god shall taken giuen vnto nation shall bring forth fruites thereof math thing diligently considered math howe vnbeleeuing perish owne iudgement vnto whome christ preached testimonie furthermore notwithstanding man incredulitie vnthankefulnesse god worde nothing preiudiced hindered god able stone rayse vp child vnto abraham shall embrace christ true faith see commeth passe vocation gentyles whose heartes harder stone mollifyed spirite worde god came great chearefulnesse vnto kingdome christ howbeit bicause apostle woulde seeme doe nothing rashlye owne headesthe place esay touching vocation gentyles alleage oracle god xlix chapter esay whereby teache god long agoe decreed gentyles also shoulde knowe howe saluation christ shoulde longer deferred seeing iewes vnto fyrst preached despised therefore calling gentyles prooued whereof haue heretofore oftentimes spoken moreouer place esay teacheth v giuen v christ first foremost light worketh v true knowledge god saluation industrie man reason cannot attaine vnto man hath seene god time onely begotten sonne bosome father iohn hath declared uerily saluation followeth light life euerlasting wee knowe god father iesus christ whome hath sent iohn woonderfull bountie goodnesse god woulde short briefe summe set vnto v belongeth saluation let v therfore walke light darkenesse ouerwhelme v may attaine saluation light iesus christ whome praise honor power glory euer amen lxxxxv homelie gentyles hearde gladde glorifyed worde lorde beleeued euen many ordeyned vnto eternall lyfe worde lorde published throughout region iewes mooued deuout honest woman chiefe citie raysed persecution paule barnabas droue coastes shooke dust feete came vnto iconium disciple filled ioye holy ghost although god gaue vnto sonne iesus christ kingdome maner power yet scripture euerywhere testify haue many enimies worlde christ himselfe oftentimes admonished disciple thereof least shoulde hope temporall felicitie kingdome offended crosse aduersitie present hystorie sheweth v euident example thing christ sayde shoulde come passe paule conuerted cyprus pamphilia came antioch pisidia according custome preached christ sinagoge iewes hath iewes gentyles embrace doctrine fayth yea whole citie almost beganne listen giue eare gospell matter seemed brought passe euen woulde haue sodeinly iewes stande vp openly speake apostle sermon refrayne rayling contention constancie boldenesse apostle specially noted whereby resist wicked enimies also pronounced horrible iudgement god declaring howe god woulde forsake transferre kingdome vnto gentyles yet coulde contention appeased grieuous matter yet ensued luke intreateth place teacheth v howe doctrine gospell faithfully published euen middle enimies sheweth newe persecution meanes whereof apostle driuen pisidia came lycaonia ende tragedie length declared haue bene prosperous ioyfull godly horrible miserable vngodly fyrst part place appertaineth wordes reioyced bicause iewes forsaken bene vnsitting faith christian charitie hearde saluation belonged also christ sauiour onely iewes also gentyles according oracle prophetes therefore thankefull mindes embrace worde god worthily commende saluation contayned within walles citie onely caried spred abrode preaching worde ouer countrie pisidia thing certaine poyntes worthy diligent consideration intreate orderly first considered men whome thinges reported verily ordeyned vnto eternall lifethey ordeyned vnto life eternall beleeue luke describeth manifest cause men beleeue gospell impugned many cruell enimies surely free election god ordeyneth vnto lyfe pleaseth likewise leaueth destruction eternall damnation whome seemeth good consider man nature shall see power beleeue gospell take holde christ1 cor phil naturall man perceyueth thing belonging vnto spirite god wee bee able selues much thinke good thought sauiour christ teacheth v ye sayth iohn needefull borne againe aboue none cometh vnto whome father draweth sayde likewise vnto peter making confession faith happy blessed art thou simon sonne ionas flesh bloude hath opened vnto thee father heauen math saying may easily gather faith belongeth onely whome god hath chosen predestinate vnto life euerlasting plaine election made euerlasting beginning worlde ephes pet christ ordeyned sauiour redeemer world made therefore election free god mercie furthermore whome chose christ seeth good calleth preaching gospell draweth effectuously spirite graffed christ faith may iustifyed merite made partaker heauenly glorye according saying paule knewe also ordeyned shoulde bee like fashioned vnto shape sonne rom moreouer whome appointed also called whome hath called also iustified whome iustified also glorified many number easily heare voyce christ perceyue god calleth bicause haue seede god lying hidden worde god quickened brought maturitie perfyte ripenesse hereof proceedeth christ sayth borne god sheepe flocke heare voyce delighted therwith yea acknowledgeth sheepe whome hitherto vnknowne afterwarde called drawne saying haue sheepe also folde also must bring iohn shall heare voyce shall bee one folde one shepehearde sort luke sheweth antiochians treatie hereof ought seeme man superfluous forasmuch nothing belonging saluation pleasaunt profytable bee considered herein opened fountaines saluation taught plague meane season wicked might without checke walke vp downe middle streetes whose sake wrath god vseth kindled banishment commonly followeth losse goodes miserable pouertie god suffreth thing light vpon elect many cause waye declareth power appeareth preserueth church middle waues persecution also trieth faith gold tried fyre mortifieth vnworthy reliques ye flesh therby deceyued war e aside moreouer maketh v like vnto sonne2 tim suffer may also reigne furthermore vseth waye make weary worlde worlde otherwise fleshe vseth esteeme make much therefore thing ought offende man let v rather often thinke promise christ none hath forsaken house brother sistren marc father mother wife child landes sake hee shall receyue hundreth folde nowe life persecution worlde come lyfe euerlasting haue easier iudgement dust cleaueth feete christes minister sufficient conuince reprooue contemners gospell shall iudge praye sermon deuises writinges bloude haue shedde testimonie iesus christ let v compare thing time may perceyue howe inexcusablye sinne dayes great impietie refuse preaching kingdome god let v therefore eschewe heynous offence abhorre familiaritie whome know polluted herewith
