ghost least shoulde perish sloth doubt saying rang eares sayde vnto ezechiel saye vnto wicked vngodly man without doubt thou shalt die ezech thou giuest warning maye turne euill waye liue shall vngodly man dye owne vnrighteousnesse bloude require thy hande c let men god hath committed charge ouer person thinke sayde vnto sayde prophete see apostle obserued place magistrate parent like accounted must well beware let malice menne ouercome although whome haue charge incurable yet shall receyue great profyte diligent study endeuour doe deliuer owne soules moreouer notable example christian charitiethe loue apostle toward enimies apostle painefully perill traueyle bring enuious nation like shortlye perishe reason incurable wickednesse vnto saluation charitie alway hopeth well also hoped remnant might saued see commeth passe oftentimes shipwrack hereof commeth paule incessantly prayeth rom wisheth accursed might saued like affection see christ mooued maner pittie sawe miserably dispersed like sheepe shepehearde wept also behelde bloudie ierusalem bicause sawe obstinatelye ranne owne destruction luke woulde knowe daye visitation example barbarous grosse people reprooued touched little calamitie others else impotently ledde desire priuate reuenge fewes sake haue iniuried beare hatred whole nation say nothing alleage cause hatred yet certaine secrete corruption nature driuen headlong hatred reioyce miserie others child god farre differ nature propertie god1 tim desireth men shoulde saued come knowledge truth vseth spare whole city fewes sake good city desire destroyed fewes sake euill chiefe cause euill consider meete goodnesse god towardes deserue thousande deathes promise rewardeth earnestly doe office dutie nowe let v see apostle gotte feruent proceeding hereby also may refused leaue ofthe effect apostle doctrine despayring shall doe good take matter hand spake sayth great multitude iewes greekes beleeued therefore worde god neuer preached without fruite euerywhere founde receyue ought doe bringeth forth fruite haue oftentimes declared god fayleth part faithfully labour name peter letting slippe nettes lordes bidding caught great hale fyshe hauing taken nothing long followed owne heade manye order matter name god appoynteth fynde greater commoditie labour looked therefore must attributed sloth falshoode little good done dayes howe shoulde lorde helpe prosper hauing regarde glory seeke onely owne commoditie neuer aduenture doe thing god name sake saluation men also appeareth place haue often sayde enterprise christes enimies vaine kingdome persecution rather furthred hindred continuall course actes apostle declareth well regard let v thing acknowledge wisedome god despaire soone christes kingdome seeing prosperously defeate deuises enimies persecutio apostlesfurthermore good successe christes kingdome afreshe persecuted manne may see true christ foreshewed concerning wicked enterprise worlde traueyles daungers minister shall profyte knowledge deepely weigh consider circumstaunces newe tragediethe iewes author persecution first nameth beginner persecution euen iewes content owne incredulitie incensed mindes gentyles brother professed christ coulde without slaundering doubt called authours sower sedition trouble forasmuch see faythfull seruants christ haue age bene charged like crime verily horrible thing iewes conceyue cankred hate truth whome god time past vsed call child priestly kingdome made vngodly vesselles instrumentes wrath lette man therefore put confydence worthynesse forefather prerogatiues followe humilitie reuerence god meane throwne downe god let v marke place author tumultes sedition beleeue gospell refuse beleeue beleeuing labour peace men much lyeth bicause abide light vse bring minister truth suspition people false accusation sedition oppresse truth meane season goe marueylous conueyance put godly fault wherof haue example achab king iewes accusing christ pylate behooueth v marke thing nowe dayes quickly beleeue say common weales publike peace disturbed preaching gospell secondly declared maner men apostle shewed themselues tumultthe apostle boldlye resist seditious go yeelde fyrst wicked abiding long space iconium doe businesse lorde great trust boldenesse god assisteth fauour myracles signes giueth testimonie vnto worde grace saye gospell whereby grace god christ preached vnto v example apostle teacheth v minister christ must yeeld ouer soone attemptes wicked although see great trouble like follow therof must admit nothing glory god rather agree ye world christ calleth naughty adulterous vntowarde marc therefore teacheth vnmeete true seruants god shoulde haue much regard thereof meane season place sheweth v vse myracles done handes minister god author men shoulde attribute vnto minister vnto men shoulde seales beleeue haue bene vsed worde god iohn christ lorde confesseth myracles teacheth v apostle shoulde doe marc shoulde serue none vse therefore confuted two errours reigning euerywhere dayes fyrst errour requyre myracles v whereof great neede among christian people whose faith must stande vpon worde god confesse apostle doctrine hath long since bene sufficientlye prooued myracles papistes alleage number pieuish myracles manifest truth inuocation saint transubstantiation purgatorie kinde trifle howbeit behooued shoulde fyrst haue prooued opinion worde god thing seeing cannot doe math thes ought taken false lying signes brought forth proofe christ long agone prophecied antichrist shoulde worke later dayes thirdlyall citie diuision declared howe farre persecution went whole multitude citie deuided sayth part helde iewes part apostle therefore little trouble among fewe person whole citie deuided take part one another thing greatest plague happen citie howbeit christ sayde shoulde come passe came sende peace sworde came set man father math daughter hir mother daughter lawe hir mother lawe mannes foe shall owne housholde yet must remember sayde vnbeleeuers procurer persecution christ properly truely anye authour diuision forasmuch place commendeth peace vnto v commaundeth v loue enimies malice wicked vrged wholesome doctrine christ raue length professe open enmitie thing cannot ended without sedition vngodly holde fast vngodlynesse tooth nayle godly must forsake standing wherin placed god least seeme make friendshippe worlde glorye christ saluation mennes soules cause apostle shewe themselues neutrales contention although straungers whome cicero forbiddeth curious men common weales sayde take part easily appeareth also tooke part therefore little like vnto apostle assoone controuersies fall matter religion thinke high poynt wisedome stande neutrales indifferentes solon sayth good citizen sedition woulde syde shall call christian christes glory assaulted sit like ydle gazers without daunger looke apoc surely men warmelinges neyther colde hote christ threateneth spewe outthe apostle flye iconiu preach place fourthly ende commeth persecution antioch enimies christ ruler magistrate rose vppe rage apostle daunger haue bene stoned wherefore following counsayle example christ fled thence reseruing themselues seasonable time yet blamed bicause fled sedition raysed occasion shoulde else doe seeing matter tended open violence let v diligently marke escaped gaue themselues fylthie ydlenesse comming lystra derba spred doctrine gospell ouer lycaonia therefore lawfull flie neyther glory christ saluation church hazarde least putting selues daunger rashlye seeme tempt christ must take heede followe counsayle rascall feare forsake office god hath called v let v therefore haue alwayes eye glory god marke deuises shall come passe hauing passed daungers shall keepe fayth soules iesus christ sauiour whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxxxvij homelie sate certaine man lystra weake feete creple mother wombe neuer walked hearde paule preach beholding perceyuing faith whole sayde lowde voyce saye thee name iesus christ stande vpright thy feete start vp walked people saw paule done lift vp voyces saying speach lycaonia goddes come downe v lykenesse men called barnabas iupiter paule mercurius bicause hee preacher iupiters priest dwelt citie brought ox garlandes vnto porch woulde haue done sacrifice people lorde sauiour iesus christ fyrst sent forth apostle preache gospell warned nothing diligently persecution shoulde come vnto going businesse foretolde shoulde suffer many grieuous hereby meaning feare dismay arme fayth trouble foreseene thereby might learne ouercome paule barnabas chosen vessel christ well vnderstoode thing speciall commaundement holye ghost sent forth hearde preach among gentyles vse fayth constancie office charge persecution men increased force strength returne alacritie office againe driuen antioch fyll iconium doctrine christ agayne beinst expulsed iconium reason sedition raysed come lystra derba beginne teach sayde preached gospell least man might thinke chaunged doctrine enimies pleasure constancie set forth imitated men thende seeme true worshipper christ shoulde giue place wicked enimies worde vnworthy christ setteth friendship vntowarde adulterous worlde glory christ howbeit bicause mention made myracles whereby god gaue testimonie apostle doctrine nowe luke rehearseth one myracle among great many reason effect falling thereof seemed verye worthy declared profyte may come vnto v consideration thereof fyrst discusse myracle circumstance declare effect thereof luke beginneth description himthe myracle creple healed whome myracle wrought townesman lystra many wayes miserable lame feete mother wombe thereby appeareth disease incurable part cleaue v natiuitie birth also added neuer went feete walkedthe miserable state creple diligent description creple maketh certaintie myracle power christ might appeare euident whose name long healed obserued christ commonly setteth forth glorye name eyther sicke incurable disease natiuitie else otherwise great calamitie one reade blinde man christ restored sight iohn another palsie length bene xxxviij yeares diseased restored againe health iohn one woman eyghtene yeares gone stowping bowed togither demoniakes raged luke math benefyte deliuered thinges serue fyrst consolation shoulde take aduersities god sendeth impaciently considering hereby christ knoweth howe fetch matter glorifye name god little hateth v therefore rather bearing pacientlye maketh v instrument glory furthermore make instruction rashly ryde whome god hath punished anye deformity blemish nature according saying salomon derideth poore contemneth god maker wicked tauntes scornes nicketh god hath chastened afflicted hande deut leuit thing cause lawe pronounceth accursed layeth stumbling blocke blindes waye curseth deafe let v see creple made wholethe creple heareth gospell beleeueth heard paule preach beleeued made whole whereby appeareth paule preached saluation christ creple heard confyrmed many myracles conceyued also good hope restitution like also secret suggestion holy spirite forasmuch promise vniuersall promiseth health bodye beleeue name christ luke ment shewe cause saluation sayth hee beleeued scripture teacheth v faith made partaker christ benefytes christ many time teacheth v saying healed done vnto thee according thy fayth thy fayth hath saued thee made thee whole worthy considered fyrst sayde hearde afterwarde mention made beliefe gatte hearing worde teacheth v sort meanes fayth commeth vnto v manifest faith gift god consisteth eloquence wisedome manne man knoweth father sonne math hee whome sonne open god vseth men minister instrumentes worde meaneth teach men word according saying paule minister cod whome haue beleeued cor euen lorde gaue euery man grace therfore whosoeuer attaine vnto fayth must diligently harken worde god shall beleeue except haue hearde howe shall heare without preacher faith commeth hearing rom hearing worde god wherefore christ ioyning togither iohn sayth heareth word beleeueth sent hath life euerlasting thing serue commendation outward word contemne imagine another word god search wayes fayth saintes neuer knewe doe lye open commonly assault deuill troubled marueylous illusion fare like men hearing howe god giueth encrease corne leaue tillage thing god hath ordeyned maintenance man creple myraculously healedafter luke sheweth myracle paule well beholding creple perceyued certaine token fayth coulde without secret working holy spirite able man countenance variable deceyueable thing iudge surely mannes faith must needes therefore suggestion spirite certifyed paule lame mannes fayth turning vnto giueth perfyte helth body written certaine auncient copyes great credite sayth saye vnto thee name iesus christ stande vpright vpon thy feete credible fyrst wordes wherein name christ alleaged paule omitted read common copyes translation bicause onely ende marke apostle doctrine myracles bring men beleeue christ sauiour worke side proceeding faith wanted prosperous successe hitherto alwayes bene lame start vp walked thus god myracle gaue testimonie apostle doctrine yesterday declared bicause myracles christ apostle commonly set forth vnto v maner saluation redemption therfore lame man briefly touch lame man creple paterne example state condicion v alla fygure redemption man yea mankinde man lame mother wombe euen weake lame vnto thing belonging saluation infyrmitie cleaueth v euen mother wombe conceyued borne sinne consider life passed shall see neuer walked say ye way god ledd v inheritance eternall life haue strayed waye like sheepe euery one v hath followed owne wayes esay god himselfe testifyeth imagination men euill euen childehoode gene therefore looke case lame man touching body case concerning soule looke howe farre soule passeth bodye much miserable case shall appeare therefore health selues must needes looke without selues euen lame man founde heard gospell iesus christ power beleeued shoulde made whole faith obtayned desire must go selfesame way saued lette v heare gospell beleeue iesus christ preached gospell streightwaye shall saued deliuereth sinnes beleeue bicause made sinne v cor might made righteousnesse acceptable god regenerateth v immortall eternall seede heauenly generation healeth sore malady corrupt nature instructeth v fresh force able selues thinke one good thought able doe thing iohn phil long abide bring forth much fruite bicause able worke thing taken sauiour misery like perishe must hande seeke phisition none also taught example lame man dutie whome christ hath thus healed deliuered paules calling start vp walked christ calleth v let v forthwith rise vp myre wherin haue long sticked casting deceyued howe foolishe papistes yet vse bragge name christ confesse apostle men seruants christ whose ministerye pleased vse setting forth hys kingdome yet make god attribute vnto thing belong god onely ought ascribed creature without ye prophane contempt true liuing god teach v yt inuocated daungers prescribe vnto diuers property prerogatiues foolish euer heathen god appoynting one patrone prisoner another daunger shipwracke another traueylers way perill fyre bicause cannot tell haue played fooles ynough confesse saint haue suffred death christes sake yet ascribe vnto great part glory christ feygning intercessor aduocates vnto god making vowes prayer vnto let v ashamed therefore take paynes confuting follye gentyles seeing much folly founde among professor christes religion furthermore holy ghost setteth vnto v example beginning proceeding idolatriethe beginning going forwarde idolatry beginning error hath bene ignorance true god men woulde vsage gentyles call nature essence god iudgement man reason error brought multitude god grosse absurde opinion men followed another error thought many god iudged euery person thing whereby benefyte commoditie god hereof came ordeyned whereby bring knowledge example hereof appeare euerywhere hystories age one notable falleth among people lystra paule barnabas preach vnto gospell iesus christ doubt vsed great diligence redeemer man decayed nature preuayled thinges men lystra destitute light holy ghost led blinde reason fleshe learne knowe christ hereby take occasion myracle glorifye according nature propertie man taking holde euery thing next sticke onely apostle woonder onely thinke ate onely worker myracle without anye regarde vnto iesus christ prepare godly honor sacrifyces bene tollerable thing lystra onely whome custome gentyle superstition long bewitched thus offended infection ensample ranne farre among professours christes name chiefe poynt godlynesse religion seemed stande like worshipping saintes vnto whome reason myracles wrought time past sicke person prisoner men daunger sea otherwhere vsed make prayer e e altar make builde church offer kinde sacrifyces hauing meane season little quench publike fyre straungers forreners coulde doe without daunger life furthermore goe matter bare wordes cry man woulde thinke forgotten modestie myldenesse priuate case knowne modest pacient sent ministery shall heyres saluation hebrues admitte cauillation say argument worshipping saint refelled bicause deliuered kinde misery infyrmities made partaker heauenly glorye graunt argument nothing gathered yet infynite place scripture teach v ought inuocated nowe liued earth holye men prophete testifye euen nowe ignorant state condicion esay agreeth verye well beatitude blisse enioy faine eyther behold reuenge misery furthermore grounded inuiolable principle religion taught must worship honor one god onlye deut math men neyther liuing neyther dead must haue godly honor sufficiently laugh folly rather bewayle turne transforme saintes work owne handes say dumbe image argument apostle fet office saying came vnto preached gospell thintent turne vanity begin worship liuing god creator heauen earth sea thing contained thus plainely protest may suffer godly honour done vnto themselues without manifest impietie offence vnto god take trayterous ambassadour worthy punishment vnder name pretence king would aduaunce owne cause studie establishe owne tyrannie among whome ought bring prince obedience would thinke wicked caytife woulde vnder pretence olde acquaintaunce friendship bring another man wife home owne house euident apostle minister worde christes legate ambassador bridegroomes friendes dutie bring men obedience faith marrye christ whome hath redeemed price bloude made vnspotted spouse thus iohn baptist reasoneth office disciple iohn cor paule place therfore place refuseth honor offred detestation bicause seeth incurre treason fornication shoulde committe like thing woulde god well obserue thing dayes think godlynesse religion sende simple vnlearned comminaltie vnto creature else teache seeke saluation merites men worship vaine deuised without word godmoreouer worthy considered apostle call worship lystra would haue done vnto vanitie hereby gather religion vaine force deuised man imagination without worde god specially tende worship god onely vnto creature whome god impart glory math esay herevnto agree thing christ alleageth prophet worship vain teaching doctrine men let papist make answere whose religion chiefly consisteth honouring creature standeth vpon none foundation men tradition duetie minister wordefurthermore apostle wordes comprehende duetie mynisters worde whyle affirme preaching ende men turne vayne worshypping creature vnto onely lyuing god therefore faythfull minister christ must ioyne two thinges togyther must ouerthrowe false religion plant true wherevnto referred saying prophet ierem beholde thys day haue appoynted thee roote vp destroy buylde vp plant husbandry tyllage labor taken plowing watering vayne except thing hinder cornes growth rooted vp good seede sowne husbanding dressing mynde haue vnfruitefully laboured haue paynefully carefully ioyned togither therfore men dayes commit double offence men abhorre antichrist wicked religion occupied onely ouerthrowing haue remembraunce restore agayne true syncere religion agayne wyll haue men taught true religion preaching word haue abuse superstition touched bicause would haue displeasure world latter sort hope superstition fall owne accorde men come knowledge true god perceyue place knowledge god men mindes tyll superstition remooued therefore meaneth profitably commendation traueyle matter religion must ioyne sayde togither thirdly apostle teach v know maner god isgod creator gouernour thing euen maker heauen earth sea god scripture declareth euery one openly professe hym article fayth according tradition apostle confesse creatour must also needes confesse gouernour meete shoulde ymagine god worke mayster hath regarde care worke dauid confesseth deede dwelleth high yet beholdeth whatsoeuer flowe worlde tossed turned interchaungeable course varietie season conclude nothing excluded god prouidence numbreth euen dyuers wayes byrdes flying flower fyelde heares head thing doting confuted say god owne wayes inuentions therefore maye take example therein followe thing fell permission sufferaunce god pleased superstition presumption curyous men deserued paule place sayth woulde seeke mystery
