miserably beguyled alleage multitude matter religion affirme church cannot erre euydent age greater number haue bene deceyued false opinion god haue truely serued hym noe familie eyght person followed opinion god religion contrary al world hath god confyrme warrant patriarch fewe number bright starres shining dark fyrmament scattred abroade among vnbeleeuing gentyles shal say people israel peculyars lord read byshops fowly wickedly erred contrarie commaundement god enterprised cast calfe prophet saith turned maiesty god similitude oxe eateth hay psal speake god newe people luke math actes thes doth christ call small flock sayth fewe go narrowe gate vnto saluation yea paule sayth grieuous wolues shall rise vp euen congregation shall spare flock sayth also antichrist shall sit aloft temple god let cease therefore obiect vnto v consent multitude authoritie church resist open veritie require worde god voyce christ ought onely touch rule iudge controuersies doctrine god charged men idolatriefurthermore least anye man put god faulte gentyles ydolatrie superstition apostle vse preoccupation preuention cleere god maner fault hee saye hath alwayes borne wytnesse himselfe nature pleasure hath shewed inuisible nature essence vnto worlde hys visible workes omytting great woonderfull work god passe man capacitie reache rehearseth daylie workes whereby doth good vnto men euen cause able drawe man diligent consideration soueraigne god blynde dull perceyueth seasonable tymes increase victual springing thereof say thing come passe chaunce knyt togyther fast order nature thing commeth beside woonted course nature thought woonder pray vnthankfulnesse acknowledge god alone prouydeth v necessary onely also giueth v aboundance thing delectable pleasaunt excuse ignoraunce alleage themselues often take meate admonished god liberallitie towards v place profytable doctrine beating downe superstitious curiositie person verie necessarie say author influence heauen increase yeelde earth apostle say god creator gyueth v rayne heauen fruitefull season replenishing v foode gladnesse herevnto agreeth scripture euery place dauyd diligently accounteth among workes god saying couereth heauen clowdes prepareth rayne earth maketh grasse growe vpon mountaynes giueth fodder vnto cattell feedeth yong rauens call vpon gyueth snowe lyke wooll scattereth hoare frost lyke ash psal casteth forth yse like morsel sendeth hys word melteth bloweth winde water flowe againe watreth hylles aboue psal earth filled fruit workes bringeth forth grasse cattle herbe vse men may bring foode earth c omyt infynite testimony might brought god moderateth thinges according hys iust pleasure whyle sendeth plenteous encrease walke hys lawe leuit deut scarcitie barrennesse disobedyent whereof haue euydent example astrologer confuted attrybuting thinges position placeing planet reuoke bring agayne prophane name god almost kinde gentilitie superstitious also reprooued make saint author hereof aske rayne seasonable weather hauing mass seruice appoynted ende purpose let sortes see god sayth hosea chap let v followe apostle doctrine acknowledge one onely god author gouernour thing eyther bound course planet subiect nature according hys good pleasure iust iudgement moderateth ordereth thing nowe luke declareth effect apostle sermon sayththe effect apostle sermon lystra coulde scarce restrayned weyght wordes sentence woulde doe sacrifyce vnto frowarde obstinate man retayning superstition yet obstinacie time greater men coulde one sermon prohibited nowe adayes number many yeares traueyle daylie sermon brought right way let v therfore pray vnto god father illuminate v holye spirite bring v true wholesome knowledge sonne iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen lxxxxix homelie thyther came certaine iewes antioch iconium obtayned people consent stoned paule drewe citie supposing bene deade howbeit disciple stoode rounde arose vp came citie next daye departed barnabas derba preached citie taught many returned againe lystra iconium antioch strengthned disciple soules againe exhorted continue fayth affirming must much tribulation enter kingdome god lord sauiour iesus christ laboureth incessantly maintaine defende saluation mankinde satan altogither occupyed ouerthrowing kingdome god pulling men waye saluation hereof hystorie haue euident example apostle preaching lystra fyrst satan moued certaine superstitious person giue diuine honour vnto doubt drift malicious enimie mannes saluation haue tripped apostle tempting ambition wheras attempted christ enterprise commeth passe paule barnabas perceyuing craft deuill enflamed zeale defended constantly glory true god nowe townesmen lystra beginne taste knowledge god forsake error forefather wherefore satan prooueth another way armeth professed enimies truth whose meanes caused apostle time also giue place go backe calleth certaine iewes antioch iconium slaunders incensed mindes lystra apostle like madde men rose paule woulde haue stoned haled hal e deade gate citie vse hystorie learne v beware satan sleyghtes wherewith vseth vndermine truth imitate constancie apostle withstanding bicause thing seruing instruction comfort shall profytable consider circumstance contention satan hath euerywhere instrumentesfirst party beginner disturbance troubled apostle euen iewes whose horrible blindenesse desperate obstinacie contending christ hath bene already oftentimes spoken marked notable sleyght pollicie satan bringeth men antioch iconium olde tried souldiours chiefe care haue euerywhere instrument whereby may ouerthrowe kingdome christ establishe owne wherefore perceyue men fyt ynough purpose one place bring place whose meanes industrie compasse purpose hereof might manye example brought olde example needed dayly abundant like subtiltie vseth dayes procuring bishop ydle monkes creepe maintayne counsel wicked incense vnlearned comminaltie slaunders christes doctrine inuegling noble fayre promise somtimes gift rewardes labouring may destroy fruite gospell euen springth blade shall profytable v well marke may labour lesse traueyle study yet godly voyde guile defende set forth truth secondlythe inconstancie common haue consider inconstancie common people long tooke apostle goddes prepared doe sacrifyce vnto sodenly perswaded forreners men another profession religion go put cruell death therefore shall thinke woulde haue done bene pricked forwarde eyther owne nation romaine president leuitie ticklenesse people forgetfull benefytes receyued detestable iniuries reward benefactor dishonest common euery place example hereof see egyptian iosephes counsayle onelye preserued time dearth also aduaunced great power glorie yet forgotte almost deade vsed maner crueltie tyrannie posteritie moses felt euen protector defender people israel hauing suffred kinde slaunderous reproches could scarce escape stoning neede speake dauid diuers others whose example reade storyes gentyles seeing euident christ suffred like called hayled king honorable great showtes receiued came ierusalem shortly ioyning scribe phariseyes desired haue crucifyed example profytable teache v must trust prayse people variable inconstant man consider himselfe onely shall easily perceyue diuers mindes contrarye affection shall thinke common beast many heades alway constant looke howe many heades hath many sens ledde admitteth harkeneth euery day newe deuises vse inconstancie leuitie lucre aduantage rather labour make doings acceptable god onely whome knowe sure reward laide vp v neither leuitie common violence tyrant take v thirdly haue consider god himselfethe prouidence god preserueth godly daungers according whose becke prouidence manifest thinges ordred suffereth moste faythfull apostle christ chosen vessell grace stoned whose saluation moste desired whome prayed without ceasing therefore ought seeme straunge insolent thing vnto v lyke come passe dayes must iudge mannes doctrine fayth according euill successe therof bicause like fell time past prophet christ testifyeth math let v rather comfort selues god prouidence appeareth place many argument acknowledge bee singular working counsayle god paule thus stoned barnabas vntouched paules companion long seemed preferre paule calling iupiter say preserued assistance god seeing reade none present went resist enterpryse harebrained common man demaunde god assisted man rather paule surelye render certaine reason therefore lyked god whose iudgements truth veritie yet place may giuen godly coniectures may seeme god therefore spared barnabas bicause knewe yet weake beare brunt god faythfull suffer v tempted beare1 cor god care goodnesse seemeth towards paule lesse preserueth middest showting people stone flying eares caught deadly wounde recouered yea restored againe thought deade drawne like deade caryon gate citie able next daye following take iourney let man therefore despayre middle daungers considering boundes god prouidence passe markes dole daungers whether liue die lordes nothing able seperate v loue rom paule teacheth v learne generall doctrine example later epistle timothy cap wordes thou hast seene experience doctrine fashion liuing purpose fayth long suffring loue pacience persecution affliction came mee antioch iconium lystra persecution suffred paciently lorde deliuered yea liue godly christ iesu shall suffer persecution wherefore fyrst let v laye foundation minde nothing come vnto v without ordinance pleasure god hath numbred euen heares head math next let v thinke ordreth thing righteous holy iudgement thirdly let v fully perswaded neuer cease take care v beareth fatherly minde affection v euen moste careth v seeme daunger enimies therefore deliuer v daunger thinke meetest behoofe seeme good vnto farre better knoweth case meete v selues pray replye hereof shall haue occasion say ende sermon dutie christian towardes brother distressenowe disciple whose mind lightened sounder knowledge christ thys businesse denie fayth take part gentyles ashamed paule stoned shamefull wise haled citie truely gathered likelyhoode good able defende open violence furious people doe yet much lyeth whome thought deade stande bewayling desirous accomplishe last dutie buriall vnto valyaunt minister christ heard faithfull ierusalem steuen martyred yet daungerous enterprise man well consider iewes cankred hatred towardes christ rage people yet calmed reason late disdayne conceyued sauiour christ fayleth godlye duetie whome lamented deade hym dyd god woonderfull wise restore agayne rose vp went citie taught example duetie owe vnto faythfull minister christ daunger duetie first able must faythfully helpe distresse wherein many dueties considered fall amongst none small hath rewarde god considering shall lose recompence gyueth cup colde water vnto disciple christ math denie succour able giue let thinke sayde vnto mardocheus sometyme sayde vnto queene hester thou holde thy peace thys time shall iewes haue helpe delyueraunce ootherwayes thou thy father house shall perishe cap seconde degree duetie able helpe consent vnto counsell wicked enimies christ al meanes possible declare neuer consented vnto marc storie gospell sheweth v example hereof ioseph arimathaea thirde last comfort whome tyrannouslye afflict meanes able lacke abilitie yet testifye teares howe lament state let v ashamed knowe christ lyeth bounde banished afflicted put sorrowe iosephus faythfully perfourme whyle caused christ honorably buried whome aduersaries shamefully hong crosse would nowe dayes thus dutyfully vse selues towardes member christ see god would helpe ayde v beyonde expectation god suffer indeauours beloued lost kingdome christ sonne shrowne downe enterprise wicked let v returne apostle see escaped broyles thus much reported followeth next daye following apostle made bolder affliction returne vocation agayne paule accompanyed barnabas went lystra came vnto derba preacheth gospell ie u christ bringeth many disciple vnto christ notable rare example christian constancie faythfull endeuour daunger made bolde feruent returne againe vnto office duetie hereby reprooued sluggishnesse slydebackes haue bene daunger though done duetie neuer brought againe suffer anye christes sake howbeit deede rather haue considered reason god late deliuered helped haue bene incouraged bolde hath god therefore set v libertie intent afterwarde stande ydle looke whyle others perill nay cause rather maketh good promise ende stande boldely defence name paule remembring thys coulde fynde heart rest scarce one day togither yet might seeme deserued haue quietus est also obserued wheresoeuer luke reasoneth apostle doctrine maketh mention nothing gospell ministerie preaching whereof christ committed vnto marc great argument fayth credite vsed office commytted charge also teacheth v ought preached church apostle durst take much vpon giue back starte commaundement christ infeoffe church newe tradition doubtlesse boldnesse excused dayes impudently presume vnder name pretence apostle moreouer apostle returne three city whence expulsedthey come city agayne whence driuen antioche iconium lystra confirme establishe woonne vnto christ fayth ordering house much prayse saue gotten get vnto church god must haue care onely gette vnto also take heede none fall duetie fayth negligence seede must onely throwne grounde also tended cherished thornes bryers ouergrowe perishe seede god worde sowne amongst men must still cherished watered parable christ well knowne concerning enimie whyle sleepe vseth sowe darnell co cle therfore much blame ter haue preached worde thinke haue discharged duetie whereas afterwarde dyligence industrie needefull began heare follow voyce christ seduced pulled back satan craft also notable example christian loue zeale paule barnabas returned againe iniuriously shamefully intreated dryuing city let man therefore offended vnthankfulnesse men thinke therefore lawfull leaue duetie bicause hearer whose saluation carefull lyke hym deserueth shoulde man imitate whome thinketh worthy blamed thou thinkest worthy reprehended doe duetie sufferest thou thy selfe doe woorse thy duetie remember rather thou art seruaunt god therefore lookest thy rewarde hande blockishe ingratefull world whose propertie requite doe good euill thing came passe vnto moses dauid prophet christ apostle aboundantly declare yea hystories gentile full example vnto referred aristides themistocles miltiades cimon camillus scipions catones cicero infynite others deliuerers country calamity whereby vnkinde citizen eyther shamefully banished country else vnworthily put death kylled let v diligentlye consyder paule barnabas city wherevnto returned fyrst sayde confirmed myndes discipels yet worke god onelyther confirme mind disciple rule mindes men confyrme mooue owne pleasure yet apostle confyrme whose ministerie god vouchsafe vse purpose worketh onely thing men yet part vseth meanes certaine orderly proceeding therfore euen preaching worde illuminateth men mindes faith meanes confyrmeth men mindes faith must thinke consyder hereof least attribute ministerie menne onely worke god else make light ministerie ordeyned god grieuous detestable error whyle seeme defend glorie god contempne order appointed god despise doctrine hys worde shunne oyne congregation neglect prayer vnder pretence god holye name liue carelesly wickedly howbeitthey exhort menne perseuerance luke declareth howe apostle confyrmed mindes disciple saying followeth exhorting contynue faith men mindes therefore vse confyrmed exhortation taken worde god let v also marke howe sufficient men beleeue christ must also abyde continue true fayth except doe math luke later ende woorse beginning thought worthy kingdome god haue layde hande plough looke backe agayne hereof came passe christ ascention rebuked church ephesus bicause lost hir former loue feruent zeale fayth commended church thyatira bicause increased euery daye faith godlynesse apocal therefore behooueth congregation diligently meditate thinges corrupt lawdable beginning fayth fylthie falling awaye negligence also let degree state men learne hereby take heede office generall rule thinges vaine beginne well except continue vnto ende meane whyle place teacheth v doctrine faith certaine inuiolable commendable thing perseuere continue fayth thing doctrine thereof amended chaunged thinge obiected whyle dare openly condempne doctrine apostle yet saye diuers thing added since necessarie obserued thing taught man compare thing doctrine apostle shall finde truth apostle doctrine stande thinges admytted let v learne therefore persist faith doctrine apostle admit nothing contrarie therevnto yea beleeue aungell galat woulde nowe preache newe gospell moreouer put away offence crossethey put away offence crosse thing needefull bicause mannes reason time iudgeth fayth according thing time fall vnlike many men mindes marueylously tempted seeing apostle doctrine euerywhere reiected still daunger trouble apostle briefe saying giue effectuall comfort weake faith saying many tribulation must enter kingdome heauen saying hath two reason fytte comfort v fyrst say must otherwise common sense teaceth v must take paciently good worth cannot otherwise thus declare state lyfe godly haue liue worlde christ also testifyeth full maner affliction whereas commaundeth v euerye day take vppe crosse luke followe surely man marke course life hee shall see nothing free euill miserie lyfe floweth maner molestation spring sinne sickenesse labor care watching pouertie alteration world infynite like reason whereof life compared moste troublesome perillous pilgrimage continuall traueyle beside affliction worlde cannot abyde light hath store godlye hereof proceedeth worlde hateth rayled put shame euery man doth iniurye laye violent handes imprisoned manacled fettered banished lose goodes suffer moste vyle horrible deathes psalm iohn thus fulfylled saying dauid many tribulation iust christ foretolde shoulde come vnto v thing must remember must onely god maye founde true hys worde bicause expedient thus tame brydle fleshe mooue v lothe lyfe desire life come feele selues loue worlde fleshe howe much adoe brought desire heauenly thing thinke woulde come v taste aduersitie world haue thing come passe according desire lyking surely flesh would neuer brought renounce worlde notwithstanding vexation woonderfully loue worlde second reason declare ioyfull ende tribulation tribulation entrance v kingdome god wordes vnderstanded though suffring affliction deserue kingdome god purchased v bloude sauiour christ teach v christ example hath trode way vnto v crosse entred glory father ende affliction set forth vnto v inheritaunce eternall life according promise christ iohn minister shall also therfore henceforth abhorre crosse offended affliction seeing heareth come also vnto wicked christes meane worke saluation godly let v remember thing day brother let v consider god appoyntment thus invred diuers trouble otherwise bicause naughtynesse flesh requireth let v haue eye example christ bicause woulde captaine suffered fyrst thing furthermore let v fasten eye minde vppon glory heauenly life forgette frayle temporall thing behinde v lette v ioyne herevnto feruent prayer maye vouchsafe accomplish performe good worke begonne v shall come passe inspyred spirite grace hauing prosperously ended race life attayned rewarde heauenly shall liue reigne lorde sauiour iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen c homelie ordeyned elder election euery congregation prayed fasted commended lorde whome beleeued gone thorowout pisidia came pamphilia preached woorde perga descended citie attalia thence departed shippe antioch whence committed vnto grace god woorke fulfilled come gathered togither congregation rehearsed god done howe hee opened doore fayth vnto gentyles abode long time disciple dutie apostle bring sauiour iesus christ disciple gather church nation preaching gospell part dutie carefullye diligently see vnto church doe paule barnabas faythfullye perill lyues planted congregation antioche iconium lystra laboured industrie possible maintaine defende assault craftes satan bicause knewe iewes marueylously vexe returned againe church notwithstanding opprobriously driuen forth neither doe returne without profyte confyrme strengthen mindes disciple admonition comfortes exhorting continue abide doctrine putting away slaunder offence crosse hath bene spoken sermon going herevnto adioyned sayde beginning place touching elder ordeyned sayde apostle haue hereof intreated much god shall giue v grace speake returne vnto church antioch agayne whome recounted done abrode sayth luke ordeyned elder election apostle appoynt elder euery church euery congregation prayed fasted commended lorde whome beleeued called senior elder partlye minister teacher word partly ayding assisting pastours administration church reason authoritie see discipline obserued church luke sayth ordeyned euery church easily appeareth necessarye conseruation church haue whose ministery doctrine worde may continuall vse requisite infyrmitie flesh also bicause corruption mannes nature must needes oftentimes warned doe dutie least brought destruction craftes subtiltie deuill cause christ onely sende forth apostle preach gospell among nation worlde also gaue vnto church ephe cor pastours teacher whose diligence fayth knowledge god apostle taught might confyrmed preserued men mindes paule writeth left titus cause creta ordeyne elder euery citie islande herevnto manifest godlyest king prince hertofore respect whose liberalitie church endowed enriched least want prouision ministery word shoulde haue fayled therefore error pieuishe absurde reiect doctryne worde vnprofytable superfluous men well knowe themselues would perceyue thys readyest waye whereby attayne vnto saluation christ sometime tolde martha much busied occupyed matter therefore many haue church maintayned let diligentlye prouide church want fytte worthy minister ceremony maner primitiue church hoosing eldersthe euangelyst also declareth ceremony maner choosing elder wherein prayer fasting fyrst placed whereof mention made haue hearde lyke case act scripture vseth ioyne togither signifyeth church vsed solemne wyse come togyther primitiue church vsed great necessitie vrged constrayned appoynt solemne assembly giuing themselfe prayer fasting vntill euening wherof haue euident testimonyes prophet ioel seconde chapter hystories kinges primitiue church mooued weyghty consideration obserue thinges electing minister thought men might easily deceyued would weyghty case attribute thing mannes iudgement therefore thought meete godly prayer seeke inspiration god spirite againe thought requisite haue menne furnished singular giftes office besought god also humble supplication wherevnto bicause shoulde feruent ioyned fasting haue otherwheres declared moreouer luke maketh mention laying handes vnderstanded onely consent voyces also imposition handes sacrament token consecration seemeth ye later rather obserued likely ye apostle receded ceremonie vsed ye choosing matthias permitted thing iudgement man see cometh passe men voyces seeing prouoked men praiers fasting religion holy simplicitie church worthy diligently obserued wherwith man would compare done dayes like case shall easily appeare tyrannie church oppressed couetousnesse ambition bishop come passe libertie church trode vnder foote choosing minister dependeth vpon eyther sell spirituall liuings money else watche carefully none made minister owne tooth cloke winke doings choosing minister luke sayththe apostle commed congregation vnto lorde commended congregation lorde whome beleeued dutie curtesie humanitie commende tuition defence god whose prosperitie well wishe also declareth diligent care apostle alwayes speciall consideration church well fare wherevnto saying paule referred combred daylie doe care congregation cor weake weake offended burne meane season admonished reason infyrmitie haue neede god protection gouernaunce prone readie fall satan still seeking howe catch v snare christ going worlde vnto father without cause commende disciple vnto protection father iohn thys ought kindle v feruent desyre true godlynesse religion betraye saluation owne slothfulnesse againe hereof may also take comfort appeareth saluation dependeth vpon protection prouidence god would dispayre depende vpon mannes wyll power vnconstaunt deceyueable thing worlde howbeit cause v dispayre consider howe standeth tuition gouernaunce god haue speciall care v seing hath care flower fyelde byrdes ayre hath numbred verye heares head hath sonne promised v iohn wyll leaue v succourlesse christ whome beleeue professeth faythfull valyaunt shepheard iohn whose hande man able take sheepe yea paule place teacheth v god knoweth tim rom nothing seperate v loue god therefore often satan tempteth v let v flye vnto sanctuarie god mercie fauour vnto christ hath commended v moreouer example apostle teacheth v doe haue done duetie let v commit successe therof vnto god whose prouidence know thing gouerned thys onely meane moderate quyet deuises wherein ignoraunt marueylously troubled often time leaue duetie supposing bring matter passe owne wisedome deuise standing betweene hope dreade fynde resting place deuise knowe trust diligence requyred duetie successe thereof dependeth vpon god see haue done partes duetie set light daungers come vnto feare daunger hold duetie nowe thing donethe apostle preach gospell perga paule barnabas appoynt go agayne antioche syria whence tooke leaue bicause would lose labour waye preach gospell perga citie pamphilia citie famous reason diana worshipped place called pergaea gentyles write therfore singuler worke god goodnesse would vouchsafe superstitious ydolatrous people light worde againe diligence apostle considered vnwearysome great traueyle vsed ouerthrowing kingdome satan whosoeuer counted apostolike meane despite worlde prince thereof roote superstition set vp kingdome christ let imitate zeale regarded eyther reason ingratitude worlde daungers euery side appearing leaue dueties time consider apostle returne antioche giue account doings abrodefyrst congregation assembled togither like faythfull legate ambassadours declare vnto whole church done circuite therefore apostle lordes ouer men faith prescribing thing absolute power according pleasure rather acknowledged themselues seruaunts christ impudently contempne spouse dayes vse swelling name succession apostle thinke vnmeete others appoyntment render account doinges anye man let reade beseeche written1 pet referre doings vnto godmoreouer vtter speake nothing themselues arrogant maner make god author doings wythout cause luke maketh mention twise thrise grace worke god fyrst sayth committed vnto grace god worke intent church might wytnesse able doe nothing without grace god declare woonders god wrought kinde phrase attributeth whole successe ambassage ministerie god onely moreouer declare howe god opened dore fayth vnto gentyles dore opened vnto fayth effectuall operation holy spirite ioyned vnto outwarde preaching whereby mindes men illuminated drawne vnto obedience fayth worke god iohn christ testifyeth saying man commeth vnto except father draweth taught therefore example apostle attribute nothing owne industrie wisedome deede v required faithfull diligent howbeit successe doings must committed vnto god must prayse glorye well doings referred vnto also doctrine onely minister worde remember also magistrate housholders maryed folke seruauntes conclude state degree men haue oftentimes declared repo e themselfe th ir traue le daugerslast sayde tarrie good space antioche ende doubtlesse recreate themselues honest godly quietnesse hauing bene wearied long whyle many labour daungers lande sea meete conuenient reape fruite labour whose fayth diligence bene many way tried christ bade apostle returned preaching gospell marc go aside waye season repose themselues little let man yet thinke apostle sate still antioche ydely gasing vpon others without doubt faithfully taught brother tooke paine helping minister certaine time surceased traueyling taking anye enterprise daunger hande god father mercie graunt nowe dayes glory gospell may fynishe course lyfe like diligence successe apostle heauenly chanaan may enioy perpetuall rest peace iesus christ sauiour whome praise honor power glory euer amen xv chapiter vpon actes apostle cj homelie certayne men came downe taught brother except circumcised maner moses cannot saued rysen discention disputing little vnto paule barnabas certayne go vp ierusalem vnto apostle elder question brought way congregation passed ouer phoenices samaria declaring conuersion gentyles brought great ioy vnto brother come ierusalem receyued congregation apostle elder declared thing god done former part treatise workethe doctrine apostle ons intesti e diuision schisme luke hath declared howe primitiue church gathered togither iewes gentile preaching apostle howe wonderfull assistaunce god preserued amonge contynuall stormes blastes persecution herevnto added newe hystorie thys chappiter teacheth v howe lorde preserued church agaynst false brother teacher least myghte lose eyther simplicitie doctrine puritie faith hytherto fourteene yeares togyther paule preached gospell according common consent apostle doctrine taught saluation christ iesus onelye doctrine euerywhere receyued certayne iewes specially phariseys secte professed fayth christ began withstande albeit confessed christ yet would needes haue circumcision ceremony lawes ioyned opinion while paule earnestly resisted caused great adooe contention insomuch horribly shooke whole church sauiour christ forsooke stro e glory merite whose prouidence came passe plaine simple doctrine christ defended confyrmed publike testimonie apostle whole church consyderation thys hystorie serueth much instruct comfort congregation example apostle taught waye resist false doctrine learne doctrine truth standeth fyrme sure inuasions wherefore order consider partes present place author discentionfirst luke telleth author strife discention euen certaine person came iurie ierusalem therfore must needes great authoritie considering ierusalem mother church worthily esteemed menne bicause thence gospell saluation fyrst issue spring cause paule also commendeth saying meete gentyles shoulde minister corporall thinges vnto ierusalem rom giuen spirituall eternall giftes saluation doubt deceyuers seducer marueylously bragge name authoritie apostle make lyght paules name saye deserued counted among apostle bicause bene conuersant iesus christ whyle liued maye gather paules epistle enforced earnestlye defende authoritie apostleship furthermore maye see howe deceyuers breede euen church neuer true member church deede church vse continue same1 iohn math actes therefore christ sayth go sheepes clothing paule another place sayth among selues shall ryse grieuous wolues c woonderfull craft satan knowing men doe hate abhorre vseth counterfeyte aungell light vnder cloke holynesse1 cor beguyle deceyue simple place serueth confute constantly beleeue romane church cannot erre deceyued affirme whatsoeuer commeth thence ought receyued oracle yet ierusalem apostle discharged office dutie diligence came hypocrite deceyuers therefore shall hope handes amongst whome many hundred yeres hath bene seene token eyther apostolike lyfe doctrine state controuersie discentionfurthermore state controuersie deceyuers helde expressed called backe gentyles vnto circumcision ceremony lawe saying except circumcised cannot bee saued saying like confyrmed many article lawe god gene ordeyned circumcision perpetuall signe couenant amongst israelite also example church ierusalem apostle yeelded farre weakenesse iewes circumcised infantes moreouer circumcision bounde obserue lawe according saying paule testifye euery man circumcised galat hee bounde keepe whole lawe taken awaye cryed sayde whole lawe abrogated gate opened vnto wickednesse yet confessed christ notwithstanding woulde seeme follower gospell like goodlye blender compounders thought lawe might mingled gospell righteousnesse workes fayth therefore whole state controuersie whether men iustified grace god fayth onely christ whether righteousnesse lawe necessarye vnto saluation man weygh expende matter well shall appeare verye controuersie betweene v papistes nowe dayes professe christ also yet affirme men iustifyed saued merites good deedes sauing poynt papist case weaker worse grounde vppon lawe moses giuen god vppon mannes tradition esay long sithence haue bene condemned sentence god worship vaine teaching doctrine men therfore necessary v vnderstand controuersie math place due vnto workes god lawe v glory iustifyed doubtlesse miserable blinde dare chalenge praise vnto colde obseruances mannes tradition meane season mannes peruersenesse bewrayeth itselfe place god offreth saluation vnto v freely contemneth seeketh rather sumptuous laborious way attayning therevnto example peruersitie appeare age lorde complayneth hereof esay saying wherefore laye money vppon thing feedeth spende labour thing satisfieth againe people hath committed two euils ierem haue forsaken well water life digged pit yea vile broken pit holde water would god occasion make like complaint euerywhere day thirdly followeth effect false doctrinethe successe therof iewish christian brought sedition open schisme luke sayth church antioch hitherto bene moste quiet common sanctuarie godly disturbed therefore fall simple doctrine truth bring new false opinion church disturber church name doth paule sette fellowes saying marueyle soone turned christ called grace vnto another gospell galat yet none trouble place calleth dogges euill worker concision philip verye enimies crosse christ know charged papist dayes haue disturbed disturbe church truth apostle doctrine well marked shal appeere cleere crime puritie doctrine bicause endeuour restore maketh v deede disturbe ydlenesse vnder false pretence christ church delight disporte themselues felles fleshe miserable sheepe furthermore chiefe vse place offended discentions rising dayes reason religion therefore thinke doctrine fayth religion doubtfull vncertayne euident doctrine truth hath age bene diuersly assaulted therefore diuers discentio haue risen meanes thereof god suffereth come passe iust iudgement weale saluation fyrst according saying paule cor must needes bee sectes perfite may knowne agayne occasion commeth passe chiefe article fayth saluation diligently earnestly examined vnlesse thus called question woulde part lye vnconsidered buryed god moderate mischiefes serue vnto saluation loue god thing worketh best may see thys present controuersie cleere daye hereby came passe meane iustifycation intreated discussed diligently apostle ceremony lawe lesse regarded among iewes wherein yet great many put much trust euen age sacrifyce masse way ouerthrowne controuersie fell supper lorde therfore clamour pieuishe absurde complaine saye reason discentions religion doubtfull vncertaine vnder colour go hyde cloake prophane hollowe heartes paule barnabas stowtely resistfurthermore let v consider paule barnabas faithfull antioch disceptation paule barnabas sayd much contention daylie disputation disturber therefore dumbe dogges woulde suffer kindes doctrine creepe church rather earnestly withstoode deceyuers true faith ouerturned gloses yet otherwheres paule becommeth thing men earnestly commaundeth strong faith pacientlye beare weaker therefore sheweth himselfe place difficult vntreatable bicause matter importance coulde dissembled opinion righteousnesse fayth haue christ alone ouerturned circumcision make selfe bonde vnto law galat christ become vnprofitable iustified lawe fallen grace moreouer thys meanes christian libertie hazarde coulde purchased none pryce wyth bloude christ iustifyed fayth christ enfrauncised libertie child god subiect commaundement intollerable yoke lawe peter hereafter declare besyde true vse lawe peruerted galat bring men tutor gouernour vnto christ fellowes sent graffed christ vnto principle beginning lawe moreouer coulde chosen light gospell shoulde haue bene obscured darkened shadowes lawe therefore paule might case haue borne deceyuers vnlesse woulde haue bene counted vntrustye minister christ example taught must concorde vnities sake admit nothing may waye obscure glory christ simple confession fayth verye hurtfull concorde redeemed prophanation name christ denying fayth saying christ standeth fyrme strong loueth father mother math worthy againe whosoeuer shall bee ashamed mee adulterous naughty worlde ashamed marc come glorye father furthermore let v hereof perswaded christian menne haue peace without christ true christian iohn world shall haue affliction christ onely peace howbeit antioch beleeuedthe congrega ion antioch referre controuersie iudgement apostle perceyued contention euery day kindle decree length one consent paule barnabas certaine disciple shoulde go ierusalem propounde question vnto apostle elder discussed paule easily yeeldeth vnto decree meaning put cause truth iudgement manne well knewe deceyuers abused name apostle therefore commoditie vnlearned simple people whose eye dazeled brightnesse apostolike authoritie easily admitted counsaile commodious readyest waye coulde deuisedthe cause conuocations sinodes counsayles primitiue church hath bene chiefe cause sinodes counsayles heretofore haue bene gathered godlye kinges bishop neuer minde holy men cause fayth saluation shoulde subiection mannes iudgement heretikes vsed impudently vaunt consent apostolike doctrine vniuersall church vnto vnlearned people catholikes thought good commodiously bridle synodes publike testimonie church thende shoulde afterwarde beleeued haue diligently consider modestie paule vseth manifest end ed constancie woulde haue yeelded vnto apostle woulde haue pronounced thing truth durst boldly reprehende peter antioch teacheth v ought beleeue aungell galat woulde preach gospell yet despiseth meane deuise peace vttred godly brother whereas sawe glorye god coulde thereby way obscured quiete weaker sorte might thereby procured modestie must ioyned constancie least whyle seeme constant founde obstinate wayward spirit christ tractable maketh men vse counsayler desirous glory meane season leuitie allowed seeme tractable easie intreated obedient counsayles see doe quite deface ouerthrow veritie faith glorye christ furthermore place teacheth v best waye calme controuersies contention rise fayth religion thinke matter might taken vp ended mannes wisedome pollicie eche part woulde somewhat yeelde one another though men might daily religion god cause worldly affaire rather doe resort vnto apostle heare haue taught appoynted whose doctrine manifestly confyrmed testimonie christ himselfe luke vnto sayd heareth heareth c know christ prayed beleeue iohn according preaching moreouer openly endued ye holy spirit shewed manifest argument presence operation wherefore must earnestlye take heede swarue one nayles breadth doctrine apostle iohn teacheth v fyrst epistle seconde chapter sayeth lette remayne hearde beginning hearde beginning shall remaine also shall continue father sonne paule also aduertiseth v presume peruert truth sayth continue thou thing thou hast learned also committed vnto thee knowing whome thou hast learned tim forasmuch thou hast child knowne holy scripture able make thee learned vnto saluation fayth christ iesu therefore fowlye deceyued example obtrude vnto v counsayles though religion ought ruled euident many yeres haue bene haue signe token apostolike spirite woulde heare prophetes apostle would according example paule barnabas willingly go vp vnto apostle heare spirite god speaketh harken vnto men farewell seeing haue none maister harken vnto iesus christ paule barnabas iourney ierusalem luke also descrybeth paules going ierusalem bicause diuers thing therein worthy considered amongst fyrst howe paule barnabas brought waye congregation appointed worthy faythfull companion iourney wyth whereby appeareth congregation tooke part suspition doctrine beliefe let congregation follow thys ensample leaue faythfull minister christ destitute helpe else doe susteyne open warre church quarrell behoofe surely ingratitude execrable prouyde stande gunneshot trouble arise religion stande ydely gasing though matter pertayned nothing vnto onely vnto minister also ende iourney vnprofytable time voyage lost preach euerywhere conuersion gentyles chiefe cause contention bicause many tooke euill parte vncircumcised gentyles receyued felowship christ church godly men vnderstoode workes god serued setting forth christes glorye must dissembled bicause men wrong iudgement nay must rather wrastle waywardnesse worlde least thereby god glorie might impayred christ sometime sayde vnto priestes offended childrens showting holde peace stone shall crye let v thinke spoken euen v although prouyding slouthfulnesse dare doe nothing glorie god yet god easily fynde faythfull defender shall made vessel wrath ignominie would instrument grace glorie thirdly brother reioyce conuersion gentile neyther enuie fellowship saluation neyther paule barnabas singuler commendation ministerie propertie godly reioyce setting forth christes glorie saluation others fourthly come ierusalem receyued apostle whole congregation singuler instrumentes christ becommeth v reuerence giftes god whose ministery god vseth profyte praise agayne declare god done bicause made much purpose aduersaries going peeuishe opinion ouerthrowe vocation gentyles god graunt dayes also contention calmed layde downe maye giue apostle doctrine heartes vnitie fayth bonde true loue may strongly knyt togyther iesus christ onely sauiour whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cij homelie rose vp certayne sect phariseys beleeue saying needefull circumcise commaunde keepe lawe moses apostle elder came togyther reason matter much disputing peter rose vp sayde vnto yee men brother knowe howe good whyle ago god choose amonge v gentyles mouth heare worde gospell beleeue cod knoweth harte bare witnesse gaue vnto holy ghost euen vnto v put difference betweene v seeing fayth purified harte nowe therefore tempt god put disciple neckes yoke neyther father wee able beare beleeue grare lorde iesus christ shall saued doe multitude appeased gaue audience barnabas paule told signes wonder god shewed among gentyles doctrine gospell spreade ministerie paule barnabas among gentile taken communion christ church grieuous contention fell among fayth bicause dyuers saide gentile ought circumcised inforced obserue lawe moses thing others agayne dyd constauntly denie luke instinct holy ghost descrybeth controuersie verie dyligently bicause serueth much instruction men teacheth v must take anye insolent straunge thing though nowe dayes also controuersies rise among professours one fayth doctrine much god suffereth controuersies come passe without vtilitie auayle men agayne sheweth v haue doe case must according ensample paule barnabas stowtely defende truth men harken iudgements men aske counsell apostle iesus christ whome hath appoynted teacher worde controuersie iustifycation apostlesbut luke holding hystorie begonne sayth greater contention fell hereabout matter proposed vnto apostle elder ierusalem author hereof phariseys beleeued christ yet retayning smatche olde leauen strengthly vrged fulfylling righteousnesse lawe appeareth storie gospell phariseys set iustification outwarde exercise workes lawe wherfore could chosen obstinate keeping whereof haue example monkes day whome harde matter drawe olde secte token thereof still remayne worthy diligently obserued chiefe article christian religion canuassed contention hearing godlye apostle whether parte helde truest opinion coulde fyrst perceyued hereby taught must marueyle although excellentest heades wyttes worlde sometime deceyued else stiffely stande defence receyued errours meane god sheweth v howe marke corruption nature humbled consideration therof stande much owne conceyte peter iudgement concerning iustification howbeit peter vntill tyme helde peace contention ende woulde seeme arrogant prescribing others bicause expedient euery man saye minde perceyued contender mind waxed hotter hotter standeth vp modestly grauely authoritie moderate matter plainely defendeth opion paule barnabas taught meane man saluation consisted onely faith iesus christ obseruation ceremonial needed yea praise glory iustification ascribed vnto lawe saying dependeth vpon two poyntes whereof one sheweth god appointeth none waye saluation obserued prescribed gospell namely fayth iesus christ declareth verie heynous matter anye man affirme fulfylling lawe necessarie saluation eche shall order intreate god iustifyeth fauour grace faith christthe fyrst poynt taken example god iustifyed fyrst fruites beleeuing gentile none otherwise fayth iesus christ place must vnderstanded concerning hystory cornelius centurion peter alleageth verie good purpose bicause bene called question argued among faythfull sawe eleuenth chapter summe argument god called adopted cornelius family gentilitie vnto christ societie churche example set forth vnto v true perfyte meane way attayning vnto saluation requyred nothing else heare gospell beleeue ergo two thinges sufficient man iustifyed attaine vnto saluation say heare gospell true fayth imbrace christ preached peter gathereth strongly perticulers vniuersall doctrine bicause god vseth one certaine inuiolable rule sauing men lyke god would neglect rule sauing prophane souldyour confyrmed bloude sonne argument might beare weight calleth wytnesses thing know sayth good whyle ago beginning church god dyd choose appoint amongst v gentyles mouth heare worde gospell beleeue upon wordes might haue inferred doe requyre circumcision fulfylling law ouer beside thing seeme god sufficient whence haue authoritie alter order appoynted god bolde adde take anye thing leaueth gather yet ioyneth two thing hereto whereby openeth example fyrst god sayth knoweth harte deceyued outwarde appearaunce hath aboundantly prooued waye haue nowe tolde sufficient euen owne testimonie assoone men beleeued gospell preached sent vnto holy ghost well vnto v spirite since world prophane men euen christ owne testimonie receyue appeareth euidently god acknowledged men member church coinheritours christ although neyther circumcised receyued ceremonie lawe pointing hys fynger maner iustifycation god sayth put difference betweene v seing fayth purifyed harte deede iewes deuided gentile lawe christ hath broken downe particion lawe two people hath made one church hath purifyed gentile well iewes fayth hereto appertayneth place paule ehesi rom wordes wryteth romanes cap holde therefore man iustified fayth without workes lawe god iewes onely also god gentile yes euen gentile also god onely iustifyeth circumcision fayth vncircumcision thorow fayth furthermorethe waye iustifyed peter one briefe sentence comprehendeth whatsoeuer may sayde iustifycation fyrst confesseth harte haue neede purifyed man therefore must needes thing altogither polluted bicause hart fountaine spring doings god himselfe beareth wytnesse hereof sayth inuentions deuises man naught euen childhood gene one thing aboundantly sufficient ouerthrowe righteousnesse workes oftentimes haue declared teacheth howe purifycation wrought fayth bicause taketh holde christ whome god hath ordeyned iustifyer cleanseth v sinnes1 iohn merite bloude communicateth vnto v righteousnesse reason fayth whereby grafte taken righteous sight god wherefore paule declareth made righteousnesse god1 cor cor againe besides onely mortifyeth reliques dregges fleshe while chaungeth regenerateth v worde spirite gyuing v power bring forth fruites aunswerable profession whervnto word referred cleane thorow word haue spoken abydeth iohn bringeth forth much fruit bicause haue felowship christ fayth scripture truly affirmeth purifyed iustifyed fayth phrase speech must taken though faith vertue ye merite wherof men clensed fro sinnes bicause therby take hold christ righteousnesse consisteth thirdly maketh god ye author purification therfore ye author faith ephes paule also testifyeth ye gift god iohn christ sayth none commeth vnto father draweth naturall man perceyueth mystery spirite selues able thinke well must needes illuminated drawne god fayth may take place v glory iustification must returne vnto god nothing must lefte man power merite sawe dauid long ago called vpon god forgiuen sinnes saying washe throughly wickednesse clense sinne purge isope shall cleane psal washe shall whyter snowe delyuer bloudguyltinesse god thou art god saluation hereby maye receyue great comfort strengthen faith temptation iustifycation saluation dependeth vpon god must needes certaine infallible hereof proceede saying paule shall lay thing charge god chosen rom god iustifyeth condemne certainetie doctrine among people god age math phariseys also could plainely confesse god onely power forgiue sinnes therefore doe without cause nowe dayes bewayle folly pryde men attribute glorie eyther owne workes else arrogant impudent hypocrite howe grieuously men offende peter sheweth second part oration shal consider attribute righteousnes work lawe heynous offence nowe therefore sayth tempt god put vppon disciple neckes yoke neyther father able beare teacheth weightye wordes saluation ouerthrowne intollerable yoke cannot layde vpon disciple neckes without marueylous offence driuen seeke saluation obseruing lawe opinion doctrine sayth god tempted tempt without commaundement eyther go themselues exact others doe power also taught god anye meanes hath appointed israelite tempted god infynite benefytes psal num sayde woulde acknowledge goodnesse omnipotencie coulde giue fleshe eate wildernesse christ shoulde haue tempted god followed deuils counsayle haue cast himselfe downe headlong pinnacle temple haue prooued truth god promise toward thinges manifest doe iustifyed workes lawe thing farre passe strength man without calling god worde themselues enterprise doe also exact impossible man fulfyll law reach heauen fynger lawe spirituall requyreth onely outward workes also minde power man obey god carnall solde vnder sinne rom euen saint remaine dreg flesh law sinne bringeth v thrall sinne euen spirit god paule confesseth himselfe chapter last rehearsed moreouer law threatneth sentence malediction death vnto many fulfyl commaundements therof else doe tempt god deut iustifyed lawe bicause neglect meane saluation god offreth christ deuyse newe meane attayne vnto grace god tempt two wayes enforce men also vnto way lay yoke vpon ye holy father time past able beare thus vsed saye thou lord wilt marke narrowly done amisse shall able abyde enter iudgement thy seruant psa righteousnesse like patched garment esay like cloth arayed woman monethly disease marke therefore iust occasion haue contende men nowe dayes woulde haue people iustifyed workes like phariseys contemning righteousnesse god giueth v christ go set vp owne let man replye ergo lawe giuen v vaine ergo boldly doe listthe vse lawe true vse lawe remayneth still like tutor leadeth v vnto christ sheweth v rule howe liue godly neither must renounce good workes although attribute glory iustifycation vnto although iustifycation belongeth vnto god yet euident dutie whome god iustifyeth continually keepe innocencie puritie lyfe giuen christ much rom touching poynt paule hath diuers consideration spoken grieuously yt peter sayth agaynst woulde seeme striue glory god good work duty christian lyfe sayeth tempt god heynous offence scripture worthye pardon put yoke vpon mennes neckes bring thraldome againe redeemed bloude christ therefore commit sacriledge christ aduersaries nowe dayes woulde expende thing shoulde easily perceyue cause rayle fare fowle v woulde rather acknowledge fault treade vnder foote grace god merite christ fylthie hypocrisie waywardly doe furthermorethe faith father olde testament newe one least peter might seeme ouerboldlye condemne father saying able fulfyll lawe conclusion bringeth meane whereby saued saying wee beleeue grace lorde iesus christ shall saued doe beleeue thus encourageth weake whome seemed harde matter forsake religion wherein beleeued forefather pleased god saued though shoulde say fowlye deceyued thinke predecessor iustifyed saued workes lawe seeing haue plainely confessed neuer fulfylled lawe woulde knowe waye saued shewe none day preached v christ whome knowe come wayted come hoped none sauiour therefore one maner fayth olde new testament one way saluation christ testifyeth speaking abraham sayth abraham sawe daye iohn reioyced therein paule sayeth father eate spirituall meate eate confesseth drewe saluation rocke christ1 cor conclude maketh communion betweene v father one applieth sacrament vnto v otherwhile vnto therefore greatly deceyued saye olde testament belongeth vnto v saye iewes whose behoofe written rather doe thinke iewes people god whome god saued none waye time passed saued adayes againe peter briefely toucheth meane saluation foundation thereof layeth grace god worde alone righteousnesse merite workes excluded bicause contrary one saluation come grace paule sayth workes grace shoulde grace workes shoulde merite saued workes grace worke loseth name merite assoone grace entreth see romaine xj chap place abundantly teacheth v grace god merites workes cannot stande togither againe sayth iesus christ mediator grace math whome taught oracle heauen god reconciled vnto v last sayth take holde grace faith beleeue sayeth saued grace lorde iesus christ therefore meane saluation may comprehended fewe plaine wordes saye saued fayth grace god iesus christ summe doctrine aswell prophetes apostle president counsell assembled holy ghostnowe peter ended saying multitude appeased silence testifyed consent maye gathered euident argument gathered togither holye ghost spirite truth whosoeuer breatheth cannot choose yeelde vnto truth must neuer beleeue counsayles gouerned guiding mennes eares stopped vp hearing truth vse libertie speach ye see bishoppes rome nowe many hundreth yeares haue summoned kept haue ratifyed opinion cleane false vngodly man coulde without manifest daunger life speake decree howbeit paule barnabas take occasion peter wordes declare myracles woonders god wrought amongst gentyles confyrmation ministerye hereby might euidently appeare god made difference betwene iewes gentyles seeing would haue myracles wrought amongst gentyles vsed shewed among iewes thus see ende ofall myracles confyrme apostle doctrine whereof haue oftentimes spoken heretofore shall duty attent minde fyrme fayth embrace way saluation peter hath declared shall come passe also purifyed made cleane grace shall attaine inheritance heauen christ lorde whome prayse honor power glory euer amen ciij homelie helde peace iames aunswered saying men brother harcken vnto simeon tolde howe god beginning visite gentyles receyue people name agree wordes prophete written returne builde agayne tabernacle dauid fallen downe fallen decaye builde againe set vp residue men may seeke lorde also gentyles vppon whome name named sayeth lorde doth thinges knowne vnto god workes beginninge worlde wherefore sentence trouble among gentyles turned vnto god wryte vnto abstaine themselues fylthinesse image fornication strangled bloude moses olde time hath euery citie preach synagoges read euery sabboth daye euangelist luke hath diligently described controuersie came passe primitiue church matter iustifycation description haue seene peter iudgement hath taught v faith onely sufficient iustify gentile burthened yoke law bicause many menne mooued example father supposing iustified law answereth obiection shewing coulde iustifyed none waye grace god author mediator whereof sauiour iesus christ bicause haue intreated hereof sermon gone let v see iames apostle sonne alpheus paule speaketh galat sayth whose wordes consist two member partes fyrst subscribeth vnto peter declareth counsell howe peace true concord might made conserued betweene iewes gentyles come vnto iames wordesthe order apostle counsayles must marke howe beganne speake afore sawe holde peace hereof man may gather order apostle counsayle howe thing modestie howe none would prescribe another example like sawe also diuers egerly contende peter helde peace saw time serued arose vp modestie grauitie beganne speake iudgement hearde others like pacience long hearde others done paule barnabas hearde without interruption bodye confyrmed peter sentence argument taken myracles also spoken minde iames steppeth forth almost last manne speaketh although accounted among pillers church modestie euident signe holy ghost gouerned mindes ouer great heate contention shoulde rise vncomelye tumulte trouble men shoulde stoppe eares truth order ought obserued publike actes affayres man shoulde ready speake heare shall say kynde men foolishe onely woulde seeme wyse thinke meete onely speake suppose haue great iniurie done vnto man dissent neuer little also vnprofytable pernicious let thing passe hearken vnto iames beginning oration1 iames subscribeth vnto peter iudgement yeeldeth vnto iudgement peter saying simeon tolde howe god beginning visite gentyles receyue people name iames acknowledgeth god counsayle purpose calling cornelius abundantly declare gentyles neede none preparation iustifyed saued faith christ therefore plainly subscribeth vnto peter opinionthe prophetes agreeable apostle least apostle might seeme opinion proueth vniforme consent prophetes although bring one testimony neither needefull bring forasmuch prophetes inspyred one selfe spirite agreed declaration mannes saluation worthy diligently marked howe apostle meere authoritie obtrude charge church nothing scripture prooue thing teach acknowledged themselues seruantes christ church therfore thought ought establishe nothing repugnant christ holy scripture modestie obserued woulde taken called successor day haue lesse superstition church godlynesse syncere religion place amoz ix chapconcerning oracle prophet ix chapiter amoz prophecyed destruction vnto iewes deserued bicause vnruly licentious lyuing bicause destruction iewes promise eternall kingdome messias might seeme quayle fall god comforteth agayne promysing restore tabernacle kingdome dauid agayne returne sayth buylde againe tabernacle dauid fallen downe fallen decay set vp againe without cause maketh mention tabernacle comprehendeth outwarde worship must abrogated abolished kingdome messias therfore seemeth iames maketh argument gentyles striuen withall ceremony obseruation lawe much long time prophecied moses discipline shoulde cease time messias also declared maner people church vnder christ among fyrst place gyuen remnaunt iewes euen vnto saued peculiar goodnesse god vniuersall destruction nation according saying esay tenth chapiter though people israell sande sea yet shall remnaunt saued vnto shall come nation shall called name god shall seeke lorde iewes word lye two argument first sayde kingdome messias iewes gentile shall one worthy next shall haue one office duetie shall dignitie worthynesse name god shall inuocated ouer much say shall called name god people god phrase speeche much vsed hebrues founde gene esay duetie people shall seeke lorde thing done outwarde ceremony obseruances lawe true fayth wordes prophete iames stronglye concludeth folly vnmeete ceremony lawes sake berealie gentyles glorie god long sithence vouchsafed giue moreouer singuler comfort falshood destruction man god promise nothing stopped hindered though beleeued shall vnbeliefe make promise god effect nay let god true euery man lyer whosoeuer taken people god place admonished duetie seeke lorde spirite infynite pear ing thing gouerning thing tyed anye certaine place maye sought founde fayth onely taketh holde whyle manifesteth himselfe vnto v worde least might seeme absurde straunge thing man gentyles thus sodainely matched iewes amoz maketh god author hereof iames expounding sayth knowne vnto god hys workes beginning though say cause eyther marueyle thing accuse god vnrighteousnesse although seeme vnto v absurde thinges yet god knoweth certainely reason doings neyther let v thinke god deceyued bicause long ago worlde created disposed ordered thing well eternall counsell hereof may gathered generall doctrine must call eternall purpose saluation man account reuerently kisse order righteousnesse wisedome goodnesse god rom see paule touching thys poynt rom chapter seconde part orationa deuyse make vnitie concorde betweene iewes gentyles iames vttereth counsell profytable necessarie sawe great enmitie betweene iewes gentyles whereof length lyke growe pernitious daungerous schisme church wherfore necessitie required deliberation taken speede procuring mainteyning concorde sheweth best done summe aduise libertie christian must kept safe inuiolable must tempered breake lycentiousnesse giue occasion offence unto fyrst poynt belongeth saying wherefore sentence wee trouble gentile turned vnto god meaning yoke lawe must layde vppon conscience charged obseruing therof thing necessarie vnto iustifycation forsaken superstitiousnesse gentilitie professed christ gentile thinke law abrogated though men libertie doe list thinketh good admonishe touching certaine pointes wherein gentile offended christian puritie holynesse also brotherly loue foure thing forbiddeth whereof two themselues vnlawfull two meane indifferent thing fyrst sort filthynesse image fornication hereof gentyles admonishedfylthynesse image fornication bicause fowly offended professed christ yet went ydols temple inuited bidden friend present gentile sacrifice eate thing offred vnto ydols briefe partaker sacrifyces easily appeareth fyrst epistle paule corinthian thought offended thus bicause knewe ydole nothing well instructed concerning fayth iames one worde preuenteth aunswereth reason aduiseth abstayne filthynesse image hereby teacheth v ydolatrie vnlawfull abhominable selfe man partaker thereof without manifest pollution vncleanesse saying seemeth tooke lawe god sayeth moses grauen ymages god shalt thou burne fyre couer golde syluer take vnto thee least thou snared therein abhomination lorde thy god deut bring therefore abhomination thine house least thou damned thing vtterly defie abhorre damned thing touching fornication licentiousnesse gentile therein vsed without check punishment knowne deserueth declared euerywhere extant hystories poetes wrytings example fylthie lust poet seeking great commendation wytte descrybing venerious actes person therefore needefull admonishe gentyles diligently thing hereof ought gathered generall perpetuall precept howe duetie christian people keepe themselues thing cleane vnspotted vnto god neyther must partaker straunge sacrifyces much god requyreth whole heart minde man deut saying paule well knowne partaker lordes table cor table deuilles agayne touching conuersation lyfe behooueth v also consecrate vnto god euident bodyes bloude christ dedicated temple holye ghost therefore god must glorifyed bodyes1 cor wherefore fylthie abhominable error say whoredome lawfull free christian men whereas paule would haue named among christian threateneth horrible vengeaunce god onely vnto adulterer ephe heb also vnto whoremonger second sort numbred strangled meates bloudestrangled bloude gen leuit would haue gentyles also absteyne although thys precept numbred among ceremony plainely abolished christ yet bicause olde lawe concerning appointed god vnto worlde floude thys thing daylie vsed among men weaker sorte among iewes coulde greatly offended seing gentile eate thing without difference therefore iames thinketh meete gentyles behalfe refraine lybertie charity sake absteyne thing themselues lawfull graunted god yet vsing inconsiderately vnwarily might offence vnto others apostle meaning rom appeareth wordes paule know fully certified lorde iesus nothing common selfe vnto iudgeth common common thy brother grieued thy meate walkest thou charitably destroy thy meate whome christ dyed cause treasure commoditie euill spoken kingdome god meate drinke righteousnesse peace ioye holye ghost c sayth also would neuer eate fleshe cor rather offende man therefore place maketh thinke may lawfully prescribe fasting dayes lyke authoritie apostle commaunding absteyne strangled bloude theyr reason one bicause vrge man tradition onely authoritie religion laye snare mennes conscience apostle thought meanes auoyded hereto also appertayneth reason iames bringeththe reading moses moses sayth hath olde time euery citie preach synagoges hee read euery sabboth daye wordes meaneth nothing else yet moses authoritie among iewes impossible sodainely pull ordinance therefore time sake charitie graunted vntill men conscience meane season libertie olde ceremony might honorably layde aside buried meane whyle haue consider auncient vsage age among people god lawe sacred scripture vsed reade holy dayes becommeth v therefore keepe vse diligently defende libertie hauing consideration charitie puritie life beware gyuing offence shall come passe selues shall saued shall also bring others vnto iesus christ whome praise honor power glory euer amen ciiij homelie pleased apostle elder whole congregation sende chosen men owne companye antioche paule barnabas sent iudas whose surname barsabas sylas chiefe men among brother gaue letter handes maner apostle elder brother sende greeting vnto brother gentyles antioche syria cilicia much haue hearde certaine departed v haue troubled wordes cumbred mindes saying must circumcised keepe lawe whome gaue commaundement seemed therefore vnto v good come togither one accorde sende chosen men vnto beloued barnabas paule men haue ieoparded liues name lorde iesus christ haue sent therefore iudas silas shall also tell thing mouth seemed good holye ghost v charge necessarie thinges saye yee abstayne thinges fered ymages bloud strangled fornication keepe selues shall doe well fare well bicause power gyuen vnto iesus christ god father therefore onely defende preserue kingdome also moderate gouerne thinges whatsoeuer satan worketh kingdome maketh serue setting forth satan could persecution open violence stop course gospell set vpon church sowing dissention among raysed grieuous contention iustifycation chiefe principall article christian religion ende purpose doctrine gospell might enuyed suspected preuayled little occasion truth knowne righteousnesse fayth valiauntly defended agaynst phariseys haue hytherto seene saying peter paule barnabas last iames saying wherevnto chiefely belongeth ioyfull victorious ende contention luke nowe describeth fyrst rehearsing consent agreement whole church next copie epistle sent synode shall speake order consent counsayle ierusalem first expresseth vniforme consent sayeth apostle elder whole congregation decreed messenger sent letter antioch great fyre fyrst kindled name prudently decreed present contention might hereby onely alayed occasion strife time come might preuented fyrst bicause whose mindes contention mooued might happen suspect paule barnabas credite dealing ioyne vnto messenger small dignitie estimation againe least silas iudas might seeme craft subtiltie wonne made paules side commende defende authoritie publike letter example taught prudence wisedome chiefely vsed publike affayres church least vnaduised rashnesse maye preiudice cause selfe otherwise good honest considered order primitiue church church woont vse publike affayres apostle deede elder rule ordering matter ouersight churche committed vnto yet tooke rule authoritie exclude shut people hearing thing appertayned indifferently vnto whole church againe people great consideration modestie whereby came passe euerye one gaue place vnto truth none prouoked eyther peruerse affection would vnaduisedly stirre make businesse nowe ambition prelate hath disturbed broken order contrary commaundement peter apostle haue chalenged vnto lordship ouer inheritance church christ congregation euery daye molested newe contention appeareth ende eyther error moste bitter debate let v see letter synode counsayle thing weight importance briefely plainely entreated truth easily perceyued voyde guile desireth fetch affectate ornament deckings epistle letter consisteth fower partes perspicuitie seuerally speake fyrst parte contayneth superscriptionthe superscription letter sent counsayle nameth author epistle whome written named man may perceyue nothing spoken arrogancie ambition yet order obserued wherof man must haue regard euery thing first apostle placed bicause christ appointed teacher whole worlde witness adourned dignitie called salte earth light worlde elder named whose office haue spoken already last beleeuers comprehended vnder name brother therefore letter written name whole synode congregation written vnto brother dwelt antioch syria cilicia amongest whome schisme trouble raysed malice craft deceyuers must marke calling one another brother appeareth moste auncient vsage euen time apostle two occasion name called brother bicause haue one father heauen hath prepared v one inheritaunce hys kingdome also iesus christ sonne god taketh v brother doth vouchsafe make v coinheritours therefore name serueth much mainteyning concorde among christian bringeth singular comfort kinde temptation impossible iesus christ shoulde neglect hath taken brother haue heyres kingdome woulde god woulde expende name dayes make odious difference nation though dutie christian charitie due vnto borne countrie yet apostle acknowledge assyrian cilicians people farre distaunt borne gentyles brother wickednesse therefore thinke christian menne whome christ taketh brother country sake straungers vnto v ephe ought inheritance earth greater inheritance heauen false apostle touchedin seconde part grauely controll deceyuers false apostle euen weyght cause daunger saluation procured deserued fyrst confesse went forth partaker laye stopple vaine vauntes bragging vsed saye came ierusalem learned doctrine apostle taught learning ierusalem therefore apostle denie went forth church yet therefore aduise euery man credite receyue teach commonly seene deceyuers come forth church haue elsewhere taught therefore vaine vanitie tytles succession whereby bishop rome defende dignitie dayes alleage authoritie church rome apostle predecessours sufficient ignorant fayth church paule worthily commended wee know also haue bene many bishop notable godlynesse faith learning whome diuers haue bene crowned martyrdome bishop dayes whose beliefe learning conuersation altogither different men defende themselues authoritie church followe step primitiue church done declare deceyuers haue troubled wordes cumbred mindes therefore disturber builder church paule well obserued wryting galathians marueyle soone turned vnto another gospell nothing else trouble againe woulde god seperated trouble galat wordes declared effect false doctrine man may espie ascribe vnto christ onely order praise saluation first trouble make hearer vncertaine saluation while ouerthrowe fayth cannot haue anye thinge stable certaine sticke workes lawe bicause lawe exacteth perfyte absolute obedience poyntes mannes power perfourme wherefore according saying paule soone saluation declared workes faith vaine promyse none effect rom false apostle doe onely trouble men waye also author schisme must needes ensue soone saluation attributed christ onely example haue church corinth paule complaineth haue bene deuided many diuers faction subtiltie offalse teacher thinges founde true ledde doctrine monkes light gospell appeared apostle adde notable sentence vnto description deceyuers whereby manifestly declare gaue false apostle thing commaundement therefore accuse lying therby likewise declare shall lyers age shall preache iustifycation workes vnder pretence name apostle lette therefore crye till horce againe legate sent pope side let pretende father counsayles let wrest scripture let glorie authoritie king prince shall sette counsayle authoritie apostle openly testifyeth apostle make nothing dare ouerthrowe righteousnesse faith attribute glory saluation way vnto workes naye referre saying paule vnto place doubted strike cursse galat aungell presuming preach gospell thirde member deuision paule barnabas commended greatly commende paule barnabas bicause knewe deceyuers greatly impugne authoritie also cause paule diuers time defended apostleship without suspect ambition epistle galathians corinthian declare therfore call beloued name accuse lying affirmed paule discented apostle ioyne herevnto praise greatest deuised say ieoperded liues name iesus christ example primitiue church teacheth name fame deserue well setting forth saluation men ought maintained defended iudged flatterie done modestly ende keepe authoritie vnblemished thus pleased christ adourne sonnes zebede worshipfull tytles long vertuous doings deserued paule sometime digresseth taketh occasion commende titus luke timothie epaphroditus like spurre forward also ministery might profytably proceede go forwarde obserued onely church also common weale bicause liuely couragious spirites waye effectually cheared take hande vertuous worthy exploytes prayse honor euerywhere example teach v common weales haue long flourished haue bene appoynted worthy rewardes commendation honor well deseruers furthermore place expressed true prayse minister verily necessitie requireth laye downe life testimonie name iesus christ deserueth called good souldiour redy hazard life comaundement captaine publike weale require faythfull minister christ ready forsake hath yea life glory christ thus doth christ euen equity right require v seeing fyrst vouchsafe laye downe life saluation mankinde yet thinges vnderstanded though none shoulde taken faythfull minister christ hath hazarded lyfe christ woulde haue v rashe prodigall liues rather commaundeth v vse prudence serpent shunning taking heede daungers many time appeareth daunger feare life yet meane time required prompt ready minde steppe backe perill life shoulde defende glorye christ promptnesse minde doth paule shewe admonished howe shoulde layde bondes confessed ready onely suffer bondes imprisonment also death name christ see actes xx xxj sayde minister worde vnderstanded also christian vniuersall rule commaundeth v confesse christ world teacheth fytte kingdome god looketh backe agayne luke hath sette hande vnto plough decree counsayle expoundedthe fourth part expoundeth decree synode peter iames saying repeated reconcyled place haue orderly consider three thing first alleage author decree namely holy ghost hath seemed good saye vnto holy ghost v ioyne themselues holye ghost meaning match authoritie woulde beleeued alone without consent spirite bicause christ made minister spirite thought good vtter oracle meaning also sayde luke heareth heareth despyseth despiseth despiseth mee despiseth sent mee therefore bicause apostle pronounced nothing holy ghost bade ioyne themselues none insolent sort modest conuenient grauitie vnto holye ghost least might seeme dissent thing write oracle holye ghost appeareth decree nothing repugnant vnto holy scripture president popishe counsayles may say decree confesse also gathered togither holy ghost thinges enact decree statute spirite oft shall put forth opinion varying fro scripture repugnant vnto oft denie ledde holy ghost bicause cannot disagree himselfe forasmuch spirite truth secondly declare seemeth good vnto holy ghost namely shoulde charge yoke burthen therefore whatsoeuer beside fayth iesus christ yoke burthen mennes conscience burthened vnprofytable obseruation traditio saluation repeate also iames prescribed touching eating thing offered idol touching whoredome strangled bloude saye necessary obserued noted sayd last homelie touching difference commaundementes two fyrst simplye plainely necessarye bicause becommeth christian men abhorre kinde ydolatrie keepe vessell body holye vnspotted make member harlot christ bloude hath consecrated temple holy ghost concerning decree strangled bloude necessary per accidens say reason another thing saye bicause offence weake brother might take eating thereof heynous matter destroye thy eating christ hath vouchsafed red eme merit bloude must necessitie abstaine thing weakes sake otherwise themselues graunted lawfull least libertie may giue vnto occasion destruction otherwise saying christ standeth full force strength math nothing goeth mouth defyle man paule permitteth men eate thinges offered idol daunger offence1 cor sayth conscience whit polluted thereby another place calleth doctrine deuils difference meate appoynted1 tim wherein saluation sayde consist therfore foolishly abuse place saye decree counsaylers necessary obserued whereas diuers serue onely yoke mennes conscience manifestly repugne euident oracle scripture meane season christian libertie must ouerthrowne sake rather obstinate weake forsake conceyued error meanes cleaue defence whome christ saying must rather vsed suffer math blinde leader blinde finally declare vtilitie profyte hereof saying thing keepe selues shall doe well shall keepe selues cleane vndefyled offende man must marke wherevnto doings must leuelled christ onely fayth must seeke iustifycation saluation meane season let v keepe selues contamination idolatrie vncleannesse endeuour much v lyeth bring men saluation let v giue offence vnto whome christ hath vouchsafed die thing whosoeuer obserue cannot deceyued erre hauing prosperously ended course lyfe shall obtayne fellowship eternall life iesus christ lorde whome blessing honor power glory euer amen cv homelie therfore departed came antioch gathered multitude togither deliuered pistle read reioyced consolation iudas silas prophetes exhorted brother much preaching strengthned taryed space let go peace brother vnto apostle notwithstanding pleased silas abide still paule barnabas taryed still antioch teaching preaching worde lorde many certaine space
