declareth much disturbed reason discention godly men much grieued article christian fayth contended vpon great offence againe another cause griefe sawe apostle paule barnabas vnworthilye defamed church sort priuilye accused therefore cannot choose greatlye reioyce heare peace restored teacher quitte slaunder church confyrmed testimonie apostle disposition ought faythfull christian vnto whome farre vnlike delighted contention ignominie contempt minister disturbance congregation industrie la paule barnabas setting forth ye kingdome christsecondly luke describeth trusty care industrie person setting forth mainteyning christes kingdome maye perceyued many euident argumentes concerning silas sayde licence returne home againe yet chose rather remaine antioch doubtlesse perceyued traueyle whereof sawe good successe followed yet needefull church therefore silas regarde church christ owne matter considering preferreth antioche citie ierusalem owne proper habitation example becommeth minister christ imitate maye forsake themselues earthly thing thende traueyle easily ministerie christ church therefore couetousnesse execrable appoynted ministerie church preferre priuate doings saluation men lucre sake leaue congregation among whome might great vtilitie doe good seruice paule barnabas somewhat also sayde namely howe abidden certaine season antioch preached gospel many fellow minister therefore gaue themselues vnto lurdenly ydlenesse although might seeme manye daungers traueyles haue iust occasion haue sought rest quiet sayde many church antioch preached gospell may easily gathered myldenesse mindes among voyde enuie seeking nothing glory christ saluation many exercise apostle worthy considered see chiefely intended preaching gospell knewe message saluation knewe weapon nation subdued vnto christ worlde brought vnto obedience fayth knew fynally sauiour christ chiefely busied one thing nothing oftentimes ignorant olde fygure god commaunded priestes vesture shoulde hoong belle thereby teaching sounde voyce exod doctrine gospell chiefly required minister adayes come passe bishop abhorre nothing much ministerye worde thinking commendable feede houndes great horse sluggishe seruile sort courtlings reuenues church feede christes sheepe foode heauenly doctrine example bring worde god contempt state menne chiefe cause calamity dayes also added argument paules doctrine namely howe carefull also church consulting barnabas touching visitation well vnderstoode sufficient plant church also howe necessary visite looke vnto bicause beside naturall leuitie example man woulde compare wholye giuen disturbe ouerthrowe church stablished fayth diligence others shoulde easily appeare spirite ledde prince minister thirdly declared greieuous infortunate discorde betweene paule barnabas discention betweene paule barnabas many cause notable hearde thirtenth chapter howe two made fellowes coparteners holy ghost suffred many peril togither lande sea laboured togither cause contention one iohn marke whose defection falling awaye hath bene spoken xiij chapter barnabas thought good haue taken agayne grace fellowship ministerie doubt alleaged weyghty christes saying luke man layeth hande plough looketh backe meete kingdome god consider circumstance shall seeme paule holpen consent approbation church choosing vnto silas commended brother vnto grace euerye poynt seeme excused yet woulde holy ghost haue example remayne president runnagates forsakers profession whereby might learne sinner haue accesse vnto grace god yet must soone admitted ministerye church haue bene author grieuous offence whose credite reason offence committed without cause suspected bishop must blamelesse paule forbiddeth yong schollers chiefely kept ministery bicause daunger backbiting slaundering nowe adayes bicause soone intreated admitting euerye one marueyle though authoritie ministerie growe much contempt moreouer maye seeme anye man marueylous god woulde suffer chosen vessel grace intangled implacable hatred holye ghost woulde haue errours recorded wryting sake shoulde come shall deepely ponder thing shall appeare diuers iust weightye cause fyrst thing teache v euen holyest men also subiect perturbation minde therefore haue neede grace god paule acknowledgeth writeth felte pricke fleshe messenger satan sent agaynst none wayes resist also description timothie teacheth v maner men ought chosen ministerie god word church behooueth greatest care religion least eyther vtterly deuoyde fayth else yong scholers nouices chosen ministerie last sort commonlye vncertaine stande doubt thing lyght inconstaunt vse religion lucre also laughe sleeue cause menne deryde must respect learning maye haue gouerne church well exercised holy scripture wherin paule testifyeth2 tim timothie brought vp chylde deede impossible teach whose selfe hath learned none blind leader blinde christ calleth math doctrine church must taken holy scripture behooueth minister church shoulde moste exercised account made though neuer expert prompt philosophye rude ignoraunt holy scripture cause christ woulde suffer apostle go abroade preach well instructed thirdly behooueth haue testimonie approoued lyfe conuersation least doctrine contemned least suspected sake therfore paule haue bishop irreprehensible1 tim much religion doctrine defaced dishonest lyfe minister example sonnes elye doth abundantlye declare whose concupiscence sacrilegious boldenesse came passe people part refrayned worshipping god occasion wickednesse preuayled among sortes men coulde redressed publike calamitie much bloudshedding therefore paules prudencie diligence must followed dayes woulde take vnto hym companion ministerie one perfyte poynts confyrmed hope conceyued seemed woulde neuer breake timothie circumcisedsecondly let v fyrst consider paule newe partner fellowe sayth bicause paule ment haue wyth iourney tooke circumcised sayest thou heare lyghtnesse inconstancie long paule earnestly bent himselfe agaynst exacted circumcision gentyles disturbance grewe herevpon matter harde bee taken vp quieted apostle whole congregation ierusalem apostle decreed gentyles burthened circumcision paule circumciseth timothie bene chrystian good whyle herein nothyng done lyghtnesse frowardnesse bicause paule hath great reason neyther doth varye himselfe well consider matter well done paule wythstande phariseyes nazareanes vrged circumcision necessarye thing forasmuch opinion christes merite defaced extenuated fayth hym lyght set christian libertie ouerthrowne subuerted bicause men woulde circumcise titus perceyued craftily laide snare libertie faythfull galat circumciseth timothie bicause great number iewes dwelt party occasion timothie might haue accesse entry preach gospell among well knowne howe greatly iewes abhorred vncircumcysed gentyles insomuch openly accused peter conuersaunt wyth afterwarde layde handes paule seditious person bringing gentyles temple unlesse therefore circumcised timothie shoulde neuer haue accesse haue taught among iewes woulde afterward also haue stopped eares paule transgressor law auncient religion therefore prudentlye yeeldeth thus farre vnto infyrmitie circumciseth timothie thintent ministerie myght make waye iewes teache little little howe circumcision ceremonyes christ abrogated ment none wayes circumcise timothie apostle synode forbade eating strangled bloude confesseth became iewe vnto iewes wynne iewes vnto christ1 cor confyrme superstitious obseruation lawe may gathered vniuersall rule whereby taught howe sorte lawfull dispence outwarde thinges namely charitie edifycation church requireth assoone perceyue bynd worship vnto erecte confydence mannes merite craftily go entrappe christian libertie must admit suffer least thing might taken meane indifferent soone profession fayth glory christes merite hazarde therfore papistes doe foolishly impudentlye alleage example paule tradition whyles reason paule circumcised timothie saye ought retayne keepe mass image pompous diriges prayer beade fasting difference meates garment single life monkishe vowes auricular confession absolution satisfaction sixe hundreth lyke omytte howe compare pieuishe superstitious deuyses mannes inuentions wyth circumcision whych hys beginning god barber bleare eyed say know howe set chiefe part god worship thinges howe repose greatest truste righteousnesse saluation conclude christian libertye cannot mayntayned retayned yea thyngs conteyne notable marke beast man receyue keepe wythout denying christ wherfore becommeth christian men rather impugne thinges neuer little violate profession christes name passe place timothie borne parentes thone iewe thother gentyle haue consider mariage timothy parent forasmuch luke maketh expresse mention thereof sayth eunica mother iewe father greeke gentyle yet reade iewes forbiden marrye gentyles yet state people iewes day oppressed vnder tiranny romanes dispersed driuen suffer many thing agaynst wyll meane season godly woman eunica reason mariage daunger god foreshewed lawe able circumcision take hir sonne timothie societie god people doctrine true godlynesse trayne vnto god whose honor seeke heart shall fynde true promise sayeth protector defender let v come treatie present placethe doctrine paule companion vocation timothie fayth hope winning meane season beware mennes conscience snarled charged burthen intollerable thing luke sayth paule euerywhere inculcate represse iewes importunately vrged gentyles obseruing lawe brydle licentiousnesse gentyles abused christian libertie great offence chiefly desired peace might flouryshe church whereby knewe shoulde chiefly increase agayne daunger offence constantlye defended libertie christ bicause woulde preiudice thing apostle wynked weakes sake fyrst epistle corinthian teacheth maketh eating thynges offered idolles free1 cor touching conscience none present offended therewith meane season paules example teacheth v sufficient haue good lawes made vnlesse haue charge thereof see put execution dayly experience teacheth v execution lyfe sinewes lawe take awaye lawe shall lye deade anacharsis sayde shall become lyke vnto spyders webbes euerye bolde presumptuous bodye sticke breake therefore let minister church gouernors common weale imitate paule meane doe duetie rather vayne counterfeyting mocke god man profyte apostle labourlast luke addeth notable successe godly endeuour labour sayth church confyrmed fayth grewe increased euery day number bicause maketh mention fayth euident paule chieflye beate heades vayne colde ceremony tradition continuall effectes worde god lyke vnto showre neuer returneth wythout fruite vnto sent also weapon wherby kingdome christ world prosperously enlarged saye diligent preaching worde feruent desire conserue keepe whensoeuer cease fayth falleth loue true religion dyeth haue example hereof euerywhere whereby conuinced thinke sufficient constrayned tyrannie partaker wicked sacrifyces yet meane season liue place worde god banished duty christian religion exercised let v therefore studye set forth worde god selues maye confyrmed fayth church daylye increase number beleeuers wherein iesus christ onely reygneth sauiour mankynde onely brydegroome church whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cvij homelie gone throughout phrygia region galatia forbidden holy ghost preache worde asia came mysia sought go bithynia spirite suffered gone thorowe mysia came downe troada vision appeared paule night stoode man macedonia prayed saying come macedonia helpe v seene vision immediately prepared go macedonia certified lorde called v preache gospell vnto losed forth troada came strayte course samothracia next daye neapolis thence philippos chiefe citie partes macedonia free citie spirite lorde iesus christe woulde iourneyes voyage apostlesthe vse apostle peregrinatio specially paule shoulde diligently described bicause make little instruction appeareth great goodnesse god within short space tyme vouchsafe lighten worlde doctrine gospell saluation bring prophane gentyles corrupt knowledge fellowship appeareth also hystorie meanes weapon kingdome god vseth earth enlarged conserued uerily preaching gospell whereby despyte worlde spirite god bloweth christ otherwheres sayeth god doth vouchsafe vse ministerie men herein required earnest diligence vigilant zeale wherein haue imitate paule others touching whose feruent zeale luke reporteth manye thing whereof simple argument proofe contented haue gayned many congregation vnto christ goeth agayne visite confyrmeth faithfull admonition teaching v must carefull matter saluation bicause men knowe sleyghtes satan laboureth turne v euer ware way saluation yet paule visiteth congregation endeuoreth gather gayne newe company vnto christ thing place luke chiefely intreateth first sayde went phrigia galacia phrygia galatia conuerted newe congregation erected epistle paule galathians abundantly declareth conteyning compendious perfyte abridgement whole summe euangelike doctrine iourney came passe one thing marueylous paule forbidden preach asia forbidden holy ghost preach gospell asia name asia comprehended part bordering sea westwarde conteyneth continent acolia lydia aboue ephesus smyrna ionia selfe country fruitfull rich others cause vnhappye christ would time heare doctrine saluation case bythinia also spirite christ woulde suffer paule go neyther argument easily appeareth apostle wandered worlde owne pleasure thing guiding ordering spirite god knowe holye spirite promised giuen vnto christ beside singuler reuelations neede whereof example peter philip ethiopian eunuch cornelius centurion ministery conuerted maketh commendation apostle doctrine despyse humane thyng little esteemed seeing manifest published among men euident working holy ghost men vse place mooue graue question paule suffred one place teach forbidden another question men thinke commodiously soluted doings referred vnto god prescience foreknowledge saye foreseeth worthy haue word saued kind menne whyle carefull defende iustice god feare making author sinne make little grace measuring saluation worthynesse menne impossible doe vnlesse also stablishe merite man prowde affiaunce mannes righteousnesse howe friuolous vayne glose appeareth men themselues vnworthye saluation paule testifyeth haue sinned destitute glory god iust man one none worthy receyue worde saluation god pleaseth make worthy meete selues able thinke good worthynesse abilitie perceyue good commeth god2 cor saying christ notable well knowne menne manne commeth iohn whome father draweth example whereof xiiij chapter sayde beleeued ordeyned vnto life euerlasting next sermon shall haue example lydia therefore beleeued paule bicause lord opened hir hart remayneth therefore none cause alleaged franke free election god embraceth mercye whome pleaseth whome againe ly eth hart hardeneth yet man must accuse god eyther vnrighteousnesse crueltie forasmuch bound man ordreth iudgements great learning commeth thereby vnto v elect sheweth example meere goodnesse reprobate seueritie iustice may learne feare one embrace kisse moreouer vse doctrine serueth necessarye many purpose marueylously comforteth v temptation bicause knowe saluation founded power merite righteousnesse grace god merite christ ouerthrow righteousnesse grace shall seperate loue god rom hath embraced shall able take one sheepe christes hande seeing power giuen heauen earth iohn whosoeuer teach saluation dependeth vpon worthinesse doe vtterlye infringe force strength consolation besides doctrine teacheth v dutie acknowledge great goodnesse god perceyue selues sought visited worde god others god attributeth vnto merites meere grace goeth saue v disdaine acknowledge goodnesse shewe themselues vnkinde towardes sheweth horrible seueritie iustice agaynst haue example corozaim bethsaida capernaum whole nation iewes reade god cast none cause luke woulde acknowledge day visitation example like seuertitie city god vouchsafe illuminate ministerie paule e day tyrannously oppressed turkes bicause shewed themselues thankfull vnto god ought lette v beseech thinke hereof whome hath pleased god many yeares let enioy preaching gospell let v abounde quiet peace thereof number beside feele great want therof famined would glad one little morsell euangelike consolation let v returne paule companion paule called go macedonia though forbidden one place preach yet cease duetie passing misia come length aeolis citie countrie called troas earnestly seeking euerywhere occasion preach paule admonished oracle vnderstandeth must go macedonia appeareth vnto macedonian vndoubtedly nothing aungell desireth haue countrye holpen came diuers thinges profytable v consider first example paule whereby taught must slacke office dutie although enterprise succeede fyrst seconde attempt desire reade like came passe many time prophetes apostle followed calling earnestlye impedimentes perceyued layde waye let men go forwarde mennes example god assist endeuours vseth seeth time place giue occasion onset also prosperous successe furthermore place sheweth v singuler example god goodnesse whereby commeth passe god worketh saluation least knowe thinke among macedonian woulde thinke thought eyther paule waye saluation came none fewe woman followe heare meane saying prophete fulfylled founde sought haue appeared asked mee esay luke sayth came passe among macedonia may seene eyther haue attained day attayne vnto saluation worlde made ephes paule sayth elected christ fyrst parent adam fallen sinne onely seeke god fled gene yet sought god called receyued free promise saluation hereto appertayneth men scripture compared vnto eepe hauing strayed flocke neuer returne vnlesse shepeheard diligence fette agayne christ shepehearde vseth seeke sheepe valleyes mountaynes esay luke hath founde layeth shoulder bringeth home care god may onely perceyued thinges concerne saluation soules also sheweth selfe thing seruing vse maintenance body god feedeth bodye bountifully giuing v liuing earth hath appoynted aungels tutor keeper arie rounde feare deliuer bicause haue hereof intreated heretofore let nowe suffyse yet let v marke vse doctrine consisteth chiefely poynt shoulde thankefull vnto god stryue kinde aduersities defende calling inuincible hope affiaunce god ayde succor furthermore example commendeth vnto v dignitie gospell ministery thereof fyrst notable thing paule called aungell oracle god preache peter admonished vision heauen preach vnto cornelius gentyles spirite led philip teach aethiopian saluation therefore menne doe vainely contemne ministerie man thing small none account requyre haue aungels teach seeing aungels sende v vnto men taught yea paule haue v beleeue aungell galat teach anye thing disagreeing doctryne apostle also wordes aungell commende dignitie ministerie sayth come macedonia helpe v yet god power onely helpe v body soule bicause worde gospell power saluation beleeue minister thereof therefore without cause sayd helpe men saue cause abdias prophecying kingdome christ calleth apostle sauiours therefore temeritie impietie saye gospell causeth trouble disquietnesse reprooued seeing euident men cannot choose perishe except called preaching christ way saluation according saying prophete esay nation kingdome serueth thee shall perishe paules passage macedonia doth paule heareth called god macedonia men vnknowne europe another part worlde doth tryfle make delayes bicause twyse forbidden yea prepareth voyage frameth altogither vnto god calling length strayght course commeth philippie notable citie state example taught nothing rashly taken hand without god calling certaine thereof wyth speede doe lorde commaundeth little regardeth prolongers delayer cannot abyde pretence godlynesse vnder colour therof neglect vocation taught example suffered go burie father luke christ called ministerye worde commodious way doe well haue diligent regarde calling god followe faythfully earnestly trust owne deuises seeke vanitie dauid sayth cannot choose grieuouslye offende god graunt mindefull hereof followe vocation haue earth fulfylled duetie maye length lyue heauen iesus christ sauiour whome prayse honour power glorye euer amen cviij homelie citie abiding certaine dayes sabboth dayes went citie besides riuer men wont pray sate downe spake vnto woman resorted thither certaine woman named lydia seller purple citie thya ira worshipped god gaue v audience whose heart lorde opened shee attended vnto thing paule spake baptized hir housholde besought v saying ye thinke beleeue lorde come house abyde constreyned v apostle paule called god aungell passed macedonia preach gospell vnto men countrie example prooued partly dignitie gospell partly saluation giuen v meere fauour grace declared consider macedonian case condicion nation paule otherwheres wryteth subiect vnto power darkenesse idolater seruants sinne therefore voyde god besides god sendeth paule teach waye saluation thinke thereof let v see philippi chiefest citie macedonia wee sayth luke citie abyding certaine dayes cause abode maye gathered circumstance apostle sawe oportunitie preache paule preacheth philippi thing chiefely wayted wherefore length sought citie went citie sabboth day preached gospell certaine woman nigh vnto certaine riuer whither vsed custome resort vnto publike prayer verye notable example teaching v howe god vseth trye exercise fayth constancie seruantes hath bene declared apostle called aungell one speaking behalfe countrie desiring helpe wherfore man might haue hoped macedonian haue receyued paule come kinde alacritie declaration ioy euery man minde bene prepared receyue light gospell hope deceyueth moste famous populous citie one giueth eare vnto neyther espie occasion make sermon notwithstanding narrowly wayted without citie woman gaue eare vnto one beleeued worde one lydia straunger therefore woulde thinke calling paule haue bene mockery seeing effect followe god vseth laye many stoppes way walke calling whereby hinder pull backe prooue fayth trayne vnto constancie teach wrastle ouercome aduersitie moses sent deliuer people fyndeth many impedimentes layde waye seemed much repugnaunt appoyntment god aungell lorde threatneth death bicause neglected circumcising sonne fyndeth pharao onely set bent requestes also child israel murmurre rebell egypt sea laye way nature hir selfe seemed fyght constancie fayth stedfast purpose fulfyll commaundementes god ouercame aduersities cruell enimie saule ryseth vp dauid called appointed king whose tyrannie euer came kingdome expulsed countrie manye like thinges came dayly passe whereby god vseth trye faith dutie constantly holde sure hope wayte assistance god shall fynde neyther fayle promise want enterprise lydia example true conuersionfurthermore haue marueylous example conuersion set forth lydia reason manifold doctrine therof euangelist diligently describeth ye circumstance beginning description person sayth woman admonish v se e kinde sinne entred worlde hir condicion calling seller purple exercised kinde merchandise seruing maintenance pompe pride vnto necessitie saye nothing couetousnesse craft deceyte like vice kinde people commonly giuen vnto besides straunger borne thyatirae citie lydia thinges declared ende might knowe howe god vseth despyse state degree men al sort fauoreth embraceth desirous conuert turne vnto infynite example lyke kinde teach v iohn luke math luke christ manye place reasoneth harlot saluation place agayne openeth kingdome heauen vnto publicanes disdeyned order phariseyes seeing admitted nicodemus talke night season mo e friendly instructed yea lighten centurion appoynted see executed math knowledge place teach v shoulde despayre god grace reason trade kynde lyfe haue heretofore ledde euident doore saluation standeth open euery man vnfaynedly desireth example also appeareth counsell god little beginning promoteth kingdome sonne appoynteth lydia fyrst fruites church whose fayth afterwarde paule thinketh coulde neuer sufficiently commende christ chose among fyshers publicanes chiefe disciple must thinke without cause christes kingdome earth touching outwarde sight reputation despysed thing hereof may gather worlde must seeke thinges worlde also euident desire partaker christ must glory wisedome fleshe nobilitie pompe like thing lorde paule hath taught large fyrst epistle corinthian fyrst chap hast thou aunswere rayle doctrine fayth gospell bicause none holde comminaltie men small reputation vsing argument phariseyes scribe sometime vsed seruants iohn commended christes doctrine rather harken christ sayth thanke thee father math luke bicause thou hast hidden thinges wyse prudent hast shewed vnto babe verilye father euen thy good pleasure described person lydia order maner conuersion declareth order maner hir conuersion fyrst sayd religious feare god diuers among iewes gentyles yet ignoraunt way true religion saluation therefore zelouslye defended superstition egerly resisted truth yet meane tyme needefull saluation mennes mindes shoulde voyde feare god enclined embrace truth desirous true religion except grounde good seede worde well growe luke yet vnderstanded though promptnesse towardnesse came selfe selues able thinke well inuentions man naught euen childehoode god testifyeth therefore gift worke god men giuen vnto desire loue religion truth otherwyse reason naturall corruption abhorre heartes next lydia hearde paules teaching therefore vseth meane instrument whereby god vseth giue stirre vp fayth v fayth commeth hearing rom hearing worde god therefore whosoeuer profyte knowledge saluation must labour haue fayth must regard seeke new reuelations god speaketh v scripture refuse heare commonly praies deuill miserably deludeth deceyued lying reuelations last sayd god opened heart lydia giue heede vnto thing paule spake without vaine worde eyther preached hearde whereof bicause haue already oftentimes spoken seemeth nowe needefull saye man aske god open hart others aswell say paule man art thou disputest god hath first giuen vnto god shall giuen againe becommeth v ouer curiouslye searche priuie counsayles god reuerence great goodnesse iustice veritie wisedome part place learne order true conuersion chiefely consisteth three pointes haue loue harte vnto religion heare worde illuminated spirite god remayneth v consider effectes true fayth shewed themselues lydia fyrstthe effectes conuersion true fayth baptized according commaundement christ custome church baptisme comprehendeth confession fayth wherby renounced hir olde superstition professed followe christ desiring accounted among member church example also admonished godly must contemne sacramentes vse reuerently knowe instituted christ also glad haue benefyte saluation whereof christ author sealed confyrmed lydia content hir owne baptisme causeth hir whole houshold familie likewise baptized property faythfull desire men partaker saluation wyth speciallye knewe god hath committed charge doe priuate affection following commaundement god whose alwaye shall consecrate dedicate vnto people abraham circumcised onely himselfe men familie according god commaundement lawe housholders commaunded instruct familie commaundements god deut psal commaunded magistrate must thinke belongeth also labour take away superstitiousnesse plant desire true religion among people reade godly kinges dauid asa iosaphat ezechias iosias like diligently doubtlesse without great suspition impietie one shoulde rule ouer others bereue god right claymeth men himselfe finally lydia biddeth apostle home hir house offreth lodging great instancie saying thinke beleeue lord come home house abyde wordes haue kinde obtestation apostle might refuse friendship offred except would condemne hir thinke hir vnworthy name christian although fyrst ciuill sorte refuse come home hir house woulde thought lyke deceyuers abuse simplicitie woman gape goodes also paule would neuer burthen many time testifyeth cor thes howbeit lydia hir intreatie vttereth minde inflamed charitie vnfearfull constancie poynt charitie desirous take hir house giue boorde whome receyued drawne doctrine saluation agayne token valiaunt courage straunger durst receyue teacher newe doctrine hir house well knewe might doe without daunger propertie faith neyther feareth body goodes glory christ may enlarged let pray looke example woman nowe dayes boaste fayth shall streyght perceyue howe wyde propertie fayth let v therefore praye vnto god vouchsafe open hart instructed true fayth may expresse christ whole life liue heauen whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cix homelie came passe went prayer certaine damosell possessed spirite prophecyed mette v brought hir maister mystresse hate meane whyle maye consider engine satan maintayneth hys kingdome amongst men namely lying curious soothsaying artes wherein counterfeyteth spirite prophecie drawe men meanes worde god ought onely rule doyngs professor artes egypt magitians exo whych scripture sayeth wythstoode moses among may baalam also numbred although egregiously counterfeyte loue truth diuers many sort prophetes among chanaanites whome god lawe commaunded destroyed unto maye referred augures aruspices interpreter dreames astrologer necromancer geomancer hydromancer infynite others whose counsayles saying great authoritie among king magistrate administration gouernance kingdomes common weales surelye consider thing well satan scarcely exercised power kingdome anye thyng vanitie oracle wherewith bewitched worlde great number yeres dayes many time rayseth vp certayne prophetes eyther make themselfe cunning knowledge thinges come else put awaye disease enchauntments assay doe diuers thing impossible man perfourme demaunde wherefore god time past suffred yet day suffreth thing done answere readye gentyles tymes past contented reuelations god went fynde mystery god maiestie pregnancie owne wit presumption deserued shoulde gyuen vppe reprobate sense miserably seduced wyth wyles ginnes deuill rom paule gaue v warning shoulde come passe towarde later dayes saying antichrist haue power would embrace truth2 thes offred god manne consider philippian shall fynde worthye thus seduced demoniake damsell liberalitie towards hir hir master dame small aduauntage hir yet little regarde apostle inchaunters soothsayer wise folke call euery thing seemeth much bestow doctrine truth worthy therefore pray satan whose subtiltie may perceyue good consumed body troubled molested let v therefore satan damsell following apostlessatan beareth witnesse vnto truth custome resorted prayer cried saying men seruantes high god shewe vnto v waye saluation kinde thing sayest thou heare saying deuill withstanding apostle yea verily coulde saye commendation confesse seruauntes god preacher saluation howbeit behooueth v much consider wordes pretence meaning deuill whose suggestion wordes spoken shall thou perceyue craftily vndermineth christes cause seemeth holde place beareth witnesse vnto apostle doctrine make wiser sort specially iewes anye present suspected satan knoweth accounted lyer amongest menne cause crieth apostle seruantes god messenger saluation make rather suspected wise men furthermore seeketh make beleeue apostle beleeue also answeres whereby heard apostle doctrine commended faith christ cannot stande ought attributed vnto deuill whose kingdome christ came worlde destroye therefore vnder pretence christ seeketh priuily creepe draw began beleeue christ little little besides thought tickle apostle mindes ambition desire vayne glory thende herewith entysed might neglect glory god see therfore poyson lyeth hid vnder bayte honorable holye acclamation marc luke intent reade flattered christ also bare recorde let v marke sleyght satan marueylouslye dissemble hatred truth transforme himselfe aungell light therefore lette v suspect whatsoeuer commeth neyther example although serue instruction men yet chiefely teacheth minister worde dutie must haue great care truth shoulde suffer nothing meanes maye derogate thing although made greatly prayse glorye declared satan vseth flatterie set knoweth wayes inuincible cause christ forbade euill spirites speake woulde receyue commendation mouthes wherefore greatly deceyued vse dally whome knowe altogither straungers truth hide many time poison flatter sorer hurt part christian man take none friende knoweth christes enimie cannot abyde doctrine christ worthye considered paule setteth iesus christ agaynst deuill constrayned depart assoone heareth name christ pronounced vnspeakable argument power christ none enter house mightie man ryfle goodes except fyrst binde iesus christ coming world hath vanquished deuill prince thereof heare name christ onely constrayned leaue possession men giue place vnto christ therfore must needes confesse power christ much greater power deuill must fet comfort temptation feare hath power force agaynst christ graffed fayth agayne place taught christ hath nothing doe ye deuill seeing doth vouchsafe receyue testimonie neuer honorable societie communion betweene seeing according fyrst promyse gene iohn christ came world breake crush deuils head destroy work also admonisheth christian dutie haue nothing doe deuill meete haue professed christ dallye deuill poynt let therefore flye soothsaying artes craft deuill curiositie man hath inuented let flye inglings enchauntmentes whereby promyseth men helpe disease distress let flye false prophane worshippings idolatrye superstition whatsoeuer else plucketh v god let hate tyrannie sinne whereby libertie christ hath purchased v lost let watch constantly fayth resist deuill shall depart whereby shall come passe hauing shaken yoke shall leade life acceptable vnto god shall hereafter liue reygne heauen lorde sauiour iesus christ prayse honor power glory euer amen cx homelie hir mayster lord seignior whole world accusation force effect people ranne vpon apostle bene quenching great fyre begun thou shalt place consider craft enimies truth heard incensed led desire priuate lucre commonly truth charged worlde namely troubleth disquieteth common weales beguyleth simple common new false religion hereof commeth passe minister teacher truth counted seditious fellowes seducer beguiler faythfull seruauntes god moses aaron called pharao tyrant thus aunswereth desiring people myght set libertie moses aaron pluck people away labour wicked achab bitterly vpbraydeth prophete wicked courtyers sedechias king accuse ieremie treason flying enimies assirians saying onely authour misery destruction marueyle considering poynts accusation layde vnto christes charge priestes sayde vnto pylate wee founde man peruerting whole nation forbidding paye tribute vnto caesar saying christ king agayne thou let loose thou art caesar friend whosoeuer maketh himselfe king speaketh caesar grieuous matter argue great impudencie worlde yet may seeme tollerable compared thing done dayes thinges time past saye professed enimies prophetes apostle knewe christ sauiour nowe adayes taken counted christian challenge vnto chiefe gouernaunce church professe themselues nurse shepeheardes defender church vse persecute minister christ gospell call newe doctrine seditious deceytfull according scripture olde newe testament sheweth saluation onely christ iesus teacheth v right vse sacrament innocencie puritie life duty charitie commaundeth v loue enimies leaueth lawes priuiledges free vnto magistrate biddeth v giue vnto caesar caesar vnto god belongeth vnto commendeth vnto v principally desire peace commaundeth v asmuch lyeth v haue peace men may therefore crie maners tymes let v therfore acknowledge blindenesse world esteeme slaunders one myte whereby go defame bring suspition wholesome doctrine gospell apostle scourged put prisonit remayneth v consider iudgement gouernour philippi concerning present cause saye iudgement whereas without iudgement raged like madde men apostle sreyghtways tare rent garment though wanted minister mischiefe commaunde without hearing aunswere guiltlesse beaten roddes bene well scourged length cast prison commaunding shoulde well watched though worthye punishment malefactor thing cause put inner prison feete thrust stockes iniustice coulde magistrate men office shewe offendeth doth denie leaue accused excuse himselfe men besides beate straungers roddes haue beaten thrust prison meaning afterwarde leysure heare aunswere cause rage suffered slaundered much kindle choler therfore let sitte iudgement flie pestilent plague remember haue two eares giuen cause one maye kept open plaintife defendant let also remember god president iudgements whome also shall one day giue account iudgements meane season admonished state godly worlde notorious malefactor maye liue safetye godlye hated persecuted men hurt none doe good vnto men haue least thanke men worlde singular benefite deliuer damsell thraldome satan good turne punished strypes imprisonment publike enimies citie hereof haue euery day example forasmuch christ prophecyed thinges shoulde come vnto v partes offended thereat constant fayth pacience hye v vnto marke appointed v may obtayne rewarde promised v iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cxj homelie midnight paule sylas prayed lawded god prisoner hearde sodeinly great earthquake foundation prison shaken immediately dores opened euery man bandes loosed keeper prison waked sleepe saw prison dores open drue sword would haue killed hymselfe supposing prisoner bene fledde paule cryed lowde voyce saying thy selfe harme called light sprang came trembling fell downe feete paule sylas brought sayde sir must doe saued sayde beleeue lorde iesus thou shalt saued thy housholde preached vnto worde lorde house holy scripture euerywhere doth teach godly must suffer persecution worlde likewise promiseth goddes abundant helpe succour want example whereby god euen verye beginning worlde hath declared truth promise example conteyned booke aungell brought apostle prison hearde taught temple peter deliuered prison defeated cruell deuise herode people gaping death notable also charitie euen nowe hearde recited faythfull apostle christ paule silas onely deliuered prison also keeper prison barbarous cruell person deliuered bandes impietie illuminated true knowledge saluation conuerted vnto christ bicause hystorie maye many wayes serue instruction consolation shall profytable examine circumstance thereof let v see therefore god apostle doe case thing considered also intreate iaylers conuersion apostle beyng whipped put bond prayse praye vnto godwe haue hearde howe paule silas verye euill intreated beaten roddes length put stockes wherefore might thinke shoulde like puling woman bewayle mishappe euery houre complayne god iustice luke reporteth farre otherwise occupied wryteth midnight made prayer vnto god magnifyed soft secrete wyse lowde prisoner farther prison might easilye heare argument constaunt fayth merye conscience found none kinde men faithfull onely rom time aduersitie thing paule attributeth peculiar tribulation glory reioyce luke declareth cause ioy v chapter writeth apostle beaten roddes counsell went praysing god reioycing iudged worthy suffer name christ regarde promise christ promiseth fellowship kingdome heauen luke haue abidden wyth temptation wherevpon gather paule shall partaker glory christ2 tim rom lyue christ euer world made like vnto bearing crosse worthy considered heare apostle feruent earnest prayer illuminated holy ghost true fayth knowe thinges ruled gouerned prouidence god example fyne ouercurious wittes confuted say neede prayer bicause god himselfe knoweth necessity prouidence thing administred whose deuyse cannot reuoked interrupted maner prayer deede declare case vnto god one ignoraunt carefull faythfull remembring testifye fayth holy men saintes also know god euerlasting decree manye distresse conuert vnto call helpe succour heareth commaundement god psal call vpon time thy trouble deliuer thee c agayne turne vnto turne vnto c apostle therefore praye affliction according ensample godly aduersitie ought seeke helpe deliuerye god onely none else taught moreouer ought onely aduersitie seeke deliuerie also giue god thankes magnify holy name afflicted verily argument fatherly affection towards v correcteth wantonnesse fleshe rod crosse tribulation nothing force god comfort effectually seene exercised diuers temptation according saying prophete multitude sorrowes heart psal cor thy comfortes haue refreshed soule paule sayth affliction christ abounde v christ aboundeth consolation wherevnto seemeth peter also respect wryting vnto brother dispersed among diuers nation beginneth prayse god commendation hys grace thinges ought remember tempted impaciencie fleshe ouercome thereof mutter agaynst god sinne chiefely prouoketh wrath god example child israel murmuring wildernesse1 cor abundantly declare nowe let v come seconde poynt place shewed god sodeinly sayth luke great earthquake god deliuereth apostle calling vpon foundation prison shaken immediately dores opened euery man bandes loosed man neede doubt worke god none bicause scripture declareth none doe thinges place set forth force effect faythfull prayer wise man sayth pierceth cloudes ascendeth vp sight god eccle neglecteth hereof commeth passe prayer thing obteyned farre exceede strength man nature constreyned giue place reade prayer moses deuided waues redde sea prayer gaue amalekytes great ouerthrowe iames apostle testifieth elia prayer locked heauens gaue raine opened agayne place prayer threates worlde forasmuch man able take praying v force efficacie well appeareth thing force alwaye grieuously oppressed likewyse let men abstayne oppressing innocent whose prayer gronings see effect certayne steppe degree shall good v order consider fyrst waked earthquake seeth doores opened thought prisoner fledde drewe sworde haue killed himselfe fearing seueritie lawes made death iaylers prison prisoner escaped negligence example seueritie herode shewed vpon set watch peter thys keeper therefore mynding escape open shame deceyued wyth common errour gentyles thought woulde sounde great praise manlynesse auoyding infamy shame kill himselfe thus satan bewytched men mindes sought saluation destruction prayse ignominie shame howbeit deede nothing pernitious dishonest go violent death throwe downe burthen crosse god layeth vpon v kynde feare doth vtterly declare cowardlye heart growe kinde neyther suffer thing agayne thys euident argument desperate mynde forasmuch man bereue himselfe lyfe pleasauntest thing man wyshe desire hande despayreth helpe grace god example iudas traytor lyke abundantly declare therefore paule doth well call vpon keeper doe himselfe harme christian menne must take heede harken suggestion satan perswading kyll themselues whatsoeuer colour pretence set vppon yet deede deuilyshe ezech daungerous bicause euident god wyll death sinner rather shoulde conuert lyue therfore taught example kynde lyfe commonly lead eyther serue wicked consent vnto euident iayler whome intreate beyng obsequious double diligent execute wicked commaundement giuen wicked magistrate putteth apostle stock inner prison fast sleepe though thing bene safe chaunce falleth putteth hazard body soule yea euen nowe vtterly perished lord hys singular fauour reuoked destruction paule preacher saluation let v thynke notable golden sentence whych fyrst psalme blessed man hath walked counsell vngodly stande waye sinner hath sitten seate scornefull c furthermore haue paule example christian charitie whych carefull saluation long vncourteously vniustly handled let v imitate doyng loue hate v seeke saluation wishe destruction shall taken true child god father math suffreth sunne aryse vpon good bad let v returne iayler prison luke writeth sodenly chaunged yea become altogither another man heard prisoner fledde stayed hande god comparing boldenesse playnnesse apostle wherof like hytherto bene seene men present myracle stryken wyth inwarde inspiration god altogither whaped hys minde beginneth feele himselfe howe grieuously sinned vngentle vsage whome sawe god greatly regarded wherfore calling forthwith lyght goeth vnto falleth downe feete length bringing forth contrary magistrate commaundement sayth syrs must doe saued acknowledge mightie hande god wrought matter surely must ascrybed vnto god reuerenceth men scourged put open shame breaketh wicked vniust commaundement magistrate demaundeth right way saued yea teacheth example thinges must lightly negligently passed ouer god worketh myraculously seruaunts nothing almost pernicious amazednesse maketh v blynde manifest workes god euident thing time past brought pharao destruction day hurteth many men iudge thinges come passe fortune chaunce search iudgements god thing see fall beyonde course nature let v therfore alway diligently marke search right way saluation touching see keeper nowe profytably made inquirie streyght wayes apostle aunswere friendlythe summe saluation fayth christ declare vnto fewe wordes right absolute way mannes saluation saying beleeue lorde iesus thou shalt saued thy houshold preach fayth onely fayth stayeth vpon none iesus christ onely author saluation conteyned satisfaction righteousnesse redemption sanctifycation obtayne none otherwayes fayth whych cause scripture teacheth iustifyed saued fayth wherof seeing haue diuers tymes intreated fewe wordes time may suffyse let v note well thys one thing none thing scripture fayth take holde christ hereof gathered seeke saluation christ lacke fayth miserably molested vncertayne opinion yet bicause doctryne briefe barbarous man gentyle coulde fyrst vnderstande therefore apostle afterwarde open large preach word lorde gospell aswell hym housholde summe whereof iustifyed saued fayth merite christ meane season taught fayth rashlye conceyued imaginatyue opinion full perfyte knowledge iesus christ dependeth vpon eternall worde god therefore fayth must learned worde nothing admitted plainly expressed gospell whatsoeuer contained therein let v embrace stedfast fayth also meane maye saued lorde iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cxij homelie tooke houre nyght washed woundes baptised housholde straight way brought house set meate ioyed housholde beleeued god day officer sent minister saying let men go keeper prison tolde saying paule officer haue sent worde lose therefore get hence go peace sayd paule vnto haue beaten v openly vncondemned romaynes haue cast v prison nowe would sende v away priuily nay verily let come themselues fet v minister tolde wordes vnto officer feared heard romanes came besought brought desired depart citie went prison entred house lydia seene brother comforted departed euangelist luke hath diligently descrybed tyranny vnrighteousnesse magistrate philippi vsed faythfull seruantes christ paule silas reporteth dyligently howe keeper prison great dooer sayde wicked enterprise conuerted vnto faith iesus christ ende hystorie partly learne v true way howe turne vnto god afterwardes must turned vnto god fyrst point present place pertayneth vnto later member wherein declared keeper dyd embrased christ part therefore wyll fyrst declare meaning afterwarde speake apostle delyuerie much god shall put mindes fruite workes faythas touching keeper prison nowe conuerted vnto christ foure thing chiefely affyrmed fyrst night bringeth apostle prison washeth sore doth contrarie commaundement magistrate badde shoulde diligently straightly kept yea euen knew seueritie iudges would euen haue kylled hymselfe thought prisoner fledde bringeth owne accorde putting himselfe manifest daunger lyfe place teacheth v chiefe principall effect fayth make men obedyent vnto god bolde put thinges execution know god alloweth commaundeth although worlde thinke neuer much contrarie saying minde faythfull well peter must obey god man therefore confuted example nowe dayes alleage authoritie prince publyke lawes friendship worlde infynite lyke agaynst preceptes god frozen cowardely feare dare neuer attempt thing christes quarrell glorye let v rather followe keeper prison whome neyther authoritie magistrate publike lawe breaking prison present daunger coulde feare durst bring prison whome knewe vniustlye committed thyther vnworthily entreated outwarde religionafter baptized causeth housholde lykewise baptized learned gospell apostle preached vnto ordynance christ woulde beleeue shoulde ioyned togither one bodye church baptisme wherefore thinketh sacrament instituted christ ought neglected sophistically reason doctrine fayth going wise faith onely sauiour iesus christ sufficient vnto saluation erewhyle dyd teache whye require nowe baptisme must needes superfluous vnprofytable truely beleeue christ neuer despise ordynaunces christ bicause know sacramentes repugnaunt vnto faith rather certaine labelles outwarde seales god promise whereof take holde fayth meane season haue consyder zealous fayth keeper wherewith enflamed would haue housholde also dedicated vnto god baptisme example wherof also lyddia thing serueth confute annabaptistes owne head keepe child faythfull baptisme reprooueth sloth intollerable sluggishnesse haue little care familie regarde haue consecrated vnto christ hys church outwarde sacramentes thereby abundantlye declaring greatly carefull glory god thirdly prepareth meate housecharitie knew prison verie slender supper none worke christian liberalitie loue beleeue christ neuer wythout impossible seperate fayth loue god truely loueth god neglect neighbour knoweth made similitude god esteemed hym would haue redeemed bloude sonne cause paule sayth fayth worketh loue galat althoughe many workes fayth yet may part math rom referred vnto charitie bicause whole lawe fulfylled apostle iohn teacheth v neglecteth neighbour neyther looueth god hath faith therefore iayler doth well declare faith workes charitie becommeth v also busily apply taken called vaine professours faith fourthly reioyceth housholde bicause beleeued god knewe nowe belonged vnto church christioy spirite whome onely treasure saluation layde vp yet erewhyle declared great daunger thereby iudges mindes notbene sodainely altered alteration yet wist dyed insomuch let loose whome iudge commaunded laide yrons faith maketh men obedient vnto god ouercommeth labour daungers suffereth feeling heauenly ioye spirite christ inspyreth ouercome temptation therefore paule wryting faythfull phylippians byddeth alwaies reioyce glad moreouer man would lay togither thing saide hitherto iayler shall appeare fayth ydle seperated good workes good workes lacking recompenseth iniuries made vnto apostle obeyeth god duely present daunger lyfe declaring hereby howe readie ment afterwarde thinges hee receyued sacramentes duelie ought doe receyued baptisme streight way like absteyned lordes supper seing conuersaunt faithfull furthermore carefull saluation familie caused also brought vnto christ vnto congregation also exerciseth charitie benefycence liberally euen middle daungers ioyeth altogither spirituall gladnesse yet apostle asked true waye saluation appointed faith onely iesus christ faith brought forth streight way excellent fruites haue heard wherevnto yet must attribute glorie saluation bicause coulde haue done none vnlesse faith beene graffed christ quickned spirite fyrst confuted saye doctrine faith enimie vnto good workes seing increase good workes springeth none thing much faith rom iames next also vnder false pretence gospell seeke vnbrydelled licentiousnesse fleshe sinne without check ful per te deliuery apostleshowbeit hystory keeper prison ended luke commeth vnto officer philippi declareth howe apostle delyuered commaundement authoritie god workes perfyte beguyle men mindes vaine hope expectation helpe succour meane season yet god marueylously tosseth apostle one maye see vseth wicked fulfyll pleasure euen wyll let v discusse thing order may receyue comfort instruction thereby breake daye came sergeaunts magistrate commaunding apostle let loose shall appeare afterward paules word secret dimission went meaning also sende citie howsoeuer dimissed plaine iudges acknowledge innocencie apostle also owne vnrighteousnesse vsed whether meane whyle night caused consider much earthquake strake feare durst holde tyrannie vncertaine assuredly sodaine chaunge minde aboundantly declare rashnesse vnrighteousnesse yet go marueylous craftily hyde heynousnesse commytted whereof ashamed therefore woulde haue apostle priuily set libertie lay fault though mistrusting cause broke open dores fledde prison thus wicked vse craftes colour seeke seeme righteous ashamed naughtinesse meaning earnest repentaunce causeth shame heape freshe offence sinnes vpon olde therefore place teacheth v fyrst repentaunce wicked partthe repentance wicked doubtlesse counterfeyte repentaunce reuerence feare men onely wringeth repenting meane season heart nothing mindefull amendement thus reade saule repented earnestly required samuel depart him1 samu least authoritie estimation vtterly haue quayled elder people vaine vnprofytable repentaunce appeareth euen meane season hate worde god woorse tode bicause light thereof discloseth wickednesse let euery man therefore learne acknowledge offence may also sorrowfull seeke hyde wyth shaming rather let publishe amendment setting forth god glorie whereof scripture giueth v example dauid paule also place teacheth vswicked officer easilye wicked officer quit themselues great heynous offence could men haue done wickedly vnworthy calling beate innocent person without hearing cause ry clamour common gore bloude sore washed cast darke dungeon nowe thinke ynnough put death shame conuey priuily citie worde amends making common thing dayes especially cause whome world hateth bicause sinceritie truth remember iudgement belongeth vnto god furthermore let often remember shall one day also come christ iudged shall giue accompt iudgementes therefore according admonition prophete let holde bloud subiectes deare sight psalm furthermore appeareth inuincible power godthe power god delyuering people whereby able take deliuer beloued handes wicked although persist wickeddesse repent naughtinesse thinke amendment sayde euen nowe yea vndoubtedly wished apostle christ destroyed yet secret working god compelled let go free egyptian although truely chaunged mindes exodus constreyned let people
