whose liues daunger beset libertie perceyue meane season howe go preiudice gospell wyth vnrighteous iudgements stop hinder course thereofpaule set libertie dismyssed priuilie therfore paule much better thus stowtely refuse fauour offered wicked magistrate saying haue beaten v openly vncondemned romaynes haue cast v prison woulde send v away priuily nay verily let come themselues fet v wordes complayneth iniurie done hys fellow silas aggrauate accusation alleageth romane lawes wherein enacted man vse vyolence vppon bodye citizen rome cause heard woulde priuilie put citie honorably let man accuse paule eyther pride impatiencie considering hath verie good cause thus doe fyrst hath care doctrine gospell charged wrong suspition eyther might offende yet weake fayth else giue occasion open enemy reproche would haue thought apostle suspected owne cause beene bruted abrode bene secretly fled moreouer paule thought would put fierce fellowes feare make meanes vse hereafter aduisednesse lesse crueltie towarde member christthe trade christian paciencie whereby gather christian paciencie suffer wicked doe liste without comptrolement rather wickednesse must reprooued brydelled meanes maye commodiously done also glorie god innocencie must defended bicause many time herewithall saluation many imperilled thus christ calleth came take swordes staues minister fulfyllers power darckenesse openly reprehended priestes seruaunt smote without cause therefore must paciently suffer whatsoeuer aduersitie commeth vnto v yet must betray cause christ truth otherwise dishonestly forsake againe taught godly may vse priuilege positiue lawes defence farre forth repugne agaynst truth religiondefence lawe permytted godlye paule ready suffer thing christes sake would haue alleaged lawes rome bene wicked shall heare howe appealed vnto caesar vsed lawfull defence armour wicked conspiracie intended kyll therfore great iniustice saye vse lawe forbidden christian men kinde defending themselues lawe haue rashely rushe kinde daungers preposterous feare wickedbut magistrate philippi heard paule speake afrayde done wrong bicause vnderstoode romaine whome serued well knew seueritie romaine defending lawes priuiledges much cicero testifyeth agaynst verres saying free man citizen rome helped saued many farthest partes worlde euen among barbarous people surely next vnto religion stronger hold bande common weales fyrme constant keeping equitie lawes therefore feare without cause occasion forthwith came vnto excuse themselues done courteously bring prison desiring auoyding trouble would vouchsafe depart citie likewise may appeare condicions wicked touched feare god feare onely men authoritie themselues seueritie lawes may freely without checke offende men dare doe thing wherof none cause thinke god careth men doings godly farre otherwise minded whose care set god detest horror sinne time offende infyrmitie feared consideration offence commytted punishment due meane season learne example ende passe rashe iudgementes wicked magistrate come surely bring author thereof perill shame hence came magistrate striken fearethe ende rashe iudgement bring forth honoraably whome day ignomiously put shame thus accuse owne temerite vnrighteousnesse many example lyke kinde vse whereof teach magistrate whosoeuer beare authority learne brydle affection according prophane wryters saying take good deliberation afore go thing intend doe moreouer example teacheth v force innocencie great egregiously confoundeth hir fiercest enimies therefore let v labour innocencie let v doubt also hir meanes shall tryumph ouer enimies howe fyerce euer nowe shewe themselues nowe remayneth last part thys hystoriethe apostle departure philippi touching apostle going away must needes doe considering henceforth place citie yet depart vtterly neglecting congregation fyrst go see brother gathered togither lyddias house exhort stedfast fayth comfort effectually moreouer paule wryteth epistle vnto wherin taught prosperously cogregation afterward came forward whose beginning seemed altogither vnprosperouse vntowarde whereby appeereth course gospell hyndered attemptes wicked sometime minister thereof bounde worde god bounde againe preach thrust banished spirite christ cannot banished breatheth wheresoeuer pleaseth yea men holde peace stone preach christ let thinges make v constaunt fayth hauing length ouercome worlde prince thereof may liue raigne heauen wyth iesus christ sauiour whome praise honor power glory euer amen xvij chapiter vpon actes apostle cxiij homelie nowe passed amphipolis apollonia came thessalonica great synagoge iewes paule maner went vnto three sabboth dayes disputed wyth scripture opening alleaging christ must haue suffred rysen agayne death iesus christ whome sayde preach vnto beleeued ioyned companye paule silas also grecian feared god great multitude chiefe woman fewe lorde sauiour iesus christ gospell luke sayth manne putteth hys hande plough looketh backward meete kingdome heauen wordes doe admonishe v christian especially minister word required inuincible constancie minde whereby maye go forwarde without feare al traueyle daunger withdrawne anye temptation forsake office committed credit constancie set vnto v worthy example apostle paule constancie paule fyrst daye tooke hande seruice christ gospell continuall labour daunger yet held seeking daylie new occasion great courage minde set forth kingdome christ done heretofore place selfe wyth incredible industrie among macedonian present hystorie declareth verie euill intreated philippi place called vision yet murmureth god doubteth calling leaueth duetie feare taketh iourney directly thorowe amphipolis apollonia commeth thessalonica chiefe citie macedonia spreade lyght gospell getteth berrhoea thence athens preacheth christ among learned phylosophers gentile vpon open stage worlde let passe thinges let v see done tyme thessalonica first sayde went amphipolis apollonia paule preacheth vnto iewes mention made paule preached city therfore lyke holy ghost offered occasion preache came thessalonica went iewes synagoge notable full people space three sabboth dayes taught gospell iesus christ yet might seeme straunge thing paule woulde offer doctrine saluation agayne vnto iewes whose incurable malice often tryed whome perceyued god cast many euident argument mooued partly feruent desyre set forth kingdome god partly constant loue bare nation whose sake otherwhyle wished accursed yet must thinke blinde affection much lorde long prophecied esay though iewes cast certaine remnauntes shoulde saued perhappes might mooued example elia thought people forsaken god israell tolde yet seauen thousande neuer bowed knee vnto baal taught example paule must ouer hastily cease duetie bicause many men ingratitude rather apostle otherwhere teacheth v tollerate euill wyth meekenesse instruct make resistaunce anye time god giue repentance knowe truth2 tim may come themselues againe snare deuill seruauntes god becommeth v imitate condition propertie offended ingratitude worlde much knowe haue rewarde layde vp lorde shall neuer fayle v therefore inexcusable waywardenesse assoone perceyue nothing profyte cease duetie ledde example god christ vsed great lenitie long sufferaunce towards incurable malice iewes euen fyrst beginning nation also worthy obseruation see howe paule keepeth religion sabbothesthe obseruing sabboth dayes comming church goeth synagoges preach following example christ dyd nothing secret taught abroade openly meane season see olde vsage amonge people god godly come vnto church whose sake reade holy dayes holy place time past ordeyned god necessarie obserue doctrine sake waye commodiously taught also bicause externe religion ought openly exercised profession true fayth fayle cause christ adourned congregation church comming hys example commended notable promise cause paule fyrst epistle corinthian diligently occupied gyuing preceptes well ordering wherfore frowardnesse must needes detested deryde scoffe publike assembly christian plainely testifying ledde care wholesome doctrine sincere religionthe tr de maner paules doctrine doth paule synagoge iewes euen heare vsed doe many place taught scripture declaring howe necessarie christ shoulde die rise againe dead christ preached must diligently marke pointes bicause fullye conteyne whole trade apostle doctrine fyrst shewe whence paule fet doctrine verily wrytings moses prophets2 timo iohn otherwheres sayth inspyred god christ witnesseth mystery eternall lyfe conteyned therefore also dayes must doctrine taught congregation taken neyther must impudencie borne haue controuersies dayes deuided scripture alleage vnto v tradition canon call apostle father counsel though left v thinges imperfection certaintie apostle taught howe paule handled scripture opened saye dyligent interpretation picked true sense meaning applyed thing therin conteyned present purpose coulde wayes commodiouslye doe conference place example paule theyr errour confuted saye sufficient haue scripture read ouer church wyll suffer exposition opened therefore mennes iudgement paule offended verie much yea christ himselfe may reade vsed order teaching schoole nazareth luc whosoeuer followeth example christ offend paule doth much better requireth teacher church distribute deale worde truth iustly duely timo apply instruction comfort euery body thirdely declared argument paules doctrine conteyneth chiefely two poyntes setting seeme agaynst many errours iewes fyrst offended crosse christ bicause vnderstoode oracle prophetes according letter ymagined kingdome christ temporall looked messias wythout crosse errour may dayes also perceyued would haue gospell preached without crosse desyre saued christ suffer afflicted errour iewes denyed iesus sonne mary messias christ paule laboureth put errours away going prooue testimony scripture god begynning world ordeyned way man saued say incarnation death resurrection sonne againe applying thing vnto iesus sonne marie prophet tymes past spake messias euidently declareth ought acknowledged messias none ought looked nowe paule declared thing large testimony scripture gathered place might v ample wise prosecuted bycause appeareth easily sermon paule apostle going place part vsed vse reade scripture fynde euerywhere thing conteyne knowledge christ wyll purpose shorter meane haue two thing obserue fyrst ought preached church uerily euen iesus christ whome paule otherwheres confesseth onely knoweth none alone sufficient v thing bicause giuen v father brydegrome shephearde king priest head righteousnesse wisedome satisfaction sanctifycation redemption himselfe would haue men brought vnto vnmeete teach thing agreeable seconde thinge howe christ preached euen one scripture declare dying v aultar crosse purged sinnes glorious resurrection ouercame death reigneth worlde lyke vnto king earth taken vp heauen comforteth v spirite affliction infyrmitie flesh triumpheth ouer aduersaries haue conceyued mindes christ one offended worldly attempt voyde care merie laugh worlde goeth church learne therefore hereby iudge doctrine dayes harken vnto businesse saluation teach christ seing paule knewe onely notwithstanding rapt vp thirde heauen moreouer successe declareththe fruite paules teaching paules preaching vaine certaine iewes beleeued yet fewe bicause nowe beganne blindnesse nation yet god keepeth fulfylleth hys truth saueth certaine remnauntes innumerable multitude vnfayned beleeuers appeareth openly ioyne themselues vnto paule silas learning sake also protest openly beliefe yet greater company greekes beleeued whome calleth religious bicause tasted little true religion lyke learned conuersaunt iewes although incredulitie nation past hope yet god would vse dispersed abroade worlde bring gentyles ydolatry vnto worshipping true god euerywhere sowe certaine principle ground pure religion touching honouring inuocating one god company faithfull numbred certaine noble chiefe woman manne maye see howe god hath regarde elect state degree person place teacheth v gospell neuer preached vaine hath bene already oftentymes declared also touched dueties truely beleeue ardent desyre true doctrine religion thankefulnesse towarde teacher saluation playne open profession true fayth god haue none worship dissemble play handes god graunt also illuminated light true fayth may declare fayth worde deede maye come vnto inheritaunce kingdome heauen onely begotten sonne god iesus christ whome prayse honour power glorye euer amen cxiiij homelie bvt iewes beleeued indignation tooke vnto euill men vagabondes gathered company set citie roare made assault vpon house iason sought bring people founde drewe iason certayne brother vnto heades citie cry trouble worlde come hyther also whome iason hath receyued priuilie doe contrarie decree caesar affirming king one iesus troubled people officer citie heard thing sufficiently aunswered iason let go brother immediatly sent away paule silas night vnto berrhoea come thyther entred synagoge iewes god ordeyned sonne euerlasting sauiour mankinde prophecyed beginning world perpetuall enmitie contention betweene deuill sayde vnto serpent set enmitie betweene thee woman betweene thy seede hir seede shall treade downe thy heade gene thou shalt treade vpon hys heele continuall example prophecie booke apostle actes declareth vnto v wheresoeuer worlde apostle went erect establishe kingdome christ preaching gospell satan instrumentes alwayes withstoode fyrst ierusalem scribe priest samaria simon sorcerer againe damascus areta king arabia cyprus elymas sorcerer antioch pisidia iewes obstinate purpose implacable hatred followed paule euerywhere sea lande hynder stop course gospell enimies lystra withstoode taught derba nowe called god macedonia trouble molest meanes present place teacheth thrust thessalonica gospell began prosperously take roote chiefe vse thing must offended lyke come vpon dayes consyder alway state church worlde bicause worlde delyghteth seruing prince thereof christ let v vewe present place marueylously serueth instruct comfort v wicked assaultes deuill worlde fyrst teacheth v instrument deuill fought agaynst paule thessalonica describeth property quality good successe tragediehypocrites vagabondes enimyes truth among instrumentes deuill thought good vse two kynde men rehearsed fyrst iewes luke sayth indignation apostle hypocrite vsed pretence god lawe zeale auncient religion cloke obstinacie vnbeliefe deede sought nothing priuate gaine glorye conspiracie may easily appeare tooke vnto certaine vagabundes men naughtie condition whose companye ought haue shunned moste pestilent plague loued truth religion thus ydle luskishe lubber worthie called haue spent goodes waste stande market place lyke publyke ware solde ready commit kinde mischiefe may fynde buyer marueylous society man would neuer suspect could amonge professours vnlyke studyes force hatred conceyued truth great vseth ioyne men diuers condition nature league togither thus thou seest priestes scribe phariseyes sadduceyes iudas apostle souldiours herode pilate conspire togither christ otherwise diuers countreyes religion profession place teacheth v earnest chiefest enimies truth uerily hypocrite vnder false pretence religion seeke owne aduauntage nusseled ydlenesse cannot away pouertie readie sell helpe thing fyrst sort testimonie christ beleeue iohn bicause burne desyre priuate glorye thinke right meede therefore satan vseth craftily ioyne consocyate two sortes men togither ende bolde desperate dickes caria hyred waged hypocrite may open violence bring passe cannot craftie subtile inuentions cause nowe dayes manye prelate seene king courtes byshops prince counsel monkes bragge men deade vnto worlde seene flying fyeld among armed men fynde themselues trustie defendoures haue solde soules conscience measure truth religion gaine lucre thing teach v kinde men shoulde beware desyre haue church safety many place dayes abbotes bishop craftily insynuate themselues pretende kinde zeale let fynde men meete purpose deuises brybed golde dare forceably doe anye thing doctrine christ founde voyde al religion righteousnesse seemed beare greatest zeale vnto god seconde part place teacheth vsthe indeauours enimies truth declareth doings hytherto pretended zeale godlynesse enterprise fyrst thing doe set citie conspiracie vprore easie doe false rumour spredde openly priuily agaynst apostle enymies publike weale done violently giue assault man house meaning haue brought forth apostle found kinde zeale maketh men burst open dores hale innocent vnto death yet heynous matter could fynde sought bring pull iudges iason apostle hoste man hospitality worthy singuler prayse certaine brother beleeued christ accuse traytors vnto citie frame accusation intermeddle euery worde impudent lye slaunders say trouble worlde come hyther also whome iason hath receyued priuilye call apostle preach peace mutuall looue troubler worlde whereas themselues nowe set citie roare lyke seditious fellowes bicause knewe religion pretence whereof made adooe smally regarded among thessalonian exaggerate matter say apostle thing lawes decree caesar accuse treason saying appointed king worlde affirming maner ierusalem obiected christ pylate let men go caesar friende chiefe vse thinges learne v instrumentes weapon wicked assault truth hir minister first vse open force satan murtherer thinke haue great defence therein themselfe pylate sent forth crewe swordes clubbes take christ luc plainely sayde exercise power darkenesse thus cain violently kylled abel pharao openly afflicted israelite yea man would consyder hystories age shoulde see chiefe argumentes enimies truth founded vpon seculer power commonly dayes vse dispute godly imprisonment chaynes gunnes speares fyre sworde howbeit bicause wiser sort abhorre manifest violence tyranny satan knoweth craftily howe mittigate heynousnesse matter lying going false accusation slaunders bring seruauntes christ faythfull minister truth ignominie suspicion example hereof haue else alleaged achab king iewes accusing christ pylate neede tarie longer matter let v learne least rashely beleeue grieuously accuse godly though blasphemer god iniurious saintes disturber common weale let v rather search verie truth matter commonly shall appeare innocent seemed worthy kinde punishment place teacheth v furthermore great destruction commeth vnto common weales ydle gracelesse person haue spent consumed owne goodes gape men hyred little commit great mischiefe whereby commeth passe iustice discipline punishe length much cumbred endammaged perceyue common weales much hyndered men long suffered thessalonica wax length bolde desperate entised hyred iewes beginne publike sedition boldenesse putteth men feare thing seemeth haue bene cause paule afterward wryting thessalonian warneth dyligently see ordering liued ydly men labour let passe present example euerywhere manye example nation teache v kynde men pernitious vnto common weales steede great many one may serue written storie romaine coniuration catiline complices prudently therefore athenian sometyme inact sluggishe ydle person shoulde brought market place openlye shamed men getting lyuing honest arte trade athenian officer called areopagitae suspected anye inordinate lyfe called demaunded howe liued mainteyned themselues seueritie industrie vsed dayes woulde make common weales church quiet foule thing christian men poynt ouercome gentile whome reason experience fleshe onely taught wise nowe let v see ende tragediea ioyfull ende sedition whose beginning man would haue thought coulde haue bene ended without shedding bloud first iudges people mooued commonly vseth sedition fyrst brunt wisemen modest also almost amazed wote doe god little blast winde chase away threatning clowdie countenance heauen place small adoe maketh quiet calme erewhile seemed starke mad secret working hys spirite mittigateth mindes iudges heare iason speake length satisfyed dismysse hym brother meane brother night season sende away paule silas berrhoea againe go synagoge preache great fruit vtilitie councell thessalonica set forth president ciuile iustice equitie men follow office authoritie person haue thinges also obserued fyrst thing verie comfortable tolde iason kindenesse shewed vnto apostle great daunger lorde deliuereth obteyneth euerlasting praise congregation saintes thus promise christ fulfylled promised sure rewarde vnto giueth cup cold water vnto one disciple math let kindle v also desyre vnto godlynesse seeme v intollerable suffer traueyles perilles christes faythfulles sake brother thessalonica shewe themselues thankefull vnto paule silas accompany bringing waye night season putting themselues freshe daunger without cause paule commendeth fayth epistle wryteth vnto galathians also commended cause sayth ready haue giuen eye needed nowe dayes minister haue small thanks fyrst daunger sometime deliuered handes cruell enimies taken christian people gospeller finally haue consyder paule embraseth counsell brother wylling flye vnderstanding thing permytted christ neyther glorie god weale brother congregation daunger god haue v perishe without great cause profyte meane season flying forgetfull duetie assoone come berrhoea teach agayne example admonished must see owne safety forsake standing tackle endued zeale god cause selfe time place shall easily giue v counsell doe let power goodnesse god also comfort v wherby see paule often defended delyuered hauing let v manfully defend vocation hauing stedfast course gotten gole may obteyne rewarde eternall life sauiour iesus christ whome praise honor power glorie euer amen cxv homelie noblest birth among thessalonica receyued worde diligence minde searched scripture daylie whether thing euen many beleeued also worshipfull woman greekes men fewe iewes thessalonica knowledge worde god preached paule berrhoea came mooued people ymmediatly brother sent away paule go sea silas timotheus abode still guyded paule brought vnto athens receyued commaundement vnto silas timotheus come speede went way although kyngdome sauiour iesus christ daylie continually assaulted world prince thereof yet little ouerthrowne myddle persecution prosperously commeth forwarde contynuall hystorie booke declareth chiefely discourse thing done paule laboured apostle else suffered grieuous persecution found euerywhere enimies fayth whose craft still chased dryuen away often rage enimies compelled auoyde place often left seede god worde mindes hearer caryed gospell place still wanne vnto christ lord luke wryteth done macedonia hearde howe vniustly vnworthyly intreated philippi yet epistle wrote vnto philippian declareth laboured vaine persecution cause went vnto thessalonian amongs whome taught three sabboth dayes length driuen thence also olde enimies iewes faith christ could driuen taken roote many men harte hee come vnto berrhoea preacheth gospell great auayle thing serue comfort v attempt world deuill salomon sayth counsel lord counsell deuise christ haue power heauen earth border boundes kingdomes shoulde stretched ouer worlde wherefore must needes come passe much heauen earth shall sooner fayle decree ordynances god let v see present place declareth thing paule dyd berrhoea beginneth commendation iewes berrhoea berrhoea lyghtened gospell declaring howe prosperously order gospell proceeded among commendeth comparing thessalonian men contumeliously reiected worde god berrhoea towardnesse better zeale receyued readynesse minde searching scripture themselues home examined tried thing paule taught touchstone hereof came passe great multitude beleeued example manye greekes gentyles well men woman brought vnto fayth christ example teacheth v maner men ought profytably heare gospell aboue thinges necessarie haue certayne readynesse minde receyue vnlesse worde maye haue place gyuen mindes men bring forth fruite wherefore stumble verie thresholde euen beginning disdaine heare worde peculiar marke child deuill iohn christ teacheth example well obserued prowde nobilitie byrth vaunt themselues therof vaine cognizaunces badge howbeit touching generation fleshe men alyke corrupt maketh v child sinne seede regeneration worde god quickened minde spirite seruauntes sinne borne child god therfore neyther noble gentle giue place herevnto borne againe made child god wherefore luke truely calleth people berrhoea noble studie desyre vnto worde meane season yet must take heede much facilitie least hastily receyuing whatsoeuer taught vnder pretence god worde learne false opinion caryed vncertayne doctrine blast winde therefore must weygh expende examine whatsoeuer sayde canon holye scripture according saying paule trye prooue thinges thess keepe good iohn apostle sayth beloued beleeue euery spirite iohn try spirites whether god two notable errours confuted place haue grieuously troubled church great number yeares one forbidding laytie common reade holy scripture yet god would haue alwaye common sortes men made lawe ende multitude israel called vnto holye ghost ordeyned bookes scripture shoulde written none vulgare tongue sure absurde matter exclude anye man doctrine eternall lyfe seeing god would haue same1 tim knowledge thereof come vnto men errour holde haue doctrine iudged man lyke arrogant cyclopicall gyauntes chalenge themselues authoritie teache church yea say intollorable hereticall man demaund reason accout say better paule suffred sermon examined according rule scripture else shall heretike dayes doth people berrhoea counted noble true chyldren god yea howe say paule submit himselfe vnto censure godly wordes eyther paule aungell heauen preach gospell galat hath bene preached ought accursed christ sayth propertie sheepe know voyce iohn voyce straunger follow voyce onely howbeit short role recount beleeuers luke rehearseth must also consydered see gathered togither al kinde men fyrst many iewes beleeue althoughe forsaking nation euen hande yet god vtterly forgetteth couenaunt according promise esay preserueth certaine remnaunts unto adioyned certaine noble chiefe woman gentyles length dyuers men besides numbred whereby appeareth grace god giuen v christ appertayneth sortes men none excluded eyther cause countrie nation sexe whatsoeuer condition christ iesu neyther iewe gentyle galat bondman free man woman c thing serueth comfort v teacheth euerie man mindefull christian societie contempne man ouer insolently comparison himselfe let v see satan attempted berrhoea kingdome christthe disturbance church berrhoea verily euen dyd otherwheres suffer go forwarde knoweth hyndereth ouerthroweth kingdome bicause could fynde none citie meete serue turne calleth iewes thessalonica hearing disdayning fayth christ went forwarde berrhoea come flying post haste cause great sturre tumulte also satan therfore vseth lyke pollicie sawe vsed lystra propertie also dayes perceyue want disturber christes kingdome one place bring fetch marueyle see howe nymble monkes accomplishing matter whome deuill craftily sende abroade onely city also king courtes priuie counsel cause prince bewitched suggestion shut eares doctrine truth meane season marke incurable malice iewes wherewith netled themselues doe onely refuse fayth christ also suffer illuminated without cause paule earnestly reprehendeth fyrst epistle thessalonian seconde chapter lyke vnto men dayes giue themselues deuill instrumentes impugne fayth christ thereby seeke great commendation yet let remember shal haue iudgement whereof shewed example vppon iewes woonder whole worlde holy ghost long agone prophecyed psal shoulde brused yron rodde christ would corrected amended worde want example mightie king haue founde reuengefull sentence christ true great losse hynderaunce whereof bicause haue alreadie large intreated otherwheres thys time contented haue spoken fewe wordes doe brother middest hurlye burlye paule departeth berrhoea leaue paule bryars daunger refuse giue counsell helpe rather leauing silas timotheus daunger remaine berrhoea conuey paule away vsing therein great singuler diligence take iourney towarde sea turne course come athens whence paule afterwarde wrote fyrst epistle thessalonian seemeth helde waye directly bicause woulde auoyde wayte iewes sawe raged hatred paule furthermore obserued loue kindnesse berrhoea shewe vnto teacher doubteth attempt matter onely much expence labour also great daunger nothing could let go godly duetie bicause right iudgement benefyte gospell receyued thinke small matter shewe outwarde duetie reuerence gift eternall saluation nowe dayes bicause fewe men iudge rightly god grace offered gospell wil susteyne labour perill time commeth passe suffer daunger christes cause tyme molested greater care cause lesse godly place furthermore teacheth v wisedome fayth maye well stande togyther christ commaundeth v beware wylinesse men math vse wisedome serpent haue neede therof bicause child worlde luke christ himselfe witnesseth wiser generation child light yet let v remember must appoynt certaine boundes vnto wisedome fleshe doe nothing counsell perswasion thereof duetie wherein better safe remedy submyt vnderstanding vnto obedience fayth paule otherwheres teacheth v shall come passe shall neyther tempt god putting selues rashely daunger dishonestly forsake truth holde myddle way dooing duetie hereafter raigne iesus christ whome serue heauen whome praise honor power glory euer amen cxvj homelie paule wayted athens spirite mooued hym sawe citie giuen worshipping image disputed synagoge wyth iewes deuout person market daylie came vnto chaunce certaine philosopher epicure stoikes disputed sayde babler say sayde seemeth tydings bringer new deuils bicause preacheth vnto iesus resurrection tooke brought mar hys seate saying maye wee knowe thys newe doctrine whereof thou speakest thou bringest straunge tydings eares would know therfore thing meane athenian straungers gaue themselues nothing else either tell heare newe thing euangelist luke hytherto hath described dyuers iourneys wandrings paule apostle reason whereof lyghtened manye nation city preaching gospell sayde otherwheres without cause laboured apostle least man might thinke drawne ignoraunt vnlearned men onely artifyciall elaborate kinde eloquence came length athens without certaine aduise god prouydence thinke famous citie euer wasthe prayse athens antiquitie passed many hyr king cecrops time moses afterwarde renowmed reason victory achieued persian shee purchase vnto hir selfe immortall commendation delyuering greece handes barbarous people happy pregnancie sharpnesse wytte passed hyr haue thanke socrates plato zenophon crate infinite others famous reason wisedome cause hir founded certaine vniuersitie schoole whole world wherevnto noble men resorted partes worlde vnto onely sea castell wisedome fame hir wisedome romaine ouercome asia thought child could worlde better infourmed preceptes wisedome maners lyuing athens preface cicero sonne vppon bookes office duty testifyeth euen many thing also religion honouring god seemed excell others bicause hir seene ymage minerua thought haue comme downe heauen manye person athens whome gloryed accounted goddes thys citie lorde sende paule apostle bring ministerie vnto obedience fayth attempted without good successe profyte ende well prooued notable example goodnesse god power gospell would acknowledge vnspeakeable grace god heareth citie vtterly drowned darknesse ydolatrie humaine wisedome fauourably regarded god againe marueyle inuincible power gospell seeth wisest men world confounded ministerie paule brought nothing pryntes roddes whippes driuen many city estimation worlde therfore hystorie conuersion athens worthy consydered fyrst part whereof luke rehearseth place declaring fyrst paule next howe doctrine receyued fyrst preached men citie fyrst preached speake eche thing order paule abyding athens comming silas timotheus paule taketh occasion preach athens walked meane season rounde citie consydering maners vsages much pretermytteth temple goeth veweth oracion hereafter shall appeare perceyuing greatest citie yet seene gyuen idolatrie drowned therein waxeth feruent spirite mislyking god religion wise prophaned god offended sinne ydolatrie mindes godly prouoked see bicause holde nothing deere glorie soueraigne god hereof came passe moses sawe golden calfe almost forgetting hymselfe brake table lawe beateth calfe vnto powder throweth water intent ydolaters might drinke let downe calfe belly elia incensed lyke zeale kylled priestes baal owne hande whome iehu directly followed holy scrypture commended therefore scripture teacheth v iosias like zeale burned bone ydolaters vpon owne aultars men might perfytely see indignitie wickednesse shall saye prophetes scarce vsed force wyt eloquence thing speaking agaynst ydolatrie ymages spared neyther earnest game blase deface thing hatefull vnto god contumacie stubbornesse therefore thys daye much marueyled woondered taken christian gospeller yet holde ymages fyght brother professe fayth christ odious name call whose zeale commended many testimony scripture example holy men fyghters image image breaker meane season paules example teacheth v fruitefully commendation traueyle christes quarrell kingdome god haue neede indewed zeale impietie verie obstinate tough euill neuer pulled vp without verie feruent zeale let example christ stirre vp v zeale seing father house turned market place fayre one forgotten accustomed myldenesse made whyp cordes next hande draue wicked marchauntes temple calling disciple mindes saying dauid zeale thine house hath euen eaten vp iohn psal consideration lord prayer putteth v minde duetie chiefe peticions wherof name god sanctifyed kingdome come howe shall vnfayned mindes praye thing whome vnhallowing name god ouerthrowing kingdome toucheth mooueth therefore hollow hearted people handling religion neyther hote colde contrarie saying elia halt side gaping get great praise addict side lyke friendly partes heard regarded sometime ye people laodicia christ threatneth apoc spewe mouth returne vnto paule doth fret disdaine within himselfe paule disputeth athens religion bicause ye ydolatry yt seeth nay mindeth reforme great citie straunger name amongst forthwith therfore reasoneth true religion beginneth preach iesus christ pray many thing haue kept would haue yeelded reason flesh mought haue thought wilt thou bolde notable citie improoue religion many yeres antiquity established prosperous successe glorious victory heretofore wilt thou haue doe men fyne wit red disputation hauing scarcely learned principle philosophie knowest thou howe odious daungerous alteration chiefly wherof straungers forreyners author common reason sence forbiddeth curious men common weales infynite like thyngs thought recourced paules minde bycause man long experience learned meete euery thing done leauing reason setteth boldlye matter teaching occupyed god vocation example admit reason flesh might procure doyng dutie prophetes apostle bene ruled reason neuer shoulde anye haue done dutie rather lyke ionas shoulde haue prouided themselues haue escaped sea see moses straue agaynst god commaundement refused charge long followed owne reason compared impediment speach exod lacke skill god commaundements let v consider therefore thinges depende vppon god pleasure easily make way plaine walke calling sharpe double edged sworde piercing euen marrowe heb ierem deuouring fyre deuiding stone therefore encouraged herewith let v boldly enterprise whatsoeuer god commaundeth v leauing successe matter cannot ioyful vnto folow conduct leading furthermore luke declareth order paule followed setting forth kingdome christ among atheniansafter maner paule taught athens first reasoned iewes touching matter bicause knewe woulde easily giue eare vnto brought moses prophetes done taketh instruct tasted syncere fayth religion keeping company iewes yet fully enformed hauing nowe layde foundation talketh euery one met withall market went farre philosopher wherof citie abundance beganne dispute agaynst among diuers sectes epicure stoikes chieflye encountred contrary opinion one another coulde yet agree togither set vpon minister truth epicure enimies wisedome good learning set perfyte felicitie pleasure yet honest pleasure sayde conteyned quietnesse mynde health body climbing higher author absurde opinion sprang hereof feare god consideration lyfe come stryketh mennes conscience dread maketh worldly thing vnpleasant denyed prouidence god also life come fabled god walked vppe downe one side heauen another regarde mortall mennes affayres soules died aswell body insomuch vsed sardanapalus like saying eate drinke make mery without measure death pleasure stoikes vtterly differing taught felicitie blysse stande vertue whych opinion though seeme plausible godly yet pulled men god much epicure bicause taught men seeke felicitie merites owne workes agayne bicause perceyued studye vertue disturbed troubled affection woulde haue follower felicitie voyde thereof neyther shoulde reioyce prosperitie shewe signifycation sadnesse aduersitie making men stone stockes deuoyde naturall motion affection whereby parent child ledde one loue another furthermore certayne concatenation connexion cause imagined fatall necessity destiny whervnto made god also subiect thing teach v paule doe also admonish v day euer haue bene enimies gospell true doctrine although time passed name epicure stoikes vse among gentile yet among people god opinion also day surely nabal somtime among iewes sayd god dauid testifyeth innumerable opinion psal also sayd lord shall see neyther shall god iacob regard psal touching later time prophecy extant christ apostle euidently teach v epicure trade sect shal reigne among v christ saith came passe dayes noah shall day sonne man eate drink luke maried maryed euen vnto day noah went arke c peter prophecieth shall come mocker ye later day shall walk owne concupiscence saye promise comming since father died thing continue estate c pet see euerywhere dayes although directly professe epicure opinion yet liue yt euery man may easily perceiue beleeue neyther god life come cannot abide light gospell bicause christ sayth euill workes reprooued iohn like wise may stoikes opinion founde age opinion helde phariseyes sometime among iewes trusted ryghteousnesse owne work greatest enimies christ sect sawe xv chapter bredde great disquietters primitiue church mingling lawe gospell togither merites work fayth dayes father doctor sprang pelagians maynteyners doctrine man woulde search lyke age fynde monkes whome may truly call sworne disciple zeno beside ascrybe felicitie vnto owne vertues teach also earnestly exact indolencie want griefe stoikes go pull vppe rootes affection nature hath sowen minde man else doe whyle commaunde parentes cast owne child penne vp monastery also teach child put away loue care parentes addict themselues wholye moonkishe rule knowen barber bleare eyed say hard vnworthy thing eyther spoken beleeued beate tender mindes must needes enimies gospell accuseth condemneth madde furious error must therefore gyue place vnto rather according paules ensample stryue earnestly agaynst waye must doe taught ensample doubt philosopher defended matter quaynt fallacy many wordes paule auoyding vaine contention wordes setteth iesus christ onely resurrection declaring two thing sufficient conuince dotage philosopher heretykes god sent iesus christ worlde purge sinnes men saue mankynde neyther opinion epicure stoikes iusticiaries stande eyther saye god regardeth thing appertaining man attribute saluation merytes workes agayne resurrection deade must needes followe another lyfe therefore folly set felicitie pleasure present worlde might extended sectes heresy may suffyse admonishe fayth saluation conteyned knowledge iesus christ article resurrection whosoeuer well instructed herein easily able confute maner heresy therfore order saluation playne needeth much demonstration wordes vayne quiddity sophistrie time past coulde boldly vrge way easily get victory heretykes neuer subtle witted seemeth good place shewe sozomenus reporteth haue chaunced certayne logitian expert dialecticall quiddity councell nice logitian euery day gaue newe onset vpon byshops affiance dexteritie wit skyll logicke dysputed none coulde get holde aduauntage certayne simple man naturethis storye written sozomenus booke chap author hath folowed ruffinus reporting x booke ecclesiasticall story chap shalte thou reade tolde circumstance knewe nothing iesus christ hym crucifyed tooke hym hande sayde philosopher name iesus christ hearken vnto truth one god made heauen earth gaue lyfe vnto man made slyme earth created thing aswell inuisible visible power worde established made fast sanctification spirite worde wisedome call sonne pitying misery borne virgin suffering death hath deliuered v eternall death resurrection hath purchased v eternall life whome wayte come iudge doings beleeuest thou true philosopher one neuer learned skill denye thing beleeue sayth turning disciple hearde sayth long matter debated wordes set wordes wordes arte skill speaking ouerthrewe spoken steade wordes vertue power came mouth speaker wordes coulde longer preuayle power man able stryue god c mightye playne vnlearned confession christ whosoeuer blendeth subtiltye philosopher make weake feeble maye euidently seene schoole doctor conspiracie many diuers sectes agaynst truth teacheth v moreouer howe impossible preach doctrine gospell vnto world without contention forasmuch wisedome worde contrary wherevnto euer incline whether banish embrace vertue therefore deede laughed dayes woulde haue v performe neyther christ hys apostle coulde performe remayneth declare howe athenian receyued paules doctryne see two sortes men bewrayedhowe athenian receyued paules doctrine one sort receyue worde rayling saying meaneth babler tryfler men founde among professor wisedome vnfyt wisedome man perceyue kingdome god whatsoeuer preached christ lyfe euerlasting seemeth hym foolishnesse hast thou aunswere men dayes obiect vnto v authoritie wyse great men pryde worlde thing shoulde take place paule vndoubtedly ouerthrowe among athenian sort curious menne supposing paule preached newe god halfe god tooke brought vnto mar streete ye end openly giue account hys doctrine therefore gathereth infynite number ydle person aswell citizen forreyners sayth luke naught else doe euery day eyther heare tell newes thys thing god permit come passe bicause woulde haue hys sonne preached famous place worlde meane season place teacheth v condicion gospell worlde eyther dishonestly despysed manifest enimies else lyght men behauiour abuse dishonestly serue affection whych perceyue succeedeth minde become also openenimies thereof bicause thing haue thus fallen age man ought offended hereat rather followe paules constancie care one dodkin lyghtnesse world wyth strong fayth trust iesus christ sauiour though reiected seeme builder god church yet become heade stone corner prayse honor power glorye euer amen cxvij homelie pavle stoode middest mar streete sayde yee men athens perceyue thing supersticious passed behelde maner howe worship god founde aultar whereon written vnto vnknowne god whome ignorantly worshippe shewe vnto god made worlde seeing hee lorde heauen earth dwelleth temple made handes though needed anye thing seeing hee himselfe giueth lyfe breath men euery apostle paule fyrst corinthian sayeth wee preache iesus christ crucified vnto iewes occasion falling vnto greekes foolishnesse wisedome fleshe looketh onely vppon thinges hir eye perceyueth mystery god spirite cannot seeme foolishe thing vnto hir manne seeke saluation christ crucifyed openly slaundered thing paule founde true aswell athens place citie preached christ among wysest men dayes giue little eare vnto appeareth scarce preuayled lesse rayled doctryne clapped handes curiositie frame apply affection meane season great corruption menne appeareth woonderfull wysedome god coulde well vse naughty affection curious men occasion cometh passe paule brought mar hys streete publyke stage whole worlde preached gospell iesus christthe argument paules sermon argument hys sermon bring athenian superstition idolatry honor onely true god iesus christ first therefore friendly reprooueth accuseth ouermuch superstition reasoneth god true religion nycking foolishnesse thought god coulde worshipped image inuentions man length commeth nearer vnto christes cause yet time intreate fyrst part poyntes annexed beginning insinuationhis beginning briefe wherin artifycially insinuateth hymselfe comprehendeth proposition summe sermon calleth men athens bicause esteemed honorable name oration demosthenes diuers others declare olde tyme ignorant ambitious tytles wherewith nowe dayes prowde vayne men reioyce made madde drunken thynke glory standes beautie name furthermore insinuateth hymselfe friendlye mindes least myght offended wyth beginning talke refuse heare sayth perceyue ouermuch giuen superstition wisedome policie euerywhere commended religion seeme onely ouercurious also vncertayne thing therein seeme haue least knowledge wherein shoulde haue bicause man reprooue hym lying prooueth saying publike superstition certayne aultar citie sayde superstition diuers haue gone curiouslye search greeke scholes make mention one philippides whose hystory shewe say inscription thus nonlatin alphabet say god asia europa aphrica vnknowne straunge god howbeit suppose onely paule reported might haue bene suspected forger false reporter recyted superscription wherein reposed great holynesse otherwyse written behooueth v chiefely consider paules intent purpose whych prooue athenian certayne religion wherevnto stande wandred vppe downe maze opinion superstition contented wyth god gentyles owne country also worshipping vnknowne god vndoubtedly wyser sort little mooued touched hys saying therefore wythout holding longer doubt promyseth teach ye knowledge true god whome yet knewe notthe athenian superstitious nation worthy considered howe athenian erred religion aboue nation yet wysest best learned others citie flowed subtile professor philosophy erewhile sayd student partes almost worlde came heare example teacheth v howe fowly deceyued suffer youth studie diuinitie euen drunken gentyles philosophie made vtterly vnapt obedience gospell notwithstanding kinde person profyte therein abandon pregnancie owne witte submitte vnderstanding obedience fayth moreouer let v marke place howe athenian chiefly accused false religion bicause worshippe vnknowne god hereby paule prooueth haue nothing certaine religion herby appeareth religion cannot stande without true knowledge god onely paule christ also vseth argument agaynst samaritanes one blowe stryketh downe religion saying worship knowe whole scripture teacheth v iohn religion consisteth chiefely true fayth inuocation god without faith impossible body please god hebr psal come vnto god requyreth worship chiefly v trouble shoulde aske helpe deliuery hym vnlesse inspired knowledge christ neyther beleeue god call vpon rom thing paule teacheth elegant feate gradation calleth vpon name lorde sayth shall safe shall call vpon whome beleeue shall beleeue vnlesse haue hearde c beside knowe god truly turne imagination owne reason wherein appeareth euidently certaintie one argument eyther themselues dayly haue newe deuises else embrace deuises men according saying christ iohn whosoeuer drinketh water materiall drawen owne strength shall thirst againe c example prooue euerywhere extant heare athenian foolishly worshipping god publike inscription confessed knewe reade hath come passe vnto men rom thinke gentyles woulde haue chaunged glorye immortall god ymage mortall man else brute beast knowne truly woulde euery daye haue receyued newe maners honouring borrowed forren nation woulde haue thought acte parliament haue confyrmed disanulled god religion tertullian apology testifyeth romaynes foolish saying shipmayster bade ionas call vpon god happily would heare seeing called god hytherto altogither vaine thought foolishnesse gentyles elia vpbraydeth israelite calling vpon baal reg god many time complayneth howe people multiplied encreased god confesse people offended time passed yet fewe acknowledge hart hath many yeares bene done yet done pope kingdome certaintie religion pope euery day maketh newe god goddess euery daye newe kindes rytes ceremony deuised deade rest safetie bicause insatiable auarice priestes exacteth tribute fayning soules tormented purifyed fornace purgatorie vnknowne god worshipped amonge v god maozim daniel sayeth whome father knew eyther made bread chaunged breade would god men woulde nowe dayes expende thinges learne miserable case want lyght truth whoso lacketh lyght ignorant themselues thing religion esay math lose labor god neyther worshipped man tradition let v therefore harken vnto paule apostle whome god ordeyned teach blinde worlde true religion worship furthermore paule teacheth al thing second part sermon paule teacheth true knowledge god therwith also confuteth ye error gentile wherof sprang error yet bewitch world meane although subtile philosopher curious men yet disputeth subtilly god essence nature god himselfe testifyeth exo inscrutable describeth god work teaching ought beleeue worship god sayth made world thing therin conteyned seeing lorde heauen earth c seemeth speaketh agaynst epicure affirmed world euerlasting else thing came togyther concurrence meeting mote togither god care worldly thing paule sayth god creator lord world layth infallible grounde hys doctryne man denie voide common reason herofhe gathereth templary religion vayne thingthe religion temple vaine thing pryce authoritie among grecian hated persian none cause euerywhere burned temple greece bicause sawe serued superstition godlinesse thus reasoneth paule lord thing must needes euerywhere god creator thing lorde therefore present euerywhere consequence dwelleth church builded men handes sayde agaynst gentyles iudged religion stoode bewty furniture temple vnto tyed maiestie power grace god maketh agaynst glorying honour true god yet drowned dotage errour salomon bestowed great costes treasure building temple length sayth vnto god behold heauen heauens able conteyne thee reg howe much lesse church haue builded god himselfe esay cap sayth heauen seate earth footestoole therefore shall house bee builde ieremie sharpely reprehendeth iewes iere trusting religion temple yea christ sayeth true worshipper tyed vnto certayne peculiar place iohn matth sheweth v worship god euerywhere spirite truth therefore pilgrimage taken away whych foolish menne heathenish error suppose saluation chiefely stande yet vtterlye condemne vse church serue outward religion necessary profession fayth nourishing concorde vnitie whyle resort thyther heare worde god saye common prayer haue sacrament ministred wherevnto temple must ordered must thynke vnlawfull pollute kinde prophane vsages paule continueth describing godgod worshipped sacrifice saying god hath neede nothing wherevpon gathereth worshypped wyth handes religion consisteth outwarde obsequies duty men prooueth antecedent sayth giueth life breath vnto men argument impugneth vaine affiance priest whome auncestours reposed chiefe part religion seemeth paule tooke argument god wordes accuseth israelite thought worshipped pleased sacrifyces sayth take bullocke thy house psal hee goates thy foldes beastes forrest mine cattelles vppon thousande hilles knowe fowles vpon mountaines wylde beastes fielde sight hungry tell thee c argument appeareth popish religion condemned else doe religion deceyued wicked superstition esay take poore commended v christ duty offer saintes haue neede yea knowe v yea oblation serue idol voyde sens priest liue wantonly ryot meane season superstition hath taken deepe roote thought lesse offence kill man robbe take peece vayle idoll aultar clothe poore bodye maners time man maye saye god worshipped sacrifyceswherefore sacrifice serued appoynt people moses commaunde let v consider two kindes sacrifyces one expiatorie sinnes called sinnes coulde purged bloude ox gotes paule plainly denieth heb prefygured christ whome holy godly men beleeued shoulde dye sinnes worlde time long appoynted taught v also shoulde slaughter mortifye beastlye affection bring contrite heart god dauid testifyeth psal acceptablest sacrifyce god requireth another kinde gratulatoriethe sacrifice christian thankes giuing benefytes receyued yet part consisted bloud bicause yet bloud christ shed wherwith father shoulde appeased bloude therefore shed mysterie redemption accomplished remayned sacrifyce expiatorie propitiatorie sinnes christ merite sufficient neede sacrifyce epistle hebrues large teacheth v yet christian want sacrifyces yet vnbloudy since bloude christ shedde vse eyther beastes bloude mannes thing pertayning ordinary honouring god rom make themselues liuely sacrifyces vnto god offer prayer thankes giuing name christ bestow goodes money math heb meate cloth duty vpon poore whome christ hath left place duly fulfyll thing accomplishe christian religion let v therefore holde fast paules saying affyrmeth god hath neede nothing let v worship spirite truth bestowe temporall goodes vpon poore liuely image god seruice maye acceptable vnto god iesus christ whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cxviij homelie hath made one bloude nation men dwell face earth hath assigned howe long tyme also endes habitation seeke god might feele finde though farre euery one v liue mooue haue certaine owne poetes sayde wee also generation forasmuch wee generation god ought thinke godheade like vnto golde siluer stone grauen craft imagination man paule sought saying doinges chiefely perfourmed hys sermon made residue depended yesterday disputed vaine affiance temple sacrifyces teaching god conteyned within temple bicause infynite worshipped sacrifyces bicause neede nothing thinges handleth may serue confute daye esteeme religion according beautie magnifycence temple oblation nowe setteth vppon heade impietie oblation nowe setteth vppon heade impietie say feigned god ymages worshipping disputeth great earnestnesse declaring shamefull impudent error chaunge maiestie glory god immortall miserable men dumbe image bicause knewe doe brought vp superstition whome verye harde matter perswade heapeth number thing togither make error seeme heynous doubt paule intreated matter large although luke hath noted chiefe poyntes thereof shall speake order first declareth beginning manthe beginning mankind teacheth worshippe one god god sayth one bloude made mankinde manifest men nation degree soeuer come adam whereto doth paule alleage gather two thing wordes make much purpose haue hande one haue one maker one beginning ought deuided sundry religion ought rather ioyne myndes study togither worshippe one creator therefore nicketh leuitie gentyles onely worship one false god imagining diuers manye goddes marueylously disagreed among themselues one thing yet agreeing altogither swarued way truth hereof ought generall doctrine learned howe offende agaynst order nature religion bring sectes diuision author occasion men forgette beginning neglect maker therefore greater offence commonlye menne weene would god argument might take place among christian professing one creator one kinde beginning glorying one iesus christ sauiour men doe yet let themselues euery daye deuided newe sectes pull awaye god creator christ sauiour truly pittied authoritie argument shoulde lesse force nowe dayes among christian men tymes past among gentyles thing paule gathereth mannes origine beginning goddes neyther ought made men error spredde euerywhere among gentyles playne vnto men somtimes bene men whome worshipped goddes creta kept iupiters cradell image delos ilande apollo diana citie thebae renowmed reason bacchus hercules borne venus countrie borne called cypria marce thracius vulcan leninius priapus lampsacenus paule teacheth v foolishe opinion beleeue god time past bene men forasmuch mankinde come one bloude argument worshipping saintes ouerthrowne whome popish religion euident worshipped god needeth long demonstration prayer made vnto inuocated called men distress temple aultars dedicated sacrifyce done vnto holye dayes appointed glory health recouered ascribed vnto howbeit knowe menne men subiect lyke infyrmities paule confessed people lystrae furthermore scripture testifyeth sinner apostle according christes commaundement prayed forgiue v trespass c aswell therefore cannot nowe become god gouernors worlde yet despyse yet bereaue honour due acknowledge singular instrument god grace affyrme meere grace god euerywhere confesse themselues wherefore shoulde absurde thing v sticke depende vpon goddes rather doctrine ensample trust onely god iesus christ whome scripture hath set vnto v mediator surely thinke saintes haue greater iniurie done vnto haue glory god earnestly defended ascribed thought good maintaine glorye yea shedding owne bloude prouydence teacheth v one god ought worshippedbut let v returne vnto paule sayth menne onely made god also placed dwell vpon earth least man might hereof inferre epicure opinion thinke god giuen ye earth vse pleasure declareth commeth passe eternall decree god prouidence god sayeth hath appoynted time endes habitation god hath appoynted euery nation people country border hath ordeyned time season according decree eternall prouidence men shall borne shall die therefore nothing commeth passe earth chaunce without prouidence god thinges doth paule alleage ende prooue people ought occupied honoring one god hath giuen thing behoofe whose prouidence gouerned preserued thus confuteth common error gentyles euery countrie god patrone defender athenian thought themselues safetie vnder godheade pallas ephesus gloryed diana hir defender people cyprus chosen venus bee lady gouernesse carthage liued vnder protection iuno romaine trusted mar progenitor president yea farre went superstition house hir peculiar proper god belonging hir error gate also among christian citie taken saint whose defence thought selfe safegarde paule prooueth god distributer country onely president people present euerywhere needeth substitute uicare supplye hys rowme marke well waye howe paule attributeth vnto god prescience also prouidence whereby gouerneth country nation whose ordinance whatsoeuer thinges done worlde come passe becke dependeth alteration mutation realmes scripture declareth speciallye prophecy daniel concerning fower monarchy worlde upon prouidence depende priuate men doings god dauid sayth taketh vp simple dust psal setteth prince people haue example saule dauid ieroboam cyrus ottomanne infynite others let daily example passe yea god prouidence abaseth selfe downe euen vnto thinges small regarde whyle careth birdes ayre math garnisheth flower fyelde numbreth heares heade let v therfore bidde auaunt acknowledge god nothing prescience imagine ydle beholder thing done worlde let v rather beleeue thinges ordered gouerned prouidence thys maketh much godly ordering lyfe aduersitie bringeth small comfort thing thus premised sheweth ende men made earth giuen dwell namelythe ende man creation teacheth v worship god seeke lorde seeke lorde busily occupied vocation knowledge searching worshipping onely seruing heartes ende wherevnto man ordeyned scripture testifyeth surely good reason whome god hath giuen souereigne power ouer creature shoulde agayne wholy giue themselues vnto paule maketh mention hereof declare knowe ende created vnworthy dwell earth bicause forsaken true god worshipped counterfeyte goddes dumbe ymages place appeareth woonderfull corruption mankinde consider ende wherefore man made shall appeare doth nothing lesse ought doe dutie seeke god whome kinde blisse felicitie reposed part men vse rather followe vnstable rich vncertayne honor fylthie pleasure worlde seeme religious gyuen rather worshipping creature god impudently go whoring peruersitie much intollerable esay ierem bicause creature doe dutie diligently man alone forgetfull least thing god requyreth myght seeme difficult impossible man performe paule preoccupationgod better creation man ymages cutteth away kindes obiection sayth seeke god shall fynde hym euen felt hym meaning offreth hymselfe euerywhere sens whyle visible workes reuealeth v inuisible power wisedome goodnesse sheweth large rom surely part worlde abiect creature simple setteth eies vnspeakable power god appeareth rude ylfauoured clottes earth yet haue marueylous force bring forth fruite see alteration entercourse time perpetuall motion heauen tempestes kinde heauenly influence yea beholde well little flower thou shalt inforced woonder infynite power singular wisedome maker bicause woulde haue bene endlesse labour haue runne parcel worlde blockishnesse number able searche fynde nothing without themselues god insinuateth himselfe neerer v farre v liue mooue haue euen generation kynne confesse liueth power meane seeing man reason cannot compassed howe infant liueth nourished mother belly doth acknowledge power creator marueylous workemanship mannes bodye proportion agreement member sense moouing vse denye haue power seeing beset rounde manye daungers yet escape euery day perceyueth certaine token godly seede v considereth perpetuall moouings operation soule hir immortalitie whole dignitie man whereby passeth creature therefore dulnesse man doth acknowledge god inexcusable also absurditie madnesse counterfeyte dumbe ymages god seeing beare v liuely ymage god athenian myght better vnderstande also ashamed thereof citeth testimonie aratus poete declare preacheth newe doctrine tyme bene heard wyse men tymes past learned euen nature lore grosse barbarous suffred naturall notice knowledge extinguished god expressed ymageat length concluding place thus inferreth forasmuch generation god wee must thinke godheade lyke vnto golde siluer stone grauen arte industrye man calleth v generation god chiefely bicause ymage made yet place speake adoption elect yet vnderstoode principle knowledge god meaning therefore god woulde haue hys ymage shyne man lorde gouernor creature grosse error forge dumbe ymage hym deade thing cannot counterfeyte man image god bicause ymage soule whose forme nature mannes arte expressed shadowed howe much lesse manne expresse god anye image nameth fyrst precious matter golde siluer shewing able represent ymage god howe much soeuer esteemed among menne yet frayle thinges corruptible god incorruptible euerlasting furthermore speaketh formes fashion man pleasure giueth vnto god arte industry man shoulde say although singularest artifycers maysters woulde lay heades togither yet able conceyue mindes esa much lesse expresse matter image true image god hereof gather image made god lie bicause able performe promise pray greater iniurie done vnto god make eternall truth like vnto lye else make god deuill whome christ calleth father lye honest man woulde contented represented made lyke vnto murtherer ruffyan honest matrone sermon wherein exhorteth repentance christ namely shoulde conuert turne impietie false worship goddes vnto true god place bicause epicure laughed kinde religion earnestly vrged mention last iudgement declare eche thing order paule vttereth first aunswereth question vsed mooued agesan aunswere alleage ignorance forefather error dayes euerywhere obiected truth preached saye god hath suffered worlde manye yeares seduced whether likely nowe length truth disclosed fewe person name estimation paule aunswereth demaundes briefely howe god hath hitherto winked tymes ignorance bicause delyteth ignorance bicause seemed good vnto appoynteth thinges according iust iudgement worlde coulde choose erre long god hid light truth bicause men themselues haue feeling vnderstanding god sayth truth hydden worlde tymes nowe reuealed declareth henceforth ignorance shall excused worthy noted howe paule alleaging god simply barely mooueth disputation concerning cause god suffered worlde long erre must also followe tracke modestie wade deepe searching au e god iudgements charge cause vngodlynesse euident man wrong bicause long sithence deserued eternall damnation borne child wrath also euident gouerneth thinges iust iudgement paule another place speaking reuelation gospell sayth mystery hidden beginning worlde rom christ teacheth math saying mystery kingdome heauen reuealed euery one therefore folly malapert wicked offence call god dooings controlment mannes reason seeing requireth v obedience fayth seeing nothing well becommeth child god frame themselues vnto appeareth worde workes furthermore paule place expresseth ende preaching gospell forasmuch sayth declared euery man shoulde repent therfore ynough haue heard learned gospell behooueth v repent v error vice order course whole story gospell teacheth v iohn baptist beginneth doctrine repentaunce christ cryeth repent kingdome heauen hande apostle preach likewyse commaundement last luke gospell prescribeth order teaching fyrst repentaunce shoulde preached name forgiuenesse sinnes order booke epistle doe sufficientlye testifye diligently obserued therefore falsly impudentlye call themselues gospeller holde former error licentiously followe vice suffer minister reprooue maners though man shoulde desire phisition maintayne health yet woulde haue withstande sickenesses applye thereto conuenient dyet remedy taught moreouer man excused god eyther ignorance predecessor time passed auncestors erred age passed iust iudgement god dissembled bare error reuealeth certayne longer beare error requyreth repentaunce men thing whoso performeth contemners grace offred therfore deserue grieuous punishment thing shoulde well obserue vnder plausible pretence forefather auncient superstitiousnesse persecute gospell fyre sworde shall neuer escape iudgement god whereof paule reasoneth present place alleageth cause wherefore god nowe reuealeth worde vnto gentyleshe vrgeth repentaunce terrour last iudgement saying hath appoynted day wyll iudge worlde righteousnessec thus layeth eye auncient vsage god neuer punisheth sinner abundantly tolde warned doe nothing fyrst reuealeth vnto seruauntes prophet amos haue euery example onely scripture also story gentyles neede stande long rehearsall better v consyder order last iudgement paule briefly plainly toucheth fyrst bycause epicure sectary declareth god hath appoynted day iudgement bicause none hickscornelyke deryde mention therof2 pet thing peter teacheth v certaine kers doe paule sayth whole consent scripture prooueth herevnto appertaine thing spoken last chapter daniel christ also often inculcateth iohn math cor rom sayde place must also come iudgement seat christ doth iustice god plainely requyre coulde meanes stand iudgement euery man shall receyue condigne rewarde according workes worlde see part godly afflicted without anye renumeration wicked rage ryot without check declareth shall thus iudged naming worlde article faith expresse quick dead therefore none shall escape day sayde shall come iudgement seate god respect person god neyther man bleare eye thing ought make great men puffed vp worldly pride mindefull modestie humilitie thirdely declareth maner fashion iudgement saying shall iudge righteousnesse therefore shall place colour pretence haue synned vnder lawe shall beare sentence lawe haue sinned without lawe rom shall condempned without lawe euery man shall receyue according hath done body ought remember entisements sinne2 cor fleshe creepe vpon v pull v duetie also glorie rich worlde prouoketh v sinne shall man giue redemption life daye seuere iudge shall pronounce sentence according tenor iustice finally math defyneth iudge whome god shall iudge worlde ver ly man whome hath ordeyned calleth christ bicause humaine nature meaning vse tollerable name among vnbeleeuing ende might come little little speake mystery christ without cause scripture euerywhere declares christ shall iudge maketh much comfort godly heare shall iudge knowe sauiour byshop hereof gather shall rather reuenger iudge iob calleth cap afrayde sentence damnation hande whome beleeue offered crosse againe wicked great terror thinke shall come iudge whome haue wickedly contemned shall looke vpon whome pierced zach iohn psal perpetuall hindraunce losse shall constrayned abyde iudgement whome would acknowledge redeemer nowe bicause paule hath made mention christ beginneth intreate mysterieshe preacheth christ treatise man maye doubt prolixe diligent mentioned luke noteth chiefe pointes onely abundantly declare paules oration doctrine three number first sayth predestinate appointed god euerlasting elsewhere sayd1 pet appeareth promise declare ordeined sauiour mankinde euen beginning hereof gather paule otherwheres teacheth saluation commeth grace without anye desert ephes man bragge hath deserued euerlasting sonne god appointed sauiour secondly sayth god christ hath perfourmed promise vnto men meaning promise fygures prophecy wherein long agone saluation comprysed fulfylled wherevnto christ ready yeelde vp ghost respect sayd finished perfourmed resurrection shewed behooued thynges shoulde perfourmed scripture might fulfylled wrytten moses luc prophetes psalmes vppon gather fowly erre shewe newe waye saluation christ else doe reprooue god christ lying see touching poynt iohn beleeueth god maketh lyer c thirdly maketh mention christes resurrection meaning thereby prooue god iudge men argument vseth also rom also comprehendeth whole businesse redemption rose agayne surely dyed dyed sayde elsewhere sinnes rom raysed agayne iustification bicause haue oftentimes discoursed poyntes haue occasion euerywhere intreate fewe shall suffyse present effect doctrine christ among atheniansnow remayneth effect doctrine diuers variable according diuersitie hearer fyrst mention resurrection mocke scoffe namely epicure sect wherof great number dayes somewhat better desired heare dispute againe touching point therby declaring somewhat tasted truth againe whose heart god illuminated spirite beleeue openly ioyne themselues vnto paule euerywhere fulfylled saying paule gospell sauour death vnto death sauour lyfe vnto lyfe among beleeued dyonisius accounted man great dignitie one number iudges called areopagitae also damaris woman likelyhoode great dignitie estimation bicause mention made hir name wherefore gospell neuer preached without fruite profyte although fewe beleeue fyrst yet great famous congregation growe small beginninges hystories declare came passe athens duty offended paucitie small number beleeuers embrace thankefull mindes gospell saluation may bring forth v worthy fruites maye attayne vnto saluation promise thereof iesus christ lorde whome bee prayse honour power glorye euer amen xviij chapiter vpon actes apostle cxx homelie paule departed athens came corinthus founde certaine iewe named aquila borne pontus lately come italy wyfe priscilla bicause emperour claudius commaunded iewes depart rome hee drewe vnto bycause craft abode wrought craft make tentes preached synagoge euery sabboth daye exhorted iewes gentyles sylas timotheus come macedonia paule constrayned spirite testifie iewes iesus christ euangelist luke chapiter went shewed v howe athens conuerted notable citie reason schoole wisedome therein also bicause manifolde fame religion next vnto handsomely ioyneth hystorie conuersion corinth vnto christ rich corrupt city hystory power spirit christ efficacie gospell brightly woonderfullye shyned paule called church corinth seale apostleship1 cor corinth aswell reason hi situation betweene two sea rich famouswhat maner citie corinth also merchandyzes traffike vsed baytes entycementes number merchauntes resorting thither partes coastes infected wyth moste corrupt maners insomuch ryotousnesse thereof nowe noted publyke prouerbes corinthiari vt graecari c men woulde speake person giuen great ryote sensualitie woulde saye played corinthian common saying people mouthes euery man maye come vnto corinth among vice whoredome chiefely reigned wherevnto giuen venus temple thousande damosel nunnes purpose afterward euen among professed christ one vnlawfully kept company stepmother vntill paules censure appoyntment excommunicated citie commeth paule went athens without ordinance god ende successe declared lorde vouchsafe saue elect pumpe sinnefulnesse preaching gospell great many people moreouer citie giueth v ensample goodnesse god towarde sinner also vertue power gospell man woulde compare abiect base estate paule straunger vnknowne indurate custome sinne glorious shewe ryches abundaunce delyghtes entycements pleasure euerye side pompe pryde merchauntes attempt shall seeme altogither ridiculous woulde go reforme lyfe religion thing seemed ridiculous iudgement fleshe wanted prosperous successe giuen lorde wythin yeare halfe preaching gospell spirite christ therwith working paule set newe face vppon citie vniuersallye reformed thing lawmaker howe great authoritie euer bene coulde haue bene able haue perswaded without cause paule reioyseth much conuerting citie considering founde effectuall working gospell also seemeth mee cause luke diligent describing hystorie insomuch prosecuteth large least circumstance thereof thing place eyther vtterly letteth passe else onely toucheth lightly waye thing ought stirre vppe also diligent attention consider first foremost maketh mention place paule hosted fynding whereof aquila paules hoste suppose paule vsed great circumspection bicause christ gaue apostle peculiar commaundement touching prouiding commodious fytte hostes paule therefore founde host called aquila iewe borne pontus long reason claudius emperor proclamation wyfe priscilla fayne depart rome come vnto corinth time state iewes verye miserable bicause vengeance god followed embrued bloude sonne god al place came passe also denied christ sauiour fayne euery day seeke newe sauiours make newe stirres vprores menne worthily hated aquila therefore violently caryed common calamitie whole nation also banished yet without prouidence god prepared paule lodging among corinthian vsed helpe laying foundation famous church thus commeth oftentimes passe thing fyrst seemed v grieuous intollerable yet length cause great commoditie profyte therefore paule diuers occasion taketh vp lodging man besides well instructed fayth fortune banished others made ye gentle vnto straungers dwell liue lyfe home part contemne furthermore occupation paule saye sower maker tentes dayes made hydes skynnes commodious apostle dwell bicause might trade helpe get liuing shall good consider yet diligently aquila paules person aquila giueth v notable example faith charitie man handycraft colde water one hys disciple shall last day take whatsoeuer done member done vnto himselfe lykewyse paule notable singuler vertues seene argument constant fayth offended course lodging woulde therefore forsake corinth knewe god vsed choose despysed thing worlde wyth set forth hys kingdome confusion seeme owne conceyte excellent singular agayne exerciseth loue equitie paule getteth liuing labor hys handes sitteth ydle aquila house layeth handes worke getteth lyuing honestly example worthye singular commendation doe naughtily apply exact minister labour handes though meete liue wage sortes shall one daye feele iudgement god suffer church slenderly regarded naught paule preacheth corinth bicause paule came corinth end sowe tent set kingdome christ also declared waye sought saluation iustifycation workes thereof taught therefore men sinner able themselues satisfie lawe thereby easily gathered must sought whose merite men might saued commodious waye come vnto mylke luke wryteth length vpon occasion offered earnestly handeled christes cause silas timotheus come macedonia beganne pull wyttes togyther eyther heard gospell good successe among macedonian else troubled minde miserable case blindenesse famous citie whose heart would mooued see notable citie running headlong hir owne mischiefe destruction see ignorance sort men miserably deceyuing themselues king priest father praise honor power glorie euer amen cxxj homely sayd contrary blasphemed shooke rayment sayde vnto bloud vpon owne heades henceforth go blamelesse vnto gentyles departed thence entred house certaine man called iustus worshipper god whose house ioyned hard synagoge howbeit one crispus chiefe ruler synagoge beleeued lorde housholde many corinthian gaue audience beleeued baptised spake lorde paule nyght vision afrayd speake thee man shall inuade thee shall hurt thee haue much people citie contynued yeare sixe moneths taught worde god sauiour iesus christ many tymes testifyed chiefe cause whye came worlde saue sinner apostle beyng mindefull hereof vsed preache doctrine saluation vnto notable synners bring felloship christ church behooued begynning bicause none shoulde thinke christes merite coulde ouercome heynousnesse sinnes beginne dispayre saluation may notably seene conuersion corinthe heard erewhyle naughtie corrupt citie yet paule sent thither delyuer preaching gospell brynke destruction fyrst according vsuall maner offereth saluation vnto iewes yet others deserued god regarde therefore despayre god mercie earnestly sought saluation hatefull people let v marke howe incurable impietie people wrastled also long suffering god christ sauiour ouercomming triumphing myddle thys sturre businesse written iewes gaynesayde paule iewes withstande paule stocke priestly kingdome god worthy noted nowe length contrarye gaynesaye paule moste plainely beginneth beare witnesse vnto christ hearde intreate law certayne pointes certayne sabboth day togither willingly done corinth see commeth passe nowe dayes euerywhere sort borne withall nicke manifest abuse error farre many vsed doe tyme papistry assoone christ vrged glory plainly manifestly defended become starke madde seemed modest cause euill without preaching christ reprehension colde weyght taulkes philosopher may reade disputed great shewe learning touching study vertue miserable condicion vice christ entring heart men cutteth awaye euen quicke corruption aswell religion manner liuing therefore consequence necessarily followe doctrine seeme worlde intollerable doctrine followeth hinderance rather bidding frowarde wicked person adewe turneth gentyles least might seeme doe anye thing heate passion mynde diligently obserueth trade prescribed christ first shaketh garment declared antioch xiij chap may seene learned ceremonie meaneth next threateneth punishment declaring perished owne default saying bloude vpon owne heade hence goe blamelesse vnto gentyles alludeth vnto wordes god written ezechiel cap sort thou sonne man haue made thee watchman ouer house israel whereas thou hearest thing mouth thou may est warne behalfe say vnto wicked thou wicked thou shalt surely dye thou giuest warning maye beware vngodly way shall wicked dye owne sinne bloude require thy hande neuerthelesse thou warne wicked waye turne whereas hee yet bee turned shall dye bicause sinne thou hast deliuered thy soule unto wordes say paule alluded saying haue done duetie sette iesus christ onely authour saluation bicause reiect culpable owne perdition fault thereof gette gentyles thus threateneth christ doth sayth vnto scribe math kingdome god shall bee taken giuen nation shall bring forth fruites thereof sayde vnto iewes let contemners gospell thinke sayd vnto gospell god offereth v remedye destruction must needes perishe iust iudgement god wickedly despyse meane season paules teacheth v minister worde blamelesse haue faithfully fulfylled dutie towarde sinner teaching rebuking exhorting dumbe dogges esay describeth cap shall bloud perishe requyred say god shall make guiltie bloud shedde negligence scripture euerywhere setteth horrible guiltynesse bloude see gene numer psal
