gather worde god paule minded leaue citie seeing little hope doe good learne example euen seruants god also subiect vnto affection otherwhiles afrayde forgette dutie paule suffred corinth diuers founde true greater ruine abraham father beleeuing forsaken natiue countrie shewed notable proofe fayth ouercome feare stayned good name fowle lye brought wife great perill daunger iacob hauing oftentimes founde god ayder helper afrayde go meete brother esau moses fearing tyranny pharao flieth madian scarce woulde returne againe egypt god calling iosue valiant warrier discomfyted one ouerthrowe people declareth feare conceyued minde vnmanly weeping mourning reade howe dauid stripling ouercame goliath man growen gotten many victory feared oftentimes threates attemptes saule helias whome neyther sight tyrannie achab furie people coulde withholde killing priestes baal afrayde threates one syllye woman iesabel tooke hys heeles desired god might die shall speake peter afrayde company harnessed men quite dismayde worde one symple wench denyed christ manye like example might rehearsed repeate ende detect infyrmities falles holy men bicause consyderation serueth little instruction knowe owne infyrmitie thereby knowledge wherof maketh v trust much selfe admonished charitie rashly condemne men otherwise haue deserued well seeme doe otherwise becommeth god haue token common imperfection appeare euen also much addicted vnto forgette grace god wrought singular workes meane season must helpe prayer eyther may beware fall else may god grace speedily rise agayne deutie christ vse towardes disciple gospell declareth luc iohn let v consider god person comforteth fearethe diligence god comforting bee although mention made call vppon god therefore god doth onely heare open desire minde cry seeth secret sobbes gronings heart helpeth comforteth needefull bicause oft time commeth passe compassed euery side aduersitie able word declare desire heart fulfylled god promiseth prophete esay cap shall come passe euer call shall aunswere yet thinking howe speake shall heare lorde speaketh moses standing redde sea cryest thou yet reade worde spake great argument goodnesse god god knoweth whereof haue neede vseth helpe v season time although sendeth v temptation teache v infyrmitie enflame v vnto godlynesse yet tempereth comfort vtterly swallowed vp sorowe let man therefore despayre soone seeing god hath infynite meanes whereby comfort helpe v place thought good vse vision oracle needefull bicause paule man comfort sawe many cause might make thinke corrupt citie regarde god word god spake conteyne three poyntes euerye whereof intreate orderlye first taketh away cause euill biddeth himfeare forbidden feare kind precept often time mentioned scripture sayth god vnto moses deut dismayed meeting king basan iosue also redy ioyne battayle ye fyue king sayd afrayd iosue lord sayth vnto ieremie called office preacher afrayde face c christ also biddeth apostle shoulde feare killed bodye coulde hurt soule omitte diuers place sort math cause god oftentimes forbiddeth seruauntes feare nothing efficacie pull menne dutie feare assoone feare conceyued heart light reason blemished cannot see needefull done deuises counsel vncertaine person feare perplexitie take hande stande throughly feare maketh men shamelesse also feare losse lyfe goodes committe moste mischieuous actes many time incurre greater daunger auoyding perill present bicause thing falleth vppon priuate men howe much necessary men publike office shoulde bolde voyde feare men offende selfe onely also whome god hath committed vnto charge exod cause wise man iethro required boldenesse minde iudges therefore god verye aptly make beginning comfort place minister must speake holde peacein second part commaundeth doe speake sayth holde thy peace manne must thinke god vsed superfluitie wordes ioyneth two togither bicause many time diuers speake yet holde peace while speake thinges thinke man offended meane keepe silence thing ought god commaundement speake meaning therefore commaundement shoulde preach gospell plainly dissemble keepe close none thinges conteyned although wist many woulde displeased therwith let minister learne haue done dutie preach worde god except preach plainely applye vnto euery man maye thinke spoken vnto vntrusty ambassadour speaketh nothing commaunded yet vttereth euery thing fauour person omitteth many thing iudged faythfull minister christ leaueth neuer small portion gospell please men see sayde hereof iere ezech math reason argumentes consolationin thirde part sheweth graue effectuall reason wherof fyrst thee one reason ought sufficient daungers whereas god almightie want nothing whome present creature able doe god without whose power cannot stande therefore dauid gathereth probably thus lorde helper feare man doe vnto psal bicause promise generall appertayneth walke vocation god menne ought applye vnto themselues affiaunce hereof beare assaultes worlde couragiously seconde reason man shall inuade thee shall hurt thee sayeth enimies enterprise shall vaine speciall promise alwayes taketh place many time commeth passe godly entangled many trouble grieuous daungers reade paule layde hand manye time yea taken brought rome sea lande ended life sworde notwithstanding thing came passe yet abideth truth god fyrst promise sure fast god saueth death neuer fayleth wherefore must walke holde vocation god fyre sworde thirde reason sayth hath much people corinth teacheth labor shall vaine bicause word god elect predestinate saluation vseth effectuall declared xiiij chapter verye notable god hath naughty citie much people athens thought hir selfe vertue wisedome passe city whereby gather openly drowned sinne moste apt receyue kingdome god iusticiaries holy one woulde seeme men iust good fareth herein sickenesses bodye sicke knowne disease doe sooner seeke phisitions diseased secret whereof ashamed sort hyde notorious open sinner doe sooner receyue doctrine saluation hypocrite swollen confydence owne righteousnesse thinke haue neede none cannot denye sinner necessitie carefull howe saued compelled seeke saluation others themselues math cause publicanes harlot preferred phariseyes kingdome god christ appointed doctrine saluation beginne reprehension sinner laying aside pryde owne righteousnesse myght learne flie vnto grace god meane season ought much comfort v lorde hath many heyres eternall saluation vntowarde nation hereby appeareth god neuer without hys seauen thousande although menne seeme wicked naught reg certainetie goddes election predestinationthe certaintie election predestination counted god elect euerlasting written booke lyfe although yet lye drowned sinne euen christ calleth sheepe yet called outward preaching drawne inwarde operation spirite yet knewe gyuen father foundation worlde layde iohn ephe consolation effectuall sinnes cannot hynder god election whome hath predestinate tyme calleth draweth maketh lyke vnto ymage sonne rom suffereth thing seperated loue moreouer howe great force god comfort ispaule taryeth corinthe appeareth paule abode whole yeare sixe moneths corinthe preached worde god pacience paule truth power god preserued seruaunt long wicked citie diligently considered aboade long among prowde vnthankefull men tyll brought vnto god heard elected fyercenesse discourtesie vsed meane season agaynst paule may easily appeare epistle example paule reprooueth rashely leaue theyr church assoone see thing succeede according desyre taught moreouer painefull thing edifye buylde church seing heare paule laboured long corinthe cor confesseth dyd plant onely yea epistle declare neede afterwarde contynuall traueyle care therefore slouth minister detestable suppose vehemencie zeale edyfying church superfluous let follow paules industrie daylie exercise fayth may make sure election vocation come inheritaunce counselleth men worship god contrarye lawe paule nowe open mouth gallio sayde iewes matter wrong euill deede yee iewes reason woulde shoulde heare question wordes name lawe looke yee selues wyll iudge matter draue seate greekes tooke sosthenes chiefe ruler synagoge smote hym iudges seate gallio cared none thing although god sendeth minister worde sheepe among wolues yet defendeth fauour protection wicked enimyes truth doe please paule found true corinth specially manye place besides feare trembling midst many daungers almost swallowed vp feare god preuenteth comfort promyseth onely safetie also great successe fruite labour traueyle promysed perfourmeth vttermost present place declareth tumulte vprore iewes raued lyke madde men hope man helpe past god secret power wonderfully saueth delyuereth hym taketh harme bycause peculiar notable example god ayde assistaunce shall vnprofytable discusse euery circumstaunce hystorie iewes beginner tumult pauleand fyrst begynners thys trouble noted iewes whome seing haue often time intreated needeth say men hauing hytherto bene quyet kept vnder repressed power god whyle gallio newe president achaia lyeth corinthe one consent set vpon paule take bring market iudgement seate liefetenaunt example taught promise god vnderstanded though god ordeyned v maner daunger hazarde rather haue v invred trouble bicause requisite fleshe order saluation cause dauid sayth many tribulation iust lorde delyuereth psal herevnto example referred large ample promyses god haue bene tempted wyth grieuous daungers god sayth vnto abraham blesse thee magnifie thy name gene blesse blesse thee cursse cursse thee yet reason hys wyfe sara daunger troubled warres suffered great distresse banishment yet god lyer hys troth much manifest bicause delyuereth manye perilles might affirme moses dauid ieremie apostle studie briefe therfore greatly deceyued expounde promise gospell reprooue minister lying soone anye crosse trouble aryseth let v remember christ promiseth v retribution thing lose persecution name sake math luke follow must beare crosse example furthermorethe property study enimies truth let v place obserue maners conueyances enimies truth maye easilyer beware fyrst see iewes seeke occasion craftily doe harme vntyll time might seeme hushte quyet whole yeare halfe almost sturred agaynst paule assoone new lieftenaunt beginne eyther hoped man voyde religion iustice therefore fytter turne else thought might safely make sturre vnder newe officer yet acquainted state affayres corinth therfore wisedome appeareth wherin christ sayth passe child light luke teacheth v must snorte securitie enimies truth sometime enymies truth sake seeme lye still rather must vse wytte serpent craftes enterprise assoone oportunitie serueth burst forth wherfore saying ecclesiasticus serueth well purpose beleeue thine enimie c next iewes one accorde make insurrection agaynst paule one propertie wicked diuersitie affection alwayes iarre hurre yet set christ worde cleaue togyther lyke burres bicause hate alyke thus phariseyes could agree togither well ynough sadduceyes herodians went apprehende christ knowe howe pylate reconcyled vnto herode sent christ vnto mocked let man therefore trust discordes wicked let put trust christ author true vnitie consent let v consider chiefe poynt accusation iewes layde vnto paules chargethe chiefe matter accusation fellow say counselleth men worship god contrary lawe meaning bringeth newe maner worshippings contrarye lawes god nowe alteration religion hatefull thing vnto romaine wythout doubt amplifyed fault marueylously brought forth romane lawes heard done philippi thessalonica false accusation maye gathered one argument paule preached christ ende law fulfylled whatsoeuer thing conteyned bookes moses prophetes yet see alwayes true worshipper god accused prophaners religion yet none earnest defender reuengers farthest religion bragge howe maynteyners religion iewes pretende keeping lawe long agone ouerthrowne mannes tradition prophane enimyes truth nowe dayes haue saintes ymages saint mouthes agaynst v notwithstanding euident little set eyther saintes ymages defend honor saintes doe imitate fayth persecute doctrine wrytings fyre sworde call heretikes desyre follow step count ymages godly thing neglect liuely ymages god robbe poore clothe stockes stone burne christian men christ hath restored ymage god price hys bloude else therefore doe men iewes dyd vnder faire pretence religion wyshed religion truth extinguished gallio refuseth heare paules cause matter belonging himbut doth gallio vprore commaundeth paule pleade cause giueth hearing speake interrupteth yet might seeme tollerable bicause pronounced sentence matter vndeclared cleerely putteth matter hearing saying appertayneth determination speaking contemptuously iewes religion though bene thing consisting onely bare vncertaine wordes name cause thus speaking seemed take iewes owne wordes foolishe genealogy brawles wordes caused gentile laugh scorne religion like thing see nowe dayes papistrie whose iuglings friuolous opinion causeth iewes turkes laugh christian religion woulde god among professours gospell straunge queynt question caused vngodlye scorne christian fayth touching gallio commaundeth busie iewes leaue putteth barre wherein thinges allowed reprooued commended rashely condemneth religion knew equitie modestie many magistrate dayes ignoraunt kinde religion doe yet take vpon onely haue skill one greatest cause calamitie troubleth whole worlde dayes meanes commendable gallio altogither neglecteth religion thinketh hearing thereof appertayneth vnto god haue king still reading lawe hath appointed magistrate seuere diligent reuengers true religion see deut haue example godly king scripture cause chiefely commended banished superstition restored true religion therefore intollerable error nowe day go perswade magistrate meddle mannes religion let euery body serue god seemeth good deede men haue farre fetch hope come passe prince shall followe example gallio shall giue leaue plant religion please church great errour prince magistrate desyrous counted called christian yet affirme religion pertayneth iurisdiction commit vnto couetous monkes vnlearned prowde prelate leauing christes sheepe ordering pleasure foolishe men yea vnto woolues deuoured thus prince thinke well excused hope shall greatly deceyue god shall one day require people commytted charge handes argument shall prooued vntrustie seruauntes bicause sayde religion appertayned charge thing chiefely commended vnto nowe let v see ende tragedie veritie god promise manifestly appeareththe ende tragedye prosperous greekes perceyued gallio dyd much regarde matter take sosthenes ruler synagoge shamefully beate hym lyke setting iewes sosthenes faythfull companyon paule whose helpe setting forth gospell manifestlye appeareth paule vsed ye superscription hys fyrst epistle corinthian thys seemeth woonderfull thing matter came hande strypes paule agaynst iewes made thys insurrection goeth away vnhurte vntouched yea compelled depart citie shall heare taryed good space shall say cause spared paule perswaded eloquence defence keepe handes liefetenaunt woulde vouchsafe heare authoritie liefetenaunt defended hym gentyle manifest vngodly person regarde vnto iewes matter anye aduocate defender coulde founde authoritie withstande furious men especially ruler slacke duety onely authoritie citie commaunde remayneth therefore confesse howe paule preserued secrete assistance god alone promise fulfylled sayde man able doe harme thus reade patriarch sometime preserued amonge chanaanites god thundering eares harte touch mine annoynted c psal christ one worde delyuereth disciple although peter prouoked raging enimy drawne sworde wounding byshops seruaunt thyngs may comfort selues seing see power god great perfourming promise defending hys people euen escape safe awaye seeme myddest enymies furie must returne againe vnto gallio gallio president vngodly officer whome holy ghost hath set v president vngodly magistrate voyde religion long agone flatlye denied religion belonged iurisdiction also confessed dutie defende harmelesse iniurie punishe wickednesse yet suffreth sosthenes misintreated sight perfourmeth erewhile confessed dutie many dayes modesty sake leauing hearing matter religion doe streyghtway bewray themselues men farthest religion iustice defend seruants god ciuill iniuries yea notorious wrong done vnto cause shoulde thinke maintayners iustice haue cast care religion faythfull trustie see men haue right vntrustie godwarde thinketh dutie maintayne god honor glory therefore may nowe dayes see many galliones pitie greater cause publyke iniustice number prince part haue feeling religion howe much grieuously maye saye sinne glorying name christian men suffer faythfull seruants christ misvsed face whome ought defende authoritie sworde mennes sake consent let enimies haue condemne pleasure thing dayes much vsed needeth example declare maner state people lyued sometime freedome nowe bondagelast considered miserable state haue lost libertie enforced serue straungers iewes pompeius magnus time knowe subiection romaine scattered abroade ouer iurisdiction also corinthian hystories make mention vanquished brought vnder romaine obeysaunce l mumius generall doubt nation punished iust iudgement god sinnes offence misery fell one fact iewes scattered throughout worlde hated men heare religion shamefully despised whome enforced take lordes corinthian although religion agreed romaine yet president regarded publike iniuries winked heynous wickednesse let mindefull hereof whome god hath giuen libertie freedome let vse glorye god least feele lyke iudgement god become example yea let libertie mynde body god hath giuen rather serue please may liue heauen iesus christ onely giuer true libertie blessing honor power glorye euer amen cxxiij homelie pavle taried yet good whyle tooke leaue brother sayled thence syria priscilla aquila accompanying shore heade cenchreae vowe hee came ephesus left himselfe entred synagoge reasoned iewes desired tary longer time consented bade farewell saying must needes feast commeth bee ierusalem returne againe vnto god departed ephesus come vnto caesarea ascended vp saluted congregation departed vnto antioch taried departed went ouer countrie gallacia phrygia order strengthning disciple paule liued greater teare trembling corinth founde god readye ayde assist fyrst promised helpe fauor vision next apprehended iewes brought lieuetenant deliuered woonderfull wise although matter came stroke sosthenes euill intreated vse thing erewhile sayde serueth comfort godly god able deliuer also like sort ought doubt good forasmuch euident true worde therfore cannot breake fayle promise bicause haue hereof sayd ynough last sermon following order storye let v see done styrres raysed paule corinth fyrst thing place declared howe paule taryed corinth many dayes feares perill daungerpaule daungers abydeth corinth next taken leaue late erected church tooke iourney aquila priscilla syria vnto ierusalem yet hauing fyrst shauen heade cenchreae reason vowe made paules constancie manlynesse singulerly commended boldly ouercommeth dreade feare remayneth corinth among cruell enimies hauing hope eyther magistrate kynde men verilye rude weake disciple sake sawe neede comforting least beliefe yet tender greene shoulde dye say blade fyrst sprooting yea doth part good shepehearde christ sayeth flieth seeth woolfe comming ventureth life safegarde sheepe iohn maye also generall doctrine taken hereof howe haue assayde ayde helpe god ought holde vocation boldly constantly preposterous wisemen vse thinke therefore set libertie bicause thenceforth take paine traueyle though discharged dutie also aquila priscilla godly cowple much marked considered hauing bene twise banished beforethe trust friendship aquila priscilla towards paule doe yet againe chaunge dwelling accompanye paule sea land ieoperdous thing say nothing expences traueyle may gathered one thing whole nation iewes seemed haue conspyred moste obstinately togither destroye paule uerily paule companye cause prayseth hazarded liues hys sake time deserued great thankes congregation gate themselues immortall glory name remayneth vnto day shall euer see rom example ought also prouoked bolde christes glorye gospell minister thereof bicause extaunt generall promise promise sure rewarde giue cup colde water one christes sake reason ought cause v consider needye brother also whome lorde hath commended vnto v daye iudgement take done himselfe hath bene bestowed opinion menne thinke common weales ouercharged multitude banished person detestable vngodly whereas commonlye procure blessing god vnto place lot onely restored sodomite gene taken ouercomme libertie agayne citie tenne inhabitant like vnto lot also bene deliuered horrible destruction fyre heauen gene sake might rehearse diuers like example time text requyreth v speake thing paules vowethis straunge thing hearde bookes newe testament paule vowes sake made shaueth hys heade place vnderstanded none otherwise vowe nazaraeans vnlesse say paule giuen mannes tradition place affirmeth standeth faythfull ought burthened ceremony god lawe touching nazarites moses writeth large booke number cap place easily appeareth euery man libertie vse trade lyfe would time date vowe expyred runne read samson samuel mother wombe put apart great weighty affayres obserued lawes nazarites life long must make general rule lawe thereof hauing inspiration feeling great religion mindes bound themselues owne accorde obseruation vowe intent woulde feruently apply god calling seruice wherefore altogither abstained wine bicause drunkennesse religion meanes stande togither wine auoided also pleasure otherwise lawfull furthermore came burial parentes kinsefolke bicause affection ought pull away men truly addicted vnto god christ also sayth care dead pertayneth rather rather dye worlde luke aspire societie heauenly life moreouer nazareans time vowe lette heare growe thereby testifying owne appoyntment bounde peculiar vow paule himselfe teacheth v couering heade token subiection commaundeth men pray bareheaded woman heades couered bicause man free woman vnder man power whome ought take hir heade1 cor cause time vowe nazareans shauen solemne wise thend might know restored former libertie againe may seeme paule tooke vowe vpon bicause iewes thought prophane wicked contemner lawe therefore thought meane sooner winne hearken gospell seemeth confesse like thing writeth became iewe vnto iewes1 cor vnder lawe one himselfe vnder lawe otherwise ignorant christian libertie euerywhere writeth ought broken anye ceremony sake see colos galat therfore doe foolishly abuse example paule maintenance monkishe vowes vowe instituted lawe god although death christ abolished ceremony thereof yet auncient dignitie thereof weakes sake sodeinely made awaye buried little little euident monkes vowes founded vppon tradition men ought authoritie religion againe nazareans vowed vnto god moste part monkishe vowes made vnto creature agayne vowes nazareans altered trade lyfe neyther vnitie church therby deuided monkish vowes take away former trade life bring church many diuers sectes nazareans vowed thing man able performe monkes vowe chastity whole scripture sayth giuen euery man nazareans grieuous chargeable none reason vowe monkes whyle vowe wilfull pouertie fedde like ydle paunchbellies mennes labor nazareans vowe forbade obedience magistrate parentes estate whome bounde nature monkes vowes breake obedience bind onely abbot owe obedience parentes ruler furthermore nazareans affiance owne merites confessed themselues sinner vowe ended god author goodnesse monkishe vowes moste maintayne affiance man righteousnesse deseruings wherfore cause one sufficient condemne put away let passe pumpe sinke superstition paule teacheth iewes ephesus returne vnto paule traueyling achaia asia lesser came ephesus haue consider foure thinges order first goeth synagoge disputeth iewes agayne appeareth loue bare countriemen whome manye cause haue otherwheres declared coulde hate although twyse shaken dust agaynst example paule teacheth v wrath iudgement god shoulde set vnto wicked conuert may yet knowe hope left god fauourable vnto pardon god sayth ezech death sinner rather conuert lyue wherefore must vse diligence bring winne people vnto lord secondlye example ephesian teacheth v labor saintes vayne desirous haue paule remayne longer among appeareth euidently much profyted cannot delyght minister companye haue yet tasted fruite doctrine gospell neyther iudged louers gospell vse hate minister thereof little regarde labor disdainefully auoyde company let v agayne consider howe paule refuseth accomplishe godly request sayth must need feast commeth ierusalem pray neede vrged paule shall say deuotion sake feast knewe well holye dayes abrogated among ceremony cause vrged weake brethren sake go vp ierusalem bicause many iewes euery citie drowned iewishe superstition notwithstanding went thither wherefore place haue reade howe paule guided holy ghost doinges lyke secretly mooued spirite take voyage nowe hande although cause expressed yet declared saluted congregation brother surely paules traueyle coulde vayne citie wherevnto agaynst feast repayred great multitude iewes gentyles among nation euen one time togither might doctrine gospell scattred among many nation marueyled paule pulled soone seemed ready receyue profyte gospell may seeme vncourteous vnloouing part leaue herin leane vnto reason god doings knowne certaine chiefe vse example v learne submit willes desire seeme neuer holy good vnto pleasure god fourthly let v see howe paule departed ephesus biddeth farewell token thankefulnesse friendly good discourtesie vnhonest depart hoste haue receyued benefytes without taking leaue moreouer leaueth aquila seeme altogither destitute furthermore promiseth returne againe leaue god whereby manifestly appeareth bare euill compelled strayned weighty consideration leaue haue imitate paules religiousnesse godly cause presumeth nothing owne heade vnderstanding endeuors deuises depend vpon god prouidence referreth thing vnto pleasure sentence salomon common prouer manne purposeth god disposeth rashnesse men attribute much themselues prophane matter appoynt doinges though woulde prescribe lawes vnto god see iacob luc paules labor diligence paule nowe departed ephesus commeth caesarea iury thence ierusalem greeted congregation dispatched matter went came antioche publike sanctuary sayde godly person thence passed galathians phrygian confyrming brother euerywhere fayth ignorant craftes enterprise satan lyeth still wayte godly luke fewe wordes comprehendeth great paynes care marueylous dyligence paule vsed gouerning christ church man would compare byshops dayes bragge paule peter name good lorde howe little shall man fynde expressing one sparkle paules breast meane season let v acknowledge truth god prouideth church faythfull chosen instrument let v beseech sende faithfull labourer hys haruest may enlarge boundes church lorde sauiour iesus christ may haue kingdome nation whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cxxiiij homelie certaine iewe named apollo borne alexandria came ephesus eloquent man myghtie scripture enfourmed way lorde spake feruently spirite taught dyligently thing lorde knewe baptisme iohn onlye beganne speake boldely synagoge whome priscilla aquila hearde tooke vnto expounded vnto hym way god perfitely disposed go achaia brother wrote exhorting disciple receyue come helped much beleeued thorowe grace ouercame iewes myghtilye openly shewing scripture iesus christ vnto discourse thinges done apostle paule corinth ephesus luke annexeth order hystorie apollo iewe borne alexandria fyrst maketh perfyte declaration thinges done among corinthian bicause apollo long went corinth watered church paule prosperouslye planted lyke dyligent husbandman brought rypenesse fruite apostle confesseth fyrst corinthian thirde chapter appeareth likewise great goodnesse god prouyding church heard sermon going howe paule secrete instinct holye ghost taken ephesian inflamed loue gospell desyred longer haue kept therefore least man might thinke god neglected desyrous saluation myght take occasion thinke yll god substituteth apollo place supply paules absence diligence endeuour god neglecteth none desyrous truth calleth men vnto euery allureth spreade open armes therfore hystorie maketh little comfort church conteyning also example faythfull absolute minister many thing belonging instruction wherefore shall profytable examine partes thereof luke begynneth commodiously description personwhat maner person quality apollo saying fyrst iewe partly declared great mercie god enuious nation falling running headlong destruction chooseth euery day newe freshe worshipper hys sonne minister partly iewes malice prooued incurable could ouercome neyther great dyligence apostle yet daylie domesticall example next declareth borne alexandria hystories saye thys present place prooueth famous church schoole erected euen time apostle thence commeth thys apollo furnished many dyuers giftes whose labour traueyle afterwarde appeared great buylding vp congregation luke verye fewe wordes attributeth singuler quality saying eloquent saye gift aptly due maner speake reason matter also power might scripture conuenable dexteritie handling intreating one learned onely ostentation sake moreouer declareth brought vp way lorde thereby attributing vnto knowledge christ yet declaring wanted poyntes thereof sayth knewe baptisme iohn onelythe baptisme iohn calleth principle christian religion comprehending vnder worde baptisme doctrine iohn al businesse whereof minister sence christ also demaunded scribe iohns baptisme math yet place must vnderstanded though iohn knowledge christ taught disciple doctrine contrarie christ iohns doctrine christes one christ commaundeth apostle preach repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes name reade iohn mooued hearer vnto repentaunce shewed grace god saluation christ onely summe doctrine repent kingdome god hande beholde lambe god taketh away sinnes worlde father loueth sonne hath giuen thing hande beleeue sonne may haue lyfe euerlasting see luke iohn thirde chapiter bicause iohn myddle betwixt prophet christ therefore forerunner sauyour promised prepare make ready people receyue christ suffised declare short briefe summe saluation knowledge christ men might vnderstande howe forgiuenesse sinnes life euerlasting alone meane season manifest taught secret misteries christes death resurrection ascension whole order redemption expresse wordes perfyte vnderstanding hereof reserued tyme yea reade apostle skilfull thinges although christ oftentimes reasoned hereof vntill ascension illuminated holy ghost sent christ promised therefore although apollo brought vp waye lorde knewe christ sauiour worlde yet ignoraunt manye thinges concerned maner redemption whereof large enfourmed shall followe little hereafter meane tyme haue two thyngs consider description person first order lincking togyther gyftesthe giftes wherewith apollo endued wherewith god thought good adourne apollo amongst thinges eloquence occupieth fyrst rowme thing necessary person well ministerie common weale daylie experience declareth whether gifte come vnto man nature gotten arte labour studie traueyle knowe hath bene thing long agone argued amongst fyne witted orator phylosophers following apostle saying1 cor account gift vtteraunce amonge giftes holye ghost whose inspiration say apollo gift secondarily luke sayth mightie scripture endued effectuall dexteritie handling thus maketh difference betweene man godly eloquence prophane vnlesse matter entreated taken holy scripture mouth god eloquence purpose occupied rather tryfles ostentation thing needeful knowne done verily orator gentile called eloquent deede disputed debated thing fynely trimly per yned nothing godly christian leading lyfe else therefore shall saye heaue vaine wordes pulling hercules buskinnes say vpon childes legges certaine men marueyle force speech yet vaine men much vnlike vnto howe much better lacedemonian aunswere sophister promised tell long extemporate tale matter sayth would commende shoomaker woulde pull wide shooe vppon little foote therefore vnto godly profytable studie scripture apollo ioyneth knowledge eloquence bicause diuers euen scripture seeke ostentation vain glory christ vpbraided iewish scribe therfore third place apollo sayd haue bene infourmed way lorde haue knowledge christ luke vseth word way declare ydle knowledge following rule christ laboured order whole conuersation life thereafter ende giftes saluation conteyned christ onely vaine vnprofytable ostentation thing except men ioine knowledge study christ himselfe expressely teacheth v shoulde marke ende iohn searching scripture cause paule iudged thing worlde greatly esteemeth dunge phil might attayne knowledge christ sayth also christ made god wisedome desireth knowe nothing iesus christ cor crucifyed woulde god woulde consider thing schooles vniuersities bewitch yong men vaine philosophie banishe thence knowledge christ thing belonging beggerly diuines call seconde thing learned apollo excellent man wanteth yet thinges know necessary men wherevpon gather god giueth thing vnto men increasements certaine degree encrease gyftes considering manne worlde hath full perfyte knowledge mystery kingdome god paule sayth shall haue worlde come taken heauen1 cor shall see god face face whereof yet manne must gather thing sayde religion worlde vncertayne god worde scripture reuealeth v knowledge hereof cannot vncertayne declared worde yet bicause perfyte knowledge god reserued v heauen may euery day long liue profyte encrease therein must therfore neuer rest still studie knowledge god maye attayne euen worlde taste perfection farre able hereby ydle dranes reprooued thinke studye giuen vnto scripture vaine vnprofytable thereby declaring neuer tasted pleasantnesse scripture baite men always bite prowde men also haue much affiance knowledge thinke learne therefore despyse study scripture confuted farre perfection perswade themselues haue yet knowe themselues well apollo vsed giftsfurthermore returne vnto luke ioyning description person thinges declareth howe apollo vsed giftes god gaue spake feruently spirite taught diligently thing lorde agayne hee beganne speake boldlye synagoge therefore vsed giftes setting forth glorye lorde teaching v example god gift lawfully vsed god name gaue v celebrated thankefulnesse owe euen lawe nature graffed creature therefore greatly offende ydly bury gift god hath giuen whereof christ intreateth vnder parable naughty seruaunt math yet much grieuously doe offende abuse giftes pleasure reproche holye name nowe dayes commonly giftes minde bodye abused shall one day giue streight account vnto god thus fylthilye defyle pollute themselues also example declareth trade teaching shoulde vsed churchthe trade howe teach church first zeale feruencie spirite needefull men maye see saying commeth heart onlesse spirite present teaching shall serue ostentation thus ardent continuall traueyle teaching feruent spirite reforming temple abundantlye declared zeale christ enflamed milke warme teacher shall neuer allowed bicause christ haue euen priuate men matter religion hote see apocalyps next needefull vse diligence bicause dull witte perceiueth heauenly thinges also bicause corruption nature alwayes vseth resist god commaundement beside malice satan common enimie whose craftes behooueth faythfull minister god day night diligently withstande therefore paule commaundeth timothie knew brought vp childe1 tim studie scripture giue heede reading likewise hereafter exhorteth pastor ephesus wakefulnesse diligence weighty argument thirdly behooueth minister shoulde bolde speake dissemble eyther fauor feare herof haue spoken paule comaunded speake hold peace thing enioyned minister word necessary al men beare office likewise performe ye scripture euerywhere declare yea let men priuately apply thing themselfe meane allowed god vocation god requyreth v serue hart haue giuen selues wholye vnto must choose paynefully plainely feruently occupie selues affayres meete luke describeth howe apollo profyted knowledge christ saluation apollo profiteth knowledge christ goeth set forth glory saluation others sayth aquila priscilla hearde tooke vnto expounded waye god vnto perfitely aboue thinges appeareth truth promise christ euery one hath sayth shall giuen shall abounde math sayde haue acknowledge giftes giuen vnto vse diligently glory god lorde requyreth account may receyue vsaunce encrease bicause apollo performe diligence industrie sayde erewhyle therefore god fayleth promise streightway stirreth vp faythfull minister enforme fully perfytely ought serue instruction men may vnderstande howe grace god waye happily increased faithfull studie thus vse wisedome setting forth god glory doe feele euery day god encreaseth like reason made learning honour rich thing whereof lacke example prooue agayne greater cause giftes god quenched v giue selues rather sloth ydlenesse setting forth god glory manye consideration aquila priscilla apollo marked vnder fewe wordes euaungelist comprehendeth great godlynesse vertuesthe prayse aquila priscilla great argument godlinesse giue eare apollo teacheth wheras yet great intelligence mystery christ able teach others true marke child god iohn whose propertie christ sayth heare worde willingly often reprooued example thinke haue profyted much knowledge saluation haue neede farther instruction therefore neyther reade scripture home come church heare sermon thus whyle thinke haue profyted much openly declare yet ignorant chiefe cognizance child god bicause knowe kingdome god consisteth bare knowledge rather god requyreth shoulde order life according rule worde cannot satisfyed hearing bicause feele want much euen chiefest poynt moreouer holy couple maried folke declare feruent desire glory god taking one instruct sawe able greatly profyte church christ agayne argument true loue cleare enuye priuately instruct enuie glory hytherto gotten faithfull traueyle rather helpe may perfytely instructed people woonne meane manne woulde compare doings dayes good lorde howe rather token christian minde shall fynde seeme godlye restorer light gospell assoone perceyue authoritie man increase gyddinesse ambition maketh enuie seeke meanes possible occasion serue bring enuye contempt though coulde prouide owne honour infamye others howe shall beleeued iohn desirous honor worlde surely spirite cain reade rose hys brother cause perceyued brother better fauor god nowe religion ministery church behooueth auoyde mischiefe priuate doings becommeth diligently auoyde occasion enuye hatred called true child god aquila priscilla vertues appearethe modesty apollo apollo maye perceyued rare singuler modestie tractabilitie excelled eloquence kinde learning contented taught man handycraft woman vnknowne time straungers true saying paule spirites prophetes subdued vnto prophetes1 cor nowe compare apollo arrogaunce cannot abyde admonished rebuked coministers whereof great number dayes time past insolencie much hurt vnto church chiefe cause dayes contention euerywhere bicause place take vpon rule church esteeme brother coministers dogges hog besides yet argument whereby appollos declareth feruent desyre set forth kingdome god apollo goeth corinth perceyued sufficiently instructed knowledge christ appointed go achaia corinth bicause perceyued church much neede helpe valyant souldyours owne accord choose place see labour daunger traueyle warfare church commendation profyte church must dyligently obserue help requisite thyther haste themselues dyligently negligence kingdome god suffer detriment also fayth dyligence brother ephesus obserued would let faythfull minister christ one deserued well congregation depart without publike testimonie vertuous behauiour yea commend vnto corinthian also desyre giue rowme teacher church needefull minister worde haue commendation person abrode fall snare slaunderer may denyed commendation vertue haue declared fayth manifest argument vnto church promote ministerie deserue small prayse kingdome god againe worthyly accounted wicked christ church blinde affection keepe backe worthy ministerie yet must beware paule sayth admyt euerie one rashely therevnto1 tim least partaker mennes sinnes say minister church obserued maner office vocation say worthy set forwarde vnworthy repulsed kept backe much v lyeth least whyle commende naughtie packes endammage indaunger whole common weale concerning apollo endeuored himselfe aunswere testimony commendation brother least might seeme haue thrust v meete minister people church much profyted brother corinth beleeued grace god whether man referre worde grace apollo corinthian commeth one sense teacheth thereby nothing attributed mannes industrie howe god taken author goodnesse vouchsafe giue increase whereof paule disputeth large fyrst epistle corinthian thirde chapter surely corinthian well considered one thing neuer giuen place afterwarde disturbed church factious name paules disciple peter apollo luke declareth also meane waye howe apollo thus profyted brother namely open confuting iewes proouing scripture iesus christ say sauiour worlde promised place teacheth v many thing needefull obserued fyrst learnein church necessary wicked confuted onely church hath neede instructed also aduersaries confuted much profyte church doe endeuour go roote vp false doctrine euen tyllage fruitfull suffreth thornes coccle growe among cause ieremie commaunded fyrst weede pull vp builde plant paule appointeth one byshop able conuince gainesayers aduersaryes titus say false teacher must needes confuted also vnderstanded open notorious naughtie packes gyue occasion offence vnto weaker sort faythfull minister must set also sworde spirite else leaue church torne woolues therefore farre deceyued woulde haue gospell preached nowe dayes men must speake neyther impious doctrine vngodlynesse manersthe minister must fyght scripture furthermore admonished weapon church men must fyght verilie scripture paule sayth inspyred god profytable teach improoue exhorte amende timoth fowlely therfore deceyued say heretikes must conuinced scripture bicause obscure darke conuince wherefore flye vnto counselles determination church therein fare one take souldyour going battayle sworde yron giue one leade though authority man constitution greater holy ghost speaketh scripture finally haue oftentimes aduertised repeated ende preaching gospell beleeue iesus christ lord sauiour praise honour power glory euer amen xix chapiter vpon actes apostle cxxv homelie fortuned whyle apollo corinth paule passed vpper coastes came ephesus founde certaine disciple sayde vnto haue receyued holy ghost since beleeued sayde vnto hym haue heard whether holye ghost sayde vnto wherewith ye baptised sayde iohns baptisme sayde paule iohn verily baptised baptisme repentaunce saying vnto people shoulde beleeue shoulde come christ iesus heard baptised name lorde iesus paule layde handes vpon holye ghost came spake tongue prophecyed men twelue bycause euaungelist luke beganne speake begynning ephesian church chapiter going maketh ende hystorie chapiter declaring howe paule returned ephesus according promise brought church happily begonne vnto perfection power god grace declaring selfe preaching gospell may appeare thing haue consider ephesus writer report famous citie asia ate ephesus reason situation fruitfulnesse soyle commodious traffiquers grewe passing riche beside fame false religion called gestes thither partes worlde church diana sumptuous gorgeous thing builded worlde bicause appeareth asia occupied buylding thereof two hundred twentie yeares togither worthyly accounted among miracle worlde citie therefore raigned ryot superstition commonly hath wayting hir hir companion handemaydes magicall curious artes whereof shall see come place ephesian udious yet paule conuerted citie within space two yeares founded famous church vnto afterwarde christ attributeth small praise reuelation apocal place haue partly consider grace god paule hereafter commendeth ephesian owne example may seene epistle seconde chapiter partly appeareth power ministerie gospell neyther authoritie rooted superstition neyther pryde glorie worlde could hynder christes kingdome flourished gospell preached moreouer luke purposing declare storie thing done paule ephesus beginneth tell fyrst howe brought certaine person frame vaunted themselues gospell throughly instructed therein howe adourned church giftes holye ghost hystorie serueth much instruction cause dyligently considered bycause dyuers men time past haue contended authoritie place baptise againe bene baptised heretiques day also anabaptistes abuse verie frowarde phrentike kinde person keeping infantes baptisme affirming none ought baptised yeares discretion well infourmed principle knowledge christ olde wryters deceyued shall easily appeare text selfe whereby shall prooued paule ment nothing lesse dooing go gather thereof fyrst sayd paule went examine certaine disciplespaule examineth aunswered life profession met withal came ephesus lykely professed christ bicause may gather greater vtilitie gospell among ephesian heard ende xviij chapiter nowe paule taketh examine rather seemeth cause liued agreeably profession christian men like hapned ephesus doth commonly euery place truth fyrst preached discipline church fully established shall see many professe gospeller hatred olde state loue truth bicause would vnder cloke gospell liue licentiously bycause paule perceyued kinde people intent might brought better conformitie passe perishe like receyued seede gospell stonie grounde paule beginneth examine beliefe laye eye howe farre yet marke perfection demaundeth therefore receyued holy ghost question must vnderstanded giftes holye ghost god time vsed giue faithfull say knowledge tongue exposition scripture whereof haue already manye time intreated place teacheth v howe know true christian false counterfeyte although speciall giftes holye ghost sometime miraculously giuen day ceassed yet promise iesus christ remayneth fyrme promised spirite paule elsewhere sayth haue spirite christ rom member effectes god holye spirite necessary daye vnderstanding tongue interpretation scripture time passed namely mortifycation olde man regeneration innouation minde purifycation sanctifycation like many therefore lacke thing certaine boast vaine faith name christ except shall say spirite christ ydle sluggishe spirite grosse ignoraunce truly pro esse christbut let v heare aunswere whome paule examineth vtter grosse barbarous ignoraunce saying haue heard whether holy ghost howe ignoraunt holy ghost heard often mention lawe prophet doubt iewes bicause baptized baptisme iohn ignoraunt saying moses beginning hystorie wryteth spirite god mooued vpon water else neuer heard saying dauid worde lorde heauens made hostes breath mouth psal againe take thy holye spirite besides might haue knowne voyce messias speaking prophet spirite lorde god vpon c therefore say haue heard whether holy ghost aunswere easie paule demaunded effectes holy ghost make aunswere concerning say content thing haue heretofore learned seeke farther neyther care whether holye ghost worketh peculiar giftes men mindes bicause thinke knowledge hereof high v appertaine v men example carnall people professe truth mouth haue denyed power thereof paule sayth deede refuse mouth confesse timoth tit great number euery founde perswaded bare name christ sufficient vnto blisse doe little regarde giftes holy ghost namely mortifycation fleshe renewing minde regeneration sanctification lyke men faulte commeth passe part doctrine gospell yll spoken worlde therefore must suffered reprooued dissimulation must disclosed may vnderstande errour lesse offended doth paule place gathereth nerer vpon vrgeth confesseoutwarde profession improoueth counterfeyt christian come christian perfection sayth whose name baptized say professed fyrst receyued gospell ioyned selues church christ aunswere baptised baptisme iohn testifye professed doctrine religion wherof iohn minister teacher therby plainly shewe care little nowe paule catcheth holdeth fast inferreth iohn sayth baptised baptisme repentance saying people shoulde beleeue come iesus christ hereby teaching iohn requyred farre thing disciple bare profession name gospell fyrst appoynted repentaunce wherevnto great earnestnesse exhorted degree person appea eth luc neyther requyreth onely repentaunce sheweth also remission sinnes preaching iesus christ whose forerunner appoynted god taught men embrace true fayth followe giue themselues wholy bicause onely thing founde fygured outwarde baptisme able performe without operation holy spirite therefore glorye haue iohn teacher little sufficiencie doctrine baptisme wherewith baptized compelleth go cleaue vnto christ graffed liuely fayth quickened spirite may declare effectes holy ghost true christian verye playne vnracked meaning paules wordes whole order hystorye prooueth wherefore foolish error place go prooue iohn baptisme christes one diuers thing farre paules meaning rather prooueth howe men sent baptisme water iohn ministred vnto christ whome onely thinges taken holde token whereof receyue baptisme also generall rule confyrmed borne taken true worshipper god shoulde stay rest vpon authoritie man ought vrged giue themselues wholy vnto christ liue quickening spirite least professe mouth declare deedes howe farthest furthermorethe baptism christ fyre luke ioyneth herevnto moste prosperous ende hystorie person conuict conscience secrete working holye ghost yeelded vnto paules reason baptized name lorde iesus wordes must expounded baptisme water though receiued againe shoulde followe iohns baptisme bene lawfull sufficient consecrate men vnto god absurde thing sayde example christ teacheth v vouchsafe baptised iohn become copartener v also thing prooueth read rebaptised iohn baptised wherefore place must vnderstanded baptisme fyre minister author whereof iohn sayde christ shoulde holye ghost giuen likenesse fyre whereof spake seconde chapter booke manifest worde baptising often vsed giuing holy ghost giftes iohn vseth speaking christ shall baptise holy ghost fire christ ready ascende vp heauen vseth sense saying shall bee baptised holye ghost within fewe dayes phrase speach peter vttered sense congregation intreating cornelius conuersion actes place luke teacheth v howe worde baptising ought taken whyle waye exposition addeth paule layde handes holye ghost came spake tongue prophecie therefore laying handes consecrated appoynted onely vnto christ followed holye ghost acco ding hearde came passe samaria also wherevppon appeareth olde writer abused place whyle authoritie hereof contended ought newe baptised bene baptised heretykes herein deceyued thought iohn christes baptisme water diuers ignorance anabaptistes great apply vnto baptisme water ought vnderstanded baptisme fyre saye receyuing gyft holy ghost haue principally consider ende vse myracle god ment confyrme adorne authoritie gospell hereby among gentyles haue already oftentimes declared let v therefore beleeue gospell whose credite truth prooued many notable signes woonders let v lyfe aunswere profession fayth quickened spirite christ maye liue whome prayse honour power glory euer amen cxxvj homelie went synagoge behaued himselfe boldlye space three monethes disputing giuing exhortation kingdome god diuers waxed harde hearted beleeued spake euill way multitude departed seperated disciple disputed daily schoole one called tyranus continued space twoo yeares dwelt asia hearde worde lorde iesu iewes greekes god wrought speciall myracles handes paule body brought vnto sicke napkin partelettes disease departed euill spirites went euangelist luke hath declared paule fullye enstructed twelue menne ephesus liued aunswereable profession sheweth afterwarde ministery paule kingdome god spredde farre neare among ephesian ouer countrie bordering vpon asia present place comprehendeth summe hystorie consideration whereof must diligent bicause diuers thinges euery part thereof serue common instruction v sheweth done reprobate vnbeleeuing thirdly describeth singuler profyte commoditie apostle labour traueyle paule preache h iewes synagogefirst euangelist comprehendeth whole summe paules doctrine fewe wordes sayeth entred synagoge disputed three monthes togther boldly exhorted men receyue kingdome god therefore otherwheres also preacheth fyrst iewes hereby appeareth partly great mercy god towarde rebellious frowarde people partly moste feruent syncere affection charitie paule manye grieuous iniuries coulde quenched bicause haue hereof intreated diuers time already let v omit poynt see trade teaching paule vsed among ephesian wherevnto appertayne three thing whereof luke discourseth fyrst nameth place sayth taught open synagogethe place doctrine must publike therefore paule diligently obserued place thought good vse also ephesus namely teach one certayne publike place although knewe well iewes vsages place bare rule whereby learne must certayne place doctrine taught howe must wythout great cause forsaken thing verye profytable maintenance true doctrine keeping vnder false teacher priuilye vse creepe beguyle vnwarye cause christ himselfe vsed moste time teache temple open synagoges bicause woulde example defend without cause refuse come vnto church else sowe false doctrine corner anabaptistes dayes ouerboldly vse doe secondly declared trade paule vsed teachingthe maner teach spake freely boldly dissembling nothing fyrst disputed confuting error iewes wherewith confounded obscured way saluation selfe playne simple next exhorted counselled yeelde vnto truth best order teaching wherin two thinges necessary obserued fyrst aduersaries argument confuted effectuall reason vrged take holde truth earnestlye followe truth haue place long lye error beare rule fruitelesse vayne shall knowledge truth vnlesse men earnestly embrace hir labour transformed hir therefore paule commaundeth minister worde onely teach also exhort rebuke2 tim instant season season christ woulde haue bidden wedding heauenly kingdome compelled come therefore fylthye error saye bare literall treatie scripture sufficient church suffer thing openly discussed serue instruction party though saluation stoode onely naked empty contemplation thing thirdlye luke sheweth matter argument paules doctrine sayth spake kingdome godthe argument apostle doctrine affayres redemption saluation called administrator executor wherof prophetes long since declared messias shoulde messias iewes conceyued onely false also carnall grosse opinion reason misvnderstoode oracle prophetes dreamed kingdome messias shoulde vppon earth hoped enioy golden worlde vnder bene sometime vnder salomon error apostle also beguyled promised themselues notable dignity promotion maye easily gathered contention among iewes also whose mindes saluation earthly kingdome rather thinke consisted wearishe ceremony merite christ therefore paule diligently declared veritie kingdome god shewing spirituall earthly consisted vaine obseruation ceremony merite christ fayth whereby graffed doctrine paule sermon luke hath described booke also epistlesthe kingdome god needeth long rehearsall therof let v marke scripture call redemption saluation kingdome god hereby ende thereof declared satan vanquished worlde ouercome god might beare rule ouer v king desire prayer saying let thy kingdome come wherefore false christian glorye name christ yet let deuill rule haue communion fellowshippe iesus christ neyther christian kingdome god bicause christ came worlde cause restore kingdome howe kingdome god suffer themselfe ruled deuilles spirite obey thinges vsage property reprobatesbut bicause christ neuer preached anye luckilye manye reprobate shall ryse agaynst doctrine hee declareth howe paule dealt yet fyrst sheweth hardened heartes agaynst paules doctrine propertie wicked vrged worde god harden heartes god worde fault owne selues haue seede child god cannot knowe voyce worde therefore mightily holy ghost worketh bring order fyercelye vse resist example haue euerywhere caine pharao saule iudas diuers wherevnto woulde god euerye day freshe example ioyned induration followeth wyll neyther beleeue obey therefore cast away worde god vayne nothing pertayning vnto besides woorse property namely rayling slaundering whereby go bring christes doctrine religion suspicion enuy amongest people follow deuils propertie desiring haue many partner fellowes perdition step doth impietie climbe vp vntill high yt falleth destruction doth paule personshowe reprobate must delt first departeth fro least either inflame giue occasion vnprofytable contention thys doth according christ commaundement bade v cast pearles dogges hogges math commaunded v shake dust feete v open obstinates next seperated disciple receyued sounde doctrine duetie faithfull shephearde whose chiefe care sounde sheepe infected contagiousnesse diseased yet paule called schismatike dooing although bare name church people god paule seuered disciple yea necessarie good auoyde familiaritie companye vngodly bicause bycome heard hearted meanes many time also partaker vngodlyes punishment see apoc thirdely paule teacheth daylie schoole one tyrannus maner thing howe came called maketh great matter lyke publike place commodious preache let v rather consider paules diligence could vntowardnesse wicked pulled duetie seeth rage busily holdeth teaching let office eyther common weale ministerie followe example exercise primitiue churche reade busily occupyed worde god thing nowe dayes lesse regarded none called accounted successor apostle furthermorethe fruite euaungelike endeuour manifolde let v consider profyte apostle endeauor traueyle manifolde first worde god spredde ouer asia among iewes greekes often commeth passe fame gospell pierceth mindes haue yet heard minister speake example great notable city maketh little purpose inhabitaunts neere easily allured follow next god himselfe worketh paule notable miracle beareth wytnesse doctrine handkerchers partelets brought seene apostle draue away sickness spirites let man yet ascribe diuine godly power handkerchefes partelets vse haue thrust church superstitious worshipping reliques expressely declared place god worker miracle paule nothing attributed ministerie surely ridiculous attribute vnto paules handkerchefes christes cote touching whereof woman diseased bloudy fluxe healed operation cote vertue power christ sayde went see marke must rather regarde ende miracle serued set forth paules doctrine haue elsewhere declared lyeth hid also thirde vtilitie namely sicke healed demoniacks delyuered gospell health soule taught deuils kingdome destroyed bicause iesus christ blessed seede woman ordeyned treade downe serpent head let v therefore imbrace wyth true fayth wholy knyt delyuered tyrannye deuill merite may atteyne vnto true saluation raigne hereafter heauen praise honor power glory euer amen cxxvij homely certaine vagabunde iewes exorcistes tooke vpon call ouer euill spirites name lorde iesus saying adiure iesu whome paule preacheth seauen sonnes one sceua iewe chiefe priestes euill spirite aunswered sayde iesus know paule knowe yee man whome theeuill spirite ranne ouercame preuayled fledde house naked wounded knowne iewes greekes also dwelt ephesus feare came name lorde iesus magnifyed many beleeued came confessed shewed workes many vsed curious craft brought bookes burned men counted price founde fiftie thousande siluerings mightily grewe worde god preuayled heard yesterday howe god confyrmed paules apostleship authoritie doctrine gospell among ephesian many straunge miracle followeth nowe howe defended example rare seueritie went instigation satan abuse name christ paule preached get gaine thereby bring authority gospell suspition chiefe vse hystorie make v vnderstande god hath regarde seruaunts many go deface authoritie bolde abuse name christ lust pleasure shall go vnpunished may receyue profyte hereby let v consider partes hystorie order luke rehearseth iewes exorcistesthe fyrst conteyneth description person declareth iewes none basest sort sonnes sceua chiefe priest next called exorcistes whereby appeareth profession get money exorcismes coniuring spirites cause vsed go place place therefore seing apostle name christ mightily controll spirites worke myracles lyke bene seene inticed wyth hope greater profyte auayle take vpon newe forme coniuration vse intermeddle name christ therein shall good consider dyligently whereof kinde people fyrst sprang among iewes although moses appointed many dyuers office among leuites yet see maketh mention exorcistes therefore inuention man therfore deceyueable thingiosephus eyght booke antiquity second chapter contrary lawes god seemeth haue taken begynning olde fable wherin reported salomon inuented inspiration god science coniuring exorcismes spirites kinde disease satan woulde haue defaced credite prophetes myracles though also bene wrought rather magicall enchauntment peculiar operation god power confyrme doctrine length hauing thus incensed foolishe vngodlye emulation beganne tell wonder vnspeakeable power name god taught make exorcismes whereby foolishe men set vp kingdome pulled away mindes great many worshipping calling vpon god remayne day certaine token olde impietie fable iewes haue deuised schem hamphoras phisick vse many exorcismes euydent little little crept among christian also without great hinderaunce true godlynesse profession therefore seauen sonnes sceua chiefe priest small argument great corruption byshops child gaue studie wicked deuillishe deceytes sought enrich themselues arte plainely forbidden worde god example teacheth v howe farre errour runneth assoone men beginne swarue worde god hapned among iewes see hath also come passe poperie would seeme want order primitiue church haue also ordeyned exorcistes though part bragged bare name yet farre hath presumption gone haue taken vpon coniure spirites soules deceassed wherin one least defence antichristes tirannie hath consisted saye nothing howe wicked exorcismes haue polluted baptisme god whole religion yea meane came passe kinde men student necromantie magike monkes priestes euen highest priestes behinde wicked science hystories syluester seconde gregorie seuenth alexander sixte many well knowne euery man also taught iudge attribute godly power holy name sentence taken scripture though eyther euill spirites coulde driuen awaye disease maladyes ridde men beastes bodyes study southsaying arte inuented man curiositie could tell v come shall happen hereafter iudaicall rather heathen gentile superstition without cause condemned lawes god fyrst vnto vaine sounde wordes vnto dombe fygures ceremony full horror attributed power helpe light offence fyrst precept table commaunded acknowledge god onely helper put trust hym onely aske ayde succour next men sent inuocation god vnto wicked science though thereby god might inforced helpe v moreouer kingdome deuill waye fortifyed dyligently seeketh make men looke helpe counsell thinges god bicause commodious way whereby deceyue beguile men therefore reade science olde time without cause abolished lawes god emperours remaine pope law canon gathered auncient counsel father cod lib tit quest aug de doct christ lib cap admonishe v keepe giuen artes communion faythfull must giue eare obiections frame argument successe holynesse word thereby defende impious superstition say many healed meanes thing otherwise impossible hereby euery day brought passe againe say offence bicause consist parte vpon holy name god else vpon certaine notable sentence holy scripture aunswere easie obiections knowe satan able shewe woonders without sufferance god well knowne wrought tymes past magitians egypt howe burned iobes cattle seruauntes fyre aboue de trinit lib cap yea augustine testifyeth able doe straunge matter bicause transfourme himselfe aungell light doth therefore become christian men beleeue suggestion vse helpe doe rather regarde counsell god suffereth satan thus doe bicause meaneth eyther trye fayth people else send effectuall illusion haue deserued destruction let v therfore stande fast fayth least swarue therefro left wholy sathans scorning delusion againe touching holynesse wordes dispute say holy detestable abuse vse eyther name god wordes serue magicall muttering vaine sounde dryue away eyther spirites disease declare set vnto v propertie god wyll holynesse wordes excuse magician enchaunters shall also excused commonly abuse holye wholsome creature god howe vaine men excuse forme maner exorcisme exorcistes vsed aboundantly declareth reprehended vse worde adiuring according example godlye men next adiure name iesus least might seeme meane counterfeyte iesus plainely expresse whome paule preacheth notwithstanding accused impietie bicause vsed holye wordes naughtily without fayth lucre sake aduauntage therefore away seeke slender pretence iewishe heathen superstition let v beleeue dare abuse name god christ effect exorcistes vnluckyebut let v consider successe enterprise agreeable presumptuousnesse euil spirit answereth exorcistes sayth iesus know paule know streightway setteth man whome possessed vpon maketh hym season strongly preuayling al wel bette set packing house naked argument euidently perceyued power holye wordes themselues whereby driue awaye deuils euils effectes depende vpon god prouidence sometime worketh myracles also euen infydels seeth helpe serue setting forth kingdome glory example teacheth maye looke abuse name christ lawes priuate lucre aduauntage common thing dayes else doth pope seeing vnder cloake christes name chalengeth supremacie church else doe masse priestes peruerting maner order supper imagine christ becke chaunge wordes supper coniuration power whereof transubstanciate say breade wine body bloude christ shall speake keyes vnder pretence whereof haue burst mennes conscience ordeyned satisfaction expiation sinnes little nothing differing reade heathen sometimes vsed lette passe infynite thing though god punishe see child sceua yet iudgement lorde peter sayeth sleepeth not2 peter long sithence punishment appointed moreouer taught place howe great power sauiour iesus christ seeing vse deuill neuer lothe setting forth kingdome wyll thinke woulde willinglye beare witnesse iesus christ paule seruaunt hurt owne bondman instrument yet compelled doe bicause seemeth good vnto lorde whose sight becke apostle writeth iacob deuils tremble quake afrayde satan craft power whose helpe see christ vse pleasure mightilye nowe prince worlde throwne kingdome long hath falsely claymed vsurped harde thing ouercome fayth graffed christ nowe let v come last part hystoriethe true vse goddes iudgements ensample true repentaunce conteyneth manifolde singular fruite first thing knowne amongst ephesian striken god whome sawe seuerely reuenge abusing sonne name lawfull vse god iudgements put mindes sense feeling god religion miserable wretch maye seeme altogither waxed deafe seeing mooued example god daily sheweth vppon blasphemer contemners name worde next many beleeued came owne accorde confessed doings openly euident argument mortifycation fleshe desirous honor estimation hardly brought confesse hath erred desire truth glorye god ouercommeth affection fleshe beleeue place appeareth maner confession scripture requyre v verily publike open serueth setting forth god glorye amendement many therefore ignorance grosse thinke example establishe auricular confession wherewith confession luke speaketh hath affinitie ephesian come owne accorde confesse olde error giuing thankes vnto god vouchsafed deliuer pope enforceth men agaynst willes confesse secret faultes also manne priuie reade made confession pope commaundeth v oftentimes confesse made open confession men pope teacheth v whisper sinnes eare priest onely confession sought nothing glory god pope commaundeth aske remission sinnes satisfaction priest stande long diligently man examineth circumstance dooing manifestly shall appeere auricular confession rather ouerthrown confyrmed example lette v returne ephesian whereof many hytherto giuen curious artes nowe touched feeling christes spirite openly burne bookes heapes vnderstande onely magicall bookes also bookes serued rather vnto fruitelesse offensiue study vnto godlynesse part bookes astrologie geomantie soothsaying bookes bookes loue like sheweth also pryce value bookes germanes account amounteth summe sixe thousande sixe hundred threescore sixe florenes meane godly person thought take occasion offence themselues time come true propertie vnfeynedly repent hate instrumentes sinne much sinne selfe grieued lose thing knowe sometime bene occasion fall neuer precious therefore cannot iudged haue truly repented vnderstande heynousnesse offence vse retaine keepe dayes instrumentes euill dooinges image superstitious deckinges church bookes teach superstition amorous writing wanton apparell innumerable like last luke sayth worde god grewe mightily confyrmed heart disciple effect former studie worde god vseth marueylously growe impediment taken waye may hinder let v therfore followe example famous church increasing daily fayth may become perfyte men iesus christ lorde prayse honor power glory euer amen cxxviij homelie thinges ended paule purposed spirite hee passed ouer macedonia achaia go ierusalem saying haue bene must also see rome sent hee macedonia two ministred euen timotheus erastus himselfe remayned asia season tyme arose little adoe way certayne man named demetrius siluer smyth made siluer shrine diana little benefyciall craftes men whome called togither workemen like occupation sayd sir knowe craft haue aduauntage moreouer see heare alone ephesus almost throughout asia thys paule hath perswaded turned awaye much people saying bee goddes made handes onely craft commeth perill set naught also temple great goddesse diana shoulde despysed hir magnifycence shoulde bee destroyed whome asia worlde worshippeth bycause paule knewe lorde appoynted teacher one nation onely therefore thought woulde serue still one nation preach gospell euerywhere vnto people yea thought chiefely lay charge church declareth later epistle corinthian wherfore contented gather church togither goeth see visite gathered ordeyned least anye thing might fall downe agayne eyther wearysomnesse man craft subtiltie deuill haue seene hitherto diuers ensamples lyke endeuor wherevnto may also annexed luke telleth beginning place ioyneth newe hystorie sedition raysed paule whereby purpose visiting church time stopped author deuise counsayle holy spiritepaule mynded go ephesus whose conduct guyding haue often shewed paule beganne tooke matter hande purposed go macedonia achaia visite confyrme church philippian thessalonian corinthian also gather almesse reliefe among cary needy brother syria may euidently gathered epistle corinthian iourney ended ment go rome bestowe gift spirite vpon faythfull also rom receyue mutuall consolation beliefe yet bicause woulde seeme doe nothing rashly sent timotheus erastus familiers meaning himselfe followe long vprore begoonne ephesus stayed good many dayes againe example appeareth howe needefull conseruation church carefull seeing moste paynefull apostle yet much doe faine often go visite confyrme church ordeined therefore bewray fylthy sluggishenesse wicked arrogancy thinke zeale minister day vse behalfe vnprofytable superfluous also paule appeareth property true faith bicause ydle slothfull maketh men diligent vocation burneth zeale glory god loue hir neighbour cannot stande still ydle ouercome traueyle daunger euident onely example paule needeth long profe let euery man apply himselfe following declare faith work moreouer appeareth fayth circumspect also bicause paule whome holye ghost guided doings sendeth men knewe trustye true beleeuers haue expresse commaundement god followe without staggering although fleshe suggest diuers thing contrarye thinges whereof haue certaine commaundement god doe thinges prudently circumspectly feare might obscure glory god giue weake occasion stumbling safest way vse taking thing hande c paules purpose disappoyntedhowbeit although paule scarce anye receyued good among ephesian taught two yeares togither great vtilitie successe onely many people beleeued also gotten many chiefe asia friend hereafter shall appeare yet length fyndeth better curtesie haue hearde founde often place namely trouble publike sedition wherewith tossed turmoyled reckeneth daunger ephesus among greatest trouble euer writeth fought beastes despayre life cor cor c luke describeth hystorie marueylous diligently bicause glasse propertie condicions enimies truth craftes weapon set forth beholden also appeareth howe god vseth moste faythfully defende seruants truth place fyrst proponeth summe matter next sheweth beginner sedition oration demetrius cause stirrer tragedie incensing mindes adherentes paule sodayne vprore time sayth arose much adoe way calleth christian sect religion way aduersaries woulde haue oppressed time diligently obserued sheweth v howe thys stirre made paule set al thing order ephesus minded go macedonian corinthian sent two companion prepare thing necessary example admonished must alwaye watchfull chiefely matter seeme safetie daunger satan neuer resteth driuen holde seeketh meanes returne againe christ teacheth math want example grieuously offended sodayne cross trouble haue fallen fayth let yet comfort v much euer enimie rage raue yet hath power vppon christ iohn ne yet vppon fayth graffed christ yea long agone vanquished doth lighten basen shewe counterfeyte scarmuches fyght whereby fraye vntryed vnskylfull myndes demetrius author vprorebut let v see author instrument vprore demetrius siluersmith capitaine welthy man one made syluer shrynes gay geere honor diana therby occasion men occupation gate much money diana worshipped shewed aboue among ephesian vnder name nonlatin alphabet multimannuia whome seduced gentile superstition beleeued goddesse nourished fedde lyuing creature temple goddesse famousest sumptuous worlde vnto pilgrimage instituted place asia farre neere cause made implementes superstition gat much daylie straungers came thether therefore could abyde doctrine paule ouerthrew superstition hope gayne men therefore called togyther demetrius go oppresse paule sedition knowing force reason able conuince hym therefore appeareth euidently may occasion sedition ought ascribed gospell minister thereof fayth preache vniteth v god chiefely commendeth vnto v charitiye concorde demetrius expressely named begynner sedition paule two yeres taught shewed token seditious person kinde many example booke also hystories whereby learne ought ouer soone credited accuse gospell preacher thereof sedition let v searche truth farther shall appeare commonly fyrst begynners sedition would lay fault thereof vpon parte lyke demetrius complycesthe demetrij age eyther lyue craftes trade forbidden god else hunte game pleasure standard bearer among men byshop rome creature cardinal byshops monkes priestes greatest share lucre aduauntage superstition commeth hym causeth creature also get much money marked badge gyueth power buye sell make marchaundize god worde chop chaunge abyde truth gospell lyke sharpe whyppe shaken hande spirite christ dryueth marchaunting temple ouerturneth table exchaungers money next vnto kinges prince great trayne noble menne worlde superstition gainefull vnto also bicause vnder pretence hereof prouide number child defence dignitie whyle authoritie thrust bishopprickes abbacy cardynalshippes perhaps otherwyse set marchaunts trade get lyuing hand seemeth heynousest matter worlde nowe sortes togyther helpe inferior sort common lyue eyther monkes priestes noble common seruile nature disposition fearing dye famishment soone perswaded anye thing demetrij adde vnto eyther desire seeke lyue lycentiously else follow pleasure gaines mischieuous meanes vsurers whoremonger drunkardes hyred souldyours lyke people bicause workes naught would reprooued therefore wishe lyght gospell bewrayeth dooings extinguished say begynners sedition gospell man denye dyligently viewe vsage dayes chiefely demetrius oration considered proposition state whereof paule ought suffered doctrine demetrius oration draweth men olde religion confyrmeth proposition wyth three reason argument vse great force kinde deliberatiue fyrst taken commoditie profyte wherevnto hungryer poorer sorte haue alwayes specyall regarde knowe sayth craft haue aduauntage remayneth must perishe hunger suffer occupation ouerthrowne paules doctrine second reason borroweth necessitie see heare onely ephesus almost throughout asia thys paule hath perswaded c therfore matter driuen borne longer needefull speede prouyde remedie thirde argument fetcheth honestie saying onely craft commeth perill set naught also temple great goddesse diana despised hir magnificence destroyed whome asia worlde worshyppeth though say companion infamie shall purchase vnto selues suffer religion decay amongst v hath bene many age great authoritie worlde also oration appeare craftes vsages wicked incensed led desyre priuate lucre onely wyll yet counted defender religion one doth holyeghost describe caiaphas iohn talkes monkes dayes vpholde maintaine poperie amongst whome man shall scarce fynde one plaine demetrius doth dissemble chiefest respect hys priuate gaine aduauntage let v learne suspect clamoures marke better wherevnto tende appeareth also place argument time wicked vse defende superstition uerily consent vnlearned multitude authoritie king prince pompe shewe outwarde holynesse contynuaunce tyme chiefely pretence priuate gaine aduauntage thing common nowe dayes man would marke talke aduersaries foule fault christian vse argumentes heathen matter religion ought iudged determyned scripture onely fynally demetrius owne saying may gathered force power gospell confesseth paules teaching two yeares space famous temple brought daunger asia buylding space two hundred twentie yeares declared erewhyle barbarous people spared persian warres set fyre church complayneth also mennes mindes part turned worshipping diana euident coulde done mannes power authoritie also taught men haue profyted well gospell mindes wholy turned superstition idolatrie long hang suspence hereof certaine mindes lightened truth let v therefore examine selues rule casting awaye superstition turne feruent fayth iesus christ lorde prayse honor power glorye euer amen cxxix homelie hearde sayinges full wrath cryed saying great diana ephesian citie rore rushed common hall one assent caught gaius aristarchus men macedonia paules companion paule woulde haue entred vnto people disciple suffred certayne chiefe asia friendes sent vnto desiring woulde preace common hall therefore cryed one thing another congregation quiet part knewe wherefore come togither company drewe forth alexander iewes thrusting hym forwardes alexander beckened hande would haue gyuen people aunswere knewe iewe arose showte almost space two houres men cry great diana ephesian euaungelist luke instinct holye ghost setteth thys booke onely persecution layde vppon apostle magistrate order lawe also raging sedition furious common amongst deserueth counted chiefe begonne demetrius agaynst paule ephesus vse lyke serueth two cause speciallye first serue instruction minister offended tumultes seditious common anye straunge rare thing leaue duetie vndone feare rather must consider church thys worlde barke vessell tossed fro wynde tyde whose pylate
