christ seemeth sometime sleepe storie gospell declareth math let also remember scarcely chosen sedition must bycause euerye many brooke doctrine gospell maketh eyther agaynst gaine dignitie licentious lyuing sauyour christ prophecied men owne countrie also one house deuision hate one let suffise minister giue cause tumult seditious ledde naughtie affection take occasion let commyt successe vnto god meane season apply vocation bycause ambrose saythfift booke chapter lyeth v prouoke people appease vp hande god onely moreouer discription tumultes make instruction men generall teach v rashely impute cause vprore gospell minister thereof men vse commonly doe euery man shoulde consyder case throughly shall founde begynners tumultes ruled gospell one haue heard demetrius whome directly follow dayes vse disturbe hynder gospell bicause haue lately spoken aboundantly hereof nowe let v consyder sedicion paule vsed himselfe luke descrybeth verye dyligently rehearsing euerye circumstaunce thereofthe description sedition fyrst begynning cause sayth fylled wrath euill counseller taking anye thing hande iames sayth worketh nothing right good cause wrath daunger losse gayne auailes demetrius whyle ago sayde neere hande perhaps euery one perticularly beganne part feele worlde abyde nothing lesse haue aduauntage turned awaye dyminished daye none cause disturbaunces vsed agaynst gospell pope bishop angry bicause see dignitie decayeth monkes priestes offended reason kitchyns waxe colde losse market holynesse prince nobilitie grieued child put possession ecclesiasticall goodes alwayes tyll nowe lyued lyke lordes poorer sort common wonte flatter priestes nobilitie lyuing frette fume fooles iesters bawdes cooke harlottes gelded men buggered boyes lyke dregges fylthye wretch whome warrant holye father hytherto prouyded lyuings stampe stare thys geere heate rage runne counselles consult howe maye breake sunder bandes christ descrybed seconde psalme good therefore shall hope counselles wrath president blynde frowarde counseller thys done turne playne exclamation crye great diana ephesian saying testifye wyll defende worship diana euen bloude craftily make religion cloke belly lucre men dayes treade euen steppe wyth little sobrietie haue saintes blessed uirgin theyr mouthes agaynst v whose honour promise defende although men deede impudent without cause ephesian exclaymed bycause paule openly spake worshyp diana professed enimie thereof v denyeth saintes speaketh right worship marie derogateth thing hir dignitie honor confesse mother sonne god confesse uirgin vndefyled vnspotted confesse saintes chosen instrumentes god nowe lyue heauen blisse inuocation godlye honour saye due god alone iniurie teach sometime taught defence whereof thought good laye downe lyues therefore manifest slaunder saye enymies saintes thirdly whole citie vprore hereof demetrius onely author example taught mischiefe sodainely maye arise fewe seditious person little sparkle may set fyre whole house flame whereof beyng caried wynde catche whole streete vppon sodaine sedition rysing fewe beginner contempned fyrst euen onely fame thereof spreadeth selfe abroade compasseth whole common weales without present daunger mennes goodes holye scripture sheweth v example core absolon saeba dyuers others lyke also seene story gentyles amongst enterprise catiline notable brought romanes common weale great hazard seditious attempt euen flourished let magistrate hereby learne stoppe betymes lykely wyll one daye sedicious suche commonly ryotous person manye loue religion lukers sake kept vnder seueritie lawes length poure pestilent poyson calamitie publyke weale fourthly rushe common hall vyolence pluck awaye caius aristarchus paules companion therefore worke wyth force vse kynde crueltie agaynst innocentes although tempest sedition manye tymes vse catche good men enforced agaynst wyll take part yet part greater number euill whereby commeth passe sedition hurtfull good men guiltlesse therefore verye fooles hope anye goodnesse sedition must wyth dyligence go resist desyre prosperitie safetie common weales doth paule whottest seditionwhat paule sedition woulde haue stept forth gone amonge haue asswaged raging rebelles least companyons shoulde haue beene hurt haled awaye hearde euen nowe hys disciple woulde suffer hym chiefely great men asia friendes well knewe propertie people place man may beholde whole heape notable vertues paule singuler ensample fayth sincere friendship woulde leaue hys companyons daunger perill paule made great accounte two friendes woulde ieoparde lyfe sake care thinke whole congregation knewe redeemed bloude christ furthermore appeareth marueylous constancie fortitude woulde aduenture hymselfe amongst furious common thys commit himselfe rage sea else fyre respected promise christ wherewith emboldened daunger coulde feare doe duetie also token singuler modestie yeeldeth better counsell doth obstinately vrge daungerous little profyte ioyned therewith let euerye manne followe example bicause see many time greatest wyttes owne daungers knowe least waye counsell take also worthye noting paule hath great men friendes fewe reade christ amongst whome nicodemus ioseph counted chiefe iohn math error anabaptistes refelled saye christian ought beare office chiefely learne howe vaine defence succour worlde seing authoritie coulde keepe paule daunger sedition becommeth v therefore put hope trust god alone prince child men helpe psalme vse present example paule teacheth hys seconde epistle corinthian fyrst chapter nowe luke commeth seditious whome reporteth two thingsa confused countenance sedition first sayth cryed one thing part knewe wherefore come togyther peculiar thing time sedition like flowing streame caryeth many away vtterly ignoraunt meaning thereof great many good men also euen therefore would appeased rather counsell reason force force vsed commonly innocentes drinke wicked beginner slylie slipping awaye dolorous example whereof germany sawe yere lorde thousande fyue hundred twentie fyue horrible streames husbandman bloude almost ouerflowed hir let prince therefore haue minde rather saying prophet commaunded holde subiects liues deere psalm moreouer iewes thrust forwarde one alexander likelyhoode one paules friendes drewe forth bicause ment bring daunger desired silence woulde haue giuen reason accounte thing attempted touching religion perceyued iewe enimie heathen superstition turne furious exclamation againe two houres long fyll citie noyse diana belly lacketh eares commonly deafe wyll heare reason mooue sedition bellyes sake contynuall practise wicked barke truth wyth furious clamour otherwyse knowe inuincible meane season faintnesse great many reprooued knowing truth yet altogyther colde confessing thereof regarde zeale vngodlye whome see bolde euen defence superstition let v learne therefore state truth standeth worlde beyng armed wyth constancie fayth let v stowtely beare whatsoeuer god sendeth maye vanquishe aduersity iesus christ lorde praise honour power glorye euer amen cxxx homely towne clarke ceased people sayde yee men ephesus man knoweth howe citie ephesian worshipper great goddesse diana image came heauen seing manne sayth yee ought content doe nothing rashly ye haue brought hyther men neyther robber church yet despysers goddesse vvherefore demetrius craftesmen haue matter agaynst manne lawe open ruler let accuse one another go thing shall bee determined lawfull congregation ieoperdye accused dayes vprore forasmuch cause whereby maye giue reckoning concourse people thus spoken hee let assembly depart haue hearde sedition demetrius raised paule described luke beside propertie furious people noted diuers pointes wherein paule chiefely considered first boldly constantlye woulde haue ventured go among people mynding haue giuen account openly fayth doctrine seeing coulde permitted doe keepeth among friend committing whole successe matter vnto god yet swarued nayle breadth truth yet dissembled anye thing cowardlye feare example admonisheth v shoulde doe lyke casehowe christian vse themselues time sedition open persecution thing becommeth v according peter apostle precept ready giue account euerye manne demaundeth pet enimies shall raue place truth confession therof must proceede warily wiselye least put selfe daunger without god calling tempt meane season let v constaunt acknowledging truth wayte lordes leysure neuer forsaketh put trust wisedome power able easily cease alaye cruell tempestes present hystorye sheweth v ensample hereof god appeaseth daungerous sedition seeming help one scribe towneclarke one whole course oration proueth manifestly haue vnderstanding christes religion power god appeareth seeing vseth reprobate helpe defence people let v examine towneclarkes oration throughout partes thereof chiefe ende whereof represse seditious tumult vnruly people himselfe meane season little carefull religion beginneth ye vexed seditious stoode great feare diana hir sake cryed haue heard bicause worshipping hir layde awaye sawe gayne lyke gone towneclarke sayth iust sufficient cause make stirre man sayeth knoweth citie ephesus worshipper great goddesse diana image came heauen shoulde saye purpose repeate often furious clamor name diana denyeth hir honourers knoweth diana image came downe heauen letteth go religion receyued forefather since thing cleare question becommeth quiet doe nothing vppon heade without aduise towneclarke coulde ignoraunt paule doctrine impugned worship diana politike wit dissembleth thing thinking sufficient appease let vnderstande howe vrged compelled publike authoritie forsake olde religion sayde erewhyle thys politike man seeketh onely bring downe sedition one sawe beganne growe hote thing supposed bringe passe commodiously craftie dissembling matter open disputation diana ymage come heauen seditious woulde haue little regarded may omit sayth image came downe heauen hereby appeareth comon opinion among ephesian thought diana image sent downe heauen satan bewitched men iuglings presumed chaunge glorye immortall god forme creature deceyued euerye day newe fetch deuises surer establishing kingdome hereby perswaded image pallas came downe heauen hir protection gate victory thought shielde romaynes vsed armes scutchion empyre reigne numa king came downe heauen unto towne clarke sayth image diana ephesus may worthily ioyned bene tollerable deuill time past sleyghts deluded heathen onely seene like among christian also knoweth fable chappell lauretum myraculously conueyed ouer sea ignorant chappelles god himselfe aungels haue dedicated seene diuers image virgin mother monkes impudently affirme luke painted hystories declare phisition painter wherevnto referred whatsoeuer myracles tolde image monkes bookes whereof say remooued place coulde remooued wepte prophecied notable property maye plainely gathered ranke crop error vseth spring image receyued worshipped without cause lactantius sayde could religion wheresoeuer image second booke false religion cap also chiefe cause scripture diligent earnest oppugning woonderfull commeth passe many founde defende seeing many vnhappye presidentes superstition euerywhere euery mannes eye premised whereby thought moodie mindes somewhat asswaged plainly rebuketh accuseth great rashenesse apprehended layde handes caius aristarchus straungers knowing cause saying ye haue brought men hyther neyther robber church yet despysers goddesse perhaps might truly saye bicause tooke vpon teach paule shoulde haue sayde true earnestly inueyed worship ydolatrie done diana may easily gathered athens credible would haue suffred defence towneclarke bene present enflamed zeale god thought thing intollerable made glory honor god meane whyle towne clarkes wordes declare faultes part laide minister charge namely sacriledge blasphemie god saintes thing heare commonly dayes neyther decked name tytles handes professed enimies gospell man woulde throughly weygh matterthe minister gospell neyther church robber blasphemer false church robber eyther stelth conuey away goodes dedicated god church else violently inuade conuert prophane v doth impudently pope bishoppes monkes priestes marke say nothing howe prouide kinsfolke commonly church goodes let v consider family shall appeare greatest part church goodes spent vpon harlottes dyce horse houndes lubberlyke sort seruantes yea disdaine v cause much labor preaching gospell restore goodes christ church againe defend vnder colour gospell prouide satisfye auarice church goodes againe blasphemous god saintes abuse name god robbe saintes due honor manifest doe rather abuse worde god name christ establishe ydolatrie tyrannie giue vnto creature honour due vnto god accuse faith doctrine saintes heresie vse fyre sworde bookes follow meane season go defame v sacriledge blasphemie oh iniquitie time among ephesian founde heathen defende innocent nowe adayes amongst professor christ scarce anye testifye innocencie christes minister let v marke also howe towneclarke sayeth men church robber blasphemer surelye woulde haue iudged worthy punishment bene although gentyles sometime greatlye erred faith religion yet lawe nature great force amongst declared robber church blasphemer ought punished nowe dayes thing farre frame faythfull defender gospell daunger pollute church manifest sacriledge blasphemie let v consider later part orationthe best form common weale prescrybeth maner fourme followed well priuate matter publike saying demetrius craftes men haue anye matter agaynst man lawe open ruler let accuse one another thus accuseth iniustice make publike case priuate belonging vnto fewe person endaunger themselues another mannes cause adding therevnto seconde poynt sayth ut go thing shall determined lawfull congregation wordes teacheth publike matter shoulde sort taken hande layeth daunger eye stoode romaine sedition made care principally people vnder gouernance shoulde liue peaceably quiet place declareth romaynes gouerned common weale obserued equity iustice euerywhere abrode certaine liefetenants magistrate place kept courtes lawe dayes suffred man hurt harmed whose cause fyrst bene hearde lawfully conuicted publike affayres ordered publike assembly lawfull councels without seditious tumultes god himselfe allowed order gouernement appoynted iudges people whome commaunded heare cause diligently giue true iudgement would haue man iudge owne cause let order obserued among christian whome shame ouercome heathen chiefly let keepe sedition impaireth authoritie magistrate subuerteth state common weale rebellion easily suppressedbut effect oration doth luke set writeth assembly little hurly burly dimissed verye quietly common sort easily brought vprore easily pacifyed againe manne deale reason counsell rather force violence herein appeareth prouident care god wherewith deliuereth defendeth child god doth accustomably rayse waues sea sodeine blastes winde layeth sodenlye againe euen tryeth child dreadfull stormes daungers seeth good knoweth howe still againe without daunger wherefore trusting goodnesse power let v keepe standing stoute courage assuring selues haue vpper hande agaynst attemptes wicked thorowe christ iesus lorde reuenger faithfull inuincible whome prayse honour glorye power euer amen xx chapiter vpon actes apostle cxxxj homelie rage ceassed paule called disciple vnto toke leaue departed go macedonia gone ouer party giuen long exhortation came greece aboade three monethes iewes layde wayte sayle syria purposed returne macedonia accompanied asia sopater berrhoea thessalonia aristarchus secundus caius timotheus derba asia tychichus trophimus went tarried v troas sayled away philippi dayes sweete bread came vnto troas fiue dayes abode seauen dayes bicause oure sauiour iesus chryst called paule chosen vessell instrument therfore without cause luke repeateth diligently thing paule dyd truth testimonie chryst bare proued general ensample set al men follow wil taken chosen vessel god moreouer euangelist proceedeth rehearsal paules matter sometime declareth whole hystories circumstance thereof euery part contayne many thing serue instruction sawe came passe philippi corinthe athens lately ephesus sometime comprehendeth many thing one fewe word compriseth long perillous voiages scarse finished many month might euidently appeare diligence paule vsed office trustinesse incredible paynes tooke courage daungerous enterprisesthe argument xx chapter thing obserueth chapiter first briefly toucheth iorney macedonia achaia entente whereof declared next vnto sheweth certayn peculiar thing myracle wrought troas eutychus raysed agayne synode minister gathered togither miletum present consider paules iorney reporte whereof ordered paule dyd others also rehearsed wise paule departed fro ephesian iourney fell oute three thing chiefly considered paule firste declared howe departed ephesian rage ceassed sayth called disciple vnto tooke leaue departed forsooke churche businesse doone sawe disciple daunger paule therefore good shepheard hyreling seeth wolfe come iohn flyeth away prouideth hym selfe nother departeth away secretely calleth congregation togither byddeth farewell giuing admonition thing needefull knowe obserue argument mynde culpable guyltie selfe sheweth signification faythfull care woulde haue euen absente muche afterwarde wr te vnto ephesi hee sayth hee made continuall mention hys prayer place wryteth c church lyeth hys shoulders2 cor let followe thys example vnto whose charge either churche common weale committed least seeme prouyde owne selues publike perilles bee hande else haue little regarde whereof shall giue straight accounte another day vnto lorde paule visiteth macedoni greece nexte sheweth whether wente macedonia thence greece place spent three monethes bestowing tyme visiting confirming church thus wee reade dyd also wheres xiiij xv chapter whereby wee gather common vse apostle onely plant church afterwarde goe visite confirme fayth clense errours perhaps crepte whyle absent wee learne example whiche haue church common weales well ordered ought carelesse take good heede chryst warneth v whyle wee sleeping sathan sowe vngracious cockle among vseth chiefly lye wayte churche2 corin pul chryst ought cleaue vnto like faythfull wife likewise diuersly assaulteth many wayes good wholsome lawes bycause thinketh kingdome woulde easily bee established ouerturned attemptes alwayes vayne bycause fewe followe paules fayth industrie sufferaunce paule exhorteth congregatio perseuerace diligence thirdly playnely declared paule dyd church gaue long exhortation verily continue fayth without none bee saued often exhortation needefull v bee ready nature fall also bycause deuill whiche alway walketh vp downe lyke roaring lyon seeketh may deuoure therfore iudgemente bee admitted whiche thinke thys superfluous care labour meane season wee admonyshed church haue nothyng pryce worde god whiche dayly instruction exhortation correction ought bee taken wherein apostle diligente easily neglected thing comparison hereof wee mighte perceyue sixte chapter therefore bee farre vnlyke apostle neglect office ministerie worde teaching occupied wearishe ceremony else administration earthly iurisdictions let v returne vnto paule iewes lay wayte paule see suffered thys voyage iewes layde wayte hym hee sayling syria thoughte haue made hym oute way paule prudently disappoynteth altering purpose going lande macedonia syria place teacheth v rewarde minister truth haue worlde certes worste bee whyle men seeke destroy whiche men labour moste bryng saluation howe carefull paule iewes bothe continuall labour trauell also hys epistle testifie specially whiche wryteth romanes ninth tenth chapiter yet greater ennimies wee haue wheares declared moyses prophetes iesus chryste sonne god suffered let man therefore nowe dayes bee offended lyke thing fall seeing nature worlde thinke felicitie standeth destruction godly whiche iudgemente yet moste myserablie deceiued thus bereeue selues wholesome succour prayer whiche godly vse make euen ennimies shall wee doo wylte thou say wee shoulde come lyke hazarde followe paule whome thou shalte note principally two thinges constantly wente forwarde vocation lykewise prudently auoyded daunger thereof arising thus must aboue thing remember vocation wee bee plucked therefro ingratitude worlde shoulde wee forget calling followe whose wicked vsage wee wonte deteste yet let v circumspect chryste counsayleth v beware men least wee bee sayde tempte god math putting selues rashly vnaduisedly daunger nowe doth god meane season paules gard garriso leaueth hee seruaunt daunger whyle iewes kinssemen false brother hee complayneth ij corinth xj lay wayte god ioyneth vnto faythfull fellowes companion trauelles daungers helpe perrill counsell otherwise heere reckened seauen notable men diuers congregation whome paule many tymes maketh mention epistle beside luke wryter present hystorie made eyghte go see marke whether lying wayte prouide paule lodging kepte closely vnto comforte companie prouide necessary heere truth goodnesse god diligently bee considered whiche vseth defende seruauntes daunger prouide faythfull companion labour trauell glory hys name thus vnto ioseph required haue buriall chrystes body ioyned nicodemus beare parte charge laboure perill nowe dayes wee complayne slothe cowardelynesse others saying wee able alone beare weyght chrystes quarell beeing cowardely slothefull wee woulde doo duetie wee shoulde see god would quickely touche heartes others also wee haue besides paules companion notable example loue thankefulnesse daungerous laborous thing followe paule sea lande hauing euerywhere many enimies euery man may easily coniecture worthely estemed gyft fayth gotten paules teaching could separated men want reward euen vpon earth bycause god hath registred name eternal memorie soules doubt reioyce wyth chryste heauen bycause accompanied minister curteously earth apostle setteth foorth promptnesse readynesse minde galathians also sayth woulde haue spared eye hee needed filthy vnthankefulnesse dayes runne farre whiche bragge fayth rent deface filthy slaunders name whose ministerie firste learned fayth yet let god promise mercy comforte v neuer leaue destitute helpe hath chosen inheritaunce heauenly life sonne iesus chryste whome bee prayse honour power glory euer amen cxxxij homelie vppon one saboth dayes disciple came togyther breake breade paule preached vnto ready departe morrowe continued preaching vnto midnyghte many lightes chamber wee gathered togyther sate wyndowe certayne young man named eutychus beeyng fallen deepe sleepe paule preachyng ouercome wyth sleepe fell downe thirde lofte taken vppe deade paule wente downe hee fell hym embraced hym sayde make nothyng adoo hys lyfe hym hee come vppe agayne hadde broken breade eaten talked long whyle euen vntyll mornyng laste hee departed broughte young man alyue lyttle comforted went afore shippe loosed vnto asson receyue paule appoynted woulde selfe goe foote come togither asson wee tooke came mitylene sailed thence came next day ouer chios next day arriued samos taryed trogyllion day following came miletum paule determined saile ouer ephesus bicause would spend time asia hasted possible keepe ierusalem feaste pentecoste apostle paule accomplished ephesus thing appertained establishment church went hee voyage hee purposed make hee visited church macedonia greece confirmed true faithe wee haue seene notable argumentes apostle faythe diligence paule lette laboure daunger eyther gette church preserue gotten length hee came troas fell oute certaine peculiare thing describing whereof luke diligent first hee setteth ensample ecclesiasticall assemblie next myracle god would haue wrought place bothe commendation setting forthe paules ministerie diuers cause else hee describeth churche assemblie circumstaunces thereof diligently beginning timean exaple churche assembly saythe came togither sabboth day day yet muche celebrated bicause auncient custome afterward church began increase next day following sabothe appoynted goddes seruice remembraunce christes resurrection called lordes day place learne suche dayes god hathe appoynted seruice religion ought bee neglected christian menne onely needefull bicause outwarde woorshippe also inwarde cheefely consisteth studie goddes woorde diligent meditation benefites bodie minde time beeing cleane separated prophane matter whiche thyng cause god commaunded breaker sabothe bee punished deathe breaking saboth acco ted prophetes amongest moste haynous sinnes cause captiuitie babylon without cause nehemias thought duetie nehem see day kept holy people retourned captiuitie whereunto appertaineth also example christ oftentimes vppon saboth day went sinagoges diuers time disputed diligently right vsing day deliuer superstition also contempteholy place sheweth also place companie assemblie mette loft chambre priuate house one faithfull appointed churche congregation bicause christian good cause abhorred temple idolater publike place permitted reason romane presidentes bare rule euery place either fauourers christian religion else open enimies thereof sayth diuers candle lighted chamber putte away darkenesse nighte auoyding suspition dishonestie therefore peeuishe erroure foolishe imitation make seruice god time past serued necessitie thinke god light euerlasting woorshipped candle tallowe waxe defense inuention vse place example moses lawe heere plainely expressed night time needefull candle bee lighted cause afterwarde christian vsed candle assembly bicause coulde meete togyther morning day reason lying awayte ennimies appeareth epistle plinius secundus may gathered oute churche wryters cause taken awaye foolishnesse helpe day lighte artificiall lightes euident farre meaning candlesticke leuiticus ceremony priesthoode figure thing christ shoulde perfourme ordained till time correction candlesticke also figure christ true eternall lighte worlde ministerie gospell lighteneth churche cause apostle theyr true lawful successoures math called light world meane season wee learne necessary haue certaine place outwarde woorshipping congregation meete suche olde testament temple sinagoges suche apostle time churche began somewhat rest oratory builded place thing must serue honestie religion nothing must suffered declareth superstition much riotous costthe breaking bread prophane contempt thirdly sheweth cause meeting writeth breake bread meaneth holy supper lorde time past called breaking bread bicause bread broken therein according christes institution bothe wee shoulde confesse oure selfe sinner guiltie death christ also vnderstand merite christ dealt among v pertained indifferently vnto beleeuers worthy obserued howe forefather time apostle vsed order celebrate supper firste paule maketh sermon thing following declare bicause supper ended eutychus raised therfore sermon ended went supper open sight assemblie place time appoynted god seruice none fashion appointed christ obserued manner rite pointes woorde breaking breade example paule declareth reuoked corinthian carefully forme supper christ ordained thus euident christ also vsed teach supper ordaine nothing tending superstition religion therefore let papistes regarde argumentes example defend masse wherin word god taught al thing strage tong people haue nothing muse think wearish peeuish gesture stage playes say nothing meane impairing chrystes sacrifice derogation merit faith religion christ ouerthrowne euen vnto foundation ought seduced leauer folow imagination braine institution christ moreouer manner paule vsed preaching pertaineth description assembly churchethe manner apostle preaching may coniecture time first sayde prolonged sermon vntill midnight supper done howe discoursed till breake day thing appertaining religion therefore teaching fashion sake though cared whether great zeale diligence righte iudgement ministerie knewe sent god embassador christ testifieth later epistle corinthian fifthe chapter therefore feruent zeale bicause would coumpted vntrustie ambassadoure vnto god also euident hearer good iudgement paules ministerie doctrine bicause vouchsafe beare paciently night long example slouth age reproued great contempt goddes woorde minister appeare token apostolike zeale bicause many occupied vaine study meditation god woorde thinke haue well discharged duetie make one two cold collatios weke people stand long heare thinke euery minute houre spend hearing goddes woorde whole day whereas trifeling study yea filthie dishonest thinke time cost laboure muche hereof commeth passe authoritie ministerie despised word god kept great many see god sayth euils malach cap amos followeth myracle god thought good eutich falleth windowe dieth approue ministerie paule also stirre men vp diligente consydering paules doctrine fyrst part whereof eutychus consydered vpon whome myracle shewed paule preaching sat window either bicause number hearer many seate elswhere else bicause wold haue shaken slepe perceiued came creping howbeit length ouercome sleepe fel downe died fall thing came vnto whose sleepinesse might many wayes excused thinke may come passe fall heare worde god contemptuous wise seeme sit heare either purpose settle selues slepe else ouercome surfe quaffing enforced sleepe men negligent saluation much regard maiesty god wherfore preaching gospel must tend destruction otherwise administratrix saluation vnto diligent hearer beleeue also taughte place god permitteth v sometimes tempted doleful heauie trouble thing pray could make paules doctrine suspected seeing industrie disturbed dolorous trouble yea enuie apostle haue haue bene iudged cause reason long sermon lord faileth notable myracle sheweth gospell bringeth saluation whatsoeuer seemeth make serueth confirmation therof let v learne therefore iudge rightly aduersities falleth oute god sendeth feare v haue occasion exercise power let v therfore paciently suffer al thing doubt knowne truth shal come passe ende thing shall ioyfull whose beginning seemed v altogither vnprosperous dolefull shall euidently declared second parte miracle omit example might brought luke describeth myraculous raising vp eutychus againethe miraculous raysing agayne eutichus wherein thing paule must considered order first assone knewe matter gate downe helpe alleageth excuse neither dishnoouring sabothe supper therfore superstitious remembring doctrine christe vnderstandeth sabothe ordained man externe ceremony must giue place vnto charitie therfore foolishe superstitious yea wicked like necessitie saye vnlawfull breake tradition men bounde vnto monkishe rule may helpe kinsfolke daunger distresse thinke cause sufficient interrupt sacrifice masse falling vpon yong man embraceth bicause thought could bring life againe touching body knew must done power christ whose ambassadour wherfore gesture paule conteineth mysterie saluation proud fal adam sinne death meane thereof fell v christ life saluation offred v partaker wherof shall bee drawne doctrine apostle armes doe come fellowship christ fayth furthermore friendly comforteth feare saying make nothing adoe troubled without cause afraide saide least weake faith would hereby much haue swarued wherefore addeth life yet wordes denieth myracle pronounceth modestly selfe bicause would seeme attribute thing selfe would giue occasion man thinke aboue becommed returning forthwith chambre againe maketh ende distributing supper beginneth newe sermon continueth vntill morning sunne vp taketh iourney herein paules wonderfull diligence commended hauing wrought myracle goeth yet vocation thinketh hath yet fulfilled duetie sluggardes vse yet great vaunter owne labor trauailes let v imitate paules industrie thinke owe god seruice greater token perceiue oure selues power grace luke ioyneth vnto myracle notable frute endeuor studie brought yong man aliue woorkes god perfecte apostle beguiled man myracles legierdemaine iuglers vse beleeuers little comforted bicause yong man restored life againe sawe set eye euident testimonie god grace fauor place declared vnto v frutes vse alwayes followe studie gospell bothe bringeth life vnto v bicause gospell power saluation vnto beleeue recreateth minde sounde ioy teacheth v father reconciled vnto v sonne iohn ioye full perfite man able take v furthermore euangelist returneth description paules voiage rehersing order city place paules viages wer ful trauailes danger either sailed else made abode time situation standing place man desire knowe may peruse table bookes geographer troas vnto asson paule went fote sending companion afore barche ment either visite congregation went auoide anoyance sailing sea yet humanitie praised would ease felowes trauaile abuse industrie good length passing ephesus come vnto miletum malta wher called minister asia vnto synode wrytten made great haste bicause purposed ierusale pentecost vsage iewes bicause concursse people thought heare preach great auaile profite place notable containing paules trauailes ieoperdies learne howe difficult matter duely truely serue god abide none worse idle sluggish worshipper thus read abraham isaac iacob moses prophet christ troubled embrued continuall laboures perilles therefore let v also prepare selues labour daungers troubled sodainly fall v place teacheth v also authoritie gospell ought v know set forth paine trauaile effusion much bloud ende laboured apostle prophetes sonne god marke luke testifieth came also preach set forth gospell therfore slouthfulnesse execrable easely let treasure taken religion likewise preposterous alwayes hauing mouthes saintes honouring saintes doe meane season lothe doctrine gospell whose sake tyll saintes suffered suche paine abode many daungers length shed bloud let v therfore haue true opinion treasure brother saluation offered v aucthor wherof iesus christ praise honoure power glory euer amen cxxxiij homelie miletus sent messenger ephesus called elder congregation come saide vnto ye know first day came asia manner haue bene season seruing lorde humblenesse minde many teares temptation came passe vnto laying await iewes bicause would kepe backe nothing profitable vnto shew teach openly thorow euery house witnessing ievves also greekes repentance towarde god faith toward lord iesus holy ghost holy wryter luke moste diligently reporteth actes apostle iesus christ partly minister might haue presidet follow partly men might vnderstande aucthoritie gospell ought v haue set forth great paine trauailes heereunto presente acte paule apostle referred although made great haste ierusalem ment spend time asia yet intermitted none thing belonged vtilitie church asia calleth miletus elder minister ephesus city adioyningthe councel miletus general coucel concludeth thing much waight importance example faith industrie paule appeareth taught conuocation minister common consent party necessary determination ecclesiasticall matter maketh maintenance discipline church kepe vnder ambition prelate conserue vnitie true doctrine beat downe heresy many time vse creepe minister doe faithfully sette helpes heere therfore error would mingle workes lawe faith christ abolished general conuocation truthe defended aucthoritie heereunto moste godly prudent prince constantine great respecte vsed cal synodes bishop togither licunus publike ennimie christian religion greatly resiste publike proclamation eusebius wrytethin first booke life constantine forbade pastoures church meete assemble togither craftie subtile foxe perceiued consent vnitie minister churche confession true faith cheefely established consent cheefely maintained aucthoritie counsel antichrist craftily hath pulled vnto selfe aucthoritie counsel end would haue tyrannie kepte vnder counsel lawfully assembled also minister asia declared singuler example modestie although number yet refused appointment paule one preached christ first quarter whome many argument proued chosen instrument christ although dignitie minister church alike none ought chalege power aucthoritie ouer yet order necessary churche neuer kept maintained except minister obserue modestie humilitie among themselues paule therefore call pastor asia bicause chalenged priuate aucthoritie iurisdiction ouer bicause behoofe auaile whole church haue warning matter importance wherein thought behinde parte bicause confesseth wheres knewe selfe debter bothe iewes gentile rom furthermore let v see paules oration containing cause calling synodethe argument paules oration made counsell hath vehement pithie exhortation muche see would followe example diligently kepe doctrine taught would carefully watche sauegarde churche stoutly resist heretickes whereof numbre noysome hurtfull would follow exhorteth rather example vrgeth earnestly bicause owne conscience culpable communed whome credite diligence well knowne beginning comprehendeth brefely bothe example owne life summe doctrine concerning liuing sayth thus paul redreth accompt liuing yee knowe first day came asia manner haue beene season seruing lorde humblenesse minde many teares temptation happened mee laying await iewes calleth witness alleageth time conuersation among least mighte thinke hee counterfaited godlinesse small seasone great many vse doe haue craftily crope gotte within men pretence vertuousnesse lengthe moste shamefully bewray cloked naughtinesse wicked long counterfet godlinesse bicause paule wholely addicted himselfe vnto christ religion therefore alwayes obserued one tenor conuersation one like studie trauaile ministerie studie trauaile vnderstanded sayde serued lorde wherein maketh mention three thing specially humblenesse minde teares earnest desyre mennes saluation caused shed greeuous temptation yet could neuer plucke office duetie lette minister church learne manner men ought ministerie churche firste lette laboure humilitiehumilitie ascribe selues impudently diuinitie godheade propertie antichriste contempne persone comparison themselues2 thessa arrogantly seeke rule lordshippe ouer fellowe minister thing peter warneth first epistle fifthe chapter becommeth bee christes minister followe christes ensample hee derogateth nothing glory father hee neuer disdained persone muche hee liued familiarely publicanes sinner witsafe washe hys disciple feete leauing example humilitie teaching shoulde refuse kinde duetifulnesse one towardes unto humilitie must bee ioyned desire profite menne whiche minister muste seeke diligencedesire al men sal ation yea euen teares hereof haue ensample christe mathewe wryteth ninthe chapter moued euen bottome heart sawe iewes go astray like sheepe lacking shephearde place read wepte hee behelde ierusalem vnkinde bloudy citie knowing greeuous wickednesse irrepentant mindes shortly come destruction luke like affection charitie see moses chose rather bee wyped oute booke life see destruction countryman exod samuel prophete like also hearing god hadde forsaken saule tooke suche care heart therefore ceased mourning till god reprehended it1 sam sam paule proudely bragged affection bothe faithfull continuall diligence sette foorthe publike saluation proueth also iewes sake hys mortall ennemyes hee wished accursed surely many well vnderstande reason ministerie cannot wante thys affection heare menne borne againe ministerie take theyr child whome bryng vnto god vse embrace fatherly affection man wante doubtlesse hee aboundantly declareth hee vnderstandeth dignitie hys ministerie muste bee also ioyned heereunto thirde thing fall time temptation ouercomen feare iohn forsake church persecution ariseth christ saithe propretie hireling yea lette thincke faithe constancie cheefely requiredconstancy see bothe selues sheepe tempted manne woulde compare nowe dayes bee called successoures apostle wyth example paule shall easely appeare howe little nothyng paules heart minde bicause pride exceede barbarous prince fill world full warres haue pitie sheepe goe astray careful prouide common losse detriment men lette v retourne vnto paule rendering accompte hys doctrine setteth perfecte patterne paul giueth accounte doctrine onely ephesian asia minister tymes place fyrste sayth didde thing among good purpose intente kepte backe nothyng profitable vnto shewed c sense ishe taughte thing hee kepte nothyng necessarie knowe required minister teache doctrine saluation perfectly keepe backe nothyng worldes pleasure yea worlde rageth muste trumpe worde sounde suffer truthe bee oppressed ouercome fury worlde heere reproued errour whych thinke good yeelde somewhat enimyes truthe bee incensed playnenesse teaching thoughe became fiercer throughe slothe minister whyle thynke men feare minister distruste grounde quarell heere chiefly bee noted apostle teache thinges fully perfectly concerne saluation man needeth addition patch supply make vp doctrine euident chryst concealeth nothing prouing argument tooke friendes bycause reuealed thinges vnto receyued father promised spirite prompt iohn put remembraunce thing haue seene receyued therefore doctrine apostle full perfecte whereby taughte iesus chryste onely vnto churche epistle sermon aboundantly declare therefore great iniurie chryste apostle dare coyne newe article fayth thruste churche diuers thing expressely contrary doctrine apostle secondely hee declareth manner hee obserued teachinghe taughte priuatly apertly whyle hee saythe taughte bothe priuately apertly thoroughout euery house witnessing bothe iewes also gentile thinges declare continuall trauell apostle wherewith enflamed sette men doctrine saluation omitted nothing made saluation men wee learne heereby beste trade manner teaching firste thinges muste bee declared generally openly belong saluation men may vnderstande ought eyther doo leaue vndoone bycause men yelde owne accorde yet many tymes offende carelesnesse malice without offence others behoueth also adioyne priuate admonition exhortation reprehension duetie euery christian admonishe neighboure bring way howe muche oughte minister thus doo whome chryste one day shall require accompte office committed vnto hym word witnessing noted earnest free kinde speech without thing colde diligently considered authoritie minister hath ouer sheepe committed charge seeing muste teache exhorte bothe openly priuily euery house also may gathered howe ought bee taken admonished neither publikely priuately minister shoulde bee iudged sheepe chryst presumptuously disdayne voyce shepheard finally coprehendeth summe doctrine two poynts saythe sume paules doctrine repentaunce toward god fayth iesus chryst thing agree commaundement chryst appoynted apostle preach repentaunce forgiuenesse sinnes name wherby appeareth paule preached true gospell also maner doctrine ought preached heere repentaunce hathe first place otherwheres haue defined conuerting turning vnto god diffinition paule alloweth sayth taught repentaunce towarde god luc thing men turne vnto god tooke apostle beginning preaching chryst commaunded bicause haue gone way nature corrupte bycause wee flye sighte god adam therfore must fayth chryst also preached teacheth v wee reconciled father meane sonne whome wee beeing borne agayne immortall seede god worde made child god therefore errour hurtefull shamefull whiche still vrge penaunce meane whyle neglecte faythe without whiche repentaunce stande howe shoulde returne vnto god hath chryste iohn onely way lighte truthe without man commeth vnto father bycause haue entreated matter wheres large let fewe suffise season let men learne paules example iudge doctrine suffer manner doctrine thrust among suche teacheth true conuersion vnto god fayth iesus chryste whome prayse honor power glory euer amen cxxxiiij homelie behold go bounde spirite vnto ierusalem knowing thing shall come holy ghost witnesseth euery citie saying band trouble abide none thing moue neither life deare vnto selfe might fulfill course ioy ministration haue receyued lorde iesu testifie gospell grace god behold sure hencefoorth ye haue gone preaching kingdome god shall see face wherefore take recorde day pure bloud men haue spared laboure haue shewed counsayle god although iesus chryst sonne god whyle world alwayes loued disciple maruelously yet declared euident token loue little gooing away graue wholsome admonition gaue laste supper abundauntly declare paule following example onely carefull saluation church whyle among departed yea beeing absent much manyfestly declared howe neare harte welfare dyd sitte appeareth euerywhere epistle specially oration made synode miletum pastours minister asia foresawe shoulde neuer come agayne church asia knewe daunger lyke follow false teacher gone therefore warneth trustinesse diligence possible duetyes thing necessarie saluation chiefly setteth owne example purchase authoritie admonition whereof bycause yesterday intreated sufficiently ynough nowe come explication present place followeth reason cause moued earnestly vrge owne example verily euen vpon departurethe argument place returne agayne hereof gathered ought follow example apostle teacher diligence take vpon care church least lose slouthe negligence gotten great labour trauell whole summe place shall good consider thing order declared seeke mystery lye hidden euery worde first beholde sayth go bounde spirite paule guyding god spirite goeth ierus lem vnto ierusalem word vnderstandeth secrete motion holy ghost see alwayes guide dooings unto although willingly obeyed thing folowing declare yet testifieth led bounde least might seeme ouer lightly rashly tempt god putting himselfe daunger without cause declareth therefore coulde otherwise vnlesse would obstinately wrastle spirite god maner paules speaking teacheth v regard secret suggestion holy ghost also open expresse oracle muste like bad wherby wayward striuing flesh must brought obedience faith willingly least fele mightie hand god great losse calamitie bringeth lefer folow se suality flesh obey calling euen perforce willeth thus read angry moses refusing ye office offered exod iere exod vnto ieremie lyke alleaging youthe sayde wrathfull wyse saye yong thou shalte go shall send thee vnto whatsoeuer commaunde thee shalt thou speake c iere happened vnto ionas refusing vocation god euident nedeth rehearsal wordes paule called vnto manifest daungersso matter commeth litle litle purpose saying knowe shall become cause spirite vrgeth take iourney spirite telleth euery affliction band prepared thing holie prophet euery church one consent testifie yet must goe thorough pykes daungers yea death also considering semeth good vnto god hath power vpon selfe death place worthye consydered bicause may serue much instruction consolation first declareth faythfull care god vseth defende prouide loueth entirely chose consider giue warning time thinges shall befall howe neglecte seruauntes honoure seing foresheweth paine wicked bringeth calamitie vpon first warneth thereof prophetes nexte see howe god also warneth paule vnderstoode band affliction prepared hierusalem ende hereof holy ghoste yet reueled vnto god therefore generall sorte parte admonisheth bee although declare perticulers euery thing reuealeth asmuch vnto needefull know may prepare themselues beare crosse leaue successe thereof vnto haue generall prediction whereby admonished shall suffer tribulation aduersities worlde chiefe vse whereof shoulde prepare selues beare least fel v vnarmed would occasion greater offence thirdely behoueth v obserue counsell god wont meruellously shewe towarde faythfull seruaunts paule many time warned brother eyther flying saued selfe else prudently defeated ennimies awaytes nowe also admonished bandes affliction vrged prycked forwarde spirit god vnderstandeth must wade middle notwithstanding brother greatly dissuade contrarie reade also iesus chryst sometime auoyded attemptes laying wayte enimies yet length commeth forth meete perceiued houre come eternall decree heauenly father required thinges teach v daungers alwayes sufficient occasion man flye vrged sure vocation god must suffer selues reuoked neyther fire sworde floudes maine sea happened redde sea duetie wherevnto perceyue called god paules constancie faithbut bycause woulde put friendes brother much feare vseth apostolyke christian consolation saying howe none thing moue say woulde haue greeued sake take sorrowe thing make accounte paule doest thou contemne oracle holy ghost louing admonition thy brother therfore little esteeme present daungers hande bicause passe little life say esteeme temporall lyfe vocation lorde hathe appoynted vnto yea desire finishe course ioyfully satisfie office duetie publishing gospell grace god place therefore haue long sithence dedicated lyfe vnto chryste imprisonmentes affliction make afrayde example paule declareth howe godly vse themselues aduersitie firste shoulde care tribulation auoyding shoulde committe vncomely vnworthy parte otherwise god haue v ledde stoikes indolencie wee shoulde haue consideration selfe vocation bee greater comforte case men oftentimes meditate vppon god prouidence christ setteth disciple dauid maketh bee onely defence safest sanctuarie math psalm beleeueth fleetings numbred god hys teares putte bottell math psalm nexte let take heede preferre temporall lyfe eternall let rather consider howe god hath lente v lyfe liue vnto neede also require dye vnto bicause must dye neuer dye happelier god vocation shall saying dauid verified v psalm precious sighte lorde death saincts vnlawfull preferre lyfe life euerlasting math howe muche lesse oughte preferre rich honour pleasure suche worldely commodity aduantageth man get worlde lose soule thing precious luc redeeme one soule finally godly muste labour passe aduersities ioyfully accomplishe course office wherewith put charge prosperously su fiseth beginne well continue still wee haue often tymes declared let men therefore remember lyfe lyke vnto race ende whereof death moste ioyfully take holde duetie euen vnto ende go furtherthe gospel grace god let v see paule speaketh gospell ministerie thereof calleth gospell grace god effecte thereof bycause offereth v grace god teacheth v reconciled god father sonne iesus chryste hereby appeareth great vngodlynesse wickedly disdaine contemne gospell like vnto sedicious people thinke inough moue stirre sedition agaynst magistrate wil also scornfully deride grace offred magistrate fowly intreate messangers sent vnto euident gyltie sedition god haue deserued destruction god pardoneth al fence merite sonne declareth grace fauor v gospell whiche whosoeuer refuse verily declare themselues vtterly inexcusable vnworthy pardon hereafter speaking ministery vseth word testifying wherby haue oftentimes declared vnderstanded playn free earnest kinde preaching gospell bare simple narration thing done testimonie iesus chryst chryste selfe calleth apostle witness iosu actes earnestly therefore preached chryst yea testified onely word deedes also lyfe bloud chryst sauiour worlde cause commonly called martyr say apostle muste christian likewise math christ wil haue v confesse worlde acknowledgeth none seruants ashamed gospell adulterous naughty generation concer ing paule bicause would haue exhortation haue authoritie repeateth short recapitulation ende spake thing heretofore said paule foresheweth death maketh metion departure also plainly testifieth yt shall see hereafter saying behold sure hencefoorth al haue gone preaching kingdom god shal see face doth parets vse redy depart life admonitios oftetimes vse like therby meaning leaue sharper sting hart childre paules intent purpose worthy al praise diliget obseruation whose maruelous bold constace appereth word althogh knoweth last meting shold haue therfore loketh nothing death yet doth womanly weping bewaile departure vttreth toke sadnes priuat sorow carefull ye welth church desireth careful example teacheth v mind haue consideration death else death approcheth hand must case beware womanish pulinesse wherwith many bewaile state condition though god apointed dye sorow care pulled fro kinsfolke friend though remained none world whose care prouidece might liue safetie whe gone howbeit ought rather remeber way al flesh iosu reg iosua dauid testifie iniurie receyue al others touching freds wiues child neither lose death either send afore beeing selues shortly redy folow el go place whither must folow christ hath prepared v countrey faithful al natios shal sit abraham math isaac iacob tutor patrone leaue behind v god scripture call defender stragers widow psal father fatherlesse therfore must comitted charge must takewith stedfast faith way leadeth heue merite chryst last paule vseth weighty protestatio paules protestation wherin layeth fault perdition owne head neglect church committed charge suffer stray fayth take sayth recorde day pure bloud men reason haue spared labour haue shewed al councell god undoutedly respect vnto word god red eze bloud perish imputed minister expresly giue warning self free fro al fault duetie faithfully bycause paule one culpable owne conscience thus speaketh also seemeth follow example singular men moses iosua deut iosu read vsed much vnlike protestation little death paules example teacheth v excused god dutie although little nothing preuayle among people committed charge gyltie destruction continue incurablenesse doctrine applied onely minister also vnto degree men ought haue place magistrate example iosias declareth whome holy ghoste maruellously commendeth although many kingdome yea courte sounde many playne incurable wicked sermon sophonias prophete testifie lyke reason made parent oftentimes commeth passe godly father haue child go kinde yet childrens wickednesse preiudiciall father fayle duetie seeing child wee haue ensamples sonnes iacob patriarche dauid diuers like magistrate parent forget duetie ouermuche tendernesse euill example infect committed charge seueritie god iudgement fall vpon see scripture example heli heere haste thou aunswere suche1 sam thinke good cease hope profyte nowe obiected agaynst magistrate minister argument sluggish vse flatter themselues thou thinke thy soule also danger thou canst deliuer none wayes faythful diligence thou deliuer hir thinke thou haste laboured vayne appereth also place miserable condition predecessor haue wel discharged duetie eyther like sluggardes giue ouer else naughtinesse corrupte haue well ordered altogither gyltie voyde excuse god forasmuch charge cleare bloud ought obserued church age reformed word god reformatio hereof laborious dangerous excuse shall light backslider haue seeing dust minister shall suffise conuince haue otherwheres declared like nedeful obserued comon weale heluetia enioy libertie redemed bloud auncestrie good lawes made doctrine gospell discipline maners instituted much labour paynes wo vnto v wretch worthy punishmet either cowardly fear light demeanor wickednesse suffer thing take fro v publike weale cosisteth faythful industrie care parent maketh child inexcusable bee aunswerable vnto finally men duetie well remember least whyle flatter selues put faulte another whereof guyltie worthy bee obserued paule hath shewed councell god namely touching redemption saluation wee knowe otherwyse many thinges prouidence god lawefull v searche neither declared tong suche paule testifieth heard thirde heauen omitted none thing whiche concerne saluation bycause hath declared cause reason thereof2 cor also moste truely reported dueties saued whervpon agayne wee gather apostle doctrine conteyned scripture perfect absolute poyntes therfore vanitie rashe thruste tradition men church whereof greatest part playnly repugne agaynst doctrine apostle teache v chryste alone sauiour thing playnely repugnaunt amongest selues haue one selfe spirite god bee author laste thou shalte note thoughe paule shewed counsell god vnto ephesian yet afterwarde wrote epistle wherein expounded vnto agayne example wee taughte care consideration minister churche muste haue men saluation howe lyttle apostolyke easily neglecte church meane season let v learne embrace true fayth obedience councell god reuealed v apostle iesus chryste wee followyng may attayne vnto true saluation throughe iesus chryste onely lorde sauiour whome prayse honour power glory euer amen cxxxv homelie take hede therfore vnto yourselues flocke among holy ghost hath made ouerseers rule congregation god hath purchased bloud sure departure shall greeuous wolues enter among sparing flocke moreouer owne selues shal men arise speaking peruerse thing draw disciple therfore awake remember space three yeres ceased warne euery one night day teares brother comend god worde grace able builde giue inheritance among sanctified seing nothing deare precious god church hath purchased bloud christ becommeth men compted god seruauntes frendes studie prese uation therof cheefely care belongeth minister woorde bicause god hath made peculiar ouerseers churche heereafter require accompt stewardship cause paule apostle ready forsake asia called minister church open assembly discoursed diligently al thing appertained administration charge committed vnto first setteth owne example speaketh going away moste graue protestation might know al charge church hereafter lay therfore ought earnestly zelously laboure therein moreouer premiss commeth nearer admonishing plainely duetie alleaging moste pithie reason rather prouoke first propounding summe matter fewe wordes saythelet minister take heede selues take hede vnto selues flocke worde attending taking hede commedeth earnest studie think done duetie superficially seene vnto know great neede care circumspection propoundeth two thing wherein neede circumspect first saith take hede selues commaundeth bicause think selues excepted excused health wel hazard well mennes scarce credible shall haue earnest care others saluation neglect owne beeing set high degree ought view life manner conuersation others daunger either shal swarue one side runne ruine puffed vp vaine glory else shal drawne duetie offended mennes vniuste iudgements therfore without cause admonisheth take heede selues heere behoueth pastoures haue special care two thing one doctrine wherein erre without manifest detriment doctrine therefore may true let taken mouthe god speaketh vnto v scripture distributing prudet maner let vse duely time place al thing may serue edification bicause matter small importance continuall studie reading holy scripture needeful paule teacheth v place conuersation life1 timoth timoth minister behooueth well ordered blamelesse least destroy euill example builde vp doctrine meanes bothe doctrine religion growe contempt read came passe sometimes vnder child hely wicked priest returned babylon sam malach sam mala auoyding like thing necessary haue good regard onely owne person also whole familie shall able rule churche god able rule hys owne house timoth titus timoth tit secondly commendeth charge whole flocke wherein somewhat long wee shall heare worde flocke comprehendeth churchlet minister looke vnto whole flock therin folowing prophet chryst many time vsed like allegorie translation vse word commodious bicause containeth expressely state degree men doe woordes house familie whereby otherwhiles church vseth termed woordes admonishe minister people duetie minister learne care al men appertaineth vnto lawfull neglecte man hee learned vnlearned noble base rich poore maister seruaunt must rather thinke great house many diuers instrument good man house haue seruauntes haue diligent conuenient care againe hearer learne men vniuersally estate degree euer bee ought bee subiect ministerie discipline woorde man free therefrom bee accoumpted one goddes flocke familie god saide vnto hieremie ierem well knowne euery bodie beholde day doe make thee strong fensed towne yron piller brasen wall againste whole lande againste king mightie men iuda preestes people lande therefore without cause prophetes time past tooke vppon reprehende admonishe state men sermones testifie whome iohn baptist immitate reprehended common people also publicanes souldioures scribe priestes moste earnestly yea hee bolde tell herode king lawful kepe brother wife like christe beeing otherwise miledest man euer would deuide inheritaunce betweene brother bicause hee would doe nothing belonging office apostle successoures whose laboures trauailes church dothe reuerence yet day therefore blockishnesse grosse rebellion obstinate challenge selfe certaine immunitie freedome saying minister haue nothing doe matter bicause needefull reason vrge sette forward dull fleshe difficulte daungerous function paule therefore vseth reason beginning hee comprehendeth diuers fewe woordes saythe looke vnto flocke among whome holy ghoste hathe made ouerseers feede congregation god hath purchased bloude minister ordained godfirst hee alleageth god aucthor ministerie declare free owne libertie ought occupied vocation god vnto whome shall giue accompte christe teacheth parable talentes stewarde math luke hee maketh mention holy ghoste name bicause christe doth cheefely rule gouerne churche first seconde chapiter booke might perceiue waightie reason consider howe shall giue accoumpt vnto whome nothing hidden beholdeth minde beleefe wee doe thing onely iudge also swifte witnesse cast feare neglect duetie malach threatneth prophet reason ought awake stirre vp onely minister woorde also personnes take god aucthoure vocation estate let magistrate remember aduaunced honoure dignitie god sitteth middle shall escape neglect office psal let lordes maisters remember also haue maister heauen vnto whome shall geue accoumpte ephe let married folke remember god aucthor estate hathe appoynted marriage chamber bee honourable hee greeuously punishe adoulterers whoremonger hebrues also let parentes consider god hathe giuen charge ouer child heb therefore canne neglecte child wythoute manifest faulte vntrustinesse likewyse lette seruauntes subiectes learne obey maisters prince onely feare punishment also conscience sake bicause god hath made subiecte vnto whose sight shall neuer beguile though beguile men thys doone hee setteth ende theyr duetie sayingsecondly ende minister feede made ouerseers holy ghoste feede church god hee alludeth vnto ezechiel thirde thirtie three chapter prophetes called ouerseers watchman ende shoulde thinke duetie consisted bare vaine speculation hee vseth woorde feede intente shoulde remember feeder therefore oughte fulfill duetie feeder poynts partly expressed christ iohn partly ezechiel foure thirtie chapiter good shepeheard bringeth flocke well grown pasture goth like faithfull guide hee seeketh strayed lost hee bringeth home againe bindeth vp woundes contrite heart conscience strengtheneth weake keepeth vnder growe fatte hee stoutely resisteth wolues thing doth circumspectly iudgement paule admonisheth ephesian minister asia thing saythe appoynted feede woulde god bishoppes dayes would remember thing doe none thing thing quite contrary yet impudent sorte challenge selues onely title bishop also exercise manifest tyrannie ouer churche like prince world obtaine kingdome vpon earth contrary commaundement christe shall haue laboure see ezechiel zacharie chapiter third reason deduced dignitie churche appeareth god purchased hys bloudethirdly dignitie ye church hee attributeth bloud vnto god figure called communione propretie tongue bicause iesus christ god euerlasting time long beefore appointed became man redeemed churche price bloud therefore church deare vnto christ guiltie bloud christ neglecte church either abolishe profite thereof themselfe else suffer perishe decay marke howe churche belongeth one man vnto god hath redeemed purged hir bloud ephe espoused hir vnto selfe therefore man may challenge vnto selfe rule ouer spouse god euery one membre must looke consecrate selues god onely addicte selues worship creature punished execrable fornication1 peter also serueth consolation impossible god neglecte whome hee redeemed great price thinke like reason god creature euery man created image god redeemed purchased bloud sonne god shalt thou go vnpunished thou slaunder wrong violently hurt marke saith wolues shall come gone afraide faithfull minister present throughe diligence care kepte backe breaking among v bicause vnkinde world commonly little esteemeth diligence men god suffereth credite authoritie example generall rule taken therof alleageth saying chrystit blessed giue receiue bles ed giue receiue howbeit wordes sentence extant writing euangelistes yet many lyke whereof may easily gathered bycause chryst euery exhorteth v vnto charitie haue ready bestowe vpon others receiue moreouer appeareth sufficiently chrystes word deedes put writing great many suffised abundauntly instruction fayth saluation wee muste yet see reason saying sticke barke therefore seeme vnto v blessed giue receyue bicause giuing money goodes declare liberalitie minde praysed make men bound vnto v fleshly reason sauour vayne glory smell kitchin wherewith reade ethnikes enflamed liberall chryst commendeth requireth liberalitie chrystians farre cause firste blessed giue receiue bycause faythfull doo disposers steward goodes god hath committed vnto manyfest god hath giuen men goodes without cause hath made richer make roume place charitie riche men appoynted patron tutor poore helpe liberalitie howe muste iudged blessed faythfull office committed god agayne salomon sayth prouer giue vnto poore lende vnto lorde counteth whatsoeuer bestowed giuen faythfull liberall rewarder wherfore keepe promise allureth men vnto liberalitie place appeareth blessed man disperseth abroade giueth poore righteousnesse remayneth euer euer horne shall exalted honour psalm deale thy bread hungry bring poore wandring home thy house thou seest naked couer hyde thy face thine owne fleshe shall thy light breake foorth morning thy health flourishe right shortly thy righteousnesse shall goe thee glory lorde shall embrace thee thou callest lorde shall heare thee thou cryest shall say isa heere finally bicause nothing like vnto god dooing well maner wayes ore resemble nature similitude god helping many god blissed selfe certayn way bilsse like vnto god thing christian liberalitie chiefly performeth wherefore although recompence benefites world yet deede much blessed thing giue receiue thing consider oughtemonkishe order ouerthrowen shall appeare howe farre monk religion distant chrystes doctrine set blisse felicitie receyuing whyle renounce thing fall lawfully inheritaunce lawfull meanes professe wilfull pouertie liuing labour men ought rather minister men foode rayment vnder plausible pretence wilfull pouertie lyue carelesse delightes beeing subiect misfortune men paule cocludeth sermon prayersbut let v returne vnto paule endeth sermon made cleargy publike prayer streightwayes fell knee prayed knew god gaue increase otherwheres teacheth therefore vnmindfull prayer specially matter importaunce whervpon depended saluation al men hereof sprang auncient notable vsage church wherin sermon vsed begon ended prayer prayer neglect abundantly declare resorte vnto sermon curiositie either desire god glory owne saluation sort described ezechiel xxxiij chapter example commendeth prayer specially publike prayer behoueth v make feruent affection minde teacheth v obserue also godly modestie behauiour wherby testifie meaning minde among gesture moste auncient godly men vse pray knee else lying body prostrate ground therby setting themselues order humblenesse vse also commonly lift vp hand vnto heauen declare ardent desire minde also testifie fayth wherby firmly beleue shall receiue desire yet muste take heede cloke naughtie minde vayne kinde gesture lifte vp handes embrued bloud touching bothe vice reade esai chapiter thing luke addeth paules departure asia two thing fall chiefly markedthe godly sory paules departure first sayth fell weeping hand euen paule somdeale openly quipped regarded muche priuate reprehension publike commoditie whole churche therfore sory church depriued suche instrument declare sorrow weeping embracing kissing delectable example mutuall charitie wherein minister congregation shoulde stryue eche ouercome others paule loued wonderfully whole trade life declared therefore agayne loued reuerenced apostle father mutuall affection reigneth thing prosper well whych hate minister moste parte moste vnhappy may euidently bee seene israelite hated moyses aaron stoikes also place indolencie stoikes condemned thinke vnlawfull man shew token affection though affection euill themselfe set v nature excesse committed default god requireth v moderation minde haue men become stockes stone last al bring paule shippe honour hono r le minister church magistrate also remember thing tha may learne like industrie preserue maintaine autority let v one another lay helpes maintenaunce church shall hereafter partaker another toke ship retourned home againe ful ended course tyre went downe ptolemais saluted brother abode one day holy ghost rehearseth diligently paynefull dangerous voyage apostle might learne committed power deputie lieuetenaunt romanes al thing shal consider time place place specially hath many thing make muche explication sayd euen wherefore content muste diligently discussed whiche first sight seeme barren first declared paul vnwillingly departed fro athens company paule taken pulled fro asia launched foorth sayth plucked sort said christ pulled disciple mount oliuet luc worde declared great griefe minde risen departure verily cause griefe neither fewe yet tryfling paules three yeres conuersation amongst engendred mutuall loue betweene diuers argument loue apparaunt freshe teares common griefe taken partes called agayne remembraunce moreouer paule knew come amongest loued intierly lefte daunger wolues trayned brought great paynes trauell thing bene able moue euen heart yron thus wee see parentes mourne child death pulled reason minoritie yet able helpe selues yet paule ouercommeth griefe minde bicause would obey calling god drue ierusalem example wee taught god calling muste preferred affection impossible v wholly voyde affection long liue fleshe euident beare stroke euen godly moderation muste vsed bring vnder obedience fayth must obserued case specially death friendes pulle ey v whose good counsell help found profitable v lette v remember vrged god calling whome gaynesay striue againste verie rashe enterprise foolish daungerous paules nauigation long perilloussecondly luke describeth paules long tedious voyage al men must confesse haue bene painefull perillous wee tarie long description place sought geographer bicause many place recited paule sayled without making abode token hee made great haste ierusalem feast pentecost considered paules feruente industrie diligence office committed charge constant fayth hee might haue liued worlde testifieth writing philippian quietly honor first state life abundantly declareth smal authoritie among iewes saw moreouer folowing christ continuall paine trauell euerye day freshe daungers springing yet embraced kinde life according god calling constant course ouercame whatsoeuer thing worlde either gayne glory vnto counted damageable set light would winne christ phil wherin appeareth litle encouraged hope heauenly crowne knew laid vp al godly let v folowe example notable apostle least either ouercome trauails dangers2 tim else enticed allurement world leaue course vocation prescribed christ world stable permanent thing able satisfie desire minde flesh god omnisufficient perfect good hath opened v christ sonne treasure goodnesse whome onely mennes mindes quieted rest drinketh fountaine shall thirst euer happy therfore blessed exchaunge counterfayte felicitie worlde fountayne eternall blisse thirdly telleth howe came lengthe vnto tyrus paule commeth tyre church tyre wee haue diuerse thing order bee considered among one chiefe sayth founde disciple tyrus say certaine christian brother might seeme haue passed mention hath bene made hitherto dueties fayth charitie may seeme maruellous thing man consider auncient state citie tyrus horrible oracle prophet agaynst reporting hir riotous proud couetous lecherous yea chryst lord detesting vnthankfulnesse city galilee compareth tyre sidon math vpon god time past shewed seuere example iustice yet euen citie shone light gospell heere would chryste haue churche planted endued notable gyftes herein appeareth truth god goodnesse towardes sinner turne vnto long agone prophesied esay come passe ende seauenty yeres shall lorde visite tyre esa shall conuert vnto hir reward shal traffique kingdomes earth hir traffique ware shall holy vnto lord psalme daughter tyre shalbe gyft like riche also among people shall make supplication fore thee thing say present place declareth haue ben fulfilled paule found christian feruent fayth loue notable example god goodnesse wherby taught ouer hastely dispaire either selues men seeing god would build church citie vpon time shewed heauy example iustice reason sinnes offence againe luke writeth paule admonished goe ierusalem brother tyrus admonished paule spirite shoulde goe vp ierusalem seemeth repugne agaynst whych paule spake congregation malta saying bounde spirite go thither place easily reconciled man consider figure called synecdoche common holy scripture whole comunication disciple atributed holy ghost dede ye author one part onely inspiration spirite admonished paule imprisonment affliction paule like fynd ierusalem counsell gaue shoulde go vp thyther owne deuise bycause louing affection wished well vnto ignoraunt god determination many time commeth passe prophetes reuelation god vnderstande come yet vtterly ignoraunt god meaning ende dooing cause many tymes erre dooings whyles contented reuelation god take wisedome fleshe vnto councell whereof haue example ionas diuers others mean season marke howe many wayes god woulde haue paule bee tempted draweth ierusalem beeing bounde spirite euery citie congregation telleth howe shall layde heeles imprisoned nowe come others endued spirite prophesie warne hym goe thyther whereto serue thing uerily god mente heereby prepare apostle crosse continuall premeditation least shoulde fall thorough manyfolde clamour furious people entrappings enimies also learneth v heereby example christian constancie obedience whiche wee muste earnestly laboure haue wee muste obey men though wee see rare example god holy spirite councell v thing contrary commaundement god adde therevnto vnhappie ende prophet1 reg beeing seduced prophet vnder pretence god oracle eate meate bethell contrary commaundement god deuoured lyon learne also heereby iudge apparicion spirites authoritie whereof monkes commonly vse proue fiction purgatorie superstition know proue scripture furthermore perceyuing paule folowed rather calling god councellthey tyre accompany paule shippe worshipfully helde voyage also yeelded vnto god accompanyed worshipfully wyues child citie wherin may perceiue rare example christian charitie truth chrystes promise seene tenth marke word verily say vnto euer forsaketh house brother sistren father mother wyfe childre mark land sake gospel shal receyue hundred fold nowe time persecution worlde come life euerlasting wee knowe paule forsooke thinges chrystes sake therefore fyndeth euery brother sister whiche willingly serue bothe body goodes yea hath wyues child ready declare good willes towards moreouer place teacheth v christian ought assigne appoint haue worshipping god also carefull themselues curteous kind towards seruantes chryst also trayne vp family performaunce lyke dueties1 timo paule place requireth widowe chosen church affair becometh widow may right required others doo detestable slouth day wherein diuers householder bring vp family teache rather howe molest straungers contemne hate duetifully fauoure make them2 reg let suche remember hapned child vpbraided helizeus baldenesse whome scripture sayth woorried beares last brother tyre kneele downe vpon shore praythe tyrians pray open sight againe see howe prayer commended vnto v whereof mooste neede publike waightie affaire hande bicause wee haue otherwheres intreated heereof lette v onely heere marke howe kneele openly vpon sea shore could bee sight men perhappes derided suche kinde religion truely graffed christ ashamed neither faith religion mark knowe glory remaineth confesse christ adulterous naughtie world would god wee woulde well remember shake execrable cowardlynesse feare vse dayes euery thing playing bopeepe like dissembler purchase v fauour men fourthly finally paule company arriueth ptolemais moste happy course gospell agayne made one dayes abode brother therefore appeareth churche erected place also surely worthy diligently considered howe doctrine gospell space fewe yeres spredde farre wyde established many congregation man consider order story seemeth thing happened xxiij yere paules conuersion therefore space xxiij yeres voyce gospell hearde throughout asia europa euery lefte behinde plentyfull fruite increase wee reade tymes past prophet tolde foreshewed bee thing declare howe happily suche thing proceede taken hande god appoyntmente howsoeuer worlde wrastleth agaynst god purpose councell fooles therefore feare threates enterprise worlde let v meditate thinke thing dayes beeing armed constant fayth let v labour set foorth kingdome iesus chryste prayse honor power glory euer amen cxxxviij homelie nexte day wee paules company departed came vnto coesarea wee entered house philippe euangeliste whiche one seauen abode hym man hadde foure daughter virgin whiche dyd prophesie wee tarryed good many dayes came certayne prophete iury named agabus hee come vnto v hee tooke paules gyrdle bounde hys feete hys handes sayde thus saythe holy ghoste shall iewes hierusalem bynde manne oweth gyrdle shall deliuer hand gentile hearde place besought woulde goe vp hierusalem paule aunswered sayd weeping vexing mine heart ready bounde onely also die hierusalem name lorde iesu could turne minde ceassed saying lorde fulfilled afte dayes toke vp burthen went vppe hierusalem went v also certaine disciple coesarea broughte one mnason cyprus olde dysciple whome shoulde lodge come hierusalem brother receyued v gladly pleased god luke shoulde diligently describe howe woulde haue gospell sonne iesus chryste commended set oute paules emprisonment captiuitie muche paule hasted hyed heereby ment lay men president stedfaste fayth obedience follow haue hitherto heard howe paule hasted ierusalem one whyle sea whyle lande manyfolde desired teares hee would goe vp ierusalem may bee gathered paules woordes surely could want reason persuade heereunto bothe seemed tempte god also hazarde onely selfe also neglect welfare churche whome meane bereeued seruice ministerie zeale commendable deede according knowledge suche christ sharpely reprehended peter also dissuaded bearing crosse yet affection praised math carefull paules horrible tempest dayes god bicause holy wholesome able effectually recreate cheare mindes tossed trouble care consideration therof let v therfore example men haue regarde onely vnto couragiously
