sauiour whome praise honor power glory euer amen cxxxix homelie morrow paule went v vnto iames elder came togither saluted told order thing god wrought among gentile ministration heard glorified lord said vnto thou seest brother many thousand iewes beleue earnest follower ouer law enfourmed thee thou teachest iewes among gentile forsake moses sayest ought circumcise child neyther liue customes therfore multitude must needes come togither shall hear thou art come therfore say thee haue four men haue vow take purifie thy selfe cost may shaue head shall knowe thing haue heard concerning thee nothing thou thy selfe also walkest keepest law touching gentile beleue haue written concluded obserue thing saue keepe selues thing offred idolles bloud strangled fornication although many false rumor spred paule apostle chosen vessell iesus christ whereby bothe good name doctrine greeuously stained impeached aduersaries yet luke wryteth brother ierusalem frendly courteously receyue thereby teaching v regarde charitie fewe persones boyling hatred setteth v example euery man followe charitie amongst men shall soone disturbed followeth present historie paule brother ierusalem place many skilles may serue instruction worthy diligent attention consideration first formoste paule companion gette vnto iames time resident citie paule goeth ye elder ierusale hearing elder declared thing priuate aucthoritie attempteth nothing mannes churche set thing first goeth superintendets minister church reuerently saluteth proceedeth narration doings one example suffisant conuince pride romane elsewhere declared must obserued manner vocation psalm except lord build house laboure ost build excepte god prosper fauoure common weales care counsel magistrate vaine excepte spirite worke study furthermore elder saide hadde hearde paules trauailes glorified lord rare example loue enuie praise fellow minister murmur churlishly commonly doe voide charitie desirous owne glory god paule made god author thing commendably done also tickle paule counterfet prayses reioysing doings giue glory vnto god teache v example iudge laboures vertues saintes must know men subiect humane affection casualty therefore haue done thing passing mannes power habilitie mu know working god meere fauor vouchsafe vse ministerie let v therfore reioyce felicitie follow yeelding selues goddes instrumentes let v ascribe whole praise doings vnto god thus imitating shall truely honoure yet god shal haue glory remain whole sound men wickedly violate cleaue vnto sainctes make aucthors giuers goodnesse wise aske helpe succor distresse looke third fourtienth chapiter nowe foloweth notable acte wherof elder ierusalem cheefe counsellersthe elder go free paule hatred counsell take vpon vowe nazarean time vowe expired according lawe let selfe purified dismissed vowe temple thing gaue occasion wicked enemy take apprehend cast prison bicause thing sort tollerable meanes borne therefore diligently examined wherefore better vnderstanding eche thing large open controuersie paule taught men iustified meere fauor god rom galath faith iesus christ doctrine apostle see allowed approued one consent xv chapter paule preaching among gentile muche adoe went iumble law gospell togither would haue gentile brought obseruation circumcision like ceremony therfore necessary diligently intreat ende vse law enforced liuely wise open thing quicke wherfore plainly taught law ceremony therof helped nothing vnto iustification bicause man able satisfie law giuen bewray corruption bring v conuicte sinne vnto christ whome onely fulfilling lawe found said opinion attributed merite iustification lawe christe auaileable could condemned bicause wittingly procured selues cursse law heereof sprang kindes locution law worketh wrathe law endured rom cor galath sinne reuiued strength sinne law many deedes lawe subiecte curse c thing seemed vnpleasant broughte vp lawe childehode knewe god appointed moses paules ennemies tooke occasion heereof slaunder saying hee prophane contempner lawe though simplie without respect disallowed improued lawe inuented new ende vse lawe would haue men saued iustified obseruation thereof therefore men enuied paule euen dayes called ennemies good woorkes say auaileable iustifie saue yet leaue still place teache dueties men must needes pay perfourme vnto god nowe thing premised shal easely appeare elder meant talke marke shotte wherefore wee nowe viewe examine partes theyr saying elder oration talkefirst plainely declare paules good name fame euell spoken amongst al men say reported thou teachest al men forsake moses c muche commended dissemble nothing good deale plainly freendes brother haue offended may amended may iudged faultlesse wrongfully accused great fault still accuse men absent flatter present also faultie suffer backbite brother warne whome beware commeth passe slaunder breaketh frendship euery great many know cheefely beware also counsell make purgation openly bringing diuers waightie reason counsell first alleage multitude beleuers conceiued euill opinion say thou seest brother many thousand iewes beleeue feruent folowers lawe expressely call beleeuers least man thinke would holde obstinate stubberne person say many thousandes declaring saluation many thing lightly regarded surely likely paule cheefely moued reason carefull countryman wished accursed sake alleage also zeale lawe ende might appeare yet somewhat borne seeing violent remedy could little preuaile feruencie zeale furthermore reason necessitie saying must needes multitude come togither men knowe thou art come matter dissembled therefore needefull thou purge thy selfe heereof wheras word thou shalt little nothing preuaile rooted superstition needefull thou declare fact thou hast hitherto bene vniustly reprehended persuasion bene smal importance cause ben suche might rather haue serued confirme superstitious error win obseruers lawe shall declare followeth counsell wherby thinke paule may maintaine keepe good name fame haue foure menne say haue vowe say nazareans counsell elder discussed whereof entreated eightene chapter sixt chapter boke numbres ioyne thy selfe vnto men cause thy selfe openly shauen purified according lawe thing easie done thereby shall appeare vnto men thou hast hetherto bene wrongfully suspected thou oughtest taken despiser lawe seeing thou obseruest ceremony commaunded counsell elder congregation ierusalem outwardly might seeme tollerable paule cenchreae expendeth thing wel shall perceiue great difference betweene apostle ought haue yeelded deuise seeing earnestly maintained defended profession faith christian libertie thing smaller importance first bounde selfe vow nazarite among corinthian cor bicause knew winne thereby weakling selfe testifieth heereby faithe suffered detriment damage bicause onely shauing head deliuered vowe heere required sacrifice nowe place left church vaile temple long rent death christ sacrifice vtterly abrogated againe thing conchreae onely weakes sake could drawne example confirmation ceremony lawe end fact paule testifie liked whole lawe ceremony thereof heereof thing could spring iewes confirmed error hitherto profited christ renounced law called backe againe obseruation thereof furthermore beene done first beginning church might haue seemed iustly haue bene done weakes sake seeing gospel ben preached euery two twentie yeeres togither surely great indulgencie bearing whereby confirme obstinate people superstition yea god declared iudgement displeased heerewith say nothing vnhappily counsell fell paule god within fewe yeeres vtterly ouerthrow citie temple forge superstition bicause would make ende leuiticall ceremony therfore elder beeing deceiued ouermuche loue bare nation counselled paule heereunto paule ouer easely yeelded vnto ought rather haue vsed libertie shewed titus cause peter galath ij therfore greatly deceyued example goe defend thinke thing must done winne mennes fau ure know thing ought haue place suche matter derogatorie confession libertie christ thing come hazard must swarue one nailes breadth way truthe wherfore erroure moste singular holy men must taken example must rather cause v warier led awry like erroure furthermore last parte preuent might obiected touching gentile paules example seemed preiudice maintaine opinion went bring circumcision ceremony among gentile therefore denie saying touching gentile beleeue wee haue wrytten heeretofore exempting obseruing lawes ceremoniall abstaine thing plaine prophane vsing libertie forgette charitie pollute selfe fellowshippe idolles whoredome offende man vnseasonable eating strangled bloude thing bothe easie profitable abstain read fiftenth act touching poyntes heere throughout appeareth obstinacie iewes howe small prerogatiue dignitie world hath matter religion seeing founde greater infirmitie weakenesse faithe apostle time churche ierusalem might iustly glory notablenesse citie chrystes sermon first fruites springth gospell also taught howe greatly supersticious teacher ceremony hinder gospell nourishe weake fayth long retayning bearing pull backe feruenter sorte minister let v therfore cast away suche weake shore proppes doubtfull wauering flesh holde faste verity fayth beeing mindefull christian libertie let v constan ly magnifie author thereof onely begotten sonne god iesus chryste lorde sauiour whome prayse honour power glory euer amen cxl homelie nexte day paule tooke men purified selfe entred temple declaring obserued dayes purification vntyll offering shoulde offered euery one seauen dayes nowe almost ended iewes asia sawe temple moued people layde handes cry men israell helpe man teacheth men euery agaynst people lawe thys place hath also brought greekes temple hath polluted holy place seene one citie prophimus ephesian supposed paule brought temple citie moued people swarmed togither tooke paule drue temple foorthwith doores shutte kyl tydings came vnto high captayne souldiours al hierusalem moued immediately toke souldiours vndercaptaynes ran downe vnto sawe vndercaptayne souldiours left smyting paule bicause paule apostle euill spoken among ierusalem doctrine law though simply absolutely condemned preceptes ceremony thereof thing selfe euill noughte elder congregation councelled howe cleare selfe suche suspition verily thing worthy prayse carefull man good name yet disliked giue councell repugneth plaine profession faith christian libertie teacheth v ceremony law leuitical worshipping chryst abrogated therefore hencefoorth vse religion accounted christes coming among thing apertaine honor god seing god time past would worshipped ordeined figure thing come ye redeption promised holy ghost setteth example neither v folow neither diminishe aucthoritie either paule elder cheefely iames learne suspect wisedome fleshe matter saluation religion swarue one nailes bredthe word god shall whole successe matter fully declare forthwith shall cheefely consider paule obeyeth counsell elder hauing small occasion haue expostulated paule taketh vow nazarite long borne manifest erroures superstition yet modestly frendly yeldeth vnto well would seeme waiwarde obstinate also thought heereby haue occasion fredome teach iewes wherefore goeth temple foure men vow declareth openly time would purified procureth haue sacrifice offred euery one seeth heere manyfest errour doth time doone would beare neuer little dissimulation peter consideration gentile might maruellously offended dooing thinketh false brother ierusalem woulde priuily espie libertie christian therefore example teacheth v howe greatly men erre religion take wisedome fleshe ouer hastily councell paule beeing deceyued heereby recedeth former simplicitie layeth stumbling blocke way gentile beleeued yet preuayleth neuer amongest iewes moued authoritie god worde man shall vayne go moue lenitie councell flesh therfore safest way v acknowledge matter religion appertayne vnto god alone haue authoritie ouer thus shall come passe shall take nothing vppon v therein shall follow worde god onely hath appoynted rule vnto v fayth religion also whole life looke numer deut chapter succes man councell vnhappybut let v length see ende facte councell seemeth beginning businesse would well succeede bycause seauen dayes togither appeared daunger lo paule thought ende hande selfe safetie trouble rise euery side suche perill lyfe neuer like importunacie naughtinesse fewe person whole citie vprore paule beeing apprehended certayne sedicious person vndoubtedly perished captayne bene moued singular councell god come rescue hand suche raging sorte let v peruse euery thing order may receiue instruction thereby iewes author disturbancefirst declared iewes came asia author tragedie see many tymes burned hatred agaynst paule following pursuing euery citie neuer suffered persecution raysed men person may seene incurable blindnesse nation paule himselfe bewayleth first epistle thessalonian seconde chapiter length greeuously punished iuste iudgement god meane season marke howe paynefull bolde hatred truthe maketh men bee fellowes follow paule place stirre vp sedition straunge citie well knew could done without euident daunger would god day lyke example euery moreouer hauing opportunitie thervntosedition raysed moue set al people running quenching great fyre newly begunne lay hand paule cry yee men israell helpe c needed helpe succour agaynst went neyther secret sedition playne force agaynst man see therefore commonly author sedition fault tymes layde minister charge wee see euery wee waygh matter well wee shall see none begynners hereof hate minister enimies whereas away light truthe none meanes extinguishe put away publike tuine catiline sayde referre heerevnto sayde chapter bicause woulde seeme make suche doo without cause intermeddle sedicious clamoursthe article point wherof paul accused certayne accusation firste accuse doctrine thing preiudiciall people god lawe temple seeme gather hereof bycause paule bridle vayne affiaunce father countrey men declared true israelite borne fleshe spirite accompted people god borne abraham flesh except beleeued christ example abraham also bicause reasoning true vse lawe taught iustification attributed therunto sawe sermone going sayd leuiticall lawes abolished comming christ merite death least accusation might seeme consist bare woordes onely complaine also fact paule newly committed namely brought gentile temple meane thereof polluted holy place moste false slaunderous reproche yet founde credite wyth men bycause seene one trophimus ephesian citie among paules companion thus suspecte broughte churche agayne place teacheth v thinges commonly layde minister charge euen wickedly sinne elect people god impudently codemne lawes tradition church subuerters churche auncient religion thus reade chryste accused euen enimies truthe lay vnto stephen charge doo certayne person dayes obiecte agaynst v also moued whit neither respect god churche aucthoritie god lawe yet wyth care desire true religion yet suche happe truthe none impudently effectuously slaundered hir minister enuied worlde condemned aforehande men iudgementes moste men easily admitte receiue thing agaynst man ashamed lightnesse dooing let v paciently know onely prophet apostle suffred euen sonne god also paule hazarde lifemoreouer contented haue apprehended man lode false accusation vse plaine force draw temple lay vppon beate without ceasing yea goe shamefull wise kill yet first shutting churche gate bicause would haue temple meanes polluted example teacheth v howe farre impietie hatred god woord proceedeth although lieth long hidden yet occasion serueth burste forthe thirsteth nothing bloud minister onely thing assuageth satisfieth example heereof aboundant euery neede long declaration first formost marke pray singular sanctimonie men seeme fight god religion haue great care pollute churche bloud therefore shut doores meane whyle feare embrue hand selues innocent bloud suche lyke thing chryst vpbraydeth gospel sayth strayne gnat swalowe downe camell priestes would goe iudgement hall bycause would prophane feast day could deliuer innocent vnto pylate maner vnrighteousnesse importunacy require bloud hypocrisie dissimulation pleased god appeareth hereby many yeres caused romanes destroy bloudy hypocrite temple vngracious citie god sendeth one deliuer paule howbeit god ayleth apostle beeing daunger thought vtterly caste sent deliuerer reuenger neuer hoped looked captayne moued clamour common rumor sedition straight way hande garrison souldiers taketh paule handes harebrayned common heere played parte good magistrate thing men haue sclender consideration suffer harmlesse person oppressed violence desperate people haste thou consider truth fatherly care god alwayes preserueth althoughe somewhiles seemeth little regarde great matter deliuer forasmuche able bring passe euen straungers fayth religion thys place paule defended romane souldiers appeareth ieremie tyme paste preserued nabuzardes iere publike enimie god people many like example might brought ende dispaire time crosse tribulation flye vnlawfull meanes remedie put care trust god wayte helpe succour paule thys tyme fyndeth moste effectuall ready sedicious whome neither feare god shame man could stay holde backe assoone espied captayne souldiers helde handes ceased smiting paule propertie wicked stayed feare men god therefore magistrate officer necessarie brydle keepe vnder suche vnruly fellowes let v therefore lyue within feare god directe al dooings holy able onely delyuer v hand wicked also iawes hell death hys sonne iesus chryst lorde blessing honour power glory nowe euer amen cxlj homelie captayne came neere tooke commaunded bounde two chaynes demaunded doone cryed one thing another among people coulde knowe certayntie rage commaunded carried castle came vnto stayre fortuned borne souldiours violence people multitude people followed cry away paule beganne carryed castle sayde vnto high captayne may speake vnto thee sayde canst thou speake greeke arte thou aegyptian dayes madest vproare leddest wildernesse foure thousande men murtherers paule sayde man iewe tharsus citie cicill citizen vile citie beseeche thee suffer mee speake vnto people giuen lycence paule stoode steppe beckened hande vnto people made great sylence spake vnto hebrue tongue saying dauid man god owne mynde sayth many tribulation iuste lorde deliuereth appeareth hystorie moste truely sayde haue howe paule taken furious multitude iewes howe buffeted beaten howe lyke killed among burning cankred hatred agaynst thyrsted nothing muche bloud lo sodayne god rayseth vp hym defender deliuereth apostle stranger fayth religion god haue laste sermon entreated vse ende heereof wee nowe examine hystorie hys delyuerie luke moste exactly describeth circumstance thereof first declareth captaine souldiers paule bound chaynes first taketh paule raging hand commaundeth bynde hym two chaynes doth head ouercome hastinesse anger bicause al dooing declareth manyfest token moderate meaning doth partely thought euill man seeing euery body earnestly set agaynst partly perceiued could pacify furious people way commodiously making beleeue shortly punished according desert meane season beeing mindfull duetie diligently enquireth done duetie magistrate nothing rashly vpon heade haue iniuried ought haue defended excuse lefte therfore moyses commaundeth iudges heare small great yea searche circumstance matter offende either ignoraunce blinde affection fleshe meane whyle haue heere diligently consider maner deliuerie paule deliuered present perill lyfe iewes put yet bounde two chayns though greeuous malefactor howbeit god ben able haue set cleane libertie thing bycause doth certayne chaynes paules commoditie captiuitie serued set oute chrystes kingdome alwayes god continuall custome vsing sorte moderate benefites specially perceiueth wee haue neede bee kepte vnder brydeled finde true many time sicknesse tribulation wherein becommeth v paciently suffer whatsoeuer god sendeth forasmuche bothe good wee exempte secluded care protection diuine prouidence aduersitie people meane season first fill eares men vncertayne confused noysea descriptio sedition nothing coulde bee certaynely knowen perceyued thing commonly vsed sedition hath bene sayde xix chapter next captayne commaunded bounde bee brought castle meaning heare matter follow impudently preace vpon suche violence souldiours fayne carry armes neckes feare rebel might doo harme length agree woulde haue put death made way thing luke setteth v liuely image sedition teacheth v none greeuous enimies truthe godly suche colour enterprise zeale godlynessehypocrites cruell souldiours man may see equitie humanitie barbarous souldiers iewes would seme fight temple religion would haue killed without hearing cause whome captayne made diligent inquirie trouble disturbe thing shouting cry captayne dothe thing peaceably quiet men impudently treade souldiours vouchsafe carry shoulder needeth many word would neither haue truth enquired cause tryed would haue foorthwith made way feede wicked eye sight innocentes bloud reade lyke fell chrystes passion equitie pylate herode priestes scribe priestes scorned hanging crosse barbarous souldiours testified bee innocent bycause wonder sawe wante example dayes considering appeareth many bycause confession truthe iustly gently entreated turkes byshoppes monkes seeme bee enflamed zeale godlynesse liuely portraiture diuell cruelly raging vnder cloke godlynesse wee taught example bee excused wrong faythfull chryst vnder pretence suche zeale chryste prophesied long agoe come passe euident paule burned zeale iewes law persecuted church cause confesseth selfe chiefest gretest sinner timo god haue v ledde owne zeale requireth v knowledge haue learned vnderstande worde prescribeth commaundeth looke xv chapter number let v returne vnto paule see dothe beeing compased wyth many daungers luke reporteth one thing wherby may iudge bothe inuincible steadynesse fayth hys coragious minde furie rage people confused clamour shouting meditateth excuse paule meditateth rxcuse selfe partly desirous hys countreymens vtilitie woulde fayne haue broughte vnto good partely woulde free chrystes quarell suspition beeing appoynted minister thereof thys example paule followed minister priuate daungers diligently seeke bothe saluation others glory chryste good consider diligently partes thys businesse first rusheth rash sort speake sedicious crymes god suffreth seruaunts suspected charged psa yet vseth deliuer wherfore cause dismay v rather follow paule beeing nothing offeded vnseemely demaund declareth modestly frendly reason modestie appeare howe muche wycked cruell bee hee assoone paule gotten leaue captayne speake strayghte way hee beckened wyth hys hande people obtayneth silence also maketh diligent oration hande small token manyfeste argument hee amased shouting buffeting hath wittes vtteraunce declare hys cause boldely artificially moste cruell enimies thus saying chryst fulfilled euen houre shall giuen vnto speake math founde good would conuerted doctrine word therfore reproued example paule condemne lawfull receiued stile honoure apostle otherwheres commaundeth v vse biddeth v goe one honor although allow god peuish flattery excede al measure goe much honor others profite theselues meane season taught dutie fewes sake haue v iniury shuld codemne whole nation greuous iniuries ca deuised tha iewes vnto paule gaine contented persuaded thing else receiue without persuasion filthie dishonest kinde people paule sheweth himselfe farre diuers saying persecuted way vnto death binding putting prison men woman co tented haue put gaile citie professed christ went letter elder farre damascus trouble also beleeued calleth bishop elder witnesse least man doubt heereby declareth feruent zeale could altered sodenly counsell carried euery winde although sometime take hold true religion yet fall assone perceiue agreeth desire let v therfore cast away blinde desire world flesh harken voice god must follow embrace chaines iewes maketh diligent reporte thing done intent vainglorie ambition meant vaunt vertues put away wrongfull suspitions make men knowe toke religion chryst rashely owne heade god calling easily perceyue feruent earnest defender law enimie christian religion could sodenly altered god power working thing proueth nowe euidently declareth storie conuersion circustances order storie alonethe first thing heere obserued paule excuseth leauing iewes religion christes one argument god aucthor counseller therto whereuppon gather ought reprehended god calling forsake old superstition embrace true religion forasmuch euident god commaundeth nothing iust wholesome owe obedience without delay onlesse thus thinke wee excuse neither paule apostle lightnesse inconstancie folowing sonne haue altered religion according appointment commaundement christ although christ vsed mene way v paule yet haue heard voice sounding word haue folowed crieth come vnto th trauell heauy laden math refreshe man thirst let come vnto drinke light world foloweth walketh darkenesse iohn iohn iohn dore nter shall safe goe finde pasture entreth dore climeth vp way theefe murtherer againe way light truthe man commeth father iohn heereunto belong saying apostle inspired spirite christe affirme one accorde onely saluation founde wise man therefore wil blame v following liuely voice christ haue left romishe sea hathe shewed vnto v infinite wayes saluation beside yea hir tradition hath brought v dout saluation much reprehended wickedly despise christ calling v aloude vnto armes spred abrode knowledge hatred discipline leuitie inconstantnesse beginneth historie vocation suche sorte may appeare onely called god also constrained addeth hereunto ordained vnto office apostle ministery ananias description ananias lest man might thinke giuen credit slender light person estimation bicause iewes would haue admitted testimonie forsaken religion first formoste commendeth diligent obseruer follower lawe saithe godly man according lawe unto commendation ioyneth publike testimonie al iewes dwelling time damascus beesides hee declareth howe sight restored againe cheefe vse wherof seemeth
