scoffery tauntes quippe ecclesiastical minister magistrate secrete wheras selues meane season neither learned honest agayne let v marke true commendation minister isthe true commendation minister beare publike office first thing godlynesse ordered directed lawe god according god appoyntment ynough onely godly wee must frame according god worde otherwise shall zeale without knowledge suche iewes paule sometime deceiued agayne must haue good testimonie amongst dwell also others abroade gospell bee euill spoken sake see paule touching poynt first timothe third chapter unto must ioyned lawful vocation calling thing feele selues shall neither boldly profitably discharge duetie euident prophet apostle haue giuen credite suche following worde god thing haue swarued one nayles breadth integritie life day turkes papistes reuerence name concerning calling man doubte seeing many testimony thereof extant scripture therfore accused vanitie haue beleeued let v rather constantly stande fayth haue taughte v onely sufficient saue v furthermore paule described person ananias reherseth also word said ananias oration talke bicause euery thing therin made much matter hande bothe teacheth god onely author busynesse declareth ende wherfore called last al exhorteth baptised touching first poynt paule called god sayth god father hath ordeyned thee hereby verily paule certaine vocation afterwarde bolde say gala ordeyned euen hys mother wombe preache gospell calleth expressely god father declare swarued righte worshipping god howebeit thing excuse paules turning iewes religion proue doctrine true shewe called deserte onely meere grace god paule beeing cruell enimie chryst imbrued bloud steuen first martyr wherefore called selfe truely sayth greatest sinner others confesseth benefite god meere bountie goodnesse made minister apostle chryste1 timo wee speake paule bee verified minister wee lyke sorte god preuented v hys goodnesse able thinke one good thought hereof haue elsewhere entreated large ende paule callednowe let v heare ende god prepared paule firste know wyll hee beginneth thys bycause minister muste heerewith beginne vnderstande god selues neuer able teache others although paule brought vp childe lawe god yet hitherto ignoraunt god wrapped folded vp lawe hee thoughte men iustified saued lawe beeing vtterly ignoraunte god iohn euery one seeth sonne beleeueth sente shoulde perishe sinnes beeing iustified merite sonne haue lyfe euerlasting therefore necessarie wyll bee reuealed vnto intent wander vp downe shadowes lawe beeing vncertayne saluation furthermore wholsome god onely contayned learned chryste ananias addeth howe shoulde knowe hym saying paule ordeyned ende see iuste calleth chryste selfe iuste faultlesse also maketh iust beleeue muche prophete sayde long agone shoulde name iere lord righteousnesse worke god paule knew chryst euident none commeth knowledge except god vouchsafe reueale vnto euen chrystes testimonie math none seeth sonne father father doth vou hsafe reueale wherby agayne appeareth saluation proceedeth god free mercy thirdly sayth ordeined heare voyce mouth taught god otherwise ordinary meanes gala thing otherwheres paule cheefly vrgeth agaynst went eleuate diminishe authoritie ministerie verily maruellous benefite god shall appeare deede wee consider paule enimie god yet god doth voutsafe friendly familiarly talk let v also acknowledge goodnesse god doth voutsafe euery day speake vnto mighte right repute enimies iustly persecute meane season heere minister admonished duetie namely fetche doctrine mouth god say scripture thinke lawefull pleasure charge churche newe decree ordinaunces see haue sayd elsewhere touching poynte last declareth office whervnto called god saying god knowledge chryst hys worde therefore declared vnto bycause witnesse chryst heard seene vnto men thus appeareth matched apostle bicause none thing inioyned beare witnesse chrystes lyfe death doctrine miracle laste resurrection ascention name witnesse comprehendeth whole duetie apostle minister declared first chapter may looke obseruations breuities sake omitted maketh mention expresly al men answere thought vnmeete thing preach gospel christ vncircumcised people also may taken generall doctrine admonisheth al duty god hath illuminated knowledge sonne spreade knowledge abroade euery beare witnesse place god mercy grace thing partely rule thankfulnesse requireth set foorth glory god haue felte hys healthfull hande mercy partely brotherly charitie whereby wee shoulde carefull others saluation owne reason also expresse commaundement god appeareth paule moued suche wise could intermitte hys duetie though iewes disdayned neuer muche remayneth laste parte ananias oration exhorteth baptised openly professe name christ paule baptised grafted church according christes comandement vrgeth great grauitie weight lingerest thou saith paule ment defer shift matter pricke hym forwarde earnestly dismayed feare trembling conscience wherfore addeth saying arise bee baptised washe away thy sinnes calling name lorde haue obserue maner speaking sacrament declareth reason dignitie baptisme ananias meaning thought sinnes washed away water scripture euery teacheth clensed purged onely bloud chryste bycause washing made bloud chryst outwardly shadowed expressed baptisme commeth passe reason suche phrase scripture synnes sayde bee washed away baptisme bycause paule shoulde thinke straunge harde kynde saying addeth thereto calling name lorde word sent vnto chryst taken hold called vpon faith bestoweth gift saluation vpon v sacrament vse figure shadow vnto v must vsing sacrament haue respecte vnto chryste wee haue profite v agayne wee taught muste condemned thought superfluous meanes god hath ordeined nothing without gret cosideration whose intent haue church ouercharged clogged mean therfore philip baptised ye eunuch also confessed fayth peter thought good baptise cornelius houshold whe receiued holy ghost yea paul holy ghost secretly comendeth earnestly moued receiue baptisme example reproue despisers sacramets seeme spiritual wickedly set light ordinance god bu chiefly wee haue marke paule followe hys example religion deale rashly vnconstantly beeing rightly instructed truth labour diligently keepe holde fast labour peril shall come inheritaunce eternal life god father mercy hath appoynted v euerlasting sonne sus chryste whome prayse honour power glory euer amen cxlv homelie fortuned come agayne hierusalem prayed temple traunce sawe saying vnto mee make haste get thee quickely hierusalem receyue thy witnesse thou bearest mee sayde lorde know prisoned bet euery synagoge beleeued thee bloud thy witnesse steuen shedde also stoode consented vnto death kept rayment slue sayde vnto departe sende thee farre hence vnto gentile gaue audience vnto worde lifte vp voyces sayde away suche fellowe earth reason lyue paule apostle hath nowe oftentimes bene declared goeth diligent long discourse dooings put away wrongful suspitions reproches wherewith hys enimies burthened two thinges chiefly incensed mindes people agaynst namely turning iewes religion vnto fayth chryst preaching gospell saluation vnto vncircumcised gentile seemed match iewes thing gathered enimie people god prophane wicked contemner lawe leuiticall seruice first poynt hath hitherto answered alleaging still one thing done nothing rashly owne head thing according god commaundement calling teaching v example wee also haue doo altering defending religion proceedeth seconde poynte alleaging argument declaring called foorth god preach vnto gentile neuerthelesse yet ceassed loue countreymen thing shall moste playnely appeare partes hystorie rehearseth paule returneth ierusalemfor first sayth returned ierusalem verily bestowe hys labour vpon borne brought vp instructed maketh mentio iourney none cause proue declare faulte preached message saluation vnto nation furthermore declared ninth chap epistle galathians iorney fourth yere conuerted wherefore let passe supputation time let v consider example paule teacheth minister although detters vnto al men yet ought haue speciall care owne countrey nation lawe nature bounde vnto aboue others amongst haue bene borne brought vp childhoode rule chryst obserued also offered doctrine saluation euen beginning nazareth whose vnkindnesse yet ignoraunt sayd vnto minister must men obserue esteme natiue soyle countrey wherin behoueth folow moses chose rather forsake rich delytes court brother oppressed tyrannie let th learne wickednesse growen impudencie find heart sel libertie countrey lawes priuileges thing may get priuate gayne aduauntage thereby let v returne vnto paule paule prayeth temple come againe citie went temple pray temple maketh mention partly bicause none say lay lurking corner partely put away suspition polluting temple opinion knewe many desired praier may easily gathered tenth romanes saith praied oftentimes iewes might obteine saluatio end prayer shal playnly see communication folowing chryst touching iewes agayne minister admonished duetie continuall prayer helpe procure saluation people rule faith charitie wherby bound flock committed vnto commaundeth necessitie also requireth bicause euident labour vayne onlesse god giue encrease auncient prophet likewise sawe whose writing extant many prayer people must magistrate also obserue forasmuche able dothing without ayde assistance god whose spirit nedeful ruled led haue also imitate example moses dauid salomon ezechias beside infinite others length paule expoundeth oracle paule oracle sent vnto gentile wherby comaunded go vnto gentile saith traunce credite authoritie oracle diligently reporteth talke wyth chryst whose person muste considered first chryste appeareth vnto byddeth speede get ierusalem adding reason commaundement bycause receyue testimonie thou bearest man would consider thing vocation paule shall appeare thys smal temptation trial heard chosen vessel christ witnesse vnto al men doubt conceiued special hope conuersion owne nation gretly loued made heareth al hope vayne thus god tryeth fayth chosen successe faileth alwayes according godly wish endeuours moses beganne deliuer defend countreymen found vnkindely reiected helias ouercome killed priest baal thought thing hushe quiet feared fresh new manaces cruel attempt iezabell let v taught suche like example giue ouer keepe standing stoutly length shall want occasion wherby profitable seruice vnto god let v heare paule seemeth disputation god drawe head coller calling remembraunce former state condition thinketh reason sodaine chaunge could moued beleue gospell comonly sene scripture holy men sometime seeme contende god froward obstinate mind feele faith confirmed discussing examining diuerse reason thing cause god gently permitteth deale v rigorously would voutsafe speake vnto v superstition suche ouerthrowne thinke haue neede sainctes intercessours bycause lawfull v beeing sinner come god sight say yet heareth onely prayer hys seruauntes also reason argumentes make euen contrary commaundements yet wee muste beware abuse god gentlenesse contending proceede vnto murmuring stubborne disobedience rather let v wholly submit selues vnto god mete al reason yeld giue place time change minde sentence appoyntment bycause cousel endureth euer paule proueth place lorde vrgeth commaundement expressely sendeth vnto gentile promising successe gospell among bycause haue v simply obey paule disturbed orationfurthermore paule would haue gone forwarde haue declared reason doctrine iewes furious clamour cry vpon hym yea required haue put death soone herd gentils mentioned could kepe pacience modesty longer cause importunitie vnreasonablenesse proud conceipt opinion theselues claymed name god people leaned vpo merit leuitical law thought hainous offence match gentils vncircumcised vnder discipline law state saluation arrogant proud thing hypocrisie dissimulation thus know pharisies sometime offended christ preached saluation vnto publican adays doctrine gospell semeth thing intollerable monk adherent bicause sheweth saluatio christ vnto sinner techeth yt iustified faith hereby see inuentions wherin put al trust throwen let v cofesse goodnesse god greeued haue sinner conuerted vnto faith partaker saluation v seing iesus christ begotten sonne god sauiour vouchsafe hanged among theeues purged sinnes whole worlde whome prayse honour glory power euer amen cxlvj homelie cryed caste clothes threw duste ayre captayne commaunded brought castle bad scourged examined myghte know wherfore cryed bounde wyth thong paule sayde vnto centurion stoode lawefull scourge man romane vncondemned centurion heard went tolde vpper captaine saying intendest thou doo man citizen rome vpper captayne came sayd tell mee art thou romane sayde yea captayne aunswered great summe obteyned thys freedome paule sayde free borne strayght way departed haue examined high captaine also afrayde knew romane bycause bounde morrowe bycause woulde haue knowne certentie wherefore accused iewes loosed hys bondes commaunded highe priestes councell come togyther brought paule foorth set although paule apostle hath aunswered poyntes aduersaries accusation mighte satisfie godly well inough alleaging commaundement god hys dooings yet iewes little satisfied therewith would voutchsafe heare longer chiefe cause indignation sayde god sent vnto gentile thereby construed god reiected vnworthy saluation thought gentile preferred semed haynous matter bycause people iewes counted alwayes god owne child gentile counted vncleane person straungers kingdome god propertie hypocrite abide haue sinner coparteners societie saluation yesterday wee heard howebeit luke going forwarde hystorie begunne declareth furthermore done wee haue consider euery person firste wee haue speake iewesthe importunate malice iewes wyth vnseemely clamour require haue paule put death ended oration muche haynous matter desire haue owne countreyman tormented pleasure prophane heathen souldiour beside handle matter argument colour honestie clamour casting away clothes throwing vp duste lyke furious gesture braydes braynesicke madde person vse example teacheth v muche hatred truthe able doe seeing maketh whose mindes hath possessed forget modestie equitie charitie done agaynst paule done presence pilate christes cause wante example wherby may proued wicked vse day also furthermore place teacheth v argument comonly made vsed agaynst seruants chryst dayes aswell owne quarell chrystes say shouting threatning punishment fire sworde c weapon haue fought euen beginning worlde fight still euen day miserable blindnesse peruersenesse worlde prophane worldly matter men prayse holde aduised deliberation matter religion common case eternall saluation many men thinke matter handeled dispatched vnreasonable noyse furious braydes vproa e rebellion paule co maunded beaten rodsbut dothe capitayne great rage iewes firste comaunded paule castle thing prudently done bicause effectual meane apease people haue sight agaynst boy ed anger hatred offendeth vnrighteousnesse comanding yet sure suspition crime accustomed maner scourged examined iewes proued nothing agaynst heard paule answere slaunders wisely herein seemeth worthy excuse bicause likely whose death people desired one consent faultlesse admit coniectures pray shal innocent shall oppressed sedicious clamour therfore greuous fault captaine hereby let beare office authoritie learne ouer cruel hasty tormenting punishing men greeuous faulte shamefully torment innocent oftetimes commeth passe men ouercome paine grefe cofesse haue thing neuer thoght ment mean season thou shalt marke vsage wicked magistrate maruellous wit foreca politike matter therin passe part child light yet haue true iustice certen vaine shew wherwith cloked couered vse handle matter iudgement pleasure commoditie hereof haue example also pilate many like euery found hystories commonly ende iudgements vnhappie shall shortely perceiue hereafter let many therefore bee office labour fulfyll iustice forasmuch iudgements god committed vnto lord wyll one day require bloude hys seruauntes handes wee also taughte thys example state sainctes worlde accompted among wicked iudged vilest men whose body life euery man freely scorneth mocketh pleaseth prophet time passed fou true christ also founde selfe vpon whome prophete foreshewed fall psal luke forerunner iohn faine satisfie yeelde incestuous luste herode herodias therefore let greeue v counted number men offended vniust iudgements world seeing euident god wil maintaine continue remembrance seruaunts fame innocentes oppressed slaunders long lie hidden see psal luke let v see paule whose life heere ieoperdie paul defendeth himselfe romane lawes dothe holde peace like blocke runneth vnto lawe alleageth freedome citie rome whereby defended set libertie assoone captaine heard hee freeman citizen rome commaunded vnbinde vseth torment vpon therefore pacience sainctes cowardlinesse beastly stupiditie blockishnesse many imagine deede ready suffer thing christes sake yet neglect lawful defence agreeable faith lawful vse creature god euen vse lawes also bicause authoritie dependeth cheefely vpon god whome manifest magistrate ordained alasse howe much miserable state sainctes dayes although captaine knewe matter religion hand yet suffereth paule enioy priuiledges rome dayes lawes priuiledges mute religion come question may thanke pope teach lawful breake promisse suspected herisy whatsoeuer else may said purpose loke sixth chapter described hapned paule philippi like matter case length foloweth ende first act tragediethe tribune feare lawes kept vnder captaine afrayde god seueritie romaine lawes manner wicked preposterously feare men god howbeit desirous amend fault made vnderstand matter certainly bringeth paule morow counsel whose vprightnesse sanctimonie coceiued good hope captaine number men adayes also loke much goodnesse counsel whereas euident many hundreth yeares haue deceiued expectation godly person bicause summoned gouerned make marchaundise religion whose tirannie christendome oppressed let v consider profitable thing seuerely keepe maintaine publike lawes although claudius cesar whose raigne thing done shamelesse beast yet bicause aucthoritie lawes stode inforce defence left good men whereas lawes lie troden vnder foote impossible common weales long endure moreouer example captaine teacheth v remaineth get good men vse giue hastie iudgement uerily euen feare shameful trembling foule confusion thing therefore whosoeuer beare office let mindfull thing administer iudgement deliberation aduise let godly comfort themselues see wicked persecutor may easily feared power christ whome praise honor power glory euer amen xxiij chapiter vpon actes apostle cxlvij homelie paule behelde counsell sayde men brother haue liued good conscience god vntill day high priest ananias commaunded stoode smite mouthe sayd paule vnto god shall smite thee thou painted wall sittest thou iudgest lawe commaundest smitten contrarie lawe stoode sayd reuilest thou god high priest wist brother high priest wrytten thou shalt cursse ruler thy people christ oure sauiour appointed paule chosen called vessell selfe example teacheth v al fauor faithfull like finde worlde duetie suffering aduersitie assoone paule professed christ hee founde greeuousest ennimies whose saluation hee continually banished uerily euen iewes whose sake hee wished accursed rage burst farre inflamed romane captaines whome otherwise hated worse tode state godly proue familiar entierest acquaintaunce ennimies vnto whose hatred many time burneth ashamed aske helpe forreine ennimies christian brother paules constant fearlesse courage defendes himselfe cause assaultes aduersaries word commaundemet god whose example fitte also folowe like aduersitie vrgeth v furthermore ch e ely maruelled onsolation ad businesse paul captain heathen man warre hi claimed vnto fame al godlinesse captain forbiddeth vse violence liuereth paul hazard life furious hand permitteth alleage lawe selfe enioy maine priuiledges lengthe perceiued matter cheefely concerned religion thinking belonged longer hearing determination profession thereof assembling iues hee paul vnto haue tried examined lawe pruden ly done vniustly much eth icke saide yesterday bicause hath hope holinesse counsel de ueth thing sequele folowing aboundantly declareth sheweth howe priestes ioyned kinde impudent da e hipocris e togither let v examine euery order luk beginning paule paule afraide cou sell teacheth howe hee behaued himselfe counsell first noting countenance gesture body behelde che earnestly argument resent constante minde wherewith behoueth cheefely armed defend quarell truthe least ouercome feare falsely forsake incourage wicked e imies christe commonly take heart boldnesse vnto cowardlyne se godly meane season heere appeareth veritie christes promisses hee promiseth spirite ad ocate shall comfort eache time bee compelled giue accoumpte faithe fore magistrate counsell therefore beeing mindefull promisse hee forsaketh apostle greate daungerous enterprise armeth inuincible courage minde muche promisses generall beehoueth v also take comfort paule beginneth oration boldly pronounceth innocencie sayth haue liued good conscience paules innocencie god vn day woordes vnderstanded though g oried hee cleare sinne able stande vppon owne righteousnesse iudgement seate god hee respecteth present matter hys aduersaries used hym hys shamefull falling auncient religion impietie againste god like publike ennemie hee wickedly violated lawe temple leuiticall seruice gone aboute bring vncleane gentile societie goddes people therefore bicause none shoulde bee preuented wrongfull suspi ion denie hym hearing hee cleareth selfe beginning fault herein committed saying hee hathe doone thing good conscience touching office hys apostleshippe much ble call god witnesse hys integritie vpryghtnesse otherwise confesseth selfe euery sinner haue neede christes merite fauoure many time holy men priuate matter vse alleage innocencie suche slaunder notwithstanding sight god humbly cofesseth selues vncleane sinner wherof haue example moses dauid infinite others beginning paules oration teacheth v matter religion muste cheefely haue regarde vnto conscience nothing done craft dissimulation haue heerein doe god searcheth heartes raines place subtiltie craftie conueyance shall lawfull v reioyce integritie conscience order religion according worde god walke diligently calling owne deuise pleasure thing endeuor doe god mercifully pardon daily slip life comit infirmitie fleshe bicause turne vnto christ daily repent v exaple antichristian counselmoreouer paule begoon oration ananias president counsel commaunded smite mouth either begon declare matter demaunded else bolde defending innocencie seemed accuse vnrighteousnesse iniquitie else left insolent proude stile men vsed flatter kinde men easily moued wrath specially suppose estimation lightly regarded farre preferre glory god publike saluation man heere let v marke manner counsel wicked bishop vse commonly haue paule burthened slaunders whereby thought bring hatred nation answer thereto great concourse people disturbed furious clamoure shouting againe make excuse resist open violence place iustice whereof would seeme great fauourers counsell world wherein christ condemned caiphas president much vnlike wherein steuen oppressed suche also haue beene counsel pope many hundreth yeares may proued one counsell constance reade holy martires ch ist iohn husse hierome prage condempned like armoure weapon may hope counsel oure dayes appeareth aboundantly indiction bulles crafte impudencie whereof perceiueth doubtlesse iudged voide common sense reason paul offendeth rebuking highe priestbut let v returne vnto paule see howe tooke iniurie god saith shall smite thee thou painted wall c word seemeth offended commaundement christ biddeth v tourne cheeke smiteth v one shall easily cleared fault weigh bothe wordes person cursseth naughtie minde affection reproueth sinne according office apostle sheweth god hath punishment prepared first calleth painted wall euer following example christ sayth al whole packe like vnto painted sepulcher graues rendreth reason sayth adding thou sittest giue iudgement according lawe say thou claymest vnto thee power giue iudgement vpon mee vnder proud pretence lawe commaundest bee smitten contrary lawe therefore thou aunswerest vnto person name iudge vnder cloke therof hydest heart cannot abide truth thirsteth bloud therfore god wil strike thee although man take vengeance thee thing say paule speaketh according office minister reprochful slaunderous intente meaning doubt respect vnto example christ byshops seruant smote tourned cheeke earenestly rebuked stoute contumelious place taught pacience holy scripture commaundeth kinde cowardlinesse giueth wicked leaue lust although commaunded paciently suffer whatsoeuer god sendeth yet must flatter wicked dissemble god iudgementes also may office learne generall doctrine rule paule threatned vnto ananias chaunced long beginning iewes warres cruelly slaine manaim captaine sort rebellious iewes well worthie suche death feared himselfe rebell god shall neuer escape handes god vengeance follow striuing god violently oppressing innocentes else suffering bee oppressed lorde shall smite whome scripture euery teach true president reuenger al iudgements although able fray men yet shall neuer escape handes god haue example pharao saule achab many others whome prophane hystories make mention paule declaring thing starte foorth certaine rebuke himflatterers defender tyrantes none would reprehende vniust force ananias tyrant take vpon lust easily find flatterer defend authority al men whereby commeth passe al men open iniurie yet man dare complaine like tyrannie hath cleargie vsed many yeares church monkes priest molested al men plesure yet counted holie haue nicked worde onely dangerous heinous matter paule feate ironie kinde scorne reproueth tyrannous hypocrisie saying wist brother high priest though say would take high priest sawe nothing worthie name title deut exo high priest heareth men cause quietly indifferencie otherwise ignoranthowe magistrate maye preserue authoritie god lawe man oughte cursse lawful magistrate reade deuter exod magistrats taught ironie paule authoritie inuiolable safe office shew themselues al wise men may iudge worthy honour vnies promote glorie god refrayne violence defende good lawes example honest lyfe may sayde vnto paule place obiecteth ananias take blasphemer bloudsuckers lawebreakers drunkardes adulterer gamsters ruffian lyke companion senatours ruler knowe verily god iust iudgement sometime ordeyneth whose misgouernance godlie temporall matter paciently suffer honored woulde let maruell acknowlede fault amend doyng shall haue iesus christ king kinges lord lordes defender aucthoritie praise honour power glorye euer amen cxlviij homelie paul perceiued one part saduceis phariseis cryed counsel men brother pharisey sone pharisey hope resurrection death iudged sayde arose debate betwene phariseis saduceis multitude deuided saduceis sayde resurrection neyther angell spirite phariseis graunt arose great crye scribe phariseis part arose stroue saying fynde euill man though spirite angel hath appea ed let v stryue agaynst god arose great de bate captaine fearyng lest paule haue bene plucked asunder commaunded souldiers go downe take among bring castle god vseth exercise chosen diuers greeuous tribulation agayne deliuereth diuers many time meanes vnlooked haue example euerye place among notable holy ghost setteth forth luke paule chosen vessell christ haue hearde howe many wayes layde wayte iewes many time daunger life god oftentimes raised vp new helpes moste part suche paule thought muche lesse coulde haue wished requyred fyrste deliuered furiouse iewes handes captayne souldiers shortlye woulde haue pleated cause defended scourging priuiledge freedome rome length captaine committed matter life vnto wicked iudges god sendeth diuision among enemy long wished death pronounced innocent thing ought comfort v cowardly feare giue ouer time temptation confirme promisses god wherby euery promiseth reuenger people presente place many thing also worthy considered shall bee profitable examine circumstance matter rehearsed fyrst formost behoueth throughly consyder cause dissention luke saith diuersitie sectes among iewes sectes iewes aduersaries phariseis saduceis touching sectes iewes many thinges written iosephus referreth beginning vnto time machabees deede approuedst author testifie began vnder iohannes hircanus first priestes applied selues beare rule care religion diuers opinion began spring religion reason doctrine god worde ceased god appoynted still among people therfore three sectes sprong vp deuided vnitie church people god fyrst phariseis contented lawe hariseies folowed tradition beleued righteousnes saluation might atteyned workes besides giuen study astrologie taught fatall destenie much differing point stoikes men cloked outwarde couering workes taken holy second saduceis denying men subiect vnto destenie attributed freewill vnto saduceis although seemed earnestly commende studie vertue yet opened windowe vnto epicure vnto kynde licentious liuing denied angel immortalitie soule resurrection body sect aucthoritie bicause gaue libertie sharpe tradition phariseis therfore acceptable vnto many thirde sect esseni escenes perceyuing phariseis saduceis measured weighed vertue wordes would selues expresse deedes liued single life would haue seruantes good common gat liuing labour hand would come publique seruice feare polluting selues men companie bicause men fewe number sought office aucthoritie got dwell pleasaunt place set balsamum planted garden studied phisicke wherby bicause dyd men good gat great commendation vertue among men men vsages anabaptistes dayes doe greatlye resemble sauyng disturbe common weales fulfill profession lesse sincerelye bicause runne headlong kynde beastlinesse miserablye vexed tossed perturbation enuie hatred yet bicause thys rule essene somewhat austere vnpleasant therefore saide fewer followed cause wryters gospell make mention onely two first sectes wee haue obserue euill couetousnesse bishoppes idlenesse springeth thereof vseth breede seeing euilles defourmed primitiue churche order monkes papistrie bredde like beginning abundantly teache v alwayes effecte vice cause haue neede take heede dayes like worsse happen againe also goodnesse god bee magnified foule scatterment flocke hathe yet reserued remnauntes churche whereby lengthe might renewed againe see came passe papacie monkes euery place ruled roste time place haue bene found durst openly inuey hipocrisie dissimulation say nothing haue lien lurking house haue thought great wickednesse pertakers superstitiousnesse heere place hast thou answer aduersaries aske churche luther zwinglius dayes yes wee knowe churche almoste ouerwhelmed buryed suche one read christes time among iewes suche one dayes helias god saide seuen thousand left neuer bowed knee vnto baal although helias knewe one furthermore concerning present historie wee taught although wicked bee diuersly deuided bothe manner religion yet easily agree togither againste christe truthe fighte vnder one prince deuill cannot chuse take ennimie specially assaulteth kingdome woulde god woulde diligently consider thing seeke cheefe praise glory dissentions debate practise minister christ taking theyr naughtie affection vnto counsell heereby encourage wicked ennimies christe thinke easie matter vanquishe whome see contend bitterly among themselues hereof shall haue commoditie speake else paule professeth pharisienowe lette v see paule perceiuing bande aduersaries consist diuers sectes deuiseth way howe set among selues sayeth menne breth en pharisey sonne pharisey touching hope resurrection deade iudged paule seemeth offende either crafte denying christ faithe seeing professeth order euident greatest ennimies christ may easily excused first enforced seeke suche shifte escape bicause perceiued haue libertie otherwise speake saw matter handled open tirannie therfore rather haue professed faith plainely haue giuen accompt thereof began doe interrupted taketh newe way confesseth alloweth phariseis opinion simply poyntes article resurrection wherein sounde iudgement ioyneth agaynst saduces thought opinion phariseis specially trust workes wherein suche pride epistle euery aboundantly declare therefore paules example maketh nothing suretie life estimation craftely draw backewarde matter religion receyue allow article playne repugnaunt fayth chryst wee yet taught lawefull godly beeing circumuented wrongfull iudgement seeke escape farre foorth may doo without detriment truthe least ouer rashe endaungering selfe bring truthe perill aboue thing marke paule sayth iudged touching resurrection deade howebeit poyntes accusation soundeth farre otherwise alleageth resurrection bycause therein consisteth principall poynte whole matter fayth religion declareth firste corinth bicause whole hope sainctes standeth herein sayth iudged also concerning hope take away resurrection else haue faythfull wherin put trust bycause world see nothing cross tribulation hereby appeareth may thinke deny resurrection bothe pull downe foundation christian fayth set open gate vnto wickednesse life howebeit paules enterprise succeedeth luckely paules enimies fal amog selues phariseis maintayne parte agaynst saduces making sedicious noyse side phariseis crie paules side find euill man spirite aungell haue spoken vnto let v striue agaynst god herein verily speake moste godly truely yet deserue prayse god therefore bicause made confession loue truthe equitie corrupte affection minde notable example teaching v partaking able doo beeing carried sway hereof little thirsted bloude become defendours thing vseth happen many time religion also controuersies forasmuche suche iudgements moste parte tende euill ende behoueth v diligently auoyde also two thing profitable obserued first howe consent wicked long endure tossed hither thither like sea vncertayne affection god vseth high scatter scorne counsel deuises doo suche dexterit e handsomnesse somtimes vseth helpe moste wicked enimies sauing seruauntes thus roddes incursion philistine profitable vnto dauid whyle kepte backe saule persecuting dayes haue seene turkes warres occasion many time church tranquillitie quiet therefore let conspiracy wicked offende man let v put assured trust saluation god take agaynst doctrine god reuealeth striue agaynst god horrible offence co mon dayes defacing gospell prince prelate churche chiefly labour whereas sonne god dyd firste voutsafe reueale worlde owne mouth length great confusion shall gyaunts feele much stronger god horrible thing fall hand captayne deliuereth paul hand iewesfurthermore clamour taken vp side turne open sedition matter proceedeth farre paule fayne delyuered agayne helpe captayne souldiours brought castle vndoubtedly moued therevnto god first let magistrate follow example captayne remember duetie succour def nde good cowardlynesse suche detested either care good else men sake deliuer tormented wherein euident pylate offended let also marke looke commit minister truthe vnto councels antichryst nether shall constrayned shamefully forsake saue deliuer greater daunger handes make game pastime wickedly breake publique lawes promyses example hereof appeareth sigismunde emperoure circumuented crafte tyrannie councell constance able deliuer iohn husse handes sente boheme letter safe conducte vppon fayth emperour howebeit howsoeuer thinges fare worlde let v imitate paule constantly defende truthe iesus chryst sauiour redeemer shall fayle bee whome bee blessing honour power glory euer amen cxlix homelie nighte following god stoode sayde bee good cheere paule thou haste testified mee hierusalem must thou beare witnesse also rome day certayne iewes gathered selues togyther made vowe saying woulde neyther eate drinke tyll kylled paule fortie men made conspiracie came chiefe priestes elder sayde wee haue bound selues wyth vowe wee wyll eare nothing vntyll wee haue slayne paule nowe therefore giue knowledge vpper captayne counsell hee bring hym foorthe vnto v morrowe though wee woulde knowe something perfectly wee euer come neere ready kyll paules sister sonne hearde laying awayte wente entered castle tolde paule paule apostle seconde epistle corinthian firste chapter sayth affliction chryst plentyfull v euen consolation plenteous chryst worthy comfortable saying confirmed many example euen beginning vnto example present tolde paule may well adioyned haue heard hitherto vexed molested greeuous perilles daungers many thinges happened vnto whiche mighte haue driuen desperation beeing laide prison romane souldiours one whole consente iewes required put death sawe none helpe succou e suche founde souldiours men farthest true religion lorde fayleth hys apostle beeing daunger distresse friendly comforteth beeing tossed vp downe wyth dyuerse care performeth deede promiseth word while miraculous sort deliuereth handes cruel cutthrotes bicause thing writte instruction comforte people let v marke euery poynt thereof order first thing herein consolation wherwith paules minde confir ed strengthned lord standeth nightgod comforteth paule say angel teach true sayd wold v vntill end world biddeth paule good cheere take good harte vnto bicause perhaps began doubt god care good towards cause sayth muste beare witnesse rome also moste euiden ly appeareth god neglecteth men matter affayres although seeme sometymes forget howe neglecte men forgetteth sparrowes chryst testifieth luke deede might seeme god regarde paule considering howe worlde conspired agaynst seeyng god standeth hym pryson easily appeareth nothyng hathe happened vnto hym hythervnto eyther wythout knowedge god without bycause wee haue example heereof euery placethe maner god comfor ing lette v nowe consyder manner consolation bare wordes whereof beeyng wayed capacitie nne rea seeme declare god rather threateneth hym comforteth hym hee saythe bee good cheere paule thou haste testified mee hierusalem muste thou also beare wytnesse rome therefore lorde giueth warning newe trauelles newe contention lyke phisitian shoulde say sicke body good cheere sonne thou haste newe sickness comming within fewe dayes thou shalte haue freshe doloures greefes one encourage souldiour weeryed late skyrmish vnto greeuous fyghte woulde say consolatyon comforte howe bee suche lyke thyng sayde vnto paule making mention rome putteth remembrance tediousnesse iourneys peril nauigation number cruell kind punishment forasmuch claudius emperour foolish cruell man ready punishe g tlesse person wee waigh matter deepely shall appeare two thing might little encourage paule one perceiued god care heard shoulde vessell instrument glory declare name chryst among romanes also lordes whole worlde therfore taught whence fetche comforte aduersitie fortunate successe worldly affayres hope lyue idelly easily prouidence god doth vouchsafe make v vessel instrument glory thing chryst teacheth v promiseth disciple prosperous successe attempt sayth nothing shal happen vnto without councell god prouidence taught also whyle god deliuereth comforteth v calleth v idlenesse prepareth v greater business therefore recreateth v taste truthe promise make v returne businesse agayne cherfully may see godly men vse doo therefore shamelesse errour haue tryed ayde helpe god clayme vnto selfe certayne immunitie freedome perilles labour else giue selues altogither desire flesh follow vnvnbridled licentiousnesse saying dooing god confirmeth hys consolation deedesfurthermore bycause apostle like molested many perilles came rome god confirmeth hys late courrage manlynesse freshe benefite deliuered great vnlooked hazarde fourtie person conspired death made vowe would neyther eate drynke tyl killed whose wicked enterprise man cannot tell whether may wonder auda itie bloudie myndes beside intend meane deathe guyltlesse bodie whiche contrarie lawe god bynde themselues othe vowe beeing ignorant many thing myght happen chaunce might hinder dashe attempt example wee learne iudge boldenesse audacitie wicked meane defend religion professe force rather scripture lette v returne votary agayne declare bloudie intent vnto priestes counsell thinking haue greate thankes handes desiring haue partner enterprise giue say knowledge captaine counsell bring foorth vnto v morrowe though wee woulde knowe something perfectly wee readie kyll euer come neare heere appeare craftes traynes wicked howe farre hatred trueth proceedeth men professe zeale auncient religion wonderfully counterfet iustice yet meane season conceyue deuice mynde voyde reason iustice howbeit sathan hath lefte pollycie also remembraunce posteritie hath seene howe minister chryst oftentymes called foorth vnto disputation haue fallen handes murtherers want example age teache v afrayde sleightes dayes also agayne consider great corruption time among people iewes seeing men durste declare wicked enterprise vnto priestes elder knewe vndoubtedly would ioyne therefore worthy miserably perishe togyther thing let looke like wise dayes labour gratifie antichrystes priestes sheading innocent bloud banishing godly yet howe vayne moste tymes enterprise hystorie following declareth nephew paules beeing yong strippling yet meete inough interrupte deuise chaunceth ordinaunce god vnderstande purpose declareth matter vnto paule sendeth hym vnto captayne diligence industrie bloudy attempte wee shall heare hereafter quite dashed defeated thus god thought good ratifie late promise teaching v howe easie hym ouerthrowe deuises wicked wicked enimies able doo agaynst seeth thing arme set foorth weakenesse agaynst destroyed wicked tyrannie pharao moyses throwen away infancie deliuered sisara holo erne moste skilfull valiaunt captaynes woman killed wisedome daniell beeing childe reproueth filthy luste elder senatours defendeth honest vertuous lyfe susanna place meanes yong springal defeateth counsell deuice seemed scarse possible disappoynted meanes bycause taken hande moste desperate men confirmed holynesse othe vowe corroborated authoritie priestes elder lyke kinde example hystories behoueth v learne power god let v truste wee shall lesse feare tyrannie wicked beeing bolde quarell truthe let v put hope confidence god onely iesus chryste lorde whome bee blessing honour power glory euer euer amen cl homelie paule called one vnder captaynes sayd bring young man vnto highe captayne hath certayne thing shewe tooke brought vnto high captaine sayde paule prisoner called mee vnto prayed mee bring young man vnto thee hath certayne matter shewe thee highe captayne tooke hande went way asked thou haste tell sayde iewes determined desire thee thou wouldest bring foorth paule morrowe councell though woulde enq e somewhat hym perfectly followe thou myndes lye wayte fortie men haue bounde selues vowe wyll neyther eate drynke tyll haue kylled hym nowe ready looke thou shouldest promyse vpper captayne let young man departe charged hym saying see thou tell man thou haste shewed thys thing mee hee called vnto two vnder capitaynes saying make ready two hundred souldiours goe caesarea horseman threescore tenne speare men two hundred thirde houre nyghte delyuer beastes may sette paule bryng hym safe vnto felix hyghe deputie although god neuer forsaketh hys electe according hys promise hande wyth alwayes place yet hee mixeth many tymes aduersitie wyth prosperitie bycause profitable haue kepte dooing duetie exercyse fayth may learne depende onely vppon hym ascribe prosperitie vnto hym alone many example heereof euery chiefely hystories moyses dauid others wherevnto thys example tolde heere paule may worthely bee referred wee haue hearde howe god appeared vnto beeing greuously many wayes tempted effectuously comforted promising hym shoulde onely escape handes iewes also shoulde beare witnesse hym rome lo euer scarse day forty men conspire hys death taking priestes elder counsell deuise matter seemeth impossible escape appeared vtterly contrary promise god yet bicause paule ignoraunt god vsage custome neyther feared mention sodayne daunger god fayleth hys promise yea least hoped god sendeth hym ayde assistaunce wee shall nowe see vse thing wee confirme fayth heereby caste hope wee see successe thynges agreable vnto god promise although lorde linger tarry yet forget v continually may receiue vtilitie hereby muste diligently consider euery person paul requireth help captenfirst commeth paule foorthe althoughe confirmed wyth oracle yet hee boasteth foolishely god promyse prouidence setteth daungers lyghte prudently taketh holde one meane remayned man hee myghte safely vse wythout breache relygion christian faythe hauing care make captayne vnderstande matter nephew beeing admonished duetie might conuey bloudy handes conspiratours bycause matter might seeme importance bee suspected reason age strippling ioyneth centurion spokesman intercessor example first taught howe vse prouidence promise god aduersitie muste doubte god eternal prouidence counsell ruleth al thing stopped hindred endeuour enimies vseth scatter counsell nation psalm counsell dauid sayth endureth euer agayne promiseth bee people assiste aduersities whose promise wee muste assuredly beleeue meane season remedy meanes lawefull selfe offered god muste meanes bee despised neglected least putting selues ouer rashely daunger wee seeme tempt god muste obserued al dooings vsed intillage husbandrie although encrease thereof commeth god yet man ought neglecte husbandry without great contempt god thus read dauid vsed somtimes flie somtimes meanes god offred holyly although nothing doubted truthe god promised kingdome likewise ezechias yea chryst selfe sticked flye knew houre yet nigh neither would cast selfe downe pynacle temple sathans bidding although alleaged promise god authoritie chryst yea furnisheth hys disciple large promise yet warneth diligently beware men math therefore errour suche abuse prouidence god maintayne temeritie licentious boldnesse vnder pretence hereof wickedly contemne al forecast wisedome suche meanes beside god hath ordeined shamefull wicked wee must rather auoide inconuenience distrust least ouercome therof turne vnto vnlawfull meanes meane vsing lawful meanes prouided god let v comit al successe vnto good holy god shall walke safelyest middle way auoyding aswell much confidence diffidenceconfidence diffidence two extreames eche kind paule doth place wisely godly therfore allowed god example teacheth v moreouer lawfull godly christian people demaunde ayde magistrate besech armed defence neede shall require neither suche men harkened say chrystes kingdome must set foorth warre seing commaunded resiste euill aske lawfull defence magistrate bicause meaning fight enlarge christes kingdome require office duty good magistrate ought deny v godly people may vse without breach faith religion euident magistrate appointed god good purpose hat sworde vayne committed god reade rom god promysed esay kinges nourices hys churche touching chrystes precepte forbidding v resiste euill mente thereby take magistrate lawfull function forbiddeth priuate men greedy desire reuengement vseth violate breake publike lawes disturbeth kind amitie peace friendship therfore paule doth wel seeking captaynes ayde refuseth armour souldiours wherby sawe craftie awaytes iewes mighte preuented repressed bene faulte souldiours conspirator met committed slaughter sydes rather faulte shoulde haue light vpon wicked person beginner wicked enterprise lawful paul vse defence safegard romane garrison doubtlesse seuere controller faith blame minister dayes seeke ayde succour christian magistrate require duetie heathen captayne thought meete deny apostle chryst let v let paule passe come centurion whose intercession vsedthe centurion curteously accomplisheth paules request calleth hym vnto hym desireth bring yong strippling vnto vpper captayne accomplisheth gently readily god vseth get people fauour sight straungers secret working procureth good men ioseph time pa e great fauour potiphare wee reade israelite easily obtayned egyptian costlyest thing bicause god gotten people fauour sight thing ought make v desirous godlinesse bicause see duetifull shewe selues bee vnto god gentle fauourable fynde men vnto v god easily pleasure get v good wil men also must imitate centurion example willingly helpe affliction calamitie reade math detestable wickednesse dayes men growen suche vngodlynesse man shall scarcely obteyne christian paule easily obteyned heathen souldiour many nowe dayes ashamed captiued chrystes sake cause onely regarde least dooing thyng cause runne suspition themselues capten ready aide assist paule let v see captayne dyd paules cause heathen man appeare token singular vertues god doubtlesse working minde ment deliuer apostle hand awaytes conspiratours first vseth singular curtesie repelling strippling came vnto frowning herd name captiue taketh hande leadeth aside asketh friendly wherefore come example men office authoritie ought vse seeing one least commendation let men haue easie accesse vnto heare subiectes cause gently paciently dooing resemble propertie god voluntary accorde calleth v hath eares open alwayes prayer afflicted doubtlesse number feare shame declare mindes men aucthoritie behoueth encourage signification humanitie good preposterous shame feare hinder agayne captayne ioyneth wisedome curtesie may hereby perceyued easily beleeueth young man although many thing might haue caused suspect message many time perceyued maliciousnesse iewes first proceeding easily vnderstoode hatefull myndes bare vnto paule easily suspected might suche among yong man described yea suche humanitie disdained counseled yong man warning shoulde bring paule vnto haue prince ruler also imitate ouermuch credit hath kinde lightnes auoyded must hard credit specially heare probable reason alleaged rather let wisely present mynde ready assayes lest oftentimes happeneth hardnesse beleefe bring either theyr common weales el good men hazarde daunger finally may see great industrie diligence captaine seeing omitteth nothing making present busines wysely requyreth yong felowe saye nothing matter least bewraying thereof might giue conspiratours occasion take new way deuise next sendeth two centurion biddeth make ready bande men might suffise purpose commaundeth also prepare beastes paule ryde furthermore appoynteth nyght carry auoyding tumulte giueth hand letter commendation felix president thing coulde done without great labour expences remembring office spareth neyther paynes charge deliuer prisoner yet conuict crime handes murtherers lyke industrie must christian magistrate vse defence good men forasmuche playne cheefly ordeyned ende example ethnicke reproueth negligence iniquitie great many person leefer deliuer hundred minister worde slaughtered would take paine suche costes sake yet let vnthankfulnesse age feare man duetie faythfully although men cease partes appeareth helpe yet god neuer fayle promise vseth take worship thousande daungers meanes vnlooked bring length inheritaunce heauen sonne iesus christ prayse honour power glory euer amen clj homelie captayne wrote letter maner claudius lisias vnto mightie ruler felix sendeth greeting man taken iewes shoulde haue bene killed came souldiers rescued perceyued romane would haue knowen cause wherfore accused brought forth counsell perceyued accused question lawe giltie thing worthye death bondes shewed howe iewes layde wayte sent straight waye thee gaue commaundement accuser thinges haue agaynst shoulde tell thee farewell souldiers commaunded tooke paule brought night antipatras morrowe lefte horssemen goe retourned vnto castle came caesarea deliuered epistle deputie presented paule also deputie read letter asked countrey hee vnderstode cilicia heare thee sayde hee thine accuser come commaunded kept herod iudgement hall man might thinke diligence luke euangelist superfluous vseth declaryng paule meane romane souldiers escaped awaytes certaine murtherers layd hym inculcatyng hys report therof euery small trifle almost tediousnesse hearer euident writ suggestion holye spirite must thinke nothyng superfluous tolde aucthoritie hereby setteth eye infallible veritie trueth god inuincible power vseth defending people defeateth enterprise wicked murtherers deliuering paule anye common vsuall sorte according promyse ordereth matter bryngeth helpe godly hoped thing enimies christian faith perhappes religion bicause god truthe selfe breake promise bycause holdeth heartes myndes men hande therefore easie matter vse helpe enimyes bringing passe haue done therfore industrie captayne souldiers must ascribed power god suche wyse described man myght thinke coniured aswell deliuer paule kill consyderation thynges haue oftentymes declared serueth confyrmation faith bicause must diligently shored stayed vp reason daylye temptation let v see howe paule brought caesarea presidente iurye bicause euerye diuers thinges founde making maintenance vpholding weake fayth beginning putteth coppie epistle wherein lisias captaine commended paule vnto felix epistle claudus lysias captayne epistle teacheth v among thinges breuitie auncestours vsed matter waight importance adayes triftes men vse many woordes whereof none cause alleadged fayth credite buried whose steade lying false counterfeting beareth swinge letter consisteth diuers partes whereof fyrst superscription conteineth name author also whome writtenwho felix declareth lieutenaunt ouer iewes time namely one felix prophane writer also make muche mention man saye bondeman made free claudius caesar foolishnesse emperoure aduaunced suche dignitie passed citizen nobilitie rome honoures yet kept styll seruile condicions polluting place filthye luste whoredome murther suetonius wryteth bene husbande three queenes whiche entyced marriage partelye aucthoritie claudius partely whoredome baudrye drusilla daughter herode whiche smitten angell iosephus boke antiquity chapter hearde chapter gate aniazus kyng people called amazi crafte conueyaunce certayne magitian cyprus caused ionathas hygh priest thought nothing thereof cruellye kylled temple cutthrotes sent thether purpose whiche tolde ende thou mayst see paules fortune vppon whome god permitted wycked man haue power yet defendeth hurte done fooles therefore feare power force menne seeyng god able bryng downe heartes lyon make forbeare people contrarye theyr nature vsage also appeareth state people whiche hauynge abused theyr lybertye heretofore haue plucked wrath god vppon suche euident iewes haue bene god onely endued wyth libertye freedome also hadde consecrated hys owne selfe amongest nation chose theym peculiare people bycause woulde obeye holye lawes god amended admonyshementes prophetes christe wyckedlye abused gifte libertie nowe depriued thereof constrayned suffer suche presidentes neyther commendation nobilitie fame vertue defamed euill reported reason filthye luste beastlye crueltie yet woulde amende plague length vtterlye forsaken shut kingdome god thynges suche menne oughte diligentlye consyder nowe dayes also abuse prerogatiue libertie make vnbrydeled licenciousnesse bothe saying doyng returne lysias captaynes letter whiche superscribed begynneth narrationthe commendation paule paules greate commendation declareth apprehended demerite faulte hee hadde done vnreasonablenesse iniustice iewes next sayth citizen freeman rome length hee testifieth innocent sayth done nothing worthy death imprisonment iewes made sturre adoo agaynst cause lawe religion sake singuler commendation muste remember wordes souldier speaketh maner romanes desyred vtter abolishment iewes religion cared whether president defended therfore see euery litle regarded controuersies religion god commaundeth farre thyng whiche appointeth magistrate haue speciall care religion meete god goodnesse hath placed degree dignitie suffer honour god eyther neglected defaced yet craft child worlde appeareth captayne trimly dissembleth errour committed bynding whipping citizen rome wryting nothing made getting praise fauour cheefly marked care god hath true seruauntes consydering defendeth innocencie testimonie enimies example hereof nowe see euery day wheras highly extoll praise prophetes apostle persecute faith doctrine deadly hatred therfore feare slaunders enimies infamie worlde nowe remaineth latter part epistle consisteth certayne preoccupation aunswere obiection myght made lest felix myght offended innocent person rather set libertie sent hym suche coste charge sheweth also cause hereof saith thus bycause waite iewes laide paule shoulde neuer haue escaped ben set libertie therfore behoued wyse sayth prouide safetie innocent see publique peace obserued againe example captayne putteth magistrate remembraunce duetie namely take heede man suffer violence iniurie euident cheefly ordeyned ende good men oppressed insolencie pleasure wicked psal rom reade psalm rom paule brought felix foloweth successe matter verilye moste happye god ordered souldiers faithfully fulfill charge committed vnto bring paule safely vnto felix president though chaunged nature becommeth curteous easy spoken asketh cuntrey man knew deferreth hearing matter vntil comming accuser lawe nature teacheth v partes ought hearde sentence giuen let v remember thinges happened according god prouidence working souldiers without grutching serued paules turne ready defende perill lyfe felix accepteth curteously frendly custome causeth hym kept herodes iudgement hall honest kynde pryson vse thinges teache v must passe much vpon enterprise men studie onelye please god mollifie barbarous men heartes tame sauage wylde maners turne enimies heartes loue v let thinges embolden v inuincible constancie fayth ouercome tyrannie worlde lyue hereafter eternally heauen iesus christ sauiour prayse honour power glorye euer amen xxiiij chapiter vpon actes apostle clij homelie fiue dayes ananias highe priest descended elder certaine oratour named tertullus enfourmed deputie paule paule called foorth tertullus began accuse saying seeing wee liue greate quietnesse meanes thee many good thing done vntoo nation thy prouidence allowe euer place noble felix thankes notwithstanding tedious vnto thee pray thee thou wouldest heare v thy curtesie fewe wordes haue found man pestilent fellowe moouer debate vnto iewes worlde maintainer secte nazarites hath also enforced pollute temple whome wee tooke would haue iudged according lawe highe captaine lysias came vpon v great violence tooke away handes commaunding accuser come vnto thee thou mayest thou wilte enquire knowe certaintie thinges whereof accuse iewes likewise affirmed saying thynges euen euangelist luke declareth chapiter paule handled felix presidente beinge sente hym captayne appoynted safegarde ierusalem haue heard whiche narration firste declared howe hyghe priest elder layde matter death vnto paules charge albeit paule declared opened cause lord presidente coulde fynde matter death agaynst hym yet keepeth pryson two whole yeares together bicause woulde shewe iewes pleasure leaueth bounde pryson still till pontius festus succeeded office thynges declared ende may learne thereby state godly lyke alwayes worlde howe worlde continually hateth forasmuch see iewes spare laboure costes bryng paule beyng faithful preacher god word cofusion christ prophecied thing shold happe disciple eue wold haue yt prophecied proued set forth exaples apostle yt shold lesse offended time like hapned v also apostle suffred al kindes persecution aduersities teach example becometh v doo tried persecution teptations ye cheef vse end al present matter whole history folowing place rehearsed ye first act paul circustances wherof shal examine paules accuser men great power authoritiehe beginneth discription person appeared felix lieutenaunt one side stoode ananias high priest elder tertullus famous orator greatly exercised pleading reason long practise syde paule alone bondes many cause suspected place appeareth againe haue often time already declared commonly cheefe enimies truthe minister thereof weapon fight verily euen seeme greatest mainteyners religion common weale amongst make marchaundize religion historie gospel teacheth v euerye paules aduersaries place euen kind men part vse excell experience wisedome vtteraunce power aucthoritie cause haue many fauour folowe contrariwise minister truth fewe number commonly small fame estimation contempned despised men seeme bitternesse minde ignorance rather godlines loue men saluation withstande worlde hath alway bene godlies happe world despised person cope number power aucthoritie seene example age thus moses aaron matched magitians egipt fauoured defended king aucthoritie nobilitie egipt side elia alone encountreth foure hundreth fiftie priestes baal almost many chaplin woodes groues achab wicked iudge read micheas long faine set himselfe foure hundreth false prophetes might also alleaged history prophetes apostle christ himselfe whiche breuities sake omit bicause reade scripture hitte euery haue rather consider ende thinges wherof shall receyue great profit vtilitie first serue instruction euery iudge faith religio according multitude aucthoritie folow see adaies men comonly graunt shal paule take foile one accused priest elder also al prophet christ apostle shalbe dauger yea shal prefer ye turk christias far passe v territory dominion multitude natios victory prosperity successe wherfore must rather herke vnto christ calleth faithful litle flock saith ye enter ye narow gate heapes rashe destruction broader waye againe co syderation thinges doth litle comfort v afrayde luke math although wee alone sometime constrayned stande agaynste manye great power glorye aucthoritie thys place strengthened paule stande v also lyke daunger haue large promyses wherein promyseth v prompting hys spirite mouth wisedome luke math marke oration tertullus whiche aduersaries shall able resist see luke mat mark let v heare tertullus oratour whose oration consisteth cheefl ye three pointes first beginning wherein doth arteficiously craftilye impudently purchase selfe beneuolence good partlye flattering felix face partelye iewes saye may thanke peace quietnesse liued care prouidence many misery euery day redressed againe confesse acknowledge goodnesse benefites thankes giuyng yet lye egregiously haue hearde felix gouerned cuntrey naughtely could infinite thing cruelly vniustlie place came committed whoredome murther prophane wryters abundantly declare againe euident men haue meane knowledge history iewes also tymes made often many rebellion agaynst romanes yet vaine man ashamed lye praising tyranne dishonestly betraye whole nation whose commendation earnestlie haue regarded therefore falsely commende quiet estate gouernement bring paule hatred felix though hee disturber publique peace tranquillitie easelie appeareth bitternesse hatred conceyued truthe worlde hateth nothing muche truethe bycause light thereof reproueth theyr euill woorkes therefore suffer beare cruell enimies rather truth thinke tyrannes tollerable ynough put helpe oppressing truth preferred tiberius caesar cruell voluptuous tyraunt christe sauiour sayde none king caesar yea ashamed preferre barrabas murtherer captaine secte rebel christ vntowarde peruerse inudgement newe thing worlde reade israelite wildernesse time past offended withstode moses likewise maruellous ie commending seruitude egipt reason melon amonds garelike fleshe like thing nume land abound disdained state life euery houre god declared new token beneuolence good like miserable vnhappy men would god like example day woderfully extol great peace liued ye time popery say yt preching gospel hath marred altogither mean seson craftily disseble bloudy war pope haue ben cheefe procurer many hundred yeares make mention suche greeuaunces haue miserablye weakened goodes conscience men yea menne haue farre exceeded madnesse haue thoughte better dallie aunciente enimies abyde lyght gospell men shall fynde true vnhappie nation iewes felte romanes many yeares driuen away apostle nowe let v returne tertullus whiche seconde parte oration frameth greeuous accusation agaynst paule point accusation consisting three pointes fyrste sayth seditious person yea woorsse plague selfe bycause troubled disturbed iewes euerye worlde put paule faulte thing wherof selues cheefe doer whole discourse thys booke teacheth iewes cheefe mouers sedition hitherto agaynste paule companion hereunto maye referred sturres tumultes whiche wee haue hearde made corinth thessalonica ephesus antioch iconium lystra diuers city next cal maintener sect nazarits therfore accusing schisme heresie faulte age compted greatest churche tertullus seemeth contempt call christian nazarites obscure beginning small regarde estimation appeareth first chapiter iohns gospell village nazareth small accompt forasmuch nathanael sayde philip telling iesus nazareth good thyng come nazareth olde pollicie diuell cause true religion suspected vile thing reputation reason whereof iuliane apostata also sometyme called christ christian galileyans thereby accuse polluting church vnder name churche comprehende outwarde kinde religion thinges daye ought diligentlye obserue myght vnderstande crime commonly layde truthe offended time called seditious scismatikes heretikes prophaners temple image church robber subuerters auncient religion thinges ought offende v neither muste beleeue impudently burthen innocent godlie men crime bycause woulde seeme charge paule false matter accusationthe confirmation accusation produce witness firste captaine hym selfe yet accuse way seeming importunate set person libertie lyke shortly punished according lawe againe affirme tertullus saying true haue behold example great audacitie impudencie dare accuse captaine complaine restrained shedding bloud deserued great praise therefore little wicked repente mischeeuous deedes continually hate hinder let wicked enterprise moreouer first accuser next iudges matter also witness beleued euery thing feare iudgement god prouer deutero hateth abhorreth false witness commandeth punished lawe talio suffring lyke thing serue great vtilitie bothe may learne suspecte suche nowe dayes lyke vnto men shall lesse offended lyke happen vnto v iesus chryst oppressed lyke preiudices liueth reigneth hath ouercome power hell beeing ascended heauen derideth deuices enimies moste faythfully maintayneth quarell chosen seruaunts prayse honour power glory euer amen cliij homelie paule deputie selfe beckened speake aunswered quiet minde aunswere selfe forasmuche vnderstande thou haste beene many yeres iudge vnto people bycause thou mayest knowe yet twelue dayes since went vp hierusalem worship neither founde temple disputing man neither raysing vp people neither sinagoges citie neither proue thing wherof accuse confesse vnto thee way call heresie worship god father beleeuing thing written law prophet haue hope towards god resurrection dead selues looke also shall bothe iuste vniuste therefore studie haue alway cleare conscience towarde god towarde men heard yesterday poyntes haynous accusation made agaynst paule holy ghoste woulde haue diligently written spoken tertullus partly truth apostolike storie suspected seeing wordes enimies also reported truely partely bycause offended heare lyke obiected agaynst v others followe true fayth nowe therefore let v heare paul apostle felix made signe vnto speake putteth away obiections boldly truely come wordes apostle haue two thing consider one example felix teacheth v iudgements partes must hearde paule beeing moste greeuously slaundered yet rusheth foorth impudently aunswere selfe led suche rage slaunder agayne abyding till leaue giuen president speake pleateth cause soberly wisely let godly likewise least cause truth wherof stand defence suspected reason hastinesse rayling many time suche rather satisfie passion minde paules apologie defence follow rule reason thing beeing premised let v proceede vnto paules aunswere consisteth confuting obiections made agaynst beginning getteth beneuolence good felix yet sorte priuily quippeth aduersaries without foolishe kinde lying flattery saith willinger declare hys matter felix many yeres bene gouernour thys natio cause wel acquaynted nature coditios thing alway defendant desireth haue iudge skill vnderstading bycause many time commeth passe otherwise great fauourers iustice offend ignorance daunger paul confesseth ne feareth felix deceiued iewes whose impudencie sedicious mind wel knew many yeres experience learne generall doctrine magistrate must diligent vnderstanding matter bicause excused ignoraunce either grosse wilfull ignoraunce god uicar deputie hath iudgements committed vnto ignorant thing therfore let remember god iudgement marke wel property condition doings people diligently examine circumstance al cause shal come passe either shal offende ignorance else perhaps comit errour deceiued others slothfulnesse errour may excused would god would often thinke thing bragging glorious title authoritie giue selues wholly filthy idlenes banketting dauncing hunting know better caues lodging wild beast instrument filthy desire maners property coditions subiects furthermore ought obserue leaue place god would suffer felix filthy tyraunt b rule many yeres ouer people might seme men strange matter incurable ingratitude people well deserue god set ouer singular captayns shepherd disdayned would voutsafe heare christ eternall sonne god therfore nowe suffer god oftentimes threatned woulde take helpe giue suche ruler care owne luste couetousnesse common weale people thing may teache v al haue looke despise either gift libertie godly magistrate faythfull minister worde vnthankfully wickedly maner iewes let v proceede paules aunswere see howe putteth away crymes layde vnto chargehe putteth away crime sedition amongst firste sayde author sedition wherevnto also ioyne polluting temple made moste adoo aboute thys matter refuting thinges diligent first gathering argument tyme proueth impossible shoulde rayse sedition bycause paste twelue dayes agoe hee came ierusalem tyme take dayes lay pryson shall bee one two remayning coulde bee able within two three dayes hys commyng make vniuersall sedition populous citie agayne came sayth make tumult businesse worship shall hereafter follow succour releeue faythful almes gathered among gentile therfore false say touching polluting temple neyther taughte temple synagoges called assembly people togyther finally shall neuer able proue thinges haue layde charge saying vttereth great grauitie accuseth onely lying also false witnesse bearing disagreeing vnto christian pacience put away accusation made agaynst v though bee ignominie aduersaries wee see truthe daunger owne estimation much learning paule diligently purgeth crime sedition heereby minister learne muste diligently beware disquiet common weales mouing sedition bycause nothing daungerous god delighted vnitie concorde cheefly aboue thing wicked without faulte godly rayse sedition preaching worde else rise vnknowen cause author saying ambrose muste haue placein fi booke epistle marcellina sister power rayse vp moue people god power mitigate appease beeing raysed thys paule commeth obiection heresie confesse sayth worshippe god maner way call heresie therefore heretyke schismatyke vtterly deny worship god father beleeue scripture c hee putteth away crime heresie diuerse thing v obserue first plainly confesseth faith wherof accused heathen iudge therfore meete separate confession fayth inough thee beleeue thyne heart conceyue thy minde certayne opinion thou must confesse thy fayth chryste men also chryste away worshipper ashamed himhow paule beleeued hath many time ben declared comprehendeth fayth foure article article conteyned fyrst saith worshippeth god father meaning dealt father whome worshipped speciall article fayth wee contented one god make vnto v newe straunge god true god old time traueled father promised sonne gaue saluation vnto men wherby appereth neither turkes iewes dayes true worshipper god bicause imagine god god without sonne secondly declareth fourme maner worshipping saith beleueth al thing written law prophet christ ende writing whome manyfeste moyses prophetes bare witnesse therefore paule woorshipped god throughe fayth chryste article oure faythe concernyng chryste comprehended none kinde seruice worship acceptable vnto god forasmuche god made one v onely whosoeuer honoreth sonne honoreth father also paules example teacheth v god must bee worshipped according scripture inuentions tradition man bicause euery taught thereby worshipped vayne see esai matth thirdly confesseth resurrection deade therefore expresseth name bycause heerein consisteth meane saluation hath taught fiftenth chapter firste corinthian acknowledgeth generall resurrection like number madbraynes draw resurrection godly onely godly must receiue rewarde godlynesse laste day must wicked iustice punished euer fourthly conducte guyding fayth sayth laboureth keepe good conscience towarde god man thing right fruite fayth fayth iustifieth men righteous iust worke righteousnesse iohn bee pollute conscience filthinesse sinne beleeue stedfastly shall bee resurrection dead hereby appeareth paules fayth hereby proueth ought taken heretike many therefore true fayth worship god father according scripture holde fast hope resurrection labour keepe cleane conscience toward god man true follower paule apostle yea true right christian howsoeuer vnhappie world rage storme agaynst let v therefore sticke fayth brother stedfaste hope resurrection come stoutly passe tribulation beeing sure shall one day haue eternall rewarde iesus chryst sauiour whome prayse honour power glory euer amen cliiij homelie bvt many yeres came brought almes people offering found purified temple neither multitude yet vnquietnesse howbeit certayne iewes asia ought present thee accuse ought agaynst else let say haue found euil stand counsel except one voyce cried standing among resurrection dead iudged day felix heard thing deferred knew well way sayde lysias captayne come downe know vttermost matter commaunded vnder captayne keepe paule let haue rest forbid none acquayntaunce minister vnto come vnto holy ghoste woulde haue accusation iewes made paul diligently written might learne thereby whereof worlde doth alwayes accuse faythfull minister chryst diligently dothe luke reporte apologie oration paule made owne defence wherby taught behaue selues like case first formoste answereth diligently boldly vnto crime sedition teaching v example minister christ aboue al thing must free cleare attempt touching faith accused heresie schisme plainly confesseth rendreth reason account therof fewe word yet perspicuous playne whereby gather confession fayth doth become minister chryst must declared reason therof may appeare vnto men led feare feeling god followeth crime polluting templehe putteth away crime polluting temple putting away wherof paule diligent albeit ignorant vse maiestie temple part abolished comming death christ must thinke paule beare iewes herein yet reuerenced temple supersticiously hath respect vnto right vse temple christian men n meanes want although maiestie god included kept within church neither worship god tied vnto yet outwarde religion requireth certayne place people may assemble togither heare worde preached sacramentes administred common reason telleth v place dedicated suche excellent v oughte bee kepte kinde pollution forasmuche read christ commaunded man carry vessel prophane thing temple like hath little deuotion religion wickedly contemneth misvseth place consecrated religion thing
