perhaps bee businesse made owne counsell free confession vttered touchyng resurrection deade face thus doo seeing shall bee enforced confesse resurrection selues excepte wyll altogither bee wycked confidence paule hys bolde speeche declareth manyfest argument hys innocencie worthy bee considered lyke becommeth chrystes minister haue persuade selues worlde hateth truthes sake onely thys shall make constante bolde agaynst daungers see peter first epistle third fourth chapter paule escapeth ha de enimies nowe remayneth ende businesse farre iewes looked felix deferreth matter vnto lysias capraynes comming ignorant thing concerning way say stubborne obstinate controuersies faith religion way warde vnruely condition iewes also grouded whole accusatio vpon testimonie lysias meane season hath consideration paule whose innocencie manifest perceiued comaundeth haue rest permitteth friend come minister vnto certayne acquaintance abode paule time captiuitie whose number appeareth luke whose example teacheth v must forsake daunger christes sake seeing taketh whatsoeuer pleasure done vnto done agayn magistrate lerne example felix beware me sake rash iudgement iudgement god whose minister must remeber therfore let folow equit e tempered long suffring mean season let intreat prisoner vncurteously seeing wicked malefactor haue pitie shewed humanitie manhoodes sake aboue thing let v marke truthe god towardes honour power agaynst enimies worke felix contrary nature wherof haue oftentimes intreated gentle curteous vnto paule easie matter vnto god mollifie cruell heart get people fauour enimies also seeing hath full power vpon creature euen ouer heart men let none v therefore feare men doo thing otherwyse becommeth v sake rather let v labour commende selues dooings vnto god able defende hys seruaunts middest enimies assuage moody mind atlength take v rom al trouble kingdome inheritaunce whereof hath prepared honour hys name iesus chryst whome prayse honour power glory euer amen clv homelie certayne dayes felix came wife drusilla iewesse called foorth paule heard hym fayth towarde chryste preached righteousnesse temperaunce iudgement come felix trembled answered go thy way tyme haue conuenient season sende thee hoped also money haue bene giuen paule might loose wherefore called oftener communed two yere festus portius came felix roume felix willing shew iewes pleasure left paule prison bounde wonderfull rare example god mercy power paule founde suche courtesie gentlenesse felix president whose wycked tyrannie euen prophane wryters haue lefte reported hystories farre notable luke reporteth heere thys place paule lyueth onely safetie also fyndeth occasion preach wherby truth saying paule appeareth though minister god sometimes prison bondes yet word bounde happened vnto paule falleth many martyr chryst also dayes led bound vnto stake fyre preache worde god boldly terrour wicked consolation godly let v consider poyntes place order felix drusilla heare paule first paules hearer described wee diligently marke wee may playnly gather occasion paule appoynted make sermon felix ben absent caesarea certayne dayes returned agayne wife drusilla thinke chiefe procurer sermon iewe daughter herode called agrippa stayne iames apostle smitten aungell suffered greeuous punishement vngodlynesse tyrannie firste shee betrouthed antiochus called epiphanes maried bycause would maried maners rite iewes maried aziazus king people called amazi whome felix president enticed hir caried hir away fayre promise conueyance certayne magitian cyprus declared wherfore became filthy adultresse also wickedly transgressed law god religion hir forfathers liuing man vncircumcised thing although vnworthely committed yet likely remayning hir feeling pure religion wherein bene brought vp hir tender yeres seemeth bee cause shee desirous heare paule preache whose doctrine euery body spake thing might easily obteyne felix hir husbande louing hir entirely heere way wee may see remayneth commonly make mariage wicked person boyde true religion although blinded eyther sting concupiscence bewitched glory richesse honour goe shake sense religion yet sting conscience returneth agayne desire fayth denied naughtely forsaken kindleth agayne commonly dothe little good bycause haue little regarde god owne saluation wherefore wee muste thinke without cause god moyses commaunded people abstayne mariage infidel bycause knew hereby like incurre present daunger saluation cause paule also willing confirme olde lawe2 corin forbiddeth v beare yoke vnbeleeuers also behoueth v marke goodnesse god suffered worde gospell whereby lyfe saluation offered vnto man bee preached vnto polluted suche filthy luste hee therefore truely god desireth haue men saued willeth death synner rather repente lyue heere vnto belong many example gospell wherein wee reade chryste certayne singular fauour familiaritie offered saluation vnto publican harlot serueth consolation bee troubled suggestion sathan whereby calleth certayntie saluation question also admonisheth v dutie wickedly despise grace god louingly offereth vnto v preaching gospel cause saluation beleue repent inexcusable god without repentance wickedly contemne offered whose number shall hereafter heare felix let v see paules sermon whiche luke reporteth worde word reciteth cheefe pointes wherof may easyly gatheredthe point paules sermon said three nuber first felix heareth entreate fayth christ furthermore christ alwayes constant selfe one yesterday day euerfaith christ alwayes one trade faith christ ought changed wherfore must thinke paule spake none thing time rom gala conteyned else sermon epistle summe men iustifyed saued freely without workes lawe faith onely christ laboured bring iewes vnto christ affiaunce workes lawe like entreated much morall virtue felix bycause little auayle vnto true iustice sight god acceptable vnto god bicause fayth onely christ bicause haue occasion euery speake thinges nowe tarry lesse vppon marke fayth christ must preached corner feare daunger must stoutly freelye confessed percyue worlde offended v therefore hearkened accompt confession faith among thing indifferent accuse apostle holy martirs christ madnesse whiche neuer feruent defendyng fayth sawe cruellye assaulted also anabaptistes confuted example paule apprehended magistrate scarce brought time giue accompt faith many time neither confirme owne opinion anye argumentes aunswere argumentes made agaynst howbeit peter commaundeth christian ready giue reason faith euery one asketh them1 pet paule litle ashamed either fayth doctrine disdayned preache band heathen tyranne filthie adultresse secondly paule reasoneth iustice temperanceiustice tempepance fruites faith vnder two vertues comprehended true fruit faith iustifieth iustice vnderstand place giueth vnto euery man therfore comprehendeth vnder hir vertues christe commendeth vertue commaundeth giue vnto god thinges belonging vnto vnto cesar thynges due vnto hereunto referred paule writeth place geue vnto men due rom tribute tribute belongeth custome custome due feare feare aperteyneth honour honour apperteyneth c temperaunce impediment stoppe vnlawfull desyres brideleth voluptuousnesse carried entisementes thereof sinne god iustice therfore whatsoeuer might sayde touching exercise vertues good woorkes paule comprehende vnder two kindes namely iustice temperance thing must necessitie subiect doctrine fayth bycause true fruites saide euen nowe whiche fayth knowen also bicause man shoulde abuse pretence fayth cloke carnall libertie many thinges euery sayde writinges apostle furthermore paules prudencie ioyned free speache considered reasoneth suche fruites true fayth cheefely wanting hearer haue declared felix many thinges like tyranne gouernaunce prouince regarde priuate aduantage publique iustice drusilla like filthie adultresse marryed vncircumcised person contrary lawe god therefore meete set thing eye might plainely vnderstand farre way saluation example teacheth v ought preache sorte many men would haue grace god faith iustifieth preached wickednesse world age wherby see men euery rushe kinde mischeefe requireth farre thing therefore thing must reproued least preach grace god vaine yet vnderstande neede haue thereof must regarde world would haue christ commaundeth would haue repentance first preached name forgiuenesse sinnes luke therefore neither godly wisely teaching grace god faith iustifieth vnrepentant world plant licentious kinde life causing men liue kinde securitie carelesnesse rather let bothe ioyned togither men conuicted wicked nesse may repent learne seeke forgiuenesse sinnes onely grace god faith iesus christ thirdly paule disputeth later iudgement namely confute errorthe later iudgement wherwith gentile deceiued made carelesse beleeued world euerlasting heereof sprang opinion epicure said god regarded thing done vpon earth wherefore needefull speake ende world christes last comming vnto iudgement least hee spoken iustice temperance might seeme foolishe purpose taught article faithe worthy marked whereby beleeue christ shall come iudge quicke deade coforteth weake offended proceding world beholde howe vngodly rustie prosperitie howe godly punished afflicted learne shall one day chaunge cause christe calleth comming day redemption againe affectuous way moue men duetie luke refraine sinne day seuere countenance iudge set eies cause heare christe often make mention thereof apostle moste parte take argumentes exhortation dehortation nowe remaineth v see effecte paules sermonthe effecte paul sermon touching felix altogither vaine deede feared mention thing hee thinketh neuer amendement sendeth paul though leisure heare longer vsage vngodly sometime curiositie sake heare woorde farre affected therewith feare tremble conscience yet token better disposition bicause apostle testifieth diuels vse doe iames assoone perceiue woorde god agreeth humoures desire disdaine longer heare achab hated micheas bicause hee neuer spake suche thing pleased furthermore felix bewrayeth hys reprobate minde againe argument looked haue money paules hande purposed lette goe withoute meede whome yet knewe right ought sette libertie therefore lawe sell cause whereof couetousnesse nation reprehende romaine thing insatiable lette magistrate learne filthie example beware taking bribe iudgement testimonie god vseth blinde heartes wise peruert wayes iuste exodus deuterono couetousnesse hathe beene destruction moste flourishing common weales hurte dothe euery nowe dayes daily example aboundantly declare felix yet maketh ende sinning perceiuing paule would neither burthen brother giue ill example slacke offering mony seeketh aduauntage innocent festus successor came must giue vp office leaueth paule prison ende hereby pleasure iewes many wayes greeuously offended may see state godly whose pacience wicked abuse pastime seeke occasion gratifie one pilate herode wickedly agreed togither vex molest christ father drusilla beheaded iames sweard hee sawe liked iewes went put peter also deathe sake wicked haue alwayes desire although vengeance god punisheth yet recopenseth slackenesse greeuous punishment lengthe shall partes paules example learne constant faith pacient continuall affliction length hauing ouercome al aduersities may triumphe iesus christ whome blessing honoure glorye power euer amen xxv chapiter vpon actes apostle clvj homelie festus receyued office three dayes ascended cesarea vnto ierusalem enfourmed hym hyghe priestes cheefe iewes paule besought desyred fauoure woulde sende hym ierusalem layde awayte waye kill festus aunswered paule kept cesarea hymselfe woulde shortly depart thether let therefore sayde among able come downe v accuse hym anye faulte man tar ied among tenne dayes went downe vnto cesarea next day sat iudgement seat commaunded paule brought vvhiche come iewes come ierusalem stoode laide many greeuous complaint paule coulde proue long aunswered elfe neither law iewes yet cesar offended thing xxv chapter next folowyng described two greeuous enditemets arrainments wherof one paule susteyned festus new president pleated cause king ag ippa bernice queene firste notable bycause vnder colour therof iewes like haue broght paule great ieopardie yet thorowe helpe god escaped promysed woulde succour safegarde must beare witnesse christ rome also emperour declared chapter cheefe ende thinges teache v howe god hath care people uffring tempted many wayes yet deliuering teptations long folow theyr vocation put hope trust wherefore thing must cheefely serue confirme faitha newe attempt iew paul thing maye doo great vtilitie consider euery thing order first declared newe enterprise iewes attempted oppresse paule festus gon ierusalem take othe allegeance citizen inhabitant priest men aucthoritie came vnto accuse paule whome felix left prison desiring newe president fauoure mighte brought ierusalem iudged might procede according law countrey meane season purposed priuily waite way kill place may sene vnquiet minde wicked lamed hatred truthe alwayes naughtie workes disclosed light thereof easily lay away hatred conceiued rather boile frothe mindes like raging sea busily watching euery small occasion wherby extinguish light truth hate co monly force hatred suche without regarde many time priuate auailes seke desire make minister truth way whose doctrin perceiue vexeth fretteth thing may seene present example haue heard howe paule prison whole two yeares howbeit neither continuance time neither miserable state captiuitie could assuage mindes could bear thing better doctrine truth wherfore narowly watch euery little occasion spare neither pain cost bring desire length passe first therfore begin make request petition vnto newe president paule oughte haue made rather behalfe common weale haue besought frendship towards general thought meane preiudice paule president might conceiue publike enimie whole nation coutry considering labored earnestly haue punished must think hatred truthe great force men onely common guise vngodly might haue wish neuer much yet nothing deare vnto haue liues know wil withstad impietie naughtinesse heereunto belongeth euangelists wryte herodias heard herode offered hir daughter one halfe kingdom yet required heade iohn giuen hir bicause long liued preached thought hir raigne shuld vnpleasant hir life also many thing like sort might reported example euen dayes bicause euery sene therfore think good passe ouer let v rather marke vse thing trust ouer sone haue conspired truthe although sometimes trimly dissemble colour hatred truth yet poison therof lieth hidde depe brest assone occasion serueth wil burst forth might main person hath saying prophet chefely place pronouncing hart man froward vnsearchable iere appeareth weapon vngodly first counterfet countenace law equity require haue brought ierusalem iudged might seeme honest iust request bicause businesse began first also seemed reason many number aucthoritie shuld great charge take pain iourney farre one mannes sake meane season vnder faire face equitie cloke horrible bloudy meaning euen nowe declared lette v learne place iudge men adayes doe like wherof man may euery finde profitable christian common weale luke iohn uerily christe saith men fight power darkenesse therefore minister deuil lier murtherer beginning paule prophecied antichrist raigne cheefely lying open force therfore many resist truth minister therof violent trecherous sleight euident fight deuil vnder standerd antichrist except repent time shal hereafter receiue pay wage eternall damnation moreouer let v see god disapointed bloudy deuises ennemiesgod scattereth counsel ennemies woorking festus consented desire petition iewes whose request yet shal appeare hereafter made small account surely great cause might haue moued yeld vnto iewes might iustly haue suspected paule whome felix going office left prison seemed request cheefe iewes made reiected againe might appeare slenderly witted beginning gouernement would procure hatred whole nation one mannes sake prisonner reputation secrete inspiration god commeth passe festus regarde iustice romaine lawes iewes nation wherefore thinketh good keepe paule caesarea still yet permitting iewes according order lawe proceede pleased god teache office aucthoritie example gentile haue doe like case verily commit nothing either fauoure men respect priuate commoditie folowe equitie lawe kept impossible common weales continue safetie therefore lette christian king prince ashamed lightnesse vnrighteousnesse dayes commonly condemne maintainer euangelical truth faith without hearing pope bishop pleasure yea bicause would seeme religious giue power faithful christ comitting sheepe vnto wolues shal one day feele great smart doe bothe bloudie pope shall punished christ iudge shall require handes king people committed vnto charge heere haue cheefely consider god aucthoure thing whose woorking wee euen nowe saide hee said paule beare witnesse christe rome also emperoure hee woulde also perfourme promisses whose counselles seeing subtilitie manne able preuente easie disappointe enterprise iewes hathe power ouer heart menne also hee nowe planteth suche festus hee prouideth rather paules commoditie iewes afterward would haue gratified iewes stoppeth meane dooing heere may take singular consolation considering see wicked men daunce worldes pipe subiect vnto commaundement god hath full power aucthoritie vpon body mind therfore afraid councels deuises feare power put trust rather god able putte heart new willes else mightily binde handes lette v returne vnto iewes iewes accuse paul according presidentes commaundement goe againe vnto caesarea make greeuous complaint accusation paule description whereof luke shorter part thing bene many time obiected vnto heere haue consider iewes complainant first stande round paule brought place iudgement thing contrary common order iudgements euen dismaye outwarde shewe aucthoritie moue festus done bring againe olde pointes former accusation may appeare paules answere seemeth cheefely vrged crime sedition though therby committed treason caesar although lay many thing charge yet able proue nothing paule pleading cause appeared manifestly men offended nothing either law god either temple seruice either caesar argument brought bothe side man may easily gather accusation aforesaide heere may see impudencie boldnesse ennimies truthe could impudently haue done againe lay paules charge without profe testimonie thing whervnto paule oftentimes answered yet wanted argumentes witness compasse paule boldly aucthoritie ought haue preuailed matter life death guise wicked satisfied kinde answeres alwayes recourse olde slaunders finde true dayes aduersaries conuinced many argument yea many yeares experience yet impudently lay charge crime seduction seditio blasphemie infinite suche like ashamed lie men ashamed speake god paules answere worthy obserued denieth hathe wayes offended caesar yet preached christe god procured people vnder romaine empire take vnto new faith thing tertullian declareth vnlawfull man romaine lawes paule therfore say offended caesar heere must know brother religion subiect neither caesar yet magistrate pleasure may decree therin belogeth vnto god according word appointment must ordered christ commaundeth giue vnto caesar thing belongeth vnto wil haue reserued god also due vnto wherfore offendeth magistrate without purpose raising tumult defendeth true honor god although magistrate forbiddeth magistrate passe bound wil encroche vpon god kingdome hearde rather peter rule muste take place teacheth v god must obeyed rather men heere hast thou answere crye seditiously bring vp many thing contrary proclamation emperours say matter religion must simplie obey prince whose saying may preuaile also prophet christ apostle shal condemned euident preached word god beat downe superstition planted true faith contrary commaundements magistrate ruler cause therfore regard slaunders let v rather cleare conscience holde true faithe pure minde serue sauioure iesus christ praise honoure power glory euer amen clvij homelie festus willing iewes pleasure answered paule saide wilt thou goe vp hierusalem iudged thing saide paule stande caesar iudgement seat ought iudged iewes haue harme done thou wel knowest haue hurt committed thing worthy deathe refuse die none thing wherof accuse man may deliuer appeale vnto caesar spake festus deliberation thou hast appealed vnto caesar vnto caesar shalt thou goe paule apostle speaking affliction vnto corinthian saithe made gasing stocke vnto world vnto angel vnto men may cheefely perceiued thing chaunced vnto last captiuitie imprisonment bene foure time presented iudgement pleade life first people ierusalem vpon staires going vp castle secondly cousel priest thirdly felix president foloweth newe arainment festus new president euery one notable reason great da gers fel haue seene place danger yet escaped help god thing teach v power god suffereth wicked haue vpon elect yet deliuereth mightie hand tribulation bicause faith wherefore must offended haue like happen vnto v also chefe vse place taught paule escaped new daunger president himselfe author bicause man thinke hee heeretofore deliuered rather benefite men power presidentes fauor god let v therfore consider eche thing order first haue consider festus iniquitie vnrighteousnes festus perceiuing iewes alleaged matter meere slaunders paule innocent yet notwithstanding minded gratifie plesure requested whereby may easily coniectured eyther brybed else fayre promised seeing minde altered vppon sodayne whether intelligence awayte layde paule euident dyd vniustly yet cloketh vniust dealing maruellous craftily least seeme graunt iewes thing requisite iuste demaundeth paule whether wyll goe vp ierusalem promyseth wyll heare matter meaning onely get good iewes heereby auoyde maner hatred enuy thys example wee taught howe easily corrupted wante knowledge feare god nature wee prone vnto euill euery little occasion setteth v cogge vnlesse wee pulled backe feare god bridle hereof festus singular example thus sodaynly beguyleth men notable hope conceyued therefore wee muste put truste suche men although sometime shewe notable signification likelyhoode vertue yet long fall agayne olde nature see festus scripture report pharao saul achab diuerse wicked person place moreouer teacheth v plague iudgement respect person goe winne fauour men heereby felix obscureth hys former prayse moste iuste iudge seemed little becommeth cruell murtherer going gratifie minde deuised death innocent man haue lyke example history nation therfore without cause god law man forbiddeth iudges haue respect person surely meete conuenient god steede resemble god property condition rom ephe actes c scripture one consent beare witnesse haue respect person dothe paule paule apealeth vnto caesar seemeth scarse able escape daunger perceiueth whervnto matter tendeth euen reuelation spirite chryste promised aduocate seruauntes therfore speaketh freely strong reason refelleth vniuste request festus fyrste stande sayth caesar iudgement seat e ought iudged hereby declareth iniurie redounde vnto caesar taken iudgement seate deliuered iewes iudged ought gouernors countreys inferiour officer imitate knowing faultes commit contrary equitie lawe redoundeth vpon haue put office therefore worthy hand greeuously punished hereof among auncient romanes proceeded seueritie censure wherwith thought good brydle keepe vnder licenciousnesse magistrate notable example wherof por ius cato shewed vpon l flaminius put nuber senator bicause beheaded certaine condemned person within circuit appoynting time execute plesure harlot loued graue wise men would haue maiestie empire blemished stained concupiscence light person nowe dayes bicause preacher winke euery thing tiranny reigneth euery place authoritie magistrate decayeth euery hereof shall speake another tyme let v go paules answere sayth seconde place iewes haue done harme whervpon gathereth reason iudged according lawes priuileges touching innocencie calleth president selfe witnesse might easily perceiue apologie defence thirdly reasoneth strong argument called dilemma haue deserued death refuse dye man hath power deliuer beeing innocent pleasure myne enimies alleaged reason appealed vnto caesar bycause hope festus also bycause knew warning oracle god appoyntment beare witnesse chryste caesar also example firste taught godly compelled rule christian pacience yeelde themselues rashly pleasure vngodly yea rather lawfull auoyde manyfest daungers may doo safe conscience obedience owe vnto chryst thus would haue scourged put order lawe throughe counsell captayne defeated murtherers conspired agaynst therefore errour foolish abusing word peter biddeth v ready yelde reason faith euery one demaundeth thinke minister worde ought brought popish councels render reason fayth reason admitted playne tirannie reigneth whose opinion allowed must wee say paule dyd vniustly chose rather declare fayth rome ierusalem therein godly wisely following oracle god auncient doctours athanasius ambrose rightly followed wherof one would iudged onely milane taught preached could neuer persuaded commit cause vnto suspected councels thought safetie prayse flee tarry among knew long conspired agaynst truthe moreouer also obserued paule shunneth daunger yet hath diligent consideration innocencie let godly like specially minister gospel least incosiderately prouide life bring good name hazarde occasion cause gospell euill spoken thirdly proueth new example hath ben oftentimes declared namely lawful christian men wage lawe flee prerogatiue prince necessitie requireth paule set priuiledge rome agaynst open force vseth nowe benefite appeale seldome done without reproche iudge much party plaintife therefore certayne braynsicke person abuse word chryst paule written mathew first epistle corinthian sixt chapter righte vse iudgementes forbidden desire priuate vnlawefull reuenge insatiable luste contention gapeth men good disturbeth kinde charitie bridled restrayned finally paules wordes conteyne generall doctrine chiefly appertayning vnto magistrate namely lawful none commit innocent pleasure others purchase man fauour death bloud whosoeuer beare office authoritie minister god defende innocent punishe naughtie wicked person therfore whosoeuer doo otherwise minister diuell felowes pylate herode whereof one deliuered chryst iewes crucified whoores sake beheaded iohn baptist president admitteth appeale although vnwillingly let v returne vnto festus beeing moued paules sodayne appeale seeing selfe disappoynted hope debating matter sate benche aunswereth length angry moode hast thou appealed vnto caesar say art thou bolde take caesar thy iudge rather well thou shalt go vnto caesar trimly expresseth vsage wicked although well know wicked e yet take euill parte man touche neuer little therwith make exception agaynst decree yet much better many prince dayes suffer faythfull chryst enioy benefite law publike equitie verily seueritie romanes vsed administring lawes notable seeing festus appeale person estimation made thought lawfull meddle matter force wherof dyd long preserue common weale battered ore shaken many vyces meete president dayes shoulde bee kepte vnder lyke seueritie wee erewhyle declared thing higher magistrate would obserue bothe hated lesse selues innocencie euery mayntayned chiefly let v obserue power truthe god wherby defendeth seruaunts assaultes enimies let v truste hereof embrace truthe heart hauing taken holde hir keepe hir faste suffer selues threates pulled sauiour iesus chryst prayse honour power glory euer amen clviij homelie certaine day king agrippa bernice came vnto caesarea salute festus bene good season festus rehearsed paules cause vnto king saying certayne man left prison felix whome came ierusalem high priestes elder iewes enfourmed desired haue iudgement agaynst whome aunswered maner romanes fauour delyuer man shoulde peryshe hee whiche accused haue accuser hym haue lycence answere selfe concerning cryme laide agaynst therfore come hither without delay morrow sate giue iudgement commaunded man brought foorth accuser stoode vp brought none accusation suche thing supposed certayne question owne superstition one iesus dead paule affirmed alyue bycause doubted suche maner question asked whether would go ierusalem iudged matter paule appealed kept vnto knowledge caesar commaunded kept till might sende caesar agrippa sayd vnto festus would also heare man selfe morrow sayd thou shalt heare god vseth exercise people worlde diuerse sundry tribulation according wisedome goodnesse maketh serue glory name saluation notable example whereof heere set foorth storie paule apprehension ierusalem euery day ministred vnto fresh occasion preaching firste permitted speake vnto people standing vppon stayres gooing vp castle wherof neuer lyke oportunitie protested fayth counsell priestes elder otherwise woulde neuer voutsafe haue heard thirdly made long oration touching vocation office felix president vsed many time sende talke length gaue account fayth doctrine festus wee hearde late hee declared opened cause euery romane president barbarous souldiours might easily vnderstande innocencie thing surely much making setting foorth gospell vndoubtedly suche seedes fayth sowen mind gret many long brought foorth rare singular increase bicause worde god esai testifieth vseth neuer preached vayne moreouer thing follow must referred euen sayde whereby shall declared occasion preaching paule giuen king agrippa bernice nobilitie countrey bycause thing seldome seene prince heare preacher bandes therefore luke thought good passe ouer none thing chaunced agrippa bernice firste sheweth occasion matter comming king agrippa bernice vnto caesarea welcome festus beeing lately come rome maruell king shewed selfe officious vnto president euident obteyned kingdome emperour fauour helde muste force acknowledge romanes lordes superiours agrippa sonne herodes agrippa whose tyrannie horrible death hath bene spoken chapter bernice sister iosephus sayth people suspected haue vnlawfull company hir brother wherfore auoyde suspition maried polemon king people called lysij yet long diuorsed returned hir brother agayne trusting amitie power romanes made account people talke singular example god goodnesse dothe voutsafe haue saluatio purchased christ preached paul vnto two person borne wicked stocke polluted incest great grandfather herodes great laide wayte christ new borne caused babe bethlehem cruelly murthered herodes antipas brother graundfather aristobulus thinke alexander selfe also defamed incest comaunded iohn baptist beheaded scoffed christ sent bound vnto father agrippa spake late killed iames cast peter apostle prison meaning haue put death also deliuered helpe aungel agrippa bernice borne say progenitours heare paule preach gospel saluation wherby easily appereth god wayward desirous reuege punish child wickednesse father grace stretched al men wil truely repent turne vnto see sayth hereof himselfe eyghtenth chapter ezechiel wherevnto also referred howe chryst peculiarly sent vnto men whose predecessor beeing many way vnkind towards god slew prophet sent vnto see dayes grace god merite chryste moste curteously offered meany haue horribly sinned therefore sathan hath taught doubt god fauour mercy though sinnes greater tha let lerne comfort hereby also let thing serue instruct v condemne man rashly bycause auncestrie seeing generation chryste numbred diuerse diffamed person man neede doubt chryste chiefly belongeth vnto sinner returne purpose let v see occasion agrippa desirous see heare paule festus communication agrippa touching paule sayde certayne dayes comming likelyhoode spent pastime banquetting prince noble men haue little care captiues prisoner thought festus comuned agrippa paule supposing holpen counsell difficulte intricate matter therefore beginneth wise declare whole matter subtilly craftely slyly dissebleth would haue gratified iewes shall see wee come place declaration consisteth three part wherof orderly intreate first part declareth paule iewes requested answere made sayth paule captiue lefte prison felix thing allegeth cause agrippa thinke caused layde holde iewes sayth made request vnto elder priestes giue sentence death agaynst thing would graunt alleaged vnto maner romanes giue sentece death agaynst man men pleasure first vse kinde search lawful enquirie accuser shal make informaiton openly accused shal haue time place make purgation defence uerily custome festus allegeth notable wherby al magistrate taught must nothing man sake contrary law iustice although humanitie gentlenesse thing much commendable yet becommeth iudges alwayes haue speciall consideration iustice thing lawes god al nation expressely commaunde surely salomon sayth god hateth much spareth wicked person slayeth innocent pro vntowardnesse day muche bewayled festus sayth vse romanes hath scarse place among christian see oftentimes come passe faithful people christe pope pleasure cruelly made way without hearing cause many magistrate therfore wil truly discharge office must see iudgement procede lawfully ought aboue al thing requisite iudgement accuser present place slaunders backbiting many time bring innocent much daunger done let defendantes also haue place make lawful purgation let iudges thinke haue two eares giuen one heare plaintife defendant specially let rule haue place right lawe transgressed man pleasure iudges priuate person must know bound indifferently al men alike furthermore equitie romane lawes deserueth praised impudencie iewish priestes vtterly detested durste requeste thing heathen man vnderstoode neither right lawfull would seeme holy pillers god churche thus dyd mighte gentile iustely suspecte religion woulde god wee sawe lyke impudencie monkes byshoppes day vse make moste wicked decree prince courtes abuse clemencie king establish tyrannie agaynst seruaunts chryst seconde parte declared howe festus handeled thys matter soone sayth came hyther festus testifieth paule innocent gaue audience strayghte way perceyued hee innocente layde none thing hys charge looked brought forth certayne question belonging owne superstition handled certayne cause one iesus paule sayde risen agayne death sorte speaketh prophane man moste contemptuously sincere religion paule yet handled bothe diligently large may gathered festus owne saying haue example contemne deride mystery word god specially resurrection instructing whome although little preuayle man muste offended considering festus little regarde thing paule moste grauely declared yet iudges haue thing obserue heathen person namely heare cause without delay considering vniust dilatories day day many men circumuented bicause able charge vnable prosecute follow right principally let v obserue paules innocencie confirmed many testimony first lysias capten witnesse therof felix festus within litle shal haue agrippa make one although wicked priest go accusatio yet confirme paules innocencie able proue none thing lay charge lyke case apostle haue oftentimes seene euangelistes declare pylate herode beare witnesse christes innocencie thys maketh commendation dignitie christian faith doctrine dayes slaundreth openly bewray selues worse gentile appereth also place miserable state iewes time seeing despiser religion greatest authoritie among constrayned pleade matter religion may thanke wicked priest wicked ingratitude denied christ king sauiour pylate like state great many nowe day vnder tyrannie turkes whose exaple except repent time feared dayes disdayne heare worde god refuse iudgement holy ghost touching fayth religion w one day suffer like finally declareth kept beeing innocent prison namely bicause appealed vnto caesar craftily dissembleth wickednesse yet otherwise bewraying confesseth playnly draue innocent exigent must needes appeale vnto caesar purposed gratifie ye iewes paules hinderaunce preiudice would neuer haue appealed vnto caesar common trick among great men magistrate craftily cloke fault make men beleeue greatly fauour iustice transgresse bound limit furthermore occasion came passe agrippa desirous heare see paule thing occasion notable sermon luke setteth forth chapter folowing thus may see prouidence god thing aduaunce kingdome least thought therfore trouble vexe selues owne deuises rather euery one cast care vpon god duety come passe euery haue occasion serue god al danger distress haue iesus christ protectour defender prayse honour power glorie euer amen clix homelie morrow agrippa come bernice great pompe entered councell house captaynes chiefe men citie festus commaundement paule brought foorth festus sayde king agrippa yee men present v ye see man multitude iewes haue intreated hierusalem also heere cry ought lyue longer yet founde nothing worthy death committed neuerthelesse seeing hath appealed caesar haue determined sende whome haue certayne thing write vnto lorde wherfore haue brought vnto specially vnto thee king agrippa examination hadde might haue somewhat wryte mee thinketh vnreasonable sende prysoner shewe cause layd agaynst although god haue giuen vnto man nothing excellente commodious worde gospell wherein offereth v incomparable treasure hys grace right way vnto saluation yet vntowardnesse miserable worlde hateth enuieth nothing muche word thing cause minister therof many time greeuously molested afflicted become certayne gasing stockes vnto world bicause vpon endes world come offended thing forasmuch euident world exercise great crueltie vnder antichrist captayne god therfore would haue v instructed partly prophesies partly example wherby might learne new strange thing hapneth vnto v minister word haue al age bene vsed world yet worde could neuer extinguished attempt enimies endureth euer al time bringeth foorth condigne fruites scripture euery declare many example haue hereof among one notable luke setteth foorth paule apostle although liued bondes constrayned appeale vnto caesar reason iniquitie enimies vnrighteousnesse president yet king agrippa captaynes chiefe men caesarea whole nobilitie coutrey handleth christes cause proueth innocencie hearing al leaueth mind certaine euident prick sting worde god shall good consider euery thing order declared euangelist beginneth narration paules hearer among first numbred agrippa bernice sister paules hearer sayth came auditorie kinde princely pompe ostentation come captaines souldiours lo d court many authoritie citie festus thoght good haue present ende howsoeuer matter fel might easilier auoyde enuy iewes aboue al thing haue consider agrippa sayd desirous heare paul desire proceeded certayne vayne curiositie minde loue vnto truthe saluation muche resembleth herodes antipas brother graundfather also desirous see chryst none cause saue heard miracle praysed many profe wherof giueth v cometh paules sermo like disciple lerner laieth aside none princely pompe bringeth courtlinesse shew preching place exaple learne affection world beareth word god surely either hateth least contemneth euen nature would haue workes reproued light therof vseth preferre earthly thing heauenly yet meane season cometh passe many time come heare thoughe led desire saluation yet affection fleshe say curiositie hope gaine hatred popishe doctrine bicause would thought vngodly ennimies vnto religion bicause suche come learner iudges comptroller bring opinion haue conceiued cannot gospel doth thing profite ende whereof paule saith captiuate wisedome flesh bring obedience faith therfore must bring v humble lowly mindes desirous learne wee receiue profite thereby see luke againe taught example iudge come sermon church pompous attire araye like vnto agrippa bernice giue litle offence first great token lightnesse remember howe mire clay beginning apparell proceeded first sinne meete v humble selues shew pride therin another occasion offence aucthors folishly imitate v else conceiue wanton imagination else minister occasion porer sort impacient murmure againste god therefore incurre horrible sentence god pronounceth terrible woe suche giue occasion offence furthermore token certaine beastly dulnesse minde vntowarde shewe pride sight god ought shewe moste lowlinesse would say wittes come prince aske pardon trespasse proud apparell sturdie lofty countenance yet come vnto church aske forgiuenesse sinnes heare woorde saluation insolent proude manner uerily christ forbiddeth v carefull nedefull apparell face therefore make garment suche sundry sortes deuises set pride see esay saith third chapiter large touching offence let v consider paule paule broughte forthe chaines preache festus commaundement brought forthe bounde chaines appeareth owne saying yet guiltie person iudges teacher preacher heere sight shew appeareth wonderfull counsel god assembly honorable personage glittering golde purple scarlate abide comming paule looking like prisoner pale wanne dragging chaine hande yea god offereth vnto thus bandes singular occasion behaue himselfe boldly quarell name whereby appeareth howe wicked nothing preuaile enterprise deuises thing went iewes hitherto take paule occasion preaching extinguishe doctrine little preuaile heereby rather meane brought great honorable assembly whome otherwise shuld neuer haue opportunitie haue preached let thing serue comfort v among terror world henceforth feare world seeing god great power dayes defend people promote word chefely haue place cosider paul sequele declareth bolde couragious minde dismaide sight king nobilitie declareth matter stoutly though band yet put auditor litle feare greatly moued king minde like thing saw hapned felix thing teach v god word bound although minister prison bandes aucthoritie effect therof dependeth vpon man spirit god bloweth wher wil subiect vaine pleasure man taught also haue like case let v boldly defend christes cause passe strawe aucthoritie tiranny world cause haue hand iust good vpon dependeth saluation cause god easily defend hadle spirit god worketh speaketh v according promisse christ therfore wil withstand spirit god thinke preuaile comforted holpen therby wil let selfe ouercome cowardly feare festus causeth paule diligetly heardlast festus setteth paule agrippa residue hearer repeateth word cause end present accusation saith iewes required haue put death yet iudgement committed nothing worthy death howbeit bicause appealed vnto caesar desired wold diligently heare weigh euery thing might haue mater certaintie wryte caesar sort romane president causeth paule diligently heard thing without prouidence god meane season haue new testimony paules innocency behoued many time thus defended bicause god forsaw age doctrine shuld haue greuous enimies apeareth also incurable malice iewes ceased require innocet put death thus folow forfathers hard heeles read like impudecy required death christ sonne god pilate much therfore vtterly ouerthrowne iust iudgement god made common exaple vnto al men christ many time prophesied shuld happen vnto moreouer haue consider festu saying thinketh point absurditie send prisoner declare wherof accused wherfore put prison thing teache v must deale prisoner may haue ful perfit certificate thing must deale rashly matter life death seing hethen man vnderstode thus much shall become magistrate professe name word christ moderation minde becommeth v entreat al captiues seing know whatsoeuer benefite harm vnto christ wold god aduersaries dais wold vse equitie towards seruantes christ thinke sport vse kinde vncurtesie towards v without cause howbeit let thing nothing offend v seing know christ also vncurteously delt disciple schollers thinke bee better case maister let v rather reioyce suffer kinde affliction truth sake high way vnto heauen inheritance eternall life remaines v head iesus christ blessing honor power glory euer amen xxvj chapiter vpon actes apostle clx homelie agrippa said vnto paule thou art permitted speake thy selfe paule stretched forth hand answered selfe thinke selfe happy king agrippa bicause shall answere day thee thing whereof accused iewes namely bicause thou art expert customes question among iewes wherefore beseeche thee heare paciently liuing liued childe first among mine owne nation ierusalem knowe iewes knew beginning would testifie straightest secte religion liued pharisey lord sauioure iesus christe talking wyth ananias touchyng paule ministerie saithe among thing chosen vessell vnto carrie name nation king child israell word greatly commend ministerie paule oughte stirre v vppe diligently consider thing either suffered ministerie bicause euident nothing therein chaunced vnto without singular prouidence god cheefely considered present action king agrippa noble courte cheefe ruler countrey defendeth faithe doctrine dexteritie constancie moued auditor greatly example taught v force efficacie worde god faith thing shall euidently appeare consider eche thing order paule hathe licence speake himselfefirst agrippa sette forth speaketh vnto paule giueth leaue answere selfe without doubt done throughe aduise god meane would haue gospell preached vnto men paule saith otherwheres god haue men saued also haue worde saluation reuealed preached vnto men ordinaunce firme stable neuer stopped enterprise tyras world whereof wee haue bothe testimony example euery scripture may confirm wauering faith al aduersities bicause haue spoken heereof oftentimes let v obserue example equitie iustice holy ghost setteth forthe agrippa though otherwise arrogante naughtie man heard iewes required haue paule put death saw nothing wherby get commoditie honoure yet nothing moued iudgement whole nation thinketh meete haue consideration himselfe publike iustice appoynteth heare paule himselfe first offereth occasion leaue speake let men beare office folowe example see conspire man diligently let weighe examine matter least bearing slouthfulnesse set forward mennes maliciousnesse thing nowe dayes common pitie king prince eares open faithfull christ bicause thinke meeter hearken vnto bishop adherentes corrupt preiudice thinke altogither faultlesse whome spiritualtie zelously earnestly withstande paul declareth cause without fearebut returne vnto paule althoughe hee compelled vppon sodaine pleate cause bandes honorable audience yet putteth hand silence beginneth sermon containeth thing belonging mater sheweth maner token dismaide troubled minde may see bothe truthe also effect christes promisses paule bothe promisses general also peculiar wherof made metion beginning namely preache name christ king prince wherfore hauing eie therunto setteth danger naught bicause knewe christes power greater could ouercome hindred attemptes worldthe argument paules oration behoueth v also take comfort example bicause christ hath promised spirite vnto godly gouerne heart mouthes shall compelled giue accompt faith furthermore touching paules oration consisteth wholely narration full argument trimly framed defence himselfe declareth trade life led child neuer gaue suspition lightnesse impietie againe howe called faith christ apostle neither taughte thing contrary scripture wherby proueth iewes hated deadly without desert narration hee vseth shorte pretie kinde beginning wherby goeth get king fauor good saying happie must plea cause ignorant ceremony question iewes paule knewe vaine dispute graue waightie matter altogither ignorant vnskilfull wherfore mete haue iudges ledde desire iustice wisedome ioyned vnderstanding moste necessary meete shoulde skilful politike matter also learned matter pertaining faith religion care study wherof scripture euery wher commendeth vnto magistrate ordained god hath giuen power aucthoritie taught law nature carefull againe maintenance god honoure glory wherfore god appointed booke law king co tinually read booke stirreth vp magistrate therevnto example moste godly king whome agrippa heere wisely folowed vnderstode religion throughly dayes growne suche doltishnesse king thinke worthy praised religion vnderstand least thereof say belongeth nothing vnto may thanke tiranny bishop perceyued greatest power consisted ignorance prince moreouer beginneth narration paul childhode education whose argument haue nowe declared childehoode life ledde calling iewes witnesse howe godlily holily spent place wryteth bishoppe bee commended euen straungers also therfore goeth proue innocencie testimonie ennimies bicause thought led life corner saithe broughte vp ierusalem seate religion moste famous vniuersitie iewrie saide beginning led life moste commendable euen secte phariseys secte worthy preferred bicause phariseis scripture reuerence excelled sectes honestie life greatest erroure maintained righteousnesse merite owne woorkes howbeit paules scope ende persuade agrippa done nothing rashly wicked lighte wauering minde seeing vsed childehoode moste straightest kinde religion without cause declareth led childhode godlilyof importance godly bringing vp child thereby teacheth howe muche auaileth haue publike person well brought vp childehoode althoughe ought reiected conuert olde age yet muche preferred whose life afore time hathe beene spotted stained suche goe boldly wonted vertues able aucthoritie withstande enterprise wicked whereas sorte returne againe frequented vice danger vpbraidings reproches wicked little little lose aucthoritie beside counsell although honest godly yet commonly good suspected feare led either lightnesse minde else le de affection therefore minde place child eyther office churche common weale must haue diligent regarde education bringing vp heere two poyntes necessary paule telleth selfe one youthe muste bee brought vp suche place religion cheefely flourisheth learning experience may ioyne also taste fauoure religion euen beginning must chuse suche kinde life hathe least occasion vice youthe euen nature prone vnto sinne occasion euill muste shunned auoided rather sought woulde god men oure dayes cause child many time broughte vp among suche knowe farthest true knowledge christ wold obserue thing led care religion gaine altogither therefore oute suche schooles commeth kinde men measureth religion according frendship commoditie bursting ouer barres godlinesse fall headlong kinde mischeefe onely destruction themselues also churche common weale thing example olde new teach v whereby ought prouoked cause child wee meane set goddes seruice instructed brought vp youth may profitable bothe selfe church common weale lengthe receiue inheritaunce kingdome heauen iesus christ lord whome praise honor power glory euer amen clxj homelie nowe againe dead pavle apostle giuing accoumpt faith doctrine laboureth cheefely proue nothing rashe minde vngodly intent purpose ende also made mention childehoode prouing brought vp ordered life ought iustly suspected either temeritie vngodlinesse aboute religion example wee taughte among thing wee must trade traine vp oure selues religion may able render reason euery man sorte wee haue liued therein euen oure childehoode god tutoure defendoure age behoueth manner age consecrated vnto reade requireth oftentimes haue child brought vp infancie lawe seruice place reproueth shamefull error say religion waightie intricate mater lay men meddle wheras notwithstanding god willeth euen tender age exercise selfe therin wheras nothing pertaineth indifferently men religion scripture teacheth created euen beginning bicause haue entreated hereof place lette v nowe goe paules oration somewhat breaking narration begun little beforethe state whole cotrouersie declareth state whole controuersie betweene aduersaries iewes saith accused hope promisse god sometimes made vnto father vnto twelue tribe say whole nation iewes hope continuall seruing god lengthe come content thus haue said repeteth said saying hope sake king agrippa accused word seme haue shewe indignation wherby would expresse indignitie heynousnesse matter say perceiueth great vnrighteousnesse mine aduersaries seeing charge death accuse schisme wheras doctrine faith dependeth vpon ancient promisse god wherein father time past put trust wherof many israelite worship true god desire partaker hauing none end holinesse religion howbeit hope promisse whereof speaketh iesus christe sonne god whome god hath promised life saluation beginning world vnto father falne destruction sinne adam shortly shall declared large plainely nicketh bothe ignorance religion also preposterous affiace glorying couenant promisses god wold taken togither people yet cast aside christ throughe whose merite intercession promisses ratified whereof wee haue vtilitie vnlesse maintainer defender couenaunt bicause well diuine power christ also office whereunto father appoynted appeareth euidently resurrection deade paule wheres declareth omitteth nowe article taketh entreate thereof thing cheefely appertaining present controuersie appeared iesus christ rose againe deade aucthor life saluation also error saduces vtterly denied resurrection confuted like secte time muche preuaile many men diuers paules hearer infected onlesse graunte paule may seeme importunate asketh angrye wise seeme incredible saide god raise deade againe vndoubtedly paule intreated thing large confirmed testimony scripture luke doth touch certaine breefe note euery thing giue v occasion meditate thereof surely place breuitie thereof maketh obscurethe sum order preset place moste plaine man woulde draw therof proposition argument paule euident large handled wherof shal first controuersie touching hope promisse made god vnto father whole meane saluation seconde teache hope consisteth iesus christe onely constantly denie third proue resurrectio declared sonne god aucthor life meane life saluation consisteth christe fourth neither ought resurrection christ seeme incredible man much moste easie thing vnto god end world raise dead againe scripture declare shall doe seemeth order paules oration summe al thing hitherto haue ben spoken consider certaine common place falling matter faithe father ancient thingand first taught faith hope sainctes whole church god hath bene al age uerily euen hath depended vpon christ sonne god became thou persecutest apostle paule declared yesterday state whole controuersie betweene iewes teaching v contention trifle whole meane saluatio also proued neither beleeued taught thing god promised father time passed wherin onely hope church israel al age consisted learne fayth chryst onely moste aunciente meane thorough father tymes passed saued furthermore bycause paule beginning narration sayde pharisie returneth handsomely intermitted narration agayne declareth hystorie conuersion onely scope ende whereof put away accusation leuitie declaring called god yea inforced agaynst paul became christian agaynst hys willbut ende narration might haue weight authoritie declareth first affected towards christian fayth suche diligent orte omitteth none thing enterprised agaynst chryst first promiseth cause saying sometime minde mine aduersaries vtterly perswaded ought many thing agaynst name iesus chryst whence sprang persuasion verily blind rash zeale fleshe otherwheres attributeth iewes yet e maketh mention hereof extenuate excuse offence therby teache v example greatly men fall onlesse order dooings according worde god1 tim cor place confesseth moste haynous sinner worthy name apostle whereby appeareth howe muche greeuously offende beeing led zeale god good intention mind call naughtie affection persecute chryst worde meane season marke howe enterprise enimies church meare opinion vayne conceypt blinded minde notwithstanding seeme first well succede yet neuer haue ende looke psalm psalmist sayth trauayle mischiefe conceiued sorrowe haue brought foorth vanitie vngodlynesse thing paule confesseth sorte selfe teaching hearer example may looke beginne take agaynst chryst holde haue begonne psal way preuayle whose deuises enterprise god scattereth abroade laugheth heauen tirannie paule agaynst churche christbut least man might thinke paule spake bostingly truely rehearseth also owne dooings molesting afflicting churche put many saincts prison sayth beeing aucthorised priestes authoritie woulde neuer haue giuen onlesse seene earnestly bente aduaunce set forwarde proceeding calleth christian sainctes bycause sanctified bloud merite chryst corinth also kylled pronounced sentence death vppon gat consent others thervnto beside compelled bene whipped sinagoges tormented maner wayes blaspheme say deny chryst recante thing spoken well godly whereby may gathered church chryst neuer well established chaffe also winnowed f e persecution fell away finally bycause would spare kinde madnesse began roue abroade forren city also bycause would leaue place christian safe inthe state churche herein haue euident image persecutours chryste also state condition wherein godly faythfull world commonly men enuied hated potentate worlde chiefly excell name religion supremacie churche studying vnder colour pretence seeke priuate glory gayne onely afterwardes men haue fitte minister mischeuous proceeding gratifie maisters let occasion escape slippe whereby may batter assaulte churche thereto spare labour heereof therefore proceede imprisonment condemnation kindes torment banishment slaughterspersecutours cause men blaspheme blasphemy infinite suche thing cruell kernes vse deuise agaynst godly meane season behoueth marke better persecute godly faythes sake uerily compell weakling blaspheme while deny faith contrary conscience confesse haue erred vnhappy vngodly feare thing christ numbreth among sinnes blasphemie agaynst holy ghost luke paule expresly calleth denying true fayth blasphemie whervnto draue enforced faythfull therefore thing remayneth persecutor horrible woe chryst threatneth vnto giue occasion offence greeuous daungerous offence man giue whereby men compelled sinne agaynst holy ghost shal therefore feele
