least wise wonderfully extenuate diminish furthermore setteth story conuersionthe story paules conuersion attepts agaynst chryst comparing togither might appeare became christian man lightnesse inconstancie mind euen beeing compelled power god herevnto chiefly referred diligent declaration circumstance alleageth place tyme chrystes talke companion witness bycause man shoulde thinke bene beguyled vayne apparition distraction minde bycause haue spoken otherwheres conuerting vnto god duetie conuerte shall neede repeate ame againe let v nowe marke ende thing none defending vocation yet vayne diligently reporteth wordes chryste sharpely reprehending temeritie heereby teacheth hearer withstande doctrine gospell shal haue mortal man sonne god punishe bolde enterprise great losse hinderaunce thinges ought serue comforte abiding constantly true fayth may clea e faste vnto god alone among broyles enterprise worlde hath promised worship inheritaunce kingdome heauen sonne iesus chryst prayse honour power glory euer amen clxiij homelie bvt ryse stande vp thy feete haue appeared vnto thee purpose make thee minister witnesse thing thou haste seene thinges appeare vnto thee deliuering thee people gentile vnto sende thee open eye may turned darknesse light power sathan vnto god may receiue forgiuenesse sinnes inheritance among sanctified fayth towarde bicause paule knew iewes accused principally two poyntes namely forsaken iewes religion turned fayth chryst matched gentils iewes preching gospel among therfore diligently declareth story conuersion bicause alone sufficiet put away bothe crime unto first belong thing haue hitherto ben said wherin declareth chaged religion vpon light fantasie whyle enimie vnto christ compelled yelde vnto god calling seconde confute place rendreth reason whole ministerie euen wordes chryst ministerie sheweth committed vnto vpon condition preach gospell iewes also gentile bycause thing belong aswell instruction defence paule may learne hereby reason ministerie ecclesiastical also whole meane saluation therefore euery thing considered order christe rayseth vp paul throwen downe beforethe firste thing wee haue note howe chryst commaunded paule nowe friendly arise stande vp hys feete whome erewhyle horribly throwen downe enimie persecutour thing happened wee haue wheres heard heart pulled downe humbly enquired chryst acknowledged lorde thing yet woulde neuer haue done felt minde effectuous working spirite chryst truel notable example god goodnesse euen euidently declareth selfe seemeth angry alwayes chiding v forasmuche desireth haue men saued obserueth scope ende iudgements haue men rather instructed saluation destroyed neither draw foorth whippes scourge vntill see preuayle wordes neither yet doth beate v ende haue v conuerte vnto truste saued wherof haue testimony example euery scripture wherewith may confirme wauering fayth trouble aduersities although seeme great thing chryste giue cruell enimie leaue aryse yet greater euen wondered paule called office postle appoynteth office apostle moste honorable commendable function worlde yea sayth appeared ende make minister witnesse thinges bothe seene shoulde see heereafter heere two wordes comprehendeth whole office duetie byshoppes churche firste saythea minister paule shoulde bee minister lorde king apostle euery called suche muste serue whole churche publikely setting foode soule taking care affayres mannes saluation reade matthew luke herevnto seemeth paule respecte confessed detter vnto men iewes gentile learned vnlearned rom heereby excluded great desire bearing rule agaynst chryste oftentimes hearing apostle entreated large ignoraunt many afterwardes would come vnder pretence ministerie would looke reigne like tirauntes ouer church done sayth witnessea witnesse name reade apostle called also first chapter thus liked playnly set trade ministerie declaring also thing beare witnesse verily euen seene afterwarde woulde reueale vnto paule seene seene onely also proued experience christ liued reigned earnest defendour people wherby easie gather redeemer mankinde onely meere man also suche god knewe apostle preached therefore thinges beare witnesse place appeareth wee haue else admonished howe certayne infallible thing doctrine apostle ought taken seeing published runner pedlary ware sworne witness iesus chryst hauing vocation confirmed infinite miracle therfore let al minister remember witness therfore must preach new opinion owne pleasure thing finde certaintie holy scripture let boldely bring foorthgod deliuereth seruants danger man able accuse falshood forgery howbeit might haue seemed paule greeuous thing appoynted office knew euen thing onely little e ore went subiect infinite danger therfore lord mixeth therewith consolation commodious season wherein promiseth deliuer hand iewes gentile thus way though bene dooing thing declareth sent also vnto gentile bring lykewise societie felowship churche meane season place teacheth v minister must looke hatred persecution kindes aduersitie world except state condition neede often confirme neither consolation promise chryst promise must diligently considered taught howe chryste neuer forsaketh people tribulation yet muste vnderstanded though would deliuer kind aduersitie set safetie preserue shall perishe body reade paule last beheaded nero apostle also cruelly put death sayde lorde deliuereth v present worlde assisteth v spirite giuing v constancie mynde commoditie dooing finally mouthe wisedome agaynst enimies able resiste probabilitie reason agayne shoreth v vppe consolation middle affliction translateth v prison thys body possession hys kingdome preserueth memorie good name remayne posteritie sorte knowe delyuered holy martyres whose remembraunce florisheth day euen among enimies fayth promise seeing generall alwayes true cause suffer selues bee feared ouercome attemptes worlde shall separate v loue god c reade place rom conclude addeth ende thinges ministerie paule eye blinde bee openedthe ende vse gospell beeing illuminated might conuert darkenesse vnto lyght beeing deliuered power sathan might reconciled vnto god may receiue remission sinnes inheritance king dome heauen fayth god hath chosen vnto selfe thing conteyne duetie minister worde true vse gospell cause thing attributed vnto minister properly worke god declared large therfore gospel men eies opened may see god way saluation gospell men conuerted darknesse vnto light hencefoorth occupied work darknesse might dedes light christian philosophie consisteth vayne speculation practise1 corin extendeth selfe partes man lyfe agayne gospel men brought power sathan vnto god obey serue finally gospel offreth vnto v ye forgiuenesse sin inheritace kingdome heuen may thinke thing stand vayne sound word forasmuch christ author thing preched ye gospel truely attributed preaching gospel bicause gospel vaine effectuous therfore preching gospel containeth cheefest treasure saluation minister therof ought haue end eye bring men partaker thing leade vaine maze stagelike pompe preaching furthermorethe order manner saluation haue heerein comprehended whole order manner saluation thing giuen vnto v god euident want nature therefore nature blinde perceiue godlynesse naturall corruption deserue waile mourne vnder tirannie sathan goodnesse god commeth passe illuminated christ translated power death darknesse kingdome sanctified iustified merite enter kingdome eternall life thing said ere god offreth vnto v receiued faith gospell faith scripture teach purified made righteous bicause power giuen v imbrace christ receiue goodnesse thing might declared large dueties whome christ hathe taken kingdome father bicause haue oftentimes spoken therof shall sufficient shewe finger cheefe poyntes euery thing meane season haue heere bewaile vnkinde vnhappy blindnesse worlde contemning plaine way saluation turne intricate laberinthes pitfals eternall damnation partes shewe selues thankfull vnto god constant faith holde fast author goodness lord sauioure iesus christ praise honor power glory euer amen clxiiij homelie wherfore king agrippa disobedient heauenly vision shewed first vnto damascus ierusalem throughout costes iewrie gentile shuld repent turne god work become repent cause iewes caught temple went kill seing therfore haue obtained helpe god continue vnto day witnessing bothe small great saying none thing prophetes moses say shoulde come christe suffer first rise death shew light vnto people gentile pavle diligently reporteth historie conuersion agrippa bicause thereby hee able manifestly proue became christian man light heade ne yet preached gospell vnto gentile rashe enterprise god aucthoure thing hitherto done conuerted farre minde commaunded preach gospel vnto gentile also thing thus premised declareth ouer happened vnto thereof taketh occasion preache present paule obeyeth god co trary bidding ye priestesfirste hee confesseth plainely obedience hee shewed vnto heauenly vision thing diligently bee noted wee compare commaundement god precepte paule receyued priestes wee shall perceiue differed muche one priestes sent damascus publique commission aucthoritie bring faithfull christe b e putte bandes prisonne god commaunded onely cease also preache gospell heere therfore saithe obeyed calling god speedely without delay ashamed confesse whome hee knewe priestes aucthoritie hee therefore hee teacheth v example wee must obay god man wee muste make delay putting assoone certaine rule euer foloweth dispatch selfe great anxietie care cannot doe amisse maner true obediencealso wee haue consider manner obedience wee may perceiue thing paule saithe hee thing god commaunded doe euen hee commaunded doe preaching gospell bothe iewes gentile therefore true obedience wee accomplishe commaundement lorde without exception also obey lorde yet parte onely farre foorthe seemeth owne commoditie whereof scripture giueth v example first saule samuel thirtienth fiftienth god farre minde saule sam forbiddeth v turne woorde either right hande lefte either put thing take thing therefore paule well take hand businesse appoynted god without deliberation fulfil commaunded according rule god iniunction furthermore hee declareth hee hee teacheth also wee ought preache gospell order set forthe firste muste laboure bring men repentaunce forasmuche manifest sinnersthe point order euangelike doctrine subiect wrath god herewith reade baptiste begun christe taught apostle begin whereby appeareth slender gospeller dayes woulde haue principle beginning omitted moreouer manner true repentaunce expressed math luke tourne vnto god wee tourning god doe greeuously sinne perishe bothe repentaunce saluation consisteth cheefely muste tourne god againe reconciled vnto muste bee done meane christe onely bothe woorketh true repentaunce v spirite reconcileth v vnto hys father hauing cancelled blotted hand writing sinne lawe againste v wherefore peter place saith sent god giue israel repentance forgiuenesse sinnes erroure men confuted preach repentance without christ send men owne workes merites thirde pointe paules doctrine men worke worthy frutes repentance appeareth iohn also required great ueritie scripture euery commaund god wil haue v hypocrite dissembler challengeth v wholely himselfe requisite proue selues truely conuerted vnto god workes conuersation life shall doe lay away former naughtie desire lead newe kinde life agreeable vnto lawes god touching newnesse life reade muche euery epistle paule heereby taught good work must taken merites required dueties prescribed due vnto god forasmuche neuer able performe vnlesse regenerated spirite merite christ first conuerted vnto god luke although euer thing bounde doe yet vnprofitable seruauntes christ himselfe teacheth thus three pointes paule comprehendeth whole gospell paul laid holde obeying god sheweth howe preached order nowe foloweth declareth happened vnto walked vocation ende would easily proue euery man howe vniustly iewes delt cause truely saith endeuored selfe obedient vnto god iewes tooke would haue killed temple done also deliuered present helpe god mentioneth temple da ger death declare led rather blinde affection moued iust cause seeing neither holinesse temple publike lawe equitie coulde restraine irefull proceeding place teacheth v obedience godly owe vnto god cheefe cause persecution bothe prophet apostle hated worlde none cause laboured bring men vnto god preaching word god dayes seruaunts christ daunger persecuting cause onely put trust onely god christ worship feare serue commaundeth hainousnesse matter greater laboure priuately publikely haue al men saued euill requi ed meane season let comfort v heare paule aided god deliuered handes moste wicked cut throtes general rule haue promise euery teache v god deliuereth people temptations2 peter cor psal c suffereth tried aboue strengthes howbeit paule sufficiently proued guiltlesse cast prisone without desert paule preacheth gospel vnto agrippa hee turneth agrippa king heater great boldnesse beginneth oration bicause might seeme maruell man howe constant office seeing oftentimes bene aduersitie danger iewes therfore first sheweth reason therof deliuered help god therfore ought slacke office thus ascribeth vnto god benifite deliuery whereof seemed captaine aucthor bicause knewe captaine led hand spirite god meane season paules example teacheth v haue twice proued felt helpe god ought inflamed greater diligence vse waxe remisse negligent though fulfilled duetie beside owe vnto god kinde duetie lawe thankfulnesse requireth faithe industrie v least might seeme vnki de god benefactoure againe bicause would seeme importune preaching vnto paule detter vnto men declareth bounde duetie doe hee detter vnto men smal great thus stirreth vp mindes thinke gospell appertained vnto also diligently considered heare gospell preached commaundement god men state degree hereby learne respect person god yea would haue sortes men saued therefore hathe appoynted minister word disposers stewardes houshold lette comfort copassed trouble also teach minister hearer duetie neither one pleasure get procure disciple owne calling thinke libertie bounde rule gospell lengthe repeateth taught verely none thing moses prophetes foreshewed time pastthe sum gospell comprehendeth doctrine three article euident moste controuersie first christ sauioure promised suffer death v thing coumpted moste absurde wordes read twelfth iohn abundantly declare seconde christe rise againe dead first order reade diuers christ raised againe worthinesse power aucthor resurrection life men thirde hee illuminate worde spirite iewes also gentile paule declared thing many place testimony scripture onely exclamation festus shall afterwarde proue surely euery extant many testimony bothe moses prophet wherby proue thing wherupon gather againe doctrine gospell newe thing resting consisting person antiquitie allowed consent age furthermore howe scripture contained whatsoeuer thing needeful beleeued seeing paul able proue mystery christian faith lette v therfore contented constantly holde fa faithe contained may attaine life euerlasting iesus christ lord whome blessing honoure power glory euer amen clxv homelie thus spake selfe festus said loud voice paule thou art beside thy selfe much learning doth make thee madde paule saide madde moste deare festus speake forthe wordes truthe sobernesse king knoweth thing also spake freely neither thinke thing hidden fro thing done corner king agrippa beleeuest thou prophetes wotte well thou beleeuest agrippa saide vnto paule somwhat thou bringest minde become christian paule saide would god thou also heare day somewhat altogither suche except band thus spoken king rose vp deputie bernice sate gone aparte talked betweene selues saying man dothe nothing worthy death bond saide agrippa vnto festus man mighte haue bene let lose appealed vnto caesar luke hathe declared paules oration sheweth effect toke hearer worthy place considered two example describeth two kindes men heare word god vaine end vse thing minister may learne deale fortes men also others vnderstand beware heare worde god profite commoditie first kinde set example festus deputie president vngodly persones festus president heare worde prophane intent haue knowledge taste godlinesse haue first consider festus paule gaue eare vnto paule declaring vision prouing al mystery christian faith man saluation testimony scripture whereof neuer heard thing gentile vnderstanding likelihode warres religion wherfore supposeth paule reasoning profoud difficulte matter madde like vnto frantike fittes vse imagine themselues monstrous wonderfull thing vtter without reason importunately hee interrupteth paule speaking yet one thing altogither vnreasonable imputeth wante wit supposed paule ouermuche studie learning vpbraiding none thing many vse dayes example teacheth v litle word god preuaileth led wt man reason comon property cout mockery passeth reach capacitie reason wheras mean season vnderstand nothing lesse thing belonging spirite god therfore canot chose must thinke gospel iesus christ crucified greatest foolishnesse worlde bicause nothing absurde voide reason aske hope saluation hanged died crosse among theeues murtherers therefore happened vnto paule preaching festus read happened vnto prophet afterward vnto successoures apostle also namely taken men wi te yea christe himselfe mocked pilate time confessed came world preache truthe pilate thought number men labored long vaine finde truthe bicause thing among men doubtfull vncertaine therefore offended bicause gospell preuaileth little dayes seeing suche multitude men euery blinded reason fleshe distract mindes receiue word god way infernall iayes say affection suggestios sathan peck vp paule constantly modestly defendeth ministerie doth paul feared festus importunate interruption holdes peace throughe silence confirmeth sinister suspition wit yea rather boldly defendeth aucthoritie ministery gospell mad saith moste deare festus speake wordes truthe sobrietie therfore boldly putteth slaunder away yet modestly reuerence due vnto magistrate least impatiencie ire rendering railing againe haue declared bene wit deede therefore wise sort vtterly denieth mad wordes seemed vnto festus madde man declared true vttered curious sort muche sobrietie could proueth credible witness among whome firste hee produceth king could ignorante none thing hitherto beene said concerning christ bicause done corner secrete famous citie nation greatest principallest feast againe calleth prophet also witnesse foreshewed thing come passe declared little large bicause saying haue waighte aucthoritie boldly freely defendeth aucthoritie prophet turneth vnto king saith beleeuest thou king agrippa prophetes waiting till answere preuenteth adding moreouer knowe thou beleeuest knew well maiestie truthe scripture propheticall yet euen among corrupt nation iewes called dout men would take vngodly person thought paul handled mater large bicause agrippa confessed greatly moued word haue certain thing diligently considered bicause make little comon instruction menwhich best wai teaching first place teacheth v best way teaching paul confesseth hitherto obserued saith spake word truth sobrietie aboue al thing minister must haue regarde truth least sel leasing wherof christ saith deuill father vnder pretence goddes worde treating mystery truth let vse godly holy sobrietie giuing heede suche thing may edifie men vnto godlinesse least folowe curiositie fleshe bothe entangle themselues vnprofitable hurtfull question also offende weake ruder sorte let therefore remember knowe parte onely prophesying vnperfite heereafter shall come day withoute impediment shall beholde mystery kingdome heauen openly face god furthermore paules woordes teache vschristian religion certain bee suspected obscuritie affaire saluation christian religion certaine nothing difficult suspected none thing happened vnto christ done corner thing concerned christ way saluation done time past publikely openly among father patriarkes whome promisses made beginning rascalles diffamed also deliuery people israell egipte thing well knowen vnto gentile publishing lawe many myracles famous renoumed matter thing figure mystery christ touching prophet good man euer suspect falshoode furthermore monarchy bothe assirians persian grecian romanes doe nation iewes among whome affaire saluation taughte voice apostle freely sound abrode world muche men knewe bothe preached great dignitie faith found none religion reproueth impudencie men nowe dayes call beleefe doubte question furthermore place teacheth vsthe scripture self worthy credite aucthoritie credite holy scripture moste certaine wee must suffer man call controuersie seing inspired god vnlawfull doubt cause paule putteth ou controuersie agrippa beleeued prophetes christ hauing doe scribe iewes attributeth vnto firmely beleeue life euerlasting contained scripture iohn howe muche execrable impudeneie dayes men wickedly cauill scoffe scripture wonderfully deminishe aucthoritie contende ought alowed confirmed iudgement men furthermore lette v see seconde kinde hearer woorde agrippa paterne care worlde chooke seede woorde whome wee haue patterne sette foorthe agrippa king suche giuen vnto worlde lette seede worde ouergrowen care desire hee dare denie scripture aucthoritie whereof hee knewe god infallible seeth also thing paule saythe agreeable wyth scripture hee feeleth also certaine euidente motion mynde whereby hee allured take parte wyth christe hee dissembleth bicause hee openly confesseth hee somewhat persuaded letteth hym therefore hee goeth forewarde publikely professeth christe uerely vnhappy liking worlde rendshippe glory wherof seemed excellent would forsake goe vnto whome many men hated enuied thought wittes would god example heereof agrippa dayes wee hearde euery suche giue gospell singular commendation yet folowe doctrine antichrist still feare losing heades honor else fear putting life danger meane season appeareth men diuine wonderful force gospel wresteth euen willes striue neuer much contrary confession truth yet nothing profiteth bicause dare set selues holy ghoste christian wishe paule paule wisely stoutly answereth festus bicause hee able doe setteth wordes agrippa christian wishe inflamed great feruencie charitie wold wish saith god onely thou also heare mee day parte wholy suche bondes excepted doubt paule wished thing euen heart otherwheres prayed iewes bothe day nighte wished accurssed sake taught way sufficient v beleeue parte required v euery day increasing faith may length growe perfite man christ iesus opinion men allowed suppose one two article sufficient vnto saluation vnprofitable superfluous thing shuld derogate muche wisedome god also goodnesse moreouer paules wishe teacheth v minister haue iurisdiction power vpon mindes men spirite god worketh effectuously paule trouble himselfe vaine wish iohn math c cor beene able haue tourned agrippa minde see saide purpose bothe christe paule muste let passe howe paule excepteth bondes althoughe nothing gree ous vnto knewe wel cheefe glory ministerie consisted yet wished quietnesse peace men farre forth stode commoditie faithe saluation thus becommeth men carie owne crosse paciently yet meane season prouide mennes commoditie tranquillitie muche able heereby appeareth spirite led enuie mennes felicitie else rash iudgement condemne good christian see liue commodious wealthy wise innocencie paule thing luke ioyneth ende dooing namely howe assembly auditorie brake vppe departed beeing neuer whitte better reason impedimentes rehearsed thys wonderfull paule absolued acquited againe consente menne yet sette libertie whereby appeareth howe little worlde regardeth state godlye whome see afflycted wythoute deserte innocencie paule often tymes tryed maketh muche setting foorth dignitie christian fayth thing also reproueth temeritie men cry dayes doctrine gospell sedicious seeing paule earnest preacher gospel able oftentimes purge crime sedition prophane heathen iudges let man therefore moued slaunders worlde constant doctrine true fayth let v boldely serue god defendeth worship middle tempestes worlde giueth inheritaunce kingdome iesus chryste lorde prayse honour power glory euer amen xxvij chapiter vpon actes apostle clxvj homelie concluded sayle italie deliuered paule certayne prisoner vnto one named iulius vnder captayne caesar italie put v therein sayled slowly many dayes scarse come ouer agaynst cindus bicause winde withstoode v sayled harde coste candy ouer agaynst salmo much worke sayled beyonde came place called fayre vnto v paule example pacience constancie teacheth v moreouer infallible truth god promise although al thing world semed go crosse paul hinder coming rome yet truth god promised brought caesar brusteth sodenly fall iustice censure publike lawes hath begun neglected behoueth v chiefly consider case state godly paule ioyned prisoner without doubt moste part greeuous haynous misdoers scripture teacheth friendly vnto paule centurion paules fred bothe curteously intreateth came sidon giueth leaue go visite friend recreat refresh selfe among like saw lysias tribune felix presidet abdias time paste patrone protectour prophet ieremie friend prison succoured bothe helpe counsayle reade first king chapter ieremie thing behoueth v also take comfort yelde enterprise tyrannes commende selues doings god onely howbeit place haue consider paule beeing citie full people standing sea coaste might easily eyther haue hid selfe haue slipped away yet woulde vse suche oportunitie aduauntage escape cause paul would flee might shoulde haue done vniustly haue brought captayne danger wel deserued also learned oracle must go rome taught example must seeke owne safetie vnlawfull meanes distress appeare way escape suche repugnant vnto charitie fayth iustice certayne god hath determined v otherwise whose pleasure meete obey least make prouision body goodes lose soule foloweth diligent long description nauigation sailing course wherof let desirous know euery thing paules voyage nauigation ful danger searche geographer table haue consider howe paynefull daungerous voyage seeing expressely declared windes agaynst howbeit god could easily haue remedied incomberaunces many example hath declared himselfe lord ruler sea thus pleased haue chosen vessel tried glory truth power might seme euident meane season appeareth state life verily troublesome state like pilgrimage wherin see newe trauels daungers euery day appeare chiefly seene life godly continually assaulted freshe care trouble example hereof haue chryst head assone borne found enimies whose awaytes trecheries made whole course life vnpleasaunt perillous paule also found euen wrastling long time craftes awaytes iewes length comitted sea element others cruel peril wherof also proued appereth eleueth chapter second epistle corinthian infinite example kinde might repeated neede let v rather marke vse thing arme selues constant fayth ouercome al aduersitie seeing euident prepared v rewardes eternall rest heauen shall enioy hereafter iesus chryst bee prayse honour power glory euer amen clxvij homelie much time spent sayling ieopardous bycause also ouerlong fasted paule put remembraunce sayd vnto sir perceiue voyage hurt much damage lading ship also lyues neuerthelesse vnder captayne beleeued gouernour master ship thing spoken paule bicause hauen commodious winter many toke counsel depart thence meanes might attayne phenices winter hauen candy lyeth towarde south northwest winde southwinde blew supposing obteine purpose loosed vnto asson sayled paste candy long arose agaynst purpose flawe winde northeast shippe caught could resist winde let hir go draue weather caryed isle named clauda muche worke come bote tooke vp vsed helpe made fast shippe fearing least fall syrtes let downe vessell caryed next day tossed exceeding tempest lightned ship thirde day cast owne hande takeling shippe laste neither sunne starres appeared small tempest lay vpon v hope escape taken away came passe vnto sonne god sauiour iesus chryst liued earth enured exercised diuerse dayly affliction paule example place expresse wordes place teacheth v remayne shall followe steppe nowe two whole yeres suffered lye bond feele greefes imprisonment tryed day day fresh awayts trecheries enimies nowe committed fierce element try daungerous tempestes sea length proue misfortune vnhappie shipwracke declared homelie afore going howe came syria vnto isle candy contrary windes daungerous sayling yet followeth description farre greater daunger length shall heare ended shipwracke order going forwarde whereof luke hath reported truely diligently bycause narration firste sighte seemeth bare barrengod warneth v danger giueth v counsell time fall diuerse thing serue learning comforte amongest worthy first noted god admonisheth bothe souldiours mariner tyme eminent daunger layne anker long whyle fayre hauen neare vnto la winter nowe drewe iewes faste beeing nowe ouerpaste vsed bee kepte seuenth moneth see leui v falleth betweene september october paule diligently exhorteth putte vowe tyll tyme whiche thing euident hee dyd without reuelation holy ghoste bycause playnely foresheweth daungers afterwarde followed heere wee haue chiefly consider howe god neuer aketh woulde haue men saued warneth danger time may take heede themselues deuise meanes howe escape attempereth warning diuerse sortes sometimes warneth v prophetes preacher worde common way vsage one chiefest token good towards v touching thing see amos prophet third chapter sometimes reuealeth vnto v priuately friend acquayntaunce daunger hath also token diuerse sortes declare wrath towards sinner furthermore nippeth v somtime eare secret inspiration spirite owne conscience reade haue ben admonished ministerie angel thing common vsuall nede declare example let v learne least wise acknowledge goodnesse god contemne faithful wholsome admonition least author owne destruction ende froward disobedient example men also shal afterward declare entreat therof haue somthings say paule heard howe tolde heauenly oracle go vnto rome thing playne firmely beleeued yet abused oracle put selfe daunger without cause tempte god rather beeing admonished daunger newe reuelation beleeueth lykewise admonisheth haue regarde vnto selues whereby appeareth doctrine fayth prouidence god maketh men bee rashe tempter god euen chryst requireth wisedome soeuer god offereth v lawfull due meanes escape certayne would haue v put selues daunger therefore becommeth v vse meanes auoydaunce feare godlynesse furthermore paules wholsome counsayle accepted greate hynderaunce losse contemned paules aduise despised behoueth v consider proceeding matter wee may learne thereby howe commeth passe greate many despyse wholsome counsayle procure owne losse sometymes destruction firste cause alleaged place centurion thought good beleeue gouernour maister shippe rather paule man woulde consider reason fleshe seemeth dyd wisely yet erreth fowely bycause esteemeth regardeth counsayle according cause authoritie men otherwyse woulde easily haue perceyued without cause paule sayde ieopardous sayling considering wynter drewe common errour specially god giue counsayle minister hys worde giue eare vnto seemeth many men onely greeuous also haynous offence nowe dayes euery achabes sedechiases whiche disdayne heare micheas ieremyes thinke selues giue beste counsayle else take vnto counsellers whiche thynke agreable wyth humour condition heereby moste tymes commeth passe daungers warre wee flee vnto barbarous nation blouddy souldioures league prince fortress holdes sycknesses phisitions onely neede pouertie vnto vnlawefull artes wee geue eare vnto wee suppose haue good successe heeretofore lyke enterprise thys sorte menne wrapped many euilles incumberaunces whiche myghte easily eschue woulde admitte worde god onely aduises counsayles taken thereof cause despised paules counsayle rode hauen seemed commodious inoughe wynter thys cause drewe vppe ankers meaning seeke commodious harbour thing sloppeth vppe way vnto many wholesome counsayles bycause wee bee contente wyth presente commodity seeke others iudgemente better thus commeth passe whyle wee followe insaciable blinde affection fleshe wee entangle selues snare sinne bee authours owne greatest myschiefes thys chaunced vnto souldioures maryners despisyng hauen god appoynted length shipwracke loste hadde also hazarde lyues wee haue example heereof euery hystories among whiche thys one wee reade israelite singular whiche beeyng weery present state condition desired haue king could induced reason broughte samuell keepe styll kinde pollicie gouernement god giuen iulius caesar wryteth lyke thing auncestours heluetians beeing weerie natiue soyle countrey went plant selues fraunce great losse hinderaunce vse thinges make v contented present state god giueth v seeke shall brydle affection fleshe kepe selues duetie see paule hath written hereof tim returne agayne vnto men third thing maketh stiffe purpose bicause thought south winde good go away withall doubt great many mocked paule one woulde haue hindered towardnesse successe cousel would haue giuen eare vnto long greuously punished disobediece notable policy diuel commonly vseth make beginning sinne seme easie prosperous therby entise v rather hope good successe sinne flattereth fawneth vpon corrupt nature beginning successe thereof seemeth fortunate whereby commeth passe wee beeing dr nken fortune doo wickedly despise wholesome admonition many tymes laughing clappe handes hysse haue example heereof euery therefore wee neede stande long heerein thus thing put adulterer dronkardes souldiours kinde mischeeuous doer good hope maruellous successe long cause gret calamity thing contemners paules counsel founde true shall declared long arose northeast windethe punishmet god counsel despised notable euen prouerbe turneth whole shippe hyther thither round like ben wheele proue great hinderaunce losse suche long well prosper go forward go thing agaynst god forbode time cometh passe thinke prosperitie sodayne vnloked calamitie quite ouerwhelmeth whereof wee haue example euery day adulterer theeues couetous person hired souldiers conclude al vngodly prophet sayth liue halfe day may seene onely priuate men also kingdomes common weales enl ged violence vnrighteousnesse agaynst lawes god commonly vnhappie ruine throweth also downe euen men thinke moste safetie power inuincible thing fall assirians babilonians teacheth v ouerthrowes persian destruction greekes ruine romane empire happened beyonde expectation worlde therefore cause eyther wee shoulde waxe insolent proude prosperitie bee greeued offended others rather let worde god squire rule doings whose gu ing wee follow wee shall neither erre truthe prouoke god agay v nowe followeth diligent description daunger procured vnto themseluesmannes power n force god flawe tempest winde caught shippe suche violence able withstande therefore let hir driue whither woulde winde wether although carried vnto ilande clauda seemed bee good c mforte yet disappoy tha hope beganne bee daunger bothe losing ote wholesh ppe also example wee taughte force altogither vayne whome god hys iustice persecuteth w ere god lorde hostes able arme eue smallest least thinges agaynst enimies shall able vanquishe subdue thus w nde vaynest vncertaynest thing god pleaseth able subuerte turne thinges vpside downe wee reade howe soote furnace frogges lyce imicies fly moste small wormes conquerours pharao let man therefore truste eyther owne strength stryue agaynst god going aboute nishe sinne although sometyme stubborne disobedient seeme haue hope helpe yet whatsoeuer helpes seeke fleshe vnperfecte deceitefull vayne onely certayne way helpe saluation turne vnto god reconciled vnto happeneth lose nothing god biddingbeside euils distress compelled caste goodes owne handes nowe mindes muche altered thought dyd ryde commodiously inough lasea nowe fayne owne accorde throw euen necessary carefull howe escape wyth lyfe onely rare commoditie delightes commonly state suche obey god wyll suffer losse thinges serue mayntayne ryot pleasure lengthe compelled spende throwe away lose thinges without lyfe bee mayntayned thys common true saying chryste wyll take chequer wyll rake moste tymes suche wyll hazarde goodes quarell fayth religion morselles tyrant tyre vpon likewise bridle gluttonous luste desire fraunching feeding god commaundeth deliuere phisitians chirurgians vexed tormented beside moste parte suche men troubled conscience woulde glad redeeme rest quiet thereof goodes rich possible let v therefore dedicate selues vnto chryst promiseth lyberall bountifull rewarde name sake suffer losse lyfe worldely goodes matthew mark let v also caste away thynges may hynder saluation bycause wee knowe bee loste neuer bee recouered agayne finally great many dayes neither sunne arres shyned paule hym selfe hazard despisers god lengthe oute hope thys lykewyse common thyng whiche e walke lyghte god worde wrapped daungerous deadely darkenesse wee haue none lode starre gi en v whose leading wee able holde course tyghte waye tempestuous sea worlde heere bee obserued god suffereth paule also bee daunger bee moste greeuously tempted among malefactoures insomuche hee neth hym vnto prayer hath neede bee comforted god ha thynges followyng wyll declare thys sta godly worlde offendeth many menne se suche lyke perill hazarde notorious cked v yet state farre sorte thinges worke vnto profite commoditie beeing good conscience myddest daungers knowe goddes eares open vnto prayer staying selues vppon hys promyses wayte also strength hym beare burthen looke deliuerie due tyme season meane season wycked troubled wyth g ltie con ien moste parte daungers ended wy destru ion lette v therefore folowe example paule wel marke loadestarre god word happely chaunce come danger vnhappy world may yet haue hope saluation firmely fixed set god suffer people tepted aboue stregth giue v happy successe deliuer v daungers length wil take v kingdome sonne iesus christ praise honor power glory euer amen clxviij homelie bvt long abstinence paule stode forthe middest saide sir haue hearkened haue loosed candie neither haue brought vnto v harme losse nowe exhort good cheare shall losse mannes life among sauing shippe stode night angel god whose serue saying feare paule thou muste bee broughte caesar loe god hathe giuen thee saile thee wherefore sir good cheare beleeue god shall euen tolde howebeit must cast certaine ilande declared late horrible tempest paul companie tossed luke saithe blowe boysteously hope escape succor man might heere maruell howe paule meane season behaued himselfe either towardes god whose promisses seemed quaile towards companion rashnesse disobedience procured themselues euill chaunce talke euangelist reporteth place dothe euidently declare matter many cause worthy singularly cosidered first time noted case stoode paul giueth comforte counsel inaduersitie paule made oration verely euen greatly hungred midst peril hitherto haue beene described without cause hee spake time troubled businesse shuld haue commoditie therfore nowe wearied bothe body minde sette downe without hope succoure sheweth counsel comfort good time whereby gather despaired ouercome feare middle daungers prayer fled vnto god comforted able comforte strengthen others example taught muste despaire time daunger put whole hope truste god neuer forsaketh promisses also example great many men aboundantly declare therfore shamefull erroure men assoone see hope man either vtterly despaire else turne vnto saincts vnlawfull meanes seeke counsel helpe hand let v see paules oration shorte according time serued yet containeth many thing moste worthy considered modestly rebuketh former disobediecefirst vpbraideth disobedience whereby procured themselues great daunger beginneth therewith partly make knowe sinne cause euill partly teach present mischance heare willingly dothe yet moste modestly seemeth rather admonish duetie cast teethe misery taught place reproue deede rashnesse disobedience procure owne mischefe yet must ouer bitterly vpbraide already afflicted miserable enough least heape sorow vpon sorow mourne verily much blame able thing goe well good owne counsell aduersitie bitterly taunte deride mennes deuises vniust iudges men adde calamitie calamitie thing disagreeing christian charitie also paule example reproueth men whose deuise first refused neuer afterwarde giue counsell againe haue doe would harken counsell comforteththis done paule great boldnesse minde comforteth exhorte saithe good cheare shall bee losse mannes life among saue ship wee haue cheefely consider dignitie paule though bandes yet farre excelled residue seeming moste miserable able alone greatest ieoperdie danger comforte counsell peculiare work christ minister seeme moste despised person doth gloriously triumphe example martires teach v thing middle fire horrible torment bothe voice example partly feared beholder partly moued like constancie faith wherevnto also referred nowe dayes also see giuen altogither world sinne time sicknesse daunger seeke counsell helpe onely minister worde whome otherwise yet hate worse deuill alleageth oraclefurthermore least paule might seeme vaine trifler busie body alleageth oracle saying stode night angell lord whose whome serue saying feare paule thou must brought caesar loe god hath giuen vnto thee saile thee heere euery worde hath weight teacheth v diuers thing worthy considered first god declareth vnto v goodnesse great cannot forget correcteth v according desertes neither alwayes angry comforteth v middest affliction helpeth v counsell tempted farther able beare hath also suche care v hathe appoynted angel occupied safegarding v wherof haue hitherto sene diuers example furthermore paules plainnesse simplicitie vsed faithe religion bee considered wee knowe hee laide bandes faithes sake yet hee confessed freely plainely muche boldely affirmeth onely seruaunt god also worshippeth christe requireth v hee commaundeth v confesse men wee reade howe martires also folowe example paule would much dissemble faithe christe muche lesse flatly deny moreouer paules woordes teache v enoughe v say belong vnto god muche euident deuils also subiecte commaundemente god requireth v kinde woorship obedience excepte wee perfourme professing chrystes name shall serue condemne v saue v yet place teacheth v howe profitable dwell among holy menne worshipper god god gaue vnto paule liues passenger euident hathe oftentimes spared many haue deserued destruction fewes sake haue bene good euery man knoweth scripture say noe lot moses infinite others yet example muste bee racked ende attribute godly honoure vnto sainctes aske thing belong onely vnto god giue vse serueth farre purpose god partely maketh wicked beholding vnto seruaunts ende may liue safely commodiously among partely suche testimony commendeth faithe religion godly vse profitable liue fewe wicked lette runne long line moste time destruction whole common weales may seene example ionas whose sake reade bothe mariner passenger ieoperdie thing men would wel marke obserue godly better regarded companie wicked men detested laste paule concludeth hys orationthe promise god must taken holde faithe biddeth good cheare hee addeth thys moreouer beleeue shall euen tolde mee lesse dout heereof hee declareth howe sorte shoulde escape saying muste bee caste oute certaine ilande taughte promisses god muste bee receiued faithe bicause ratified confirmed goddes truthe dependeth vppon v bicause promiseth v helpe saluation vpon condition none shall haue onely beleeue gospell haue example heereof euery heere one thing comfortable althoughe bee fewe beleeue yet god easily discerne betweene wicked hath regarde scripture teacheth v happened time past iosue caleb whome onely god broughte lande promisse bicause onely beleeued promisses let v diligently occupy selues consideration thing wheras god offereth v comfortes counsel saluation dayes also let v embrace stedfast faithe shall come passe haue sailed tempestuous sea life shall broughte heauen hauen eternall saluation throughe iesus christ lord whome praise honoure power glory euer amen clxix homelie bvt fourtienth night come sailing adria midnight shipmen deemed appeared country vnto sounded founde xx fadomes gone litle sounded found xv fadomes fearing least haue falne vppon rocke cast foure ankers sterne wished day shipmen flee ship let downe boate sea vnder coloure though wold haue cast ankers foreship paule saide vnto vnder captain souldiers except abide ship yee safe souldiers cut rope bote let fall away day began appeare paule besought take meate saying fourtenth day yee haue taried co tinued fasting receiuing nothing wherefore pray take meat doubt health shall haire fal head thus spoken tooke breade gaue thankes god presence al broken begun eat good chere also toke meate although god suffreth seruauntes many wayes tempted yet haue oftentimes declared assisteth counsell comforte ouercome temptation euident example heereof haue storie tempest increased vehemently hope left man god sendeth angell vnto paule renue former promisse wherewith freshe confirmed able confirme comforte others also god vaine wordes holde miserable creature hope faithfully performed promised shall see come place luke commeth therevnto declareth done meane season beleeued promisse god touching euery point shall speake order first haue consider mariner adriaticke seathe incredulitie distrust maryners perceiuing certaine markes lande farre vsed diligence coulde gette vnto shore letting downe plumbet lead long line sounded depth sea prepared thing necessary present season might seeme worke faith considering buckled framed themselues vnto promisse god cast plumbet seconde time perceyued sea waxed verie shaule stricken newe feare forgetting promise oracle god go aboute dishonestly runne awaye hoyse ouer boate gette downe make though woulde hoyse ankers aforeship meant prouide themselues leaue passenger destitute hope coure heere appeareth propertie fleshe suche purpose followe waye reason thereofthe propertie flesh danger men firste delyghted promyses god frame themselues accordingly successe thing agreeth promyses thinke euerie thing go forwarde well assoone daungers begyn appeare dashe hope successe playnely renounce fayth turne counsel flesh shewe themselues moste dishoneste person bothe towarde god man mariner dyd see people israell dyd also fyrste hearde god promysed sette libertie embraced deuice counsell god great reuerence pharao vexed demaunde request moyses aaron began handle seruilely forgat promise god fell yling saying lord looke vnto iudge hath made sauour v stinke eye pharao exod eye seruantes haue put sworde hande sley v people shoulde go egipt laden wyth golde costly apparell tooke iourney ioyfully came red sea sawe host enimies harde backes accused moyses aaron faythfull seruauntes god treason murther exod agayne miraculously delyuered daunger declared ioye myndes wyth singing anone perceyuing want scarcitie meate drinke turne agayne murmuring complayning neede rehearse israelite seeing haue euerie dayes lyke example commonly chiefe cause men fall fayth forgetting commaundementes god neglecte dutie let v learne therefore abandon counsell fleshe disagreeth worde god temptation haue respect onely vnto hys worde vnto fleshe fleshe reason see nothing presente state thing doth quickly dispayre true fa th grounded vppon worde god onely cannot fall f lter knoweth god whose wyll certified hys worde see abraham whiche paul handleth fourthe romaine diligently trimlythe property confident bolde agayne mar may see propertie suche bolde confident persones despise refuse godly faythfull admonition thus wee see dyd persuaded centurion sayle cand counsell paule brought bothe others daunger lyke atdes afraide sought dishonestly forsake tackle compa e propertie whiche dronken owne wisedome lyke partes also play seditious persones aucthoures rebellion common weales daungers euery side hand conuey themselues away thus chore made stirre vproare oute campe setteth himselfe quiet hys tente num absalon souldioures fight rideth himselfe vpon mule taking pleasure pastime daunger example teache v suspect suche kinde men despise wholesome counsell sage sober person see agreeable worde god paule commaundeth stay marrinersnowe let v returne vnto paule throughe secrete instincte holy ghoste perceiuing marriners intent admonished captaine souldioures disappointe thing heere haue diligently consider woordes paule except men sayth abide ship safe yet god promised safetie whose counsel frustrate made vaine howe escape except marriners abide shippe doth truthe goddes promisse depende vppon false marriners paule reasoneth place absolute power god might easely haue deliuered oute daunger without helpe eyther marriners shippe bicause hee certaine promisse miraculous deliuery yea hee tolde muste cast lande certaine ilande hee thoughte order nature remedy hande despised least ouermuche confidence truste goddes promisse hee shoulde make tempt god example teacheth v prouidence god faithe consisteth therein lette vnto godly vse lawfull ordinary meanes right vse god instrumets meanesfor god haue order appoynted bee obserued many example may bee declared sowing corne scripture teacheth v nothing succedeth except god giue increase scripture testifieth god hathe appointed order grounde shoulde bee tilled oure laboure muste receiue blessing heauen bee made fitte beare corne gouernaunce house wee knowe endeuoure superfluous onlesse lorde builde house prouer yet scripture diligent careful housholders commended setting forthe praise good huswife matrone holy ghoste mighte almost industrious carefull therefore paule dothe well thinking marriners oughte bee lette goe althoughe hee nothing dou red promisse god following example christe hee certainely knewe commended ministerie tuition angel coulde yet neuer persuaded tempte god casting himselfe downe pinacle temple yet must take heede vsing lawfull meanes wee attribute muche vnto swarue way faith teacheth v haue eye l fixed vpon god letting passe men let v consider captaine souldiers obeyed word paule faithe captaine souldioures asunder rope bote tied let bote fal sea singuler token faith meanes spoile theselues bote might haue stode great steade present perrill shipwrack already learned losse hynderaunce greater safegarde life paule taught god therefore thoughte good bee obedient vnto howe soeuer matter fell lette v followe example menne thoughe beleeue beginning yet leastwise taught oure daungers domage may beleeue word god shew selues obedient vnto howebeit luke againe sheweth howe paule comforted paule exhorteth take meat counselling furthermore howe doe exhorteth fall meate alleaging weightie reason bydding firste hee boroweth time saythe hee fouretenthe daye whiche yee haue remayned fasting taken nothing heereby declareth greate ieoperdie wherewith encombred scarce leasure thinke meate certaynely whyle made ordinarie meales repastes seconde reason hee boroweth necessitie expedient health otherwise although yee escape drowning ye wil dye hunger thirdly repeateth promise god wyth greate truste confidence shall one haire fall head thus answereth obiection might haue sayde meate bene little purpose profite shortly muste perishe die length hee prouoketh example thus sayd toke bread gaue thanks god sighte brake beganne eate shewing token fearefull dismayed minde thus hee cheateth mindes putting good hope life take meat also might able beare laboures bruntes hande heere maye see propertie true faythe nearer daunger shipwracke drewe lesse hope appearedthe nature propertie fayth bolde minde paule waxeth insomuche hee alone able encourage embolden also appeareth indued true faithe profitable onely vnto selues also vnto others considering see paule alone ruleth thing comforteth counselleth menne lette v therefore learne make muche suche menne seeing history nation testifie contemning suche good menne hath beene destruction greate number moreouer worthye obserued howe paule suche daunger going meate hastily forgetteth say grace sighte mennethe discipline table thing becommeth godly yea righte required menne seing confesse prayer god fedeth v dayly bread meate cannot prosper v vnlesse bee blessed god whiche thing cause chryste also commended thys vsage often vnto v owne example let hogges therefore bee ashamed bothe vnthankefulnesse vngodlynesse whiche goe vnto table without eyther reuerence gyuing thanks scoffingly vse vpbrayde suche men supersticious whome see followe example chryste hys apostle fellowes lyke one daye buye theyr stubbournesse full deare let v remember goodnesse god doe ouercommeth thing bee hindered maner wayes end history also referred god saueth paule company drowning hee promised hee would doe yet meane season sometimes exercised faithe diuers temptation shall euidently appeare consider euery thing heerein order number paule shippe two hundreth three score sixtene soules declared pleased holy ghoste haue number plainly expressed partely truthe god might appeare certainly vnto v partly miracle deliuerie might seeme euident men knewe many number none could lacking residue must know daunger shipwracke euen vse hinder let one eche man prouideth owne safetie perill god e dently put forthe hand broughte many togither safe sound vnto shore heereby wee may gather easie thing god saue number fewe hath thing tale prouidence stretcheth selfe euen vnto heares little sparrowes power infinite vnmeasurable ouercome neither multitude haue neede helpe neither greatnesse daunger thus brought israelite togither safe red sea easie deliuer moses onely beeing caste riuer nilus like sorte fedde people israell fortie yeres wildernesse miraculously easily afterwarde fedde elia ministerie rauens herevnto king asa respect beeing ready ioyne battayle innumerable multitude ethiopian made prayer vnto god wise lorde hard thing thee helpe either many haue power parali profitable v acknowledge god suche one shall feared neither owne wante power myserie multitude daungers brought desperation moreouer shippe taken meatethey caste corne sea paule exhorted lightned shippe thinges insomuch caste corne also ouer borde heard caste marchaundise tackle shippe passe necessitie driue delicate person whiche contrary god woulde needes seeke commodious hauen would bee contented present state condition meane season singular argument faith would throw ouer borde corne also except certaynely beleeued god would haue saued woulde neuer haue bene perswaded haue caste away succour lyfe onely remayned example set v follow wee also god appoynteth shoulde likewise willingly forsake thinges without seemeth lyfe mayntayned wee see abraham hym selfe apostle many others whose fayth holy ghoste commendeth scripture followeth description wracke breefethe description shipwracke yet suche teacheth v many thinges fell therein bene able quayle fayth paule others would haue harkened rather wisedome flesh promise god first although see lande appeare farre yet knewe whether shore ignoraunt also whether come among friend enimies bycause many time chanceth escape shipwracke light vnharberous countreys suffer harme barbarous people sea otherwise moste cruell element wherfore hope succoure shewed selfe farre ioyned little feare agayne might laboured get shore runne shippe place sea side foreship stucke sande sterne violence waues splete sunder heere truth god oracle declareth selfe fortolde shippe perishe yet seemed nowe lyke come safe sounde shore howbeit ship may called figure men contrary worde god seeme happie wyckednesse though neuer punished therefore commonly suche men seeme haue escaped daunger haue sodayne destruction diuerse example suche men testifie see written men psalme deuise souldiers killing prisonersthirdly souldiours deuise kill prisoner least gotte shore shoulde take hym hys heeles doubte moued take thys bloudy counsayle feare lawes example whereof wee hadde souldiours herode whose handes peter escaped guyding aungell actes howebeit greate wickednesse woulde excepte paule spare hys lyfe throughe whose counsayle prayer lyfe preserued propretie worlde serue worlde quickely forgette benefytes good turnes recompence moste tymes haynous iniuries therefore fooles seeke please worlde haue rather regarde vnto god onely moste faythfull rewarder men moreouer concerning souldiours deuise daunger paule others nowe greeuous shipwracke selfe muche prisoner nowe moste wofull case promise god seemed vayne promised saue lorde remedieth thys inconuenience tyme also captayne beeing desirous saue paule withstoode souldiours deuise tooke effecte commaundeth also many could swimme fyrste take sea residue followe vppon broken bordes fragmentes shyppe heereby wisely prouiding shoulde lette one businesse sturre came passe escaped alyue safe vnto shore god promysed come passethe truthe god promise cannot let hindred heere veritie god promise notable see hyndered aduersitie surely hitherto thinges might seeme haue conspired death paule sea rageth greate mayne surge waues winde armed ayre also destruction earth holdeth faste shippe driuen caried vpon hir lightes starres heauen withholde shine miserable creature false vntrusty maryners meane runne away cruel souldiours deuise mind bloudy slaughter truth god whose pleasure saued ouercame thing therfore thing ought comfort v also amyddest daungers worlde experience teacheth v worlde fareth lyke moste troublesome sea wee haue promise god hath assured v sonne bee alwayes present assistaunt vnto people therefore god v bee agaynst v surely wee beeing safetie vnder hys protection shall happily escape trouble daungers come hauen eternall blisse euerlasting inheritaunce kingdome heauen appoynted prepared v iesus chryste whome bee prayse honoure power glory euer amen xxviij chapter vpon actes apostle clxxj homelie escaped knew isle called milete straungers shewed v little kindnesse kindled fire receyued v euery one bicause present rayne colde paule gathered bundle stickes layde fire came viper heat caught hand straungers saw beast hang hande sayde among selues doubt man murtherer though haue escaped sea yet vengeaunce suffereth lyue shooke viper fire felt harme howbeit wayted whe haue swollen fallen downe deade sodenly looked great sawe harme came chaunged mynde sayde god hath bene declared hitherto howe god care paule hys companion promysed middest daungers tempestes sea foloweth deliuered afterwarde fro drowning howe ministred occasion paule preach gospell firste melite vnto romanes whereby taught god work perfit though tryed euery day new daungers yet must cast away al hope looke euery day newe benefites god handes vseth temper aduersitie prosperitie rayse vp discouraged mindes effectuous consolation shall bicause rashly condemne none reason affliction suffer partly bicause soone offended aduersities happen vnto v seeing thing worke vnto best loue god thing follow teach v happened vnto paule beeing nothing afrayde soden chaunce paul shaketh viper without hurte shaketh uiper fire felt harme therof yea mean findeth christes promise true saith would beleue driue away serpent drinke potion poyson
