chryst merite death maiestie resurrection hath troden downe crushed head peces let v returne people malta people malta take paule god seing paule cotrary opinion nothing hurt knowing biting viper present poysoning altered minde iudged one number god doubtlesse deceiued error gentile vsed take author strange benefites worker vnwonted effect myracles god thus satan helde occupied consideration secudary cause lest climbed higher might haue come knowledge true god one pollicy thought get mind people malta make paule honored god meaning hinder fayth christ wherby knew kingdome chiefly assaulted satan wil suffer euery mortal man honored worshipped god rather true god vnto honor due cause men occupied honoring others runne manyfest daunger saluation worship god casting away yoke diuel finde true saluation let man therfore maruell worshipping saincts know sometime chosen vessel god mayntayned pope kingdome false signes diuelish disceytes greeueth satan worshipped inuocated long seeth doctrine regarded maketh men worship god inheritor life surely satan craft subtiltie great although costrained paules dayes giue place yet afterwarde planted euery among malta supersticious opinion touching paule bosting paules name stockethe family stocke paule vse worke many wonder aswell killing keeping vp serpent vngodlynesse hereby easily confuted greatly delighted serpent euident first instrument wherwith diuell beguiled man let v marke place inconstancie people lyke example wherof order saw lystra toke malefactor wold haue stoned first sayd god men accout take one god little sayd murtherer haue many like thinges dayly falling teach v nature people always diuers changeable fooles therefore miserable people thinke trust giuen vnto put hope god onely hath giuen v sonne iesus chryste earnest reuenger euill done vnto v prayse honour power glory euer amen clxxij homelie quarter land chiefe man ile whose name publius receiued v lodged v three dayes courteously fortuned father publius lay sicke feuer bloudy fluxe paule entred prayed layde hand healed whe done also disease ile came healed also v great honour departed laded v thing necessarie three monethes departed ship alexandria wintred ile whose badge castor pollux came syracuse wee taried three dayes thence fet compasse came rhegium one day southwinde blew came next day puteoli founde brother desired tary seuen dayes came rome notable full comfort verily sentence iesus chryst sayth none forsaketh house marke brother sister parent wife child land sake gospel shall receiue hundred folde lyfe persecution world come life euerlasting hereof luke setteth v euident example historie paule christ sake gospel forsaken al thing counted excellent profitable world shipwrack escaped isle malta found innumerable brother sister parent faithfull friend house land kinde goodes common yea reason bandes semed miserable al men shipwrack estimation people malta sake pleasured mariner souldiers prisoner residue paules company shal appeare playnly thing follow set foorth publius hospitalitie publius chiefe man gouernour ilande singular example hospitalitie farmes neere adioyning curteously entertayned three day togither humanitie notable ruler rich man yet disdained stranger manyfold afflictios rich men part vse think men mishap appertayne nothing vnto next receiueth al togither could without trouble great cost heard ship two hundred three score sixtene person al escaped safe vnto lande let riche men authoritie lerne duetie thinke god hath giuen alone great gift let remeber appoynted steward wherfore let liberal vnto haue neede plenty may releue others scarcity doubtlesse great offence forgetting dutie haue co passion body passe ouer cry poore deaf eares legth according saying salomon shal find eares god shut praiers yea latter day shal haue christ accuse furthermore math people malta receiue notable recopense amends hospitalitie ministery paule rewarde hospitalitie may learne man vyle may procure vnto v great vtilitie shew selues curteous liberal vnto god requite v man reward vseth lost god sake chrystes vse benefite body present place declared two rewardes men receyued paule selfe fyrste father publius receyued beeing sicke feuer bloudy fluxe disease vtterly vncurable restored healthe paules meane great benefite pleasure wee consyder body onely man denie althoughe wee say nothing howe occasion broughte vnto fayth muste marke howe thys cure paule obserued manner order prescribed chryste bothe vseth prayer layde hys handes vppon sicke body wherby taught miracle wrought power paule god sort woulde set forth sonne iesus chryst peter iohn haue declared apostle wrought miracle farre otherwise chryst vsing absolute power hys worde onely pronounced draue away deuils disease apostle holy seruauntes chryste calling name chryste errour men confuted bycause miracle holy men wrought thinke ought inuocated regarde god author whose honour glory sainctes chiefly sought see concerning matter thirde fourtenth chapter seconde rewarde extended vnto men publius father beeing healed stirred vp men also lykewise deliuered diuers disease ende vse thing shoulde vnderstande paule minister chryst deliuereth v infirmitie body soule therefore seeke saluation merite bycause haue intreated hereof oftentimes place let nowe suffise briefly haue touched thing let v see people malta luke sayth requited great thankfulnesse suche great benefitesthe thankfulnesse people malta also greatly honoured departe gaue whatsoeuer thing needefull vnto voyage manyfest fruites fayth also taughte owe vnto whose meane chryst light gospell shineth vnto v ought esteeme parent bicause regenerated ministerie deserue honoured yet godly honour owe parent mete man receyue man surely paule writeth elder gouerne well worthy double honour timoth marke pray god ieoly gospeller thinke selues trim men steyne good name minister scoffes quippes child owe vnto parentes onely honour also necessary whereby liue necessarie hearer prouide minister god commaunded tymes paste olde testamente may seene eightenth chapter booke number fiue twentith chapter deut chryst forbiddeth apostle cary money prouision bicause liue ministery gospel like laborer bene right lawfull haue done math luke shoulde apostle haue offended receiued thing see touching matter first corinth ninth chapter therfore great vnthankfulnesse men dayes say worse giuing nothing selues vnto minister enuie craftily beguyle thing time past haue giuen vnto paule caried idolatrous shippebut ende three monethes returne voyage agayne sea course wherof let seeke geographer table desire haue instruction euery suche poynt haue herein two thing obserue one paule company go bord shippe alexandria errour gentile thought vnder patronage defence castor pollux example many men counte imagerie superstition among indifferent thing thoughe christian man touching outward conuersation mighte vse without offending god wee must likewise consider paule owne accorde constraint neither also consented vnto wicked superstition either winked thing fauoure men therefore example paule maketh defence dastardes vse dissemble matter religion serue time howe fette long compasse sea arriued length syracusa citie cicile italie putesti finde brother christian entreatie taried seuen dayes also may seenethe church putesti charitie brother vouchsafe great charge chearishe make much straungers long also curtesie captaine souldioures prisonners sake would stay many dayes heere appeareth also might power god maketh seruauntes accepted fauoured maiestie sain te cheefely triumpheth vnder crosse affliction nowe paule thoughe bandes yet like king emperoure hath souldiers obedient becke commaundement like wee haue seene also many time euangelistes teache v baptist made herode afraide offended crosse affliction let v rather constantly followe vocation seeing hande god able defende v middest oure ennimies looke rewarde heauen oure sauioure iesus christ hathe purchased v merite whome praise honor power glory foreuer amen clxxiij homelie thence brother hearde v came meete v appiforum three tauernes paule sawe thanked god waxed bolde came rome vnder captaine deliuered prisonners cheefe captaine hoste paule suffered dwell himselfe souldioure kepte three dayes paule called cheefe iewes togither come saide vnto men brother thoughe haue committed nothing againste people lawes elder yet deliuered prisonner ierusalem hand romanes examined would haue let goe bicause cause deathe iewes spake contrary constrained appeale vnto caesar ought accuse nation cause haue called euen see speake bicause hope israel bounde chaine saide vnto neither receiued letter iewrie pertaining vnto thee neither brother came shewed spake harme thee heare thee thou thinkest concerning secte knowe euery spoken paules affaire done time apostleship notable many skilles singuler yet chefe among bringing iewrie vnto rome great preparation plead christes cause christian faith caesar rare insolent thing iudgement world shall easily appeare man compare paules persone small account reputation yea hated enuied almost men maiestie caesar whole romane empire whereof nation people stoode feare could neuer haue beene brought passe meanes man either romane president shuld haue taken greate paine suche mannes behalfe nero emperor man wholely set fire voluptuousnesse tyrannie haue suffered suche one haue come sighte heare onlesse god mightily stretched hande whose affaire thing cause luke described voyage diligently lord many cause woulde haue notified fame report paule going excite stirre vp mindes romanes heare present place teacheth v successe god deuise vaine wherein many thing recourse consideration whereof able singularly enstruct comfort v romane brother goe meete paule luke wryteth brother came oute rome vnto appiforum place called vulgare tong tipergote whome saw gaue thankes vnto god conceiued thereby greater boldnesse minde place aboue thing wee haue consider god whose dispensation certaine thing came passe pleased hys seruaunte shoulde bee confirmed meeting brother hee mighte afterwarde boldly wade thoroughe chrystes cause whereunto also bee referred wee heard laste touching brother puteoli althoughe paule bolde inoughe ready suffer onely bondes deathe also name christe yet hee man wanted temptation surely hee mighte well haue feared hee shoulde haue laboured vaine christes cause suche citie whereas vngodlynesse tirannie raigned god therefore plucke care oute minde moueth brother goe meete hee mighte see howe wanted suche hee mighte confirme example constancie woulde helpe prayer thys conflicte lette v therefore bee encouraged example constantly holde vocation neither shall godly zeale god woorde want frute god himselfe faile v easely gette v euery suche take parte v bothe laboures daungers thankfulnesse romane brethrenagaine brother rome also considered knowe paule wrote epistle vnto thing came passe hee declareth aboundantly bothe good towardes promiseth hee woulde come vnto therefore good tournes sake shewe themselues thankeful vnto although manye thing mighte haue discouraged therefro firste hee commeth pompe worshipfull traine broughte bounde like malefactoure prisonners woulde haue beene ashamed suche man woulde haue feared daunger companying againe thing selfe daungerous among romanes professe christian faithe religion raigne tiberius tertullian wryteth condemned publike statute decree furthermore mette onely daunger whole congregation rome beside whome occasion diligent earnest searche inquisition myghte haue beene made howesoeuer matter wente thoughte meete declare theyr duetie loue suche apostle trauailed earnestly behalfe menne therefore leiuer incurre daunger bee founde flacke dooing duetie thing teache v owe vnto minister christe whose ministerie wee broughte vnto saluation time happen daunger faithe doctrine lette v bee ashamed beeing bandes forasmuche wee knowe christe bounde woorde god bee bounde againe hee heereafter accepte bestowed bestowed lengthe wee haue consider paule hymselfe also whome two thing affirmed firste hee giueth thankes vnto god paule encouraged confirmed meeting brother bee vnderstanded thoughe hee hadde lette brother passe spoken vnto whereas good wil coulde bee acceptable vnto doubte hee also gaue thankes vnto cheefely acknowledgeth woorke god stirred vppe theyr mindes shewe selfe bolde thus becommeth v also doe thankefull vnto men recompence muche v yet wee forgette god vnto whome behooueth v ascribe goodnesse seconde howe paule confirmed freshe newe boldnesse seeth vewers beholder hee like haue conflict wherby appeareth holy men also haue nede confirmed christe teacheth example peter disciple saithe prayed peter hee addeth thou art conuerted strengthen thy brother likewise seeme moste perfecte men haue neede also doctrine admonition exhortation reprehension therefore great ignorance intollerable confidence forgetting men reiecte wyth great lothsomnesse kinde doctrine correction moreouer come rome centurion deliuered paule prisonners captaine hoste paul kept hired house rome one sorte paule put prisone libertie dwell priuate house hired himselfe kept one souldioure onely heere reason requireth speake somewhat commendation centurion whome hitherto wee haue seene bare paule muche good cheefely let v consider howe god gaue good captaine get fauoure lysias captaine felix festus others heere haue wee cheefely consider state godly worlde wee see commonly reputed among wicked chaunced also vnto christ yet meane season christe hathe suche care wante nothing serueth either owne sauegard setting forth god glory ende paule permitted dwel himselfe hauing one souldioure appointed watche muche keeper faithfull defender also see lacked nothing belonged liuing furthermore libertie comfort church abrode epistle letter also call whome hee would vnto yea gather church congregation together lodging euidently shal appeare thing follow paule calleth togither cheefe iewes three dayes calling cheefe iewes reporteth vnto bothe imprisonment appeale occasion afterwardes euery day people resorted vnto whome hee preached gospell singular example kindenesse loue set forthe paule howe many howe heynous iniuries iewes done vnto wel knowne also aucthors bond yet hath still care saluation doth vouchsafe call render reason doings vnto therfore true wryteth howe prayed daily rom wished seperated christe might saued math let v folow affection godly minde according rule christ loue euen ennimies learne diligence procure set forward saluation putteth away wrongfull suspitionshowbeit touching paules oration consisteth partes shall order consider first answereth wrongful suspitions wherwith hee knewe hee charged seditious disturber iewes publike peace one wickedly broken infringed ancient religion father moste constantly denieth bothe saith nothing neither people neither ordinaunces elder thus example teacheth lawfull christian men defend cause good name slaunderers least peraduenture sake doctrine gospell euill spoken also well marked minister christ neither offend againste publike peace againste religion father beat downe superstitious affiance men haue ceremony workes faithfully teach christes true religion publike peace disturbed broken lawfull reprehending wickednesse wickednesse selfe prophet euery declare euident faith stayeth resteth vpon christe auncientest faithe therefore labor restore faith againe purge superstitious tradition men falsely accused noueltie excuseth appealingin second parte rendreth reason appealed vnto caesar thing might haue gotten great hatred among iewes appealed seemed partly allowe aucthoritie romanes libertie iewes partly selfe shame ioyned reproche iudge appeale vnto therefore bicause suspecte suche thing hee saithe hee constrained doe hee ment accuse nation caesar sauegarde owne life contrary right equitie iewes ierusalem lay waite haue also wee admonished ciuill lawfull defence denyed christian men althoughe christe forbiddeth v resist euill ought vnderstanded priuate reuenge althoughe forbidden yet vse lawes lawfull iudgementes graunted vnto men taketh away must needes also abrogate take away manner magistrate officer thirde partehe declareth ye state whole cotrouersie comprehendeth state whole controuersie betweene iewes hope israell saythe bounde chaine thus hee calleth christe whome iewes hoped kingdome libertie although rightly knewe hym dreamed worldly kingdome libertie fleshe wrongfull vnderstanding prophesies thing cause persecuted whome hoped god sente vnto common thing affaire saluation bragge name christe wickedly refuse thincke shall lose gaine perceiue libertie fleshe brideled meane season manner paules speaking teacheth v none hope saluation giuen vnto man christe iesus promisses god exhibited fulfilled onely father wayted moses prophetes sent v vnto apostle knewe none sauioure whome wee also putte oure truste shall deceyued nowe followeth answere iewes standeth two poyntes firste giue notable testimonie paules innocenciethe iewes beare witnesse paules innocencie whereas say neither receiued letter man hearde reporte thing shoulde priestes wryte thing paule whose innocencie knewe men perceyued meane season heere appeareth state godly thoughe bee neuer innocent yet easily finde ennimies whose procurement either cast prison else banished country whether two come passe ennimies afterwarde carelesse passe neyther man thinketh care suche persones belongeth thing vnto lengthe conceiue farther hatred againste goe put innocentes vnto deathe also second part iewes shew themselues desirous heare paules iudgement concerning faithe religion christe althoughe knewe men euery spake surely worthy great commedation blinded former iudgementes men reiecte declaration recoumpte faithe nowe dayes many vse doe like serpentes stoppe theyr eares shutte dore kingdom heauen vpon themselues whome none reason able moue let least ashamed see iewes indifferent vpright iudges suche matter heere haue specially consider state gospell age euery hath bene spoken deuil prince worlde cannot suffer doctrine christe bicause christe moste mightily subdueth kingdom likewise naughtie wicked person abhorre light thereof bicause knowe reproueth theyr wicked workes iusti iaries hipocrites flee thing detecteth naturall corruption ouerturneth confidence mannes rightuousnesse wherfore cannot chosen shall haue ennimies euery side serueth bothe learning comforte stirreth v vp prepare selues conflicte promisse selues sluggishe idlenesse againe teacheth v power gospel god inuincible hathe beene able many yeares withstand attempt world prince therof man woulde consider religion euer world shal perceiue haue falne owne accord haue come vnto nothing althoughe man euer assaulted force armes christian religion drawne gospel hauing age fierse ennimies hathe persecuted fire sword indureth yet vnto day shall indure vntill later day christ shal come vnto iudgement recompence affliction people eternall ioy reward enimies condigne paine wickednesse let man therefore offended stubbernesse speake againste fury persecute iesus christ bridegrome churche liueth raigneth easily deliuer hi hand hir ennimies praise honor glory power euer amen clxxiiij homelie appointed day came many lodging whome hee expounded testified kingdome god preached vnto iesus lawe moses prophet euen morning till night beleeued thing spoken beleeued agreed among themselues departed paule spoken one woorde well spake holy ghoste esay prophete vnto oure father saying go vnto people say eares shal hear vnderstande eye shall see perceyue heart people waxed grosse eares haue lust heare eye haue closed least shoulde see eye heare eares vnderstand hart conuerted heale knowne therefore vnto saluation god sent vnto gentile shal heare said word iewes departed great dispicions among themselues althoughe minister iesus christ preacher gospell exercised diuers tribulation many time imprisoned layde bandes yet worde god bound shutte prisone bicause spirite christe breatheth pleaseth subiecte pleasure man yea doctrine christe throughe deathe enlarged hee promised come passe also encreaseth throughe affliction punishmentes minister euident example heereof sette foorthe historie paule although heretofore preached gospell abrode many place worlde yet greate dore opened vnto prisonner chaines hee permitted freely preache vnto men citie rome sight vpon stage world suche successe doctrine pierced emperor court also may gathered salutation greeting sent philippian phil surely straunge wonderfull thing wherin men might consider prouidence power christe blinde cleare light furthermore luke declareth howe thing came passe many sermon choseth one whereby may iudge shall speake circumstance order first euangelist noteth time place saying paule preacheth house resorted paules lodging vpon day appointed dayes permitted christian haue church neither though church bene lawfull paule haue taught prisonner bondes therefore place apostle preached priuate house heere also paule assembleth house hired wherby gather worship doctrine god ought tyed place thoughe helped auailed thing saluation euident woorde god hathe aucthoritie self also god heareth praiers euery place pray faith lifte vp cleane handes vnto wherefore necessitie vrge v nede carefull neither time place howbeit enioy peace haue christian magistrate must haue regard vnto order requireth bothe time place therefore example primitiue churche doe nothing defende furious clamoures anabaptistes bicause necessitie time passed compelled assembly doe diuers thing contrary vsage secondly heere declared argumente paules sermonthe argumente paules sermon order teaching vsed expounded kingdome god testifying preaching vnto iesus christe kingdome god haue oftentimes said gospell vnderstanded hereof paule coulde well intreate muste also confute erroure iewes prophesies wrongfully vnderstoode dreamed kingdome messias worldly wherfore taught kingdom spiritual beginning wherof world whole regeneration man newnesse life marke end therof eternal felicitie prepared v heauen bicause iewes knewe aucthor kingdome teache iesus christe hee vnto whome according office apostle beareth witnesse plainely also exhorted men receiue let v heere obserue doctrine gospell called kingdome god verely ende effecte thereof offreth vnto v bothe kingdome god true felicitie bringeth v vnder rule gouernaunce god subdueth reason vnderstanding vnder obedience faithe heere many glory name gospell warned duetie let remember kingdome god preached therein therefore lette haue care god may raigne kingdome deuill may bee abolished knowe christe came fleshe destroy againe minister admonished true trade way preaching gospell vnto three thing necessary first muste declare open mystery kingdome simpler sorte bee seduced false imagination muste beare witnesse iesus christe men may vnderstand howe hee aucthoure kingdome true felicitie finally muste instantly exhorte persuade men despise saluation offered christe fountaine apostle doctrinethirdly declared fountaine whence doctrine springeth paule reasoneth christe oute lawe moses prophetes prouing performed whatsoeuer thing foreshewed promised sauioure mankinde thus folowed example christ himselfe vsed many time bring testimony place teacheth v inuentions man worde god comprehended scripture must preached church wher church housholde god meete woorde heard therein good mannes house cause prophet apostle bounde vnto commaundement wee haue elsewhere declared therefore little blamed either teache doctrine themselues else heare followe seeing true marke churche heare voice hir husbande onely psal iohn see psal iohn moreouer let v marke consent bothe olde newe testament least wee say brainsicke person doe belongeth nothing vnto v yet bothe teache one selfe christe one selfe way saluation wee knowe nothing fulfilled newe testament promised olde whereby also appeareth faithe christe moste antiquitie onely way meane whereby electe beginning worlde haue beene saued bicause wee haue oftentimes otherwheres intreated heereof may suffise time haue breefely poynted thing finger paule teacheth whole dayfourthly luke declareth howe long paule preached euen mornyng vntill euening whereuppon wee maye gather also disputed paule aunsweared theyr argumentes lyke yet vtterlye ignorant chryst woulde haue hearde paule wyth suche pacyence woulde sometime haue interrupted saying meane season heere expressed ardent desire bothe paule hearer whereof like example twentith chapter reproueth slothfulnesse dayes wherwith diuerse minister word hearer also sicke accrased thinke labour time muche spent sermon one day shall come hunger worde wherof reade prophet c amos fifthly effect earnest diligent sermon describedthe effecte paules sermon beleeue beleeue yea great disputation contention riseth amongst see case gospel world chryst set vp marke signe spoken agaynst men receiue gospell vniforme consent let man therefore offended paucitie fewnesse beleeuers ranke croppe controuersies dayes seeing heare tymes passed sonne god selfe apostle preached fewe beleeued let also serue comforte minister see haue little nothing profited preaching let call mind saying chryste haue kept worde keepe also iohn paule seuerely rebuketh stubbornesse threatneth horrible iudgement god paule rebuketh stubbornesse ye iewes chryste owne example teacheth v deale milde holeseme preaching gospell moue many time rang eares scribe phariseis greeuous manaces horrible wo paule likewise bicause would seeme yeelde thing affection fleshe alleageth propheticall oracle vj esai declaring rare newe matter stoutly resisted gospell father time paste done lyke god fortolde latter day kingdome chryst reuealed men lyke also thus confirmeth weake fayth multitude authoritie gainsayers might haue hindred offended herewith also feareth sayth god long agone ordeyned punishement place esai notable oftenest cyted alleaged new testament euangelists make mention heereof mathew thirtenth marke fourth luke eyght iohn twelfth chapiter paule repeateth tenth chapiter romanes therfore muste thinke consideration thereof superstuous conteyneth three thynges greatly belonging v also fyrst sinne iewes described wittingly willingly blinde despise knowen light truthethe iewes vnbeleefe wilful like vnto men hauing perfecte sighte hearing make yet blinde deafe gospell many place teacheth v would god onely time paste bene suche euery lyke dayes also beeing conuinced euen testimonie conscience fayne yet though could vnderstande mysterie fayth yet appeareth brightnesse goddes woorde greate mightily pierceth eye eares men worde god hath set oute vnto v candle darke obscure therefore darkenesse man grosse wilfull darkenesse thinges following declare cause incredulitiesecondly prophet describeth cause euill namely hart waxed grosse calleth mynd indurate hardned naughtie affection moued admonition exhortation men suche dooings thys chryste expresseth parable mariage gestes bydden mariage wherein hadde maryed wyfe hadde bought ox farmes whereabout beeing occupied refused come vnto mariage heereby vnderstanded suche men beeing addicted flesh earthly thinges neglecte despise thinges heauenly e appeareth chiefe iewes greater regarde honour aduauntage vnto chryst kingdome heauen nowe dayes scarse bee shewed cause gospelles contempte menne studie euery heape vp ryches fulfyll pleasure fleshe hadde rather lacke chryste forsake desire thus appeareth perishe incredulitie inexcusable lyghte come worlde menne haue loued darkenesse c iohn paule sayth tyme come menne shoulde suffer doctrine truthe shoulde gette selues false teacher whiche shoulde speake thinges agreable fantasie affection euidente also hathe bene many yeres fulfylled according letter thys day fulfylled man shall fynde greate many whiche shall confesse gospell taughte true doctrine fayth religion yet wyll preferre popishe religion bicause bette lyketh fleshe also acceptable worlde speake nothing meane season openly great clamour testifie neither heare suffer shall teach better holesomer doctrine howebeit prophete pronounceth punishement men deseruethe punishment incredulitie bothe manyfolde horrible firste conuerted may healed therefore hope saluation taken none way saluation turne vnto god one disdayne worde god wherby called vnto holesome conuersion wherby right way therto taught must vtterly fall saluation wherefore muste needes must perish sinnes iohn chryste threatneth priestes iewes next saluation translated caried vnto god often threatneth vnto iewes therby mollifie stony confidence adopted god became peculiars thought impossible shoulde fall dignitie yea persuaded selues kingdome god muste fall god forsake paule therfore teacheth affiance vayne bicause god could easily translate kingdome whole sound part vnto gentile affirmed owne head hauing respecte vnto oracle god wherby long agone prephesied shuld come passe herevnto belong thing read deut deut haue angred god prouoked vanity also prouoke people anger foolishe nation c see also sayde oseas purpose christ sayth also expressely kingdome god shall bee taken math giuen nation shall bring foorth fruites thereof nowe howe came passe verified whole order booke abundauntly declareth paule tenth eleuenth romanes large sheweth least man shoulde thinke iudgement god stayeth heere wee muste also marke horrible destruction bothe citie whole nation followed chryste threat e assoone doctrine gospell taken carye vnto gentyles thinges worthy diligently continually obserued also may learne heereby hope follow iewes become vnkinde vnto god wickedly wrastle agaynst doctrine gospell god constante iudgements nation doth like vseth punish like iudgements ierem cause wee thinke gospell kingdome chryste shall fayle though forsaken persuasion sayde erewhyle deceiued iewes god able stone rayse vp child vnto abraham diuerse coniectures portende shewe empire lyke returne east west shal seruitude agayne cording opinion lactantius whiche thing come passein vii boke xv chapter shall see kingdome chryst greatly increase among turkes perhaps among iewes also touching thing paule eleuenth chapter romanes seemeth prophesie thing altogither obscurely let v returne vnto paules hearer luke sayth wente hauing begonne great contention among themseluesthe contention iewes doctrine gospell helde striuing doctrine truth labored maintayne sentence chryst fulfilled saith woulde sende sworde diuision whereby shoulde come passe tha moste intie familiar friendes shoulde moste bitterly contende one yet let man thynke thys happeneth defaulte gospell seeyng ende thereof vnite knitte v togither chryste therefore thys commeth passe naughtinesse wicked reprobate whose propertie earnestly vrged worde god rage become madde example cayn pharao achab zedechias others testifie bicause godly know dueties defend glory god men yeld vnto men hereof burst al flame contention present place easily appeareth paule profited somewhat men bycause therewere openly withstoode wycked person word god neuer preached vayne bycause selfe fruitfull chryst hath place people know voyce followe meane season taught duetie godly faythfull person wee muste constantly defende quarell truthe agaynst men god requireth suche worshipper feruent ardent zeale warmlings dastard winke kinde impietie pacient mind eares suffer scoffes wicked suche man nowe dayes may finde number cause thinke selues moste worthy praysed wyse men modest deede bee dullardes destitute sense godlynesse prouoked blasphemy fooles also muche esteeme friendship worlde denie vnto chryst duetie godlynesse therfore let v prepare selues holesome conflicte strife godly worlde muste suffer cause wee feare power worlde forasmuche knowe fight quarell one day shall breake peeces gaynesayers scepter iron sonne god lorde sauiour iesus chryste whome prayse honour power glory euer amen clxxv homelie paule dwelte two yeres full hys lodging receyued came vnto hym preachyng kingdome god teaching thing concerne lorde iesus confidence man forbidding lorde sauioure iesus chryste comforteth hys disciple many time argument wyll leaue destitute succourlesse present vntill ende worlde truthe promise appeareth euery aswell time also chiefly aduersities chryst nigh hande vnto seruauntes onely defendeth mightely faythfully also directeth thinges seeme dolefull infortunate vnto saluation hys glory wherein captiuitie paule may bee vnto v steede number testimony whiche beginning mighte haue seemed vtterly haue stopped course gospell howebeit lorde moderated doctrine gospell rather aduaunced hindred occasion thereof bothe romane president souldiours heard gospell lengthe preachyng thereof fylled rome yea iudgement place emperours court bycause thinges haue bene spoken thynges whiche remayne bee considered thys hystorie muste briefly bee runne ouer firste euangelist expresseth tyme paules captiuitie saying paule prison two yeres togither abode two yeres togither house hyred hys owne charge beeing garded souldiour whome made mention lay pryson whole two yeres also vnder felix lyke ranne monethes betweene felix departure prouince tyme paules sending vnto rome furthermore wee muste allowe foure monethes least nauigation tyme spent malta thus paules captiuitie endured fiue yere time found one commoditie thrust prison open warde whereby occasion preache euery offred heere wee haue consider state godly bee worlde alone parte counted suche wicked person vnmeete enioy either libertie lyfe meane season sorte wicked slaunderous menne trowe yee lyued pleasure vnder nero moste ryotous tyrante paule alone publike plague calamitie whole worlde kepte prison like curtesie prophetes tymes paste iohn baptist length sonne god selfe founde put death among theeues murtherers counted greater malefactour barrabas murtherer ende thinges offended lyke dayes meete scholers seruauntes state shoulde better teacher master furthermore knowe partaker chrystes affliction worlde shall reigne hereafter heauen2 timo appeareth also infinite goodnesse god preserued paule long tyme open warde verily electes sake vnto whome occasion woulde haue gospell reuealed farre passed hope bothe paule faythfull bycause vnder nero moste vicious cruell tyraunt man woulde euer haue looked therefore let many walke god callyng fetche counsayle long wee bee occupied god affayres requisite saluation god easily defende v among moste cruell enimies able saue noah middest waues floude ouerflowed worlde ionas lay hidde belly houge whale tyme shall require translate v misfortune internall kingdome sonne furthermore let v see paule dyd two yeres space paule prison preacheth writeth receiued sayth came vnto preaching kingdome god teaching thinges concerne lorde iesus confidence man forbidding dyd th bondes done beeing libertie bycause vnderstoode nowe apostle seruaunt iesus chryst aswell dyd onely preache also sent letter one place nowe bothe instructed comforted congregation abroade insomuche man consider time shall confesse haue receiued profite commoditie paules bondes doings saying beside went libertie oueral world time may thake singular epistle written holy ghost endited ephesian philippian collossians hebrues philemon seconde timothe churche vntill day hathe kepte preserued moste singular precious iewels howbeit many thinges mighte haue feared paule either haue written haue taughte doctrine cause put pryson also alone trauayled quarell rome lykewise firste meeting founde iewes lyke vnto selues say stubborne disobedient furthermore earnest desire write vnto forrein nation might seeme declare minde somewhat inconstant vnquiet might thought next neighbour sedition teache confirme men fayth religion sayde condemned whole consent senate againe daunger depriued length libertie haue bond layde vpon haue ben cast inner prison dungeon muste thinke blockishe perceiue consider thinges knew ought life vnto christe coulde persuasion pulled duetie verily wonderfull example whereby taught muche owe vnto god tyme perceiue holpen defended middest danger aduersitie must feared neither danger paste neither danger present come must inflamed greter zeale bolde defending glory god may shewe selues thankful accordingly therfore reason fleshly wisdome many dayes follow playnly foolish peruerse thinke hold peace bicause enimies danger euery side appering though ye enimies power hinder course gospel nay becommeth v boldly go forward god quarel bicause plainly find truth power apparant middle danger touching paules doctrine luke sayth three thing paul preacheth kingdome god must let passe first preached namely kingdome god wherof haue intreted ofte time way exposition addeth teaching thing concerne lord iesus wherby gather kingdome god preached chryste preached none way come vnto kingdome scripture one consent shew v christe iesus onely hath destroyed kingdome diuel work therof mediator betweene god vs1 timo colos mat iohn hath put hande writing sinne v purchased v good father therfore without cause saith man cometh vnto father thing sufficient disproue religion shew v kingdome god way saluation beside christ secodly declared paule precheth plainly paule preached al confidence boldnesse say plainely freely fauour men cloked dissembled nothing ashamed gospel iesus christ testifieth otherwheres neither feared tiranie world prince thereof bicause learned long time wrastle therewith verily chryst requireth minister businesse diligently leaue nothing vnto worlde wisedome flesh vnder fayre pretence modestie bringeth dastardly dissembling truthe denyall right fayth paules successe thirdly declared successe paule preaching onely argument appeareth moste prosperous luckie bycause none whiche forbadde preache thinketh greatest miracle others god wrought paule alwayes tyme whersoeuer came founde enimies either secrete awaytes else open force sedition alwayes troubled would hynder teaching lengthe draue city brought rome prisoner teacheth beeing bondes nero monster mankinde emperoure bothe christian iewishe religion hated enuied men bewytched either vayne superstition god epicurious contempte religion finally diuell seemed haue chiefe see kingdome preached chryste freely two yeres togither man forbidding hym whiche thing wee shewe none cause god woulde brydle mindes men mightie hande though would yelde doctrine gospell yet shoulde bolde withstande thus citie lady maistresse world apostle beeing captiue triumpheth preaching chryste crucified bringing many vnto obedience chryste emperoure euer subdued lyke wee reade happened tymes paste daniell beeing ledde captiue babylon defended true religion bothe constantly prosperously althoughe chiefe kingdome muche agaynst yet firste instructed nabuchodonosor afterwarde darius knowledge true god authour dyd publike proclamation spread farre neare honour glory god ouer kingdomes wherevnto also deserueth referred romane emperours vsed kinde outragious crueltie agaynst name chryste churche yet many tymes founde euen owne courtes among chiefe suche greatly fauoured christian openly defended true religion afterwarde enimies chryst taken away aduaunced empire may seene story iouinian valentinian emperours thus christ declareth power man would least thinke harde thing brydle willes men bycause compasseth sea bound causeth lay swelling waues surge therfore many strong iob ierem let hope present ayde shall neuer disappoynted hope nowe paule dyd two yeres expiredwhat paul two yeres expired luke dothe declare ending place hystorie according instincte holy spirite would haue church ouercharged many writing bokes therfore hath writen onely thing may suffise instruction fayth life howebeit paules owne epistle may coniectures taken wherby declared afterwarde seconde epistle timothe fourth chapter expresseth playnly pleated cause emperour saying deliuered benefite god redy offred writing philippian among thing sayth hope shortely sende timotheus vnto assone shall see howe matter go truste lorde selfe also shall shortly come writing philemon colossian sayth moreouer prepare place lodge trust helpe prayer shall giuen vnto agayne xiij hebrues sayth pray v desire instantly may soner restored vnto knowe yee brother timothe deliuered whome come shortly see yet led prisoner rome minded go spayne epistle romanes xv chapter declareth thinges men gather altogither without cause set libertie returned grece asia lesse syria saluted easte church wente italie fraunce spayne thus according opinion men preached gospell ten yeres set libertie length beeing called backe rome agayne laste yere nero loste heade receiued crowne martyrdome preached chryste vnto moste parte worlde seuen thirtie yeres long togither bycause saluation dependeth suche poyntes contende herein ouer muche man e thinketh deserue much christian fayth religion laboure searching foorth thinges holy scripture haue passed ouer silence bothe scripture negligently handled supersticious haue occasion giuen occupied doubtfull vnprofitable question neglecting doctrine apostle bewitched fable greeuously ire matte faith saluation surely god would haue moses sepulchre buriall place time paste vnknowen holy ghost hath left fewe thing memorie olde testament touching martyrdomes prophetes present treatise luke hath described th de two person onely namely stephen apostle beeing contented say onely residue moste constantly preached confessed chryst kindes aduersitie commending vnto v studie apostle doctrine maketh men follower apostle partaker heauenly inheritaunce wherefore wee also place muste principally obserue followe feruent continuall trauayle paule setting foorth glory chryste wee muste bee offended de hereby chryste maketh worshippe lyke vnto selfe worlde ende hereafter may bee partaker heauen glory kingdome conclusio repetition premisseshitherto haue expounded booke according grace god giuen vnto v haue seene therin forme fayth doctryne primatiue church also must keepe obserue dayes coumpted christe churche must giue eare vnto say many thing necessarily required religion way saluation primatiue churche lacked whose rashnesse rather impudencie know whether man may maruell heerein accuse apostle either negligence vntrustnesse feare prefer themselues whose example holy ghost hathe set forthe men counted member christ attaine saluation folowe thinke continued whole eight twentie yeeres faithe religion taughte apostle lacked thing without saluation could obtained saued without thing certaine bolde superstitious person afterwardes brought deny v saluation folowe steppe man thinke hee led madnesse frensie manichee accuse boke falshode haue seene also state church world molested continuall tribulation while bothe open ennimies false brother vexe disquiet wee haue seene vnworthy case minister howe slenderly world requiteth wee haue seene also mighty hand power iesus christe whereby faithfully defendeth churche middest waues persecution crosse seruauntes moste gloriously triumpheth ouer world prince therof let v therfore diligently vse thing instruction confirmation oure faithe strong ouercomming al danger according example apostle primatiue churche may come inheritaunce kingdome heauen prepared v euerlasting iesus christe king priest whome prayse honoure power glorye euer amen finis fought said amisse remember man spake well thou alone christ glory take ivdgement hierome vppon actes apostle actes apostle seme set forthe bare history onely weaue infancie beginning church consider howe luke wryter physition whose praise gospell shall perceiue euery woorde medicine sicke languishing soule imprinted london henrie denham dwelling pater noster rowe signe starre
